reviews.review: Rockettes at Radio City Music Hall. The Music Hall is a beautiful place and decorated wonderfully for Christmas. The Rockettes are amazing and they have a nice gift shop.
Loved it!!. Saw the Rockettes at Christmastime and it was amazing!! The lights are incredible and the show was amazing. I definitely think everyone should come here at least once in their life!
great at christmas. It's every christmas lover's dream! We visited on christmas day and the lights and decorations are spectacular! worth a visit.
Everyone should see a show here!. Christmas shows are a must see in your lifetime! Conveniently located near Times Square and Rockefeller Plaza.

Take a step back in time to the early days. What a place, step back into the 20 and 30s style, art deco and see what music hall was all about. Backstage tour very interesting and gives the history of the builidng and how important it has been.

Xmas Show Should Not Be Missed. Being at Radio City Music Hall brought back so many memories from my childhood. My parents took us every year to see a show. December 2015 show was amazing. I loved the toy soldier skit. Radio City Music Hall shows should be a MUST DO on your list.
highly recommend the guided tour. leant a lot and was lucky enough to be able to go onto the stage! Interesting tour - recommend this as part of your NYC experience!

We did the tour. We did the tour. Very interesting for my husband, teenaged son and I. Beautiful facility with technology from the 1930's that couldn't be improved upon in the renovation of recent years. Tour ends with a visit and photos with a Rockette. It was interesting to learn their requirements, etc. from a current member.

So glad we took the tour.... Radio City - what a delightful venue in the heart of NY. Decided to take the behind the scenes tour and was not disappointed. Tour guide was knowledgable, friendly and obviously loved her job! The interior is Art Deco style, lavioushly decorated and well looked after especially when at some time in its history, it was going to be flatten! The tour takes you to areas not normally seen and you just see so much of its history and why it is a special venue. Met a gorgeous Rockets and had the chance to ask question and see just how amazing these girls are especially when it is so hard to become a dancer here. A must see venue in NY and if possible, see a snow - they were getting it ready for the Christmas Special Shows, which was a shame as we didn't get a chance to book before we left NY. A good reason to return...

Excellent tour. I used my explorer pass to the the stage door tour and was so pleased that I did. The guide was so knowledgeable and the history was very interesting. Such a beautiful building with lots to photograph and see. A must for anyone interested in music / dance / entertainment both current and historically.

Magical. I went here on a family trip just before Christmas last year and it was incredible, we went to the rockettes Christmas special and it was SO GREAT. The seats were nice and comfortable (wide) and the bathrooms were so classic, it really is a great space to check out a show (or a tour? they probably do tours)
Instantly recognisable venue......... I only viewed the Radio city Music Hall from the outside while visiting the Rockefeller Centre, but it was instantly recognisable. Well worth checking out !

Amazing! . We did the tour as a last minute decision and it was the highlight of our whole trip! The helpfulness from staff was amazing, we wanted a tour before our visit to the Top of the Rock and even though the tour had just started, they accommodated us well.Our tour guide was Melissa who was such a lovely, enthusiastic and professional person. She expertly shared all the beauty and history of the building and made the 75 mins fly by. Even my 14yr old daughter loved it.Radio City Music hall is a stunning building filled with Art Deco and 1930s original pieces. Even the foot pedalled hand driers in the 'restrooms' are beautiful! The stage is so carefully thought out...I definitely would like to return to see the Rockettes in action in the Christmas Spectacular one day...fingers crossed.

Stage Door Tour, excellent. We used our Explorer Pass to do the behind the scenes tour of the building. It was well worthwhile. The guide gave us fascinating insights about the building, who's been there and of course access to all of those areas that you would not see if you just attended a concert. If you love art deco, the building is a must.

Best tour we took in NYC!. We chose to do the backstage tour at Radio City Music Hall with our NYC Pass. Our tour guide was great. She was very enthusiastic and knowledgeable. With this tour we met a Rockette also. Next to seeing Wicked, this was our favorite attraction.

Much improved tour since last visit. Last visited Radio City many years ago when the tour was very short, not informative and left out many areas (although at the time they did show you the *STAR* dressing rooms.This visit could not have been more different. Started with an introduction to Angel, our guide for the day. Angel was incredibly informed and enthusiastically shared her knowledge of the venue with us throughout the tour. The foyer where you meet is small and not very impressive but once you go through the doors and see the huge and impressive area before the auditorium and hear the history, look at the staircase and wall art you cannot not be impressed with what you see. From there we went to see the ladies and gents toilets and heard the stories behind the decoration, statues, mirrors and gold leaf! We then went through a maze of corridors until we were under the hydraulic stage and heard the story behind that and saw the size and drop of it.We then saw a full working model of the stage and were encouraged to take photos of it. We then made our way, via the beautifully ornate lifts, to the balcony area in where we were able to look into the auditorium (unfortunately as there was a rehearsal soundcheck taking place we were unable to take photos or enter the auditorium (something to do with artistic copyright I expect) which was a shame. Angel told us more about the auditorium, its size, history, stage curtains (very interesting) and lighting. We then toured more corridors emblazoned with posters of events from the past and saw the rehearsal rooms (there is footage of Adele on You Tube in one of these) and then on to the highest area where we went to where the projectors and follow spotlights are. This is also the area where Presidents and uber-celebrities sit in a private room away from the paying audience, so they can enjoy the shows in peace no doubt! The view and quality of sound from here was stunning and although we have not been to a show I would be more than happy to sit that far back and still be able to see and hear things. We then saw a short history of the venue before our tour finished. Our guide Angel was just that, and deposited us back in the large foyer before we left to go back in to the NY sunlight. The experience could only have been bettered if we had been able to have a full back-stage tour and stand on the stage to experience the view performers see from the stage and see the dressing rooms, unfortunately this was not to be on this visit. Maybe next time....

Lovely old building, lots of history.. I like Art Deco and this was superb, we had a great guide who was very informative, good tour it last 75 minutes and you get to meet one of the Rockettes. Also get to keep the stage pass.
Terrific venue. Was lucky to see Post Modern Jukebox perform for the first time at RCMH. What a great show in a great venue.

Wonderful Art Deco. The backstage tour must be one of the baragins of New York City sightseeing.The Art Deco is marvellous, and the stage machinery fascinating, the sheer scale of the place awesome.And you get to meet a Rockette !

Beautiful venue but in need of some logistical reworking. Radio City Music hall is a beautiful historic theatre and music venue - this is undeniable. However, after attending a few shows here, I am repeatedly disappointed with the procedures regarding entry into the venue. Despite arriving quite early for shows (even before the posted times for official opening of the doors, I have missed significant segments of performances due to the snail-like speed with which people are admitted. From the process of queuing to ticket scanning and security, everything takes too long, and they need to figure out a more efficient method. If I pay over $100 for a show and line up well in advance, there is no excuse for making me late for the show. This happens to a significant portion of the audience at each show I have attended and as such it is also incredibly distracting (if you do make it in on time) because ushers are frequently bringing in people late, thereby interrupting the viewing experience. Amazing venue, but not an optimal viewing experience. My advice, get there early.

Holiday Tradition. Our entire family ( kids to grandparents) always enjoy seeing a show at Radio City Music Hall any time of year. It's especially nice during holidays. Love the Rocketts and the Christmas Spectacular! The change the show a bit each year which is nice too. Prefect choice for families.

Radio City Music Hall tour. We had a New York pass so decided to do a tour of Radio City Music Hall. Beautiful building inside and the building's history was interesting to here. I wasn't expecting them to let us on the stage but they did and that was awesome looking out from the stage.

An enjoyable tour (with a sergeant major type guide!). A great opportunity to see a beautiful building and hear a little about its history, which you wouldn't get to appreciate from attending a show. You get to meet a real Rockette ! and have the obligatory photo taken with her. At $22 for just the photo and $27 in a cardboard frame it's a bit pricey, but a nice souvenir. You do get to keep your entry pass on a lanyard though...Watch out for the stairs if you're not fit and able. Even though you are given the opportunity to use the elevator to go up, you still have to walk down two flights of stairs! The guide was very good, and had obviously learnt her stuff but was a little sergeant major- like! She was pretty humourless and repeatedly barked orders at the group. Very funny though. Tour lasts about an hour.

Huge Venue!. We came here for a show last year and the venue is huge!!! It was a shame that nearby was a bunch of construction as trying to get a good photo with it in the background was nearly impossible.

Even great just to walk past!. Beautiful fascia and I wish I had more time to go in and get a tour. Lots of history, a great current line up of acts, and an iconic part of NYC that doesn't seem to be buried in tourists. Yet.
part of our NYc tour. absolutely breathtaking ... not waht i expected. What a great history and what a great facility .. go make sure you do not miss this gem.

Radio City Music Hall Tour. We were able to be in the hall and on the stage. We were even able to visit with a Ricketts. It was interesting to see how the stage was able to raise and turn to give scene changes

Beautiful building, great shows!. Going to Radio City Music Hall is an event in itself! The first time I took my husband, I thought I lost him--but found him just staring at the ceiling! The building is an architectural wonder and just beautiful. Seats inside are comfortable and I don't think there is a bad seat in the house to see the shows. I have been in the front as well as the very last row in the balcony---and always enjoyed the shows. I have been there several times to see the Rockettes, especially for their Christmas show. Taking youngsters there makes it not only fun for me, but so much fun to just watch the wonder on their faces! From the dancers to the actors, to the music, to the Christmas story with live animals (including camels). Of course Santa is a hit, the 3-D segment is dazzling, and the way the light dances around the whole auditorium is fascinating! I have been there for other shows too, mostly concerts. The stage is large and the acoustics are wonderful for music. I would encourage everyone to go and enjoy their shows.

Radio City. Pure tourism marketing, but what a journey. All the old era of entertainment. Beautifully restored. Guide was excellent. Obligatory pic with Rockette. Went every in the building, including under the stage area. Wow! Through the old Ladies and Gents restrooms, through the private quarters. Great.

Beautiful building. My daughter and I are huge AGT fans so we really wanted to see Radio City Music Hall. Wow, is it beautiful. We saw backstage and all the different interesting pieces of art. We sat in the very back row and could hear the workmen on stage clearly as well as had a great view still. We loved the old style men's and ladies lounge. I was a bit disappointed with the photographer who took the pictures of us with the rocketry. The packages were printed out at the end and were expensive. We would have bought maybe one picture but not the whole package. The lady selling the photo was not very polite about it either. Our guide was great and had so much knowledge to share!

Wow. Waiting outside to go in gives you no inkling of the design and architectural delights that wait for you. The main foyer is just stunning and everywhere you turn are Art Nouveau and Art Deco wonders. Wall, doors staircases. murals, lights and the theatre itself leave you speechless. We went to see ELO and the splendour of Radio City did Jeff proud. We didn't take the tour but apparently that's good too.
Worth a look. Did the back stage tour with the NY Pass - well worth a visit and another part of the Rockefeller legacy. Get photo with one of the Rockettes

The tour is truly interesting. It was a very interesting tour for me, even though Radio City was not part of my life in any moment until I decided to visit the place. They explain a lot about how the show happens, the technical part and all, and the culture of the presentations, which makes you a little bit more knowledgeable about the American cultural recent history. I was a bit frustrated, though, because when you buy the ticket they tell you that you'll meet one of the Rockettes, have the opportunity to ask questions and see her perform a little bit. I didn't know about the existence of the Rockettes until that day, to be quite honest, but I like dance, so I was excited to see that. But we just met one of them, took a picture side by side, asked questions and left. There was no mini show or performance or anything. But, anyway, it was interesting to meet her.Inside, everything's very beautiful, very elegant. When I got there, I was trying to find where I was supposed to buy the tickets, and there was a guy that asked, in a bothered way, "Are you here for the audition?" I confess: I almost said yes just to see what he was talking about hahaha. Later I discovered they were making auditions for the Christmas season (which is, I heard, the biggest one in the year). In case you're lost like me, it's important to know that, if you haven't bought the tickets yet (and I recommend you do, because I paid 27 dollars on the spot, and I had seen on the internet for 20), the place to buy them is in the candy store right next to Radio City.
Great old building with the same charm as back in the day.. I go to see the Rockettes every year with my family. It is always so nice and clean , friendly staff, and a beautiful theater.

Great Tour of Facility. We happened into the gift store when a tour was just starting - so we decided to join the group. It is an hour tour through the Music Hall from the auditorium, to backstage. It visits the Rockettes practice hall, passes their wardrobe room, goes into the guest entertainers private space for before/after performance, and views the stage raising mechanism. Our tour guide was very good. Well spoken and knowledgeable. The tour meets a Rockette and had a brief Q&A.
Radio city music hall. It is a beautiful place, met one of the rockets had picture taken with her. Took my 17 year old with us she was very impressed.
Trip To New York. Iconic Music Hall . Beautiful interior very Art Deco. You can go on a tour of the interior and it's well woth an hour of anybodys time

Great venue with lots of history. We saw the Radio City Christmas Spectacular here and it was a great show in a great venue. The one knock I have is the lack of any formal request for people to not use their phones to take pictures during the show. Countless times when looking toward the stage in a darkened theater you could see dozens of people holding up their phones to snap pictures, as their bright screens glowed back at them. Some form of announcement or help from the ushers would be appreciated.

Great place to catch a show or concert. I was lucky enough to be in NYC last week while one of my favourite bands (Lake Street Dive) were playing Radio City, so I just had to get a ticket and pay a visit.First thing to say is the place is HUGE! It surely must be one of the biggest seated theatres in the world (6000 capacity) and it takes your breath away walking into the auditorium for the first time. The 'sunbeam' arches on the ceiling, coupled with the ornate lobby, and even the grand entrance to the bathrooms on the lower floor, all add to the wow factor at Radio City. The only negatives I can say is that drinks are typical New York prices ($10-11 a beer). Also, I've heard that given how large it is, the seats up on the higher tiers can feel very distant from the stage. I'd therefore recommend trying to get reasonably central tickets on the bottom floor for the best views, within the first ten or fifteen rows from the stage (I was in row LL).I had a great night at Radio City anyway, with a brilliant performance from Lake Street Dive. A truly memorable night in one of the world's most iconic theatres!
Photo's of radio City. We took photo's of Radio City on route to other places not sure what was on but we didn't buy tickets for a show
A trip back in time. If you want to experience show biz in the 30's there's nothing that come close. Yes you do actually get to meet a Rockette and she'll give some incite into thier life in dance

Brillant. Was passing here right at the right time when they were giving away free tickets for Americas got talent finals live, managed to queue up and see the show live. Was really nice to be a part of the show and to go inside this famous landmark. Nice building inside, good to visit if you get the chance.

NYC landmark, decent shows. I feel that Radio City Music Hall speaks for itself. There's so much history in the place, in the name, in all the performers who have been here. Came during the holiday season for the Radio City Music Hall Christmas spectacular. What a well oiled machine, a standout even amongst a city famous for its shows. The Rockettes were fantastic as expected, the show itself somewhat simplistic though understandably exciting for little ones, but my kudos are above all to the staff. Everyone that I saw were focused on making sure guests felt the holiday cheer, including one female staff member who kindly snapped a few photos of us.

Fabulous to visit again after so many years. I had last visited Radio City Music Hall during grade school field trips. We had heard so many great reviews about the New York Spectacular that we decided to go. We are SO glad we did. We sat in the front row of the mezzanine. The show greatly exceeded our expectations. The special effects during the live show were phenomenal! Words cannot express the experience. And, the Rockettes were beyond amazing. Their part of the show was somewhat modernized yet in keeping with the tradition that is the Rockettes. The "Singing in the Rain" sequence was worth the price of admission alone. It actually poured down rain on the stage! We have our eye on the Christmas show now.

What a beautiful place. Went along at 9.30 and went on the first tour. Only 5 of us instead of 20. Our guide was fantastic and so knowledgeable. The theatre was like stepping back to the 1930s. A great place to visit

James Blake in concert. Besides the fabulous concert, the Radio City Music Hall was worth seeing. We didn' t had to wait a minute to enter for the concert. The security checks before entering the building were quick but thoroughly - better for the safety. Inside there's many space to sit or walk around. In the concert room itself, you have a good view from all places, I guess. We were sitting at the first tier and were satisfied with our chosen seats. The music was really very loud - so for some might it be better taking hearing protection.
Worth a visit. Very interesting tour which took you behind the scenes. Great interior deco and knowledgeable tour guide. We would love to be there for the Christmas show.

My best time in NY!. I have been to NY numerous times and never like it really. Always some problem or another. This time everything was smooth as silk, including my favorite band Opeth playing the most legendary venue in the country. It was a magical night. Sound was phenomenal and I felt privileged to witness such an amazing gig! Thanks! OH, and there are lots of bars and restaurants very close by and I felt safe walking around drunk after the show. haha kidding I wasn't that drunk.

Like a studio with seats. We attended Sigur Ros at Radio City Music Hall on October 5. Despite having seen tons of concerts in NYC, this was my first time at Radio City and the beauty, acoustics and overall historic vibe was tremendous.

Don't miss this!. A wonderful tour. We actually got to go on the stage! It's quite overwhelming to walk in the footsteps of so many famous people. Our guide was excellent and gave us full information. We felt very privileged. One tip - try to go for an early morning tour when the groups are likely to be smaller.

Tour excellence xx. We recently visited this venue on the last day of our holiday, it's excellent value for money. Our tour guide Michael gave us a very in depth detailed tour, he made it easy with his warm personality and sense of humour. This tours a must do, it's a great venue, steeped in history an integral part on the New York theatre scene.
Nice to look at. This was a great building to see near the Rockafeller Centre. I'm not quite sure who was playing and we didn't go inside but it suits the flashiness of Midtown.

Acoustics and Ambiance Make any Occasion Special. We grabbed a one night only showing of Il Divo here. The acoustics were fantastic and it is hard to imagine any seat being less than perfect. Was nice to see a show in the hall where Annie saw her first movie. Felt like Daddy Warbucks.
Concert in Radio City. My first visit in Radio City Music Hall. Wasting Il Divo concert. Absolutely grate place to watch such a show. You can take drinks to the hall which was quit unusual for Finn.

Christmas spectacular. Beautiful venue for this nostalgic magical Christmas extravaganza. Incredible experience. Made me feel like I was a child again loving every sprinkle of Christmas cheer. Best show I've ever seen. If you love Christmas you'll love this. And the Santa is so like the real one.....

James Bay Concert. Haven't been to this theater since I was about 8 for the Christmas Spectacular. So let's just say going for a concert I had no idea how it would be. Well I think this just might be one of the best places to see a concert! The acoustics are incredible and I truly don't think there is a bad seat because the theater is not that large. It still has its old school Art Deco thing going on and well if you have a chance to see a band or just go you won't be disappointed! The only downfall might have been the lines for the bathroom and the lines to get a drink!! Be prepared to be patient but other than that can't beat it!

Beautiful venue...with the Rockettes while we were there. This is a beautiful theater. We saw the Christmas Rockettes show. Although some of my family thought it would be corny, we ended up really enjoying it. Great show. We were about five rows from the stage, so we had a great view of the dancers and actors. Getting in and out of the theater was very efficient.

Opeth!!!. Thank you Radio City for bringing Opeth to your incomparable stage! This is a great place to see a progressive metal show. It was my third one here. The sound is amazing, the seats are comfy and well spaced. But the merchandise set up was really really bad. We really want to buy tshirts and posters and stuff but we don't want to spend half the show waiting in line to do so. This was the same at the other shows I've been to here. Please fix this.

Radio city music hall & Rockettes. Thoroughly enjoyed the Rockettes performance at Radio City. The iconic hall is stylish old theatre. Acoustics are great and have modern special effects. Efficient movement of patrons in and out of the theatre, and they do security checks of bags. Shouldn't miss a performance here--this is a NYC experience icon.
Unexpected visit. It was nice to come across the Hall. A great place to take tons of picture and enjoy the lights from outside.

Radio City Music Hall. We took a tour of Radio City Music Hall and it was very interesting. We went up and down and all around inside Radio City Music Hall. We went behind the stage and even met a Rockette.
Fantastic venue. Take the back stage tour with a guide for a terrific insight into RCMH. We also saw a concert there, the likes of which we will never see again, just wonderful!!!

Came to see Miike Snow. This place was absolutely amazing for seeing Miike Snow, the acoustics were amazing and the ladies bathroom was like a mini palace! Such a nice place. Make sure you bring ID out with you though if you want to buy alcohol as they were ID'ing everyone and even people who were clearly over 21 were being refused service if they couldn't provide a valid ID.

One of the Great Music Halls.. Took a behind the scenes tour of the great Radio City Music Hall . What a great tour from the bowels under the stage to the highest point in the theater. It seats over 5900 people and hosts many awards shows like the Emmy's, the Tony's and the MTV Awards among others. The Rockettes are legendary and perform 600 shows between Nov. and Jan. On the tour you actually get to meet a real Rockette! You also get to see "Roxie" Rockefeller's private suite in the theater. This is where Roxie had his bedroom and private dining room and kitchen . He would entertain people like Judy Garland for dinner parties. The entire theater is so iconic and so beautifully preserved . It was a fabulous 90 minutes of theater history .
Amazing!. This is one of my favorite theaters in all of the USA! The decor is wonderful, nice and spacious seating and the views are great!
An Amazing Venue. We took a tour of this amazing building and were impressed by it's size and complexity.Our guide was very competent and knowledgeable.A great tour and shouldn't be missed.

O P E T H \,,/. First time in New York, First time at Radio City Music Hall. A++ Absolutely fantastic sounding concert hall one of the best I've ever been to, also extremely friendly staff and ushers. Oh, and "Opeth" was simply, freaking amazing!! I will definitely be returning.

Restored to previous glory.. The buildiing and the interior have been restored to previous glory. The theater if immense. There are no "bad" seats. Take the Back Stage Tour, it is well worth the time.
Go for the tour. We did the tour and found it to be very informative and interesting. It made us want to come back during the holidays for the christmas show.

Take the "behind the scenes" tour on the NYC Pass card.. The behind the scenes tour is excellent. They'll take you, in small groups, everywhere... and explain the history, architecture and art of this classic building. It's fascinating to see how the stage mechanisms work and to also visit their famous green room (used for parties).
great. great piece of history , very interesting to me , a bit dated these days but what great fond memories

Had no interest in doing this, but it was turned out to be awesome. This was included in our NY pass and it was raining out so we did it.
The theatre is stunning and we were allowed on the stage, which I was told is very rare.
We had a great tour guide. All in all a fun time, and you get to meet a rocket.

Worth taking a guided tour.. After the disappointment of a cancelled Aretha Franklin concert, my friends and I decided to take a tour of Radio City Music Hall to see what it was like. We had a terrific guide, Kurt, who gave us an informative commentary about the building, it's history and current shows. We were impressed by the main foyer/staircase with its lovely art work. We were also lucky to be taken onstage as well as backstage for a look. We had a short video which was interesting, then we had an opportunity for a photo with a one of the Rockettes, as well as time to ask her some questions. Overall, we visited many of the backstage areas which would never have been seen if we just attended a show. The tour was covered by the New York Pass.

Fascinating. This is by far one of the most beautiful venues I have ever seen. The attention to detail is incredible. It's also fascinating to know that a lot of the original decorations and even the motors that power the stage are still there and fully functional.

A MUST JUST FOR THE ART MURALS. Radio City is a classic beautiful place. Seeing shows there is wonderful. The Christmas Show is so fun even if you're 50. It's not just for kids. Concerts there are great.. Just walking up the staircase with the huge ceilings and mural on the wall is the best. You feel like you're in an old 30's movie. It's a must for visitors and New Yorkers.

NYC. The day we were touring this Building (shout out to out wonderful Tour guide Adrian ) Tony Bennet, Lady Gaga , Michael Buble and more were present ...VERY Interesting place ,very big ,,beautiful ,we were also lucky to meet and greet with some of the Rockette girls
just sight seeing. unfortunately,didn't do much but look around.it's quite old and just enjoyed seeing it so when it's on tv I can say I was there

Magial. We went to see Christmas Spectacular and absolutely loved it!! any seat is a good seat and you can enjoy the show to the fullest!! would definitely be back..If you are in NY during Christmas, you cant miss this show!

Rating the tour!. Was included with the city pass so we decided to check the tour out. Tour guide was excellent, I wish I could remember her name. We saw backstage and alot of the history involved and got to meet a real Rockette and get a picture with her. Would love to see a show sometime here.
one of the greatest. a classic new York city experience and great showsBe sure to take the tour. The hall is designed as an ocean liner and you will meet a Rockette!

Its Huge!. We took the tour which showed us the backstage areas (some of which are not usually open to the public!) seeing the technology for the staging (wait 'til you hear about the elephants) and how the Christmas Spectacular is produced. A fair bit of walking involved, but worth the trip, you can even get your photo taken with a Rockette!
ROCKETTES. before there were rock stars, there was the rockettes.......see them at this world famous music hall......near fox news any many other 6th avenue attractions

ELO last night concert . We came to see the last night of Jeff Lynnes tour and it was well worth it! The concert hall is an amazing Art Deco building, although you would not know from outside. The acoustics are brilliant due to the band stand style auditorium. Loads of leg room and comfortable seats which are staggered you don't get a restricted view due to the persons head in the row in front. The atrium is a fabulous Art Deco area which is worth a few minutes look in itself. If you are not doing a concert it would be well worth booking a tour, I wish we had!

Excellent tour. This building is an amazing example of Art Deco design and engineering. The tour takes you through the backstage area, the 'Roxy suite' , many public areas and the audition room for the Rockettes. The tour guide was well spoken and very patient. I definitely recommend this tour.

Excellent venue!. Just heard ELO (Electric Light Orchestra) here on Sept. 18th. Great location! Comfortable seats! Could see and hear very well! Great venue for this excellent group! Staff was friendly and helpful. Would be happy to hear another group here! Worth the price of the ticket!
What a great tour. We really enjoyed touring behind the scenes here. We have also seen several performances here as well and can think of no better place to see a show.
Great Tour. Thoroughly enjoyed the tour we did. Very good tour guide and fascinating to see backstage - especially the restroom areas!

A must see theatre. Wow . I have never seen such a magnificent theatre any where in the world. So vast. It seats over 3000 people. There are no obstructive vies as there are no pillars to block your view. too many wonderful things to mention about the interior decor.

The Stage Door Tour Is Great. Taking in a movie or show at Radio City Music Hall is great, and if the Rockettes are performing it's a must. But you only get to see the lobby and auditorium (which are spectacular). Take the "Stage Door Tour" and you get to see all of the behind the scenes places. You visit the main men's and women's rooms, which are lovely, the back stage area which is amazing and interesting, and the fabulous apartment of Roxy Rothafel, the creator of the Rockettes. And you meet a Rockette and get to take pictures with her if you like. You get to see a great deal more, too. The tour lasts 90 minutes, so you have enough time for it to go into detail but it is not so long as to be exhausting.

ELO. Saw elo there. They were great, the light show was great the sound was good. Getting in was horrible. We got on line at 745 , and not get into the Hall until almost 830. I realized they needed to beef up security, but seems to me they were not prepared for it.

Great venue to go see a concert. Went to see ELO with Jeff Lynne on Sunday evening. The venue is well kept and very comfortable. Lines move quickly, the venue holds 6,015 people. Great show from start to finish !! Would definitely recommend going to see a show at this venue.

Twice in two consecutive nights.. We enjoyed a wonderful and informative tour of Radio City Hall the day before going to see ELO and what a fantastic venue it is. The sound system and venue treats one to a class apart from many venues and we were so pleased to have actually been informed as to the history of the place beforehand. Great venue for any concert and so much better than massive arena's and football grounds.

Radio City Stage Door Tour - Fantastic!. We passed Radio city and to my shock my other half hadn't heard of it! When i realised there was a tour i knew he would love it! We got our tickets for the next tour, only had a 15 minute way. All the staff were very helpful. Our tour guide was christian B. He was fantastic! Some of the other tours we have done on our trip the tour guides just read a script basically, but Christian was energetic and full of facts, he made the information fun! The building is amazing. Just lovely! You get to see all around the building, backstage and also meet a rockette. The venue is full of history and pictures of singers and bands who have played the venue.This wasn't on our itinerary we just did this on a whim, and i am so glad we did as it was one of the best tours we did on our trip! I really recommend this trip to everyone :)

Visions of former grandeur. Good acoustics, comfortable seats, plentiful bathroom stalls. The security line wrapped around the block, but moved efficiently. A modest selection of beverages/snacks was available, at the types of premium prices that's typical of venues such as this one.One item of note: when purchasing orchestra tickets, keep in mind that, unlike many similar places, double-letter rows are closer to the stage (i.e. row DD is by the stage, whereas row D would be towards the middle of the orchestra section).

Jeff Lynne ( ELO ) . Radio City music hall was soooo nice , and Jeff Lynne's ELO WAS AMAZING!! His voice, the band , the atmosphere!!!!!! Another classic off my bucket list . But i hope to get to see him again !

Backstage Tour. The interior of RCMH is beautiful and the history that was taught to us by our guide was worth the trip. Amazing to think this building was built for $8M!! Everything from the columns to the carpet is intentional. Going under the stage and seeing the platform lifts was unforgettable. We will certainly be back to see the Christmas show some day.

Fantastic. I thought it would be fantastic but it was even better than I thought it would be. We met a Rockette and had our photo with her. Our guide was great and funny too. Listening to all the information on the hall and it's guests was great and informative.

ELO Concert. We got tickets to see ELO one of two nights that they were here. The show that we saw was sold out. Our seats were pretty good, second balcony, and the seats were very comfortable. The acoustics there are amazing and ELO sounded great that night. The ticket stated that they were on at 8 p.m. and that wasn't the case. They didn't appear until 9 and that gave people plenty of time to get lubricated, which later produced some of the typical obnoxious concert behavior that I have complained about so many, many times. There was one bimbo who got so plastered that she decided to stand in the aisle and wiggle herself until she almost fell. Eventually and usher came in and told her to sit down. Within a minute she was up again and again the usher had to come in. There was no telling this drunk anything; she was up a third time and back into the aisle. I wouldn't have cared except that naturally, she was right in front of us! What's new...Luckily, I was able to spot two empty seats and we moved to them. By this time there were other wiggling fannies in front of us but it was toward the end of the show and the ushers didn't bother to tell those people to sit down. I wonder if anyone's actually fallen over the balcony. Other than those things, the music itself was great and I'm glad that ELO is still touring.
beautiful hall. beaiful theater to see christmas spectacular or your favorite artist when performing at this venue. take a backstage tour if its offered.

Beautiful and Historic Venue. This venue is most closely associated with the Rockettes who give an amazing show both at Christmas and during the summer. The theater is well maintained and seating is comfortable.

Christmas Show is excellent. We have taken our children and now we are taking our granchildren. The true meaning of Christmas is here. The "Political Correct Police" have not stopped this famous NY Site from presenting why we celebrate Christmas. The live animals are an amazing site. You can hear lovely Christmas Hymns.There is now a Spring show each year and concerts during the year.

Fun place to go but interior needs updated. We enjoyed seeing ELO at Radio City and just being there, knowing the history of the place makes it a special venue but it is definitely showing its age and could use a renovation on the interior. Staff was all very nice.
Art Deco splendour. We had an excellent guide who took us around the theatre and into some back rooms etc. Very interesting history and the Art Deco is stunning

Fabulous place. Absolutely fabulous place very easy to find and get in love this place from now on every time we go to Manhattan were gunna go to radio city we love it and cannot rave about enough came to nyc for our honeymoon the 2nd time we've been to nyc and we saw the rockettes Christmas spectacular it was sensational timeless place wish I lived in New York I would go ther every week

The Rockettes rock. We made the effort to see the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular show two years in a row. This Summer we went back to see the New York Spectacular and enjoyed it tremendously too.'The precision dance routine, the story line, the change in scenery, the costume and the orchestra made it an all rounded entertainment.

Excellent Tour . We really enjoyed the tour of Radio City Music Hall. The interior is a stunning Art Deco design. The history of the venue is fascinating and the behind the scenes access is special. Great tour guide too.

Rockettes truly spectacular. Rounded off our trip brilliantly. Expected an amazing dance show but got so much more in a beautiful setting. Thoroughly recommend for all ages (including cynical teenage sons!)

Not really worth it. We had high expectations for the radio city music hall tour but we were left disappointed. We didn't get to visit the main auditorium just other things that really should be on the tour for example we passed the same toilet twice. We met the rockettes but beware as they charge for the photos and you aren't permitted to take your own. I think we should of just stuck to seeing the thanksgiving decorations nearby and saved our money

Very pleasant surprise!. We decided to tour here as the tickets were part of the NY City Pass and have to say it is well worth a visit. Beautiful building, full of history and brought to life by the knowledgeable tour guide, Melissa.
Always wonderful. Every show we have seen here is excellent! The music hall is very grand! A must visit when in the city. If you can make it to the Christmas Spectacular I strongly recommend it!

A World Class Venue!. If you are in New York and want to see a world class venue offering a world class performance, Radio City Music Hall is a must. The Christmas holiday show is one of a kind. Purchase tickets months in advance.
Radio City. Went there to see the Radio city Rockettes and the place is beautifully huge! The staff is nice and I got see one of my favorite actors perform.

Rockettes are amazing!. Pros: they have taken great care in maintaining this venue. It's beautiful! AND The Rockettes show is amazing! Great for adults and kids! You get a chance before the show to take a picture with a couple of the dancers. Great time!Cons: Adults only beware, there are a lot of kids that attend...at any hour. Be prepared to hear a kid or two cry...but it won't ruin the show!
Visit the Rockettes. A must see. We visited Radio City Music Hall and went to see the Rockettes.. What a performance they put on.. A must see for sure..

Wow! What a room!. Got to see my favorite living guitar player at Radio City in April of 2016, David Gilmour. Radio City is a hall built to honor the art of the live performance. This place is amazing.
Backstage tour is a must do when in New York. Loved the tour and managed to get free tickets to the NFL draft just by walking past, try to catch a show there if you can, it's a fantastic theatre.

Like going back in time. If you are visiting NYC you must go to Radio City. It is like going on a time machine. This is how entertainment was 100 years ago and more. Always very talented dancers and well scripted "plays ". Beautiful music hall.

Not up to expectations. I have just come back from NY and one of the attractions I visited was the Radio City Tour. This comes highly recommended, and I think I will be out of step here with other reviewers, but for me, the tour which cost $26.96 and takes one and a quarter hours is a disappointment. I didn't even step into the main auditorium!! I saw the foyer, the lifts, loos etc, which was all very interesting, and the tour itself was well done, but I was very sorry not to even step inside this palatial sized space!! We did see if from a viewing room behind glass and from high up, but we weren't allowed to take any photos. I was very disappointed.

Loved it!!. Absolutely loved this tour. It was not something I thought of doing before, but so glad we did! The building was beautiful with a lot of the original Art Deco items still in place. It was great to go behind the scenes and meet a Rockette and learn about all the different shows they have had there over the years. Alvin was an amazing tour guide! Defo recommend this tour to anyone visiting New York
One of a Kind!. Radio City Music Hall is unto itself! Just to see the famous rockettes is a thrill in an extrodinary theatre not to be missed if this is your first visit to NYC!

Hidden gem. Decided to do the tour on a whim as we walked past and we are so glad we did. An amazing art deco building and we got to see behind the scenes and meet one of the famous Rockettes. Give it a chance to wow you as well.

Interesting tour. The tour was interesting, particularly the stage workings...amazing! Got to meet with a Rockette in costume and she answered questions and then got a photo taken with her which they sold for way too much at the end of the tour. Didn't have to buy it though...capitalism at its finest!!!

Informative tour. We weren't going to do this tour but because we had just been up to the TOP OF THE ROCK (AAAAAMAZING) we decided to use another freebie from the NY pass. We are so glad we did! The tour guide was friendly and knowledgeable when it came to dates and previous stars/history. Pretty cool watching Americas got talent and knowing we walked all through there. Id recommend it

Very Interesting details. We took this tour using our New York pass so we got the tour for free. The morning we were there the theatre was preparing to host Marc Antony so there was a real buzz in the air. The tour is very interesting showing you behind the scenes and showing you behind the stage and what actually goes on. Nice decor and well worth a visit. Our guide was very knowledgeable.You can see the room where all the artists can entertain before their show. No sitting on the furniture in this room. Photos can be taken but no video.

Back Stage Tour. We went on the backstage tour of Radio City and it was great. We were a party of 3 and there were 2 other participants who dropped out of the tour early so effectively we had a private tour! Our guide was Joyce and she was lovely - very knowledgable and enthusiastic about the venue. It was lovely to meet a rockette and just see the beauty of the building itself having not set foot inside before. I would recommend the tour to travellers to NYC.

A morning visit to Radio City Music Hall. We had a few extra hours in NYC and decided to visit Radio City Music Hall one morning. We purchased the tickets right next door to the Music Hall and waited in the lobby for the tour to begin, about a 15 minute wait. We were a group of about 20-25 eager visitors who were shown this magnificent building. The tour guide was articulate and told us a wealth of information of the building. She answered many questions and at the end we had a short film with the history of the building followed by a question and answer time by one of the Rockets (you could have your photo taken with her, if you wished). I think it ran about 1- 1/2 hour, but the time went by quickly. You must see the ladies room which still looked like 1927.

Love It!. The guide was knowledgeable and behind those doors was a whole new experience of what a theatre should be. Extremely impress with the ambience they retained over the decades. Definitely will want to watch the Rockettes perform if given a chance to revisit in Xmas

Christmas spectacular was ace!. The christmas spectacular at radio city was ace! Surprised by how good it was, thought it would be a bit naff but it was one of the best evenings we had in NYC. Recommended to everyone!
Amazing Theatre. This is an amazing theatre and our guide on the day was clearly passionate about the place and its history. The tour lasted about 90 minutes and was always interesting.

Jimmy Fallon tickets. We arrived here and waited in a line to see if we could get tickets to the Jimmy Fallon show. We went into the store and my sons were able to see the Jimmy Fallon show. My wife and I saw Hoda from the today show. We did not go to the top of the rock because we had made other plans but we will be going up to the roof next time we visit.
The Rockettes performance was amazing!. We got our tickets the day of the show for the Rockettes and got pretty good seats.. The show was spectacular and so much fun! Such talented performers!

Good value and interesting. You don't have to be interested in theatre to enjoy this experience. It is an interesting and informative tour which goes into the history of RCMH as well. Worthwhile visit

Iconic building. Have always had this on the radar to visit since I've heard so much about it growing up. There was a nice gentleman who answered our questions when we went inside to look at the building. There are tours offered daily. Not sure how much they cost...didn't go.

Really interesting. We did this tour on our last day in new York, as part of the New York Pass. It might not be top of your list for attractions to visit but it was really great. Our guide was full of enthusiasm for this fabulous building and its history was fascinating. Well worth a visit.

One of my favorite stops - Christmas Spectacular. This is always a super amazing historic spot. I love coming here for the holidays when the street is all light up anddecorated and then I step in to the magical area where Christmas happens - there are so many deals on tickets but get them early.
Marc Anthony Concert. We had the pleasure to experience everything about the Radio City Music Hall. Beautiful place! We saw Marc Anthony in concert! Best concert ever!
Rockettes Rock. This is a great show. Very much a classic NYC experience. Their Christmas show is great for kids and adults.
Absolutely Stunning. The programming here can be a little hit or miss, but the building is absolutely stunning. Try to go when the Rockettes are performing, they're also a total must-see.
Great Place. We took a NY tour Its a lot of walking like most of NYC is but the guides are excellent and its an interesting part of NYC History. A must again in your list.....

A must do. I started going here when I was five so that is 65 years ago. Have taken my daughter and now granddaughters.
It delights all
Wow. RCMH is not to be missed. The size of the auditorium is enormous, and the art deco theme is not to be missed.
Love the Rockettes. went to see the christmas show.. It was GREAT. the lobby is beautiful and the show was great. this is a must see if you are in New York.
1st Time in NYC. We had a NY Pass and this was a tour we decided to take. Its a lot of walking like most of NYC is but the guides are excellent and its an interesting part of NYC History.
A must see. Taking photos just walking past is nostalgic...Night and day this looks great. With NBC near by, you can't miss it.

Must visit place during Christmas season. If you are in New York city during Christmas season. Then you must see the Rockettes at Radio city. Outside the music hall the places are beautifully decorated with lights. There is a water fountain nearby which is really spectacular at night with Christmas ligt decorations
Best experience ever. If you only visit one theatre, this is the one! Fantastic show, we have been four years running now. Book on line from England & collect tickets at will call all very civilised
trip back in time. Excellent guided tour through the art décor marvel that has hosted a multitude of stars and the dance troupe the rockettes informative and entertaining guides.
Landmark Spot. Saw the Rockets twice here and not only is the performance amazing but to see it in the Iconic theatre adds to the experience.

Timeless. We saw the Rocketts. It was a wonderful show in the beautiful Radio City Music Hall. If you have the opportunity to take in this show, you won't be sorry! Brings the holidays a little closer!
See Radio City show. Go see Radio City Christmas Spectacular show. They also stage a Spring show which equally beautiful.

Not expecting so much history. If you get a chance, take the back stage tour at Radio City. The tour gives a history of the building and how unique the stage is (think aircraft carriers). I have seen several performances at Radio City Music Hall ... but I never really appreciated how much more there is.

New York Spectacular. We attended the New York Spectacular featuring the Rockettes. The show was a real treat but the building itself adds so much to the occasion. It is a gorgeous art deco style building and even the restrooms are worth exploring as they have a different theme on each floor!
Rockettes. Saw those gorgeous talented Rockettes there a couple of times. I loved the Christmas show a lot! I really enjoyed the grandure of the building also!
The Rockettes Rocked!. The production was produced by Mia Michaels and the perfection of the show was very evident. A wonderful way to spend the evening.

The Crown Gem of NY theatrics!. Although I have seen concerts at this location it;s the Christmas show that makes this place a famous destination. The NYC Rockettes are known worldwide for their dance routines and shows. if you are in new york and you get a chance to see the Rockettes in action...DON'T MISS IT!

A great trip for tourists to see this wonderful show!. I would recommend this show very highly having been to see one
every year on my trip to New York! It truly is fabulous and the
dancing and singing are not to be missed!

Did not disappoint!. I have always wanted to see the Rockettes at Radio City Music Hall. A few years back, We did see their Christmas show in Orange County, CA. It was nice, but I really wanted to get into RCMH!!Anyway, purchased tickets thought the website. Got "better: seating due to Chase card. Some people say to sit far back to see it all, but I have to disagree. We were about 5 rows back and it was PERFECT. That said, I would sit in ANY seat to see them.The venue was BREATHTAKING. I got tears in my eyes when we walked it. I am so glad we got the tickets and went. Worth every penny.The show was SPECTACULAR. It was a good show to see as a tourist, as it showed all the different areas. The music was great, the girls looked good and it was a nice evening.The entry was sort of a mess. We arrived just before the show was going to start. Instead of a line, it was a mob to get in. Took a while to get our bags poked, etc. If you are planning on going, give yourself at least 30 minutes. Also, at the end of the evening, we lined up to get our picture with a Rockette (you pay), and got in line to buy merchandise. We then headed to the bathroom and were given GRIEF. Show's over, go home. Rude. Sorry we were in line spending money. We were not able to use the toilet before the show because it took all our time to get in, then could not get in after due to the lines. Maybe a little more understanding that customers have a right to pee!! :)
Rockettes!!. Last minute we booked tickets to see the summer show which also happened to be their last weekend. So glad we did as it was a favorite part of the trip for sure!

Class act in NYC. We called in as the rain came down to take the tour. We had the explorer NYC card which came in handy. What an awesome venue. To think they almost knocked it down. Rarely do you get to see a venue with this character. Well worth a visit to get a behind the scenes look at this iconic venue. Got to mention staff were great, Allie the guide was friendly and informative and even down to Kenneth on the info desk at the door, all very welcoming.

Amazing Venue , steeped in glamourous History , fabulous show.. I went to see the "Christmas Extraveganzer Spectacular" and it was just that.The show and performers were the best I've seen anywhere. Some sets took me back in time to the old tiller girls. I use to sit in ore and watch these when i was a little girl.There was so much glamour , the costumes and sets are very authentic.The building itself is steeped in history , to the likes of Lizza Minnelli appearing there, , the sweeping staircase really gives you a true insight of what an important venue Radio City is. I loved it so much i will be going back again this year.
Amazing performance . I was there on a Chinese New year performance. It was brilliant. Unforgettable experience. Would visit again

Rockettes Spring Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall was Excellent. The show was marvelous. My daughter and granddaughter loved it and I thought it was excellent. I don't think there is a bad seat in Radio City Music Hall so if you can get a ticket to see a show there, then don't miss your chance.

This is the wonderful performance worldwide. Don't miss this.. The Rockettes are fabulous , no doubt about it. Be sure to buy your tickets well in advanced, anyplace in the theater is great. They are coming for another one "Christmas Spectacular". This one New York Spectacular.

Tour was full of interesting facts and information. We only did the tour, but wished we had booked to see a show. Tour was great and I highly recommend it, but I would book to see a show to as once you've done the tour you just want to see a show in this amazing landmark.

Summer Spectacular was SPECTACULAR!. I highly recommend seeing this new show at the Radio City. It runs for 2 weeks in July/Aug. Rackets are amazing. I never thought I would enjoy this. Went for my daughter and sat grinning the whole 90 minutes. And it's affordable - only $60/ticket.

Rockettes really rock. We were looking for a last minute family show this summer during our short stop over visit to New York, en route to Florida. This one really fitted the bill. All of our kids aged from 7-12 got something out of it, whether it was the music, the dancing or the special effects. There was of course a little bit of glitz and glamour about it all so the adults enjoyed it too, especially with the excellent seats coming in at a mere $50 a head, which is a snip compared to Broadway. The story of two kids lost by their love struck parents at Grand Central is a little stretched of course, but it provides a workable backdrop for an uplifting dance across the Manhattan skyline and the attractions that it has to offer. All in all a great family night out.
Beautiful landmark. This is a beautiful facility. Makes you feel like you are stepping back in time. Even the ladies room is something to see. If you are seeing a show , seating is goid.

Back stage tour. this was an insight into the history of the Radio City Music hall as well as a touch of 'nostalgia' from the 30's up to today.Guide Christian was informative and a chat with Allison the 'rockette' was pretty cool..we learnt a few things from her :)all in all I highly recommend this tour.

Always a memorable experience. I took my family to see the New York Spectacular this summer at the Radio City Music Hall. What a pleasant experience! Even though we know every location personally well, we still enjoyed the spectacular performance of the song and dance. It is absolutely New York City at her best.
Rockettes are the Best!. Saw Mia Michael's production "New York Spectacular" and it was! A definite highlight of our trip! Can't say enough about this production. TOP SHELF!!

Walking tour. Wife and I took walking tour today. Wasn't sure what to expect, but we were pleasantly surprised. Curt was our guide and we couldn't have asked for anyone better. Very, very knowledgeable about the theater. Tour was a 4 but Curt made up the extra to make it a 5.
Really good tour!. Very nice tour, you also get a sneak peak of the running show and meet one of the rockettes! we also got a discount for the New York spectacular show for later in the day.
Best theatre ever. Radio city music hall is one of the best theatres in NYC. Went to see the Rockettes in Christmass espectacular. It was simply amazing, one of the best shows i've ever seen.

Historic Visit. We booked this before we arrived in New York, this is not to be missed, the guide was very informative the history behind the Radio City Music Hall was to say the least was very interesting. We were allowed to go on stage and look up towards the balcony it was amazing we also were able to go behind and under the stage. We were taken up to the top balcony so we had a spectacular view of the stage from above. We were also introduced to one of the Rockettes and have our photo taken.This is a must do in New York.

LOVED IT!. They take you to a private viewing area to watch a show, if there's one happening! We saw a good part of the New York Extravaganza with the Rockettes, and also met one of the girls during our tour. Pics were allowed! Very informative tour of this luxurious icon!
We had a great time. We went to the summer spectacular. The kids all loved it and were not bored at all. Even my son who was sure that he was not going to like it had a good time. Beautiful building.

Art deco galore. Didn't know what to expect on this tour but i was wonderfully surprised. Its art dec decor is wonderfully preserved and the backstage tour was awesome. Would recommend tghis to anyone

A New York Landmark. I gave this site 5 stars, not for its appearance but for its significance to New York. The Rockets, the shows, and the memories. I have been to this memorable location since I saw the Christmas Show there as a child. If you come to New York try to stop by to see the outside and if you can to see whatever show is going on inside.

Summer show - fantasy in NYC. Much to my surprise, security began at admission by having to form a line along 50th St, having my ticket scanned as I entered the line, and then a similar to airport security to get into the lobby of the theater. After all that, I promptly found my seat and then enjoyed a remarkable show which highlighted the sights and sounds of NYC from Central Park to the Battery and the Statue of Liberty. Special effects, lighting, a rain storm on stage, dancing and singing statues, buskers, the Rockettes, a live orchestra all contributed to the story of two children looking for their parents. A very enjoyable 2.5 hour production.

An Art Deco gem. We did the guided tour of the hall and were not disappointed. A beautifully restored theatre that is clearly a big part of NY life. Would recommend the tour, you even get to meet a real life Rockette !

Amazing To See Inside. The Radio City Music Hall is amazing to see inside of. We saw the Rockettes Summer Spectacular and were amazed! A great show. And of course the music hall itself is amazing to see inside of. It is an amazing building.

I Loved It!. We went to see the Rockettes perform in their summer spectacular. There were also male Rockettes performing. The theater is beautiful. It was exciting to be in a landmark theater. You have to see the Rockettes and the Hall. It was such a positive experience!
Spectacular show. I hadn't been to a show here in about 40 years! I sat entranced...felt like a little girl seeing something magical for the first time.

Take the tour. Firstly the staff front of house were lovely. They kept my daughter entertained until the tour began and she got upset when we left as they were so lovely.
The tour is very informative, yet there is no toilet break which was needed. The guide was reluctant to let us sit in some of the seats, but we had fun
Rockettes!. Good old fashioned fun. We saw the "New York" special and really enjoyed it, especially the finale when the ladies performed en masse. We took a 13 year old and she loved it, too.
Classic. This is an iconic place in the city. All the spectacles played here are high quality. Rockettes really rock! Both attendance to New York Spectacular or Christmas Spectacular are a must see!
the Rockettes rock!. we bought tickets one day in advance at RCMH and saw the latest Rockettes show, it was great, highly recommend

Fantastic Tour Made Better by Enthusiastic Staff. I was surprised at the size of the theater. It seats at least 10,000. We got to meet and talk to a rockette who was adorable and very candid and informative about her work. The whole place is impressive. There is a video. You get to sit in the theater and see the costume room. It's a lot of fun. Wish we had had time to see a show.

New York City Spectacular!. My boyfriend and I went to see the New York City Spectacular in July. Besides the venue being breathtaking, it is actually really comfortable! We sat on the 1st level in front of the stage (Row GG) and had a great view! At some point during the show, the performers were dancing and singing around us and running through the aisles! It was really engaging and fun to see! I'll definitely go back for the Christmas Spectacular!
Lots of glitz and glamour. Very interesting tour and bit of show-biz history. Meet a genuine Rockette and have your picture taken with her.
Iconic. It was great to visit the Music Hall and see the Rockettes. It is one of the bucket list things to do in New York.
Christmas Classic!. Seeing the Rockettes at Radio City Music Hall is a Christmas in NYC "must do". The show is so much fun and the music hall is beautifully decorated. It's a memory we won't forget!
Christmas Spectacular. Watched the evening show on Xmas day. Doesn't get more Xmassy than that. Excellent show, well worth seeing. Very spacious venue, with well trained staff

Summer spectacular. Great experience for the entire family. The magic of Radio City is in full force. You can get a ticket day of the show. Tickets can be pricy, however I sat in the 2nd Mezzanine and had full view of the stage. The entire show was 2 hours. Don't miss it !!!!

Summer spectacular. Thought it was going to be just the rockettes but it was an extraordinary show with fantastic effects; on par with a Broadway show. The audience was predominantly female but my husband enjoyed it as much as I did. Would definitely go again.

Amazing!. I brought my daughter to see the Radio City Music Hall Summer Spectacular before it ended it's run. We got into the city and went up to Radio City to take the tour before the 2 pm show. I had pre-ordered tickets which I had to pick up from the Will Call window and then take that ticket to the gift shop to get a timed ticket for the tour. We were in the 12:30 tour which was cutting it a bit close for the show. The tour was awesome- our guide was energetic, engaging, enthusiastic and knowledgable. The tour was 75 minutes long and we walked all through the lobby side of the hall. You don't actually get to go back stage or see the dressing rooms. It is more about the history of Radio City, which was quite fascinating. The Summer Spectacular show was truly spectacular. From the moment the Rockettes came out out stage for the opening Heartbeat of NY number to the kick line at the end, it was amazing! The show was just long enough (~90 minutes) to keep your interest, especially for kids. The food was pricey- $9 for a small popcorn in a souvenir cup but we had our own water so that saved some money. We can't wait to see the Christmas show!

breathtaking. We came for the summer Rocketttes show. It was everything you see on TV. I might have teared up when we sat in our seats and I saw the big red curtain. I just felt so fancy and grown up. It was amazing.

A Favorite Venue. I've watched the Rockettes dance to perfection for over 50 years! The sound system is incredible, so it is the perfect place for a concert. The holiday show is beautfiul and creative. The seats are comfortable, and the music hall is gloriously beautiful.

Loved It!. My family enjoyed the tour inside Radio City. Their tour guide is friendly and has a sense of humor. Because of this we watched their live show. It was reaĺly awesome! It is what New York is known for.

Iconic with beauty . We went for a Rockett show. Just stand in the middle of the lobby and look at time such a thrill was my 1st time there. Beauty of time and the famous people that walked though the lobby. The bathrooms are still well maintained from years past. This place is a must do if you come to NYC. If you take a tour of the place it will show you pictures of many stars. You also get to see the Rocketts. I loved the whole experience.
August 2016. Saw the Rockettes Summer Show at Radio City Music Hall. Not as good as the Christmas Show. Not as crowded the night we were there.
New York Spectacular. if you love all forms of dance and theatrics, this show is for you! We were not disappointed and neither will you.

The Rockettes Summer Spectacular. We took our friends to see the Rockettes at Radio City Music Hall. They did not know what to expect. The show exceeded all their expectations. The venue is as spectacular as the Rockettes show. We had our photo taken with one of the Rockettes, which we named Roxy. It was an unbelievable experience.
Radio City Music Hall. I remember my Grand Mother taking me to see the Rockets way back in the 50s. Still there, still doing it.

Enjoyable tour !. Visited the Radio City music hall using our New York Pass. Only had to wait 30 minutes for the next tour - group was small 8 people. Cassie was our tour guide - she had many interesting facts about the venue and was very knowledgeable. She even attempted to speak French to one of the group. The Music hall itself is like a step back in time - you get the opportunity to sit in the auditorium. At the end of the tour we were able to watch one of the Rockettes numbers as the afternoon show had just started. Very enjoyable glad we took the time to do it.

Wonderful tour, beautiful building. We attended a Rockettes show, which was fabulous. We also took the tour and really enjoyed it. My three teenage daughters enjoyed meeting a Rockette, seeing the costume room and private apartment, as well as the many posters of past performers.

Wonderful Rockettes Summer Show. Not only is Radio City Music Hall a beautiful place but it is well kept up. Plenty of rest rooms. Nice seating. We attended the Rockettes Summer Show there and it was fabulous!! They are always so good and so precise! They deserve their reputation!

Go see a show!. If you get the opportunity to go see a show here, make it a priority. This is one of those venues like the Royal Albert Hall in London which has an atmosphere all of its own. Their Christmas (and Summer) Spectacular's are events in their own rights and really do make for a highlight and memorable part of any NYC stay.

Christmas Spectacular is Spectacular!. We took my 8 and 6 year old children for the Christmas of 2015. It was every bit as good and better than I had remembered from my previous visits. It has been jazzed up a bit with special effects to keep up with the times, but kept all the classic Rockette moments from years gone by. My favorite, the march of the toy soliders! The tickets are pricey, but were worth every penny to see the awe on my son's face as he sat on the edge of his seat the whole time! The live Nativity at the end is always fantastic as well!
Amazing Venue. Such a great place to see a show! We saw the Rockettes New York show and really enjoyed it. The venue itself is huge, and a fun place to be.

Iconic. Great tickets for Chase Monday promotion. We had orchestra seating. The show was very good. The dancers amazed us. The story line was a little "immature" and irritating at times. It's the story of two fighting siblings who get lost from their parents and spend the day trying to find them. The constant "bickering" got on my nerves, but the Vogue dance montage was fantastic and outweighed the irritation.

Absolutely beautiful theatre!. We did the tour of the hall before seeing the Rockettes Spring Spectacular and it was amazing! It was so cool to learn of the history of the theatre and then to see the awesome dancers!
Awe Inspiring.. Our Hotel was steps away from this beautiful building. The Architecture is truly amazing. Go in and just sit awhile.
Amazing!. We were so glad that we did not miss seeing the architecture of this beautiful building! Plus the summer show of the Rockettes Welcome to New York was stunning!
Great Building. This wasn't on my list of places to visit but when I stumbled upon it I just had to go inside and it is impressive. I wish I had allowed more time

Rockettes!!!. Went to see the New York show starring the Rockettes and loved every single minute. It might seem like a cheesy and touristy thing to do but it was worth every dime...show was amazing, as were the sets and visual effects! Theater is absolutely beautiful and pictures do not do it justice.

Rockettes never disappoint!. Just back from NYC and went to see the Rockettes. The show was awesome!!!!! as always. I have seen the Rockettes 3 times and each time the show was worth every dime. The show was basically a tribute to NYC which included a storyline interwoven with the dancing. All the actors were great and having males in the dance numbers really made it feel like a Broadway show. The tix were reasonable....$70 for floor and it was a matinee. Even my friends, who aren't really show people, loved it. Had you singing as you left the show, so that's normally my indicator of a good time. If you like dancing and musical theatre, then this should be on your list of things to do in NYC.

Summer Spectacular. The Rockettes Summer Spectacular Show Was awesome! I hope they show it every year like the Xmas show. From the moment the show opens you are transformed to NEW York. The story line and costumes choreographer and the music keep you mesmerized. One of the best live performances i have ever seen.Well worth the trip.
How do you get to Radio City? Practice :). Great venue for shows. Great midtown location. Christmas show compete with world famous Rocketts is a must do if you're traveling with young kids.

Spectacular theater. Even the curtains before the show were amazingly large and beautiful! The restrooms/lounges were a nice place to sit and refresh oneself before the show. Snacks were available. Bottled waters cost about $5.00.
Mesmerizing!. Again, the hotel was near the theater. Restaurants and shopping were also nearby. Everything was in walking distance. Love that part.

Amazing Summer Rocketts Extravaganza. We went to a matinee show of the Rocketts summer show.The story was a little corny, two kids lost in New York City visiting all of the sights whilst trying to find their parents, but everything else was amazing.The special effects were sometimes unbelievable especially where the effects and the actors had to interact like when a digital subway arrives in the stage and then people get on and off the train - great.The Rocketts were great with a number of numbers all of which could have closed the show, they were so good.The actors were good and full of energy.Highly recommend this show.

Historic site and thus a must visit. Radio City Music Hall is a historic site that you have to visit. It's featured in many movies so it's a familiar sight. The place is so full of history that a behind the scenes tour is definitely recommended! And while you're there, buy tickets for a show. You won't be disappointed...

A fabulous night out!. Recommend you make the effort to queue for cheap ticket purchases at the booth in Times Square. Cut price tickets for the evening shows go on sale at 3.00pm so get in the queue about 2.30. We got our tickets at half price for the same night performance.Radio City Music Hall has all its original fittings and décor and looks fabulous. All the glitz and glamour of the '20' s and '30's is fully preserved and the show was top quality and totally energised.Really worth the visit for the experience and the fun of a great show.

A Piece of History. There are so many iconic building in NY, and this is yet another. Looks nice during the day but even better once it is all lit up. The Art Deco feel runs from the outside to the in. We did the tour which gave an insight to the building and the many famous things that have taken place there.
Iconic Venue. Radio City Hall Museum is such a splendid venue. I highly recommend catching a show in this majestic venue. It really is lovely and the Rockettes are amazing!

Awesome Tour & A Rockette, Too!. On our annual NYC trip from Watertown, NY, this year we took in a Radio City tour. Our tour guide provided us with wonderful facts. I never thought a peek @ historical restrooms would be exciting. Imagine, 1 of the worlds' priceless murals (Men Without Women) would be found here! From a visit to the practice room, costume rooms & the exhausting display of those who have performed was breathtaking...topped with a chance to meet a Rockette!However, the best part was the matinee performance of THE NEW YORK SPECTACULAR. With seats 6 rows from the stage, center aisle, we were treated to the "extras" of 'money' falling from the sky & of 'flying pixies' floating down upon us. This was a magical afternoon. Great story! Greater cast! I especially enjoyed the extra 'nudge, nudge, wink, wink' moments thrown in for us seniors.I don't know what will top it next year BUT it's New York, Baby!!

NY Spectacular. While I loved the Rockettes and the theater is as beautiful as I remember as a child I didn't love the summer show. As a Native New Yorker I think to enjoy the show you need to have no idea how far apart certain places are to enjoy this story. Again, Rockettes extraordinary rest of the show...average.
ROCKETTES DANCING IN THE RAIN. An amazing show. Not at all like I remember seeing as a kid. The show as engaging and interactive. Loved it

Stunning Art Deco. We visiting a Radio City Music Hall in July on a tour. I am a drama teacher, so theatres in general are a joy for me and I also love Art Deco, so this place was amazing. The tour guide was very interesting and it was great to learn all about the history of the building including its design. We met a Rockette as well who answered questions. The tour flew by and I recommend this as part of any trip to NYC.

Brought back memories of growing up!. When we were kids my dad would treat us each year to the Christmas show at Radio City. Haven't been there in years...
My 12-year-old daughter was mesmerized by the Art Deco architecture AND the show!
My only beef is the ticket price!! Makes me feel old and poor...but the experience with my daughter was so definitely worth it!

The NY Spectacular was Spectacular. I've been to NYC dozens of time and usually catch theater on Broadway, but this time I decided to see the NY Spectacular at Radio City Musiuc Hall, and I was blown away at this great venue and show. The theater is incredible, the staff were super friendly, the set, actors, singers, dancers and of course the Rockette's were spectacular. You can't help but smile throughout the entire show and get a tour of NYC. Absolutely fantastic.
Beautiful Theater. Attended the theater in July for the Summer Spectacular and it was awesome. Highly recommend this to all.

Rockettes!. Highly recommend!My teenage daughter and I decided on the spur of the moment to see the Rockettes at Radio City Music Hall, and it was one of the best decisions all summer! The hall is wonderful, the show was very entertaining, and the Rockettes are fabulous!

Excellent !! . It was very neat and even thought the popcorn looked old, well not SO old it tasted great! Then I took a picture with a Rockette and the bad thing was the prices, they were unreasonably high! But the performance was excellent even though the lady who served my popcorn and drinks was very mean to me! I hope you like it, and you probably will.
This is NY!. Everyone needs to tour this theatre!!! A must see! if you are there when there is a show..go and see it! The hall is really one of a kind!!!
Nice theater. We didn't really go inside, just pass through. It's very impressive theater from the outside. It about half block fro NBC studios
