Interesting tour. I took a tour of the hall. The guide was very knowledgeable and friendly. The hall is beautiful. Great pains have been taken to maintain the classic look through renovation.
Rockettes NY Spectacular. Fun evening in the Art Deco Radio City building. Rockettes show was excellent and affordable - especially on a hot night!

Spectacular Venue. We did both a tour backstage of Radio City MH and a show with the Rockettes back to back. Loved it!!! Really really good! Impressed with everthing! Rockettes show is flawless and ladies are exactly in sync with one another. Amazing! Best show in NY!

Neat Place to Tour. We didn't get to attend a show in the Hall, but we did take the tour and were able to see some neat, behind-the-scenes things/places that most folks never get to see if they simply go to a show. A lot of history in this place. The tour guide we had was nice enough and informative about the history and unique things in the Hall, but she was a bit dry. I think she was probably tired of saming the same things over and over so many times each day on the tours and it was obvious. She tried to cover it up by being pleasant, but I could tell she wasn't a happy camper. The people that supervise and give the tours are rather strict at times and make you feel as if though you may've just entered a military boot camp instead of an entertainment venue. Don't stray too far or they'll order you to get back in line! You go to the bathroom when they tell you to go to the bathroom and they give you 3 minutes ...really?! ... 3 minutes?. I can understand that they don't want to let people freely roam around a place like this without a chaperone or guide, but they were a bit over the top on this when they wanted you to do, or not do, something. I'm a rule followerer type person in most instances until I think the rules are becoming overly strict for no good reason and I felt that way on this tour. We were waiting in line for the tour inside the ticket lobby and decided to sit down on the floor next to a wall and one of the people said we were not allowed to do sit and made us stand up. It wasn't like there were 100 people in the area waiting to take the tour ... there were maybe 10 people around. To say the least, they run a "very tight ship" and could loosen up a bit. The general attitude of the tour guide folks was .... "let's get these folks in here, get them through the tour in the exact time allotted for a tour, and then send them out a side door so we can do something else that is more meaningful with our lives" ... and this attitude showed during the entire tour. It wasn't horrible, but they can do better.

Rockettes Radio City Summer Spectacular. WHAT A SHOW! I've seen everything from Wicked, to Book of Mormon, to Miss Saigon, to Aladdin, etc. So I decided to do something a little less "Broadway" and a little more "spectacle." The venue itself is magical. The openness is breathtaking while the layered ceiling illuminates every part of the music hall. The show was outstanding! The musicians, band, and orchestra take full spotlight upon the opening, and then the show begins. What a clever way to dialogue NYC, through the journey of a family on vacation, interacting with all the statues that have become famous here in NYC.The precision of the rockettes, mixed with the ensemble of boys who danced their hearts out, and the energy of the swing = BEYOND AMAZING. The whole time I was anticipating what was next. There was humor, imagination, energy, and love in every sequence. Some of my favorite parts included the NY Library, 7th Avenue Fashion, Broadway/Times Square, and of course, the finale (which had every touch of class that is NYC).Highly recommend this show to everyone and anyone. Coming from a native New Yorker, this really does highlight the best city in the world.

WOW. We had a great experience at Radio City Music Hall and took the tour before our show started. The guides were very knowledgeable. We enjoyed going through the building and learning about it's history. Great experience!
Rockettes are beautiful! Spring/ Summer show!. Loved the Rockettes - the costumes and dancing were spectacular! However, could have done without the two whiny kids running around arguing on stage.

Unbelievable piece of history. I toured Radio City Music Hall on a whim and what a surprise. The building has been restored to its former glory and it recaptures the old world charm. The tour guide was very friendly and knowledgable. I was so impressed that on the tour ending I purchased 4 tickets for a show "New York spectacular"The show was fantastic. If you're reading this and are on your way to New York don't miss this tour.

Very interesting. We booked a 'backstage' tour of this incredible theatre. The tour guide was very helpful and informative. We were taken along the many corridors of this huge building whilst being told the history at every turn. We were then allowed to sit inside the colossal auditorium to view the stage where the set for America's Got Talent was set up. We didn't actually go backstage as such or allowed to walk on the stage which was slightly disappointing but we did get to meet an ACTUAL Rockette! A very interesting, informative tour.
The Rockettes. What more can be said?. Great show. A musical journey along the island with great intermittent performances by the Rockettes. The music hall was fabulous with great amenities.

Love the rockettes. Went to the Rockette's show which is always entertaining and gets you into the Christmas spirit. Also did the tour which was much better that I could have anticipated. Did the tour through the NY pass. We definitely got our moneys worth buying a 1 day pass.

Rockettes' New York Experience show!. We had the pleasure of seeing the New York Experience with the Rockettes earlier this month at Radio City Music Hall. Such a great venue, with no bad seat in the house. All the people working were very friendly and helpful.

Iconic Music Hall: saw New York Spectacular starring the Radio City Rockets‎ - awesome!. Iconic Music Hall in NYC. Stunning building. We saw the New York Spectacular here - Starring the Radio City Rockettes‎, and it was absolutely amazing. Much better than anything we expected. Can't believe it is only on for a few weeks. The show was an overview to the top tourist sites of NY in spectacular fashion and the stage sets were incredible. I think they also do the NFL drafts in this building.

very cool place!. Saw the Radio city Rocketts for the summer show. Was amazing. Wow i wish they would extend it till like october as i have recommended it highly to friends and family. I hope to see another show here
Good seethrough. While going to Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall is a great seethrough. I am sorry that there are so many construction going on to the Radio City.
Amazing and Delightful. Haven't seen the Rockettes since childhood. They are wonderful still, but the summer show is technologically amazing. What a treat.

A New York must.. If you want to see what this amazing theatre can do go see the New York Experience this summer or the Christmas show in the winter. The Rockettes are unreal. The stage goes up, down, it rains, a subway appears, it's unreal.
Rockettes Summer Spectacular. Fabulous show. More than anticipated. Great for adults and families. Music, dancing and staging were all well done. Beautiful building as well.
Rockettes summer show. Although only a few weeks remain, this production with special effects is exceptional. Mia Michaels' choreography is first rate. Don't miss it!

Beautiful building!. The Hall is absolutely gorgeous. It was a little wam inside and our seats were 5th row, but taller people in front made it hard to see show. Also, lady in front of us recorded entire show on her phone and that was distracting. Show was okay. Rocketes were wonderful, but as my granddaughter said, "production was a little cheesy". Kind of disappointed in the show, after seeing the Broadway shows.

Awesome show - a must see in NYC. The New York Spectacular Starring the Radio City Rockettes. My aunt loves the Rockettes & we normally go to the Christmas Spectacular every year. I took her see the New York Spectacular show for her 60th birthday. We were a little apprehensive because we didn't think it would be as good as the Christmas show. Well, to our pleasant surprise, the show far exceeded our expectations. It was very entertaining. The special effects & sets were incredible. They have everything from dynamic graphics to talking / moving statues. The show holds your attention from beginning to end. My two favorite scenes were the Vogue Fashion show and the Rockettes dancing & singing in the rain. Great family show. Highly recommend seeing it!
Impressive. Watched the Rockettes Summer show. Radio City Music Hall is just plain spectacular to see. If you do not go to a show, they also have tours which should be booked a few days in advance.

Great Tour. The backstage tour is really interesting. The beautiful Art Deco surroundings and the stunning theatre is a sight to behold. Our guide was so knowledgeable, gave us lots of time for photos and was obviously so enthusiastic about her job. The Rockette we met was very friendly and happy to answer our questions. Our decision to do the tour was a spur of the moment decision and so glad we did. We were inspired to buy tickets for the show in the evening (we got a discount for attending the tour) and it was great. Amazing sets and effects, great for kids and the Rockettes are amazing. Highly recommended.
BEAUTIFUL. Ice skating, the big x-mas tree, the lights, the music it's awesome, but lots of people during the holidays. ...COLD

Great summer show !!!. My grandson and I enjoyed the summer show very much.
The Rockettes never disappoint. The music was great !.

Interestingly Historical Backstage Tour. A highlight of our trip to NYC was our backstage tour of Radio City Music Hall. Our group of 28 was comprised of kids and parents. We all enjoyed hearing and seeing the Hall. Since our visit was during a Rocketts performance, we didn't actually get to go backstage. However we were thrilled to meet one of the Rocketts (Sierra, I think was her name) and got to view the costumes room, among other areas of the Hall. It was a good tourist stop.

A part of iconic NYC - such a treat!!!. It was so exciting to see the Rockettes perform. The music, the costumes, the colourful sets...all were spectacular. the show itself was delightful - two children who end up exploring the city on their own. In its own way, it was a great orientation to the sites of the city. This is a beautiful building, with an immense stage. Ticket prices were quite fair for such a show. I enjoyed it immensely.

Fun for All Ages!!. We were encouraged by our concierge to see this show before it closed in August. So we got tickets at the last minute and we were glad we did! The show was fun for the whole family and of course the Rockettes were amazing!!

Brilliant Show - Rockette New York Spectacular. Visited in July 2016 for the New York Spectacular Rockette show.Wasn't sure what to expect. The venue is very impressive, and worth a visit just for that.However the show was really first rate. 90 minutes of singing and dancing with a loose story theme. The sets and graphics are amazing and a number of times you can't believe what you are seeing as it is so impressive. The Rockettes are also totally amazing and the whole evening was just a great night out.Would go again without a doubt.

Rockettes New York Spectacular was Spectacular!. I was so thrilled to finally be able to see the Rockettes! It was an amazing show. Great intro to the sights of NYC , creative and well done. Loved it.

Iconic Radio City Music Hall in NYC. While coming out from Top of the Rock visit, we passed by the entrance to the Radio City Music Hall. This iconic entertainment venue is located in Rockefeller Center in New York City. Its nickname is the Showplace of the Nation. Inside visits and tour programmes are available for those interested.

Watch A Show at this amazing Theater. I was there to see the Rockets and was impressed by what the theater has to offer. A must visit in New York. The inside light up with the latest graphics - unbelievable !

Stunning Iconic Landmark Building! - Radio City Music Hall. Radio City Music Hall is an iconic MUST-SEE in NYC!!! Whether you see the annual Radio City Christmas Show starring the world famous Rockettes or their new Spring Show or a music concert, you must go early and browse the lobby, mezzanine or simply sit in your theatre seat and gaze in amazement at the stunning Music Hall architecture itself. So much history here! They also offer tours! Sometimes led by an actual Rockette!!! :):):)
Amazing . This is a must-see destination for any New York visit. It is amazing how well the building has been kept for so many years. The bathrooms are a destination in themselves.

The tours are fun; the shows are great!. The venue itself is impressive. Knowing the history of the Rockettes and a bit about everything else that goes on there is a lot of fun. We saw the Rockettes show and loved it!
Radio City. Fun show. Interesting theatre. Not full and would probably saved money by purchasing as the box office. Coming from out of town was not able to ge tins info..

The Rockettes Summer Spectacular is all that and more!. We recently saw the Rockettes Summer Spectacular at Radio City and were absolutely "wowed" by the outstanding dancing, costumes sets and "tour" through some of NYC's most iconic attractions. The show runs 90 minutes without intermission and is well worth the cost. I highly recommend this show which runs only until August 7th so run - don't walk - to get your tickets. Beyond the outstanding show, the theater itself is exceptionally beautiful and something everyone should see at least once in their lifetime.
Magnificent venue for the Rockettes. MSG tour guide recommended that we get tickets to the Rockette's spring/summer spectacular at Radio City. We weren't sorry. It was a wonderful show!

Only in New York. I've been here for concerts and special events, but the true treat is to see the Rockettes dancing across the stage in their Christmas Spectacular. You should see it at least once in your life!

Summer Spectacular . Excellent show with great dancing and music...our seat was where the Rockettes came in at the start and also when the dancers were out in the audience...one of the best shows I have seen...great for teenagers...if anyone is New York right now you must make this a definite visit....10/10 from me

A beautiful example of the architecture of the time.. The lobby is cavernous and beautiful. When you step through the door you feel like you go back in time. Everything is very clean & in excellent condition. I will definitely return for another show!

Christmas Magic!. We took the kids to NYC for a Christmas adventure! This is a must for every American family! The highlight of the trip is going to Radio City Music Halls's Christmas Spectacular! It is an amazing show that both kids and adults love!

Amazing!. This beautiful theater with it's huge stage and fantastic Christmas shows is not to be missed.In addition you have Rockefeller Plaza, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Top of the Park, just steps away.
An all time classic. There is always something fun to see in this place. Plus it happens to be the home of MTVs award ceremonies. So many memories from the late 90s

Quintessential NY experience. We just saw the New York Spectacular and loved it. It was a perfect combination of Music, dance, pop culture and tourism.It's just as entertaining for a local as it would be for a visiting tourist.If you are from out of town, it may enhance your experience help to visit some of the spots touched upon during the show:The Met, Wall St, Times square, Central Park, etc.There are also some fun, interactive special effects -sit in Orchestra!

NICE!. We bought discounted tour/meet a Rockette tickets when we purchased our tickets for the New York Spectacular show. Not sure it would have been worth full price but for $14 each, we're glad that we went!
Elton John and Katy Perry concert. The line up went around the block and when you got in it was awesome. Sound was just right. Also, disability accessible.

Best Rockettes Show Ever!. Radio City Music Hall advertises the Rockettes New York Spectacular as a “Must-See Show”. I totally agree! I’ve seen several Rockettes shows over years, but by far this was the best. Everyone in my group agreed. If it’s possible, don’t miss it! The singing, dancing, tour of NYC makes this a show you won’t forget!

Still a NYC Gem. The Rockettes summer show is - Specular. The music, the dancing and the effects. The building itself is a beautiful thing to see. The staff are wonderful. Everyone I interacted with were so helpful and friendly.
Great show....... The Rockettes were fabulous. It's not just the girls dancing, but a wonderful story about so many of the highlights of NYC.

My daughter and I attended the Summer Spectacular! It was!. The Summer Spectacular is a great event with a great summer story line. The cast was amazing. See it early and be reminded of many manhattan sights. Its great for all ages.
Rockettes. The Rockettes summer performance was amazing! I'd love to see the Christmas show sometime as well!!!
Iconic. I don't are how long you've lived in New York, if you're a true New Yorker you've been to Radio City at least a few times!

Rockettes Summer Spectacular. My husband and I took my sister-in-law for her first-time visit to NYC and she wanted to go see Radio City Music Hall. My husband and I had seen the Rockettes Christmas show and suggested we see the Summer Spectacular. She was so excited. We were able to get tickets the day of the show and we went at 7:30 on Monday night. It was wonderful and we enjoyed seeing the architecture and being in the history setting. Everyone loves Radio City and its grandeur. We will return!
didnt really find much going on here. didn't really find much going on here, maybe i just visited at a bad time or missed the point and history of it. I was just expecting more really

Very cool. We had a tour here and it was really cool to see an old fashioned theater compared to what we have now. We did meet one of the rockettes and she wasnt very pleasant but was informative about the rockette lifestyle!

Highlight of the trip. If the Rockettes are performing, it is a must see! They will disappoint! The special effects, costume changes, singing, and dancing made for a memorable evening. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. For those in need of a phone charger, they do have charging stations, although they are not all in working order.

Rockettes rock !!!. Saw the Rockettes Spectacular and the show was FANTASTIC, will see it again if we can get back to the city before it ends. If you can't decide on a Broadway show, go see this show, you will not be disappointed, scenery out of this world, costumes so incredible and the dancers....beautiful !! The whole show was wonderful.

A must see!. VERY USEFUL TIP....... If you plan on seeing the Rockette's perform; do the Tour first. Prior to the tour, you are given a lanyard with an entry card; if you present this at the ticket booth you will receive 30% off of the Rockette's concert tickets. Many folks on the tour has just finished seeing the concert and were informed that they "could have" received a large discount! The guide was just ok. She has been doing tours for 23 years and seemed a bit bored! It was a great tour though.

timeless and gorgeous. growing up in NJ, I've been to radio city so many times. the live shows of Americas got talent are great to see. of course the Christmas show is great to see and is very kid friendly.

" ELECTRIFYINGLY AWESOME". Just took our daughter here for her 7th birthday! We cannot say enough about this new summer performance! It was beyond our expectations and the rockets blew it out the frame! Radio city music hall is a awesome experience on its own, add in this performance and you have a beyond incredible experience that you will never forget. We and the audience were at the edge of our seats. My daughter was so Thankful for this that she kept saying the whole way home. I guarantee to anyone that this is money well spent!!!!!!

Good show if you don't want Broadway!. We want to see the Radio City show with the Rockettes which was about 2 children lost in NYC. The story was good and took the audience around a variety of New York landmarks. I have to say however, the stage lighting was fantastic. It really drew the audience into the stage and you felt as if you were going on the journey with the actors.My only criticism is the inconsiderate audience members who insist on ignoring the request at the start of the show not to take photos with flash or film portions of the show. There were several audience members who did this and the light from their phone cameras was very distracting . One family in front of us constantly took photo's to the point that we felt we had to challenge them - we were then faced with a barrage of abuse! When we spoke to a member of Radio City staff about it, they only shrugged their shoulders. Perhaps it's something that Radio City staff need to consider and either allow audience to take photos / video of the show or police it better. A good show which could have been great.
Amazing!. I have seen several shows at this New York Classic, and it never lets me down... The Stage and Seating design are the best. The tour is also a great thing to do,,,

New York City Spectacular is SPECTACULAR !. Myself and our friends teenagers and parents saw the Summer Rockettes show. This theatre is BEAUTFUL reminding me of the glamorous 1920s! The show starring the Rockettes takes a tourist family to main NYC attractions like Wall Street, NYC library (loved the animated lion statues!), Central Park (Alice & Wonderland statue), 7th (Fashion) Avenue (the gowns are gorgeous Mr. Sosa!), he Met and more! The visual backdrops are genius - reminding me of moving TV screens. And of course, the incredible choreography of Ms Mia Michaels, starring the beautiful and gorgeous Rockettes plus ensemble. There are many dancers, dance styles and beautiful story and of course costumes to match. Enjoy this show before it's gone! loved it !

Good Place to See and Bacgeound for NYC Pics. We didn't go in but we did get plenty of good pictures of this iconic landmark! Unfortunately the venue was closed when we were able to get there. That didn't matter because we still marveled at seeing the place in person. If you want to tour the place, I say really plan ahead so you don't miss out. We missed out just because of so much to do and see in such a short time.

This should be the first show you see.. We saw a bunch of shows and only did this near the end of our time in New York. Realised though that this is so iconic, both the Rockettes and the Radio City Music Hall that it is a must. The current "day in New York" show is really brilliant and highlights all the must sees. Love a good bit of tap dancing and the rap in this is different and great (no spoiler).The hall itself is huge and magnificent and just adds to the experience. Tickets were readonable and cheaper than the big name shows but U can see them in plenty of other cities but there's not too many shows like the Rockettes around.

Radio City Tour. We were in NYC with my daughter and 75 of her friends and went to Radio City Music Hall on a tour of the back stage. What a good experience for the girls. I should mention that this is a group of dancers. We were able to meet and talk to a Rockette and my daughter was able to get her photo taken and an autograph. She was all smiles. The tour guides are great at what they do. Well worth the visit.

ROCKETTE SHOW IN JUNE. went to see the Rockette show in June with husband son and his girlfriend was very impressed with the show the scenery was excellent couldn't fault it everyone in the audience had a great seat would go again if I am ever back in NY would strongly recommend
Historic entertainment venue. Located in the Rockefeller centre ,inside it has an austere art deco theme and a mighty Wurlitzer.Great place to visit.

Great tour which cover the history of this magnificent theatre. Where do you start? Even if you are not interested in theatre, this tour is worth it for the history and background of this building.Not only do you get to hear about how the place was built but you see and experience history.Small things like the original mens and ladies rest rooms, with original furniture and pedal operated hand dryers to the naked sculpture in front of them and how it caused a stir, to the private dining room up to how the rehearsal floors are laid out, to actually meeting a Rockette (unfortunately she was not free for dinner the day we met) this was a really interesting tour.Plenty of walking but if you are not good at walking you will be ushered around in lifts. I doubt that a wheel chair would be suitable however.Our guide was obviously passionate about the theatre - he had worked there for a long time and he knew the history and lay out.I really enjoyed this tour and would not hesitate to recommend it to all, but probably to people with a bent for architecture.

Back Stage Tour at Radio City Music Hall. My niece and I did the Back Stage Tour on rainy afternoon. We're both theater buffs and we thoroughly enjoyed it. We didn't get to go on stage because they were rehearsing for the new Summer Show that was opening in July but we did get to sit and watch rehearsal for about 10 minutes and got to see the Rockettes in action. Looks like it was be a great show. You have to either buy your tickets or exchange your show voucher in the gift shop next to RCMH. If you decide you want to buy a souvenir, wait until after the tour because the badge they give you at the beginning of the tour entitles you to a discount (20% I think) to merchandise in the gift shop AND the purchase of show tickets but I'm not sure how much discount on tickets.
See the Rockettes . Wonderful entertainment. We just saw the summer one and also the Christmas back in January both wonderful Looking forward to seeing another someday

Enjoyable Show at an Iconic Theatre. My daughter and I went to see the Rockettes at Radio City Music Hall. The show was a wonderful experience and we loved seeing the Rockettes dance. It was a thrill to actually be inside of Radio City Music Hall. It is a beautiful venue and just a short walk from our hotel in Times Square.
Rockettes!. Radio City Music Hall is really fun to visit in the winter time when the Rockets are doing this winter thing on stage!

Interesting. The building is so historical and beautiful and has been completely restored to what it was like when new--even down to the same carpet that was laid when opened. The guide was great and we got to meet a Rockettte and had our picture made. The pictures were pricey and the Rockette was like a robot--not friendly and had a very rehearsed speech.
Rockettes in Summer. Got last minute tickets to see the summer show. It was very good. Not as much dancing as I would have liked but the show was still entertaining and a quality performance.

Love this place and the Rockettes!. We went to NYC specifically to see the Summer Spectacular by the Radio City Music Hall Rockettes and, as always, were not disappointed. This was by far the best show I have ever seen anywhere! The history behind this magnificent theater and the massive stage upon which the performance takes place is just part of the breathtaking ambience of visiting here. The sets are now digital, smooth and technologically ahead of anything anywhere. The Rockettes professionalism and talent never disappoints. Like anywhere you go these days you are frisked and searched at the door to get in, but that's the way we live these days and it is to be expected. If you have a chance to see anything in this historic hall, be sure to add it to your list of things to see and do in NYC!

New York Spectacular. The building itself inside is just simply stunning. The show itself was in my opinion, just ok. This is the 2nd year they've done this show and for a very limited time. It was an hour and a half, and it told a cute story, however, some of the show was quite boring and some parts creepy (when the animal statues talk...no thank you). The rockettes were spectacular as always, and the costumes were fabulous. You can get cheap tix. Great for a fun day in the city.
visit for a show. One of the most famous places in new york city. A great place to see the shows that are presented there.
A piece of New York!. Had to convince my husband to go, but the beauty of this building as well as its history sold him. We stayed to watch the Rockettes. It does not disappoint.

Great Building Home to the Rockettes. I visited Radio City Hall on July 3. This was my first time seeing the Rockettes, and it won't be the last one, for sure. This particular show is awesome to say the least. The music, performances, and the theme make the Rockette what they are. This is a must see if you go to New York. You will be very glad you did. Radio City is a very comfortable facility. You have to go see the Rockettes!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
NYC Spring Spectacular. Was very impressed with the show. Very techno and the Rockettes are fantastic. Also took the backstage tour which is highly recommended.

Imagination Needed......magnificent!. With a little imagination, you can imagine this building filled with the aristocracy of the USA and other fashionable people milling about!) What a beautiful place, filled with beautiful people! Not tourists in sneakers!The rest rooms are very neat to see and on our tour we saw the Men's and Women's. We especially liked seeing the costume room and some of the costumes worn by past Rockettes. We met a Rockette! Seeing the theatre, how we wished we were there for a performance. There's a model of the stage that's very interesting and still in working order! This was my husband's favourite attraction while visiting New York City. Seeing this building restored to its 1932 glory is most impressive. I think a tour would be of special interest to history buffs. The decor is beautiful.

Take the tour. It was our lucky day! A woman was "giving" away extra tickets she had to tour the Radio City Music Hall. Amanda was our guide and a delight. You might think you know everything about the center, yet trust me, you don't! So much history and so much to learn. We even were able to meet and speak a lovely Rockette from Long Island, NY!
The Rockettes are super. Went to see the NY Experience at Radio City Music hall - the rockets and show were great.As always Radio City puts on a great FAMILY show

Toured the Hall and went to The Rockettes show. We took a tour of Radio City Music Hall with her New York Pass. This place is full of music history and is absolutely amazing and beautiful. I'm a guy in my 40's and didn't think I would enjoy the "show" experience. We got tickets and attended The Rockets New York Spectacular. It was terrific.

The Rockettes Spectacular was the absolute highlight of my trip!. My husband and I recently spent 5 weeks in New York City. This was a bucket list trip and, to be honest, I was a little underwhelmed. That is until I saw the Rockettes at Radio City Music Hall. I called it my "New York moment". I've seen a lot of live shows in my time but this one takes the cake. Absolutely fabulous and a must do if they're playing while you're in New York.

Everyone needs to see the Christmas Show!. Great art deco atmosphere. The most incredible thing about this theater is that no matter where you sit you have a perfect view, so no need to splurge on the high priced tickets.

Lifetime wish fulfilled!!! . I have wanted to go here ever since I rented Annie from the film shop when I was about 6. When I came here in 2012, I marvelled at the place from the outside. I couldn't pluck up the courage to go inside. This time I did. Oh my goodness! What an experience. It was so emotional for me. Seeing the theatre and learning it's history. Being able to see the rockettes costumes and meet a real life rockette! Would definitely recommend. You definitely feel like you're walking through the halls of history.

Supervisor Insensitive and careless!. Building dirty, smelly and old. We were late because we had our cellular phone an hour behind and they didn't care and disregards that we were visiting from out of the state. We paid $250.00 for our tickets to see the Rockettes and only watched 20 minutes of show. Management team on the evening on 06/30/16 were insensitive and inattentive. Shame on them.

Great Visit to Radio City Music Hall. Instead of just touring the Hall, we purchased tickets to see the Rockettes which was a great way to fully experience the Music Hall. We found the Music Hall wonderful with a grand feeling of the architecture of the last century. I'm not sure what more you could see with only a tour.

Routine tour of an epic venue. I'm glad I did it. I have seen it on TV, and am fascinated by the operational side of theatre, but frankly the tour was a let-down. We did get to see a number of the non-public areas, but technically we did not get to see backstage. We did not see the famous hydraulic stage lifts - just a (non-working) model in the foyer. The meeting with a Rockett [their chorus line] was pleasant but very brief, and while the picture taken with her was good it was expensive, and not purchased.The guide obviously knew her script well and did her best, but this was a disappointment. I'd chosen a day when there was no show playing in hope that we would get to see more, as indicated in their publicity - my guess is that as there was a show resident we saw as little as on a show day. Such a contrast to my visit to TotR across the road earlier.

wish list tick. what at show!!!a real spectacle of music and dance with costumes, effects and sets that leaves even an experienced traveller oohing and aahhing. groupon new York often has discounts available if u have a local who can purchase for you.
We had to see the Rockettes!. If your in NY in the winter, this show is a must see. Such a great Christmas show and musical. I would see it again!
See the Rockettes!. This beautiful classic 6,000 seat hall was built in the Depression as part of the Rockefeller Center project. Spacious central areas and very nice staff.

Great show. Our first trip to The Big Apple and not knowing which Brodaway show to see ( having seen many of the shows elsewhere) we just decided to live the true New York expeience and see the Rockettes at Radio City Music Hall . We were not dissapointed . Great show at an incredibly low price .

a bit old and worn out. i was here during the Christmas week and boy it was so packed. I went here to see the rockettes and the line was long. I didn't expect the surrounding area to be so crowded (wasn't that comfy). Anyway the landmark itself, the 'radio city' neon sign outside is interesting but as i go in i think the building is quite old and has this worn out feeling , in my opinion. I don't expect this from new york, i guess i just overreacted. But if you're in NYC i guess taking a picture around the area is a great idea since this is close to rockefeller and also fifth avenue, so it's a great deal to walk around and see the famous landmark.

A mesmerizing and awesome 90 minutes - worth every penny. This show is absolutely beautiful. From the superb sets, the fantastic music, excellent cast and of course - The Rockettes! I was absolutely blown away by these 36 woman and their spectacular addition to this show. Absolutely loved every single minute.

beautiful theater. We watched the Rocckets there...it was wonderful. The theater it beautiful. even the line for entrance was so big they were fast and we didn't wait longer outside. very good acoustic. and very friendly staff.
wow. what a show we loved it exactly like you see it telivised i would recommend this to visitors all kind of foriegn people were in so it fits all people

You Must See the Summer Spectacular!. Absolutely a fabulous way to see the Rockettes and a brilliantly produced show! The Cast and the Rockettes are fantastic and the costumes,sets and special effects are amazing! Everything about it is fun!
Breathtaking!. Art-deco at its finest. One of the most dazzling interiors ever. And, of course...the Rockettes! A New York icon.

"Rockettes ". Last minute purchase to an already planned trip to NY. I Loved the Rockettes . Wasn't excited at first but when I learned it was choreographed by Mia Micheals I was ready. Only thing I didn't like was the greeting at the door by one of the employees attitude was nasty but she was corrected by me an my friend. We where stuck in traffic over 50 mins So we arrived 20min late. She began to speak with a nasty tone stating " you are late the show have already started you need to show your ticket if you have them" . I do believe we knew we were late we purchased the tickets she didn't. Outside of the experience I will return to Radio Music to see another show.
Great tour. Meet the rockettes, see the beautiful music hall be in R ockies apartment, costumes, history tours of about 30 people with a knowledgeable tour guide. A great 90 mins

Trip with daughter to NYC. We bought tickets last minute to the NY Spectacular, Summer show with the Rockette's. The seats were amazing and the show was AWESOME! My daughter is an aspiring dancer, so that makes me a "dance mom". We know all the hard work and dedication it takes to become and great dancer. We really appreciated the show knowing the countless hours the dancers have to put in to get where they are today! The show was the best I've seen yet! Very Moving and great representation of the sites of NYC!

Summer Show. As a lifelong NYer, I hadn't been here in 40 years. Theater was magnificently redone and the story about a family being redone was well written, flowed well with great scenery music. Slightly pricy but this NYer left entertained, with a renewed sense of pride and a firm belief in the iconic stature of the Rockettes.

Rockettes Rock!. We did not go for a Broadway show on this trip, but decided to take the kids to the Radio City Music hall instead. We did not know anything about the show in advance, and was really very pleasantly surprised. The show was really good and spectacular! It was a hit with both adults and kids in our family. Will go again on our next trip to NYC!
Mythic!. This a world renowned theatre and well worth the visit for it's history, to sit in the balcony and absorb this awesome view! Be sure to clap your hands an appreciate the acoustics.
Great tour. This is a very beautiful building and the tour provides a lot of very interesting history. It is like stepping back in time.

amazing. this is a must. I have too list travel date as 2015. It was actually about 5 years ago. The Rockettes are the most amazing Dance Team around. If you're a dancer or appreciate the art of dancing this is it

This is an amazing Art Deco theatre with an unusual stage. This theatre is a must for lovers of music and exceptional dance by the Rockettes. On previous visits we had tried to see a show but there was nothing of interest to us on, but this time we saw the Rocketts in New York Experience. Great staging and lighting and the Rockettes were the best dancers we have seen.

Best Set Design EVER. Attended the Rockettes for the first time 40 years of visiting NY and was amazed. Thought it was merely a row of beautiful women dancing but it's a real stage show with the best sets I've ever seen. The dancing individually and collectively was over the top. Don't miss this for a fine show and to my surprise, take the kids.
Summer Spectular. Cute story about s family adventure around New York City. Interactive with the audience, especially children and seniors.

Rockettes Rocked It!. Wonderful venue...it's a beauty! I saw the Rockettes there and it was a great show!!! The staff was very hospitable to getting everyone to their seats and they serve amazing cocktails too!

Excellent tour and show. We went on the tour with our family. Everyone enjoyed the experience. Interesting facts about the decor, bathrooms, wallpaper, curtains, stage, costumes, and Roxy's apartment. We got $10 off tour tickets on line. Then we used our passes from the tour to purchase tickets for The Rockettes Summer Spectacular. The show was AWESOME!. Youngsters who performed in the show were VERY TALENTED. A must see.

Enjoyable tour.... We visited with my daughter's dance team and enjoyed a 45 minute tour. We really enjoyed learning about Radio City Music Hall, the history, the Rockettes, and getting to meet a Rockette! Definitely a highlight for my daughter. I loved the décor of the hall, I believe it's art deco. I highly recommend taking the tour.
So grand. This tour was totally worth the money and such a surprise. The lobby and theatre are absolutely gorgeous. Go have a look!
Christmas in NY. Definitely a trip every family should make to this spectacular event. The kids will absolutely love it. A must see.

Lovely interior.. I took the tour of Radio City Music Hall, and I've seen a few shows here. The tour is definitely worth it because you do get to see the behind-the-scenes stuff on putting on a show, meet a Rockette, and it may be the only time you could say that you have been on stage at Radio City Music Hall.

The show is fine, but be prepared. The security at the door can be border-line harrassment.. Was it ageism, racism, or are the security guards at the entrance to Radio City Music Hall just very poorly trained? I wasn't sure. I wasn't carrying a bag, but was "ordered" by the security guard at the entrance on 50th St. recently to empty all my pockets and hold everything in my hands. Seriously? I'm 66 years old. Hold my wallet, keys, coins, tissues, throat drops, and stuff -- hold them all in my two hands and walk through the door? Yes, the security guard was very serious and not the least bit welcoming. It affected my enjoyment of the whole experience. The show claims to be "spectacular," but there are many shows in town that are just as impressive (and most have a better storyline). Honestly, at my age, I've been to many, many shows all over the world; but I've never been to a music hall anywhere that treated its ticketholders this badly as they entered the door. Unfortunately, this kind of behavior tends to reflect badly even on New York City, which is the theme of the entire show.

A Spectacular Worthy of New York!. Without a doubt, Radio City Music Hall is a New York City gem.However, it's also an art deco monument and a reminder of spectacle all but lost in these times. The Christmas show is a treasure. And now, add to that, this summer's summer Spectacular, an amazing presentation of artistry. It is perfection exponential! Everything--the lighting, costumes, set design, music and creative design behind this valentine to New York City soothes the ragged soul. The precision and choreography that the Rockettes highlight is enough to make one run to the gym or a dance studio. You'll want to kick your heels high, too. The summer show includes worthy set homages to Grand Central Station, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, Central Park, Fashion Avenue, The New York Public Library, Wall Street and more. The way the show unfolds is pure entertainment perfection. It's not to be missed and this from the mouth of not a tourist, but a native New Yorker!Go and enjoy. You won't be disappointed.

Take the tour!. I took the tour of Radio City twice. Tons of great information and history. A behind the scenes look at a true piece of history...so many interesting facts about this location and you also get to see meet a Rockette!

Rockettes . This was a "I am doing this because my wife wants to" outing but I am glad I went. The show was exciting and tugged at my heart as well as entertained. Lots of humor, great dancing, and great electronic props. Highly recommend this 8 week show!! It's ok guys, GO!!
Radio City. The Rockettes were amazing. It was a very good show and tickets were priced very reasonably. Show was great for the family.

Great if you want to hear about the Rockettes. Our tour guide was good-- she knew a lot about the music hall and was entertaining and funny and was a native New Yorker. We enjoyed getting to see part of a show from way up top in the balcony and seeing pictures of lots of people who have played there. The 2nd half of the tour seemed to be just about the rockettes--thier costumes, how many of them there are, etc. We got to meet one who wasn't performing and have pics taken with her to purchase later. Overall it was good but is not long enough to do again.

Fantastic Summer Rockettes showcase. Get your tickets now. You will love the show. The Rockettes were fabulous.The sets/songs/story are worked together to make you feel a part of New York city. I LOVED the choreography.I especially liked the "Singing in the Rain" segment and the final part with Frank Sinatra singing New York,New York.The Rockettess are such an icon. I couldn't stop smiling ,especially at the end.

Iconic Experience, well worth it.. We saw the Rockettes show. Realize that the Hall is humongous when selecting seats. As the Hall is larger than most, I think sitting beyond the usual Orchestra range would benefit from 10-power binoculars. It looked to me like the first balcony was therefore further away than in the usual symphony hall, so consult the seating chart. Consider arriving 30-45 minutes early and shopping before the show, as the kiosk lines were lengthy after the show, with tourists hemming and hawing about their purchases, and lengthy payment procedures.
Holidaymaker. A whole new experience seeing the Rocketts A great show only on for a few weeks .Enjoy as well the decor excellent.

Walk the same halls the countless legends have walked. The tour was interesting. The tour guide was very knowledgeable and had a great personality. Most of all to see the stage and walk the halls that so many legends have walked is a pretty cool feeling. There is so much history is this very building. I recommend checking this out while in town.

Spectacular!. I recently saw The Spring Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall. What a delight! It is totally uplifting. Wonderful singing, dancing, costumes and scenery. Very light and colorful. I definitely recommend seeing it.
Beautiful theater. Beautiful theater, went there with my daughter to see the Rockettes summer spectacular. They did not disappoint. Restaurant was amazing. The theater itself is remarkable

Thrilling family friendly show!. It's thrilling just to be at the iconic Radio City Music Hall. Then add live music, special effects, precision dancing by the Rockettes, extremely talented ensemble dancers - including men all choreographed by Mia Michaels, and costumes designed by Emilio Sosa from "Project Runway," the word "thrilling" takes on a whole new meaning. I was hooked as soon as the music started. I loved the show so much I'm going back in early August with a friend from San Francisco.

Great way to spend an evening. We went to see the Rockettes and thew show was as awesome as always. The staging and production was superb. Cute theme with phenomenal staging...truly enjoyable 90 minutes!! Best seats for us were the second level, first row, center
Must Visit. I was in this iconic venue last week for the NBC Upfront. Before that I came as a child for the Christmas Spectacular. This beautiful venue always brings good thoughts!
Rockets. Saw the Rockets do one of their Christmas Spectaculars - and it was very spectacular. A real treat for all ages. I feel it is must a Christmas Time.

The Rockettes Rock!. The Summer Spectacular was the main reason we went to NYC. I love the Rockettes and brought along 3 other ladies to share in the fun. They hadn't seen them in person and they were blown away, as was I. Everything about the show was over the top -- the costumes, music, dancing, and the stage sets were amazing with crazy good special effects. Love the kick line! We had toured the city for 2 days prior to the show, so all the locations depicted in the show, we had been to, which made it very exciting! A must see. Loved, loved, loved the show.
Amazing!. We came here to see the Rockettes perform; blew our minds! The building was fabulous, excellent service and quality! Loved it!

Best Theater in The City. Radio City Music Hall is an Art Deco Gem that can't be missed. I saw Frank SInatra perform live here 2 times, and there were two of the most memorable live performances I have ever seen. Radio City Music Hall is a NY Institution that's not to missed if you ever get the chance to go there, DO It" !!!!

Loved the costumes, dancing and lights! . We got tickets on Groupon for $45 and ended up in orchestra seats, so we were off to a good start. The theatre was an easy sub ride and with preprinted tickets we had no waiting. So everything was good. We liked the show a lot. It lasted about an hour and half, with no intermission....began at 7:30 and over by 9/00. I felt the lights, the dancing, the costumes and the staging were fascinating and extremely professional. The story showed all the famous tourist spots amid great scenery and fast moving action. The storyline was not much- but we went for the dancing and costumes. Well worth our time and money!
Wonderful Matinee, Wonderful Childhood Memories. Iconic Radio City Music Hall. NY Spectacular is a great show, fun and lively. I noticed it is now on Groupon too!!

Rockettes Summer Show ROCKS!. Really...I thought the show was going to be a bunch of beautiful dancers doing endlessly entertaining kicklines. Nothing wrong with that...right?! SO much more! Amazing production values, great story, nice trip around the city AND great dancing!

Fantastic!. What a great choice to visit while in NYC. High recommend taking the Stage Door Tour. Naomi, our tour guide was extremely knowledgeable and shared the history of Radio City. The tour also includes meeting and talking to a Rockette! What fun! If you are in NYC between now and August 7th, attend the New York Spectacular Show featuring the Rockettes. It is worth every penny. I can't wait to visit at Christmas time to see the Christmas Spectacular!

Summer Rockettes - aka The New York Spectacular. This show is phenomenal. Absolutely brilliantly choreographer by Mia Michaels and the dancers are amazing. The dance moves and costumes blew us away with their complexity and creativity. The music and orchestra are great. The special effects are mind boggling. The family story was entertaining, but the Rockettes were my hands down favorite stars. We saw the holiday Rockettes last December and this show was different and beyond spectacular! In my opinion, Orchestra Row LL is a little too close for this show. I would recommend a little farther back..maybe OO or PP.

Top Notch. You will enjoy even the silliest Musical here: the stage management (lights, scenography, sound) is superb, and the performers are top-notch. Yet, if you look for the charm of Woody Allen's "Radio Days," you may have to look elsewhere.

Rockettes!. I've been to Radio City Music Hall 3 times. The Rockettes Holiday Spectacular is, well, Spectacular! If you haven't seen one of their shows I think it's worth it. I also took the tour and that's a great way to see Radio City Music Hall if you aren't going to a show. The third time was this year in May for my son's college graduation, and that was wonderful!

Bygone era. After visiting most of the other Rockefeller buildings we called booked in out of the rain. If you like Art novo then you cant fail to enjoy this. It was nearly lost from history before substantial renovations. An informative look around the back and underneath the stage. You can imagine a bygone era and the first hand driers in an almost decadent ladies powder room. Enchanting.
Beautiful Inside and Out. The outside and the interior are historical landmarks. But best way to do that is to go to a show and see the Rockettes you will not be disappointed.
love the shows!. year round events, love the shows. Good price in tickets, visit there several times and watch different shows.

Rockettes Rock in the Grand RCMH!. Had a great opportunity to see the Summer Spectacular featuring the famous Rockettes. The performance was great with the colorful technology and live singing and dancing. We had seen them perform in the 70's so it was a special to us to attend this.

Great dancers. First time every seeing a live Broadway show and it was great those rockettes. Sure move in sync. And the radio city music hall was nice, you need to be able to walk up some steps and all seat offer you a great view of the stage.
Great Entertainment. The Christmas show is stupendous. I never get tired of seeing the Rockettes. I have been going since I was a toddler to see different shows. One is better than the next

Beautiful Venue to See a Show. I've been to Radio City Music Hall to see a number of shows from rock concerts to the Rockettes. It's a HUGE space. Every performance I've seen here has taken full advantage of the incredible space and the amazing stage. The acoustics are amazing. I've been seated as far up as the second mezzanine and as close as incredible orchestra level seats. And I was happy every time. The bathrooms on the lowest level is a throw-back to a time long ago -- very cool. The murals on the walls are gorgeous. The chandeliers amazing. Every detail is spectacular. And I found the seats to be comfortable.
Christmas must event. Best time seeing the rockettes, would do it every year if I could. People of all ages attend and show never fails to get you in the mood for the Holidays

Rockettes summer spectacular was spectacular. Our family was mesmerized by the Rockettes summer show at Radio City. The staging, special effects, music and dancing was awesome. Thoroughly enjoyable and great experience.

Impressive and Educational Tour. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed a tour of this marvelous facility. Our docent was pleasant and interested in making a connection with the people in our group. The tour lasted 75 minutes, and it covered all areas of Radio City Music Hall. It was quite evident that our docent was highly trained and very experienced because every question asked received a detailed, informed, and ready answer.

Not that interesting (the tour). I went on a tour and not to see a show. The tour is not very interesting. You will see some pictures, 5 minutes of a rehearsal and the bathrooms. You are also compelled to take a photo with a dancer, which they will try to sell you at the end of the tour.

Located a block away from Rockefeller Center. We were not able to see the Rockettes, they are rehearsing for a new production. Too bad for us, they are noted for their precision. You cannot walk in to see the lobby; you have to book a tour in advance. Appreciated they congratulated the 2016 graduates on the marquee. My niece was one of the graduates this year.

NYC Icon. If you've visiting NYC check it out. The art deco interior is worth the look - understated elegance at it's best. I've been here to see movies, concerts, and of the Rockettes!! If you have the time, check it out and heard east to Rockefeller Center.

DO THE TOUR!!!. Do the tour and you may get lucky and be able to stand on the same stage as legends like Frank Sinatra and Tony Bennett have! The tour guides are great and you get to meet a real Rockette! Amazing!
Very cool -. The building is pretty special. The Rockettes were amazing. It is worth the price of a ticket to see the building.
History. this Radio City Music Hall build in 1932 very impressive the decor it is fantastic memories running in front of your eyes,if you have to be in New York don't miis it

Disappointed!!. The Rockettes show was very disappointing! I expected to see the Rockettes perform and in turn I got to see a lame story about kids being lost in NYC! There was too much of the "story" and not enough performances by the Rockettes. I had no idea this was going to be a poor attempt at a Broadway show and not a dance performance. Our entire group of 5 was very let down by this show! Don't waste your money on this show!
Saw the new show New York Spectacular. This show is not as "spectacular" as the holiday show but was still entertaining and my kids really enjoyed it.

This 6,000 seat hall is awonderful sight... We went to see the Summer Spectactular Show.
It was wonderful.
There was a large queue to get in, so people would be advised to arrive at least 20 minutes before the show starts.

Phenominal. The stage was fantastic. Everyone helps you get to your seats. The theater is HUGE. The décor is so impressive. They can do anything with that stage. The ROCKETTES were awesome, so was their stage & tech crew, their orchestra, etc.. I would see it again in a New York Minute!

Built for Palatial Entertainment. When it first opened in 1932, Radio City Music Hall was the largest entertainment venue in the world and dazzled its public with its opulent interior. The ceiling gives impression of a giant sunset. This great Art Deco theater first offered stage entertainment combined with movies and generations of New Yorkers have grown on those. Nowadays, it's mostly stage shows. Frank Sinatra, Lisa Minnelli, Michael Jackson have all performed here. The Rockettes, its team of 36 long-legged beauties is its easily recognizable symbol throughout the U.S. The Christmas Show nowadays features portions in 3D. Movie goers will recognize it in “An American in Paris”, “Singin' in the rain”, “The Godfather”, “Radio Days” and “Annie”, to mention but a few. They do offer hourly tours at a cost of about $25. The tour is interesting and it will take you behind the stage, fun!
Be apart of History!. Bring the family and become apart of History! This is a once in a lifetime experience that should be shared with the family! Great fun for all!

Beautiful venue & Great show. This place is just lovely. We bought our tickets for The Rockettes show prior to arriving in NYC. We were also able to purchase a snack box to enjoy while watching the show (which I thought was neat). The venue is beautiful. The workers are so pleasant. And the show... oh my, the show was amazing. Love the storyline and the actors were great. Definitely a must see!
Rockettes Summer Spectacular!. A Terrific Show! Don't Miss It ! Even enjoyed by my teenage daughter! It's everything that's loved about New York City!
Love Radio City music hall. It was walking distance from our hotel and we crossed the building a few times. We also took the one hour tour which was great.

If you like Entertainment..... The Radio City Musical Hall tour was interesting and took you into the backstage of the Music Hall. An opportunity to meet one of the Rockettes and see the stage for their upcoming show was great. We had an opportunity to see part of the technical rehearsal testing the stage. Thank you to Christian for his interesting tour and knowledge about the Music Hall. A great step into the past and info on the present.

OMG . This show was in one word spectacular!!From the first moment you step into the building you know you are in for something special.The summer show was the perfect ending to our trip to new York as the plot visits all of the places that we have visited this week. The effects and scenery were fabulous and so realistic making full use if the larfest stage in the world with moving stage levels. My favourite, singing in the rain was an essential classic.The rockettes were flawless and transported me back to the heyday of musical entertainment.A must see show that you can only get in NYC.

Rockettes New York Spectacular. I have seen the Christmas Spectacular with my daughter and granddaughter. They loved it; I was mildly entertained. This is a totally different experience, and I loved it.The set design was amazing! With new and truly awesome technology, they were able to morph one set into the next. The sets extended beyond the stage to the side walls and the ceiling. You had to be there.The story was simplistic and a bit lame, but it was a perfect vehicle to take the audience on a tour of many of the spots for which New York is known. The dancing onstage and in the aisles and the upper side balconies was as good as it gets. This is a wonderful activity for the entire family of any age.I'm still smiling!
Rockettes Rock. We went to the summer spectacular performance of the iconic dance troop. This performance had it all, a good story along with the world rebound dancing of the Rockettes.

Such a beautiful music hall. I always feel like Annie when stepping foot into RCMH. As a young girl, my grandmother would take me to see the Rockettes. We were there for the Spectacular Rockettes show opening. Fantastic show. I was amazed at how efficient they were in the bathrooms. The line was super long but the stalls are numbered and they have a staff directing you to the numbered stall. Very efficient.
Went to see the Rockettes' Spring Spectcular. I love going to Radio City, it's such a staple and a great venue for large productions. I loved the show, I like the facilities and services.

Great tour of historical NY building. We visited in October 2015. Had a great 1 hour tour of everything you would want to see plus much in depth history of the place. We have all seen the outside and maybe taken a picture. Trust me when I say this is well worth the tour as well. We toured using our NY passes which made it even better value. Great if it's raining. Very near to the 'Mona' Art Museum as well. All in all, if your in town for 3 or 4 days add this to your list of great things to check out.
Loved watching Rockettes NY Spectacular. Came with low expectations and left quite impressed with the gigantic theater. Excellent backdrops and technology.

Absolutely fabulous. Joyce was our tour guide; try and go on one of her tours. This was one of the best things we did while in NYC. Radio is a beautiful example of Art Deco architecture, and interiors and is rich in history. We got to meet a Rockette and had our pic taken with her. Don't miss this experience!

Great shows, beautiful venue. This venue is huge! Been here multiple times for the radio city Christmas spectacular which is always worth it. this time saw there new spring musical and that was much better than I anticipated. both shows are awesome and the theater is beautiful

Not very spectacular. We went four times to the Spring Spectacular. This new show was a huge disapointment. They kept the opening number "Welcome to NY" after that it was all down hill. Two bratty kids stuck in NY. The girl was overly bratty. The plot was so disjointed and choppy. The Spring Show took years to develop. This show was put togather in 6 months and it was apparent. When I looked in the Playbill for the stars- there were none unlike last year. I have seen high school plays better than this. The loud music did not save the show. In fact, it was too loud. Why did they mess with Singing in the Rain- another disappointment. However, The Rockettes were fantastic as usual. The Rocketes deserve better than this plot. And let the Rockettes do what they do best- kick. Dont try to modernize them. They were the show. I would not waste the money on this show. Save your money for Christmas
Especially pretty at night. Even if you are not attending a show, worth seeing this Hall famous for all the shows including the Rockettes. Convenient to 5th Avenue and adjacent to NBC.

Excellent Show w/Rockettes. We ended our trip going to the Rockettes Spectacular that is running this summer. It was a perfect seeing this show at the end of our trip since it highlighted so many of the places we had visited earlier. The visuals in this show are spectacular!!!

Very impressive with a slice of history. Only visited because my wife wanted to. Did not expect much but was very impressed. Tour was excellent and the Theatre breathtaking. Was totally unaware of the popularity and rich history of the building

Amazing theatre. We did the Rock City tour & were greeted by a lovely tour guide Alvin who took us round the theatre showing us the main attractions of the building & taking us behind the scenes to meet a Rockette. Was a great tour in a fantastic building. The tour last approx. 1 hour 15 mins & really does show off the theaters beauty. Next time I visit New York I will hopefully get the chance to see a show.
Iconic Grand Hall. A beautiful place for a tour or a Christmas show but it is very big so if you want to really see the Rockettes, you might want to pay for seats in the front half.
Behind the Scenes Tour Rocks. Absolutely loved the behind the scenes tour. Informative guidelines and we got to walk around on stage. The immensity is difficult to describe.

Backstage tour. I have been in the audience to see the Christmas Spectacular a couple of years ago, This time, I took the Backstage Tour. Very interesting story, great knowledgeable guides. Met a Rockette with option for photograph.
New York Spectacular Starring the Radio City Rockettes. Great NYC show for natives and tourist; ideal event for families, solo, and couples; the theatre is well maintained

Thoroughly enjoyed this tour. We have never been to see a show in this theater and have only seen the Rockettes on television. It was an interesting tour explaining how they have kept the feel of the 1930s but have things upgraded. The meeting with one of the Rockettes was nice too. The view from the balcony indicates that there is not a bad seat in the house. They were preparing for their new show starting this month.
Grand venue to see events. Exciting to see a place you hear about and now you are there! The interior décor on all levels is a site to behold. The stage has several elevators and can produce rain!

Interesting theater, but current show is not so hot. We visited both to see the theater and to see a show. The theater is historic and a real landmark. The Summer of 2016 show we did not like. The special effects are stunning, but they did not make up for the extremely corny premise of the show, which is really just an advertisement for NYC.

here for the Xmas holidays 2015. Had a chance to go and see the Xmas show of the Rockettes. Wow. it is really a piece of history. i seem to recall them when i was much younger. it never gets old. wow. wow. wow. and then there is the decor of the Radio City Music Hall. redone and so extremely pretty. you have to go and see this place.and the rockets were not bad either. (smile).i would definitely make this a part of your New York adventure.

Stage door Tour. We booked a group tour, we were please to find that out tour group just consisted of us two.We therefore got a very personalised tour of this wonderful building.I was very surprised that not more people did this tour as it was full of history, gave a great insight into the working of Radio City and gave us the chance to see the great Art Deco features in great detail.The tour guide was excellent and gave us a great commentary throughout.Good value for money

Summer Spectaular is!!!. Just saw the Radio City Music Hall Summer Spectacular and it is spectacular. Just walking into the theater is entering a magical place. Even the ladies' room is a must see (check out the foot operated sinks). The show is 90 minutes long and the entire 90 minutes fills one with awe. The story is simple, but a way to see the major sites of NYC brought to you with amazing special effects. As someone born in Brooklyn who has visited the Music Hall many times, I found this show more enjoyable and exciting than even the Christmas show. Great for the entire family. A family with preschoolers sat in front of us and was mesmerized and sat entranced for the whole show. As seniors, my husband and I were just as entertained. The puppetry of the statues and the special effects of the scenes were amazing. And as always, the Rockettes were perfect. A wonderful experience for tourists and New Yorkers. Discount tickets can be obtained from many sources.

We Met a Rockette!!!. Splurged on the NYC Spectacular Summer Show and had the tour of Radio City before hand. Excellent history of the Music Hall and the opportunity to meet a Rockette and have a photo taken with her was one of the highlights of our trip to NYC. Worth it, so very worth it. The show was great for kids and adults alike!

Don't Miss The Radio City Music Hall Summer Show!. I love Radio City but this was my first visit to their summer show-what an extraordinary event---A great story about NYC, with terrific dancers, wonderful music, graphics galore all in one show-I actually enjoyed it more than their Christmas Show, which says something for this show-and the Rockettes were there too------------don't miss this when you come to our fair city-another blessed event here in The Big Apple..
Must see Christmas show. Definitely a must on a Christmas holiday excursion. Fantastic show, beautiful interior, and then there are those Rockettes!

Tour with family . We all enjoyed the tour. Seeing how shows were managed backstage was particularly interesting including the hydraulics. We met with one of the Rockettes in her dressing room and we were able to ask her questions. Nice experience overall.

Great Tour, Beautiful Place!!!. We were blown away by this place. We got to see the hall, plus several backstage areas. They were rehearsing from the NY Spectacular show that day, but we still got to meet one of the Rockettes. It was a memorable experience, and I would highly recommend it.
Radio City Music Hall. A trip back to the 1930s...almost 90 years ago.Art Deco movie place with 4,000 seats! Go just to see the place. Don't forget to visit the bathrooms. HUGE!

Best tour ever. Dragged reluctant husband along on this tour. The whole tour lasted about 80 mins. We were hooked from the moment we set foot inside it's such a beautiful building & our guide was so knowledgeable. Needless to say husband loved it & still talking about it!!
Iconic NYC landmarks and theatre. Have been to RCMH on many occasions to see many rock concerts from the Moody Blues to the Rockets.It's an impressive venue in the heart of Manhattan

Best theatre in the world!. Took the Radio City tour on NY Pass. Our tour guide, Tania, was awesome. She was very knowledgeable about the history and operation of this great venue. Walking through this gem is like taking a walk into the golden age of stars. Roxy Rockefeller's vision of providing a luxurious entertainment venue available to all, was a gift to this great city. Don't miss the summer spectacular. The Rockettes are better than ever!

Fabulous show for all ages. . If you're in NYC this summer and want to see a live show this is the one to see. It is spectacular in every way. It is 90 minutes of song, dance, and storyline that will intrigue all ages. The scenery and special effects are stupendous. Don't miss this show.

Rockettes summer spectacular. I would say this is a must see. Only there for 8 weeks! Tickets were reasonable at $69 in the orchestra halfway back in the middle. Special effects were phenomenal! My husband and son were not sure about going but both were thoroughly impressed even the 16 year old. Great storyline also. Backdrops were so impressive. Would see again!

Fascinating tour. We did the the tour which takes 75 minutes and was included in the NY City Pass. It was excellent. Really interesting to see all the different areas where the Toni awards had been held the previous day. We got to meet one of the Rockettes (dancers) too and she was lovely and happy to answer questions. Only slight moan was that the tours are every 15 minutes and you can therefore wait for 15 minutes for the start of the next one. There is no seating in the 'holding area' and when we sat on the floor we were told we had to get up. There were some elderly people on the tour and this isn't ideal.

One of the best Music facilities in the country. Everyone knows Radio City so if you have a chance go to a concert there, the acoustics are great, it is ornate and everything about this place is nice. Well worth the time.
Flying visit. Great day to walk pass this into Rockefeller Centre. Peered into it and absorbed the musty smell & feel the Music!!!

New York Spectacular is "Spectacular!". Excellent show. Focuses on the Rockettes. Music, singing, dance reviews are great. Although it is the same theme as last year, a tour of the highlights of New York City, the changes made are fantastic. Lighting, characters, moving statues, songs, costumes...all fantastic. If you like New York City and Broadway, this show is a must see. The Rockettes finally get the limelight they have always deserved!

Rockettes are amazing. Saw the new New York City Spectacular and it was spectacular!!!We sat very close and it was amazing to see the precision of their dancing. The hall itself was beautiful. Loved that we could take our wine into the show with us. A real New York experience.

Fantastic show, great value. My wife and I were handed a flyer for the show "New York Spectacular" by one of the Rockettes so went to check it out. We got two tickets for $78 and it was the best money we've spent in New York. The show was fabulous, the Rockettes were stunning and the whole ensemble provided one and a half hours of glorious entertainment. The sets too were brilliant and the music was foot tappingly rousing . Overall one of the best experiences we have had during our four day stay in NYC. If you only see one show and want a real "New York" experience we could not recommend this show highly enough. Go see it!!
Very cool looking place, extremely art deco. Check out this pretty building with interesting art deco exterior. Best seen during the night when the neon really comes in to its own.

Art Deco & behind- the scenes tour. Really great way to get away from the crowds. 1932 tour of gold-leaf interior. We saw private rooms, costumes and met with an actual Rockettes, Carissa. But the best was catching the Rockettes in a dress rehearsal finale. Full orchestra, lights, hydraulics, the works!

Cool tour!. A guide led us on a tour around Radio City Music Hall, giving us a history of the gorgeous theater. We were able see the hallways in the back, where the costume department is and where the original owners entertained celebrities. We also got to talk to a Rockette and take pictures with her!

Great tour. We took the 45 minute tour. It was well worth the time. Not only did you get to see many of the public areas, but there many non public areas visited as well. After a short movie about the history of the Rockettes, one of the Rockettes came out and met with the group.

Our Favorite TOUR!!!. This is a great experience. The building is amazing and they have restored it so beautifully. We happened to catch a rehearsal of the Rockettes which was so fun it made me want to travel back when they open. After the tour you get to meet one of the Rockettes, take a picture with you (ready at the end for about $25), and ask questions. Loved the whole experience :)
Awesome visit!. Guide was very knowledgeable, the tour was so much fun. This is an awesome place to visit. We will visit again and hopefully get to see a concert.

Loved it. Wasn't sure about going here, but so glad I did. It was really interesting and such a beautifully restored building. Our tour guide was very good, Tabatha, and we met a Rockette Dancer, Megan. Well worth going.

Adds magic during the holiday season. I've been here in the winter twice to see the Christmas show. I just love it, it leaves you with such a good feeling and really adds to that 'something special' during the holiday season. The inside is gorgeous -- the decor is beautiful. The on stage props are truly fantastic as well, they even have live animals! The seats are so comfortable and the show will keep your attention from start to finish for parents, teens, and children.

Rockettes. We didn't buy our tickets till we got to RCMH. I'm glad we didn't buy them from the concierge at our hotel. It was fraction of the cost and we had great seats. Must see for the Christmas Season.
Amazing just like the place . I've been here many times because I live in New York but Greatalways clean and very nice service any show u see here you will love
Excitement. Huge! Largest theater I have ever been in. A must-see is the Rockettes during the Christmas holidays. So much fun!!!

My Visit to Radio city Music Hall. I highly recommend to come to see the Christmas Spectacular atleast once or twice in your life. Bring your whole family. Very worth the time and money. This can easily be made into a family tradition.
Spectacular!. I have been many times for the Christmas show. Highly recommend whether a couple, or family. Tremendous and unforgettable.

Beautiful. Beautiful at night.
Didn't have time to go during the day.
But at night. Wow
Will visit again.
We walked the whole neighborhood

The Radio City Music Hall Tour is Awesome. We booked the tour of Radio City Music Hall. The venue is beautiful and the history is awe inspiring. We also had the privilege of standing on stage and viewing the theater from this vantage point. If not seeing a show, I would recommend doing the tour. We also got to meet a Rockette and learn more of their colorful history.

Danced on the stage!. Until I went on this tour I had no idea of the history of Radio City. The tour included a photo with a rockette along with stories of Radio City entertainers and it's construction

lovely building, great tour. What a beautiful building, so glad it wasn't demolished. My husband and I did the guided tour using our N.Y. pass visitors card. Our guide was so nice, very knowledgeable and seemed to love her job. We had a question answer session with a real rockette.
Stunning Venue and History. Another iconic building with so much history and thought to detail, that it will amaze you that this was built so long ago. A must do.
A Look into History. This is a great place to see the history of the Rockettes and the shows that are performed as well a the history behind the Radio City Music Hall

Awesome place to see. This is a must when visiting NYC. It was great to see this iconic place in person. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable. It was great to see this place as well as learn the history. To top it off we got to meet a Rockette at the end of our tour.

Classic. I have seen the Xmas show here twice with my son and we enjoyed both visits. A truly classic NY experience. The show is perfectly-timed and perfectly entertaining to keep a 5-year-old and then 6-year-old engaged the whole time. The show does not change much year after year so perhaps seeing it once is sufficient. We liked it enough the first time to go back and see it a 2nd time the very next year and Im hopeful we'll go back again when he's older. Additional perk: the hot chocolate that goes for $6 is totally worth it especially if you save the mug! That mug has become my to-go-to mug for my coffee or tea!

A beautiful building. There are so many beautiful buildings in NY. This is my favourite one that has sn intimate human scale. So many buildings involve looking up. This one is more personal. And it is beautiful to look at.

Fantastic Tour Very Impressive Building. Radio City Music Hall has a long and very interesting history. During the backstage tour you get to walk around the hall, view the impressive design and hear about the history.
