Much of building is original or restored to the original which is really interesting and impressive. The bathrooms were very interesting and they had the first electric hand dryers. Our guide was great as she energetically taught us about what we were seeing. Well worth the time to visit. I would highly recommend this and will sure to do it again when I come back to New York.

David Gilmour concert. On the last day of our visit to new york we went to radio city music hall to watch David Gilmour in concert. The hall itself it's lovely , the decor quaint and we'll laid out. The only thing was the price of drinks and sweets , 17 dollars for a cold drink and a box of popcorn was very steep , works out at around 12 pounds , but I guess it's a captive market , the concert was amazing and would love to return at some time in the future.

America's Entertaimnent Icon. The minute the Radio City sign comes into view for the first time, you know you're someplace special. Then, you step inside and suddenly the Art Deco design is everywhere. The look of Radio City was designed to resemble an ocean liner with subtle maritime motifs everywhere. If you have the time, take the backstage tour, usually featuring one of the Rockettes.Public transportation is your best bet, with the F and D trains bringing you right to the front doors.

Christmas Spectacular. We went to the Thanksgiving afternoon performance and it was great. We had seen the show years ago and there have been a few changes to the show which helps to keep it fresh. The building is beautiful and the Rockettes are fabulous! There was added security to get into RCMH, so plan accordingly. When purchasing tickets there was an option to buy a package for popcorn and soft drinks. Wish I had purchased it, as prices are high and I could not purchase that option without purchasing more show tickets.
Interesting place. You need to be interested in the old style music hall & concerts to appreciate this tour. If its your thing, it is very good and worth a visit.
Rockettes were great!. Went to Radio City Music Hall to see the Rockettes. The show was wonderful. If I visit NY again I will definitely check out the Radio City Music Hall.

Showplace. Another fantastic landmark to not miss. This is a special place to see shows. There is no other theater quite like this one. It is the home of the dazzling Rocketts which is a chorus line of special dancers doing all kinds of sexual shows marking special occasions. If you can get tickets for one of there special shows I would not hesitate to get them and it is a great place to bring children of all ages

A time capsule, now this was an awesome memory!. My family loved this tour and now really want to enjoy a show here. They have preserved the RCMH in the finest details making you feel you're back in time. Theres nothing like it. I still can't get over the bathrooms...no, really!

Backstage Tour!. Take a backstage tour of the radio City Music Hall, It's very cool to see where the big artists and performers get ready for their big shows. I would have liked to see the actual stage and the mechanics of it, My mother said that she went on one of the tours years ago and that was apart of the tour. It was really exciting to look around and walk the not so glamorous steps to the old music hall.
theater comes alive. radio city muic hall hostes many live concerts and live atrctions such as cirsuc and anymall shows I saw the new York city rockets there performing the chrismas show

Beautiful Theater. Most tourists know the Christmas Spectacular with the Rocketts which is an incredible family show but they have great shows and concerts year round. Make sure to look them up to see what is playing there if it's not the Christmas season. You won't be sorry. An iconic landmark not to be missed.
Beautiful building. A must see since I have a Rockette friend. The building is beautiful! Took the backstage tour as saw the Christmas Spectacular. It was wonderful.

Rockettes Home. The Christmas show is very well done but it is loud. Great for kids or any age provided you are not too close to the speakers. We had to leave because our kids could not take it. Be prepared for that. No refunds given.
An inconic place. The history of Radio City Music Hall is amazing. They have redone the inside to the original look. If you do the tour you meet a Rockette.

High Kickin' Entertainment Always Pleases. We never tire of seeing a Rockette show! Iconic location, iconic group. Take a family, see it by oneself, just see a show here. And spend some time observing the details of the architecture above your head. Great photos opps, too!

A Staple of NYC. I took family members in for the Christmas show, had an amazing day. I have been attending shows here since I was a little girl with my parents; I guess it has been a tradition. Each time I enter the lobby I get an overwhelming feeling of joy. A great place to go and the Rockettes are always amazing. The changes to the Christmas show I was very disappointed in, I loved the older traditional shows; the is what Christmas is about. Some times when you try t modernize things it loses it's meaning. I felt the new Spectacular was cold; it lost something.
NYU Graduation. This is a fabulous old Art Deco Building. I was just there for my child's graduation! It is a great building to see & tour.
Rockettes. Beautiful place they have the Christmas show there that is wonderful, they have the Rockettes there, they always have something going on there they also have concerts there

Bus Tour 2009. Richard, Henry and James from Canada's largest processing technical center came by car and took a bus group tour, tickets $80 for 4 days anywhere in Manhattan. Live changing experience from being from the Maritime Provinces of Canada.
Super. This is quintessential New York with impressive shows and Art Deco architecture that can't fail to impress.

Vacation Trip. We take the tour, and we never think that it's gone be so perfect and magic. From the beginning of the tour this place send you to a golden Era or something like that. The history, paints and design of the building is so beautiful. When you go to stage center you feel like a artist. So I recommend if you gone visit NYC.

A building oozing with nostalgia!. We had a great tour of this fabulous art deco building. It was fascinating to see and imagine how this building came alive in the early days. Beautiful interior! We had a very informative tour guide and got to meet a Rockette. Well worth an hour of anyone's time.
Loved the Christmas show. Went to see the Christmas show it was fabulousBeautiful building great night out 1love RadioCity :)

You will love Radio City. I have been here many times. You will love this theater and the Christmas Shows are awesome. But if you go anytime is good. See if you can get a tour of the back stage But you'll need connections. Be careful on the streets here the is a lot of snatch and grabs in this area since it is a little more quite of a street. I have seen 3 in my times there.

New York's Classic Theater. The Rockettes, the Christmas Show, movies, concerts! Radio City Music Hall is a classic NYC experience. It's an old Art Deco hall that's been kept in top shape. It's a great place to see a show and feel as if you're back in 1940's New York.

Cirque du Soleil plus radio city music hall = wonderful experience. We saw the opening of Zarkana. The mix of the scene of the Cirque with the stage of the Radio Music City Hall made the experience great! The staff is really polite and helpful and the place really worth the visit. Kids enjoy the place although Zarkana is not a show recommended for young kids. (The opening took place earlier than the date of the visit mentioned here).

Amazing piece of entertainment history!. We visited the Radio City Music Hall and joined their tour during a short stay in the city. This is a simply brilliant venue a well worth a visit! The recent restoration is amazing, bringing the interior of the building back to its original 1930s splendour. Our tour guide (Lyle) was confident and informative, answering all questions from our party. This is a working entertainment venue and we had to fit around the preparations being made for a TV show that evening, but this just added to the quality of the visit. We even had the chance to meet with one of the 'Rockettes' dancers (Marie) and this was a highlight of the tour. In overall terms, this is a superb venue that will not disappoint!
Radio City. This is a great tour with a very informative guide, my elderly father especially loved it as he is a fan of music hall. would highly recommend for any age though.

Has to see. Part of a tour we had booked and glad that we did. I had heard about it but really didn't know too much about. I have seen the rocket ties when they came to my home town of Hamilton, Ont. Great show. An absolutely beautiful building. The acoustics were unbelievable I would have liked to seen a show there but nothing was playing at the time we were there.

Extreme experience. Watching there for the second time was more exciting especially had a great seat to watch those long legged Rocketssss dancers .
Great atmosphere !!!!
Elegant lobby , very friendly staff .
Well covered place for security .
Restroom were clean .
There's a lot of souvenir stuff to buy.
More picture backdrop to take selfie :)))

Tour of the Theatre. They were between show seasons so we took the behind the scenes tour and actually got to meet one of the Rockettes . We also learned the history of the theatre and the Rockets. Now I have to go back and see a performance!

What can one say. This was an extra for us as we had a spare couple of hours before we went to Citi Field to watch the Mets playing Baseball and we were glad we did not miss it what a building full of music history definatly not to be missed.
Classic. A classic NY stop, Radio City Music Hall lived up to all our expectations. It's in a great location (near 30 rock) and is a must see!
The highlight of our trip. This tour is worth every penny and every minute spent there. The history in this building is truly amazing. Don't miss it.

If you love Art Deco, you will love this.. We took a guided tour of what is probably the most beautiful Art Deco building in the city.
The detail is amazing, right down to the restrooms.
Our tour guide was friendly and knowledgeable, really bringing the history of the building to life.
Oh yes, and you get to meet a Rockette.
A fabulous NYC experience.

Enchanting!. My husband is a retired disc jockey and lifelong music fan. The guide who led us through the building answered all of our questions and was clearly a fan himself of the building, its presentations and its history. The best tour of our NYC trip.
Great events. Went to watch the New York Rangers (ice hockey') and it was fantastic. Great venue and atmosphere, well worth a visit even if you aren't into the sport on.

Guided tour of Radio City Music Hall. Radio City Music Hall is a stunning example of art deco with no expense on the opulence of the surrounds. The tour guide was very informative and the talk by one of the Rockettes gave us an insight into their working habits. The auditorium is huge and surprisingly up to date in the audi visual equipment.

New York Spring Spectacular. In April of 2015 my husband and I went to see the New York Spring Spectacular performed by the Rockettes. Unfortunately the option to select April 2015 is not available so please excuse the date listed for this review. From the ticket booth till the very end staff was very nice and helpful. Only downside to our visit was the lack of t-shirts available in adult women's sizes. It would have been nice to have been able to obtain a shirt as a souvenir. Granted I'm not sure if the products available were that of the Radio City Music Halls doing or the Rockettes and their vendors. Either way the show was wonderful and we would recommend this venue, if asked.
Awesome Historical Sight. Visiting Radio City Musical Hall was a real treat, after watching TV shows from Radio City the last 50 years it was exciting to visit!

Rockettes what more could you want.. Go see the rockets in the Spring Review. Nice to change it up from the Christmas show.See the grandure of the building from the crystal chandelier to the beautiful curtains on the stage to the organ that plays live music. A must to see. Oh did I forget to mention the famous Rockettes who always delight the crowd with their high line kicks.

Lovely tour. Tours of the Radio City Music Hall run all day. Grab a ticket at the candy store alongside. The guide was very knowledgable and entertaining. What you see varies a bit with what is going on. The stage was being setup the day of my tour so we didn't get to look around it or backstage but the building itself is amazing. Well worth the visit.

Great tour of Radio City Music Hall. I did a tour of Radio City Music Hall; we got to hear the history behind Radio City Music Hall. It was amazing to see this place, we looked behind the scenes and saw the costume room as well as the training room where the Radio City Rockettes get put through their paces to be picked as part of the show. I found it to be a great tour, you get to see the theatre stage from high up in the seats! Very professional tour guides and personnel involved.
A must for any music lover. Wonderful box seats and the Broadway stars were incredible. The singing and acoustics were out of this world!

Delightful Building. Interesting tour, beautiful building. The guide was a bit strange, she kept forgetting what she was saying and seemed a bit pissed.Didn't really know anything about RCMH before we went but that didn't really matter as the tour covers the history and explains why all the gloss and glamour. Loved the tale about the elephant that refused to use the lift!

Entertainment venue from NYC. Radio City Music Hall is located in Rockefeller Center and it is Entertainment venue from NYC. Many shows, talent hunts gets performed in this place. It is one the famous tourist destination now a days. Lighting during New Year is very beautiful.

What a fantastic concert hall!. We went in as part of the NY City Pass and the guided tour lasted about 75 minutes. It gets busy so you may have to wait. The guide was very informative and a look behind the scenes, interesting architecture and unchanged suites and restrooms that give an insight into a different age. A photo opportunity with a Rosette dancer and needless to say an option to buy an expensive photo memory. All in all a wonderful place to see, it makes you want to go back to see a concert

Great acoustic. I went there to see a New Order Concert., The sound quality was perfect, excelent acoustic and view. For me so far living in NYC for 2 years, the best place to see a concert not in a stadium. I haven't been to a concert in The Lincoln ccenter yet. WOrth to go.
Radio City Oh My!. My daughter is a dancer and actress. She wanted to stand on the stage that all her idols have performed on. It was an amazing tour. We even met a Rocket.

Go on the tour. Wow what an experience we had when we went on the Radio City Music Hall tour. The decor is stunning and the tour guides were friendly and knowledgeable. The theatre itself is absolutely stunning. This was one of the best tours we did whilst we were in NYC

A Bucket List Item. I've been to Radio City so many times I can't count, for various types of performances, from seeing a restored "Snow White", complete with Rockettes show, to the Christmas Spectacular, the Spring Spectacular, and rock concerts, and Eddie Izzard. It's a wonderful venue and I'm so very happy that this glorious theatre managed to dodge the wrecking ball. Treat yourself to an evening at this grand palace!

What a surprise. This 75 minute tour was a total surprise from the start . I had no idea that Radio City is such a large auditorium . lots of Art Deco and the only tour I've been on where the toilets are a feature . Really was worth doing if only to see inside the main theatre which is one of the largest in the world.

A true classic... preserved as it was, not a modern reinterpretation. Many times when classic buildings are "Restored" they become ruined as modern architects try to leave their own fingerprints on the building rather than truly bringing back what was once there. That hasn't happened with Radio City. They truly turned the clock back and restored this beautiful theater to its former glory, somehow with no modern influences. Even the bathrooms still retain the 1930s hand dryers. Climate control, electrics, and sound systems are all modern, but hidden from sight. I still am amazed by this place every time I see a performance here. If you can do the backstage tour, go for it! The workings of the Radio City stage, even for a stagehand, are pretty unique. Also, if you can get a chance to hear the wonderful theater organ here, do it. In a city where progress usually means tear down something beautiful and replace it with a dull office building or ugly condominiums, Radio City stands defiantly, beautifully, defending its well-deserve turf.
Christmas Spectacular. Awesome show at Christmas time, book well in advance, Very nice venue also at Radio City Theatre. ..

tour was very interesting. We stayed near Radio City and it was a rainy Sunday morning so we needed to figure out what to do. So glad we took the tour. It was interesting and the venue is beautiful. Now we want to go to a concert at Radio City.

Feeling like a little kid. Going to the Christmas show has been a tradition for many years in my family. You have to visit Radio City at least once in your life. The inside is absolutely beautiful and you feel very special once you are inside. Enjoy the show or any concert that is being held at Radio City.

Beautiful Venue. We went to see David Gilmour - Nice perfect light show. Great sound, however atmosphere stuffy. Seats are very closed together and it feels uptight for such a concert. But I would go again. Staff is great.
Must See!!!!. We saw the Rockettes Christmas show! What a great family activity! Our 5 year old still talks about it over a year later!
Tour was fabulous!. What a great, fun and informative tour! Went with a large group. I highly recommend this!! Meet a Rockette, see the stage and under the stage and hear about the events.

Fabulous. A look back in time in an art deco building/theatre at the past actors and actresses and the Rockettes. Even met and had a picture taken with one of the current Rockettes. A not to be missed attraction
Radio City Magic. A last minute decision to join the tour led to one of the highlights of our trip. An amazing building with incredible history. Loved it

Informative tour. My husband and I took the 10am tour, which was great to do. Our guide Eloise was really friendly, knowledgable and fun. Really enjoyed exploring the venue and its history; great for all ages!

A beautiful bit of theatre history. We ended up on the Radio city Music Hall tour by default as we were put off by the sales assistant at the Top of the Rock, but ended up having the best hour!There were only 6 of us on the tour and the tour guide , (unfortunately I can't remember her name) was lovely. (She was an actor and working as a tour guide was her 3rd job....info which added to the authenticity of New York! I had no idea of the history of Radio City and had heard vaguely of the Rockettes, but now feel as though I have missed out on something really big and important (had no idea Adele, Prince, Madonna etc etc etc played there) , and next time I go to New York, I will try and coincide it with a Radio City show. I did feel a bit sorry for the Rockette who had been made to dress up and meet us , as no one wanted to have their photo taken with her in front of a green screen (been there done that in so many other places!)Would recommend a visit.
It's simply awesome!!. Radio city music Hall is simply superb...it's one of the best happening place at new York city...Music is crystal clear...
It's there.. It's an iconic building with interesting art deco. We didn't get to watch a show due to tickets being sold out. It's still interesting to see.
A beautiful Art Deco building. I came here to see the rocketts Christmas show, which was a bit young in cheek and reminded me of British pantomime shows. The building is well worth exploring.

Came here to see a concert, Dream Theater. Few music venues evoke the recognition or grandiosity of Manhattan's legendary Radio City Music hall. One of the most beautiful venues I have ever visited. I was there for a concert, so I did not take the tour. Don't know if that would be worthwhile just to tour the facility.
I was surprised that I loved this place.. My friend wanted to see the Rockettes Christmas show. Me - not so much. I went and was amazed. The venue itself is extraordinary and the show was fantastic.
LOVE THIS PLACE - Such Amazing memories. I have been to RCM many times through the years and never been disappointed! From the Rockettes to New Kids on the Block RCM is awesome!
Rocket yes Christmas Spectalular. Wow. Fabulous show. Advise to book tickets in advance as queues are lengthy. Good value for money. Something that you won't see anywhere else.

Backstage Tour. I didn't know what to expect from this tour of such a Historical place...but I was very impressed with the quality and historical value of this amazing building. They have gone to great lengths to make this venue a very important place of interest!

The place for true NY Xmad. The Rockettes never fail to show holiday spirit and make pump up the audience
Lilttle girls dressed up in there new holiday outfits
It's a really a happy old fashioned event

Garden of Dreams Concert!. One of the highlights of our trip to NYC! Congrats to all involved, letting those precious children SHINE for one evening! Such heart- warming stories from the very bravest kids!! Bravo to each and everyone who performed!

Iconic building on the corner. A lot of the pictures you see make you think it is stand alone and easy to pick out but it actually spans a corner. Advertising the rockettes but not until next month. Cool to see and take a selfie.
Great architectural tour. Amazing theatre for a very old venue. Kept in original condition including original fixtures and furniture. Rocket history very enlightening.

A NYC must see attraction. It's been a few years since I've been here but I think everyone should see Radio City Music Hall. I've seen the Christmas show here several times and also did a backstage tour. I recommend the Christmas show and the tour if you have a chance.

A Disappointment. This is the very first negative review I have written - so please keep that in mind. When we arrived at our seat in the first mezzanine, my seat, section 4, row 2, seat 412 was broken. We bought these tickets last December as soon as the show was released because we wanted to sit in an area where we didn't have to stand because both of us suffer from arthritis. Being seasoned concert goers, we know the mezzanine is the place to go. I immediately called the usher that sat us, and she apologized and said she would resolve it. She came back and wanted to re-seat us higher up in the same section, but over to the left side. My husband declined because the view was not good. I sat in my husband's seat, while he sat on the floor. She returned, without telling us where she was taking us, and sat us in the extreme right of the hall, near the stage. As soon as the show started, everyone in our section stood up, and continued to stand through the second song. I went to the back and asked another usher to find her to move us back to the mezzanine. There was no one in the seats behind ours. Instead, a different, very sassy and rude employee came and started giving me a hard time saying that "this is a concert, we can't make people sit! What if you move you back there and then someone stands?!" I tried to explain to her why we bought those seats and she started shaking her finger at me and said, "stop yelling and keep your hands away from my face!" She was more interested in arguing with me that resolving the problem. I was yelling because the music was loud and it was already 20 minutes into the show, that we had been missing. We paid over $200, not to mention the train and subway trip. I was very frustrated and turned away from her because she was not at all demonstrating any level of customer service, she extremely rude. It took some time for the original usher to return. She took us back up to the seats behind ours (which no one came to sit in during the entire 2 1/2 hour show),took our tickets and never returned - we always save our tickets and this will be the ONE show which we don't have. The man next to us, attending with his two boys, said he originally told her that no one was sitting where we ending up, before she took us downstairs. He bought the mezzanine for the same reason! NO ONE stood in our section the entire time. After the aggravation and inconsiderate behavior we experienced, we will not be returning to this venue. If you pay that much for seats, you should be able to sit in them, they should not be broken! And if you inconvenience your customers, you should show some consideration and apologize. But, no one had thought of any of that at Radio City Music Hall. We were not treated well at all and will not be back.
Exciting. Any show you go to, you will love. The atmosphere is thrilling and you are stepping back in time when you go to this theatre. I love it.

Bowie Tribute. Radio City Music Hall is still beautiful and I haven't been there in years. You can see from wherever you sit. Of course you will want to be on the floor or first tier. We were on the second and could see,but not distinguish faces. Still the seating was comfy. The Tribute however, well, it needed Bowie! That's another story....

A "must see" while in NYC. We enjoyed a "behind the scenes" type tour of Radio City Music Hall with a small group led by a very knowledgeable guide. I was absolutely shocked when, upon telling her supervisor after the tour was complete, what a great job our guide had done, he told me this was her first day conducting a tour! I view this as testimony to proper training. We went through this huge facility from top to bottom with interesting background info given on the facility's history. I cannot recommend touring this grand theater highly enough!

A backstage Tour is worth seeing. Interessting Tour through a Building with History of Great perfomances. You get to See a Lot of backstage and you Meet a rockette towards the end of you Visite. Worth seeing

You Will Get a Kick Out of It. Of course you have to play the game. Of course, all thoughts of the nose up in the air black tie Carnegie Hall melt into gales of delight at this child of Music Hall and Old Cinema that my grandmother described at the beginning of the 20th century. The show is amazing, innocent, escapist, gaudy, and choreographically miraculous. I remember accompanying my parents in the 60s a few years before RCenter was closed and had to go through a very bad patch. But like Grand Central and other threatened monuments RCMH is possibly the Knickerbocker answer to Disneyland and a true New York institution. The Christmas Show is especially wonderful. We bought tickets at the last moment and had good seats with high visibility to gape at the two gigantic organs.

What's not to like?. Radio City is an old New York standard. It is a gorgeous facility that attracts top notch shows. I always love going to see the Rockettes at Christmas. It is a true NY experience - even for us that live here! One of those places that just makes you happy!
Stunning Lights. Definitely Radio City Music Hall is Eye Catching at night. You will never miss the bright lights and lots of people who wants to check inside. Iconic place to visit.
Iconic place in NY. One of the most popular places in the city, the performances here are able to immerse you in their atmosphere even if you are not a fan of musicals.

SO many memories of childhood!. It always was and always will be the most amazing building in NYC. Used to go there all the time as a child with my grandmother. Now, through adult eyes, it was stunning. Hot, but nice nevertheless. You get to "meet" a rockette. Which really means they usher you into this small room and "try" to stand you in front of a photographer for NOT Free pictures. It was a beautiful morning and worth the price of admission.

fantastic organisation. Went there for the bowie tribute sharity concert and was very impessed about this place. Very good organisation when thousand of people entered the arena. Not crowdy at all. Very comfotable seats in red velvet as it should be in a real theater
One of a Kind. Iconic New York venue with beautiful Art Deco decor. Great acoustics. The Rockette Christmas show is something everyone should see at least once.

Great Insight into the Music Hall. This tour provided my husband and I with an amazing insight to the Radio City Tour and Rockettes.The Tour Guide spoke very very fast, as times I'm sure he didn't breathe for a long time!! He didn't really seem to have a sense of humour either, just more of a case of "doing his job!"Great venue, be prepared to be completely bombarded with information in the 75 minute tour.

Tour was awesome. We didn't catch a show, but the tour was awesome and ended with us meeting a Rockette. They took us backstage and many other places and explained how productions are done and how some of the stage magic happens.

must see Radio City Christmas Spectacular at Christmas. If you are travelling during Christmas, you have to see the Radio City Christmas Spectacular ... otherwise, it is not a Christmas in New York. Excellent show for family !!!

Beautiful trip back through time!. Fantastic chance to see the opulence of the 1930's Art Deco era. My husband was not keen on taking this tour but it was raining so decided to join me and absolutely loved it. You see behind the scenes, meet a beautiful Rockette dancer and really get a feel of the amazing people who have passed through the theatre. One of my favourite tours

Do the tour it's unreal. Want to see backstage and soak up the history and atmosphere it's superb. Our guide Joyce has worked there for 20 years and was so enthusiastic she had many stories of her own let alone the ones she had to tell us. The original bathrooms are unbelievable,the stage hydraulics wow but the theatre itself is the best I have ever been in no matter where you sit you can see everything even in the gods no pillars restricting views in this theatre.

Radio City Music Hall Stage Door Tour. Hidden in the skyscrapers of New York, there is a breathtaking concert hall which is a must do, if you have a fable for concert halls. Without any expectations we did the Stage Door Tour. We really enjoyed the tour with our awesome guide Joyce (special thanks!), who made tour just amazing with her nice and charming manner. We discovered the impressive foyer, the magnificent stage and several more hidden places, which a usual visitor does not see. A bad weather program for every age!

Lets go back in time. I only went to this attraction as a friend wanted to go. I was pleasantly surprised with my visit. I felt transported back to the thirties. The decor, furniture and artwork are stunning. Our tour guide was very informative.

A Classic . RCMH is always a classic!!!No matter what you are going to see...the christmas show....seseame st or a music concert....its always a pleasure. Nothing really new the decor is the same ....but thats what makes it a classic.Sundays are best for low traffic and better parking.Fridays and saturdays ...is New York City at its best.

Radio City is a most beautiful NYC landmark. We purchased a City Explorer Pass which had a tour for Radio City on it, most likely we would not have taken this tour, but so glad we did!! Our tour took us through the behind sciences of the theater, her rich history is fascinating and we even got to meet a Rockette in her costume, fun!
Radio city music hall. This is a fabulous tour. So much more than it seems from the outside. Great tour guides. Had a meet and greet and photo op with a Rockette

A NEW YORK GEM. Looking at this New York icon from the outside does not hint at what to expect when you enter its magnificent and very large foyer. The entire building was built in the art decor style of the 1930s and this has been retainted to this day. We started our tour in the foyer, with its enormous chandeliers and murals on the wall alongside the staircase leading to the upper levels. The carpeting has a repeating pattern of musical instruments.We then moved to the backstage area, but below the large stage itself, to be explained how the stage is lowered and raised - a mechanical feat. We ascended to the upper level of the auditorium to see the splendor of the thousands of seats and the stage. The auditorium is built to represent the setting sun.The tour continued to the dressing rooms where the Rockettes are costumed, several times per performance with total efficiency. Seated in a conference room we saw a short movie of the history of the Rockettes and this was followed by us actually meeting a Rockette who, dressed in her stage costume, explained to us how they are chosen, trained, rehearsed etc.The above is not fully inclusive of the tour but merely the highlights.Our guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. A tour of this New York gem is highly recommended.

David Gilmour was amazing!. I went to NYC to see David Gilmour play 3 concerts. The first one was at Radio City Music Hall. I sat in the front row of the first mezzanine (seat 611), and the view was great. Acoustically, RCMH is very impressive. The sound of the concert was great! In fact, the acoustics might be a little bit TOO good. Some people behind me were talking at a normal level during the concert, and I could hear them! The venue is nice, the seats were comfortable, and it's hard to believe that there is a bad seat in the house.

Beautiful theater. I've been to many many concerts and somehow I had never been to Radio City until I saw David Gilmour on his 2016 tour. The show was amazing and the venue is really a very nice theater. Everyone should try and see at least one show here in their life. Getting into the show was pretty efficient and the wait was not too bad despite the long line. The RC staff were all pleasant and helpful.

See The Christmas Show!. Get tickets in advance for anything here! It will be well worth the visit! The CHRISTMAS SHOW is a must see! Try and eat before you go because the $ are a little high in this neighborhood,also you don't want to miss your show !
Amazing Theatre. Saw David Gilmour here and ... It was amazing!! The seating, the lighting, and the atmosphere! :)I would highly recommend it for performances!

GREAT TOUR!. The Radio City Music Hall is one the iconic theaters in New York, and best known for the Rockettes Spectacular Show that I have the opportunity to watch for the first time on 1981. A serious visitor of the Big Apple should include the R.C.M.H. in his/her 'must to do things' as a part of his/her touring agenda.

Special tribute for David Bowie!. First time in this awesome theatre in a very special show dedicated for David Bowie. The crowd got almost crazy with "Space Odity". Comfortable seats and great view from almost all seat. Just great!!

David Gilmour Concert. Fantastic... a bucket list artist! Great show and nice atmosphere. Prices were about what you'd expect to pay for food and drinks, and the facilities were well maintained and secure.

Best concert venue. Period.. We had the amazing opportunity to see David Gilmour here on Sunday 4/10/16 and were absolutely blown away by the show. I'd seen the Christmas show many years ago, but this concert displayed to true amazingness of the space. The acoustics are fantastic. The venue itself is beautiful. And of course Gilmour put on a stunning show!

4th Time and Will Go Again!. This is a must see! I have enjoyed every visit and highly recommend this tour. We actually were able to go on the stage this time and it was fabulous. I recently had knee surgery and walking the stairs was very easy. They give you time to look and enjoy the beautiful place. The history of this building is magnificent! A TRUE MUST SEE!

Christmas Spectacular!!. What a show! The Christmas Spectacular was indeed just that. I was blown away from the moment it started. The music and dancing were fabulous, and were improved only by the addition of the Rockettes who were outstanding. There is something for everyone in the show, and the traditional nativity at the end was breath taking in its simplicity. The Rockettes stole the show, their dance routines were energetic and without fault. I loved the toy soldiers routine. The experience was well worth it. I would recommend this show for some Christmas cheer!
The Christmas Show. A must see for everyone young and old. I had not been there in over 30 years and it is still as exciting as it was then. A must for all New Yorkers and visitors of all ages.

See any show here!. See any who you can here - just so you can lap up the beauty of the place. I was lucky enough to see the David Bowie tribute here and although the concert was a little disappointing - it was WONDERFUL to see the amazing pomp and grandure of Radio CIty Music Hall

Best venue ever . David Gilmore ... Birthday present tickets ... Road trip to NYC!!! What a place for one of the greatest rock musicians ever. Guitarist and vocalist for Pink Floyd. The acoustics were superb. The seating (second balcony) were great. Unobstructed. Comfortable. Classic. Art Deco decor. Again - did I mention the acoustics? If you're going to hear Pink Floyd by the Pink himself you gotta go perfect. It was. Lots of - ahem - "smoke" but that's just the crowd. Plenty of bars - a bit of a mosh pit for t-shirts - cool 1930s-ish Men's Lounge/Lavatory. Beautiful.
Tour - A must Visit. IT's historic Music Hall . The tour brought you to the back stage. Told you the history and a chance to sit on those original seats date back to 1932. OMG. Amazing

Great music venue. Attended the Music of David Bowie memorial concert at Radio City Musi Hall. A wonderful venue. Had the good fortune to be seated in the Pit so only two more rows of seats between me and the stage. Although there 6,000 people behind me it was like being in a small club. Wonderful experience
Amazing. We saw the Christmas Spectacular and spectacular it is. We also booked at back stage tour which was absolutely amazing and worth the time. We learned a ton about the history.
iconic. cool to see a show here, smaller theater than I anticipated but lives up to its iconic image and repuation

A step. Back in time. A fantastic tour , well worth the money .Got to go on stage looking out to where the ordinance would be . The guide gave us lots of information about the present & the past , & we even got to meet a rocket to ask questions & chance to have a photo taken .An amazing tour for all ages , A fantastic experience THANK YOU RADIO CITY

Great accoustics, excellent theatre. This is one of the places no one should miss, but you have to plan in advance because sometimes they have shows you wont like or get sold out early. The whole theatre and its accoustics are just grand, but the dancers named rockettes I would say are the main attraction. If you do no care about the show, I think you also have the option to take a tour of the place, but it is not the same.
Loved it. The tour was excellent and the Staff were so friendly and welcoming. I would definitely recommend a visit.
Tour was GREAT!!!. We took the tour and it was fantastic. We were lucky enough to get to be on stage, see Roxy's room and meet a Rockette. My music loving 10 year old loved every single minute!

Fantastic experience. If you're in New York fit this tour into your itinery. It was fantastic and if you get Joyce as your guide you're in for a treat. She was brilliant. It was so interesting and getting to see backstage and even standing on the stage was all part of the experience. Getting to meet one of the Rockettes and then having a photo taken with here just finished off a great tour.

So Much Fun!. I would recommend seeing their Christmas Show, it is incredible! The site is set up where there are no bad seats although my motto is if your going to spend the money, time and effort then you should get the best possible seats for your budget!

Excellent place. Every time I go to radio city music hall I am pleased with my experience. I saw the rockettes perform at least 3 times. I recently went to see the impractical Jokers on tour here and was not disappointed. I wish we were closer to them though but those tickets were too expensive. This place is huge inside and I love it.

Epic Show!. Went to the Christmass Spectacular this last winter and it was a wonderful show! Very wholesome and enjoyable. The Rockettes are just a fun bunch and they find a way to show that through the show!
Rockettes Performance. We enjoyed the Christmas show! It's something everyone must experience at least once in their lifetime and check off their bucket list.

Bowie tribute concert. Once again, classic elegance in the big city! Art deco fantastic. Saw a concert, acoustics great. Seating excellent and comfy. Would love to see the Rockettes here! Lots of bathroom stalls, too :)
NYC Landmark. From the Rockettes to more current shows, Radio City Musical Hall has withstood the test of time to continue entertaining new generations.

NYC Must-See!. Iconic NYC landmark that completely lives up to its reputation! We saw the Rockettes in the Radio City Christmas Spectacular Show and took the Radio City Stage Door Tour.The Rockettes put on an incredible show filled with traditional and new routines. You won't be disappointed!The Radio City Stage Door Tour took about an hour. Make sure you sign up for the tour right after the show if you buy the combo ticket. You can sign up in the main lobby near the main doors. Our tour included a short video about the history of Radio City Music Hall and the Rockettes and concluded with a Q&A with a real Rockette. She answered plenty of questions and then posed for photos. You can't take your own photos though, you have to buy the ones they take.

Music Fanatic. I traveled here last year (2015), and this wasn't a stop I was typically excited about. I came to New York for a Choir trip and of course we did everything that was related to music, but I had no idea what the Radio City Music Hall was about. It was interesting seeing all of the exhibits they had displayed, hearing all of the musicians/performers/artists that had performed there, seeing the huge stage, the tour of the entire place, and even meeting some of the Rocketts. Such a fun experience.
Famous building. Let's say this, it's a landmark and a famous building, but to me it didn't have that magical feeling. I'm not a radio-freak so this didn't do much for me, but hey, that's me
Great old movie, much history and the Rocketts. An old and wonderful theater. Everyone should enjoy it just for the architecture, and the wonderful Rockett dancers. Not your typical movie theater.

a great place to see a show. Another wonderful NYC landmark. Wonderful to see a show here. Such a great venue. I saw a CIrque du Soleil show here some years ago and it was one of the best. No complaints at all.

Meh. The reason I am saying "meh" is because we got a great view of the bathroom. We were not allowed near the grand auditorium because of Batman and Superman. Whatever. We got to see the bathroom -- enough said.

Step back into the old elegant era. Wonderful tours of this magnificent old lady of the movie palace/live theatre era. Unparalleled art-deco architecture and art work in this huge building. The electronics and hydraulics done in the 1930's are so great that they did not touch them during the renovation.

Christmas Spectacular. Loved every minute! A beautiful venue - awe-inspiring theatre. The show was wonderful. Queue was not too bad, all things considered. Staff were friendly and helpful. Souvenirs were very pricey but drink prices were fair. If you are in New York for the holidays, this has to be at the top of your list.

A special place... Of course the shows are wonderful but the theatre itself is spectacular. I don't know if they still do tours of the building but I still remember that tour from 60 years ago. They tell you the weight of the curtains and the size of the organs, but what I remember most is that during WWII they discontinued them because the machinery used on the stage was the same as used on aircraft carriers of the day and that was considered top secret.
the only place you can still find Christmas!!!. I always go to the Xmas Show with the Rockets, it's the start of my holiday season, wonderful show for everyone!!!

Go Any Time.. Back at Radio City for the Christmas Show this time. First time for my partner. We has a fabulous time with free Santa hat,3D specs and loaded with a popcorn bucket and 2 glasses of wine from the bar we were set for good night that was even better than we expected. The show is worth every $ paid and the staff on the sales desks very friendly and helpful. The added bonus is Radio City itself, decorated for the holiday season and the original deco design it was a delight to have a look around.

Nice as an alternative to broadway. We didn't actually get to see a show here but there was a big que for one when we got there. We had to make do with just a look at the foyer and outside of the building with its iconic name in lights. Impressive!

GREAT Deco Theater. Radio City has the magic of the Deco era, it is so well preserved and beautiful you will not be disappointed. You can not actually imagine public spaces were once this well thought out and spacious, comfortable and always well planed. The Christmas show is good, but a bit cheesy,though great for children. It is better to go when they have a performance by a group or singer you are really interested in, then it will be unforgettable.

Go see the Rockettes & the Christmas Show if you are visting around Christmas. Very famous (& vast) theatre famous for the Rockettes and the Christmas show. Lovely building which is faithfully restored.

Go see the Rockettes. While in NY we were luck enough to go and see the christmas show The Rockets. If you are in NY over the holiday period go and see them. The tickets are not outrageously expensive and the performance is great. All those Christmas carols we all know and love and the choreography and synchronization is amazing. Definately worth a visit and it gets you into the Christmas spirit.

Great history of entertainment. Close to Rockefeller Center with great Art Deco interior design Radio City is another great NYC landmark which I will strongly suggest you visit in your trip to Big Apple Sits about 6000 with the biggest pipe organ designed for movie theatre. Not too many people know that system of elevators was so advanced at the time that US Navy used the blueprint for hydraulics when they build their aircraft carriers during World War IIYoursAK

Great alternative to Broadway . We saw the Spring spectacular here last March. My girlfriend had really wanted to see a show on Broadway but we'd left it too late. I wasn't too bothered, but suggested this show and maybe more impressively for me anyway, this venue. Anyway, long story cut short, really impressive venue with so much history, a good, enjoyable, even for me show, and the famous Rockettes of course! We'll definite go again next time we're in the big apple!
Batman v Superman World Premier. Not allowed to mention the film, but it was good. What an iconic venue. Glorious old world charm. So glad we got to come in here and see the decor, wonderful.
Iconic. Beautiful theater in the center of it all. We have seen several shows here and loved them all. Seats are comfortable.
Great. It looks like it does on the Television. I visited many years ago and it hasn't really changed since. Well worth a visit.

Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular Show. This is one Christmas show not too be missed. It had 3D effects for part of the show, digital screens and so many Santas! Plus it also features The Rockettes and what's not to like about that!?!
Nice theater in NYC. My parents and I went to see the Christmas Spectacular Show and Rockettes were amazing. The seats were a little bit uncomfortable and small but it was worth seeing the show.

Beautiful theater & the Rockettes!. The theater itself is lovely, and we saw the Christmas Spectacular with the famous Rockettes. A must-see if visiting NYC around the holidays, and great for children.

The biggest stage I've ever seen!. I went to see my aunt sing there, I was in a back row and she looked like an ant. I've never been overwhelmed at the size of a stage before. Wow It's fantastic! Go see a show there. You won't be disappointed. Especaily if it's a holiday show,

Amazing show. Been there during the Christmas period to watch the Christmas Spectacular show. It was great and the kids (ranging from teens to a 4 year old) truly enjoyed it. Book early to get good seats at the best prices.
Legendary. A trip to midtown would be incomplete without checking out Radio City. The history of this place is wonderful!

A bit of nostalgia in the city!. Who can't say that Radio City is not a bit of nostalgia for NYC? I love th exterior of the building and more so the interior of the building is historic. Must see the Rockettes at Christmas time.

Radio City Christmas Spectacular. I didn't do the tour, we went to see the Christmas show and wouldn't hesitate to go again. I don't have kids, I'm in my 40's, I no longer feel any Christmas spirit - BUT this show had me teary eyed. It brought back the joy of Christmas. Great show, dancers, scenery - spectacular!

Another Must See While in NY. Certainly not one of my favorite places we experienced in NYC, but still one of those places you have to at least see while you're there. An important part of NYC history.

The real home of the NFL draft. I never went inside but i popped by a couple of times during my stay. For any football fan this is the real home of the NFL draft, knowing all of the amazing players that have been drafted here, its a must stop by for a football fan!
X'mas show amreican style. we went to see the christmas show in the RCMH and it was a nice experience. i believe if you have seen it once it is good enough.
You cant miss it. Going to the Radio City Music Hall is awesome especially at night when the lights are bright. Jimmy Fallon did a tonight show while we were there, the stars are about in NYC!

Best place ever to see a concert. Took my daughter and her friend to the Shawn Mendes concert and the venue is by far the most eloquent place to see a concert I have ever been too. The process to get in was very smooth and the ushers were very helpful and super cool to talk too.
WOW - New York City Here We Come!. Christmas or Spring shows are both fantastic thanks o amazing correography and the Rockettes! Like jo other show anywhere - don't miss it!

Must see if you are visiting NYC. This has been a "destination" for NYC visitors for many years. It is the home of the fabulous Rockettes dancers, especially the Christmas spectacular which is an incredible show. Don't miss it!

Great for all the family. We queued for these tickets on the day and got 3rd row seats. The show itself was great fumn. There were lots of families there and the kis will have aa great time. The effects and the dancing and singing are just brilliant

If you don't look for it, you could miss it!. I wanted to see this as it is iconic, however you could definitely miss it. Although it is near a lot of things, we were walking around in circles trying to find this one night and gave up and ended up coming here on accident the next day! Glad we saw it but wish we had of spent less time lost the day before looking for it!It's cute for a photo, we didn't go in but it's just like any photograph in the movies - colourful and fun!
Wonderful. One of the great art deco places in the world. A beautiful theater that has to be seen and experienced.

Radio City Christmas SPECTACULAR!!!. I have always wanted to see the Rockettes at Radio City Music Hall. My husband and I got orchestra seats through Groupon and we were not disappointed. The costumes, the sets, the music, Santa, the actors, everything about the show was awe-inspiring. It is amazing how the Rockettes are in perfect unison during the Parade of the Wooden Soldiers and, of course, their synchronized high kicks which they are known for. This show is for children and adults alike. The lobby is beautifully decorated for the season. If you are in NYC during the Christmas season, this is a show you cannot miss. It is truly unforgettable.

A great Christmas Show!. We enjoyed the annual Christmas Show this past December .............have not been there in years but a must see for all ages. This is a NYC Christmas tradition and it is truly a spectacular presentation. Get your tickets early so you can get the seats you want .

Christmas Spectacular. If your in New York you got to go. Excellent!Lineups can be long so try and book your tickets ahead for it. If you do decide to buy your tickets while there, have a look around Times Square or anywhere in the downtown area. We got 50% off the box price with a coupon handed out by some of the Rockettes staff in Times Square. We tried the "discount" show tickets places but they were charging outrageous prices by comparison. If you have kids and are there in late Nov, December. TAKE THEM!!!
old hotel. This is an old hotel, but a veryhandy position for all NY attractions, and clean, and replenished every day
Lovely historic home of the Rockettes. Lovely design, very appealing to the eye. Seats are comfy and offer good view no matter where. Great to see a concert or show here.

Christmas Spectacular. What a show, so glad we chose this venue on Broadway to see a show stunning building seeped in history, what a show absolutely fantastic the Rockettes were awe inspiring well done worth going would go again.
We found Christmas in Radio City!. Really great show, well put together and fun for everyone. You should give it a whirl, and really take in the building itself, very impressive throughout!
Good to see. We visited here just to recreate the scene from Home Alone 2 for a movie photo challenge! It was good to see from the exterior. I think they offer tours but we didn't have the time.

go for the Christmas Show!. a fun delight for the whole family - such a wonderful way to put everyone in the holiday spirit. The chorus line is amazing, and definitely on our bucketlist to spend Christmas in NYC! - Absolutely GO!!

A great show! I love to see it over and over. It always puts me in a happy mood.. Every other year I try to see the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Show. The Rockettes are amazing, and the venue itself is great. Though I prefer to sit in the orchestra, I have sat in the mezzanine and enjoyed the show just as much. It's a beautiful theatre and in spite of how large it is, it is well-organized. It can be tough to get a drink or food when it's jammed, but other than that, great experience!

Amazing. i went to radio city to see Rockettes show named "Spring Spectacular". And the experience was just amazing. The hall is quite big and colorful from inside and you actually get a unique view from the top floor when you look at the entrance. The show itself was quite enjoyable

Holiday season extravaganza.. In NYC for the Winter Holiday season; Radio City a spectacular attraction. Other times it's great if you are a movie fan of the 40s-50s and want to experience it first hand.
One of a kind.. I actually visited quite often since I work within walking distance from RC. Enjoyed taking my children when they were small to see the shows. Them rockets can rock.
Awesome. We went to see the Impractical Jokers. What a show and what a venue both inside and out. Seats were spacious and comfortable. A good venue for any show.
Rocketed Christmas Spectacular. it was great to visit this iconic theatre... Totally impressive, we booked to see the Rockettes, what a show. Loved the Christmas tree chandelier
Christmas Spectacular. This show was really amazing, the visual effects were truly spectacular. A very slick and impressive show.
Rockettes rock.. When to the Radio City Music hall Rockettes Christmas show and really enjoyed it we were in the balcony but seating was excellent.

You Must GO. Love the Christmas Spectacular and any other special performance we attend here. The beauty of this space as an Art Deco monument is so extraordinary that any excuse to go is a good one! The Rockettes are extraordinary as are the mighty organs on either side of the stage,

A must at christmas. I went Christmas 2011 it's the only time I have been and I'm so glad I did the Christmas extravaganza is a must do a real bucket list experience I have been to NYC MANY TIMES I'm here now while writing this review

Very interesting tour. We happened upon this stage door tour accidentally and were pleasantly surprised by what we learned. It was a fascinating tour. Very informative and really interesting. Lots of history and beautiful decor. Well worth a visit if you have a spare 75 minutes to do the tour. The tour guide was great also- she had a wonderful way about her. Well done!

American Theatrical Treasure. Every time I get the opportunity to go to Radio City Music Hall I am completely wowed all over again! What an amazing example of art deco over the top glitz and glamour right out of the early 1930s. The Christmas show with the Rockettes is truly a sight you will never forget. Some of their choreography has remained exactly the same since it's opening performance in 1932. That is real history coming alive for you right along with the 2 massive pipe organs, the fabulous orchestra that rises up and out of the orchestra pit and a dazzling array of live camels, sheep and the entire cast in a fantastic Christmas tableau. When you visit New York, you must see this jewel of a theatre.
LOVE LOVE the CHRISTMAS SHOW. We take the kids every year and we all love it!! We go in November to kick off the holiday season. It always puts us in a festive mood.

Great example of Art Deco. well worth visiting to see a show or do the back stage tour OR do both! fantastic building with a lot of history of the entertainment world set in a superb art deco environment.
One of the good places in new York to visit . One of the good places has sentimental value for me as I had my graduation ceremony there Its definitely worth a visit!

Love the decor, great art deco feel, still one of the best music halls. Even from the outside this place is still impressive and awe-inspiring. Go inside and there's another level of beauty and detail that you have to see to appreciate. The amount of history and number of famous people that have walked thru can almost be felt. Definitely worth at least a 30 min trip to visit the place, and if you can catch a performance, even better.
Impressive show. I was very impressed with the Radio City Rockettes Christmas show. The production was the best I have seen there. I was pleased I did not pass this up.

It's like a tar dis. We visited Radio City Hall while in the city on holiday, and it's like a tardis it just opens up and wow it's very impressive, the tour was great and very informative and we had our photo taken with one of the famous " Rocketts" This place is well worth a visit.

Very cool must do once at Christmas!. The theatre is beautiful and the dancing and customs make for a fun treat but honestly there is so much talent on Broadway I would not do this more than once....I would go to the theatre for that special treat!
Christmas Rockette Show. Was not sure what to expect but wow what a great show. My 12 year old granddaughter was thrilled with the performances . Very much worth the time and cost of tickets.

A one time event. It is definitely worth going to see the Rockettes perform during christmas time at least once in your life. It truly is a lovely spectacle, but it is quite repetitive after that. This pertains more to the performance than the location. The venue is very vibrant and has some good staff and others who are rough and rude.
Great place. What a great place to visit when your in New York. Iconic building from the outside and once your inside it just keeps getting better.

Take the Tour. We took the VIP trip around the iconic Radio City Music Hall. So glad we did! We were able to go up on the main stage and behind the scenes to see the hydraulics for stage operation. We also toured the Rockettes rehearsal studios and even met a real Rockette. The building is so beautiful and the history is really interesting. A recommended tour!!

Excellent Tour. We took part in the Radio City backstage tour. Our guide (Alvin) was informative, knowledgeable, polite and couteous. The tour itself takes you into the iconic theatre, behind the scenes, under the stage, to the top floor. The beautiful theatre is a true masterpiece. As part of the tour we also got to meet on of the famous Rockettes in a Q&A session.A wonderful experience that I am glad I took part in.

Don't miss the Christmas Spectacular show, the essence of Radio City. Overtime I visit NYC doing the Christmas Holiday I make sure I buy a ticket for their Christmas Spectacular show that together with the great acoustic they have in Radio City Music Hall is a must.The theater itself is a show in itself with the red velvet upholstery and the entrance chandelier

Essential Christmas time viewing. If in NY at Christmas time a visit to Radio City to see the iconic Rockettes is an absolute must! Great show for the whole family. Didn't really need to see it again this year as it doesn't really change, however, there we were ... for our third visit over the past six years. I still enjoyed the experience.
Beautiful Building. This is a must do. The building inside is beautiful and the tour guide had amazing knowledge of the building. Would definitely recommend it to anyone.
love it. What a beautiful place to visit it's like stepping back in time to the 1930s with its amazing décor Tour guide was brilliant for information

Surprise Christmas Gift. This brought tears to my eyes! My son and his wife bought us tickets to see The Rockettes Christmas show. This was on my bucket list and the show is awesome! Got to see it on my first trip to NY thanks to my son & his lovely wife. It was so worth it and a must see.
Iconic space worth a look. Attended multiple events here for decades. Space is beautiful and comfortable. Sound quality surprisingly good for the size of theater.

Step back in time! Magical place!. Once you walk in, you feel like you have stepped back in time. Beautiful architecture, stunning light fixtures, powerful acoustics. Even the women's bathroom was beautiful! Whatever you can see here, take it in! Make sure you visit on your next trip to NYC.
Fantastic back stage tour. Our guide Michael was great. Well balanced tour in term of walk, sir, break, video. History and background well explained. I highly recommend this 1hr15 min tour.
MUST VISIT. If in NYC this is a must stop! It's still as lovely as ever and it has so much history of NYC. We took photos under the sign and they came out great.

Great venue, great show. You can't beat the Rockettes Christmas show. I've been here about 4 times and have loved it every time. The venue is historic, quaint and has great acoustics. The staff are friendly and I've never left disappointed by a show.

Great Rockettes Show. We managed to secure decent seats for the same night, about a couple of hours before the Christmas Spectacular show opened. The theatre itself is amazing and so beautiful. The Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes was a perfect start to our Christmas in New York. It's a show for all the family to enjoy and you could also meet Santa and The Rockettes before the show.

Only in New York. The Christmas Spectacular is always a highlight for families in the New York metropolitan area. The show is over-the-top choreography (the Rockettes are outstanding) and use of technology (3D glasses this year)--even the 18-month old loved it!

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. We had a great time. The 3-d show was more than we could have imagined.We had my husbands Service Dog and we were put way at the very last row, up at the top. My husband is a Disabled 3x Iraqi Veteran and when we CALLED for our reservations, we were told that we were going to be put in HANDICAPPED SEATS. My husband has knee braces on both knees and it is so very hard for him to get up, sit down, get up, sit down, not to mention we had to SQEEZE Barrette his Dog in front of him.He was un the first seat of the isle, but it was a regular seat marked "Handicapped". I'm not sure how any wheelchair bound person would have fit. It was horrible fitting. His knees hurt that night and next day because he was not able to stretch out.Thank goodness there was an elevator but, squishing my husband and his dog in a little space was not a very pleasant experience.We experienced very rude people while there. Not sure if its the Manhattan society or Radio City Music Hall patrons, but before the show, we purchased a few items and a drink and while attempting to get to the elevator people would not move for my husband. The worst was a very snody, wealthy women and her daughter standing in the middle of the lobby. The daughter was taking lots of selfies and I politely said "Excuse me" as to make way for my husband and service dog. She saw both of them, looked at me and so very rudely said "NO". I told her she was rude, went by her and went to the elevator. This was vefore our show. I could not believe what we started with, then our seats. More happened, but very trivial. We will never go back to see a show while in NY or advise family or friends that live there to go.Rockettes were great!!!
Fantastic!!. Great value for money!! Amazing theatre great to see backstage and learn so many facts!! Our tour guide was fantastic!! Would definitely recommend for all 'theatre goers'
Best Christmas Spectacular. Don't miss this Show if you are there in December. The best the City has to offer. We go again and again if we are there for Christmas Shopping

A must!. We went to the 75th anniversary show a few years back and had a blast. It actually snowed in Radio City Music Hall! It's worth to pay a little more and sit closer, the show is a lot of fun. I'd do it again in a few years. Im not big on this kind of stuff but this was great. Recommended, for sure.
Great place! . Unfortunately didn't get to go inside, we just passed through it for a couple of times but God it felt like a dream. Next time i'm in NYC i'll spend more time visiting this place.

Daughter loved the tour. We did the backstage tour, and found it very informative and interesting....My daughter is in high school, performing in plays, and loved the tour....I'm an architect, and found the tour interesting, but did not knock my socks off...If you have time its worth doing, but I did the Lincoln Center Tour in November and if I had time to do only one, I would choose that tour as you see multiple buildings.
A must at Christmas. The building inside is spectacular the entrance especially! We went to see the Christmas Rockettes show and was not disappointed amazing show!
10PM CHRISTMAS SHOW WITH THE ROCKETS. The show was spectacular as usual, but MUCH SHORTER than the many times I have attended before.......
The Best Music Hall in the World. I love everything about this place but for the entry ushers. There uniforms do not live up to the class of the place and their customer service is very poor.

Rockettes!. A dream come true! Watching a live show of the rockettes certainly puts the New York experience up to the highest of expectations! It's a well worth visit to Radio City Music Hall and seeing the Rockettes Christmas Show is just the cherry on top!

A must visit especially for the Christmas Special Rockets show. A must see when in NYC at Christmas time you must visit Radio City Music Hall for the Rockets Christmas Show. It is absolutely excellent.
Never get tired of this place. This place is history. You go in there and see the chandeliers and the layout and know that there is no place like Radio City Music Hall

Christmas Show as a gift. I took my grand kids to the Radio City Music Hall Christmas sow. The two kids were entertain and enjoyed the show .Behave through out the show. It is amazing and worth the money for 3&5 to enjoy it. WE are lucky to be treated to backstage tour by my daughters friend. The children played with aninal the donkey and say hello to the Ballet de Tour. The two kids are taking ballet lessons at Capezio Dance studio LES.

Take the backstage tour if you love art deco. What an amazing building!. To think that this theater was to be torn down. Take the tour! Art deco is absolutely beautiful! You will walk out with a new, deeper appreciation for this landmark music hall.
Magical Show. If you are a fan of Christmas you will absolutely love this show from beginning to end, in particular the 3d sleigh ride over New York eventually arriving at Radio City Music Hall.

Much more than you think from the outside.... This is a magical place which has been painstakingly kept as it was when it was built in 1932. Of all the "attractions" I visited in NYC, this had the most style. What an interior! And a really charming guide who took us slightly off the beaten track as there were so few of us on the tour. Well worth the ticket price, especially if you have an interest in Art Deco, architecture, design or theatre.
The Rockettes & The Christmas Spectacular IS just that!!!!. Just perfect in all aspects! The theater itself is breathtaking, the live music, the show, the people, just a must do for all ages! Go!

Great show at a great venue!. My boyfriend had bought me tickets to see The Impractical Jokers at Radio City Music Hall. This was the first time either of us had been here, too. We can't wait to go back again. The show we went to see sold out, which is 5k people. Considering the amount of people exiting, the crowd moved smoothly. There wasn't any annoying elbow to elbow jams. The ushers and all staff were extremely helpful and knowledgeable when we had questions about tickets, shows, seating, etc. Being a frequent concert go-er myself, I truly appreciated how fast they processed security checks at the entrance. Overall, we had a great time and loved Radio City. The history behind it made it a little extra special, too. We hope to come back to see the famous Christmas Spectacular. It's the perfect place for a date or a family trip!

Christmas Rockettes show. I took my girls along to this iconic show, I don't think they've ever forgiven me. It was cheesy and overpriced. But visiting the music hall was worth every penny, and it was Christmas so whats not to love. Warning: these shows are busy, get there early and work out what line you need to get in. It was chaos.

The Christmas Spectacular. This year was my first time going to Radio City Music Hall. I really like the performance. I got a chance to see the Rockettes for the first time, and they did an excellent job. My favorite scene was the Santa Clause dancing. I hand a great time.
Great Shows super price!. I went here for the Christmas Spectacular! Amazing show!! Been twice!! But don't get thirsty or prepare to pay $20.00 for soda! lol

Rockettes!. We were there for the Christmas show and it is something that I thought I wouldn't care for. But I went to see Manhattan and hang out a bit. The show blew me away! The Rockettes are truly amazing and the theater is beautiful. It's a big time place with big time shows.

Wonderful place to see a show.. We loved Radio City Music Hall. We saw the Impractical Jokers on their tour here. I loved the old charm to the place. We sat in the 1st Mezzanine and the view was great. I looked around and to me, it looks like all of the seats are great. I would love to see another show here. Highly recommended.

The Christmas Show is not to be missed. We hadn't been to Radio City in many years. Found a discount code and purchased tickets for about 50% off in the Orchestra section. The theater was clean and comfortable. The show was outstanding and utilizes modern technology to engage the audience; appealing to all ages. The ushers were helpful with seating and answering any questions. The souvenirs are expensive but very nice. Be prepared to wait outside to enter (in long lines that move quickly) even if you have pre-paid tickets; but they are very efficient in getting people inside. We highly recommend catching a show here - especially the Christmas show. Look for discount codes and buy early to ensure you get the seats you want.

Spectacular Christmas Spectacular!. Took our entire family (10) people to see the show. It was AMAZING. Ages 4 to 74 were glued to the show. Kids especially loved "Riding in Santa's sled" in 3D and the "Bus tour through Central Park" all the places we just visited. Everyone loved it - even the crabby teenagers. We'll be back!
Wonderful staff. My husband has a disability and staff went the extra mile to be helpful as well as getting us great seats for a same-day showMakes me want to go there again. Thank you everyone

The ROCKETTES were amazing!. I had seen the Radio City Christmas Spectacular, and it was the best multimedia show I've seen in my life! With a crazy blend of music, comedy, dance, light/tech, I was on the edge of my seat the whole time! As for the music hall itself, it truly lives up to its history of glamorousness! The washrooms themselves had sitting rooms to relax in!

The Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular was the Best. We visited during Christmas and got tickets to see the Christmas Spectacular and it was amazing. My wife and I thought it would be great to bring the kids and it was sort of a "touristy" thing to do, but the show knocked our socks off. We would have gone to see it again if we had time. The show, the props, the Santa, the Rockettes were all amazing. This is a must see show if you are in New York anytime around Christmas.

Out of this world. Absolutely fab show. It was our first visit to see the Rockettes and we were not disappointed. It was out of this world and the 3D effect of Santa was awesome. Everybody needs to visit the show once in their lifetime. They even used real animals. A real family show .

Rockettes. Saw the Christmas spectacular a week before Christmas during our 4 day NYC trip. It was always our intention to try and get tickets, got given a flyer in Times Sq on Monday evening, went over to book, got a fantastic discount for 2 good seats on Friday morning. Cost us half of what we planned. Show as outstanding and well worth seeing.

Amazing Christmas Spectacular. We saw the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City and it was amazing. Definitely a must see if you're in NYC over the Christmas period. The price was very reasonable and we'd absolutely go next time in NYC.

Christmas Spectacular was Fantastic. The Rockettes show was even better than a few years ago when we visited. Radio City Music Hall is very comfortable venue even with the extremely busy holiday crowds,

Excellent Christmas Show. We went to see the Christmas show the week before Christmas. We actually went to the 10:30 PM show as it was more reasonable. Very impressed by the show. I hadn't seen it in about 10 years. Some of the parts of the show I believe they always include but there are new parts each year. It was very enjoyable and would definitely recommend it. The theater itself is beautiful I had taken a behind the stage tour here a couple of years ago that was really informative, and we got to talk to one of the Rockettes.

Not a patch on the moulin roug!. Not overly bothered. From teenagers to adults I'm not quite sure who thought it more than average. There is some good stuff and it was lovely and Christmassy but I guess it was just middle of the road safe entertainment.
Awesome show. The Rockettes show is pretty awesome, I took my teen age kids for the first time and they Enjoyed very much....

Christmas Spectacular. We saw the Christmas Spectacular during our visit to New York for the Macys Thanksgiving parade. The theater is beautiful and they are extremely organized and I appreciate their security measures (by checking everyone's bags/personal belongings). Show was EXCELLENT!!!!

What a fantastic way to spend Christmas Eve. Being such a huge lover of anything to do with Christmas, I booked tickets for my husband and I to go and see the Christmas Spectacular show.Wow, it was wonderful. We had great seats and what an amazing venue. The Rockettes were fantastic and the show was very special, particularly on Christmas Eve.Would definitely recommend it.

Art Deco Beauty. This is a wonderful theatre with so many original elements. If you have not seen the Rockettes do their Christmas Spectacular, you must! The behind the scenes tour is great, you see retired costumes, private residence, and you get to meet a Rockette!
Christmas show brilliant!. A packed house. The queue to get inside was not pleasant and the security persons were rather rude. The show was fantastic and the Rockettes were wonderful

Must see. It's not far from some other iconic buildings in New York and right on the doorstep of the Rockefeller Centre
Must see and only given 4 stars as we didn't have a lot of time to visit /tour the venue (just not enough time to tour everything we visited during our short trip to New York)

The Christmas Extravaganza. Great to visit this iconic venue. We saw the Christmas Extravaganza, which whilst isn't really our thing, it was great to experience a show that has been going nearly 90 years.
Christmas Spectacular. Worth every penny...makes Christmas even more special. My 11yr was beyond happy be did not make a sound or a move until the show was over. Next year we will be there again

Xmas spectacular. A nice family tradition, especially for family with young children. The chandelier is grande. The ladies room is hands down the grandest you can imagine with three distinct sections/ functions.
Great Christmas Special. Always wanted to see something here and we saw the Christmas Special, great venue. The Rocketts are amazing.

Spectacular. A friend recommended the Rockettes Christmas Extravaganza and we were amazed. Beyond our expectations. The entertainment is non-stop. Our family group consisted of ages 67 to 11 and we all enjoyed it so much.
Outside View. I just wanted to see it in the flesh as it's been so famous for many reasons, mainly as a concert venue to people in the UK

Christmas Spectacular was spectacular!. We took our 13 and 14 year old sons to the Christmas Spectacular show. The boys were thoroughly enthralled! It was their first big city show given that we live in NW FL. The theater was beautiful. The ushers were friendly. The only drawback was the lengthy wait in line to get in. Overall I loved the show, theater and venue and would highly recommend it to others!

SUCH HISTORY. Radio City Music Hall will always be an iconic landmark for NYC. Rich in history.... Tons of fun shows...
