I work in the entertainment industry and love both working shows there and going to see shows there. The Rockettes Christmas Show is a must see for anyone who hasn't been there yet.

History, Cultures and Rockettes. What a beautiful grand old house!We took the tour and it's totally worth it! $32The behind the scenes walking tour has you walking up and down the back isles of this wonderful music hall. The history about this old movie theater and sights had me in awe. We were even able to meet a Rockett. Just a note: when you take a picture with a Rockettes they cost $30. It's your choice to purchase them.

Christmas Spectactular, reccomended.. When my children were small, I loved taking them to the Radio City Christmas Spectacular. Now that they are in their 20's, I treated my son, 23 and his girlfriend, who is from upstate and never had the opportunity to see the show as a child; also an adult friend of mine joined us, she grew up in Columbia, and at 54, this was her first Christmas Spectacular. The performance was enjoyed by all!

Radio City Tour. Rockette fan in our group so we did the tour. Very informative and impressed with history and appreciated the decor. Stage engineering interesting as well. We got to meet a Rockette and take a pic as well as ask questions.

Great Concert Hall. I've seen some of the best music concerts here. The sound is fantastic and the beauty of this venue is unparalleled. I've also seen the Radio City Christmas Show which is a must for most tourists with children during the holiday season.

Timeless. Time stands still when you walk through the outer doors into the lobby of Radio City Music Hall. The grand chandelier in the lobby is breathtaking and the double organs on either side of the stage evoke thoughts of vaudeville and classic theatre. Of course the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Show with the Rocketts Is always wonderful. A little different than when I was young with a lot more technology but the dancing is still marvelous.
Radio City Rockettes don't disappoint. We saw the Christmas Spectacular. Got tickets last minute. great show, lots of kids and families. Pretty amazing

Loved the Rockettes at the Christmas show, beautiful setting. We saw the Rockettes for the first time in December for their Christmas show. Loved the scenes, the music, the dancing. I thought it was great, although it is truly a Christmas show (no attempt to be PC). I would recommend it highly. Also, the Hall was beautiful, and I would like to come back for something else.
Beautiful!. Went to the Christmas spectacular, and it was a fanastic show. I was so impressed by the décor and architecture in the building itself.

Radio City Music Hall. Located in the best place in the city, easy to get to (not by car though). Well decorated. However, acoustics and the view from most of he seating not great. Went there to enjoy various performances: from singer, comedian and circus, was disappointed because of those issues. Especially considering how expensive tixs are.

Back Stage Tour the BOMB!!. Fantastic walking tour lasting about an hour and a half. Going back stage, under stage and around the venue was a delight. Well worth the small price especially if you have ever gone here to watch a show.

A great step back in time. A great visit for all people who enjoy the entertainment world you get to meet one of the famous rocketts you don't get to see much of the behind the scenes but very interesting

The Radio City Music Hall is a delight. The building is stunning and The Rockettes!!!!. The Radio City Music Hall has always been an exciting place to see, whether it's just to tour the building or see The Rockettes or a Disney on Ice show or anything else. It is so exciting a d so beautiful. There is a pulse of excitement there all the time.

Christmas show is a classic. We went on New Year's Day - 4 moms plus 4 girls aged 19-23 Everyone enjoyed it. It was only 1 1/2 hours so not a big time investment but I'm glad we made time to see it. I still remembered parts of the show from when I was 10 years old!
Rockettes at Christmas Time!. What could be better than to be in New York City at Christmas Time and seeing the Rockette's at Radio City Music Hall! Just Do It!

Radio City - A NYC Classic. My family and I had the great pleasure of seeing the Rockettes perform in the Christmas show this year. The costumes, the singing, the dancing -- an absolute delight. If you have the chance, DO check this one off your bucket list. It's pure enjoyment.
Rockettes. Must see show especially at christmas the best new york tradition. Fabulous show a must see for families
You MUST experience this while in NYC. This Venue is awesome. You should try to catch a concert or a show @ Radio City. The acoustics are like no other. IT is just an amazing experience .

Must See Christmas Spectacular. A must see… It will bring a smile to anyone, even the Grinch. Theater’s huge and impressive how they have 4+ shows a day! 1.5 hour long show flew bye… didn’t hear a single child cry or fuss. Just added to my family’s annual xmas event. A++

So slick!!!. We went to the Christmas Show by the Rockettes. It was BRILLIANT!!! Never seen TWO Wurlitzers in action before! The singing and dancing were amazing. $10 for a Coca Cola was rather excessive but you were able to take drinks into the theatre. I would definitely recommend this show - we all LOVED it. We had flown in on a night flight from Buenos Aires and were worried we might fall asleep at the 2pm show. NO chance....it was enthralling. Fantastic.

Fun show!. My mom and I went right before Christmas and saw the Christmas Spectacular. I've always wanted to see the Rockettes. It was a fun and entertaining show with singing, dancing, acting and great sets. I'd go again! Great show for adults and kids.

Magnificent and so SPECIAL. There is nothing like Radio City Music Hall and the Christmas Spectacular is so unique by itself. We go every few years and just love Manhattan and the theater. Radio City is a must see.

There is a word for this amusement wonderful. Went to see the Christmas spectacular , I have seen it many times! This time it was different because they use the newest technology ! 3D inclusive! The Rockets are incredible! I found it a "very must see show! " All the Radio City Mysic Hall shows are great! I found this one a bit long! The perfection on the execution of the Rickets Tap dance as I said, great! Shorter will be better I think! But if you go to New York, don't miss one of their shows! Prices are not low but .....make an effort and go!
Show.. Crowded with outsiders wanting to say:- I have been there.Show all right, some glamour, action, less intellectual stimulation.
Very popular place and elegant. I went to the Radio City Hall to watch the rocketts and this place it was really nice and pretty....

Rockettes . Took the back stage tour and watched the Rockettes Christmas Show. We all loved the show. I could go watch it every year. Our tickets were booked by our hotel and they were awesome. We were very close. This is a don't miss experience.

Amazing Christmas Spectacular. The Christmas Spectacular is worth every penny. I was thrilled to share the experience this year with my children and my husband. The story line, the dancers, the routines, and the costumes were fantastic. What really warmed my heart and really moved me was the nativity scene at the end! The procession of characters and the live animals were amazing. The costumes were so beautiful they all looked like kings and queens. Can't wait to see it again.

Christmas Spectacular didn't disappoint.. We visited to see the Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes. The whole show was fantastic and we particularly enjoyed the Toy Soldiers and Nativity, complete with live camels, sheep and a donkey. It really got us in the Christmas spirit.
Amazing venue. Awesome holds 6600 people saw the rockettes Xmas show ok great dance troop however story line is a bit bland
Great Show. All first time visitors ought to catch a show here. The Rockettes are great entertainers and put on a wonderful show. We particularly like the Christmas show each year. Delightful.

A former Rockette LOVES Radio City Music Hall!!. I bring so many people to Radio City Music Hall to experience its beauty and great shows. I am partial to all the shows that the Rockettes are performing in since I was a former Rockette!! It has been declared a national landmark and was first opened in 1932. Geometric art deco designs are seen all over the beautiful theater.
christmas spectacular. this was so well done.I would see this again and i am older.My son 14 loved the show and seeing the auditorium too.

AMAZING!!. This was our first time here....and all I can say is the grand entrance is beautiful!! We sat in the 2nd mezzanine (sp?)...I wasn't sure what to think of the seating since I had never been there and I am completely satisfied with my choice! Our seats were great as well as our view!! Can't wait to see another show here!!
Rockettes. We saw the Rockettes which was awesome, part of it was in 3D.Our seats were great and the show couldn't be better. Definetly plan on seeing this while in the city.

The Rockettes: Really Spectacular!!!. The Rockettes show was simply amazing: great Christmas atmosphere, excellent music, very funny 3D show, superb dancers (I had never seen such a perfect synchrony and coordination before!). The location is beautiful and our seats (PP 405-408) excellent. I highly reccommend this show if you are in town during Christmas season!
The Rokettes show. Excellent show, loved it all the way through.A must during the festive period. Very popular but worth going.

RCMH:Tour and Christmas Spectacular. Visited New York near the Christmas period (2015). Our "To Do list" was pretty big but we manged to do the Radio City Music hall tour. The tour was brilliant! Our guid was exstreamly friendly and very informative and was fabulous to be surrounded by 1930s décor. We also attended the Christmas Spectacular show, the whole performance was stunning! Every enjoyable and made me want to be on stage with them. Highly recommend the tour and any of their shows as I'm sure they will blow you away! :-D

I love the Rockets so much!. It's a show that I never get tired of seeing it. Any time of the year is great. Fantastic for adults and for families as well. The dancers are incredible nothing like it. One of the best shows in NYC for sure.

TOUR IS EXCELLENT!. Art Deco at its finest!!! We took the tour and it was wonderful. We arrived a couple of minutes past our ticket time, but they kindly caught us up to speed and welcomed us. Our tour guide was so knowledgeable and easy to listen to and follow. It was one of my favorite tours ever in NYC - and we've toured a lot of places. If yours a fan of Art Deco - GO!

Still a great venue. Visited several times... the venue is a little dated but it's still a must. Try going to a popular event, they're probably most famous for the Christmas spectacular shows all December with the Rockettes.
Christmas Spectacular. This show was truly spectacular from the whimsy side of Christmas with Santa and toy soldiers to the Amazing nativity scene. Do not miss this!!!

Stepping back into history. Radio City Music Hall is one of those places where you feel like you've gone back in time. The tour was great, telling of interesting happenings and history of the building. We especially liked the info about the stage and how it works. They said when the whole place was renovated, they left the stage workings as they were, because "there was no way to improve upon the original plan…it was ingenious." The boys in our family found that fascinating. We took the tour in the summer, and went back at Christmas to watch the Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes. WE LOVED THIS SHOW. There is perfection on stage when the Rockettes are performing. Nothing like it in the world! Fun for men, women, boys and girls….you should try to get seats close enough to feel like a part of it, but far enough back to see the precision and choreography. The Rockettes are always together! We sat in the middle of Orchestra section, about Row R, and we felt it was perfect.
Sadly cant rate a 6. Stunning productions. the family and I saw the Christmas spectacular........ and it was. i expect its worth a visit for any production.

Grande Dame of New York. The expanse of the theatre and low-rise makes most of the seats great. Even as a resident of NYC, this is my local concert hall...the place where my husband and I check out first before all others for shows and concerts. Treat yourself to this beautiful and historic location.

This place is amazing!!. When you walk into Radio City Music hall, you feel like you are walking back in time. We loved our visit here! We saw the Rockettes Christmas show. (Which was amazing!) It was a wonderful experience to visit here! I would highly recommend to any New York Visitor! I wish we would have done the behind the scene tour. For sure, will do this next time!
Very cool Inside!. We attended the Christmas special on Christmas Eve 2015. The show itself was awesome but the inside of Radio City is very cool to see!

Christmas Spectacular Was Truely Specatacular. I loved it that they brought the show into the 21st century by adding 3D and a great modern storyline. Unfortunately, I was highly disappointed with how filthy the carpets and seats were.
Rockettes Christmas Special. They continue to deliver an awesome performance, The finale is the best. The lines are incredibly long, and we just got seated in time. It was worth the wait.

architecture in the building is just glorious. when you enter the building it seems like you enter into a different time period. Roam around the 3 floors before going to your seat. It is so worth it. The rockette Christmas show is really well done and you usually can get discount tickets throughout the season. We went this year on January 3rd and went right to the ticket counter for tickets. We got discount tickets in mezzanine which was fine and we all could see. However as I looked down into the orchestra it was totally emptyI have hard time with the fact that the entire first mezzanine was completely full and orchestra empty. Why could we not get tickets in the orchestra at discount prices if there were obviously 15-20 rows that could of been filled?Bad part on management.Putting that aside, you must see the Christmas show once in your lifetime.
What a fabulous venue. Great venue. Totally organised. Felt like I was stepping back in time. I think you'd be able to have a great view from any seat. We were in row P and it was amazing.

Awesome place. We went to Radio City for the first time in December to see the Christmas show. Both the venue and the show were fabulous. The minute you enter Radio City you are in awe of how big and beautiful it is. More importantly the layout of the seating and levels are perfect to see a show. Our seats were in the back of the second level of the balcony but are view was perfect.

The Christmas Spectacular was amazing. Our tickets were reasonably expensive (AUD280 for two of us) but the show was certainly spectacular. The Rockettes were amazing and their choreography was superb. Would definitely recommend this if it's within your budget.

Christmas spectacular ok, but not all that. Went there recently. It was beautiful but I expected more of it after reading about it. Yes, it's beautiful and they are very good dancers, but I felt like there was missing a story and sometimes I would almost fall sleep.

amazing experience. it was my first time seeing the christmas spectacular show with the rockettes, what an amazing experience, its really enjoyable, fun, delightful , its a must to do been in ny in this time of the year.....

A Grand Venue. I've not been here since a Bob Dylan concert in the 1980's but as a child I frequently went to a movie and a show at Radio City Music Hall. It is a grand space, as was recently confirmed by the Adele concert. If the performers that are presented today are acceptable to you this is an amazing and grand place. An optimistic and forward thinking exuberance during the hard times of the 1930's. It is worth experiencing that optimism and luxury from another time.

The Rockettes Rocked!. Just spent 6 days in NYC and the Rockettes Radio City Music Spectacular was the hilight of our trip. We met 4 New Yorkers while travelling abroad recently and when we asked them the one thing to do when travelling to NYC over Christmas, thie Rockettes was the unanimous answer! Go see this if you can - both the show and the theatre are spectacular! So much history and such great design and acoustics.

Breathtaking. I attended the Christmas Spectacular with my family in December. The show was fantastic. The Theater is beautiful. The lobby has the most amazing décor. The Chandelier is something you must see in person. The Hall is near many attractions, around the corner is Rockefeller Center and St Patrick's Cathedral.
A must do for Christmas. Went for the Rockettes Crhistams show didn't disappoint it was great really a must get tickets early sells out quickly.

Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes are always a great show!. Since I grew up in NYC, my grandparents always took me to see the live show in Radio City Music Hall. Coming back to see the Christmas Spectacular is like I am a little girl all over again!The March of the Wooden Soldiers is always a delight to see, as well as the Teddy Bear dance. Everything else seems to be new every year. There is always a long, but relatively fast moving line for the ladies' room. (They now have an attendant calling out the number of the open stalls! What a riot, but very efficient!)I brought my son to continue the tradition. Love it!
Rockettes. This was the 3rd time we saw the Rocketts. Great show always and the theater is beautiful. Would recommend
A must see when in NYC. We saw the Christmas Spectacular for the 3rd time, and it is always amazing! No trip to NYC would be complete without Radio City!
Christmas spectacular. This certainly lived up to its name fantastic night out absolutely loved it. If you are visiting around Christmas time this is a must see.
A Landmark that you must see!. Not only are the shows wonderful (and a very good value) but the building is extraordinary inside and not to be missed. Great history too!
Christmas Spectacular. Fun night/day to spend with the family. The Christmas Spectacular is a great show and never disappoints. We go every year.

Christmas Extravaganza!. I was so surprised! I had to be talked into going and have to say this was the highlight of my trip. I have been to Vegas for shows and have to tell you that this ranked right up there! I would recommend this to everyone.
Take the Tour. We were actually there during the holiday season so we got to see the Rockets Christmas Show. Fantastic.
Christmas Spectacular was Amazing!!. My wife and I saw the Christmas spectacular with the rockettes. The show was amazing and the stage was very large. Best Christmas production we've seen.

Fantastic!!!!. We saw the Christmas Spectacular and it was just that - spectacular!!! the Rockettes were dazzling, the live nativity incredible. The building itself is wonderful - that chandelier!!!!!
Staff were pleasant and helpful. This was absolutely one of the highlights of our recent visit to New York City.

Rockettes & Christmas Spectacular - LOVED IT!!!!. This is a must do it you're visiting NYC anytime near Christmas. The show is superb and passes soooo quickly because you are so immersed in it. It appealled to all ages, and truly worth the money. The theatre is beautiful and the Rockettes truly incredible. Cannot recommend it enough

Gotta See The Christmas Show At Least Once!. Radio City's Christmas Spectacular is a must see, at least once in a lifetime! The Rockettes are amazing, and the live Nativity - complete with camels and sheep - is beautiful.... and there's lots more. One great thing - there are multiple shows daily late-November thru early January, so it's easy to find a time that works. Radio City Music Hall also offers an interesting behind-the-scenes tour, particularly good when the grand stage is on the itinerary (ask - sometimes a specific show makes the stage off-limits) - and you can meet a Rockette. Pretty fun!

Radio City Music Hall. Didn't actually go in to Radio City Music Hall but walked past it several times as we were staying very nearby and we also had to go to the Rockefeller Centre on numerous occasions to change our tickets for Top of the Rock due to poor visibility and low cloud.However, all I can say is that the place has a lost of history, and people interested in its history won't be disppointed. The neon lights and Christmas decorations were very impressive.

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. AWESOME!!!. I'm typically not a fan of live theater and such, but I have to say that our trip to NYC and going to see this show was simply incredible.The theater itself is truly impressive, but the show was a whole different level. Truly amazed and impressed. I have been telling everyone I know that if they ever go to NYC at Christmas, they need to go see this show.My only disappointment was they they did not offer any current DVD of the show. We did get our Rockettes Christmas tree ornament tho.

Best tourist thing in NYC. If you're into design or music or perhaps both this is just the ticket. The art deco building is like nothing I've ever seen before, it's magnificent. It was like stepping back in time to the 1930's. I really was so surprised, i didn't expect to love it so much.

Just Awesome!. While in NY, we had to catch a show. What better than the NY Rockettes. Great show.The seats were spacious and comfortable. I'm a big guy and I had no problems. Although we did get aisle seats. We paid for the pricier tickets but that placed up way up front and in the center section which was great. The snacks were a bit pricey. Bottle of water was 5.50 which was a bit much.

Wonderful show. Typical New York Christmas atmosphere. We did this show a few days after Christmas. The crowds were huge but in typical New York fashion orderly and good humoured. We had to queue for about 40 minutes in the freezing cold before being let in the doors and were subjected to a full security check. Not sure why we were made to throw out our water but suspect it had everything to do with profiteering so we could buy a bottle inside for upwards of $6,00 and little to do with actual security but maybe I am too cynical. The show was wonderful. Great singing and dancing. Was very surprised at the overtly religious tones towards the end for a country which enshews Merry Christmas in favour of the more secular Happy Holidays! Expensive but a must see at that time of year and a wonderful overall experience

rockettes christmas. We went there to see this show. The building is amazing! The show was just as amazing! However, they had people walking up and down during the 3D show. They were definitely not organized at all!

Backstage Tour. We took the backstage tour which offers an insider's look at the legendary place. The view from the top of the massive 1.8 million cubic feet auditorium, is spectacular!The Tour offers guests a more detailed examination of the interior design throughout the building highlight by the Art Deco from the beginning of time. We meet a Rockette who answer questions gracefully.

Best Xmas show ever!. This is the 2nd time we've seen the Xmas show and it is amazing! Our 10yr old daughter loved it. The building is fantastic and has the most glorious chandeliers. The show itself is quite expensive but well with it especially to see the Rockets with their soldier routine!
AMAZING!. My husband and I traveled to NYC during December and saw the Christmas spectacular show. It was AMAZING!! Best show I have seen in NYC ever!! I highly recommend it for all ages!
Christmas spectacular. This is the most wonderful show I have seen. I have waited a long time to see this show and it was worth the wait.

A must see!. We went on a backstage tour and found it absolutely fascinating. The history, the costume areas and the stories told by the guide were amazing. The sheer beauty of the theatre itself has to be seen to be believed. This is a must do for all international visitors

Christmas Show. Ive gone several times and am never disappointed. I always find the best way to get tickets is via email. They start sending emails early November and I was lucky enough to get mine half price. Kids and adults will enjoy the show which changes a little every year. If you can get to the backstage tour, it is worth it, too. Food and drinks inside are expensive as are the souvenirs and you cannot bring your own in. But, there are plenty of places to eat nearby (including food trucks) and the tree is only a block away.
Fun Tour. We toured this legendary place. It was amazing. We enjoyed seeing the different areas of the building, meeting a Rockette, and walking on the stage. It was a lot of fun!

A must!!. You must see the Xmas show at Radio City. The music hall itself is worth seeing alone but you must see the show as well. You will not be disappointed. We booked our tickets on line from Australia and had no problems.

Fantastic Educate Tour Guides. Incredible and very well formed with great guides. I really enjoyed myself, as did my partner. I came here early to get a ticket as i went in peak session and knew it would be busy. If you are disabled it takes longer as there are stairs and if you need a lift you go a separate way and sometimes they don't wait for you to catch up.
excellent xmas show. Went to the rockets xmas show, probably one of the best xmas shows i have ever been to, it was amazing
Excellent show. We missed our show due to airport issues. The ticket office seated us for the later show!! We purchased popcorn, which was surprisingly good!

Spectacular Christmas Show!!!. Amazing show and a must see. The theater is huge and spectacular in itself. The show is amazing and we loved the santa claus portion. we were all thrilled and loved it!!!

Perennial Favorite. This classic beauty of a building is a must see, especially with the Christmas Show. The Art Deco building, dual organs, nearly perfect sight lines from most seats. And of course the Rockettes! No better performance than their annual extravaganza.

Rockettes Christmas Show. This show was affordable, close to the hotel and just fun! The 3D part was really neat - Santa throwing packages out of the sleigh into the audience! Loved it! The dancers are just amazing. Love the costumes, story, singing, everything. A perfect evening.
The Rocketts are great entertainment for all age groups.. Radio City Music Hall is a fabulous venue to see any show. We saw the Rocketts perform a fantastic Christmas show.

The Christmas Spectacular was amazing!!. I had heard about the Christmas Spectacular before, so being in New York at Christmas I jumped at the opportunity to see the show. I got a good deal as I booked the tickets 2for1 on Black Friday and got great seats in the first row on the 1st floor mezzanine.My husband and I both really enjoyed the show, the dancers were absolutely faultless and the entire show was so entertaining. The building itself is beautiful and I loved the way the projection was all over the curved ceiling. Even the entrance area is lovely with the stunning chandelier. This show was the highlight of my week long trip and if I lived in or near New York, I would be at this show every single year!!
great old theater. Saw the Christmas show, which was very fun, and if nothing else it is great to see the theatre which is great design and a piece of history. Worth checking out.

Go to the Back Stage Tour. I've been to RCMH countless times but have only done the backstage tour this past year. It was indeed interesting, fun and educational. RCMH has a special place in my heart and I would recommend going there anytime of year.

Unexpectedly Spectacular!!. I purchase tickets to see the Winter Spectacular show with my family and it was AMAZING. If you think it's just a bunch of ladies kicking up their legs you are completely wrong! I have a little background in theater and have may have a higher expectation that some. They kept you entertained throughout the entire show. The set changes were seem-less and I tried a couple time to focus on them to see how the changed them. There was even a small part in 3D! Would highly recommend.
Saw some great Jazz at this iconic landmark. If you like Jazz, this is the place to see it. You may have to stand in line for a while but it is worth the wait.

An Architectural Wonder. What a beautiful building. It has great staging and wonderful acoustics. I must say that it is bigger than I had imagined. It is a perfect venue for the Rockettes to perform. This is a must visit for any New York Traveler.

Wonderful experience. Went to the Radio City Christmas Spectacular show. Wonderful theatre with excellent viewing, even from quite far back. The show was really good and very professional. The lobby area was lovely. Everywhere clean and tidy.

Fabulous Radio City Music Hall. I have been going to see the Christmas show at Radio City Music Hall since I was a child, (a very long time ago). It is ALWAYS spectacular. It is like going to see an old friend, who you haven't seen in a long time, and it's always so special reconnecting. The Rockettes are amazing. There's always a clever storyline. The choreography, music and glitz are all fabulous. Looking forward to the new Spring show. I have heard wonderful things about that show and I plan on going this year.
Worth a Visit. Such an iconic place for music and for the city. Worth stopping by to have a look even if just in passing.

Can't do a trip to NYC without a stop at Radio City!. Whenever I visit the city I am drawn to Radio City. I have fond memories of visits throughout my childhood, so 10 years ago I took my 4 year old son to see the Christmas Spectacular. Our return this year would not have been complete without a return engagement, even though my now 14 year old was not as excited as he had been as a pre-schooler (go figure). Never-the-less it was still a great experience - the beauty and glitz of the venue itself, and the magnificence of the production all held his interest, and filled me with warm, wonderful holiday feelings. And for those of you who enjoy photography, the RC Christmas marquee is spectacular, and I got some fantastic night shots of this old Music Hall from a block away, using no flash. S do yourself a favor - go see a show. There are also backstage tours, which will be on my agenda next time we visit. Radio City is classic NY at its best.
Spring Spectacular. Honestly this is a show, I thought I could avoid. So glad we decided to see the Spring Spectacular. It was an extremely entertaining and high energy show.

Christmas Spectacular. The Christmas Spectacular was just that, spectacular.
The theater itself was wonderful, it is beautiful and comfortable and the acoustics and sight lines are excellent.
The Rockettes and their fellow performers set the standard for all shows.
It is well worth the price of admission.
Posterity. My wife took me to on a tour of Radio City and I enjoyed every moment. Great to feel connection to so many talented people. Great costumes and artifacts, much to see.
Rockette's Christmas Spectacular!. Did the Yankee Trails package deal from Latham, NY. Great show and a little time to explore the city. Overall great day even though it poured most of the day : (
From the outside. we didnt go in as we had to many show to go but there and around is some lively photo spots at night time when its all lit up. next time i will be visiting :)

Radio CIty Music Hall Christmas Spectacular. My mom went to the Christmas Spectacular in 1990 and I followed her footsteps in 2013. So worthwhile, just once. I loved the nativity with live animals. And of course the Rockettes in their outfits with their dancing.

Complete christmas experience. Christmas Eve 2014 hubby and I saw the Rockette's Christmas Spectacular and it was exactly that. the day was wet and very cold so it was nice to be indoors for this fabulous show. We saw the 10:30am show and I had to buy an alcoholic beverage just to get the glowing swizzle sticks - well it was Christmas Eve after all. the show was fabulous and I would do it again in a heartbeat. The lines and the kicks on those girls are amazing. Loved it!!!

Holiday Classic. A classic piece of history in the building itself and a fun show every time. People of all ages can appreciate and enjoy varying parts of the show and the crowd flow is managed very well.
Beautiful show, need update.. The show is amazing, all the dancers are incredible but I think that they have to update the show, It feel like in the 90's. Also the music was not exciting at all.

Christmas Spectacular Show with the Rockettes!. Took the Stage Door Tour the day before the show. Very interesting history and information. Show had several surprises like 3D effects. Great orchestra seats! Very entertaining show!
everyone must go. Everyone should attend the Christmas Spectacular at least once a decade.Radio City believes in the maxim : "More is More"

Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes. This show was amazing, timed to perfection and absolutely flawless. I have never seen anything like this and would thoroughly recommend. It would be great to attend in the run up to Christmas as it has a very festive feel to it. The theatre is lovely with very spacious seats. Loved the 3D glasses and the lighting and scenery

Fantastic xmas show!. We went to see the Rockettes Xmas Show and it was fantastic. From start to finish the show is superb and those dancers are amazing.. the theatre itself is so quaint inside and it had a lovely xmas tree hanging up......this was a fab start to our xmas.

Fantastic "Christmas Spectular at Radio City Music Hall, Don't Miss it! Just Wonderful. My wife and I spent Thanksgiving week in New York City; we took the 2pm performance and the orchestra seats almost center were about 16 seats back from the stage were excellent, but rather expensive. The show was wonderful it included the fantastic Rockettes! And all aspects of Christmas included, the Nutcracker, the Christmas story with live animals including two camels, a donkey, and several sheep and of course Santa Claus and his reindeer! The 1 hour 45 minute presentation was fantastic, a wonderful experience.

Another Fabulous Show. We last did the rockettes iconic show about 8 years ago. This time there was more security but handled well.The theatre is lovely and we were quite close to the front. The show is so slick and nothing less than perfect. How they manage all the fast changes is a miracle. We of different ages all thoroughly enjoyed the escapism, just pure fun and suitable for the youngest children.Well done and keep it going!

A must-see during Xmas season. We went for radio city Christmas spectacular during holiday season and it was indeed spectacular and could meet those lovely "Rockets" and take pictures with them. The sound was excellent and the Hall is appealing after so many years!

Great Show. This was a lovely experience and we were pleased we had pre-booked as it was extremely busy around the Rockafella. We did it at night when the tree was lit up. We had the cookies and hot chocolate which was a nice added touch. As we are not pro’s at ice skating we did not glide as elegantly as others but we got the hang of it eventually. If you do go around the busy times, allow yourself extra times to get through the crowds.

NYC Gem. One of those places that you have to visit when coming to NYC!A great place to take pictures at night. The lights and neon are great. Spacious and very clean inside. Book your tickets in advance. There are a number of place you can visit for a bite- both street food and sit down. The schedule is available on the Radio City site. Tip:Look into coupons at hotels or travel booking sites.

A must see, especially during Christmas. How can you not go here during the Holidays. I was mesmerized the minute I walked in. The lights, the stairs, the chandelier; beautiful. Next time I'll bring the family to see the Christmas Spectacular. The show was fun.

Beautiful Venue to watch the Rockettes!. We saw the Rockettes here and our seats were great. They did a great job with getting everyone in the auditorium quickly. The snacks were great. I also lost my credit card and the security team was great and helped me recover it.
Great show and worth doing. We went for the X-mass show and had a great time even with jet lack in our bodies. It is not high culture but a great show that also speaks to kids

Holiday Show a MUST to see!. What a place! what a show! This is SO worth it! Found a great special ticket price online with a discount. Attended on a Saturday evening. This place has kept so much history to it's interior it was amazing! Seats in the second mezzanine where great! Be prepared for high prices for concessions (but that's at any venue) The Dancers are the most talented group and the live orchestra and organ players were wonderful!

It's a beautiful interior.Classic NYC. I've seen been there over the years to see movies, the Rockettes, Elton John, , a college graduation and the beauty of the place always gets to me. Anyone visiting should go there. Could you believe they wanted to knock it down once!

Rocketts Christmas Show. We prepaid for tickets with Viator and bypassed all the lines...great seats and an amazing show!!! Far exceeded my expectations. Even my grumpy 23 year old was delighted...definitely a feast for the eyes!
Birthday celebration Christmas 2015. We watched the Christmas Spectacular show.It was amazing ! A wonderful celebration of Christmas.It is also possible to buy tickets for the backstage tour.
Absolutely gorgeous venue!. This is a splendid venue! Really pretty. We had front row mezzanine seats right in the center - for the premier of the Rockettes Spring Spectacular - and it was!

A NEW YORK CITY CLASSIC!!. Still a beautiful place to see a show! Great sightlines and acoustics! We saw Tony Bennett with Lady Gaga, and Tony demonstrated how great the acoustics were by singing one song without using a microphone and was still able to be heard by the fans sitting in the upper reaches of the building! And he's in his late 80's!! A must-see for anyone visiting the Big Apple!
Christmas spectacular . Amazing musical ,fantastic.All people were satisfied at the end.Nice story and very nice ballet,very synchronized and very well organized.

The Rockettes Rocked It!. Even though it was after Christmas, we went to the Christmas Spectacular! It kept our holidays in full swing & they were amazing. So precise & the show even impressed my 19 year old son! My 16 year old daughter who is a dancer was on the edge of her seat! The whole set was amazing!
Christmas Spectacular. We bought our tickets at the box office and saved the ticketmaster fees. Saw the show in 2012 and again in 2015- Loved it 2nd time around too

Christmas Spectacular was spectacular!!!. Wonderful family show to watch at Christmas time and even better for $10!! Bought tickets morning of performance. Seats on 3rd mezzanine were perfectly situated for a great view of performance.

Christmas Spectacular. Would highly recommend this show to anyone that has never been to see it live. The Rockettes were amazing. Loved the toy soldier part. The 3-D part was the only disappointment. They could totally do this show without the 3-D and that would make it even better. Overall it was beautiful. So glad they did both the santa and religious aspects of Christmas.
Good show. Went to see the annual Rockettes Christmas show.Venue was very clean and comfortable.A great show.

Great theatre. Had some family in from London, took everyone to the Christmas show. This is an old beautiful theatre in NY and a must see. Show was very nice and high quality, very expensive but worth it .
Christmas spectacular. If you are in NY anytime around xmas then the Rockettes Christmas show is a must. Radio City is a huge venue that stages major events all year round and well worth every cent.
Christmas Spectacular!. We have been in New York City for the Christmas holidays and went to the Christmas Spectacular Show which was really spectacular!

The Christmas Show. The show was fantastic. The dancing was great and so perfect. The story regarding Santa was a bit long and could be shorter to have a bit more dance. The price and value were very good, especially for NYC.
Excellent. Great experience, well worth a visit very professional and the Rockets were great ! Entrance Hall is worth going in for that alone if no show on.

Merry Christmas to the Rockettes!. We enjoyed the wonderful Christmas show starring the famous Rockettes. The Radio City Music Hall is a huge building, but our view even up high was great! We had seen the Rockettes in Nashville, but this show was so much more. It will get you in the Christmas spirit right away. I am sure any production in this reknown place would be worth seeing.

Everyone one said, " you have to go," and they were right.. We saw the Rockettes and the Christmas Spectacular. A little slow at times but overall it was beautiful. The nativity scene was breathtaking.

The holiday spectacular was spectacular!. Got there early to get pictures with Santa and a rockette... Female bathrooms were still from another era (very cool). Show was amazing! Even if you sat near the back (like we did!) a must see if you're in the city during the holidays!
Spectacular!. Had not intended to attend the Christmas Spectacular show, but so glad we did! This show was well worth the cost and time invested. The Rockettes are amazing!
Christmas at Radio City. This is a must see if you are in NYC in December. The show was spectacular. It was so fun to spend the evening watching the show and to see everything in the area afterwards.

Breathtaking Holiday Show. Have visited NYC many times in the past 5 years. Always wanted to see Rockettes perform.
Delighted when we saw the Christmas Show. The dancers were incredible and cant imagine the amount of practice and precision needed to attain the precise moves.
Definitely plan to make this an annual event.

Surprisingly Great. We had no intention of going to Radio City Music Hall but then we learned about it on a tour of Rockefeller Center and we got discounted tickets. We sat in the cheap section as we already had purchased Wicked and Lion King Tickets but we thought one more couldn’t hurt. We were glad we saw the Rockettes but we wished we had gotten better seats. If you are on a budget, get the discounted seats but if you have some extra cash, by all means and do yourself a favor and get better seats. The auditorium has such a great and terrible history so you don’t want to miss it. By the time you read this review, the Rockettes will probably be gone but I’m sure there will be another exciting show for you to watch.

Great time for the whole family!. This was my boy's (ages 9 & 12) first trip to NYC and we decided to take them to see The Christmas Spectacular at Radio City. What a beautiful theater and a great show! We went the next to last day, so we were able to get B1G1 free tickets, which made it very affordable. Seats were very comfortable and a nice place to rest my aching feet from running around all day. We will be back again in future years!

Christmas Spectacular was amazing!. Absolutely incredible show! Two organists started by playing carols throughout the hall pre-show. From there, it is the Rockettes and a pretty corny show, but the dancing, singing, and costuming was tremendous! LOVED the closing scene! Truly enjoyed being there!
Christmas Spectacular. The Christmas Spectacular Show is well-worth going to just because it puts you in the spirit of the season - it's kitsch and fun.

Enjoy the "2nd" show - always playing at Radio City!. Caught the Rockettes show here this week (Jan '16) - certainly enjoyed the show but the "2nd show" that is going on is simply the presence of being in such a historical and grand performing arts center. I think it seats 5200 - and its shape, its walls, the tiered mezzanines and balcony, the acoustics, everything is first-rate!! Everyone should take a good look around when seated and know that you are in one of the world's greatest music halls!
Fab!!!. We went to the Christmas spectacular which was great, it was a great experience and amazing to finally get to see inside radio city, which really is spectacular,
Rocketts Christmas show superb. Went here for the Radio City Christmas show -- if you here for Xmas it is a must. Extremely well done and the whole experience was amazing!
Beautiful Theater!. Finally got to see the Rockettes for the Holiday. Beautiful theater, comfortable seats and great acoustics.

Radio City Christmas Spectacular kicked tail!. Loved the Christmas Spectacular. The performances were top notch, the sets, lighting, music, costumes, dancing and singing were outstanding. HIGHLY recommend for family friendly entertainment.

Christmas Spectacular - loved it!!!!!!. Loved seeing The Rockettes at the Radio city Music Hall - what a treat and the building is just worth going inside to see for all the amazing Art Deco workmanship. Very comfortable seats and well maintained theatre
The Rockettes were amazing. A first time visit for me, I cannot imagine being more impressed . The show was unbelievable. Seats were easy to locate.

rockettes christmas show not to be missed. a dream was to see the radio city rockettes christmas show and i was not dissappointed....im a 46 year old person and this show was so magical and special...would recommend to any age.....

Christmas Spectacular!. My 16 year old daughter managed to get us reduced price tickets (buy one, get one free) for Christmas Day to see the Rockettes in their traditional Christmas Spectacular. Radio City is huge but all seats would give you an acceptable view. The entertainment was fab, very 'Hollywood/Busby Berkeley'. Drinks very expensive though, $11 for 2 bottles of water!

Spectacular Christmas Spectacular!. An amazing show....a must see! Radio City Music Hall is such a grand theatre, it's so incredibly beautiful, and the show will not disappoint at any age. It's only a little over an hour long, seats are comfy, and the Rockettes are amazing!!
Christmas Spectacular is a must see. If the Radio City Christmas Spectacular is on when you visit New York. GO GO GO Its the best show ive ever seen

Christmas Disappontment. Radio City Music Hall and its Christmas Show is a standard by which some rate their Christmas experience in New York City. The Hall is too be sure Huge and the Sound overwhelming. But this reviewer found the overall show to be Passe. To start the prelude to the opening with the playing of the 2 mighty Organs was enough to awaken anyone who by some chance dozed off in their seat. The Dance numbers were to be sure well executed but except for two (The New York City Tour and the March of the Wooden Soldiers)Disappointing.Most Distressing was the behavior of the Audience and their Use by all too many to Use their I Pads and phones to Record the Performance and in the process blocking the view of patrons behind them.This was indeed one of My most Disappointing Experiences In New York City

NYE trip. Thoroughly enjoyed the show. Ordered tickets on line last minute got great seats really cheap. The show was impressive and all my kids are in college and enjoyed it as well. One thing I was most impressed with was Nativity Production! Being a Christian I did not expect anything NBC had to with would include the birth of Jesus, so I apologize Radio City Music Hall I underestimated you. Would definitely recommend to all ages! Thank you for an awesome close to our fast weekend in New York!

Christmas Spectacular . What can you say? A 1930's theater in pristine condition AND THE Rockettes??? We loved it. I recommend front row, first mezzanine. Close enough to see in detail, far enough away to take in the entire production.

Amazing Show!! An NYC must see!!!. Visited NYC in November 2015 & top of my list was to see the Christmas Spectacular. We turned up at the box office on the saturday morning and managed to get tickets for that evening. Tickets were a very good price but also good seats. The show was absolutely spectacular as the name suggests..I was sat with my mouth open for the first 10 minutes. My husband wasn't keen but even he enjoyed it! My children would have loved it, hope to bring them back in a few years to see it!!

Beautiful Theater! Loved Christmas Spectacular! Amazing. I've been to Radio City on two occasions. I've seen a Cirque du Soleil here, and recently saw the Christmas Spectacular.The theater is beautiful. The Christmas Spectacular is terrific. The level of perfection is unreal. The dancers are so synchronized. Some of the other patrons could use some etiquette lessons though. Screaming babies and toddlers who were too young to enjoy such a show, but parents lacking the logic to take them out of the auditorium so that others could enjoy it. People talking on their cell phones, during the show!!! Even dirty looks didn't deter them. Shame on you!

Great venue . We had two tickets from living social to see the Christmas spectacular with the Rocketts. My 11 year old was not disappointed. I saw it 22 years ago and I was excited to see it again. Always takes me back and feels magical. We did not wait in line and had great seats. Very organized place even inside restrooms. Be prepared if u r not tall because the seats are not designed to give u a good view if the person in front of u is tall and they had run out of booster seats.

Gets u in the Sprite of xmas. We walk in of the street got great seats mid way in the hall $45 each ! Show was amazing and the rockettes don't disappoint it's a must see ! And the establishment in self is worth seeing like going back in to the twentys the toilet is amazing! Check it out !! The whole joint just rocks !!

Christmas Spectacluar. We visited here the Tuesday before Christmas and it really did the trick to get us into the festive spirit.The line moved quickly and we were in the music hall around 45 minutes before the show. Programmes were expensive at $25 especially when as we got to the door to be seated we were given a free just as adequate brochure. Seats were brilliant 2nd Mezzanine Row A A seats 105/106. Excellent view of the stage. Loved every minute of the show and the messages it gave.Bought a coke $5.50 so fairly pricey!

Christmas Spectacular!!. Their Christmas show truly is spectacular!! I would recommend anyone of any age to go see it.. The Rockettes are amazing & the whole show is so well thought out and presented. Loved it!

The Rockettes Kicked It!!!. The 2015 Holiday Show was spectacular!!! Radio City Music Hall is beautiful and the seating is spacious and comfortable. The show lasted 90 minutes and it was non-stop entertainment. All the Rockettes, singers, musicians, and staff were fantastic!!! Don't miss the opportunity to see a show while in NYC!!! Cheers!!!
A CLASS ACT. We went for the Christmas show and it was magical. The theatre was amazing, the show was terrific, and the service was excellent. This was my favorite thing in NYC.

Fantastic Place to Visit!. I did the backstage tour and it was really interesting and good fun. The tour guide was very informative and it was a really exciting experience offering you the chance to see a lot of really cool things backstage and throughout the building!

Absolutely Spectacular Christmas Spectacular. My family came to new york for a week during christmas and we were all impressed by this beautiful christmas show that we watched on Christmas day. It was a wonderful show composed not only of dancing but also singing, flying drones, a 3d movie, and figure skaters. Also the hall itself is very well maintained, it has a grand chandelier at the entrance, and statues everywhere. Overall, this was one of my favourite "broadway" productions and I would recommend it to anyone travelling to New York, especially during christmas.

Great Place. I went here twice once I took a tour of the backstage saw where the rockettes get ready and their museum they have and also met and spoke with a rockette about her daily job, and the other time I went to the tv taping of Americas got talent it was a great place it's nice to see shows there.
celebrity place to spot one. not so important to see but if you pass by its lively and crowded as such one or two celebrity politicians or A1 people hangout at the radio city

Tour was a great peek into the past. The backstage tour guide was very informative, got to meet a rockette, saw a quick film on the history of the place, the backstage 'party' room. Most interesting to me was walking through some of the back hallways, looking same as ever.
Christmas Spectacular. Fun and impressive! Wonderful visual effects, the great Rockettes and just a fun show all the way around - very glad we went!

2015 Christmas Spectacular. Never made it to this annual extravaganza as a child. Still just as impressive as an adult. RCMH is a destination that must be experienced at least once. Recommend searching online for discounted tickets as they can be really pricey at face value.

Fantastic. Did the tour as it was free on the new York pass. The building is amazing. We also got to meet a rockette.Well worth a visit. We also viewed the show That was expensive.... cheapest seats we could get on the day were 120 dollars. But it was well worth it. The rockettes rock.
Christmas Rockette program. Christmas Rockette program was magical. Music was wonderfully familiar and message was so good. Cost of souvenirs was outrageous

Christmas Spectacular 2015. Awesome show on their huge stage singing, dancing and of course the world famous high kicking Rockettes dance troupe Food drinks both soft & hard available in the main lobby & on the mezzanine. Friendly helpful staff.
Christmas Spectacular... a spectacular show!!. Visiting Radio City Music Hall is it in itself an experience. The Rockettes are magnificent. It's an old fashioned show and a show for all ages.
Rockettes Rock!. This was our first time to see the Rockettes and the show was magical! Would recommend it to anyone visiting NYC. The visual effects, and even 3-D glasses added to the effect.
Christmas Spectacular!!. A great show and so meaningful to see the Rockettes and to enjoy a little magic of Christmas. Beautiful Venue

RAdio City Music Hall and The 2015 Christmas Extravaganza. Ohmygoodness!! How can you go wrong by seeing this show at Radio Music City Hall? My husband and I went to see the Rockettes at Radio City Music Hall. The inside was beautifully designed and decorated. It brought a good feeling to stand where so many superstars had been. The show itself was awesome and had amazing special effects. The Rockettes rocked out for Christmas. So did Santa.

great show. The theater is old school elegant – very nice. There is a huge chandelier in the lobby. We saw the "Radio City Christmas Spectacular Show". The show was good with a combination of acting, singing, media, special effects and of course, the Rockettes. Their movements were so synchronized it was a sight to behold. I'd say that you have to see this show at least once. The souvenir prices were ridiculous - $15 for a magnet.

Still an amazing show for kids and adults. I took my 3 granddaughters this morning to the Christmas Spectacular show. It was an amazing show that the kids and I absolutely loved! The 3D ride was amazing, the Rockettes great as usual, and the Nutcracker was a delight! I hadn't gone to this show in years, and was so happy it's still a real treat. I would recommend it for young and old.

The rocketts are legend. We had a great visit to Radio City Music Hall and the show really is first class, we hadn't pre-booked but went to the box office around 11.30 and they had tickets for the 7.30 performance $62 each and right near the front. Great value for money (NYC prices)
Mother and Daughter Trip. The Highlight of our trip! We had seats in Row SS Orchestra Center and even took a picture with an Rockette!

Rockettes Christmas Show. Really enjoyed this show, and like that they mixed it up with dancing, singing and even acknowledged the religious theme of Christmas with a few religious Christmas carols and a manger scene. It was extremely well done and the sets, music, dancing and experience was incredible to watch. Can't say enough good things about what we saw in the 90 minute show. Great production for the entire family.

Great time at Radio City Music Hall. We went to see the Christmas spectacular with the Rockettes at the radio city music hall. The show was very enjoyable. We were able to get discounted tickets at the last minute.

Christmas Show Wow. Shared the Christmas Show with family that had never seen it. What a great time in the best theater in the world. Expensive but family fun at its best. Leave time for a walk through the shops at Rockefeller Center and of course the tree.
Christmas Eve visit. Went to the famous Christmas Spectacular to we the Rockettes, spectacular is definitely what this is, fabulous !!!

The Christmas Spectacular Show was a MUST SEE!. What more of a way to get into the holiday spirit then to see the Rockette's Christmas Spectacular Show! This show doesn't disappoint! The rockette's are amazing and the toy soldier routine was my favorite! Santa Claus even makes a visit - the 3D movie part was awesome too!This is a great attraction for families, couples, seniors - well pretty much anyone!Show ends January 3rd HURRY!

Awesome show-worth it!!. Great place for a show-amazing props and stage work-you can figure out a bit of how they do it if you want to (I'm always curious) but mostly just let yourself enjoy it and get lost in it!! Saw the Rocketts Christmas Special and it was spectacular. Very precise and beautiful-enjoyable for all ages! We sat about half way back in the orchestra level and could see fairly well. Definitely recommend it, especially if you can find discount tickets, although it's still expensive it's well worth it if you want to experience a great show while in NYC!

Xmas Spectacular well worth seeing. We had booked prior to coming out to NYC tickets to the Rockettes Xmas Spectacular, well we were not disappointed the show was amazing and very clever in places. We felt in the Xmas spirit right away and would recommend to anyone of all ages to see the show. Very good story, with lots of singing, dancing and festive treats to boot.

Christmas Spectacular Will Make You Feel the Christmas Spirit. So much talent and so many beautiful scenes and I am not even a kid! I loved it! This was a show with a lot of families in attendance so expect distractions here and there from the kids on the naughty list. Also - we ordered some drinks and the staff is not the friendliest, but that barely matters with a show this nice!

I'd give it a five if they would police the idiots holding up their cellphones. The show is great. It is such fun and so well done. BUT, some people are incredibly rude and hold their cell phones up to record it. We called the usher twice because of the jerk in front of us blocking the show. I looked around and there were a handful of people doing this and the ushers do nothing unless you find one and complain. They finally sent a big burly security guy to fix this and that did the trick.

Quaint experience for families. The Christmas show was good entertainment for families good old fashioned sing and dance, music hall style. Superb stage production. The Rockettes have to be admired for timing and style. Great family entertainment. The queue to get in was basis all though! Go early or pay extra for VIP entry. Some people missed the start of the show. No signs inside to show where sitting areas are, but plenty of tacky displays so that was a shame.

Beautiful building - loved the Christmas Spectacular Show!. Radio City Music Hall is so Iconic that its a must visit site especially during the holiday season. The building was lit up from the outside with the xmas lights which is very pretty. The lobby area in the building is no less spectacular with the gorgeous chandeliers and Xmas decorations its beautiful. The theater itself is amazing, and the Xmas spectacular show is not to be missed - we went on a Santa hat day and it really added to the experience!

Christmas Spectacular! Enough Said!. We were lucky enough to see the 'Christmas Spectacular' on Christmas Day, whilst staying in NYC over Christmas. We had been recommended by friends to see a show here at Christmas who came the previous year. The show did not disappoint at all, it was the most amazing dancing and choreography I have ever seen, the effort and practice the cast must put in is truly admirable. The venue itself was amazing too, very welcoming, very big security presence which was good to see, reasonably priced food and drinks and a generally welcoming atmosphere. Would recommend to all, the shows that aren't Christmas themed must be amazing too, I'm sure!

christmas spectecular; spectecular it was!!. beauty full scenery, fantastic opening of two artist, great lightning, beautifull dance and singing. a night never to forget in the passion of christmas and new year. what a gift.

The Christmas Show is great for families. If you want to introduce your children to Broadway extravaganzas, this should be one of your stops. The lobby spaces are enormous and decorated in style. Seats are comfortable and the view is great. Acts are short enough and varied enough to keep most kids interested.

Christmas show. The show was very nice and joyful with great decoration and music The sound system is superb as well as the discipline it was very busy and people waited in a row at the street for almost 400-500 meters
Christmas spectacular. I went to see the Rocketts and it was spectacular. This was a birthday event for me the day after Christmas and we all enjoyed the show

Need to update their program. This was the second time but we had better seating this time. They were great performance wise, but just the program was very similar to one we saw 3 years ago. Chances are we will not see it again in the near future. Their policy on photographic equipment was not uniform. I have a fairly basic camera in a bag and was told that I had to put it in storage while other walked right in with cameras. Many people used flash during performance which I believe is against their policy but no one did anything about it.

Truly Spectacular!. We went with family - 7 of us in all, and the first time for our 5 year old Granddaughter. She was so enthralled with everything. She was engaged from the moment the organs came out of the curtains to play the opening songs and get the audience seated. My husband and I had been several times -- before 9-11, and this was our first visit back. The ending sequence of the Baby Jesus birth - Payton was just as still as she could be. And full of questions on the way home! It was a wonderful experience.

Christmas Spectacular Indeed!. The Radio City Christmas Spectacular was fabulous! Everyone enjoyed it, from a two year old to a 73 year old! A definite recommendation to help put you in the holiday spirit.

Amazing . First time to New York and we really wanted to see a show. We decided to see the Christmas Spectacular and we totally made the right decision!! The show was amazing we can't wait to visit again!!!

Just Perfect!. First time to the Christmas Show.....and it was FANTASTIC!!!! The theater itself is mind-blowing....I LOVE that they have kept the original features, the velvet, the ladies' lounge....even the phone booths!!! The show was simply incredible....! Magical! The live nativity at the end was a show-stopper and had me in tears! Multiple Santas were a big highlight too! Probably too long (and maybe too loud) for the under age 4 kiddos. Bathroom lines are very long, but they do move quick. My daughter is 8, and this was just the PERFECT time for us! Even the teens will like it! Walking distance to the Tree and so much more. Just.....go! :)
Christmas Spectacular. Excellent show! The whole family enjoyed it, worth the money. The show is 90 minutes which could have been cut down some to make it even better.

Amongst the Best Theatre Venues in the World. Attended the wonderful Christmas Show. The theatre is a magnificent example of Art Deco architecture. When I was a kid, we could watch a live Rockette Show and see a movie for $2.50. We had great seats in the orchestra. The Christmas Show was, indeed, spectacular! Even the youngest (just under 2) was enthralled and loved it.Tickets today are high, but the venue is worth it. Before and after the show, two spectacular pipe organs come out to frame both sides of the stage. The graduated steps up the walls of the theatre enable performers to step out at all levels.There are refreshments that are very pricey, including drinks, popcorn, and candy.Whatever the show, this is a "must see" in NYC.
first time in Broadway. We saw the Rockets christmas show and were very excited for the spectacular. Even my 8 y old boy enjoyed it a lot. My 1st experience in Broadway was very sweet.

The Christmas Show. This was my bride's first show like the Radio City Christmas show. Not only is the theater an amazing attraction, but everything is done perfectly. Music and choreography, with just the right amount of corn. Tickets are pricey, but worth every penny.

Truely a Christmas Spectacular. First time we have been to this venue. It was everything we expected and more. The music, dancing, and singing were wonderful. The people working throughout the hall very helpful and friendly. We will go back.

This is a Christmas Time Must See. I loved the Christmas Spectacular. It is a beautiful, historic theater. It was comfortable and fancy. Be sure to use the ladies restroom, it is fancy and beautiful too! It's like a ladies sitting room, we just don't do that anymore. Too bad.

A great run down Memory Lane. My husband and I had not been here since we were kids and it was a blast. There was a good mix of modern and traditional. The dual-organ playing was fantastic!
Would definitely take our grandaughter sometime.

"Don't pre-buy pictures for Rockettes!!!!". Would not accept pre-bought Ticketmaster $66 photo tickets printed before the show. Had to exit building, wait in line again, argue with confused box-off, reprint ticket, get security screened again just to pick up photos.
John the manager was wholly unhelpful.
Half-filled theater watched an unjoyful, uninteresting show. Time to call it on this show, it's outlived it's time.
Outstanding. Really really enjoyed it. Get your tickets ahead of time and avoid lines. Traditional New York experience.

The Christmas Spectacular is appropriately named!. This was our first time to see the Rockettes and it was fabulous! The Music Hall is beautiful, the show was fantastic, we loved the whole experience!

Amazing Rockettes Christmas Show. Although the ground was bare of snow, we quickly got into the Christmas spirit at the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Show featuring the Rockettes. From the opening 3D sleigh ride with Santa to the many Rockette numbers and classic Christmas music, the time flew by as we relived our childhood. We ended the show with a visit to the Rockefeller Center skating rink and Christmas Tree as well as the nearby Macy's window displays. This was a day we won't forget.
The Rockets Christmas Spectacular. A perfect performance fit for the whole family. An incredible experience. Everyone should go to Radio City at least once in their lives.

Loved every minute of the Christmas Spectacular!. Nice to see a large production keep Christ in Christmas! We also did the stage door tour which shared alot of history of the building and it's past. It's such a beautiful concert venue, everyone should experience a show there!

Excellent. We attended this show to check off a bucket list item. We are so happy that we did, it was worth every cent we paid to travel to NYC and to see this show. it was AMAZING! The dancers/singers interact with the audience, it's an amazing experience. We are hoping to take our kiddos and grandbabies next year! Totally worth EVERY CENT! If you can only see one show, make it THIS ONE! You won't be sorry!!!!!!!

Great Christmas Show! See the Rockettes!. Excellent show and beautiful venue! A must see when you are in NYC around Christmas. we sat in the Second Mezzanine and the view was great. I've been to the show before and sat center stage. I really liked the mezzanine seats better because the Rockettes are known for their precision and you could really see this from the mezzanine seats.  The lines were long and the crowds massive-security was impressive. Be prepared to be part of the "maddening crowd"!
Love the Rockettes. The best part of the city in December is watching the Radio City Rockettes do their thing on stage. What a great show for the holidays and it puts you in that Christmas spirit.

Great sound and seats. Saw the Rockettes who were great. Sound is very good as well as the seating comfort. Was in the 1st Mezz, 2nd from the last row, but the view is still great. Though for the some of the rockettes act it would be great to be more centrally located and a bit lower.Only negatives was that the souvenirs are expensive and the magnet purchased was not magnetic at all.And that they keep letting folks in at all times that does take away from the viewing experience as they are being seated. To avoid that you can be seated as close to the stage or level start as possible and also somewhere in the middle seats of the row.

Tradition at its BEST !!. The Christmas Show at Radio City is one that should not be missed....while certain numbers change from year to year you will always be entertained....make it a tradition for your family.
Rockin Rockettes !. Lines move quickly, venue in great condition, beautifully decorated . Seats a bit small and tight for the average adult, show makes up for that, ROCKETTES are amazing !
Wonderful for the Christmas show.. Nicely decorated for the holidays. Comfortable seating. Restrooms clean.Prices of food items steep. A plastic bottle of regular water was $5.50. Easy exit.

Great Christmas Show. First time seeing the show in many years.It was great and wonderful to see it the Lauren and Emme's eyes.We went to the 11:00 show before church .We then went to Jason and Lisa for dinner.Great day. You can't miss at the show.They are so talented.

Radio City Music Hall Dazzles. We had a great time on Christmas Day attending the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular performance by the Rockettes! The theatre was very comfortable with lots of leg room. The show was truly "spectacular". A must see.

The Rockettes rock!. Excellent family entertainment at Radio City Hall Xmas Spectacular. Sit in the first mezzanine to take in the entire experience of the digital displays on the walls and ceilings, and to see the orchestra as well as enjoying the view of the entire stage. Not to be missed at least once during the holidays.
great show. The show was amazing. The only thing was for 3 non alcoholic drinks before the show was $33!! Kind of steep. Otherwise great place to visit and catch a show!!

RCMH is on the "must do once" list for NYC. Everyone must see the Rockettes at least once! We attended the 10pm Christmas Spectacular 12/26. Knowing they do 5 shows a day, we were prepared for the herding in & out of the theater. That doesn't give one much time to take in the beauty of the Music Hall. The show itself lasts about 1:15, with the expected Christmas tunes and Rockette dances. To get in, line forms on W. 50th Street & quickly extends back almost to 5th Avenue. At some point, they start directing those in the back of the line to the 51st St entrance.

The Rockettes can kick up a great performance!. I haven't been to see the Rockettes in many years but got the opportunity after Christmas to see the 2015 Christmas Spectacular.Even though we thought we would not get into the venue - the lines were soooo long - they started moving and we had plenty of time to find our seats. What a fabulous show - the BEST number is the toy soldier - not quite sure how the "falling" is done - but kuddos to the 36 dancers!

Christmas Spectacular - It was Spectacular. What a great way to spend an Evening at Christmas.I wasn't really sure what to expect, and being in my late 30's, I wasn't sure this would keep me entertained for an hour and a half. I really didn't need to worry. From start to finish, the show was fantastic. Great choreography, fantastic costumes, and the sets, just wow!!!! Wasn't sure the need for the 3D section, and if it really added anything to the show.The Music Hall itself is worth a visit alone.

MUST go and see The Rockettes!!. We went to watch The Christmas Extravaganza with The Rockettes on Christmas Day...This show was FANTASTIC, coming from a performing background, me and my family all thought this was one of the best shows we have ever seen. The Rockettes were just so so brilliant, the precision was on another level, and you can imagine the dedication the girls have to get something so good. We went to watch on Christmas Day & it was so festive! There was something for all ages too! We were sat in Row A in the Orchestra/Stalls from seats 214 - We were unsure about these seats when we booked them, having never been to Radio City before but they were perfect to be honest. They are slightly off to the side but it doesn't make any difference to the viewing and I would sit there again, no problem.Anyone in NYC over the Christmas period MUST go and see this show. Really great fun.
xmass show. this is a true nyc experience .this place is always clean and safe.you a little pricey now but still well worth it.there is a lot of shows and concerts here. the sound is great.

Beautifl. Beautiful theater. We saw the Christmas Spectacular, which was way beyond all of our expectations. I expected the rocketed to be out there constantly clogging and dancing, but was overjoyed to find such an awe inspiring production. The nativity scene was unbelievably beautiful!
Great for the Kids. Radio City Music Hall is a great show but definitely more for kids. The actual hall is amazing and worth going there just for the show.

Well done. We saw this show on our first trip to NYC when my daughter danced in the Macy's parade. The show was very good as you would expect from the world famous Rockettes. Their dancing was flawless and the music was better than I expected. The auditorium is HUGE and we were way up, and way in the back. I think I would have enjoyed the show more had we had even mediocre seats. The other negatives were 1.) the ridiculously high priced souvenirs (I'm used to over-priced, but I found these prices nearly offensive) and 2.) the search of coats and bags upon entry to the building. I'm a Kansas girl, so I guess I'm just not used to being patted down, but at the same time, we saw two other shows (Hamilton and Phantom) and did not receive the same search. I understand it is their building and if I don't like it, I don't have to see their show. Of course, I did not know before I went that the search would occur.As for the positives, as stated above, the dancing was really good. The singing was great. It is a family atmosphere appropriate for even little ones. Since many of the broadway shows are not kid-friendly, this is a welcome production in NYC. Finally, the live nativity was spectacular.

Christmas Extravaganza. A great evening out for all the family... we had tickets high up in the stalls although we had a great view, from what we could see you get a clear view of the stage regardless of where you are....

Great Time 🎄🇺🇸❤️. Another attraction on New York City! Specially if you visit the city on Christmas time, The Rockets Espectacular Show its amazing! No words to describe this amazing theater! You will never be boring! It's a place surrounding with a lot of energy & Historical memories!

cHrismas Spectracular is VERY Spectracular!!!. OMG, this show lives up to its name!!!! I loved this show so much I'd fly back to NYC just to see it again. We had orchestra seats in the second section which were perfect. Radio City is not a huge theater (like Staples Center or Madison Square Garden) for concert or theater shows so any seat is a good seat. TIP: check several ticket sites other than the Radio City one. I paid $85/seat through Ticketmaster but those same seats were $125 on the Radio City site.

Christmas Spectacular. I thoroughly enjoyed the show! Brought back the Christmas spirit, which was lacking after a day to trying to navigate though Times Square. Sat next to a little girl who was so entertained and entertaining! Most enjoyed the fact that they maintained a Christian holiday theme at the end, complete with manger and live animals.Tip: Arrive 45 min.- 1 hour early. Traffic is terrible so walk if you can. Wish we had taken a tour of the music hall as well. Enjoy the organists pre and post show! Also, would recommend mezzanine seats.

Cool landmark. Christmas is the only time I enjoy in the city, people are generally decent and it's quite pretty. After years of living close we finally decided to see the Christmas Spectacular. The show was fun but this review is for the venue (we've been before for a Kevin Smith movie showing). It's cool and has a historic edge ... Albeit the that edge is a little worn. Very little incline between the rows and seats not staggered so if you're short (like me) try to get an aisle seat so you can at least lean your seat out. Besides that like most other theaters but worth the visit for Christmas.

We all loved it! . My wife chose this show as her 'must do' for our visit. My daughters and I weren't sure but we loved it. Particular favourites were putting on 3 D glasses for a trip with Santa, hundreds of Santas on stage and the Rockettes who did some spectacular routines. A must see when in New York.

Amazing show, Fantastic archietecture.. Thoroughly enjoyed our trip here, the Radio City Christmas Spectacular was amazing and great for all ages. Immersive and exciting, I wouldn't hesitate to come back to future performances.

Went to see the Christmas spectacular . Great venue and a classic NYC sight, but pure chaos trying to get in to a 10 p.m. show. There was no system to let people in, so the crowd just starting pushing through the lines. If you have a chance to visit and see a show, just make sure you're in line early so you don't have to fight the crowds.They had plenty of bars to order snacks like candy, chips and popcorn, as well as a decent bar for drinks. Prices are similar to any other event in NYC, but nothing outrageous. Regular mixed drinks and wine were about $12-15. Popcorn came in two sizes - small for $9 and large for around $12-14. Drinks and popcorn came in souvenir containers.Other than that, the hall is beautiful and the show was good. The Christmas Spectacular is more for children than adults, but it was still great to see once. We sat in the orchestra section to the left of the stage in the fourth row from the stage. Tickets in this area are expensive $140 and up for this specific show. It was great to be so close to the stage and orchestra, but it's hard to get the entire stage in your pictures. I would pay to sit in this section again, but would prefer to be in the center section.
