RADIO CITY TOUR. Incredible theatre, most beautiful lobby, doors and carpet. The bathrooms are too cool! Tour offers lots of facts. You will know a lot about it when you see it on TV. Meet an actual Rockette, they are not from this planet!

As good as you might hope. I grew up in New York and have visited many times since moving away, but never went to see the Rockettes. For our 40th anniversary, my wife wanted to see them and I thought, why not? The theatre itself is truly gorgeous. I just remember the age of movie palaces from when I was a kid, but this was undoubtedly the top of the heap. There are no bad seats. The public spaces are sumptuous, from the elevators to the restrooms. Seriously, the men's room on the Second Mezzanine had a lounge area in which you were tempted to linger. If you want to experience what a great theatre used to be, you must visit.The Christmas show was even more professional and impressive than I expected. The whole experience would be wonderful for families, but even adult couples would be entertained by the talent and discipline of the Rockettes. One of the best stage shows I have seen.

Holiday Spectacular. It is the Rockettes at Christmas what can you say. The 3-D effect were actually very well done and not chessy at all. Radio City itself is gorgeous at Christmas. Just make sure you eat and drink before you go, a bottle of water is $4

Christmas Show. Went to Radio City Music Hall for Christmas Show thinking that it would be hokey and boring, but something that we should see when in town for holiday visit. I was wrong. It was thoroughly entertaining and dazzling! The Rockettes were amazing and magnetic! Their dancing was out of this world and an athletic display of dance ability and stamina! The story lines were great and really paid tribute to NYC! This show really makes you feel the Christmas spirit especially when the live animals are brought on stage for the nativity scene!!! Go, you will be so pleased that you did and always love that you saw the Rockettes perform!

Rockettes were superb. We went to see the Christmas Spectacular on Christmas Eve and it was a wonderful experience. We booked the tickets on-line from Australia prior to arriving in USA and were concerned about our tickets. After seeing the show I don't think there would be a bad seat in the theatre. Unfortunately up to 45 minutes into the show ushers were still showing people to their seats which was quite annoying when you were seated behind these groups of people and your view was blocked whilst trying to enjoy the show. Perhaps this theatre should be like other theatres and close the door at the time the show starts. It was a great Christmas experience for our family. Rockettes were great and choreography superb.

Disappointed..... We went to a 10pm show on Christmas. It was horrible. We paid good money to be upfront, however, they allowed people in after show started and people were standing in the 4th row for the first 15 min straightening out a ticket issue. 10 people came in a group after show started and caused a second scene in front of us. Again could not see show. They say no flash photo but do not enforce it. People just rude for a live show. For the price we paid, never again.

Do it once! . Yes, the Rockettes are hot, and the show is campy. However, it is very well done. Our six year grand-niece still believes in Santa even if there are 40 of them on stage at the same time. The Christmas Spectacular is not cheap for 16 tickets, but it brought lots of smiles and brought back lots of memories. A couple of things- follow the directions on printing/downloading/picking up tickets. Don't assume that you will be allowed in without a printed ticket. Enter at the 51st Street entrance. Go to the bathroom before the show if you are female - the line will be huge afterwards. Plan parking. We went to a Saturday 11am show and parked just a block and a half away. We had a cup a coffee while all 16 showed up. It was relatively easy after that.
Must do!. The Rockette's Christmas Spectacular show is spectacular. It is a must do when in NYC for the holidays. There is nothing like it and the builiding is beautiful to see too.

Rockettes Christmas show . Great show! Saw the Rockettes on Christmas Day. The facility itself is beautiful ! And the entire family really enjoyed the show. We did not plan on the crowd in the surrounding areas and took a car- we should have walked. We were a few minutes late to the show.
Wooooooooow !!#. Went to the christmas show featuring father Christmas and the rocketed. Amazing performances, the soldier routine was breathtaking.

Great!. We absolutely loved radio city music hall ! The Rockettes Christmas show was wonderful. Go a little early, as the lines are long to get in. We got there at 7:00(show at 7:30) and made it in as the show started.

Christmas spectacular. Great show to put you in Christmas mood, got seats on the day, used discount voucher handed out in Timess Ssquare and saved quite a bit, two seats on third floor mezzanine for $70, show non stop dancing, really enjoyed the famed Rockettes, beautiful theatre, great experience...but get there early!

Wow!. I went thinking the Rockettes show would be some sort of throw back to a 40s floor show routine. Man, was I wrong! Their Christmas show was a fantastic blend of good music, great dancing (they are probably in sync more so than any other group I've seen), and technology. Yes, technology. For the second "act" you got to put on 3D glasses and ride along with Santa as he flew across NYC. The finale had radio-controlled balls of light floating over the seats and tons of paper snow falling on the crowd. Really, just a great show!

Joy to the World!. The highlight of my Thanksgiving Day in NYC wasn't the parade but this show. The Radio City Music Hall is spectacular as are the Rockette's and all who put on this magical performance. The living nativity brought tears to my eyes and I appreciated how the true meaning of Christmas was portrayed. This show puts the joy into Christmas! So festive, so beautiful in every way.

The Rockettes kicked it!. First thing you see when you walk into Radio City Music Hall is the beautiful chandelier. The live orchestra was great. The Rockettes were impressive, the Naivety scene was very special, and I also really enjoyed the procession of the 3 Kings to visit Jesus. The music was great. I was surprised at all the cameras that were used throughout the show taking pictures (including flash) and videos. Very casual atmosphere with people walking in and out during the performance and people talking. Snacks were super expensive. Fun Christmas show especially for families with children of all ages.
Roberto Carlos and the Rockettes. We saw tow shows in Radio City hall. We loved the facility and the staff is very friendly. The sound system is amazing!

Very Interesting tour; Even better Show! . Took the tour that I purchased online; mom, daughter and I all had a great time on tour so much we bought tickets to Xmas Spectacular the next night. Met and got a picture with a Rockette while on the tour as well. Highly recommend.

A beautiful place to enjoy a Christmas show. We went there for a traditional Christmas Spectacular show. The theater was huge and beautifully decorated inside out. The seats were comfortable and everyone had a good view of the stage. It's definitely worth a visit for everyone.

Christmas Specatular was truly spectacular.... Such coordination, beauty and powerful performance - all wrapped in one for celebrating the holiday season. Each individual performance was beautiful and the overall presentation was extra ordinary. Must do during the holiday season.
Outstanding show; worth the money. This was simply sensational. A sensory overload with the new electronic enhancements and special effects. Loved every minute of it.

Christmas Spectacular Show - Excellent Show/Disappointing Atmosphere. The show was absolutely spectacular. The Rockettes are amazing and we would love to see it again. What was extremely disappointing was the atmosphere. Since the theatre allows food during the show, it can be very distracting. We had a couple in front of us who must have thought they were at a Yankees game. Hot dogs, popcorn, pretzels, m&m's and they even had a mustard bottle. They were eating and talking most of the time. We noticed that there was a lot of chatter throughout the whole show. Many people came in very late and many adults were in and out during the show, both of which was distracting.Like other Broadway shows, we wish Radio City would close the doors at the opening of the show (and potentially have a better system of getting people in the doors to begin with) and to not allow food during the show. It would have made for a more overall enjoyable experience.

Loved the Christmas Spectacular. Although the show is basically the same as it has been for years it is always spectacular! The precision of the Rockettes is fabulous - a wonderful show to see when visiting NYC at Christmas. Loved the Nativity show with the live animals and the Parade of the Wooden Soldiers is always makes me smile. Beautiful building, very festive at Christmas. Wouldn't go every year, but if you've never been or haven't been in several years it's really worth seeing. Makes you tap your feet and want to sign along!

Christmas Program with the Rockettes. This show was absolutely spectacular! Kids of every age will enjoy it, and it sure put us in the holiday spirit. The costumes, the choreography, the songs, the lighting and special effects.... it was just breathtaking. I would go again, and I think it would make a great Christmas tradition for everyone. If I never get to make it there again, I will always remember and cherish our trip to the Radio City Music Hall! Just wonderful!
Christmas with the Rockettes. Awesome time in NYC at Christmas time seeing the Rockettes. It's a must see. We had a fabulous time.

"It's a Hell of a Town". If you have a chance to see The Rockettes or something else at this gorgeous Art Deco building , Don't miss it !!!You will feel like old NY society. Make sure you make it down the stairs to the rest rooms.

Christmas Spectacular . Went to the Christmas Day showing and it was simply incredible! I had never thought of going being a local myself but it was truly a memorable experience. Great show that I highly recommend !

Christmas spectacular was just that. We attended the Christmas spectacular on Christmas Day and it was truely spectacular. Flying snow flakes. Dancing Santas, two grand organs, a full orchestra, magnificent staging and an amazing 36 person kick line. The kids were enthralled. We loved it. You have to see it if you are here. Just get here early to get through the lines to get in.
What a Christmas Spectacular!!. We were there for the Christmas Spectacular show on Christmas Day. It's a wonderful show, at a wonderful venue. Suitable for families with kids of all ages.
Christmas Spectecular Show. Excellent shows, great scenes, best rockettees.We enjoyed the show, there were many scenes full of joys and great scores and musics

Beautiful building, show is overrated. We saw the Christmas spectacular, but it wasn't really all that spectacular until the end. The 3-D Santa sleigh ride is silly. The Rockettes are good at what they do, but they do the same thing all the time. The nativity at the end was absolutely beautiful and worth the price of admission.
Christmas Show. The show was spectacular and loved the Nativity show with the live animals. I have not been there, since the 60's but worth going to see the show.

very crowded. Nice place, showy of course. A lot of selling going on when you enter. Interesting murials and a great lihjting in the grand hall. The show is just smooth and well planned. It basicly all about the rockets of course. No difficult choreografies; lots of legs and such :) Nevertheless great entertainment. When you ar ein NYC at Christmas a definite must see.

Fabulous Christmas Show. the Rockettes and a large cast of support performed the Christmas spectacular, it was a good show, great dancing that included the nativity with real sheep and camels, definitely worth a visit
Super. Really a nice venue. We went to the Rockett Christmas show. This theatre is big, user friendly and well staffed. Show was great.
Fun Fun Fun!!. This is the most fun I've had in the city in a long time. Add the Stage door tour to this and you'll have an awesome day!!

Annual celebration. Spectacular Rocketts
Beautiful pageantry
Must see at Christmas
Loved the wooden soldier. Santa Claus and the 3 wise men bringing gifts

Christmas Spectacular is not to be missed!. What a wonderful show and venue. These dancers are such amazing dancers/singers/actors/athletes. The costumes were just as amazing. While visiting New York don't miss this.

A Christmas show that is well worth your time and money. The Radio City Christmas show has long been on my bucket list. As a young child, I remember my parents trying to get tickets for the family but they were sold out. I ordered my tickets about a month ahead of my trip to NYC. Even a full month ahead our seats were in the back. The place itself is a wonder with its ornate decor. The Rockets live up to their great reputation; however, my absolute favorite part of the show is the finale with the live camels and other animals supporting the nativity scene. It truly is a Christmas show. The one small drawback is the crowd. This is a very popular show and many people line up long before the doors open. In addition, the commercial part which sells every type of souvenir. It is a distraction from a wonderful show.
The ROCKETTES Christmas Show was AMAZING!. WOW! The show was incredible! The talent, the pageantry, the amazing choreography...the Hall itself! DON'T miss a chance to experience RCMH

Christmas spectacular. Excellent show. The technology is so much better now and they know how to use it. Much better then when I was a kid. Something for everyone and the nativity that closes the show was extremely moving.Dancing and singing excellent and of course the Rockettes make the show.

CHRISTMAS SPECTACULAR-THE ROCKETTES. Great, fantastic show. The weather, 60°F, was perfect on December 12, 2015 to be in New York and enjoy all of it. Being in NY during the holidays is an enchanted. Every one should have this experience at least once in their life.

Made the trip for this, and it was worth the effort1. We went for the Christmas show, and were not disappointed. Had never seen the Rockettes before in person - and they were great. The whole show was terrific, ending with the Christmas story they always do. This was a great treat - and we'll be back to see it again in future years.
Christmas Spectacular was stunning. We picked this show out of many available and we were impressed by the Hall of the venue and loved the show all the way, including the short 3D movie.

lovely building. I have been passed this theatre on a bus it looked
nice from the outside . I have only seen what it looks
Like inside on the Internet

Do not miss this Christmas event next year. I spoke with several New Yorkers and was told, "I saw that once". If I lived in New York, I would see it more than once. It was fantastic. Definitely, a must do! I had a seat in the first mezzanine, center. It was a great seat at a more reasonable price than orchestra.
Christmas show at Radio City is very entertaining. Great show and great theatre. Well worth a visit for the tour and catch a show. Drinks are pricey but so is NYC in general these days.
Excellent Show. Had booked to see the Radio City Christmas Spectacular show and it certainly was. The whole show was fabulous, the singing, the dancing and everyone involved.

Loved the rockettes. We saw the amazing rockettes Christmas show here. Awesome show,awesome venue. Drinks even came with glow sticks in!! Rockettes are true NYC at Christmas. Got bargain tickets from Times square ticket booth but would have paid more show was so good. Teenage daughter wasn't sure but she loved it!

The Real Santa!. The Christmas Show is incredible. Loved The Rockettes! Santa's 3D ride was lovely. The audience was people of all ages. Get there early as the security is very strict. It looked as though people with shopping were being turned away.

Amazing venue. Great for any show. Try to get any show at all at this venue. It is beautiful inside and all seats have excellent views of stage. Take time to look around lobby and other areas as the building is amazing.

Chrsitmas Spectacular. Went to the spectular this year. The 3D effects are amazing and the 90 minutes just flew by. I did think that the Rcokettes were featured less than in previous years...and didnt perform their standard kick-line dressed as santa's helpers
Christmas Show, for all ages. The Christmas show, is outstanding, and even, being almost the some show, it is a very pleasant evening, very inexpensive, and very good for the season

Terrific building and a great venue. We have seen many shows at the Music Hall.
The acoustics are terrific. The architecture is wonderful. Take the time to see a show there.
The annual Rockette's show is a tradition for us. They incorporate all of the features of the huge stage area.

It was a Wonderful Christmas!. The Radio City Christmas Show was so fabulous! It really puts someone in the Christmas spirit! I plan on making it a yearly event. My girlfriend had never been there and she plans on making it a yearly event too!!!
Rockettes Christmas show. The show was fabulous. Great time for all in the group. Our seats were great and the production was well put together.
The Rockettes Christmas Show. Outstanding! The Rockettes are great! The Christmas show was enjoyable and partly in 3D. We enjoyed every bit of this experience.

Christmas made Spectacular. Attending the Christmas Spectacular was, again, another fantastic and heart-warming experience. Our last visit was 4 years ago and wasn't really certain if we wanted to see another show for fear of having a repeat. Such was not the case, the show was much different but the message the same- Christmas is joyful !! What a wonderful show and our suggestion would be to reserve your seats early; best section of seats is the orchestra section (Orchestra 4) at least 12-15 rows from stage. Definitely do not want to be real close to the stage !! I'd also suggest forgoing the popcorn & soda....... no cup holder for cups of soda + is not your typical theater prices !! Save your money and snack afterward. Show is only 90 minutes but goes by quickly. You'll definitely depart with a warm, fuzzy feeling. WE LOVED IT and ready to go again

Christmas Spectacular Show @ Radio City Music Hall was Super Spectacular!. If you have never been to see a show at Radio City Music Hall, the Christmas Spectacular is definitely one to make the effort to see. The Rockettes are fantastic. It brought back sweet memories of a childhood visit with my parents. It is a perfect show for the whole family and it really puts you in the Christmas spirit. The 3-D glasses they handed out made the 3-D effect just perfect - Santa's sleigh was speeding through the skyscrapers of the New York City skyline and presents were flying out of his sleigh and it appeared that you could reach out and grab them. It is a must if you are going to New York in December. This show was approximately 90 minutes with no breaks. Your bags are checked before you go in and your are wanded by security at the entrance. They are serious about being on time, doors shut and the orchestra starts the show, so allow yourself enough time to get there and get in, because NYC at Christmas time is very busy and crowded.

Magical Christmas Spectacular. The theatre is stunning, beautiful and enormous. The Christmas spectacular was simply amazing, so professional and really entertaining. A must for anyone visiting NYC at Xmas.

It's the temple of entertainment and a destination of its own!. Not that I've travelled world wide, but I can't imagine any music hall or theater being on the scale and beauty of RCMH. You can spend time just marveling at this place before the show. The show is almost secondary to the theater itself. And it's in the heart of Manhattan!

Even Guys Will Like This. In planning our first NYC trip, I was told by many friends that I HAD to take my wife to see the Rockettes. While there were probably 10,000 things I would have rather done, I bought tickets for a great price on StubHub and saw the 9:30pm show on Friday. From our first step in Radio City, it was obvious this was historical and revered for a reason. It was really like going back in time to the 1920s, as everything was opulent and impressive. The theater was huge and the show was simply incredible. The precision of the dancers still confounds me, and the AV effects added a modern twist to a show that has not changed much in decades. They even had a 3D movie! Will definitely return and will strongly recommend that my friends take their wives!

Chrismas Spectacular Show. This is a must see once in your life. I think 9 and up would be the correct age. The show top notch. I purchased tickets on line from Ticket Master and thankfully I looked early in the day because I was required to activate my purchase before they became "tickets" it required me to "transfer" them which was slightly concerning because they directions were sketchy...but we succeeded and again the staff was amazing and let us in early to visit the downstairs while the other show was going on. Anything early that day was a blessing because it was 34 degrees outside. The staff in this venue was also working double shifts and they we still in great spirits. I wish the public was more respectful about moving around during the show. There was a lot of distractions throughout the show. If they are late maybe they should be forced to sit in the rear of the theater.

We were thrilled with Radio City Music Hall. Everyone has seen the Rockettes on TV. We decided we should see their Christmas Spectacular and we were glad we did! First, the entire facility is both beautiful and easy to visit, in spite of the huge crowds. There was efficient security prior to entering the building. Wow! Upon entering the Hall you see a spectacular chandelier. The concert hall itself was simply gorgeous! We were thrilled with both the visual beauty and content of the 90 minute show. There are backstage tours available which we would like to do next time. Remember that RCMH offers a spring- summer show as well so warm weather visitors should plan to attend a show, not just holiday one. This show was one of the highlights of our trip! Great for all ages.
Christmas Spectacular. Booked this at the last minute and so glad, it was amazing!!! The dancers were brilliant and the backdrops and attention to detail just awesome

Christmas Spectacular was Spectacular!. Went to see the Rockette's Christmas show. It was fantastic. I think it's now my new must do each year. Definitely worth the price of the ticket, which I bought ahead of time. I also bought the behind the scene theater tour, also worth the money.

Great Show. The show was wonderful! It definitely gets you in the mood for Christmas. Everything was so well done and amazing. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars had nothing to do with the actual show. The process of getting people into the theater is kind of a jumbled mess. In fact, I was a little nervous that the people behind me were going to get in a fight with a couple who had cut in front of about 100 people. This is the line for people WITH tickets, so I can't even imagine what it would be like if you were trying to purchase tickets. The other thing and the main thing that REALLY bothered me was they never held the latecomers. We had aisle seats and for a good 30 minutes after the show started they were still letting in late people who walked in front of all of us who arrived on time. It was super annoying considering the price we paid for the tickets. They didn't even make them wait to find their seats between acts.

Christmas Spectacular. Loved it! Great fun for all ages! The show included Santa, their incomparable Rockettes and reminded us all about the origin of the Christmas holiday. NYC highlights were all visited in a clever 'bus ride' through the city via video.
Great Locatoin. Went to RCMH for Christmas specalistor Special in Dec 2015, was a great location! Food/Drink good and ok prices, long time for bathroom was only complaint.
Rocketts Rock. We went to see the Christmas show spectacular and blown away by the storyline and 3D effect of Santa. The fall of the Toy Soldiers was impressive.

Take the tour!. We did not see The Rockettes live in action, but we did however take a tour of the place and had a blast! The tour guide Kenneth was informative and funny, he definitely made the tour. I should also mention that you get to meet a Rockette on the tour, so there's that! Something to keep in mind if you are looking for something to do in New York City on a rainy day.
NYC Christmas. Lived up to the expectations. We had a great time. Seats were great, service was fabulous, and show was great as expected. Highly recommend if in NYC at Christmas.

Not to be missed. I have seen this Christmas show 4 times and have yet to be disappointed. Such a wonderful way to begin the holiday spirit.The show is beautiful, entertaining and amazing dance skills.

Bucket List Item, check!. Took the family to see the show after planning to do so for about five years. It was worth the wait and was a great way to get everyone in the Christmas spirit. Loved the beautiful venue, projections onto the ceiling, Rockettes, snowflakes that hovered over the audience, 3D Santa arrival into Manhattan and LIVE camels, sheep and donkey! Highly recommend this show for all ages.

Wonderful Christmas show!. We have never been to this show before so not sure what to expect. All I can say is WOW! This show was definitely worth taking the train up from Baltimore. Although the show was only 1 1/2 hours long it was spectacular!!!

Spectacular!!!. Visited NYC to take 4 y/o granddaughter to see the Christmas Spectacular show. Worth the expense incurred as the show was everything expected. Thoroughly enjoyable for all ages. Magnificent scenery and the Rockettes were fabulous! Highly recommended!
Holiday Magic. It is crowded, but they soon disappear in their seats - a wonderful show for the family. Rockettes will knock your socks off...

Mesmerising. Dynamic Christmas show put on by the Rockettes, with a thrilling 3D ride through the skies/City of New York with Santa, and up to the North Pole, as Radio City Music Hall into a magical, immersive wonderland.
Lovely last night in NYC. We spent our last night in NYC at the Christmas Spectacular, couldn't have asked for a better she'd off :)
Rockettes!. A trip to NYC requires a visit to see the Rockettes at Radio City Music Hall. Awesome venue and spectacular performances.
Traditional christmas Fare. we went to the xmas show - it was very well produced colourful - Santa arrived via 3d glasses - good old fashioned Xmas fund

Christmas Spectacular at Radio City. We went for the popular Christmas Spectacular show at Radio City and found it quite interesting and entertaining. Performance by NYC Rockettes is the highlight of this show and is quite entertaining. It is advisable to book the tickets in advance as the prices go up very soon. This is located in busy Midtown and nearest subway is Rockefeller Station on 47-50 St and 6th avenue. Must visit the radio hall city area around Christmas to check on the lights and decoration.

One of the highligts of our week in Manhatten. The Christmas Spectacular was fabulous. The Rockettes were great. Huge fun, and something unique when compared to Broadways shows that can be seen in London and other big cities.

Radio city Rockettes christmas show. What a lovely place! The Christmas decorations were lovely, and the show very enjoyable , even though a tad expensive! I guess we could have waited for cheaper tickets from one of the ticket sales, but our itenery was tight and we didn't want to miss out on the show
A Must See. You have to do this at least once. It is great and the Christmas show is worth it. Do not miss it , it is a must do.

Christmas Spectacular is all that and more!. Fantastic show! Performers were all terrific, and the live nativity was truly awe-inspiring! Very impressive!! If that doesn't put you in the Christmas spirit, nothing will!

Very Good Shows. Probably the most popular show is the Christmas Show which runs from early November thru the end of December. It holds over 6,000 seats. Very close to Rockefeller Center, the ice skating rink, the Today Show, St Patrick's Cathredal and Fifth Avenue.

Christmas Spectacular was Fantastic!. We went to the Christmas Spectacular at the Radio City Music Hall... the show was fantastic! Very well done - sets were amazing and the danvers were awesome... the entire show was very well put together and very entertaining... it seemed like it was over so fast! That's the sign of a good show. One thing - we had second row seats - although it was nice to be close... we were probable too close... get seats about 10 rows back at least.
Christmas Spectacular Rockettes Show. A must see! The show has been up-dated from years ago. Great show for all ages. Really nice! We had great seats even in the 3rd Mezzanine!

A Christmas Treat. This is a real New York Christmas tradition. The show was fun and full of energy, despite the 10pm start time! You could say that parts of the show are a little "cheesey", but to be honest it was exactly what we expected. A great way to spend an evening at Christmas in New York City.

Great holiday show! . We went to the holiday spectacular show and saw the Rockettes! The show was done very well! Their are very talented performers and the show is suitable for all ages! We really enjoyed it!

Christmas Spectacular - You've Gotta Go1. It's the Christmas Spectacular - 3D glasses, Santa Claus all over the place, young families with small children, tourists, streamers, singing, and the dancing Rockettes. Arrive about 30 minutes before the show because of the long lines getting in - security checks. The show is about 90 minutes long with no intermission. DO NOT PAY FULL PRICE - just go to the TKTS booth for 50% off.

Great show: RadioCity Christmas Spectacular Show. Great show. Tickets are reasonable compared to the total value you get from the show. Make sure you get seating as close as possible to the stage. There is a huge line getting into the show. So make sure you arrive atleast 1 hour before the show to make it in time.Restrooms are clean and they have popcorns and light snacks on site.

Spectacular. A fantastic iconic building and home of the all singing all dancing Rockettes.The Christmas spectacular is just that - spectacular. It's full on synchronised dancing with up to 40 odd dancers on the stage at any one time.There are two pipe organs one either side of the stage concealed by curtains which pull back to allow the players to moved out towards the audience to warm them up before the show kicks off.It is a little bit American cheesy, but we are in NYC after all.The dancers are incredibly skilled and the sequence in the current show with the dancers dressed as toy soldiers is almost unbelievably perfect in execution and breathtaking.I don't really like song and dance shows, but I would recommend Radio City Music Hall to anyone.I also don't think you need to buy expensive tickets, I bought the cheapest at about $40 each and had a great unrestricted view in the gods and can't really think of a reason to shell out $100 or more for the top price tickets.A sight to see that I think you are only going to see here in NYC.A great visual treat that smaller children would just lap up.This is also a brilliant option for a show if English is not your mother tongue.
Spectacular is understatement. Took my 70 year old mom and two college age sons to the show. Wow! Words can not describe the beauty and sheer magic of the performance. Definitely a bucket list item

Rockettes! In 3-D!. No trip to New York is complete without seeing Radio City Music Hall, and especially the Rockettes Holiday Spectacular -- the lights, the music, the costumes, the sheer precision of those gorgeous dancers -- it's amazing and not to be missed. I began smiling as soon as the organist began playing and the curtain went up, and was still smiling 90 minutes later at the finale. A great show for young and old.
Christmas delight.. Went to see Christmas show. Very professional. Don't forget to get your 3D glasses or you miss out on Santa's sleigh ride.

Holiday Show Experience. I went to the Christmas Show that the RCMH put on and it was a thrilling experience. Would strongly recommend it. On the list of mandatory things to do in NYC, I'd put the Hall as one of those things. It's very impressive and up to date. Be picky about seating and prices. You don't have to pay an outrageous price.

Bah Humbug. A horrible experience for my family - don't go if pictures are important to you and you family. The objective of our trip is to celebrate our daughter's efforts in school, which has been a big challenge for her. With that said I bought front row tickets to the Christmas Spectacular show at 9:30. I planned to take a picture of her at the show, before the show, and periodically remind her with a picture what she accomplished and what the reward was. Yesterday we flew from Houston to NY, caught a taxi to the hotel, went to dinner and the show. When we got there one of the security guards confronted me to say I could not bring my camera to the show. I was openly holding a Nikon Digital camera with a 50mm lens. According to him it was a "professional camera". I was surprised because when we go to Texan games at NRG stadium they have spelled out a professional camera to be one with a lens longer than 12 inches, where mine was less than 3. I was then given the option to either see the show without a camera or leave. I was then told I could purchase a picture with one of the Rockettes. The hotel we staying at had a similar view even going further to say no telephoto or zoom lens, which it is not.This experience left a horrible taste in my mouth especially when someone sitting relatively close to us filmed a fair amount of the show and then told me I should have hidden my camera until I got to the metal screening. I wish we would have spent our time and money elsewhere and I would have given a lower score if I possible.

Christmas spectacular delivers!. It was a blast and well worth the hassles of NYC to see the radio city music hall Christmas spectacular. We loved every minute of the show. A quick walk from our hotel and we were there. Take your entire family if you want it's great for everyone. I will take my nieces next year for a great night of family fun.

Christmas Show. Saw the christmas show and was really entertaining, i think a little expensive for the legnth of the show, i guess its only worth a one of visit as it is the same show every single year which is dissapointing as i would go back again if it changed
Nice theater. Despite the age of the building, it's kept in great shape. Was there for the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. The staff was nice and efficient.

Great Christmas Show, but no variety from year to year. A classic is always a good thing, and that's exactly what Radio City and it's Christmas show is. The Art-deco style of the building remains unchanged, giving it that old classy feel. Walk into the bathrooms and it feels like walking back in time. They include an area for women to fix their makeup, and another area for lounging. It was quite interesting. The Christmas show was fantastic, from the high kicking Rockettes, to the Nutcracker performance, to Santa flying around NYC. I did see the show about 5 years ago, and it was the same show now as it was then. Tradition is good, but some variety would be nice.Definitely a must-see.

Wonderful Christmas Show!. We loved the excitement of the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Show. The special effects were excellent and the Rockettes were great. It was especially fun when the live animals came on stage. In addition to the fine show, we loved the beauty of the design of this iconic theater.

Christmas Show. Orch level (expensive) seats have poor view due to no elevation between rows so people's heads were always in the way. Lost the beauty of the long UNOBSTRUCTED line view of dancers, etc. A real BUMMER!!!

Over the top experience.. The Christmas spectacular was just that. It's a must for a first time visit to the city over the holidays. We lucked out with a connection to one of the Rockettes and got a backstage tour. Topped it off. Unbelievable how all the behind the scenes transformations are orchestrated. This was a highlight for my 12 year old granddaughter. If you have time, just ask and you may be able to luck out also.

Awesome Holiday show!. Went to the "early" show & it was jam packed. the show was spectacular & the performers were exceptional. Really enjoyed that the show contained live animals, that was a surprise!The only complaint I would have is the lack of bathrooms for both sexes, if you waited till the end of the show, good luck!!! & hope you have great bladder control! It took 20 minutes to finally get in the Men's room & about 30 minutes for the ladies, This I think is unacceptable, I realize it is an old building but for the price they charge, things should be better in this regard.Wewould go again, but I would be planning the rest room "run" a lot better, before show ends!

Its Showtime.... A year ago we visited Radio City Music Hall to watch the famous Rockettes perform their yearly Christmas Spectacular Show which was just breath-taking. RCMH is such a beautiful venue and is a real treat to watch such a beautiful show! We wish we were in NYC this festive season

Racio City Christmas Spectacular / City lights/Store window displays. Saw the Radio City Christmas Spectacular again this year. What a great show! I suggest seeing this show. Also you must see the lights and store windows. Macy's on 34th street was the best with #A Charlie Brown Christmas theme. Then you have to go 7nto Macy's Christmas Shop.

Christmas Spectacular is just that. The show is amazing!! It dazzled all from children to grandparents. The combination of music, dance, video, and electronics (no spoiler) was fantastic. It was a joyous hour and a half removed from the hustle and bustle. The show also featured and celebrated CHRISTMAS loud and clear. A true family memory.
Christmas Spectacular. We go EVERY year for this event. Always on my husbands Birthday. This year was one of the best. They changed so many of the dances and scenes it truly was SPECTACULAR ⛄️

Legs, Precision...Perfection!. We Americans are a young people when measured against the sweep of history. Our traditions are not as fastened as other areas of the globe, yet if one looks hard enough we can find them. The Rockettes who have been high kicking their splendid legs since the 1930s consistently deliver a Christmas Show within the magnificence of Radio City Music Hall each and every yuletide season. It is a show that is appropriate and enjoyable for every age group and is a sparkling example of why the denizens of the earth's most magnificent city make it something timeless--an American tradition!

Gotta see the Christmas Spectacular. The Christmas Spectacular is far from the best show playing in NYC at any given time, but it's a lot of fun and is a beautiful production. Plus, the interior of Radio City is quite special.

Loved the Christmas Show. My daughter, granddaughter, and I loved the Rocketts Christmas Show. We had seen it twice at the Fox in Atlanta. It was even better at the Radio City Music Hall. It was one of our favorite things about our visit to NYC.
Christmas show is amazing!!!. Took my family to see the Christmas show- we all loved it! It has something for everyone- great music, choreography, graphics, fun!

Trip back in time. GREAT VENUE and the tour was really good value, very well done and good fun, got to see behind the scenes and meet a Rockette, sat in the auditorium, admired the foyer and staircase and all the art-deck features.

Best show in NYC at christmas. We went to the Christmas show and were very pleased with the performance. We started with the backstage tour and then the show and it was well worth it to do both and in that order. The show was spectacular. I purchased "obstructed view seats" in the front row and was concerned. When we got there the only obstruction was for a few minutes when the orchestra was elevated on the stage and we couldn't see any of them except the few closest to us. But that lasted a few minutes and the rest of the show our seats were excellent. Check out the bathrooms on the first floor they are huge and so unique. The lobby was beautiful. We got in line about 30 minutes before showtime and spent maybe 5 minutes to get in. They obviously know how to move the clouds in efficiently. This was well worth the money.

Beautiful theatre - still in beautiful shape.. What is Christmas in NYC without a visit to see the Rockettes. This was my third trip to NYC, but the first time seeing the Rockettes. It is a great show! The skill of the Rockettes is spectacular. The auditorium is beautiful. I think the best seats in the house are "near front row" seats on the 1st Mezzanine level. 2nd Mezzanine is really good too. Having that upper view of the stage allows for a much better view of the precise choreography for which the Rockettes are famous!

Christmas Spectacular - Pros and Cons. Pros - The show is excellent. Every form of entertainment for all ages. Loved it. The Rockettes were superb as was all the supporting cast. lasted just the right amount of time. Cons - First let's talk security. Poor. they take a look in your purse but not a real thorough search. Couple in front of me were wanded as were we all but the baby and carriage..nothing. Hello..people doing these despicable things don't give a damn about whether they die or a child dies. Wand everything and everyone going in the theater!!Second..the gouging of prices for items within the venue. Water $5 come on! ..Then they have these cheap spinning Rockette toys which were most likely made in China for less than $2 ..Guess what Radio City charges..$25. Another overprice...candy. Backstage Tour - we unfortunately got a tour guide who wanted to be the next Henny Youngman. Except for meeting a very nice Rockette the tour is not worth it.
The Rockettes. Great venue to see a show or concert. Good acoustics and excellent view from anywhere inside. Have seen numerous shows there and never had a bad one.

Great show...do not miss it... Haven't seen this show in many years, so was hoping for the best. This show didn't disappoint. The Rockette's were terrific,as was the rest of the acts. We really enjoyed the performance. If you are visiting NYC, make time to see this show.

Really Spectacular!. I loved it, it was my first time. The show is for everybody, singles, couples, families with kids, the Roquettes are fantastic, perfect and the show is absolutely spectacular! A must see in NYC.

Go, Go, Go and see the Christmas Spectacular. Had an excellent few hours at radio city music hall and saw the Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes. A show that must be seen, for us Brits beware they start the show on time, and will not wait or hang around till all are seated, so grab your drink early and settle in for your Christmas experience. The Rockettes are amazing, You will leave with a smile on your face.
Don't miss the Rockettes !!. The show is amazing and a must see in NYC. The Music Hall was decorated for Christmas and it was beautiful

Another Really Cool Place to See in NYC. This is one of those must see sites for an NYC. Just the place it pretty fabulous to see. We saw the Rockettes for the second year in a row and they are well worth the show especially the Christmas show.

Christmas Extravaganza AMAZING. It was sunny outside in NYC but inside Radio City it was definitely Christmas. The show was amazing with fab special effects and the Rockettes were WOW. Would recommend this show to everyone if you are in NYC in Nov or Dec - not to be missed!!

Christmas Spectacular Was....Well, Spectacular. Of course you have high expectations when you go to such a seasoned, well produced, long time running show, however, the Christmas Spectacular blew my expectations out of the water. What an incredible show that included 3-D effects, live nativity, and all sorts of crowd engagement. Wonderful experience!

Radio city Christmas show. Get yourself some kids, seats in the theatre and relax and enjoy the Royal ballet meets the Tiller girls.Be transported through the Manhatten streets with Santa in your 3D glasses, then enjoy the different sets, from Santas workshop, through the parade of the toy soldiers to the nativity.And when the show is over take in the wonderful decoration in the theatre

The Rockettes are a Christmas Tradition!. I have been going to this show for 30 years and have never tired of it. The show is amazing, professional and exudes Christmas spirit. You must go if you have not been Thank you Radio City Music Hall & the fabulous Rockettes

Spectacular Christmas show...best ever. We went to the Christmas spectacular this week in NYC. Wow....it was great....the best we have ever seen there. Outstanding in every way. Great family fun. Certainly puts you in the Christmas spirit. Delighted to see the Christmas theme told without any holding back. There was an interesting "under theme" too that was encouraging. On stage, a couple times, there was a Salvation Army red kettle for Xmas fundraising prominently shown, but never mentioned. And in one of the scenes, a young boy is seen depositing money into the kettle. Very nice. The Spirit of Christmas. The shows are expensive, but well worth it.
Christmas Show. We shared our childhood delight of the Christmas Show with our children and now our grandchildren. It is part of the NYC holiday experience and great for sharing across generations.

You must see the Rockettes - Radio City Christmas Spectacular. I did not know what to expect, but the show was fantastic, I have been to a lot of production shows in Las Vegas, but this show is something to see. The live music, the Rockettes, the sets, all so well done. Purchase your tickets ahead to get best seating!
Christmas Spetacular. Amazing show! Very entertaining! The Rockettes and the rest of the cast members were terrific! Would definitely recommend the show to everyone !
Just go!. Fabulous! Rockettes were better than expected! Will make this an annual Christmas tradition! Just go - you'll be happy you did!
Beautiful building in NYC. We didn't get to watch a Christmas show! We would have loved to. But, the outside of the building with the Christmas décor was amazing. Such a beautiful site to see!

Rockettes Rock Out Christmas!. Radio City is a spectacular theater, massive staircases, and seating provides great views even from the third level seating. We saw the Rockets' Christmas Spectacular, a really good show for the entire family, music dance and a few skits. If you want to save a few dollars, buy your at tickets 4 tonight at a fraction of the cost.

One quick day in the city for Christmas. I took the train up from Washington DC for the day and saw the Rockettes at
Radio City Music Hall and did sightseeing, dinner, and went back home. Every minute was worth it and all was spectacular;

See the Rockettes & the Christmas Spectacular. I tried to plan our NYC trip to see as many free things as possible, with the exception of a broadway show. We ended up getting $30 tickets from TKTS in Time Square a few hours before the 8PM Christmas Spectacular show. It was awesome. The lobby was magnificent and the theater was nice.The show could have done without the 3D glasses/show though. That part wasn't that great.

OUR 13TH YEAR! MUST SEE FOR ANY AGE (both 60+, no children)!. FABULOUS experience for all ages, young and old! And while every year there are a few changes, it's always WONDERFUL!If fits your schedule, book ahead/take the Back Stage Tour prior to performance! And this gets you in the venue right after the tour- no longggg lines in the outside COLDDDDD weather! Plus you get to talk to a real Rockette (and get a badge!)... Or if not the Tour first, remember that the line forms on both sides, so lines are shorter on the north side of Radio City Music Hall (farther from Rockefeller skating rink/tree) as first timers don't know this tip!!!And book a reservation at the Del Friscos Grille before or after, it's just around the corner. Plus one of the booths in the front corner might get you a view of that AMAZING TREE- ask! But be prepared- this meal will NOT be cheap!!! 212-767-0371

Still the thing to do in NYC. This is one of the "must do's" when visiting NYC. It had been a number of years since I last went to see the Rockettes and after attending the show I wondered why I waited. The Christmas show is always special definitely a must see. GO See it!

The Rockettes Rock!. Found ourselves with some extra time and decided to see if tickets were available for an afternoon show. Picked up one of the coupons that people are handing out around the "TREE" and went to the box office. Got two orchestra seat tickets (13 rows back from the stage) for $89 each. What a deal. The show is wonderful, live animals, fire works, three D segment - just a lot of fun. If you want to see this show make sure you get one of the coupons before buying your tickets!

Well worth it. I'm not big on musicals, but I was definitely glad I went.We decided to see if we could get tickets and were lucky enough to get them for the next show. We paid under $40 per ticket and the seats were very good.The show itself is way more than just the Rockettes dancing. They do a good job telling the "spirit of Christmas" story, but actually also tell about the birth of Christ, which was very unexpected and I loved it.Go to this show!

A hassle but good experience. Took the family to see the Christmas Show with the rockettes and it was a very nice experience given this was our first time. My only problem was the show was too expensive. I don't think it was worth the asking price but good thing I found very cheap tickets for 4 on Groupon which cost the total amount of the asking price per person. Another thing is it was scheduled very late in the evening, (10 pm) where taking the train was a preferable option. We had to drive there because the train stops running around 10pm, then we had to find a parking which cost an additional $40+, pay a $14 toll, and walked all over the place to kill time while we waited for the show to begin. Other than all the hassle, the show was awesome.
A Classic. I've been 3 times since I was a kid and it never gets old! However, needs more bathrooms for the women at the very least. The lines are insane.

Absolutely the best. I had seen the Rockettes on tour but nothing beats seeing them perform in Radio City Music Hall. We were able to buy three front row seats from Ticketmaster less than a week before we left. To be honest, we should have been back a few rows because it was hard to see their feet but we could see their facial expressions. The show lasted 90 minutes and the time just flew by. The orchestra was wonderful and of course the Rockettes were superb. I did appreciate the manger scene at the end complete with a live camel. I would highly recommend attending.

Rockettes Christmas Production. This show is incredible! A tap number was performed and it is amazing that so many feet can tap at the exact same time and do so repeatedly. When ONE CLICK is heard, from that many taps, the definition of precision is ROCKETTES. I especially loved the signature "fall" of the "Tin Soldiers." I will endeavor to see them again!

The Christmas Production of the Rockettes is something every visitor to NYC should see.. The Christmas Show is awesome. The Rockettes really "rock"! You can have your picture made with a Rockette or Santa Claus, there are refreshments you can purchase and you can sit back and enjoy the spirit of Christmas. The use of the live animals completes the experience.
Radio City Christmas Spectacular. No need to purchase a very expensive seat....a balcony seat is just fine. Go early to look at the interior lobbies.

Unexpected great tour. Did this tour while we waited for our allotted time for the Rockefeller centre and it turned out to be great. Our guide was well versed in the history of the building and had many stories to tell.Loved the old structure and decor

What a great show. Went to the Christmas spectacular 14/12 8pm what a great show! The Rocketts were fantastic I felt like a kid again, all the cast were excellent really enjoyed santas sleigh ride (not giving anything away) well worth taking the family to see the theatre itself is beautiful the entrance is stunning had a great time would highly recommend this show.
Christmas Show. Excellent venue, see a Christmas show here last year and loved it. Lovely seats, great atmosphere, fantastic choice of venue.

We saw the Christmas Spectacular - not that spectacular . .. The show was not very exciting. More like a highschool dance performance. We still enjoyed our evening though and the Music Hall itself was stunning :)
Rocketts show was great during christmas time.. It was a great show. I love every bit of it. Dancers were great. Christmas spectacular by Rocketts was amazing.

There is NO other Radio City any place else !!!. Even if there is no show at Radio City while you visit NYC, make a point to come to the tour the have. It's only 1 hour and it's worth it. This Art-Deco building is an stoning place....if you come during Christmas Season don't miss the Christmas show..it will be an experience you will never forget. The best of all it's the location...1 block from famous Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick Cathedral, 5th Avenue, Broadway (just 2 blocks) ..you will be in the right in the Center of the City. It's another place not to miss in NYC.

Must see Christmas show. Buy tickets ahead of time. Lines are long to get inside. Must go through a security check. Bathroom line in the bottom level before the show was horribly long, about 75 people. Second mezzanine had a shorter line. Show was awesome. Well worth it. I loved it.
Fabulous. The Christmas show is fabulous. Definitely one of the highlights of our trip. I would recommend this to anyone - male or female any age. Loved it!

Mesmerizing. A must for everyone's bucket list! A New York classic, don't miss a chance to visit Radio City! The Christmas Spectacular is a sure win year after year. Not only is the art deco interior stunning but the design of this venue was far ahead of the times with technology such as the complex hydraulics. Thank you Mr. Rockefeller for your vision.
Christmas Show. It's show is amazing!! You need to arrive at least two hours early to beat the lines. Prebuying your tickets is also a good idea.

Brilliant don't miss this. Saw the radio city Christmas show with the rockettes If you can get a ticket see this show they are truly amazing The timing of the rockettes dancing is second to none this is a good family show to be enjoyed by all
Rockettes. As usual the show was fantastic (Christmas Show) Rockettes were super, seating was lovely, sound and lighing perfect
Fantastic Christmas event. Really enjoyed experiencing a New York tradition. Was a true spectacle to watch. The dancers or rockettes were so precise. Well worth a visit but very busy.
Fun Fun Fun. Went to see the xmas Rockettes, show was great but a little overly religious. Long lines to get it. Beautiful theater!!!!

christmas show is WONDERFUL!!. We took 6 of our grandchildren, ages 4 to 14, to the show. They all LOVED it. The older ones were really into the orchestra and the precision of the dancers. The time just flew by. After we walked to the Rockefeller Christmas Tree. Very nice evening.

Less Interesting than Hoped. We saw a show at Radio City Music Hall. The sound was good and stage was easy to see. Unfortunately the show was not very interesting. Generally all areas were clean. We did walk some short time through the Hall, but there was not too much to see.

Christmas Spectacular was Great!. My wife and I went to see the Christmas Spectacular for the first time, and we both thoroughly enjoyed it! 14 different scenes in 90 minutes and the time flies by! Music, singing, dancing, animations, lighting, and even some drone snowflakes! Only Scrooge would fail to enjoy this!

Brilliant Family Show. We took advantage of reduced price tickets to see the 2015 Christmas Show.It is unashamedly schmaltzy but tremendous fun with terrific 3D effects,and faultless dance routines from the legendary Rockettes.It was surprising to see the live camels and sheep in the Nativity tableau which was beautiful and quite moving.
I loved every minute of it!
Amazing !!!!. This is a must see, so beautiful and the rockets are awesome, we loved the show, would definitely go back again!!!
My Bucket List. Nothing like Radio City Hall and the Rockets. Cant give it a high enough. I hope to return next year.
ROCKETTES. Greatest 2015 Christmas Show on Broadway, lice animals, too many Santa's to count them. Legs higher that you or I can kick in unison!

Rocketts. I tried to read reviews on where to seat at Radio City Music Hall and could not find any. We sat in the 11th row in the middle which was excellent seats. The only seats that might not be good are the far right and left on main floor. Just because you are at the end of stage. It is so worth the money for good seats. We went on a Sunday morning at 9 am and the left side about first 8 or 9 rows were empty, so if you are a last minute Sally and don't care if you see it or not check out discount tickets. We did get tickets so that we were sure to see it.

Christmas Spectacular.. We went to the Christmas Spectacular for a Sunday matinee. The show, no matter what seats you have, is amazing. I had not been there for more than 20 years, and though there are now laser lights, and 3-D glasses, the "feeling" of Christmas is still the same. My adult daughter and I loved it! First of all, being in NYC at Christmas time is a wonderful experience in itself. All the beautiful decorations, the Rockefeller Center tree, Times Square all lit up, is beautiful. Radio City Music Hall is an iconic building, just gorgeous with all its splendor, chandeliers, soaring ceilings, lush carpeting. The show was beautiful from start to finish! The orchestra was fabulous, rising up out of the pit and playing Christmas carols. Santa, with his booming voice, and the children who sang and danced, were wonderful. There were awesome special effects with laser light, a time for the 3-D glasses, where snowballs came flying at you, and Santas sleigh flew around the world. Best of all was the world-famous dancing precision Rockettes who were involved in numerous musical extravaganza productions - they were wonderful, particularly in the Tin Soldiers number that they have been doing for years. Lastly, the touching live Nativity, with the three kings, live camels and donkeys, Mary, Joseph and baby Jesus. This was a five star production, and I hope to take my grandchildren next year. Tickets are pricey, ours were $75 and we were in the third mezzanine, and of course there are programs, and souvenirs, and food to buy, but it's a fabulous experience and I'd recommend it for anyone of any age who loves Christmas.

Christmas with the Rockettes. When in New York...we bought tickets through the Concierge at our hotel and we had great seats. Radio City was spectacularly decorated for Christmas (can't miss the Christmas Tree chandelier in the center of the lobby)! We also had our picture taken with Santa Claus as well! I had never been to see the Rockett's, so I did not know what to expect. It was AMAZING!!!! I would recommend this show to anyone who wants to go and have a great experience!

WOW!! Christmas Spectacular really was spectacular!!. I hadn't been to the show since I was a kid - 40 yrs ago.Took my family, had great seats on the floor (bought on stub hub).It is gorgeous outside, in the lobby, in the theater, and everywhere!Stunning place!The show was SPECTACULAR!! The sets, costumes, scenery, ceilings, effects, and on and on!!Everyone has to go see this!The moving bus scene was incredible!How they change stage sets (large and involved and so detailed) while a curtain is momentarily down is amazing!!The girls are beautiful, the choreography is remarkable, and the voice and sound and music are all fantastic!!MUST SEE!!!

Christmas Extravaganza. Wow!. Wow! I am usually sort of a "Bah Humbug" type when it comes to Christmas. And I don't like dancing so much. But I took my wife to the 5 o'clock show since it has been on her bucket list for quite some time. I have to say though I loved it. The venue, costumes, the dancers, the music (especially the twin pipe organists) made for a fast and energetic 90 minutes. The precision of the choreography is astonishing. We were in the second row but I wish we were farther back to take in more of the big picture. Santa's 3D experience is a fun touch, as are the streamers they shoot from the right side as you look at the stage. The ice skaters were also incredible in their one brief number. I highly recommend this show to anyone who is thinking of going. I didn't look at my watch a single time when we were there. Did I say WOW yet?!

Perfect spot for a short trip. Came to New York on a weekend getaway. We were able to catch the Radio City Christmas Spectacular. It was perfect because there was a 9 am show, so we were able to see more shows. I wish the staff had been a little more on the ball in getting people in because we almost missed the start and there was no reason it should have been that close.

Kick it up at the ROCK. In addition to seeing several shows at the Center in which your eyes never leave the stage, we highly recommend the back stage tour. The stage technology, once a wartime secret, meeting a Rockette-WOW, how shows are handled and all the other details of the production are explained. There are additional points of interest in the timing and construction of the Center, all worthwhile. At our visit we saw Ms Hudson rehearse for the Tony awards. The time slot below did not permit us to enter the real date.

The Amazing Rockettes. WOW, the Christmas Show is a must see for Children 6 and up it is such an amazing show my favorite part was the Tin soldiers falling so syncronized. Santa looks and sounds ligit, Loved every minute of it

Wonderful Christmas Spectacular. Although the tickets are not cheap ($175 for the first mezzanine) it was a wonderful show. An absolute Christmas must at least once in your life. The Rockettes continue to be amazing.

Great Place to see the Christmas Spectacular!. We went to see the Christmas Spectacular recently and had a great time. The Hall is large and holds many folks but it seemed as if all seats had a great view of the stage. The Rockettes were outstanding and Santa really made the show. Great place to bring your family for the holidays!

Spectacular NYC Vist and show. The Christmas Spectacular was just that! My son,11 year old granddaughter and I all enjoyed the show which changes yearly. Last one I saw was 12 years ago. Visibility is good almost everywhere. We were happy with reasonably priced second mezzanine seats. Be aware there are a lot of tempting but expensive things to buy.

Christmas spectacular. Beautiful theatre White the mist gorgeous chandeliers. Love our trip here to watch the Christmas spectacular show with the amazing Rockettes. Great views , comfortable seats. Totally recommend.

Hadn't changed in years!. I loved walking around that area as the sign still looks like it did 50 years ago. This iconic building has such charm and flair about it. The tour is also very neat as it takes you being the scenes where we got to meet a Rockette. Great half day spent at Radio City Music Hall!
Love Radio City. The acoustics, the architecture, the feeling of a NYC moment, the intimacy. Great place for a show! Iconic NYC!

Radio City Christmas Show is Spectacular. The show was fantastic. We had seats close to the stage and it was a treat to be there. It is a traditional rendition of the Christmas story along with a hearty Santa Claus story interwoven into the production. If you are looking for a non Christian rendition or a Politically Correct 'holiday show', then you are in the wrong place. The Rockettes were awesome, the choreography and costumes were wonderful, and the orchestration put you right into the holiday spirit. There is even a 3D number where Santa is flying around NYC. Make sure you get your 3D glasses before you are seated.The only knock on the entire experience was the line to get into the venue. Allow about an hour if you want to get into the theater with time to get a beverage and a snack. We barely made it in there before the show started. They had us line-up along the side of the building, and it stretched down the street and across the side access to Rockefeller Center. Plenty of opportunity for people to cut into the line as it wasn't clear where it ended and how many lanes wide it was to enter. The event staff were kind and tried to keep things orderly, but once it got close to showtime the patrons weren't interested in getting on the back of the line. This being NYC, I wouldn't be surprised if tensions rise and patience is tested. Once you get past security checks, then your frustration shifts to enjoying the show.This is one of those shows where you know the story doesn't change, but it just puts you in a Great Christmas spirit. I could definitely see how this can become a family tradition, and one where the kids would be totally entertained. Merry Christmas!
The Rockettes Rock. What a show they put on here. The lines were crazy the whole time we were in NYC. The Hall itself is also extraordinary! I would highly recommend this to anyone visiting NYC>
The radio Christmas Spectaculor The Rocketts. We watched the Rocketts radio Christmas show Which is a MUSTThe place seats 6000 people, The show was great All of it.
Saw the Rockettes. Great Holiday show! Def put me the season! The place is so clean, so glamorous! You feel like a big deal seeing a s how there.
Elegant Hall. This is a must visit place in NYC. Its art deco elegance is worth a visit. I go every time that I have visit in NYC.
show. went to see the rocketts christmas show last week,it was fabulous,beautiful theatre,helpful friendly staff.recommend it.

Christmas Spectacular Wowed Us!. My husband, 6 year old son and 1 year old daughter and I visited Radio City's Christmas Spectacular this December. We were seated in second mezzadine...row A. WOW! This show was by far the best show I have ever seen. The price is well worth it. It was 90 minutes with no intermission and entertained both of my children! If you are visiting New York, YOU MUST SEE THE CHRISTMAS SPECTACULAR! You won't regret it. Bravo!

Annual Christmas Show 2015. We enjoy going to this show every few years when we are in the city. It gets you in the mood for the holidays. There is good variety in the music and the show. The Rockettes dance multiple times, they have an ice skating rink for 1 number, there are live animals-camel, donkey, sheep. They had 3 d glasses for the number where Santa takes off for New York and it makes the sleigh come out into the crowd which was fun. Look for ticket specials online, at Travelzoo and if you are in NYC and around Rockefeller Center they may have staff handing out coupons. We got our tickets about 2 weeks in advance via Travelzoo for about 50% of website prices. They also offer ticket specials online very close to show time as they want to fill the seats. Earlier shows are usually cheaper and have more seats they want to fill and are often discounted close to showtime.You line up outside for the show so be prepared to wait for entry. They recommend arriving an hour before and it is a good idea. They come through the outside lines and scan tickets but they do search bags at the door so it takes a while to get in. They have concessions upstairs and down and it is mostly geared toward children with lots of candy. As usual the women's restrooms have long lines and you need to allow waiting time ( 15-20 minutes). They also offer some fun toys for the kids as take aways so just be prepared. You are directly across from Rockefeller Center which offers subway access and lots of food and shopping choices. We came by subway so I cannot address area parking.

Great time, event for NYC Local. I've lived in NYC for 12 years now, and have seen this a few times. It is always good! I usually stay away from the tourist things, but when family visit this is a good time and family friendly. The dancing is always on point, and very entertaining. Drinks are a little pricy, as other broadway shows, $12-$16, but thats NYC for you. Get there early as you have to go through lines of security…even if you are a ticket holder.

A Christmas Holiday must!. We generally go to NYC in early December for a birthday celebration. And we always take in the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall. We have seen it many times. Just the grandeur of RCMH is worth seeing. But that setting along with a fabulous holiday production is guaranteed to kick your Christmas spirits into high gear. The Rockettes are amazing!

Christmas Spectular. A great show with loads of fun surprises. Loved seeing the Rocketts! My favorite dance number with them was the wooden soldiers where great precision and control is key. An awesome experience.
What an amazing show!. We went here to see the Christmas Spectacular and it was breathtaking! I would advise anyone to go and see it,you won't regret it!
Excellent should have visited before. The Christmas Spectacluar with the Rockettes is amazing. The show is stunning, I only wish we had visited in previous years. Inside Radio City is beautiful.

Amazing Christmas spectacular. Been there 3 weeks ago for Christmas spectacular. Must say was amazing. Tons of people so if you go there with young kids go straight to the bathroom and goodie shop first. Strollers stay on a designated area but keep in mind you should take out everything from them so be prepared to carry your things with you.Our seats was in row BB, very close from stage. For better complete view recommend 2 rows behind tough, middle seats. Didn't see booster seats available.Other than that, show was as it says "spectacular"

Christmas Spectacular at Radio City. Went back again to NY this year around december and decided to attend the Christmas Spectacular show. It was splendid! A little expensive but worth every single penny. RCMH itself is wonderful and stunning, got great service and the show with the Rockettes was solid perfect. 10/10, would visit it again and would definitely attend another show.

2015 Christmas Spectacular.. If I am in NYC late November/December I unashamedly go solo to a performance of this show! Some favorite elements remain each year, with new tableaus each year.The 3D effects seem to change each year, and seem to get better all the time. Any visitor has to see the Rockettes in action at least once in a lifetime!As to pricing, it can vary dramatically. Because it was not my first visit I chose a 'cheap' seat in the 2nd mezzanine, which was just fine! As the theatre is fairly steeply stepped most seats have great unobstructed views of the whole stage. My favorite is centre, 1st mezzanine.

Rockettes Christmas Show. The Rockettes Christmas Show at Radio City Music Hall is exceptional. The dancing, music and special effects were all excellent. The bold presentation of the true story of Christmas was refreshing. A truly traditional Christmas pageant that is not to be missed when in NYC during the holidays.

Xmas show. Excellent value would go on a Monday as it is not that busy. You can go to the box office to book seats to avoid cues. The dancing, sets and costuming top notch. I went with 3 stage managers from various parts of the world and they all were very impressed. We all thought it was amazing. We paid $60 for our seat in the mezzanine level row b.
Rockettes Show. Great seats loved the show. Very organized and time perfect with great organized event. Very easy to find and show great for all age groups.

Christmas Spectacular. I have been to NYC many times but this was my fist time going to Radio City Music Hall. We took our kids for the Christmas Spectacular. It was wonderful. We loved it and out kids loved it. Aside from the show - the building itself is incredible. It has a magical feel to it - like you are stepping back in time to a glamorous era. There was so much to look at and it is so well preserved. A beautiful place.

This is CHRISTMAS!!!!. There is nothing else like it. I have seen it many times and it keeps getting better each time. It's not just the Rockettes, Yes, they are wonderful, but there's so much more value added. Also, they openly use the word "Christmas" over and over in the production, and they back it up by providing one of the most exquisite Nativity segments (real animals, elaborate outfits, narrated story about the birth of Jesus, etc.) on the planet. Good for Radio City Music Hall.

Absolutely worth the trip. Went to see the Radio City Christmas Spectacular, as it is something we had never done in spite of living in NY state for 26 years.. It certainly was spectacular! Having seen the Rockettes on TV for years, I thought it might be somewhat boring. But, the live orchestra was great, and the Rockettes really blew me away with their precision. The Living Nativity: where else might you find sheep, camels and dwarfs together with seasonal music. And the venue. We had seats way up in the 3rd mezzanine, but still could see everything quite well, and the acoustics were perfect.I highly recommend putting it on your bucket list.

A repeat visitor loved it just as much!. Radio City Music Hall is an iconic NYC building and the Rockettes never fail to set the perfect tone for your Christmas celebration. I had seen them before, but think that only one number was repeated from the prior performance. The Rockettes were MARVELOUS and we all enjoyed it so much! I would even go so far as to say that I would go again!

Rockettes! More entertaining than expected!. My husband and I went to Radio City for the first time to see the Christmas Spectacular and it was a blast! Radio City is a huge venue, but it also seemed like, in the orchestra level, that there wasn't a bad seat in the house. We were in row VV and had a great view. It's a show perfect for young and old that puts you in the Christmas spirit. The synchronization of the Rockettes was awesome! We both had a great time, with my husband enjoying it even more than he expected. We'll be back in the future!

AMAZING- Christmas Spectacular. If you are in NYC for Christmas you must do the Radio City Christmas Spectacular. This is a Christmas MUST!! The show was amazing and even my husband said it was the best show he has been too. Great for Adults date night or with kids!

Flawless. This is the most spectacular venue I have ever had the pleasure of attending. The building is a flawless example of Art Deco design and its size is staggering. We were here for the Rocketts and it was fabulous. We enjoyed the entire performance and thought it was perfect for all ages.

You have to go once or twice in your lifetime!. I went to Radio City with my two granddaughters and my daughter and haven't been here since my daughter was 8 or nine. That was about 25 years ago. Radio City still does the trick. The kids, 6 and 8, were awestruck and mesmerized by the entire show. Although the concessions and picture with Santa were outrageous, the show is wonderful.
Magical. We saw the Christmas show and all I can say is wow. Beautiful theater, wonderful show. We will definitely return.

Just --- Spectacular. Not to be missed - I think every seat is a good set - We were on the second mezzanine and the view was fine. for about 1/4 of the Orchestra Seating price.The show is so prefect! It is truly a Christmas Spectacular. I'd attend again -- and again.
Fantastic Show,. Great show, fantastic special effects. Full on stage orchestra. Worth it. Appealing to all, if if not celebrating Christmas. Fun for the entire family

Great performance in an iconic place. We went to see the Christmas Spectacular. It was an amazing experience and a phenomenal show, but you definitely have to be prepared for all the children kicking the back of your seat and talking during the performance.
Excellent venue for Show. Saw the Rockettes Holiday Spectacular here (see separate review) and it was amazing. Beautiful venue!

A great Xmas show !. Being someone who tends to follow the "Humbug" attitude towards Xmas but married to someone who is a Xmas lover I decided to book the Christmas spectacular when in Manhattan. What a pleasant surprise ! The show only lasts an hour and a half and opened with a 3D flight through Manhattan with Santa on his sleigh. The following Disneyesque production consisted of dancing Santa's, Rag Doll's and a spectacular Toy Soldier routine by The Rockettes. Not missing the true message of Christmas the show ended with a not too long nativity piece with real camels, sheep and a donkey. Dare I say that I left the theater into the bright lights of Rockefeller plaza with a slight Xmas glow about me.The theatre is large and well managed and all the staff were friendly and very helpful.

Radio City Music Hall / Rockettes. Spending the weekend in NYC and visiting the Radio City Music Hall venue, we had had an opportunity to see the Rockettes. It was called the Christmas Spectacular !!! This is an amazing auditorium and the seating is just really generous in trying to see the show. The audio and visual was second to none and the show itself, well...... the choreography was the best ever. Bring your family or come as a group, you wont be disappointed. Book well in advance though, the lines are long.

Christmas Spectacular best suited to kids. RCMH is lovely, the sound amazing, the staff welcoming and friendly. Was literally in last row of balcony and could see and hear perfectly. Seats are comfortable, rows are roomy. No complaints about the venue or staff.Merchandise and photos expensive but photographer was good and photo with Rockette in her Christmas costume was a fun but expensive vacation expense. Bought 8x10, 5x7 and 4 wallets for $50The Christmas show is sweet and feels nostalgic, but it seems long even at only 90 minutes, the orchestra if fantastic, the Rockettes of course are stunning, The Santa host is entertaining and a stand out for me was the funny Nutcracker segment with giant teddy bears.Overall though the show seems oddly boring for adults and kids alike....most of the children were restless and a lot of adults played on their phones which brings me to my only but huge complaint.......there is zero enforcement, at least in the balcony, of no recording or photos....there was no announcement about it so assume it is allowed.....that needs to change! People used flash, the held up their phones, they didnt silence them and one woman took a call in her seat with an usher right there. Its disruptive as can be and needs to be addressed
