Great Show. It was a great show! It had everything you can think of in a show....even live animals. The dancers are amazing! I would suggest to go early because you line up to get in at the side of the building. You need to go through security to get in the building so try not to take a large bag/backpack. Have your ticket ready as you get up to the door.

Rockets - Amazing Stage. Went to see the famous Rockettes here and certainly didn't disappoint. Hard to not feel festive at this event and amazing Christmas tree on the outside near the entrance. The stage performs amazing tricks and no expense is spared on the place. You can do a tour of how all the magic works too which we didn't get time to do but would be great to see.

Icing on the Cake. This was our first trip to NYC. And this was the show we decided to see. My husband loves Christmas music. I know he loved the show- since being home he has looked up on the internet the history of the show and the Rockettes! It truly was a great way to end our trip. Thank you.

Great way to get into the Christmas spirit. Entertaining and a New York City classic. It seemed a bit slow at times with some of the individual numbers dragging on longer than I would have liked, but I enjoyed the music, orchestra, costumes, and dancing. The "tin soldiers" dance act was by far my favorite and the most entertaining. Definitely worth it and a great way to get into the Christmas spirit.
Christmas show. Went to the Radio City Music Christmas show. It was amazing as always. The dancers were great along with the singers. Technology was used to enhance the experience.

A Christmas Tradition. My mom and I have been going to this show every year for as long as I can remember and it never gets old. Everything about this show is truly spectacular; from the orchestra to the wonderful choreographed Rockettes to the beautiful costumes. Not to mention the beauty of Radio City Music Hall. The show flows seamlessly from one scene to the next. It always amazes me how quickly the Rockettes can change customers (and there a lot of changes). My favorite scene is The Parade of the Wooden Soldiers. Just love how they all fall on each other at the end of the scene. Also love the 3-D effect in the beginning of the show and how they incorporate the true meaning of Christmas. Of course Santa makes a visit. The 90 minute show (no intermission) goes by rather quickly. A must see!!

A Marvellous Christmas Show.. I was initially quite sceptical about this, as I imagined it would be like some kind of old music hall show, worn at the edges. I couldn't have been more wrong! The state-of-the-art 3D beginning was breathtaking and the effects onstage were only beaten by the eye- popping, perfect dance routines. I'd rather not use the old 'a show not to be missed' comment but this is exactly that! This show appeals to any age group and will not disappoint. The scale of Radio City Music Hall is vast and, to give some indication of seating, we were on seats ORCH4 D401 and 402 giving a superb central, unobstructed view of the action, some distance in front of the balcony overhang above.

Radio City Music Hall. Every one needs to see the Christmas Show at Radio City. Rockettes are as usual terrific and so is the show. Special whether you live in the Tri-State area or visiting from a distance.
Huge place with great seats and sound. The place is huge, ans the seats ae very comfortable and the quality of the sound is great. Was there for the Radio City Christmas Spectacular ans it was great.
A Christmas Extraveganza. The Rockett show is both entertaining and beautiful. You will be in awe of the precision dance routines. Excellent show for all ages. A must see.
The show must go on.. Great dancers, awesome. I don't know how they change their costumes so quickly! The show will defiantly get you in the Christmas spirit.

Thought I would hate it, but I was proven wrong. Thought I would hate it, but I was proven wrong.... The guida called Naomi was excellent, the history was very interesting, the art deco was fantastic. Got to meet a Rockette (I had never heard of such a thing before) and was amazed to see what the competition was to secure a place (400 applicants for 4 jobs). The skill of the dancers is truly spectacular and the show was really great. Even if you don't like musicals (like me) treat yourself to the show and you will not regret it. However, I was upset at how badly behaved the audience was. People arriving 30 mins late for the show and still being allowed admittance. People talking all the way through, folks seemingly more interested in feeding their stomachs than paying attention. The orchestra was superb, I thought the organists were a little heavy on special effects and low on playing anything of real difficulty. I suspect they are as high quality as everyone else and were just told to play such awful music by the management
Rockette xmas show. Fantastic. Great fun. Great costumes. Wonderful. The Rockettes are wonderfully choreographered and the 3D effect at the beginning is great.
Fantastic Christmas Show. We went to see the famous Rockettes in the Christmas spectacular. Good traditional family entertainment.
Christmas Wow!!!!!!!. Christmas Spectacular really lived up to its name.A must see while in this city. So full of fun and joy. Very professional and so entertaining.

Behind the scenes.. We visited this as it was near to our hotel and part of our City pass experience. I knew very little about Radio City which seems to be very special to New Yorkers and very much a part of their holiday tradition. We visited it during their Holiday Show and nearly turned away due to the vast crowd but we didn't have to join their queues. We were intoduced to the venue by Tabitha who enthusiastically gave us the history of Radio City. There was also a short film in very comfortable, original seats and a look at the rooms where the 'stars' hold their after awards parties. The highlight was to meet a real Rockette who is a dancer who had wanted to join the cast since she had visited as a child! We had our photograph taken with her too as a keepsake. It was a special time to visit due to the Christmas Show as the crystal tree chandelier and decor were stunning. Well done New Yorkers for saving Radio City - we really enjoyed our visit and the staff were really great.
Christmas Spectacular. great show to get you in the Christmassy mood, long queues would be the only disadvantage , but it moved quickly enough
December in nyc. Great Christmas Spectacular. Even if not seeing a show this is a must see landmark. Good location to Rockefeller Plaza

Love the Rockettes!. We went to the Christmas Spectacular. The show was amazing so full of energy, beautiful sets, special effects, and of course the dancers are incredibly talented! The venue is so full of history and grandeur, we love to just spend time in the lobby! The only drawback is that they allow non-flash pictures and videos so you have to deal with rude people holding their phones up and blocking your view. Would love to see them change to no pictures/videos at all since so many people have no manners.

Magical Experience. The last time I had been to Radio City, I was 12 years old. As a now 40 year old and a mom, I LOVED visiting Radio City and seeing the Christmas Spectacular. What a wonderful experience. This will be a holiday tradition for years to comes Just a magical!

Rockettes are incredible! But security/ushers are terrible! . We went for the Christmas spectacular and it was incredible!!! One thing that was very surprising and very unfortunate was the ushers literally didn't care who'd be walking up and down the isles blocking everyone's views. Especially the lower level where people pay extra for good seats. Ushers did nothing about sitting people down or telling people not to block isles! Buy middle seats because anything on the sides suck! If ushers would just do their jobs and wait for a break in the performance to send people down it would make it a little more classy and enjoyable! Couldn't even see the end bc this old grandma was standing right in the middle of the isle doing nothing!

Amazing!. We saw the Rockette's Christmas Spectacular and it was indeed. Not only do they do a fabulous job I love the fact they incorporate the reason and meaning of Christmas in the show. See it asap!
Great Show to get u into the Christmas spirit.. Wonderful show,with lots of awesome dancing, sets, and costumes. It never gets old! The Rockettes are unbelievable. Great for all ages!
Legendary, what else can you say! Must see if you are in NYC!. It is an amazing, historical place. You must see it if possible while visiting NYC, home of the Rockettes...
A classic. Took my grandchildren to see the Christmas show. This is a must do for this kind of trip to the city. Just wish I bought tickets on the first floor.

Rock Solid Message of Christmas!. Are you looking to start a tradition and savor memories that will last a lifetime?The show is magical! The script, stage, props and theatrics were amazing right down to the ushers. The Rockettes take such pride in their accomplishments, as they should. Their costumes, routines and facial expressions are the epitome of perfect. The old world charm of glam transports you back to the 1930's yet the modern twists will make your heart swell. From drones and animals to lighting and special effects, young and old will be mesmerized! Tips: Get on the e-mail list and buy your tickets in the summer when it is B1G1. It was a better price and seats than the groupon deal.When you pick your seats sit on the right hand side, when you are looking at the stage. They shoot streamers and snow from that side and it makes it more spectacular. Like up early on the side of the building and you can get in to get settled before the mob of people hit.Don't bring any drink. They don't allow it if its opened. They use a wand to check for illegal things and always check your bags. Be alert and ready to cooperate to make the lines move faster.

Rockettes show was Amazing!. Saw the Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes and it was amazing! From the costume changes, to the 3D portion of the show, to the 3 Kings march to baby Jesus, I would definitely recommend this show! The venue is pretty spectacular too! The huge chandelier in the lobby makes for some pretty great photos!

Ninety minutes (or there about) of pure entertainment. If you have only time or money to see one show in NYC - look seriously at this Christmas tradition. We smiled, laughed, clapped and sang our way through this production. Thank you to the lovely Rockettes, the singers, the organists (amazing) the band, the set designers, the makeup artists, the costume designers and of course the choreographer(s) and all the countless staff I am not naming - what a great time you gave us.
Radio City Christmas Spectacular!. This was great! I've heard about this all my life so it was fun to go see. It was definitely worth the wait! I highly recommend for anyone to go see the Rockettes!

Glad to return!. It had been probably 2 decades since I last saw the Christmas Spectacular, if I have the title correct. It was a great show, incredible performance and very professional. Highly recommended.

Tradition and Memories. My family and I have been to see this show many times over the last forty years .It's always a spectacular show . However I would also stress ... that you plan on sitting your children on your lap as the layout of the seats will block their view if there is an adult sitting in front of them. I would also like to add that the current ticket pricing is sadly going to eliminate many families as it is no longer affordable. The concession stand pricing is also outrageous ...$ 5.50 for a bottle of water . I am prepared to pay what ever I have to...my thoughts are for some who might miss this experience due to corporate greed.

Rockettes Rock It!. We saw the Christmas Spectacular featuring the Rockettes, and it was fantastic. It was better than I imagined. The story was great and true to the spirit of Christmas. Everything was awesome. I would highly recommend seeing this show to anyone visiting New York.

Always A Classic. Bringing the wife and kids to see the Rockettes is always special for them. The building is a long missed relic from the golden days of NYC with great architecture and a traditional feel. If you are in town during the holiday season, you need to visit and see a show. You will never forget it.

Pleasantly surprised. When I was told that we had tickets to the Christmas special at Radio City I was a bit apprehensive but my fears were unfounded.This show is of a song and dance nature but is performed in such a way that it is suitable for children and adults.With a mixture of technology and expertise the routines were exciting and interesting and I found the whole show most enjoyable.Would thoroughly recommend it.

magical. A must see to enchant the child in all of us is the Christmas Show! High kicking beautiful Rockettes, stunning sets, live animals in the glorious Nativity scene. And, of course Santa Claus! A 3-D number were you "fly" with Santa on :Christmas eve.
Rockettes at Christmas. Can't beat a visit to Radio City during the holidays. First visit to NYC during the holidays. Radio City is beautifully decorated inside and out. Highly suggest.

Great Christmas Show. The Rockettes were fantastic. We had good seats in the mezzanine, and could appreciate all of the dancers and music from that distance. Non stop show, and would reccomend it to all ages.
Christmas Show at Radio City. This should be on everyone's bucket list to see the Christmas show at least once in their lifetime. Show is fabulous and a definite must see.

Their Christmas Extravaganza was delightful!. We made last minute reservations for an evening show during a three day visit to NYC. It was a highlight! Incredible theatre and extraordinary show. Loved the Rockettes, of course, and the live nativity especially.

Memories and Reflections. Having been at Radio City numerous times over the past sixty years, I have never been disappointed. Growing up in NJ, I remember seeing the seasonal shows with my mom and siblings. As a young educator, I brought my students to the show. Then I attended with my own family, when my children were young. This time, I brought some retired friends from Upstate NY, who had never had that experience. We loved it just as much as I did when I was ten. There was so much variety and color and precision. Loved every minute!!!

Christmas at Radio City Music Hall. My dinner meeting was rescheduled Sunday evening, so at 7pm a raced down to Time Square to grab a last min ticket for the Rockettes Christmas Show. WOW. The show was a delight, and the Music Hall... stunning. The twin organs blew me away. I think this is a "must Do" in the city at Christmas!
Christmas Spectacular!. Just once in your lifetime if you can go, GO! It is one of the most memorable events I have ever attended.
Christmas show. The Rockettes were fabulous. Great for all ages! Very entertaining and a must for the Holidays if you are in New York.

Delightful Christmas Celebration. The Rockettes Christmas Show was absolutely delightful entertainment. This was the first time I've seen them and would definitely go again when I'm in NYC. It's entertainment for the whole family and fast-paced, so you don't wonder when it's going to end.
Excellent show - worth the money. Excellent show and would highly recommend. Clean and organized well. I will return for another show. Very classy and well done!

Grand Christmas Show. We loved the show. It was just what we needed our first night in New York. The live animals added a special excitement. Would highly recommend. Just one recommendation. Don't get in the three or four block line. Wait until the line has gone in. You have reserved your seat so it's waiting when you get there.
Go Rockettes, Wonderful Show. This was the greatest performance my wife and I have ever seen. Dancing great, Singing wonderful. Stage, animation and theater made for a perfect performance.

Christmas Spectacular show was amazing!. The choreography, the music, the songs, the acoustics, the seats, the ability to have snacks while watching was fantabulous. What was not great was that there is only one ladies lounge and one gentelmen's loung so imagine the throngs of folks wanting to go to the restroom!!!!

Amazing (as always!). A definite MUST if you're lucky enough to travel over the holidays! This was my second time to see and was even more amazed than years ago. Don't hesitate about seating....all seats are good!
Christmas Spectacular. The Christmas Spectacular is just that! The Rockettes are ah-mazing! The orchestra, dance numbers and costumes are fantastic!

Great Tour. The Radio City Music Hall tour was one of the best things we did in NY. Joyce was our tour guide and she was very personable, informative and knowledgeable. She's a great story teller and the time flew by. We didn't want the tour to end.

Great Show!. I saw the Christmas Spectacular on 12/9, and it was great! I sat in the 2nd mezzanine in section 200, Row G, and had a great view. The show was entertaining from beginning to end. The Rockettes really know how to put on a show! This show is good for young and old, families, couples, or even for a solo visit. You have to experience this at least once.
ROCKETTS ANOTHER WIN. Fourth time to see the Christmas Show. Exciting and what a walk away good feeling. GO EARLY as lines and crowds are overwhelming.

Best Christmas show ever. I have seen this show several times. This year was one of the best ever! Fantastic scenery, multiplying Santas, Buses filled with dancers, Wooden soliders marching in tandem, a great Christmas "I believe" story, and of course, the Rockettes were wonderful as always. Not a show to miss! Get there early as the lines are long to get in!

Spectacular show!. This exuberant production lives up to its reputation. The Rockettes' precision, the gorgeous costumes, the actors, the music, the additional dancers/actors, the 3-D segment, and the joyous presentation created a wonderful show. I highly recommend this show for people of all ages.
Rockettes - Brilliant Christmas show. Simply a stunning show of precision dancing in a massive theatre. This was on the list of things to do before... and it really didn't disappoint.
Radio City Christmas Spectacular. Go and see this when it is on. It is a must see over the Christmas period. Fantastic show and worth every penny (or cent!!)

One of the best shows I've seen!. The Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular was absolutely brilliant! The Rockettes are just amazing and are so synchronised, Santa also does a brilliant job! The show lasts about 90 minutes and it just flies in. If you are in NYC over the holiday's try and see this show, I wish I could again!
Beautidul. Went to Christmas show. Amazing as always. Great family show and so festive for the holidays. Seating is great just about everywhere.
XMAS Spectacular Show. Fantastic show just what is needed to get into the holiday spirit. Very slick run show. Beautiful theatre and comfortable seats. Well worth a visit.

Fantastic show & experience. I went on a AAA tour from PA which included the Christmas Spectacular, a backstage tour and a city lights tour. We had seats in the last 2 rows of the first mezzanine and while we could see our pictures didn't really come out all that great. You are prohibited from recording or using flash photography. There are no columns holding up the tiers so technically there's not a bad seat in the house. The show itself is fabulous and I loved the young ballerina for the nutcracker part and the precision of the Rockettes just has to be witnessed to be appreciated. Just amazing! Maybe not a yearly visit for us but certainly every few years.

Best Holiday Show Possible. Remembering seeing the show 25 years ago, we were totally bedazzled by the current show. The Rockettes do so many dazzling numbers and the costumes are exceptionally gorgeous. There were many kids at the performance we attended and the how totally held their attention. The way they use 3 D glasses, the use of the whole area including the ceiling is quite remarkable. The Christmas Story tells the Christmas story in a very beautiful way. Would never miss the show if we are back in NYC at Christmas.

What a beautiful, stunning theatre. We saw the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular with the world famous Rockettes. The show they put on was absolutely perfect from beginning to end. the whole performance was so slick and professional. The auditorium was world class and kept us all in awe of its grandeur. The reception hall is very grand and although there are signs everywhere saying 'no photography' in the foyer you are constantly bumping into people as they stop to take a picture of the huge chandelier. I was amazed by the whole experience and will defiantly book to go back when I return to NYC

Incredible performances and location. We saw an Incredible Christmas Show featuring the Rockettes, who have been dancing on the stage for many years. The Radio City Music Hall has amazing attention to detail, with most seats offering a very good view of performances, particularly large scale shows like the rockettes. A must see in New York

Awesome venue!!!. My husband and I went to NYC to see the Rockettes and we loved it! The staff are friendly and the place was clean. We had no troubles finding out seats (there isn't a bad seat in the house). We are going to make the trip an annual event!

The Orchestra really does come up out of the ground............. .........and the two organs come out of the wall! A real professional spectacular, we went to see the Rockettes Christmas show, it was excellent, I dont know how they get such precision into dancing! A great night out!

Truly Spectacular Christmas show. We saw the 2015 Christmas Spectacular Show this weekend. It is still wonderful. I have seen the show many times over the past 15 years but it was the first for my kids. We all loved it. They have definitely embraced technology as some of the effects are really great. I love the 3D and the floating snowballs. It still has all of the elements I remember, toy soldiers, NYC snow scenes and my favorite the living Nativity that keep it wonderful but they keep somehow improving it every time. We got there early and had our picture taken with a very beautiful Rockette.

Christmas with the Rockettes. Highly recommend this show. Radio City Music Hall was stunning inside and out. Honored to be able to attend a show there. The Rockets were outstanding with the Christmas story in between. Loved!We sat on the first mezzanine on the first rows and had a great view of the show. Limited bathrooms on this level. Arrive 30 minutes early to allow easier entry and time to take pictures of the lobby area.

Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular!. The Radio City Music Hall show was my favorite activity during my recent trip . The show is a must see for young and old. The Rockettes and the performers are all so very talented. The Rockettes, performing their famous Nutcracker routine, are AMAZING! The hall is a beautiful old building and the Christmas decorations just added to the whole experience.

The tour is Great, so is the show.. Take the backstage tour, it's great. The guides are really knowledgeable and you go right behind the scenes. You can't go on the stage while the xmas spectacular is on, but you can at other times of the year.Xmas spectacular was good, but definitely aimed at children as a bit twee.

Great Kick off for the Christmas Season. This was the second time we have attended the Christmas show. It was fun. We brought friends and our 6yr old and we all found moments that we loved. Everyone's favourite is the closing with the Navity scene but I also really enjoy the multitude of Santa's and the Toy soldiers set. The addition of the 3d is fun. Olivia was busy trying to touch things that seemed to come out at her. The seats and the theatre are very comfortable. I wish that I had the same seat at the Broadway show I went to the day before. The space is very roomy and there doesn't seem to be a bad seat in the house. We took mezzanine level on the very righthand side. It was very reasonably priced and as I said we had wonderful sightlines and very comfortable seats.

Fun for kids, and adults. We saw the 2015 Christmas Spectacular with the Rockets, and couldn't have been more pleased. The 3D portion was great, and the precision of the Rockettes in several numbers was amazing. Great if you have a kid to bring, but if not, go anyway.

A Christmas Show adventure. This was my first time here and I enjoyed every minute of it. I was able to find street parking real close so I didn't have to walk very far. I got my tickets from Groupon and my seats were in the Mezzanine. I was able to see everything. The show started ON TIME! I came to see the Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes. They were GREAT! Their costumes were nice and the props were awesome. Cons- The only problem were that the ticket agents seemed new and didn't know what to do with our Groupon tickets. And many of the people on line behind me had the groupon tickets as well so we had to wait till they found a manager to sort it out. Other than that hiccup, it the night went smoothly.The show is definitely worth coming to NYC to see. From the 3-D effects to the songs and the dancing. It was truly a great adventure to see it. They have Santa downstairs to take pictures and cotton candy upstairs. They have a bar to sell drinks and booths to purchase photos as well as other souvenirs.The bathrooms are old-fashion and there was a long line for both male and female bathroom. I would not mind coming back here for another show. I definitely recommend if you are in NYC, to come see the Rockettes, you will not be disappointed.

Christmas Extravaganza!. I'm one of those people who have trouble sitting still, especially for musicals and live shows, however found the Rockettes Christmas Show one of the best performances I've ever attended. This is a wonderful venue with spacious and comfortable seating, great acoustics, and clear sight lines. The Rockettes were as fantastic as people say, and the energy and visual effects (including 3D portions!) were astounding. This is a great show to get you in the spirit of the season, and something for the whole family to see. Definitely one for the bucket list!
Christmas spectacular great value. We booked cheap seats that were partially obstructed view, but could see perfectly. Don't need to be close. Get a good over view from seats further back

Definitely A Must Do At Christmas!!. This was our fourth visit to Radio City Music Hall and our 3rd time seeing the Radio City Christmas Spectacular. We had an amazing time as always. We attended the 9am show on Saturday 12/5 and had orchestra seating. The show was amazing!! The Living Nativity scene is always a crowd favorite. The tickets are on the pricey side though, even after taking advantage of the BOGO offer. The prices for the photos with Santa were quite high too($100 for 4 photos and 2 frames). If you're in the city during the Christmas season, don't miss out on seeing this show!!

Must see the Christmas Show with the Rockettes. Great show for all the family. Brilliant 3 D Santa's sleigh ride scene and brilliant high kicking dancing routines from the Rockettes. There are plenty of shows each day to choose from. A great start to the Christmas festivities if I lived in New York I would have to make this a family tradition every year.

Must see the Christmas Spectacular!! The building itself is beautiful inside!. Last time I went to this show was in 2003, boy has it changed! If you want to get into the holiday spirit this is the show to see. Perfect for every age!! I do recommend getting there early as the streets were jammed packed and took 15 minutes to move half a block.

WENT TO WATCH ROCKETTES MUSICAL SHOW. The show which also have a part in 3D is worth watching, the adjustment and training among the artists is amazing. The show is worth the name it has. Performers are perfect in their actions and extraordinary coordination. Very nice & beautiful show.

Radio City Music Hall - Rockettes. Not my cup of tea....but my wife adored it! RCMH staff go all out to make an enjoyable experience - could not have been better. Rockettes show is well worth the price of admission - and this is not the type show I usually enjoy - but the talents were obvious.

great show long line to get in. Went to Christmas show , line was long 35 minutes to get in . got their 35 minutes before show it started before we got in a good 100 people behind use .Show was great and a must see
Christmas Show was Spectacular!!!!. Watching the Rockettes perform and all the Christmas characters was Wonderful! Should be on everyone's list at least once in your life. Perfect for all ages.
Christmas Spectacular. Brilliant show but fat too short. Great atmosphere. More time spent on selling their merchandise than the show.

Simply Awesome. Went to see the Christmas spectacular featuring the Rockettes. Was fairly sure it would be good but, oh my goodness, it surpassed all expectations. Spectacular doesn't even begin to describe it! Outstanding choreography, sets, music, costumes and staging whilst the quality and precision of the dancing is second to none. The show lasts 90 minutes and there is no break but I was captivated from start to finish and it was over way too soon. It's impossible to convey how awesome this show is - a definite must see!

Worth your time!. Hopefully you will be fortunate enough to see a show at Radio City. We saw the Rockettes christmas show and it was wonderful. The sound is great and there the vies was wonderful even from the 4th level

Iconic landmark. Visited for the Christmas Spectacular and it was excellent. Rockettes are easy on the eyes also. Show was enjoyed by all six of us(ages 5 - 70). Very professional production. Theater is really well done and comfortable.

xmas show. Spectacular. Anyone visiting NYC should make a point of going to the Rockettes fabulous Xmas show . Never will you see anything like this anywhere else. Words can't describe how fantastic the show is.
Rockette's - Wow!. We were fortunate to get tickets to The Rockette's Christmas Spectacular over Thanksgiving weekend. This is a must see!

Girls' weekend in NYC. One of the most spectacular shows I have ever seen. The Rockettes are one of a kind. Their Christmas Show should be seen by all. Families would definitely enjoy this., The Music Hall is beautiful. So neat to be in a famous place. Had to pinch myself to be sure I was really in this place. Music was fascinating. And definitely keeping Christ in Christmas. Thank you.

Did not disappoint!. I have wanted to see the Rockettes for 40+ years. We had bought our tickets online and had them in hand when we were ushered into the doors. Our bags where searched and our bodies frisked before entering the lobby where a grand chandler hangs and staircases lead to the different levels. There are several gift shop areas upon entering in addition to refreshment bar areas offering cocktails and food. You can have your photo taken with a Rockette to remember your visit. We set off to find our seats which were on the third Mezzanine almost middle front row end – perfect seats to see the whole stage. We had amply leg room, which I found interesting compared to all other Broadway theaters I’ve been in.The 1.5 hour show was truly spectacular and did not disappoint. It included everything from a NYC bus to a live manger scene including camels, sheep and a donkey. I cannot comprehend the hours of practice the performers must go through. Every step, every line was perfect!

Rockettes Christmas Show Extravaganza. We so enjoyed the Rockettes Christmas Show that we have decided to return to NYC in December each year to see this show. The 3-D technology had the audience gasping in joy. The dancers toy soldier routine was a tribute to trust as each soldier fell backwards into the woman behind her. The multiple dancing Santas did a good job explaining to the children in the audience why there are so many Santas. Fun, fun, fun.

Christmas Spectacular 2015. This was my first time going to the Christmas Spectacular and I loved it. The entire experience was quite fun. Just going into the theater is like stepping back in time to when theaters were theaters. My children (6 and 4) couldn't quite make it through the entire production without getting a little antsy, but overall they had a great time. I bit pricey, but people pay it so why wouldn't they charge those prices?

The 2015 Christmas Extravaganza. Wow! Just wow! The show starts out with the orchestra playing a variety of Christmas songs. The acoustics are fantastic. Then there is an unbelievable 3 dimensional trip with Santa to the north pole. After that, the Rockettes do their thing to everyone's delight. The real star of the show is the visual effects to include enormous floating radio controlled balls that hover over the audience. There is also a few little vignettes to keep the story of Christmas intact.

The Christmas spectacular. Can't beat a show with the grandeur of the Rockettes. The show has been upgrade to include a lot of digital backdrops and even a short 3D experience. First time in over ten years, but I thoroughly enjoyed it. Get there at least 1/2 hour before the start time.

Christmas Spectacular!. We went to Radio City Music Hall for the first time watching The Christmas Spectacular featuring the famous Rockettes. This is christmas spirit and joy on speed - what a fun show! It's as christmasy as you can imagine. The Rockettes are as good as the hype. Radio City Music Hall is as spectacular as you think. Don't miss this opportunity for some extraordinary christmas feels!
The Rockettes. Beautiful building on the inside. Rockettes show is a must at least once in your life. You can usually find a coupon for a discount.

Stunning Christmas Show. Spent a perfect evening watching the Rockettes Christmas Show, totally magical and mesmerising, excellent dancing an humour, just what you want from a christmas show. Would put on anyones to do list when visiting New York over the festive period.

Rockettes at Christmastime!. You must start your Christmas season with a show at Radio City to see the Rockettes. It never gets old even though most of the segments are the same each year, its a great way to begin the season!

Loved this Place! Loved the Rockettes!. What a great theatre; historic and classy and beautiful. Saw the Rockets Christmas Spectacular for the 1st time, and would see it EVERY year forever if I could! Wholesome, fun, and the most get-you-in-the-spirit for Christmas thing we've ever done! Well with it and a MUST-SEE!!!

Christmas show 2015 - Santa Hat Day!. This is just such an essential part of Christmas in the city and I recommended the show to visiting relatives who loved it. We went on Santa Hat Day - so free hats for all. It was a 5 pm show and it was so nice to see all the little kids there who were taking in the magic. Each year the show changes a little bit but my favorites were the classics: the Rockettes as tin soldiers, the Rockettes as reindeer, and the Santas (lots and lots of them). Also lovely is the Nativity scene at the end complete with the kings and camels. Enchanting for young and old - make it a part of your tradition. PS Kids especially will enjoy the 3D portion where you feel as if presents from Santa's sleigh are coming right at you.
Christmas Spectacular is Spectacular. Nice theater. Seats are more comfortable than most theaters. Sound quality very good. Christmas Spectacular good family entertainment.

Radio City Rockettes. My husband loved it. He was not really wanting to go but raved about it the most. When asked at the end of our trip what was his favorite thing about our 3 day NYC vacation he replied, "The Rockettes. I wasn't expecting it to be more than just girls kicking their legs. It was a great show!"We all definitely recommend people of all ages boys and girls alike to see the Radio City Rockettes.
Christmas Spectacular. What a dream to take our 6 & 8 yr old grandchildren to see the Rockettes! It was a wonderful show for all ages and we all agreed it was the highlight of our weekend!

Christmas Spectacular lives up to its name!. What a great way to spend an evening in New York! This was our first time in Radio City Music Hall, and it is beautiful!! It is a very impressive venue! The staff does an excellent job of getting everyone security-scanned and in the door in a reasonably quick manner. The Christmas Spectacular really does live up to its name. There is so much attention to detail throughout the entire show, and so much talent. It is really incredibly well planned out and just a super nice evening. I don't know that this is something that I would ever do again, but I highly recommend seeing it at least once.

The Christmas Extravaganza-a must see. The building itself is a beautiful piece of work. We saw the Christmas show and it did not let us down. The sights and sounds really set the mood for Christmas. I really enjoyed seeing families sharing this together. Don't want to be a spoiler but the show ends with the Nativity. That really made it special.

Turned away with NY Explorer Pass. Really looking forward to the Radio City stage door tour as we'd loved what we'd seen of the Rockefeller Centre. Pitched up at the relevant desk and were told by the lady attendent that 'we don't accept those any more'. Plenty of other things to do, so didn't argue the toss. But checked on line when we got back to our hotel, and the Radio City stage door tour was clearly advertised as an option with the NY Explorer Pass on both the Radio City & Smart Destinations websites. So either the web sites need updating or the staff need training. Either way, not impressed.

Amazing show!!. I took two 10 year olds to this show - I wasn't sure if it would be there thing but I was happily surprised - the girls LOVED it! I don't think their eyes left the stage!! We especially loved the snow orbs!

Christmas Spectacular!!!!!!!. The most fabulous Christmas show EVER!!!!! From start to finish this was pure magic and entertainment!! The Rockettes are so talented and the whole show was polished perfection!! Such a fantastic production!!! So pleased that we went to see it!! It completely got us in the Christmas spirit!!!!

Beautiful Building. Went to NY and decided on a whim to see if any tickets available that evening for the Rockettes. Well there were and very inexpansive for 4 seats close to stage. I have seen them before and they were as always, outstanding. The real treat is this magnificent building! Beautiful can not describe this. Radio City is a must see while in NYC

Not as good a previous version of show. I've seen Christmas Spectacular four times and was disappointed by the most recent version. I missed the Santa Dance behind the curtains. The couples hsopping i NYC is replaced by a trimmed down version - not as colorful. Then they added some kids looking for a gift for his sister with Santa. Kid actors are just annoying. Bring back more high kicks. More colors. More NYC.

CHRISTMAS SPECTACULAR SHOW. I visited New York for Thanksgiving and the one thing on top of my list to do was to see the Christmas Show with the Rockettes dancing. It was fantastic and was everything I hoped it would be. I could have gone straight back in to watch it again.My big disappointment was that I bought the DVD in the foyer after the show and looked forward to showing my family the magical show.Unfortunately the DVD is not compatible on our systems BUT it does play on the computer. The BIG DISAPPOINTMENT was that the DVD purchased for $25 is from 2007 ! not the show I saw, although very nice I preferred the show I watched.

Amazing Show. I have seen the Christmas Spectacular show more times than I can remember, but every time I walk away thinking - wow, what an amazing show. It is so much more than just the Rockette's kicking. It is a full theatrical production with music, singing, dance and even live animals. It is something special and a treat. It's a great way to celebrate the holidays in NYC.

Christmas Extravaganza. Went back to my childhood with this performance. The Rockettes were wonderful and had me spellbound. Great venue and wonderful production for this aussie. Really appreciated the extra security checks that were held.
BEST SHOW EVER. I can't tell how much we enjoyed the Christmas show. Amazing, entertaining and all things Rockettes. Take the children, they will love it.
Great evening with the Rockettes!!. Its a must see!! The show started on time and keep us entertained throughout the whole show. Its an amazing experience and the seats were comfortable.

Christmas Show. The show is fantastic. It's a wonderful experience for young and old. The show included 3 D visions which will amaze you.The rockets performances leave you in awe of how can they do that, especially the dance of the toy solders.The ending is beautiful with live animals on stage in the nativity scenes. Well worth the trip to New York to see this show

A Christmas Must See!. Many years ago, I lived in New York and would see the Christmas show on occasion. It's been over thirty years since I went to Radio City Music Hall, and I have to tell you, it's not your grandaddy's (or even your daddy's) Christmas show any more. It truly is fantastic! It's an hour and a half of non-stop music, dancing, and Santa, with some 3-D thrown in and very clever movement on stage with impressive backdrops. Of course, the Rockettes are in almost every sequence of the show, and they're as great as ever. And yes, the show ends with a nativity sequence and a few live animals, just as in the past.When I went as a kid and very young man, the price was quite different from today, so expect to spend upwards of $60 to over $100 if you want Orchestra seats. Honestly, if you can afford it, treat yourself and get up close n the orchestra. I was in the back of the Orchestra seating (Row T), and while I saw quite well, I would've enjoyed being closer. I think up front in the Mezzanine would even be better seating than the back of the Orchestra.If you're visiting the city for the first time, I hope you're staying at a hotel so you can walk or take public transportation to the show. You DON'T want to drive in the city!While you're there, be sure to visit Rockefeller Center where you can see the tree, always a sight to behold, and visit in the building where there are tours, shops and places to eat galore. In addition, NBC Studio is right near by if you have the time for a tour, or even a show.As long as you can handle the crowds and rush, rush of the city, this is a great treat this time of year, whether you're visiting or live there.

Amazing at Christmas... Loved it!. What an extraordinary building. The interior is amazing and the Christmas decorations awesome. We saw the Rocket's Christmas Show. We had great seats and enjoyed it very much. The Rocket's live up to their reputation and the show is also great for kids. Would see this again if I am in New York. Try to buy your tickets online as I was able to buy mine for $55.00 and got 10th row seats.

Great Christmas Show. The show is 1 hr 30 min long with no break. They entertain you with popular Christmas songs and different skits that include the rockets dancing wonderfully in uniform. If you want to bring up your spirits and gut in the mood of Christmas this is the show for you.

Just Saw the Christmas Special. I was there 50 years ago and the inside is still an amazing place. The show was 90 minutes and the first part is 2D, they give you the glasses when you enter. There is no intermission but the time goes by fast. Organ duet before the show. The doors open up one hour before the show so plan to arrive when the doors first open, still there may be a block long line but it moves quickly.

Perfect Christmas Show. My family has visited NYC several time but never really had any interest in this show. We decided to try and now this will become a tradition! Very good show and great Christmas spirit not leaving out the true meaning.

RUN, Don't Walk!! . To get tickets!!! Knew very little about what we would see today, but it surpassed ALL my expectations!!!! Spectacular time, whether you attend a morning, evening or afternoon show. A delight for all ages! Truly put me in the holiday mood!!
Great Christmas Spectacular. If you've not been, you must go see this amazing show. Special effects lighting, great dancing, amazing stage.

The Rockettes were Great!. We went to see the Rockettes and the show was amazing. I highly recommend trying to get into the tour of the Hall before seeing a show there. I believe the tours go every half hour and you can arrange for reserved tickets. Absolutely fantastic!
Great Night out at the Rockettes. Had been 10 years and the show has evolved and was a very enjoyable evening out in NYC, with a fast moving and entertaining show
Rockets Christmas Spectacular. I've seen this several times. This year's show is the best I've seen. If I had time, I'd go back for a second time!

The Rockettes. This was an incredible 90 minute show. Such a variety of performing-- dancing and great stories about the Christmas season. Generosity, love, Jesus. The Rockettes are truly incredible performers. I especially loved the opening "reindeer dance" and their nativity scene close was phenomenal. The colors spectacular. Oh and the one 3D scene was so fun with Santa.
The Christmas Spectacular. Booked to see the Christmas Spectacular and loved it. Beautiful theatre with comfy seats. Show was amazing. Very festive. I would recommend everyone to see this show.

Must see this show.. Radio City Music hall is an historic gem worth seeing itself. The Christmas Spectacular is one of the best musical reviews I have ever seen. The actual stage show was fantastic but the music, the lights, the sets, the digital backdrops all were amazing. I had worried that this show was over hyped, it is not. Go and take the kids. Simply winderful

Amazing. Was a little apprehensive about attending the Xmas show,with my wife,as I am a male in my 50's.What a spectacular show for kids of all ages.The Rockettes were superb,and the show is memorable.Just wish we had been able to take the grandchildren.The theatre is very big ,so try and stretch the budget and get seats in the stalls near the front if possible.
Spectacular!. We attended the Christmas Spectacular.Thoroughly enjoyed and were impressed.The dancers, the music, the songs, the colors, the lighting, all very professional and wonderful.

Fantastic show. We booked the Radio City Christmas Spectacular...we weren't dissapointed. A fantastic show, dancers out of this world, loved every minute. A great show for all ages, worth every penny.

Fabulous!. I loved visiting Radio City to see the Christmas Extravaganza! It was the highlight of my trip. The building itself is very beautiful, they were very tight on security checks on the way in which was good to see.
Awesome and Amazing. Took my daughter to the "Stage Door Tour" at Radio City. We got to go into the costume room, the rehearsal studio, and how amazing was it to actually meet a Rockette!!

Rockett's Christmas Show. This is a beautiful theater and the Rockettes, as always, were spectacular. It was expecially nice to see that not only did they feature Santa but also included the nativity scene commemorating the spirit of Christmas. We have seen them before yet its always a favorite outing.
Great Christmas show. Great Christmas show of Rockets. Really got us into the Christmas Spirit with good performance and venue.
Bucketlist Experience. Beautiful theatre. Show was amazing. Brought back many childhood memories. Comfortable seating and clean facilities.

The Christmas Spectacular is not to be missed!. Thoroughly enjoyed the Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes!
Yes - it's kitchy - but it's MEANT to be! Wonderful live music, singing and dancing and a fantastic live nativity - great for the whole family.

Those ladies can DANCE!. The Christmasspectacular, or whatever its called, is a glorious introduction to the Rockettes - and a great event for the family. I think my mouth was open the entire time in awe. Most attendees were dressed casual.

Rockettes and more. I have been to Radio City Music hall to see the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular several times, to take the backstage tour, and to see Cirque du Soleil's Zarkana. I think it is comfortable and have enjoyed the shows I have seen there. I do love when they decorate it and find the Swarovski crystal tree at Christmas quite beautiful. Makes the long lines a little more bearable.
Rockettes Christmas. Just a wonderful show. Never the same they did change it up some. Excellent show a d will see again.

Great Entertainment!. As entertaining and impressive as any show I have ever attended! It was classic and contemporary, combining modern technology and the classic Rockettes dancing. Our two teenagers loved it as well. Don't miss this!

An absolute must visit!. This place is a must visit if you go to New York City. The tour is great, the venue is breathtaking and the history mindblowing. The Christmas Spectacular is one of the best live shows ever and the Rockettes will amaze you inhuman dance precision and talent!

Wow what a Show. This has got to be for me a bucket list item. Having worked backstage for most of my life you hear stories of this show. And I can safely say they are all true. Firstly hats off to the staff who treat this as a military campaign to get you in. Also you get the usual free playbill program but also a Christmas hat (great idea as the show logo and main sponsor is on it) now to get anything free is a bonus nowadays. The show is a mix of traditional song and dance routines dating back to the thirties and some with a clever mix of new technology including a great 3D film to follow Santa to the famous music hall and some drone snowflakes that hover feet from your head. But the star or stars of this show is of course the rocketts who come on all the way and give you stunning routines that are so perfect that you hear gasps throughout the show from the audience. Special mention to the soldiers dance. Where very slowly they line up within inches of each other and very slowly fall over into the next like dominoes. This show I believe should be scene at least once in your life.

A New Yorker's View & Loved It!. Grew up, live and work in the New York CIty area, and has been a very, very long time (a time when there were no computers, cell phones, digital, etc.) since I last saw the Christmas Show at Radio City Music Hall. Decided to see the Christmas Spectacular this year after hearing about the many current and relevant technological enhancements to the show.It was amazing, entertaining, and had everything you can imagine and surprises (won't spoil it for you)! The music, scenery, costumes - all fantastic and eye pleasing. The Rockettes are truly a class act. The Music Hall is as grand as I had remembered it. Whether you're a local or a visitor to New York City, take you and your family to see this show. There are many different discounted tickets available; we had tickets that were $44 each for center orchestra and were perfect, well worth it seats. The show is about 1 1/2 hours and just the right length for young children. Try to go this holiday season!

Wonderful Start to the Christmas Season. We arrived early because of previous reviews and were able to go inside within 5 minutes! We were routed downstairs to see Santa and concessions but if we had known what was actually there, we would not have gone downstairs. We had five small children and the large area was packed. When we were allowed in the theater the magic began. Two huge organs played a prelude that lasted about 10 minutes that was unbelievable. The show itself was amazing. Everything was perfect - costumes, scenery, music, the precision of the Rockettes. Our seats were very good and the show kept everyone in our party, small children as well, entertained for the entire 90 minutes. It was also exciting to see the Living Nativity. I agree with others though, it would have been wonderful if it had lasted a little longer.
Musical. It's a place to know, and to watch a very good musical with your family or a dating!Better to buy things in advance cuz you might not find

Spectacular Start to Christmas . Seeing the Radio City Christmas show is an absolute thrill. You're mesmerized by the facility as soon as you walk in. We had our picture taken with a Rockette, and Santa too (separately). Downstairs in the lounge area is tons of candy and popcorn to purchase. And of course inside the venue the show was spectacular. The kids loved every minute of the show, the 3D part, snowflakes and live nativity scene were amazing. But the real show stopper is Santa and the Radio City Rockettes! This is a mid see activity during the holiday. Get orchestra seats too, it's worth it.

radio city. had a fantastic time here. everybody was most helpful the lady who showed us around was very knowledgeable about the whole history of radio city and how it all came about we didn't get to go to the xmas show but when you are doing the tour you get to look down from above behind a screen and you can see the whole stage and some of the show . we wish we had gone it looked fantastic will definitely go next time in new york

Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes. ABSOLUTELY AND POSITIVELY FANTASTIC!!!! We have seen a few Broadway shows and Cirque Du Soleil in Charlotte, Las Vegas, and NYC but this show with the Rockettes was nothing short of outstanding. Must, must see in NYC during the holidays!!!!!! It was 1 1/2 hours and if anything, I'd wish it was much longer, perhaps 2 hours. Spectacular!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Rockettes. Went to see the Rockettes. Great show.....highly recommend. Great show for children as well as adults. Long lines to get in but it goes fairly quick. Beautiful building!

Christmas Spectacular. Went to Radio City Music Hall to see the Christmas Spectacular. I had mixed feelings about seeing this show when I bought the tickets. Well I am so glad I took my family to see this show. It was a lot of fun.

A great experience. It's been years since we have seen the Rockettes dance, other than on Netflix--it was wonderful to view with a young child (CA 6) and recapture a bit of childhood. Well done and they move HUGE numbers of people very efficiently. HIghly recommend as a Christmas Extravaganza!

An Institution. We saw the Rockettes annual holiday program for the first time. We'd always heard about it, and when we scored some discount tickets online, we went. It was well worth it. Being in Radio City Music Hall was an added bonus. Terrific program!

Excellent xmas show. This has to be one of the best xmas show i have ever seen, I took my son who is 25 to New York as a treat and wondered if this kind of thing might bore him but we both loved this, I would strongly recommend

Fabulous - the way every musical spactacular should be. If musical spectaculars are your thing then you will love this - it literally has everything - and then some more! The theater is a fantastic spectacle in itself and the current Christmas spectacular uses avery aspect of the architecture to the greatest theatrical effect. Of course, expect meticulous and jaw-dropping dancing from the Rockettes - they cannot fail to astound , and wonderful music; but also surprisingly this show has a real heart and emotional substance - including a moving and stirring telling of the story of the nativity. It is not all commercial glitz - this show has a soul too.
Great Christmas Spectacular!. Visited here last week to see the Christmas Spectacular - it was amazing!Loved every minute of it.Would highly recommended a visit to see this.

Christmas Spectacular Show. Went to see the Christmas Spectacular show here which was great, the queue for ticket holders was extremley long, which meant by the time we got in to the Radio City Music Hall, we only had 5 minutes before the show started. The Stage itself is huge and the production was excellent.
Rockettes!. I went here to see the Rockettes and had the most amazing night! The decorations and atmosphere was wonderful! Would definitely recommend seeing the Rockettes here.

The Rockettes Are Awesome!. We went to see the Rockettes during the Christmas season and enjoyed a spectacular Christmas Special. The dancers are incredible! We would definitely recommend this to all families and friends! A real piece of NYC!

Great place to see a show. Opened in 1932 and built during the great depression along with Rockefeller Center Radio City was the premiere theatre in the USA as well as the world. In 83 years it had it shares of ups and downs. For the most part up until 1973 it was a first run single screen premiere movie theatre. In addition there was the annual Easter and Christmas Spectaculars. in 1973 it hit a down moment in it's history when management decided to book live concerts and some other shows and has been running that way since. RCMH seats 6200 people which makes it better to see a concert than going to an arena and larger than the 2000 seat plus theatres.One of the nice features is the Mighty Wurlitzer pipe organ. The low notes will knock your socks off. It has 2 keyboard consoles which can be play from either side or both at the same time. RCMH is owned by Cablevison of NY which also owns Madison Sq Garden along with the NY Knicks & NY Rangers as well as Beacon Theatre on W 74th and Bway that recently underwent a $16 million dollar renovation. RCMH is a can't miss. You'll love it. The tour will take you in to places that is not available to the general public

Christmas Spectacular. This is a fantastic theater with an incredible show. I am not a fan of theater or dancing performances and yet I find this show to be a great experience. There is enough variety in the acts and quick pace to keep everyone entertained. We went with a group ranging in age from 9 to 70 and everyone was talking about the show for hours (and days) afterwards.
Christmas Spectacular. Loved the Christmas spectacular, the atmosphere was fantastic,my favourite part of the show was the toy soldiers and the 3d animation.
Saw the Rockettes. Their holiday show was amazing. This is a must see show. There were seven of us from all ages and we were all kept captive.
Christmas in NYC. We of course had to go to the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes. Awesome show. Highly recommend it!

Rockettes!. Wow those ladies can kick! The entertainment and holiday excitement is fabulous for the kiddos and the dancers and special effects were amazing! However it didn't take my teens long to notice what appears to be a real lack of diversity in the performers. My little guy enjoyed the performance entirely though. Probably should do it once in their lives! It was nice. (no intermission!)

Loved the Christmas Show. I had not been to Radio City in a long time and it was fun to be back. I still can't believe that they wanted to knock this place down in the 70's. It is so beautiful and lavish. Very Art Deco! The show is very good and the routines are still the best. I love the Dance of the Wooden Soldiers. For a once in a life time experience when visiting New York City during the holidays, make sure to make your way here. It is a real treat.

Distracted by the cheesy projections and sponsor placement ads. When the Rockettes were on stage this was well worth seeing. They're an impressive group of dancers in great costumes even if you can see the tape on the stage for their marks. During their wardrobe changes you are entertained by some other talented dancers but also by cheesy videos including many reminders that the show is sponsored by certain companies, unimpressive acting, and a weak story. Of course there were also camels and some sheep. I think I would have preferred this performance fifty years ago before the videos and 3D movies made it less about the dancing.
Is great show. Went to see the Rockettes Christmas show, absolutely fantastic. You have to go. Staff were great and organised he cues well and got you into your seats without fuss.

14 scenes of perfection. On our trip to New York for the Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, we added a trip to see the Christmas Spectacular. We were seated in the 2nd Mezzanine level and could see everything very well. Radio City is an architectural gem! Every aspect of the show was amazing from the initial dance scene to the final scenes of the nativity. It was great to see live sheep, a donkey and three camels. The Rockettes were amazing. The scene of the marching toy soldiers was a work of art.I could go on and on. Go see the show, it's worth the money and you don't have to pay top dollar to enjoy. Our seats were 60ish each.Merry Christmas

Rockettes. We did the tour of Radio City Music Hall and later saw the Rockette's Christmas Spectacular .The tour was very informative about the building and the history of the Radio City Music Hall we were able to meet one of the dancers and talk with her and pictures . The Show was AMAZING .A must see if in the area.

The Rockettes are amazing! Christmas Spectacular. I can't believe how wonderful the Rockettes are. That those talented women can dance like that and put on many shows daily is crazy. The 3D technology and drone snowflake balls are fun. I think some items need to be updated - who buys kids rag dolls and trains? But a New York institution and not to be missed, even from someone who does not celebrate Christmas.
Rockettes. Had an awesome time. The show was fabulous and well choreographed. They even had a 3d part of the show and live animals. This was a first and won't be the last.
Radio City Christmas Spectacular. We saw the Christmas Spectacular and it was great. My teenage daughters enjoyed this much more than they thought they would!
The size of this theatre is phenominal. Watched the Holiday spectacular and what a wonderful venue. Everyone was in the joyous spirit and the workers are clearly trained.

The Christmas show is fantastic. We went Thanksgiving night. Had been looking forward to it for some time. We were very impressed with the theater, staff and show. It is a grand old building with great architecture. The Christmas tree chandelier is beautiful. If the performance does not get you in the holiday mood, nothing will. Worth every penny spent. A must see on your list.

UNBELIEVABLE!!!. Four college roommates met in NYC and decided that we should revisit our childhoods and see the RCMH Christmas show. It was everything we remembered and beyond! The incredible choreography, music, colors, music - and drones! 3-D! We even had our photo taken with Santa. The Rockettes are an awesome troupe of professionals who never fail to thrill us! Just like Disney - not appropriate for very young children - it would be lost on them.

The Christmas Show is pricey but you'll be glad you went. The theatre is breath taking. Staff is very efficient. The show is incredible. It's the 90th anniversary of the Rockettes and based on the show we saw - here's to another 90. It's not cheap if you don't buy your tickets direct - brokers seem to snap most of them up.
Christmas show. Awesome! First time seeing the show. I took my 18 year old son and we both loved it. Ot is not only the rockettes, there are ballet dancers, singing and a great orchestra.

Our annual Christmas highlight. My wife and I have enjoyed the annual Rockette’s Christmas show each year for the past nine. This year was as good as ever and I would encourage everyone to go at least once. This year we sat in the mezzanine for the first time and really enjoyed the different view.

Loved the Christmas Spectacular!. Great show - lots for everyone. 3D video for the kids and the traditional Rockettes kicks for the grownups. Building is spectacular and easy to miss in the rush to get to your seats - be sure to make time to look around.

Impressive interior, bring a bucket of money. Interior breathtaking. Shows excellent. You can get tickets to the shows at discounted prices if you look, which you should definitely do, because once you walk inside, you'll be bleeding money. The show book, the Rockette picture, the food, the drinks, the snacks, all ridiculously overpriced. If you don't live in NYC, then it might be worth buying all that stuff...but for native NYers (like me) the prices are crazy. Good experience for young children. We go every other year because the shows don't change that much from year to year. Many families make it an annual tradition, but there are other things to do in the city so every other year is enough.

Go for the Rockettes, and the Christmas show. Wow! I went in 1960, and it has not changed, it is so beautiful, and the music, and the Rockettes are wow! Yes, you will enjoy it, and the children, too. Love it!

1st time and loved it. What a amazing building . We done the tour then went to see the Christmas spectacular which was very entertaining and a great show, the tour was very interesting and the guide very knowledgeable. The history behind the building is very good
Christmas show was superb.. Have been to NYC many times but never saw a performance at Radio City. Attended the Christmas show last weekend and it was great. A treat that should not be missed.
Radio city Christmas Spectacular . Wonderful, a magical Christmas experience. Who said there is no Santa ho ho ho. Real camels and hundreds of Santas. A must if you are going at this time of year.

Christmas Spectacular Show - Wow. This is a must see, Rockettes were amazing and the show definalty got me in the festive spirit.I got tickets from radio city the day before and chose 3rd mattane tickets. Being further back I think you get to appreciate all the special effects and synchronisation of the dancers a lot more.This is something I would recommend to everyone young or old .. If you don't get the festive spirit after this your obviously coming to New York at the wrong time of year !!

Spectacular show - but very lousy security. We went to see Christmas Spectacular today. The show itself is absolutely amazing and if you a are not in Christmas spirit yet: believe me- you will be after the show. It is a must see. I would have given 5 stars if not for 2 things. Basically I'll give the show 5 stars, security a straight F and the photographer staff 1 star. My daughter wanted to take a picture with one of the Rockettes after the show. We approached the photographer staff and asked for the price of the picture. The staff member just gave us a eerie smile and said: it depends on the package you buy. I asked her how much it would cost for a single photograph with the Rockette dancer. Again: Depends what package you buy. Excuse me??? If you would like my business you better give me a price... we left ... because since no one seemed like giving us an answer... The security is more then lousy. A staff member at the door pokes into your bag or purse with a stick without checking the contents and waves you on. The lady that "checked" my bag didn't even look into it - she just told me: "you are good" By the door they scan the people but again not the bags... With all the terrorism going on: God forbid- but it would be way too easy to bring something in if someone would be for real! My advise to the management: It is not always only about the numbers and the money.. Hire better security staff. The music hall is a "soft target" and should be a lot safer!!

Rockettes are superb!. The Christmas Show is spectacular. Went numerous times as a child and now as an adult I can still enjoy it jsut as much. The costumes and the precision of the Rockettes is amazing. If you are in NYC during the Holidays - its a must see. Esp. since its a public place that isn't afrain to say Meerry Christmas & not the politically correct term of Happy Holiday's. Radio City staff are friendly despite the crowds and very organized. Wonderful show.

Simply Amazing!. I can't say enough about how amazing the rockettes are! We saw the Christmas Spectacular and everyone from my 9 year old son to my 15 year old son LOVED it. We will go again and I highly recommend it for all ages (old enough to sit still).Very entertaining!
Much better than expected . Me, mister skeptical, was expecting to be bored with this show. Not so! Great production, great effects and great talent. Well worth the effort to get there

Christmas Spectacular. Just caught the Christmas Spectacular. It started on time and was incredible. It's a major production. The Rockettes are great. Using live animals for the Nativity scene is impressive. The place was crowded but how can it not be? It hold 2,000 or so people. The building alone is worth seeing for it art-deco look. Security is fast, professional, and unstressful. A fun thing to do.
Majestic. I've been there many times, the most epic watching Black Sabbath with R J Dio. Such a great hall to have some killer music.

Christmas Spectacular Show. Spectacular is an under statement. The show was unbelievable and would suit all ages. The Rockets did Rock how they kept going I will never know, The costumes and stage were beautiful. I would happily have watched it again. This is a must do !
Rockettes Christmas special. Went to see the Rockettes at the Radio City Music Hall, the show was 90 mins long, well worth the money it was a great show and a super evening

wow. We booked are tickets on line before arriving in New York, so picked our seats quite carefully and at our leisure. It is a New York institute, the building is lovely even from the outside, we went to the 5 o clock show and also chose a xmas hat special, a great momento of the night ! There was an efficient sdcurity check so not much queuing but no food and drink allowed, I had taken a small bottle of water, just be aware.Once inside it does not disappoint, stunning interior, incredible history of this art deco gem.We booked to see the xmas spectacular, and it was, the whole show is magical, great special effects, 3D imagery make it a seasonal event not to be missed, and your watching a little bit of living history.
Wowow. Wonderful xmas show beautiful theater lovely experience..comfortable seating ..would reccomend to go at least once in a lifetime

Christmas spectacular. All of us enjoyed this Christmas show. From Santa to Jesus and all the classic songs in between. All set to wonderful dancing and choreography. Loved the soldiers and the special trick. All of us got Santa hats and has been a great start to the holiday season for us.
The Rockettes Rock. This my second visit to the Christmas Show. It is not a cheap show, but it is worth every penny. I would recommend trying to get seats in the first mezzanine, center.

Christmas Spectacular. I have been to the show maybe 4 times in my whole life. And I am impressed every single time. It is always magical and the Rockettes really shine. My sister had tickets through Groupon and we were in Orchestra 2 for the 10pm Saturday night show. Dancing was great. Singing was great. There was pretty tight security. A bomb sniffing dog, 2 bag checkers and a metal detector but I was impressed by how quickly they got people in. People were complaining but its NYC, the week after a major terrorist attack in a big city and before the Thanksgiving Day parade. Better safe than sorry. No drinks can be brought in but available to purchase inside. Santa was downstairs by the rest room. The bathroom was clean and the restroom worker made sure that the line moved quickly and people know which stall to use. Do use the bathroom before hand because there is no intermission. For those with Sensory issues, the dancers and Santas DO come out in the middle of the show so if you are in Orchestra 1 or the first 10 rows of Orchestra 2, they will be close. If my daughter had been there, she would have ran away (scared of Santa). The lady in front of me almost hurt herself trying to run away. Show was great for my sister and I, great for families and even would be a fun date. My favorite was the living nativity scene. So nice to remember the Christ in Christmas and beautifully done.

See the Rockettes Holiday Show!. Arrive early to line up on the street before entering. The line literally wraps around a couple of city blocks before performances. This was a bucket list item - seeing the Rockettes holiday show and it did not disappoint. The Hall holds several thousand people and is amazing to see the size and scale of the stage and production. Would love to return!
See the Rockettes!. Radio City Music Hall is the biggest theatre in the city. The Rockettes are spectacular. The show is a full production, not just girls dancing. Way better than expected.

2nd time seeing the Rockettes. Nice family oriented musical and dancing holiday extravaganza. Actually room for my legs unlike Broadway theaters and awesome architecture and interiors. Crowd ques up early for performances but line moves quickly. No cell phone policy.
Christmas Spectacular . Great show, production values, the set, the music, the choreography - all amazing. If you love Christmas, you will love this show.
OMG What A Show. Really Good Time.. The Christmas show was so good. The rockettes and the stage hands did an awesome job. A must see with or without kids.

Radio City Christmas Spectacular: New York icon of a show. Three adults ventured forth with a Living Social coupon; we were way back in the next to the last row, but the space is made for spectacle, from the booming bass of the twin giant organs to the dancers on the side balconies. The computer generated images are enhanced with 3D glasses in the second number as Santa's sleigh swoops through the skyscrapers of New York. But the precision and costuming of the Rockette dancers were awesome, especially in the mechanical soldiers routine. The Nativity scene is near the end so the show covers both the Santa/gifts and religious aspects of Christmas. Go once and enjoy the show, as people have done for decades, although it's always new and improved! (It actually is a little long for children under 7 who may get restless.)

Christmas how with the Rockettes. This was a wonderful show. It had the Rockettes, and many other characters with Santa and it was all about Christmas. The show ended with the Nativity scene and truly glorified Jesus as it ended with the Hallelujah Chorus. I went to see the Rockettes, but got blessed by the entire show.

The rocketts!!!!!. How wonderful to start holiday seasonMy first time seeing the rocketts Christmas show,Even more special taking my 8 year old granddaughter We were lucky enough to go backstage afterwards Fabulous dancing and great storyPlease go and see a true must
An American Icon. We were able to go to the Rockette's show here last year. Simply amazing experience. You have to go at least once in your life!

A Beauty!. This beautiful building is a great plave to see a show. We have been there many times and always took our kids there for the Christmas show. The interior of the RCMH is simply beautiful. Lines can be long to get in and out. If you're in NYC, make sure you stop in. I think they still do behind the scenes tours which in the past is excellent.

Pretty Theater. Nice old theater. Have seen the Christmas show twice and probably won't see it again. How many times can you see a row of girls kicking? It was better back in the 70s when the show had more substance.

Spectacular!!!. We brought our 18 year old granddaughter to NYC for her first visit and the Christmas program here was our first event. It was spectacular! The staging. The Rockettes. The music. All spectacular!!
First time, great time.. Seeing the Rocketts there. Seats were comfortable and roomy enough to sit. I would go again for sure.
Christmas Spectacular. The Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall was Fantastic!! What a great show to get you in the Christmas spirit.

Tour. I recently undertook a tour of radio city music hall with your guide Michael. His knowledge and genuine passion for the work that he and the rest of your team does was evident. He truly is an asset to your organisation. He made the tour fun and educational at the same time. It was also a thrill to meet one of the rockettes in person. I would highly recommend this to others who are interested in musical theatre.

A Sense of Grandeur. We didn't see a show, but the tour of Radio City Music Hall was priceless! Iconic in every way, this place was like a page from the past.... original light fixtures, Art Deco furnishings and design, and seating for over six thousand! You would never guess the grandeur of the place from the outside, as it sits across from Rockefeller Centre and NBC Studios. Opened in 1932, the place was supposed to offer high class variety entertainment. The Rockettes are synonymous with the theatre. As part of our tour, a Rockette gave our group a personal interview.The theatre itself is built in a shell type of shape meant to resemble the setting sun. The seats have been redone, but they look like the original style of the 30's. Most interesting were the bathroom fixtures, including a hand dryer that required a pedal be pushed for it to operate. Included in the tour was a guest book signed by famous names of the 40's and 50's, including Woody Woodpecker!. There were several nude sculptures cast in aluminum that adorned the hallways... not to my liking, but something that I am sure has artistic merit and historical value. Most interesting were the unseen workings of the moving stage that used state-of-the-art hydraulics similar to those used in aircraft carriers.We'll have to return for a show!
Excellent. Couldn't be better. Excellent show, music, light show and superb dancers. Very professional, awesome venue, clean and very comfortable seating.
Tour recommended. We did the tour- 75 minutes long. Worth it to learn about the history and see backstage. The toilets are amazing!!!

A good show but what a shame people weren't seated in time. We went to the 7.30 showing.It was a birthday present for my sister, a holiday gift for my nephew and niece, the tickets weren't cheap. We arrived early and sat down, I'm not sure what caused it but the performance started and half the seats were empty. We missed watching nearly the first 4 songs\performances as people were in the aisles being seated blocked our views. Once we did get to start watching it was amazing and I would recommend it. Just such a shame as we may never get to see it again travelling as we did from the UK - oh well, that's the way the cookie crumbles

Christmas SPECTACULAR!. SPECTACULAR is the correct adjective for this performance! Non-stop entertainment and Christmas Joy! The Radio City Music Hall is the perfect location for such an amazing show. The spirit of Christmas truly fills the auditorium, and we (the audience) sing along, when our mouths aren't open by surprise. When we left the theatre, we couldn't take the smiles off our faces. And with all the Christmas decorations going up in NYC the magic continued all the way home.A MUST SEE for the whole family, if you're in NYC in the Fall/Winter.

Rude security guards and act like a gangster. Radio City musical hall is notorious for their security guards.
