I went there for Christmas show many times and I found their security guards are absolutely rude and unreasonable. I went there in 2011 for Christmas show, and the guards use his stick to poke my arm when he searched my bag. I complained to him, and he ignored me. I went there in November, 2015 and I just wanted to buy a ticket, the security guards checked my bag and asked me to throw my water bottles away. I am not going to the show and I just want to buy tickets. This is absolutely unreasonable. I went back in 10 minutes and I wanted to pick them up in the trash can, the security guards still stopped me. I wouldn't recommend anyone to go there. The show is too commercial and they only wanted to make money without showing any respect to their customers. This place is lousy.

Great show today!!. We saw the Christmas show today........a group of 8 aged 27 to 93.....wonderfully done, great mix of the secular and the religious....and very well-done special effects....the Rockettes are amazing!!! Go go go to see this show!

Radio City Christmas Spectacular. One place they have not lowered their standards. The show was outstanding and entertaining for all ages. There is not much more to say except that it lives up to its name, it is spectacular and worth the time and money to go see. The live nativity scene at the end is beautiful and a great ending to the show.
Christmas show at Radio City Music Hall. Beautiful music, scenery and costumes that make this one of my favorite ways to celebrate the Christmas holiday.

Alive!. The Radio City Music Hall is in close proximity to the Rockefeller Center. It is good to pay this music hall a visit in the evening hours if you want good shots out of it. Of course, if you're a big fan of musical shows, get in!

Christmas Spectacular Show was outstanding.. We have visited New York over 50 times and never have gone to the Christmas Show with the Rockettes at Radio City Hall. It was outstanding. Very fast paced 90 minute show great for the entire family. It will put you in the holiday spirit. It is a fabulous venue. We would highly recommend the tour also.

The Rockettes Were Awesome. Went to the Christmas Spectacular and it was amazing. I can't explain how great it was. I would recommend to anyone, young and old. Family Friendly! Everyone will find something that they will enjoy about the show.

Amazing!!. Visited the Christmas Spectacular opening show of the season. My husband and I visit the theatre regularly, both enjoying musicals in particular and both agreeing that it was the best show we've EVER seen.It is exactly as advertised, SPECTACULAR. The dancing, singing, costumes, special effects and lighting are very entertaining and suitable for all ages. We live in UK and have wanted to see this show for a long time but never been in New York during the season, now having seen the show we definitely plan to see it again in the next few years. I know the toy soldiers feature annually but it was a simply stunning routine and we will definitely look forward to seeing them again.
One of the best experiences in New York. My wife and I saw the Rocketts Christmas special. It is so worth going to see. The theater is just amazing.

Every Seat is a Good One. We were lucky enough to attend Adele's show here this past week. The sound quality was amazing and it seems every seat in the house gives you a good view of the stage. Definitely a night to remember. (only complaint was not being able to bring our drinks from the foyer into the show itself)
Great Show this year !. new things , sound is good great too, very nice with the lights and drones , its a must see if you are in NYC . Enjoy .

Pretty Theater. We went to the Rockettes last week. The line was very long, but they did a great job at keeping it moving. Once in there is a gigantic chandelier in the 'lobby', it is really pretty. It was crowded so we didn't really walk around that area. The theater itself is smaller than I thought it would be. That being said I don't think there is a bad seat in the house. It was comfortable and in good condition.

Christmas Spectacular...Was - except the lines. We went to see the Xmas show with the Rockette's and it did not disappoint. The only issue is that we got there about 40 minutes before the show and had to wait three blocks from the entrance. By the time we got in, there wasn't time to go to the bathroom and get the kids a snack. GO EARLY to relieve stress. The Hall is still amazing inside. Like no other!
Christmas Spectacular is fun!. My kids and I loved the show and planning to go again next month. The best part of the show is the Rockettes' Signature Kick! Fun for all ages!

Very Interesting. This lovely old theatre is great to see on the behind the scenes tour. The guides shares interesting facts and stories. The bathrooms in their original state are fascinating in that they haven't been gutted and renovated. Nice to see.

Iconic. Radio City is right off of Times Square so it is easily accessible. There's a lot of eateries and shopping inside. We didn't get to see any shows but just walking through the halls and checking out the gift shops was a lot of fun.

Wonderful Shows for everyone!. RCMH is another iconic attraction here in Manhattan, another must see. The shows are fantastic and a wonderful experience for the entire family. The Christmas Spectacular is great and now 4 dimensional. We also saw Tony Bennett there last year and it was great. It is a fantastic venue and one for everyone, they have a variety of different shows and artists etc.

A Musical Delight. Visited Radio City for the first time to see the Rockettes Xmas Show. What a great venue to watch a show. From the outside I had always envisioned it to be a very small theatre. To my surprise when you walk in you are amazed to find a 4 story lobby area with large chandeliers, food and souvenir counters and a grand staircase to the upper mezzanines. The architecture is just beautiful. If you've never had a chance to visit here definitely place it on your "To Do" list.

Rockettes Rock. Went to the Christmas Spectacular and it was incredible. What a was to get in the Christmas spirit. Everyone was so helpful showing to your seat and the were all pleasant. The costumes were beautiful and what talent everyone had. Will be back next year.
Home of the Rockettes. Be sure to visit the colorfully lighted venue. Right in the heart of Broadway. A true New York experience. Take a tour and see a show. You want be disappointed!

great place to see a show. had the opportunity to see a concert there and what a view from our seats. It seems like there isn't a bad seat in the house. The building inside is great and most of the staff treat you with great service.
The Christmas Spectacular was amazing!!. We went on a family vacation and this was the first non Disney Broadway show me kids had seen and we all loved it!!
Take the tour. Had the opportunity to take the tour backstage throughout radio city music hall. You'll have access to several areas that the public doesn't know about.

SO MUCH FUN!!!!!. We had not booked the show and managed to get tickets at a good price. Got good seats, let the show begin..... The 2015 Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes. The whole show was spectacular, lots of dancing and singing with the Rockettes... the dancing is fab.. so synchronised. NYC tour bus on stage, toy soldiers and a camel on stage as part of many different scenes!! You are given 3D glasses and have reindeer and Santa on his sleigh flying through streets of NY. Thoroughly enjoyed it, a must see. Really puts you in the mood for xmas. The show is suitable for all ages

Amazing show. We went to see the radio city christmas spectacular featuring the rockettes. It was a truly amazing show, great for kids and adults alike. Well worth going to see, the rockettes were fantastic, 36 girls in perfect sync.

A must for NYC. Enjoyed the Christmas Spectacular show! Great way to end our trip. Perfect time to be in NYC and this show really gets your holiday started off right. The building itself is a must see. The auditorium is beautiful, the lobby grand and even the lounge downstairs is a must see!

Entertaining!. I have been to NYC a few times before and had always missed the Christmas Spectacular by a few days. This time we planed it during the first week the show began and I was not disappointed. What a way to start out this Christmas Season! A must see while in NYC during the Holidays.

Christmas Extravaganza - Amazing !!!!. We had booked p for the opening night. Beautiful building and then the show started. Absolutely fantastic. I was upset when it had finished, i just wanted more. If you get the chance take in a show here. It is amazing.

Famous landmark and a Christmas Spectacular featuring the Rockettes. Nothing compares to the world famous Radio City Music Hall. The place is like a blast from the past. Saw the Christmas Extravaganza show and it is perfect for the family. Great entertainment for 90 minutes!

Amazing Place with a Very Entertaining Guide. The tour of this fantastic building is fantastic. We had a guide called Alvin who was extremely entertaining and informative. We were in a group which included a number of high school students from London and Alvin was great at keeping everyone involved.The building is wonderful with many 1932 original features. Would definitely recommend this as a top place to see.

Incredible place to see a show!. We went to see the Rockettes and the Christmas Spectacular! It was our first show in NYC and we would highly recommend it to others. The show itself was just so incredible and held the attention of my child (age 6) for the entire performance.There really are not any bad seats in my opinion but I had seats on the first floor and would recommend them to others. The items for sale were a bit pricey and I paid over $5 for a bottled soda pop so advice to bring water or something like that if possible.There was an opportunity to take a picture with a Rockette or Santa, which we took advantage of and would recommend getting there when the doors open (one hour before the performance) and get those first so that you look your best and beat the lines as the picture is fast but waiting in line to get the picture and pay was longer.The bathrooms on the ground floor were huge and reminded me of days gone by....a must see!

Amazing Stage!!. What can I say about this amazing place. If you can ever watch a concert at Radio City please do, its built perfect for sound. I have seen many of performances here. The most amazing was years ago when Whitney Houston had a concert there. Her voice sounded incredible. I seen her a few times in concert at other venues it was nothing like this. Also, The Christmas show is a must see.

Gotta go here once in your life!. You've gotta see at least one show at Radio City once in your life. I have seen the Christmas Spectacular here and it was wonderful. This is a great venue. I have also been to graduations here. The venue is large but not so large that you won't be able to see from your seat if you are far away. The acoustics are perfect in the theater. The lobby of the building has a very old hollywood vibe to it. The style is art deco and can be seen in the lobby and bathrooms. There are some artifacts from old movies and shows in cases in the lobby as well. This may change. Around holiday time, they dress up the outside and the inside of the building and it is lovely.

Christmas Extravaganza. We had a totally awesome experience at the Music Hall. The Rockettes were great. We had great seats and the show was beyond all my expectations. The staff was also great, even taking pictures of the guests. I was just expecting some high kicking, but the program was great. We also saw their signature Toy Soldier routine. A great experience you won't regret seeing.

Christmas Spectacular was just that ... . Incredible show! Every moment was wonderful. The storyline was really good. A good mix of laughter, wonder and amazement. The toy soldiers were very good. Rag dolls were great also. The live Manger with real animals and a reading of the Christmas Story from the Bible was a perfect way to end the show. Must see if in NYC.

Magic for Children and Adults!. I was at opening day of the Christmas Spectacular with my nieces (13 and 16). We ALL loved the show! At 90 minutes (no intermission) it is long enough to entertain and short enough to keep from being bored (although we all agreed that the story line with the 2 boys and going to the North Pole was the slow part of the show). Our favorites were Christmas in New York and the Toy Soldiers. The seats are amazing...so big and comfortable with lots of leg room. Yes, it is expensive, but well worth the money.
christmas show. Saw the 2015 Rocketts Christmas Show and did not disappoint.1 1/2 hour went by in a flash . A must see Christmas show.

Best show in NYC . It was amazing show about 1 hour 30 minutes. Opening really good, fantastic voice, good singers, and good story. For people's who really like show this is one of show that you guys have to see, worth of money, very crowded all seat was full.

Christmas Show is well worth it!. We were a group of 6 and 3 had never been to Radio City. The overall rating was 5 stars!!!! So exciting!! Maybe a little too loud at times; I might need to pack ear plugs next visit. Great time! Loads of good memories!

A NYC Tradition. Our visit to NYC coincided with the first day of the Christmas Spectacular. We were glad we arrived early enough to take in a little of the grandeur of this beautiful venue. The scale of this building is impressive. The show is fun, inspiring, superbly crafted and of course the execution is impeccable. The inclusion of a skating piece was a pleasantly unexpected! The interweaving of the traditions of Christmas, both sacred and secular was well done. My review would be an excellent except that there was absolutely no attempt to control some audience members' insatiable desire to photograph and video huge portions of the show. Needless to say the glaring of phone and tablet screens was very distracting. Please leave them in your pockets and actually enjoy the show!
BACKSTAGE TOUR WAS VERY INFORMATIVE. The hall has a great behind the scenes tour. You get to meet a Rockette, You learn all about the history of the theatre and how it works.

Think of Christmas. I always think of Bing Crosby and White Christmas and the Ed Harrison Show.The christmas show eavh year held at Radio City is a must. Just bought tickets ready for this christmas show will be re visiting in December.
Worth a vist. Excellent tour and well worth the visit setting up for Christmas while we were there wish we could of been there for the show

Superb!!. We were lucky to visit for the 1st Xmas show with the Rockettes. What an impressive building. The show was the best Xmas show we've ever seen and is a must if you're in NYC during the holidays. The staff are really friendly and helpful too. Excellent all round!

Rockettes...Always a great show. What a terrific venue regardless of what you are attending, but we saw the Spring Rockettes show with Derek Hough and it was great. Sometime I think, "Well, you've seen them once and that's enough," but that is not necessarily true. Radio City Music Hall is iconic and if there is something playing that you want to see, make sure you go and engage in a little history. It's really inspiring.
Surprisingly Great Tour!. We learned so much and were amazed by the theatre and history. We did this at the last minute and felt it was definitely one of the best tours.

It's Spectacular. The Rockette show at Radio City is just spectacular. But the venue itself it just incredible. One cannot appreciate the enormity of the venue without actually visiting and seeing a show. Different sections of the Hall are deserving of their own Zipcode.

What a wonderful tour of a beautiful building.. A guided walking tour of the entire building. Very interesting. An exquisite building, wonderfully restored. Beautiful. Get to meet a Rockette, see the costumes, all the wonderful Art Deco furnishings. Must be able to climb 3 stories of stairs.
LOVE RCMH. Def take the backstage tour of RCMH and the Rocketts and definitely get in a show if you can. They're amazing and RCMH is def a must while in NYC
Very Interesting. An absolutely beautiful building. The tour was very interesting and informative. Definitely worth doing if you are interested in the history of Radio City Music Hall.

A Must See for any Tourist. This is an amazing place. The theater itself is so amazing, so grand, the lobby... the entire theater. So much history here as well. A definite must stop for anyone visiting NYC... whatever the show. Also, don't miss the backstage tour they offer.
Great Trip. I went to see the Radio City Spring Spectacular and it was amazing. Everything was life-like, and I especially liked the features of the show. I greatly recommend it!
Magnificent hall with decent sound. Lately I've been enjoying an increasing variety of musical and dancing performers here. Definitely worth at least a show with the Rockettes
Best Christmas show!. Love the Rockettes! This is the best Christmas show and really gets you in the spirit. Prices are high for souvenirs, but that's what Granny's are for! Love our annual trip!
Fabulous Christmas Show. I went to the Rockettes Christmas Show, I didn't really want to go but it was the only show we could get tickets to. Was terrific show, great fun.

A wonderfully designed venue to experience music or a show. When first designed, they found there was too much echo off the walls, thus you will find drapery sourrounding the walls outside of the stage area. I've seen numerous Christmas Shows and some concerts. A large venue with a small town feel. Really lovely. Enjoy!
Yearly Trip to the Rockettes. We have been going to RCMH for years each Christmas to see the Rockettes. There is nothing that gets our Christmas season started like a trip to Radio City. Magical.
Great tour. Take the tour, it is really good and very informative. The interiors are gorgeous. Book in advance as tours start at predetermined times.

Art Deco delight!. I can't recommend the backstage tour highly enough. This takes you to the places that you don't get to see as a regular patron and gives you a real insight into the history of the building, which is breathtaking in both scale and decor.
Absolutely fascinating from start to finish, don't even think about it, just do it!

Radio City Music Hall with the GV TRAVEL KING. This Music Hall is quite a sight to see. As someone who has a serious appreciation for architecture and design– I have to say, the interior of the Radio City Music Hall is a visual delight of architectural wonder. While retaining the regal and classic look of an older time period, the space still captures the grandness and scale that surprised, shocked, enamored all those who lived in the old days. I'm referring to a scale and magic that would melt even the most modern viewer. When it's showtime, the architecture of the space surrounds you and it really has you focusing on the stage. The lights, the sound– everything is so nice. It's such a delight being in that space.
Beautiful. Have been there many times, just the outside reminds , and gets you in the spirit of Christmas. Always have a special feeling walking by.
Rockettes Holiday Show. Saw the holiday show here. Kids loved it. Go early, lots to look at inside and it's huge, so there are a lot of people that are trying to get in the doors.

Backstage bliss. It's a real treat to go backstage at any theatre so this is a fantastic opportunity. The gorgeous interior with its lush opulence gives way to a huge backstage area designed to cope with any situation! Amazing!!Meeting a Rockette was the icing on the cake!
The Rockets. When in the city during the christmas holiday, go see the rockets if only once, it's worth it, then stay and grab a bite to eat at the many restaurants.

Back stage tour. I would highly recommend this for a tourist or a local. Very interesting tour below,backstage & up in the roof. You see all aspects of the theatre. Only warning is there are a lot of stairs to be climbed. One of the highlights is meeting on e rocketttsupstairs.

Take this tour. Fantastic tour. Every room and almost every step my breath was taken away. Excellent building with so much history. Great to chat with an actual Rockette. Would certainly recommend this tour as you will not be disappointed.

Home of the Rockettes. Historic entertainment hall comes alive each Christmas season with their 90 minute, no intermission Christmas show featuring the Rockettes. The building's interior is magnificent. Children will remember their visit. Show is so entertaining.

Take the tour of this outstanding venue. The tour is fantastic and gives an insider's view of this outstanding venue. You will come away with a tremendous appreciation of this place and all that it has to offer.
Excellent tour. Well worth a visit. Tour guide very good amazing building with so much history. Art deco brilliant has been upgraded without losing the atmosphere.

Christmas Spectacular with the Rocketts a definite must see.. We were lucky enough to go and see the Rocketts Christmas Sectacular and it was worth every penny fab show for everyone adults and children.

Best at Christmas Time. The world famous radio city Rockettes are a must see for all ages. The Christmas show is spectacular. I first visited when I was a child. Going back as an adult brought back many wonderful memories.
Meet a Rockette. Fabulous Art Deco building with an interesting guide. Was able to learn all about the history and even met a Rockette who gave a talk about her work.
Iconic. Great place to stop by and visit if you're already near Rockefeller Center. I'd love to see the Christmas show there some day.
Take the backstage tour. Fantastic venue to see a show (like the Christmas Show). The backstage tour is worth a try....and it ends with a photo op with a Rockette!
The best concert venue in NYC. Have been coming here since I was a kid. My first concert was Cheap Trick. Great acoustics and ambiance.

Take The Tour!. If you are planning on visiting Radio City Music Hall you must take the tour! You get to go around almos the whole building, they tell you amazing facts about everything that has happened and not happened, the memorabilia in there is priceless, and if you happen to find yourself in New York during Christmas time, you get to meet one of the Rockets and take a picture with her!!

Great venue. Such a great venue to see your favorite artists. Very easy to get to via public transportation or driving. If you drive, I would recommend trying out spothero.com. I found very discounted and convenient parking near the venue.
Art Deco !!. A masterpiece of Art Deco luxury - got a tour of the theatre - on stage and behind. Even met a Rockette!
Classic. Iconic architecture and one of the best concert venues in the city. If you get a chance take a guided tour to rally get a handle on why this place is so beautiful and unique.
A NYC staple. Very cool to catch sight of this legendary place when strolling around 6th avenue. There is lots to see in this area.

Beautiful Interior w/ Great Sound. We have visited a few times and it's a little chaotic getting inside, but once you are in the lobby, the building is beautiful. We have seen the Rockettes Christmas show and the Decemberist's concert and the sound was great and seats were comfortable.
Must see. Would love to see the Rockettes Christmas extravaganza. Go to TKTS in times sq for discount tickets day of event! Cool building, lots of history
Christmas Spectacular. Amazing Christmas Show! With special effects. A little bit sceptical before but really entousiast at the end!

Tour is great. We visited as part of the behind the scenes tour. The tour guide was very informative and knew his stuff and the venue is fascinating. The end of the tour includes an interview and a photo (for purchase) with a Rockette.This tour is probably best for either people who love theatre or are familiar with the Rockettes

Back in Time. A wonderful place to spend 75mins enjoying the past and learning all about its history and magnificent 30's style decor .It is walking tour with stairs perhaps not too suitable for people with walking problems

Music Hall. This is an Icon in the city. Great place to come and take some photos. The best time to come is during the winter time so you can see the christmas tree. Add this to your list when you come.

Radio city music ever hall. the RCMH tour is fantastic! The story of its history was one I didn't know and was amazed to hear. The stage area is awesome. The whole experience was well worth the price. I have not seen a show there yet but would love to do so in the future.

A hidden gem. I had access to this via our 2 day New York bus passes that we were sold at premium price ! Initially a great deal sceptical , in fact this was a riveting tour for the whole family over 90 mins - 2 hours It was really worthwhile seeing and one for the bucket list is to go back and see a Radio City Hall Christmas spectacular !

Christmas Show is a Must for First Time Visitors. Getting your Christmas Spirit filled before or after the holiday can happen with the Rockettes and their Christmas Extravaganza! Such fun for everyone!

The Rockettes Spring Spectacular. Great experience. Everyone who visit or live in New York City should take few hours and watch the Rockettes in action!! They are a legendary icon of NY and it is a most!! I totally recommend the experience.

The Rockettes Christmas show. The Christmas show at Radio City Music Hall is a NYC a tradition and one not to be missed. Nothing will get you in the Christmas spirit more that December in the city and this show

A Great Tour. Even if you are able to attend an event at Radio City Music Hall, you should take a tour as well. It is very informative about the history of the venue, how much work goes into the shows, the behind the scenes, and seeing things that only the performers and famous get to see.

Great place to visit!!. We had a lot of fun walking around Radio City and the NBC Studios. This place is rich in history and you can feel and see it in every inch. We recommend RCMH as a part of any vacation to the city. We cannot wait to return!!

institution in nyc. when a proformer wants to make the big time in ny, they strive to get to radio city. this place has seen all the greats. one thing negative, it is so hugh, that seats near the rear are redered useless
amazing. one of my all time favourite places to visit,especially with all the christmas shows ,you really do feel part of all of it well worth a visit
Historic concert hall. Radio city hall is a very comfortable event space and I enjoyed the Rockettes and America's got talent at this venue in the heart of midtown.

Inside tour. Wonderful guide. Beautiful building You will meet a Rockett and be able to ask questions and have your picture taken with her We saw the hydraulics for the stage and watched them getting the Christmas show ready Do the Christmas show if you are in town

Christmas Spectacular. Took my young daughter to the Christmas Spectacular show here featuring the Rockettes. The show was outstanding and really put us in the holiday spirit. The interior is very nice and old school. If you have the opportunity to see this show or another, do it! Quintessential New York experience right here.
Amazing place. We saw their the cirq de sole show. the place is big but you can see good from every where. the place is amazing, old and magnificent like old times movies.

Amazing Theatre. Our New York City Pass got my son & I into this amazing theatre for a free backstage tour. Our guide was so full of interesting information & we could imagine each show so clearly that she gave us stories about. The building itself is truly stunning & majestic & a complete maze of corridors, stairs & rooms. So many famous people have performed here & we were honoured to actually walk on the stage, apparently only 1% of visitors get to do that. We got to meet a Rockette & learned so much about them. Would love to go back & actually see a show there. Check out the 'ladies' as they are out of this world. The most beautiful art deco place I've ever seen. A definite must if you are in New York.

Informative and interesting guided tour. The guided tour is well run, and combines useful background historical and technical information. It focuses on the Rockette experience rather than on the golden days of its cinema years. Includes the magnificent foyer, luxurious toilets, back stage, dressing rooms, etc. Amazingly, you can't buy a souvenir booklet or postcards etc -what a missed commercial opportunity.
Radio city tour. Well worth a visit. Our tour guide was very informative and entertaining on our tour of the prestigious theatre. The back stage element of the tour was great!

The absolute best to see a movie or a live show. A visit to Radio City is always a treat. A legendary classic in art deco design. I cannot count the times I have been here, but each time feels like the first leaving me in awe of the beauty of this magnificent show place.We had tickets to see the movie Back to the Future in HD with the NJ Symphony Orchestra playing the movie score live. A spectacular evening. Cannot wait to go back to see the Christmas show
Rockettes. You have got to see the Christmas show at radio city. Wonderfully entertaining and a real treat for the whole family. Worth the price.

The most incredible venue. It is surprising to have a tardis of a venue such as this in the heart of New York City. We went to see the Christmas Spectacular (those Rockettes don't half know how to dance in unison!), but the foyer of the venue (downstairs) was amazing to see a space restored and maintained from a golden era. Huge candy stalls, plush carpets, the toilets with chaise longue's in the waiting area. Spectacular.

Impressive Old Facility, Worth Your Time. If you are interested in beautiful old Art Deco facilities, this is the place for you. On the tour, we saw many different areas in this facility and even got to meet a Rockette. Of course, they will not let you take a picture of the Rockette. You may pose with them and purchase a photo from them. If you are interested in mechanics, you will get to see how their huge stage is operated from below.
Spectaculap place. This is a spectacular place to see a show. When in NYC during the winter months, the Christmas show must be seen. Fun for all ages. A must do.
Spectacular. We did the tour which was very interesting and well done. Next time I will make sure to buy tickets to what ever is playing! An amazing theater.

TOUR GUIDE BAD. This has a lot of history associated with it. Unfortunately our tour guide was on her cell phone twice during the tour. Very unprofessional. There were questions from other tourists that she was unable to answer. She made the comment she was only three weeks into the job. By the was she acted on the job I doubt she will last another 3 weeks. With a place filled with so much history we expected more.
Nice and informative tour. I really liked this place even though I had no idea about it. It was more of a last minute decision to take the tour and I think it was really good.
Make sure you see the Christmas Show. Nothing compares to a visit to the Hall when the Christmas show is playing. The Rockets kick their highest then. Always a spectacular experience.

Remarkable preservation and Engineering. We visited it only today. Our tour lasted 75 minutes and the tickets were bought from the candy store next door. It was about 20 $ a piece for seniors. A bit expensive considering hat we had to shell out another about 20 $ plus for a photograph with one of the Rocketeers, Shelby in her gorgeous costume, as a souvenir. However, as an Engineer, I was particularly impressed by the engineering expertise which went into the hydraulics of stage movement, with 6 columns which could be lifted by the force of hydraulic pressure. Considering that it was conceived in the 1930's, it is indded a remarkable engineering feat. Also, was highly impressed at the thoughtfulness of the architect, who wanted everyone to enjoy the experience, that he gave even the last seat holder ample leg room. Wish our economy airlines, can take a hint from this.

Back stage tour. This tour takes you back to another era. The 1930's. The guided tour is very informative detailing the history of the theatre and you have access to all areas back stage,you would otherwise never see. The theatre still has the original 1930 furniture still in excellent condition and original wall coverings and carpets have been restored. The ladies toilets are also worth a visit to see the powder room. Would recommend this tour.
Rockettes!!. Saw the Rockettes' Christmas show. Their choreography is stunning. Costumes are beautiful. A great family show!

It's NOT Christmas without seeing the Christmas Spectacular performed by the "Rockettes". The "Parade of the Wooden Soldiers" is worth memories that your whole family will remember & cherish. Check it out on the Radio City Music Hall web page and plan your trip!My wife & I have seen the Christmas Spectacular many times and we're going to see it again this December. Adults or children, your whole family will have a great time!Merry Christmas!

The Rockettes are amazing!!!. I loved the Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes! We saw the show at Christmastime. It was a wonderful experience. The performance by the Rockettes is energetic and electrifying. This show can be enjoyed by the whole family. The costumes and backdrops are colorful and entertaining. If you are in New York City during the holidays, don't miss this show! You will love it!!!

A fine bit of Christmastime fluff. The show was a lot of fun with special visual effects. We all found something to like, from me and my wife to our under-10 children. The storyline and sets kept our interest, but the show started to drag near the end. The nativity scenes were framed and lit beautifully.

Take the Tour. We played tourist in Midtown and this was a highlight. As Westerners, the history, art, engineering and magnificence personified New York. Now, we have to back to see the Christmas show! An elevator that can lift elephants to the stage? Amazing. While standing in the balcony at the back, we could hear gaffers talking on stage in normal voices--tremendous acoustics to go with beautiful vistas.
Historic beautiful place. If you get to see a show in this historic music hall you must go. Been going since I was a kid. The Christmas show is nice and they have sveral concerts and shows there.

Radio City Music Hall ...home of the Rockettes. A must see for new visitors to NYC. A huge theater with delightful movies / stage shows .... depending on time of year but the theater itself is a spectacle to see. The famous Rockettes perform and the size of this theater will amaze you.

Happy we did the backstage tour!. AGT had just finished up, but the theater was pretty much back to it's normal state. Without tickets for a specific show we'd otherwise never have seen the inside of this remarkable venue. Huge, huge, huge. Really enjoyed the tour and learning the history.

A must visit to see the Rockettes or the Annual Christmas Spectacular!. I love this part of Manhattan where the restaurants are wonderfull and unique..you can choose from steakhouses to sushi places to dine. Come here for the shows but it's better to buy the tickets on-line to get your discounts. If you are staying at any of the local hotels ask your concierge to get you discount tickets for this attraction. The art-deco building is worth booking a sight seeing backstage tour if you are into this kind of stuff...worth the visit in my books. Have fun!
Following the film of Woody Alan-Radio Days. Following the film of Woody Alan-Radio Days.Visit a little expensive.I enjoyed every minute.The guide was charming and interesting. Recommended.

Architecture, Deco and theatre...oh my!. If you're a fan of architecture or theatre or art deco then Radio City is a MUST SEE! The backstage tour is well worth your time and money. Fascinating. Lots of useless trivia. Very grand. I've taken the tour at least a dozen times and each tour guide takes you to different places. Once we even got to go on stage and belt out a few lines of a favorite song (or just check out the view from that perspective for the non-performers). If you're VERY lucky you might even get to see the FABULOUS duplex apartment that's in there...somewhere. Ever wonder where they keep the animals that are in the Christmas Spectacular? Or how deep does it go when the orchestra slowly drops down out of sight? Where do the pipes from those pipe organs pipe to? And why does the men's room have a waiting room/lounge area in it that's four times as big as my whole apartment? Get the answer to these and other questions you didn't know you couldn't live without knowing the answers to during the tour. Oh...and...meet a real live Rocket!

puts you in the christmas spirit. Loved the Christmas show! such a joyful and happy event. It is perfect for children and adults alive. The Musical Hall is stunning too! Got the tickets from the half price boot - a bargain
Bucket List. Just going there and seeing the outside lights is not enough. However you cannot see the inside of the Theater without purchasing a Tour ticket or Show Ticket...

Absolutely Stunning. We visited radio sity music hall using the New York pass. We started of our tour at the main doors where we were greeted by our extremely friendly and knowledgeable tour guide Michael. All I can see about this building is that is stunning, with art deco design and incredible art work. This tour takes you through the complete history of the building including a look at the incredible entrance reception and music hall itself. Michael was a fantastic tour guide and I highly recommend this tour to anyone with an interest in New York History, music or architecture. A+++

Don't miss the Spectacular amazing show. One of the great memories while we were in New is the Radio City Spectacular show. An amazing show in large scale won't be forgotten. You find a combination of New York and Las Vegas spectacular show. Search for the promo code or people may pass the flyers with promo code from street, you can have a good deal for a great show.

A True American Treasure. Everyone should be able to visit Radio City Music Hall at least once in their lifetime! The Art Deco design, outstanding employees with manners from a bygone time and the ambiance are just part of the magic. The unchanged details ( original bathrooms just one of the surprises!) Comfortable seats, a good view from almost every section are a given. The sound is unbelievable!! I urge anyone who can afford to see ANY show at this magical venue to go! You will cherish your memory of the evening.

Best customer service ever.... Went to Radio City to see the rockets holiday show. It was so much fun. My parents, husband and the kids loved it. Not many places you can go these days and make all these age groups happy. Added note... We thought we had purchased tickets for Saturdays performance and realized Saturday morning that they were for Fridays show. I was so upset thinking we would have to pay more and it get good seats.... When we went to radio city they issued us 6 tickets at no cost for Saturdays performance and although they were way over on the side, they were only about 8 rows back in the orchestra and they really didn't have to accommodate us at all. Now that's customer service. We loved the show and will never forget this Christmas show, a must see if you are doing Christmas in NY...

The tour was amazing! . We took the tour around the Radio City Music Hall with Cristian B. and enjoyed every minute of it! Funny facts, amazing details, beautiful costumes and architecture and you get to meet one of the Rockettes! We met beautiful Ellen.

Spectacular show. if you are in New York then this is a must you have to see a radio city music hall show, saw the christmas show with the Rockets, it was fantastic, if you don't do anything else go and see a show here
Beautiful venue!. Such a beautiful and iconic venue! Love the history and the way that the building has been kept up. Catch a show here if you can - especially the Rockettes!

Amazing Architecture and Technology from the 1930's!. I knew little about Radio City before their tour, and was glad to become more informed. This building is a piece of history and has been beautifully restored. The theatre is a triumph of sound technology, designed in the 1930's! You also get a lot of background on the Rockettes and what it takes to be/stay one! Well worth the visit.

Celtic Women Concert. Christmas gift from my parents. Took the day visit NYC and ended with a wonderful concert at Radio City Music Hall. I can now say I've been there. Not what I expected ... better. It was smaller than I had thought. Hope to go back soon.

The Rockets Rock!. The Christmas Spectacular is exactly that, spectacular! An amazing show with the greatest dancers in the world. The Rockets never fail to impress, and the entire cast is just wonderful. The perfect way to celebrate the holidays, great for the whole family.

One of the best visits in Midtown Manhatten !. Excellent history in Art Deco Music Hall. The Backstage Tour was excellent as our guide had a great knowledge of the history and was also very humourous. We were overwhelmed with the sheer size of the Theatre and all it's expert functionalities considering the year it was build c1930's. Had the 1% chance of going onto the huge front stage- wow, this takes your breath away ! Also had the pleasure of meeting a live Rockette and hearing all about her training to retain fitness and precision dancing with her team.

Great Time. Faaaaaaaantastic place to go for a concert. The staff is excellent and customer service focused. Drinks are reasonable and plenty of bars for service. Acoustics were great and seats comfortable.

Great tour!. I really enjoyed this tour! We got to see different areas of the theater. It was a well done tour and very informative. We used our New York Pass so the price of the tour did not affect us. I do recommend this tour!

Radio City Combination. I saw Radio City Hall after visiting Top of The Rock, it was very central and right on the corner, the day I was here which was a sunday there was also a market and the whole block around it was closed to traffic. I did not go inside but there are tours that can be taken, the obligatory photo of the outside was taken and this was enough for me to know that I had seen this famous place. It is about four blocks from the centre of Times Square
Ben Howard Concert . Went to concert brilliant location and lovely building Was in upper mezzanine excellent view and great soundDrinks little expensive 10 dollars a bottle of bud light
Take the tour. Great place. we did the tour and very informative. Also have done the Spring Show as well as the Christmas Show and they both are a must see for all ages
Historic Radio City Music Hall. Visit this iconic venue to enhance your trip to New York City. Go to a show or just visit the hall. A must do.

Best guided tour ever - 'Angel'. Wondered whether to use our last attraction pass to visit here and was unsure to be honest until we read the reviews from this site. We decided to go and thank goodness we did. It was FANTASTIC so it was. I would highly recommend it.

Fabulous tour. Make sure to go on this tour. It is very unusual to be able to go back stage at a major theatre or a minor one. I was disappointed they charge for a photo with the rocket since I am accustomed to attending events and they give you a code and email you the photo. Oh well it was fun to meet a rocket and ask her questions.

The Rockettes Christmas Extravaganza is spectacular. Wow, those girls can dance. The props are great, the dancers are spectacular, the music is great. This is a must attend at least once, especially around the holiday season.

Worth a visit. Good tour for families, tour takes about one and quarter hours.You are able to suit in the chairs in auditorium and take photos and go under the stage. Interesting tour and includes the opportunity to meet a rockette for photo and ask questions.(you have to buy pic as you leave and they are overpriced) Worth the money spent.

Got free entry. We were watching Ellen live at the Rockerfella when a CNN rep approached us and offered us free tickets to watch America's Got Talent Live Semi Final , we couldnt belevie our luck so we headed round to Radio City and it was beutiful inside , our seats were on the top floor, but you still had a pretty good view from the top. The building is very grand.
Must see Radio City Music Hall. You have to do the tour of Radio Music City Hall. If you go at Christmas or when the Rockette's have a show spend the money to see the show as it is amazing.
Entertainment at its' best. Was able to secure tickets for the AGT finals at RCMH. Very interesting to watch how it is done, etc. Would love to see the Rockettes there one day.
Retro to the Max. This was a great tour. Our guide really new all the history. The hall was impressive, loved the bathrooms! It was wonderful to end the tour by meeting a Rockett!

See the Radio City Christmas Spectacular. Radio City Music Hall is such a beautiful art deco venue -- very elegant and lots of red velvet! It's a great place to see a concert but it is best known for the Christmas Spectacular and the Rockettes. Everyone should see the show at least once in their lives.
A must. The tour is the best -- beings this Art Deco jewel to life and you learn fascinating anecdots and see behind the scenes

A GREAT SHOW FOR ALL AGES. The legendary Radio City Music Hall presents some of the best shows available and you have the famous ROCKETTES. I have gone to the Christmas show and it was truly spectacular and entertaining for all generations A MUST GO TO when in town.

Loved it.. Loved the tour of Radio Music Hall. The day we visited there were rehearsals in progress for 'America's got Talent' We had a great guide. Could not believe the size of the stage - it's huge and the sound was brilliant. Great to see all the' behind the scenes' areas.
Radio City Music Hall NYC. The had and still have some amazing plays such as A Christmas Carol. There is always a long line so be sure to arrive about 30 minutes to an hour ahead of time.
Fun visit. Can't miss this iconic attraction. Everyone should visit Radio City even kids when possible. You never know who you see. It's always a surprise.

Beautiful Art Deco. I had no idea there was so much Art Deco design on the outside. Above and beyond the marquee. Since we were on a mission to see as much as possible in 2 days we didn't make it inside but so enjoyed seeing the exterior. I can only imagine the interior design and will have to visit again.
Best Show in NY. The Rockettes, amazing Christmas show that ever see. The Toy soldier was espectacular. Recommended 100%
Rainy day in New York activity. Very interesting look behind the scenes. Good rainy day activity. Takes 75 mins which was longer than we expected
Take the tour if you have time. Looks cool from the outside, but if you have enough time I would recommend taking the backstage tour.
Rocketts are a go go. We loved the Radio city Tour, not rushed loads of history and a fantastic view front of house and behind the scenes. The staff were fantastic!!

Go see the Rockettes. Would say that if you are in NYC around Christmas, go see the Rockettes. These girls work very hard to put the synchronized show, so it's definitely something worth to see at least once. But I did like the Christmas miracle part of the show the best. It was pretty amazing.

Entertaining. I was amazed by the shear size of the theatre. We took the back stage tour and learnt a lot about Radio City Music Hall. It was a
very enjoyable experience.
Old school look. Looks v old world in this part of town but a good reminder of the past. Also v close to magnolia bakery on the next cor,near!
the Rocketts. The Rocketts - great dancers, great show, well worth see, expect to book in advance on line to make sure you do see them

Glorious Theater. If you ever get to see the Rockettes perform here, you will have seen the greatest show on earth, I think. What an experience. Of course, there are many other performances here that do not involve the Rockettes, and I'm sure those are worth seeing in this glorious art deco treasure. The stage is styled like it has a setting sun behind it. When it opened 80-odd years ago, it was a 6,000-seat movie theater - which was the largest in the world at that time. The acoustics in here are terrific. Yes, this is a part of the sprawling Rockefeller Center complex.
Christmas,!!!!. Always like to visit this place in Christmas always reminds me of my childhood, nice show even tho they have taken a lot of its original

get your tickets months in advance if you can.. never been here? well you should as it is an Icon of NYC. Always a nice show going on with girls with legs as long as a train.Just to go inside this great building is worth a trip in itself.Holiday shows are great as well and well worth it. get tickets early,like months in advance if you can. It will make NY a trip to remember.

Radio City Music Hall. Everyone should experience Radio City Music Hall when visiting NYC, it is a NYC landmark and the home to some wonderful concerts and shows. It is a beautiful venue, some of the greatest entertainers in the world have performed on that stage. It is also home to the world famous Rockettes who perform there every year during the Christmas season and now In a Spring show as well. It is a place that is not to be missed!
Go! it is an experience!. Still love this place. Been going since I was a kid. hadn't gone for years but took my nieces who loved it as well. Grand theatre with terrific shows

Radio City. The show that is put on is absolutely amazing. I have been twice and loved it both times. I hear a lot of mixed reviews, but the atmosphere and performance is truly incredible. The Rockettes are a phenomenal group and are never disappointing. Any seat in the theater will give you a decent view of the huge stage and performers. Overall, a few things to note are that you will be crowded in the main lobby when you walk in and food is expensive. They have some novelty items that you can buy, and if you are lucky you will be there to get a picture with a Rockette before they go on stage. Great experience that I could go back to time and time again.

lovely ornate art deco building. take the guided tour to learn all about why and how this lovely building was built and it's near death before being saved from 'improvement'. a brilliant space and part of US history.

Always need to stop by to see it. Even if you're just in front, you can say you're there. The shows are pretty cool, especially the Christmas spectacular, bu pretty much any show with the Rockettes is a treat and well worth the money

Spectacular performance or Tour. If you have the chance to attend a performance at Radio City then don't miss out. If there are no shows at the time of your visit then take the tour. Either way you will be impressed by the splendour of this location.

Great tour!. My wife is a dancer and choreographer so there was no way we were going to miss out on a tour here. The building is astounding, and the tour was very informative and interesting, you even meet a real Rockette!! Highly recommended.
Elegant & iconic. Busy, much choice, great location, getting tickets can be a hassle though, i will visit again in 2016

Christmas Spectacular is a Must. The Rockettes Christmas Spectacular at Radio City is a must if you are visiting New York over the festive period.A fun filled performance to get you in the Christmas spirit filled with lots of singing and dancing and laughing. A special performance, must see at Christmas time. My fiancé did fall asleep during the performance so maybe not for everyone! But I absolutely loved it so he was happy I had enjoyed it!

Beautiful building, beautiful tour. We had the New York Pass and picked up tickets for Top of the Rock and had about two hours to kill before the time on our tickets. We walked across the street and got a tour of the Music Hall. It was fabulous. Our guide, Angel, was an angel! She was personable, knowledgeable and very helpful. The beautiful Art Deco building is the real star of this tour, and boy does she shine.

Pip the Dragon at Radio City Music Hall!!. We were not able to go inside as they were closed, however we did sit on the ledge by the fountains across the street and had lunch. America's Got Talent was filming during the week before the finals. We saw PIP the Dragon who does magic riding in a convertible that said Vote for Pip... That was cool!
Nice theater. Love the holiday decorations~Love the Christmas Tree on top of the roof. Love the lighting all over the theater! Definitely feeling the holiday spirit.
Great tour. we did the tour and was well worth the visit. Visited behind the scenes of the final of Americas got talent. Tour guide was great and very knowledgable.
What a great way to spend a couple of hours. What a great way to spend a couple of hours. The guided tour is very informative and meeting a Rockett was great.

Americas Got Talent!. We were fortunate to sign up to receive free tickets from Toronto for the show. We had wonderful seats near the judges. The Music Hall is beautiful and so grand. It is an unforgettable event in a historic setting.

A Classic Especially At Christmas Time. A Christmas Tradition every year for my family is to go to see the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall,it gets better and better ever year and is great for children of all ages including us grown ups who are still children at heart at Christmas. Radio City is a beautiful venue and it shines especially during the Christmas season.

good shows. all events here are good, the rockettes in christmas and this weeks I even saw florida free concert there
america got talent is taped there
Rasio City NYC. Tour guide was well versed. The theatre is beautiful. Sad they no longer show movies. The group size was managable.

Our family trip to NYC. We had just finished getting our tickets for The Ride and were just walking around when we came across Radio City Music Hall and decided to take the tour. Once again in the New York Pass. This tour was very informative as we walked through the entire building. We explored the secrets of the great stage, amazing art-deco interiors, saw the art-collection and even met one of the world famous Rockettes. If you like theatre then this is a must for you.
Great Christmas show. This is a great show to see at Christmas time like the old Hollywood movies with the show girls very well choreographed and well worth a visit

America's Got Talent. We were lucky enough to get free tickets for a semifinal of the American talent show, good seats, the theatre is awesome, if you get a chance to see a show then I advise you to go.
AWESOME. So much history here. I had no idea. Our tour guide did a very good job conveying the historical meaning in saving this building. I know a lot of people that would have enjoyed this tour.
Must visit if you are in NYC!. Must visit! If you read about its history, you may probably recollect good old memories of this place

A brilliant visit. I went on the tour a bit apprehensive on whether I would enjoy it. However, I found it fascinating. The guide gave such detail on the building and history. We were even fortunate enough to meet a Rockette. I would strongly recommend going on this tour.

loving on santa and the girls. the outside has the funny falling over lit up soldiers and cannon, inside one of the best ever designed in its era building if i could i would try to find time in my life just to study the building, great concession stand, and the show was superb combining the old show with new technologies was a brilliant move.
Radio City fun. We had a fabulous tour guide Kristen. We really enjoyed hearing about the history, the types of performances held there & the story about saving the venue. Thank goodness.

Good tour. This was my third visit to Radio City Music Hall spanning 50 years. It was always awesome but this time the hall has been restored to the way it was in the 30's and is beautiful. Our tour guide was first rate and we really enjoyed the tour,

Radio City Music Hall. We had a 2:00 tour of this complex with a very knowledgeable and personable guide. We got a good overview of the Hall's history and saw the behind-the-scenes areas that we would normally never see. We met a Rockette and had a picture made with her. She gave us some history of this group. It was a wonderful way to spend an hour!

There is NO Place Like Radio City Music Hall. This is a great and fun thing to do on a rainy day in NYC. I loved seeing the grand staircase and our guide was funny and informative, plus he took his time and let us enjoy the full experience.
Very good. See the Christmas and Spring Spectacular with the Rockettes. Amazing shows, spectacular building. Overall amazing.

Good informative tour. We enjoyed our tour of Radio City Music Hall. Americas Got Talent was filming/in rehearsal while we were there so a couple of areas we inaccessible, but overall it was an informative and entertaining tour.

Cool!. We walked here in hopes of being able to visit, but it seemed as though a show was going on during our visit, so we were unable to get in. From the little we saw, it was a very cool building on the outside and inside. On our next visit, we plan on taking a full tour!

Great 90 minute tour. Took the 90 minute tour. 26.00 if you buy on site, but only 19. if you purchase online. Well worth it - this building is a treasure. Could not believe how much is original, or carefully restored to original design (carpets, wall coverings etc. ) Don't skip the restrooms with foot petal hand dryers, they are original. "America's got talent" was in rehearsal - that was pretty amazing to see.

NY Best Sites to Visit. Whether your a native New Yorker or a tourist, Radio City is one place everyone should go to at least once to see their show. They also have tours on the inside that can be taken. Their Christmas show is exactly as they advertise "spectacular" I recommend anyone who is in town at Christmas time don't miss it!

"Showplace of the Nation" is the leading tourist destination in NY. Open to the public on December 1932, Radio City Music Hall has continued to provide lavish stage shows, film premiers, leading pop and rock performers. It has hosted the Grammy Awards, Tony Awards, Daytime Emmy Awards, the MTV Video Music Awards and lately the NFL Draft. The great stage is huge, 66 ft. by 144 ft., and resembles a setting sun. The Music Hall's "Mighty Wurlitzer" pipe organ is the largest threater pipe organ built for a movie theater. It has Identical consoles with four keyboards each on both sides of the Great Stage. The famous "Rockettes" perform during holiday season.

Christmas in NYC. We saw the Rockettes Christmas Show in December 2014 and it was magical. What a way to ring in the holidays...Christmas in NYC! The show was great and the Hall is fantastic! If you are in NYC, go see a show at Radio City.

Loved the lights. I couldn't stop taking photos of this place! Beautiful inside and out, definitely take the tour. Odd that they only sell tickets in the candy store next door which is very cramped, though. Tour guide was very knowledgeable.
Beautiful theatre, amazing to visit a place that famous.. We enjoyed watching a taping of America"s Got Talent, easy to get free tickets. Thank you NBC Studios. It was a memorable experience.

Fantastic guide. To be honest, we weren't too sure about what to expect, but as it was included in the New York Pass .. we wanted to give it a try. Well we weren't disappointed at all. The architecture and interior design create some kind of magic atmosphere that brings you to another time of glamour and glitter.We had as well one of the most fantastic guides (a lady in the 50's) that you cold expect. She was knowledgeable, passionate, funny, friendly .. Definitely one of the highlights of our trip to NY

Beautiful venue - shame about the tour guide. Liked - the venue is stunning and full of history, it's fascinating. Disliked - our Tour guide was knowledgable but spoke to people like they were Idiots & quite rude. A the point where you meet the Rockette - youre told to go into the room to have your photo taken with her. Those who weren't keen went to sit on the sofa and the guide went nuts speaking to us like children - make it clear! She also had no enthusiasm for the tour, she sighed when asked questions and stood there rubbing here neck with her eyes closed whilst speaking to us! If I did that at work I wouldn't last long.
Grand. When we were waiting to enter the music hall i was not sure what we will see because it looks like an ordinary bulilding from outside but once we enter we were surprised to see the grandness

Enjoy the show!. A bit outdated and run down; however, the performances and history are magical. The theatre is massive; a front and center seat are a "must". If you are in the "uppers", try and sit as close to the front and center as possible. Enjoy the show!
Cool. Very cool to see, kinda sneaks up on your because its just in the middle of the city. The marquee is really cool to see in person.

The Radio City Music Hall in New York>> Must visirt!. Being a Musician myself, I really enjoyed my visit to Radio City Music Hall. If you like any kind of Music then please do visit this Hall.It would be worthwhile your trip.

WOW !!! The Most BEAUTIFUL PLACE !!! A Must go to. The Acoustics are so awesome in this Radio City.I have seen so many Concerts and Venues.It Is Beautiful.It is such a Staple of NYC.You must go there to see a show.I do not care what show it is.The place is Gorgeous.Not a Bad seat in the place .I SAY A MUST DO IN NYC.... 10 STARS...LOVE IT
Fantastic icon Radio City. Great Icon worth a visit and you will be amazed at what this place represents. Right next to the Rock.

Well worth a visit. We took the guided tour which lasts just over an hour. It is very informative, and you get to see a lot of the venue. Also, one of the Rockettes is there for a photo op and some Q&A. This is really an historic theater, with a long life ahead of it.

You'll Get a Real Kick Out of It!. Another in a seemingly endless list of NYC institutions, nothing beats a good seat in RCMH and a Rockettes extravaganza. There's nothing like the precision and flair of the Rockettes. Long may they reign.

magnificent. love love love Radio City Music Hall........been to NYC many times. Always make a stop at RCMH. Did have the opportunity to see a show there. The interior is fantastic. Makes you think of the real hayday of NYC.

Neat tour, but disappointed we didn't get anywhere near the stage. We did the behind the scenes tour, and it was pretty good. My favorite party was getting to go up in the rehearsal rooms. So many celebrities have practiced in there! Just walking around the different levels was pretty cool--even the bathrooms are awesome! So many beautiful artistic details in the building! I have to say, though, I was definitely disappointed that we didn't get to walk anywhere near the stage. We didn't even get to walk on that bottom level because they were setting up for America's Got Talent. We did get to see the stage--but from the very top level, and it was tiny from there. Our guide was..umm.. interesting. She was a bit cranky and a little rude to some members of the group, although she did seem to enjoy her job and the history of the building. Meeting the Rockette wasn't really anything special--just a ploy to get your money for a picture with her. I would have paid for a picture near the stage with her, but not for a random awkward photo with a Rockette in a tiny room. Over all, I enjoyed it. I've always wanted to go inside the building, and it was a great introduction to the space. Very beautiful!
Historic. Well... thats an iconic Theatre/Hall... Many shows are held here, many artists were here, and you have to go see a show yourself!

Don't miss Radio City Music Hall. The tour of this amazing, historic venue is simply delightful. I'm an AGT fan so it was especially awe-inspiring to sit in the seats and dream, visit the powder room and talk to a Rockette. The Rockettes Sprin Spectacular was an amazing show, the lights and sound in the hall are worth the ticket.

Highly recommend the Radio City Music Hall Tour. My wife and I did the tour of Radio City Music Hall using our New York Pass. It is a truly amazing venue, was a great tour with a fabulous passionate tour guide.Kelly Clarkson was appearing at Radio City that evening and was doing her 'soundcheck' at the time we were on the tour. So it was an added bonus that we caught a glimpse and heard a few 'songs' along the way. Would love to catch a show at this iconic venue. Maybe next time we are visiting New York City.

TAKE THE TOUR!. Definitely take the tour! We did, as part of a city pass program, which would never would have without it. My son loves drama so for him to stand on the stage was awesome. You can even meet a Rockette.... A little disappointed that they make you buy the photo with her and don't let you take your own photo. We got tickets the morning of the tour with no problem.
great acoustics. We went there to see "america's got talent" the live taping of the show with free tickets, and enjoyed it thoroughly, the acts were amazing and the sight was unobstructed

Thanks for the memories. Loved the tour we did here and my 10 year old granddaughter named it as one of her favourite activities. We had a wonderfully enthusiastic guide and the interior is wonderfully restored.

Nice Land mark you will not miss. The word Radio City is very famous specially in India. I was not aware that there is a theatre in NY city which is a land mark.
We show this theatre while travelling to Top od Rockefeller .
It is very well decorated and land mark in the areas.

Fantastic Tour!. We absolutely loved this tour on our trip. Our tour guide was fun and knowledgable. The highlight was getting to see part of an "America's Got Talent" rehearsal in the theatre. I would highly recommend this tour for any theatre fans!
Go for the Xmas Show. An experience without question but not a frequent stop. Generally a mob scene - pay for the best seats you can afford and enjoy the evening - you will probably not be back!
saw as part of thr Rockefeller tour. We didn't go inside and do the tour as we had full days enough in our schedule! We did see the wonderful ornate art deco on the outside and the mosaic work!
amazing space. saw Tony Bennett and Lady Gaga here. Fab venue, very efficient staff and excellent location. If only going to shows in London was as pain free!

Christmas Spectacular !!!. Amazing Christmas Show for everyone , adults will enjoy it just as much as the kids. the foyer is out of this world , totally dazzled by the festive decorations and only a short stroll to the Rockefeller plaza to see the xmas tree there.

Why not?. Unfortunately, my mother and I did not go on the tour, but wish we had. Any other thoughts? This has been highly recommended, is close to many other things to see and do and the shop looks great.

The Christmas Spectacular, is just that.. The Christmas Specyacular, a must see. The Rockettes are amazing...bigger than life. The variety of performance numbers, but the 2 which I most enjoy are the wooden soldiers and the living nativity. A MUST see. A little pricy, but worth it, splurge on fairly decent seats, mid orchestra or front mezzanine.

What More Can Be Said?. What can you write that hasn't been said? You want NY? This is one of the icons. Saw several great shows here and it gives excitement and lot of fun for the kids to experience a tradition. Be ready for packed, always, but it's worth it just to say you did it. Another reason why this is truly one of the greatest cities in the world.
RCMH...wow!. The absolute best! So interesting and gorgeous decor! Hard to believe I was in a building that soooo many famous people performed on that exact stage! Tour was awesome also!

Definitely worth it. Still beautiful, especially if you are lucky to see a show. Was there for the taping of America has got Talent, so check to see if there is anything going on. Sounds and lighting was great, comedians etc to warm up the crowd.
Great Place for a Show!. Wonderful place to see a show; the theater has been renovated and maintained well and the pride in the original art-deco style of it is evident. Worth a tour!

Take the tour. In March, I made my second trip to Radio City Music Hall. Both times, I had taken the tour. My first time we walked onto the stage and my second time we sat in the audience. Each tour seemed to be unique to some degree. Radio City Music Hall is the place to check out; it is completely beautiful and impressive. I hope to someday see a show at Radio City.
Fantastic experience. Had an opportunity to experience America's Got Talent in this famous theatre. Beautiful, well preserved.

One of my favourite highlights. Omg this was one of my favourite attractions. Such a beautiful and grand entrance with original features. The tour guide was very informative and sounded so convincing in everything she said. We had the chance to meet a real Rockette with a question and answer meet and greet. You couldn't take your own photo with her as they used this as a money making opportunity which is a bit of a shame seeing as you've already paid to go in. I was so excited to get a little sneaky peak at the Rockettes actually rehearsing. This was a highlight for me as I've always loved the Rockettes.
Radio City!. A nice site to see! Lots of history at Radio city and is steps away from Times Square . Explore the list of famous people that have been there!
The Rockettes. Radio City Music Hall is known for the iconic Rockettes but there are many more amazing performers who come there to perform. You have to go just once.

Famous iconic musical theater!. One of the most famous musical theater in the world. If you get a chance see a show there. Cost dollars, but worth it. Good restaurants around this famous spot. A must see and worth a visit!
Christmas Show. A must see for locals and visitors alike around the holidaysa little of everything the glitz and the true meaning of Christmas
8-2015. A must do for New York, great tour and not expensive. They have a senior rate. Very informative and only an hour long, so it does not take up all of the day.

Rockettes - a must see. If you are in NYC at Xmas then you need to go and see the Rockettes. A great spectacle and an Xmas must in NYC. Seats and auditorium is so spacious and comfortable. A great evening at the theatre!

Out of this world. I visited Radio City to see were Liberace played to a sell out audience, where he played 28 straight shows. The staff were excellent in their history of the hall. I love every minute of it. A must see are the powder rooms! A time capsule. Will be back.

it's on your way. while you are walking to go to times square or grand central or anywhere in the center check radio city hall and Rockefeller center they are in the same road , lights and the building reminds you movies in nyc
wow music hall. right behind rockefeller central, which is great because you can take the subway right around the corner. The neighbourhood is just amazing; restaurants, shops, culture you name it...
America has talent. Enjoyed being in the audience for the live performances. Ticket lines were well supervised and acquisition of tickets ran smoothly, but we had to wait in line for about an hour.
America's Got Talent. We saw the live show and loved it. There is no bad seat in the theater. It is rotunda seating in three levels.
Take the tour!. the radio city music hall tour is a MUST. so beautiful on the inside, you get to sit in the seats, hear the history and even meet a Rockette!

A real treat. We had guided tour which was wonderful as our guide was so enthusiastic. We met one of the Rockets (I think this is what the dancing girls are called) and also were able to stand on the stage as there was nothing going on that day. The deco is so interesting. I recommend a tour of this place.

Worth seeing once. I did both the Music Hall tour and then the same evening we went to an America's Got Talent taping. The Music Hall is a beautiful place (and we met a beautiful Rockette - they try to sell you a picture with her) but our guide was a little dull - her jokes seemed a bit forced and tired. For the AGT taping, I had problems showing the enthusiasm they required from the audience and some of the acts, though this was near the end of the season, were just silly (but no longer entertainingly silly). Nice to see Heidi Klum (from a distance) but disappointed when they told me I couldn't take pictures.
Need more time here. What can be said about the Rockettes Christmas Show but AMAZING. The auditorium is amazingly beautiful. I'd love to go back for another show and maybe a tour.
Meet a Rockette. An interesting and informative tour of this amazing Theatre. Meet a Rockette and view the fantastic costumes. They were recording X Factor when we toured which was an added bonus.

NY Icon status!!. I went to a wonderful graduation from NYU here, and also saw the Radio City All stars on another occasion, its beautiful, I imagine its one of those venues that you feel the history, seating is all good, one of those NY experiences worth visiting, especially at Christmas!
A must see. If your into music, history and architecture then this is a must visit! Loved the tour we took backstage!

Radio City Music Hall, certainly in the top 5 of NY!. Americas Got Talent certainly made sure that we were going to visit Radio City Music Hall! The background tour was excellent and our guide (Alvin) very good. Meeting one of the Rockettes was very nice and to got to know the history and see the parts of the Music Hall that the general public do not always see, was great!
America's Got Talent. A beautiful theatre! Very large, exquisite décor and comfortable seating. We enjoyed the show and would definitely go back again.
one of a king. what a wonderful place. well kept, iconic, helpful staff and great sight lines. highly recommend a show here. is big but not too big and there should not be a bad seat in the house

Take the Radio City Music Hall backstage tour. We did not know much about the history of Radio City Music Hall until we took the backstage tour. We learnt that the hydraulics used to raise and lower the stage were kept a secret during WW2 because the same design was used for the hydraulics in the US aircraft carriers. The ladies and gentlemen's rest rooms were very different and have been well preserved. You also get the chance to meet one of the Rockettes and hear about the life they lead. All in all this was a tour well worth taking.
Very interesting!. A great tour of what activities go on backstage. The history of it was very interesting. And to think they were going to demolish it at one point.

Christmas in the city. The holiday season is on display loud and proud on many streets and in many window displays but for me, Christmas is truly Radio City Music Hall and the Rockettes. (Well of course and Santa too!) the show is always different and always the same in a few yearly favorite vignettes. Yes, I've been for other events, but the holidays aren't the same without the Christmas Show...
Amazing, a must see.. So neat...saw AGT live show.Looked like some pretty cool shows coming up too.This iconic building is a must see.

Fabulous Art Decor. We took a guilded tour and believe it was the highlight of our 8 days in NY. The guide was knowledgeable and interesting. The building was just fabulous. It has just had a US $70m reno and it shows. It is vibrant.
Beautiful Building. But if you don't have tickets for a show, use your time to go somewhere else. Not easily accessible to the general public.
First NFL draft. Went to NFL draft, great atmosphere, not better than Chicago, but was first time going to NFL Draft.

Do NOT miss this great experience. A great experience and definite on any trip to NY. The guide was good and if you walk out without being taken back by the splendour of it and the size of the hall then I'll eat my hat! Its well worth the $24 entrance fee and certainly not a rip off
Top of the Rock. A magnificent social and cultural area of the city. A trip to the Top of the Rock is most enjoyable. The architecture is fabulous.
Everyone should see the Christmas spectacular!. The radio city Christmas spectacular is amazing year after year. The rockettes are a must see around the holidays.
Radio City a Fixture in NYC!!!. A landmark in NYC. The productions continue to thrill children through adulthood. The rockets are hopefully a permanent fixture on the NYC scene!

Beautiful venue. This is a gorgeous venue. We saw America's got talent here. We enjoyed it. I wish they would have stuck with the age 10 limit that we saw when getting our tickets. We had a 3 year old kicking our seat and climbing over other seats and listening to crackling water bottles is annoying as is listening to a man speak behind you making it hard to hear anything else. Otherwise great place to see events at.

History you cannot miss!. Mostly known for it's Christmas show and the Rockettes, I once saw a filming of two shows for Wheel of Fortune there. As a child, there wasn't one Christmas show we missed and back then, it even came with a movie. The stage has so many curtains and sets it is truly amazing.
Glamerous. This place is entertaining even without a show. The art deco interior is breathtaking. Enjoy any show in this glamourous place

Do the Stage Door Tour!. We took the Stage Door Tour and had a great experience. Interesting facts and an opportunity to meet one of the Rockettes! Our daughter who is a dancer really enjoyed this experience.

Great stage, great staff. We scored free tickets to see Americas Got Talent. My son was simply enquiring about the show and they offered them to us. They were so kind in the way they spoke to us and helped us get in to pick up the tickets. We returned for the show and enjoyed our evening so much. Its a beautiful theater with lovely memorabilia inside. Even from the "nosebleed" section we had a great view of the stage.

A must see for every Rockette fan. My husband went along with this tour since I really wanted to do this. However, we both enjoyed the tour. We were lucky enough to do the tour on a rehearsal day for America's got talent and we were able to see part of the rehearsal.
Rockets. Go see the rockets. Fab show that leaves you mesmerised. Especially the Christmas spectacular. The old theatre is huge and the red curtain just adds to the luxury.

Take the tour! Government secret revealed during the tour!. Take the tour of this iconic music hall! You will learn and see VERY interesting things that you did not know before. Like: the stage was protected and studied by our government for decades. Take the tour... You will learn why. (Don't want to spoil the secret.) Bonus: You get to take a photo with a Rockette girl.
