Fantastic Old Theatre!!!. Grand theatre from America's gilded age. The one, the only.... Radio City. Superb acoustics, an organ that rattles your bones and contemporary shows to please the masses. Don't miss the Christmas show....
Radio City WInner. Have been to several shows there and also took the backstage tour which is offered during the day. Fascinating to see and to hear the tour guide.

Excellent!. Having walked parlay this gorgeous theatre on our last few vista to NYC we finally decided to do the tour- and I am sorry we didn't do it sooner. Inside the building is absolutely stunning and the tour takes you backstage as well as into the auditorium. You get to see some costumes and meet a Rockette. There is also a short film that gives more history and insight. At 75 minutes I was scared that I would lose interest, however, our guide was engaging and informative without being intrusive or OTT. The meeting point could be better sign posted. It's not at the main entrance of 50th rather you enter from 51st. Please don't miss the opportunity to see this amazing place!

Beautiful, elegant auditorium. I only rated this as Very Good rather than Excellent because at the time of the tour they were filming America's Got Talent so we were not able to photograph the theatre which is absolutely stunning. To think this classic beauty was going to be torn down. Thanks Goodness New Yorkers protested enough to ensure that it retained its place in American culture and was fully restored in its majesty. It is a breath taking theatre, and a must see in New York.
Unbelievable place !!. Unbelievable Place & a must to go to , we were lucky enough to watch a Christmas show & it was fantastic what a place full of history where so many great artists have a sung

A World Class Attraction. The Rockettes are an attraction at Radio City Music hall that you
will never forget. The live organ music is terrific and just the size
of the place and Art Decco design is unbelievable.

Radio City Christmas Spectacular. its busy but well run. The line is out the door when you first get in. it is a very historic landmark and the shows are always amazing. we go to radio city every year for the christmas show. we will always return.

A must see while in New York.. Attended a live broadcast of "America's Got Talent" The staff at Radio City Music Hall ran the show with good spirits and much professionalism. Of course the building and it's history are a must see while in New York.
really loved it. my friend dragged me here, but i really loved it ! i will take my family here when they come to visit you should to!

A landmark not to miss!. I came to. NYC on a tour and one of the stops included RCMH. This theater is classic NY and worth the time. Sitting in the back row of the balcony, you can hear people having conversations clearly while they are sitting on the stage. If you like classic NYC, take this tour.
Looks amazing. Din't actually get to go inside but from the outside the building looks fantastic,Especially at night when it shines bright.

Once is more than enough. Just Alright - expected more history and to be taken back in time -perhaps highlights of great events. Tour was rushed, an overuse of the word "iconic" and "ceiling", scripted - led by performers and not proper professional tour guides/historians and more a marketing effort to sell photos with the famous Rockette. There was a time, I believe, when the tour allowed a view of the backstage workings, which was terrific - althoug my wife did enjoy the "old" ladies loungeOur travelling companions took a tour of Madison Square Garden (Radio Musical Hall is owned by the same company) and found the same circumstances......Think we will skip
what a place. the shows here are well worth going we have been to see thr rockets as well and the inside makes it worth while on its own
a New York Landmark. great crowd control on entry and exit. We were there for the Rockettes Christmas special. What a treat. Will repeat in the furture.

A MUST SEE!. You have to go during CHRISTMAS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Amazing! So much history. We took a tour at the Radio City Music Hall........If you have never been you have to go and check it out. Worth a detour!

An evening,,, well spent. a New York institution... well managed entry/exit. we went for the Rockets Christmas Special and we weren't disappointed at all.
Will look for other opportunities to go in the future.

Top of the ROC! A must see. I can not say enough about seeing the sights in NY, this being one of the famous one. Radio City has so many things to see and has many different reasons to go. But start with the View.
Don't miss it!!!. Always, always wonderful to visit. Christmas show? Priceless. Rockettes Rock. The 3D portion engages the audience. So much fun.

Huge music hall. An incredible sized theatre located in Rockefeller Centre; seats 6000. We really enjoyed The Spring Spectacular with The Rockettes. We had booked online & collected the tickets there- worked well. After the show we enjoyed wandering around the Rockefeller Centre area where we also had dinner. Another item on the bucket list ticked off.

Gotta have tickets!. We walked around the lobby only to be screened by security, then asked for tickets. Unfortunately, we were just checking out the sites and didn't realize tickets were required. We weren't able to take any photos of the lobby. It was neat to see the outside of the building and see some of the shows that are featured.

Iconic!!. Was happy just to see the outside of this iconic theatre! We happened to see Santa and the Rockettes as they filmed a spot for the Christmas special (snowing in August??). It was fun when they closed down 6th Avenue and set up a street market in front of the theatre.

Fantastic insight into Radio City. Fantastic tour with lots of insight from the tour guide given throughout the tour - made the history of the venue really come to life and it's possible to imagine how great this venue would be to see a live music or other event. The tour guide, Tabitha, was really friendly and knowledgeable keeping the entire group engaged.

see rock bands in style. absolutely fantastic location with great shows and atmosphere
only in the USA can you see a rock band in true luxury
THE BEST OF THE BEST. If you are visiting NYC and want to see some of the best shows in Manhattan and with Christmas 4 months away a can't be missed Rockettes, get tickets now.
Rich history, great shows. A NYC landmark and a great venue. Being in the theater is as much fun as any show. I highly recommend the backstage tour.

A interesting and good value tour. This is another excellent value for money tour. The building is full of Art Deco and is quite something to see. We toured back stage and were able to see the stage where, when we visited America's Got Talent was being staged. A really good guide showed us around in a group of about fifteen. There was no queuing which was wonderful. A peaceful and enjoyable tour.

History and Today - wrapped in one. When I first entered Radio City Music Hall.. I was amazed, astounded, and in awe of this amazing building that has housed sooo many famous concerts and events. I hve been here only for the christmas show by the Rockettes, but would love to go back.

VERY INTERESTING PLACE. We were guided by a very easy to listen to lady who described all the history, facts and stories of the building very well with ample opportunities for photographs and questions. We were introduced to an actual Rockette (America's answer to the Tiller Girls) for a photo shoot and ask any questions. A fascinating tour well worth the money. remember to ask for the senior citizens rate if you qualify.

You haven't visited New York untill you see Radio City.. You will not see a threater like this anywhere else in the world. What this place can do is unbelievable. And if you can time your visit for the holidays you MUST see the Christmas show. You have to be dead not to be impressed. You will really enjoy it.
Restored beautiful music hall. You cannot come to NYC and not stop by Radio City Music Hall. This venue brings you back in time. It is a beautiful concert hall. Every seat is a good one.

Impressive!. My kids and I visited Radio City Music Hall the first time for the Christmas show and were wowed by everything we saw. We just went back for a taping of America's Got Talent and were just as impressed with the entire location! Our seats were on the second Mezzanine and we could see all the action on the stage.

Share the Beat. Radio City MH is something special for all music & art in general lovers. It's part of the most common and aspirational "place to visit" list.It's very close to R-Center, few minutes walk from the 5th. If you proceed straight to the end of the street you will find a FANTASTIC bakery on the right corner. A sweet idea and additional motivation :-)

fun and we got to see the dress rehersal for america got talent. love art nevo and this is a great example of design. the guide was great: friendly, paitent and knowledgeable. the only problem was it was a bit difficult to book by phone

Terrible tour guide.. Our tour guide was one of the worst tour guides that I have ever come across in years of travel. We went after reading excellent reviews of the regular guide. He was absent when we went and the replacement guide was a young woman who struggled to remember what to tell us. She knew very little about the place and told us that she needed a coffee to help jog her memory. She also said that she been away for a week and forgotten all she had learned about the place. She was a total waste of time. On the positive side, the building was very beautiful. It would have been nice to have someone there to tell us about it. Overall we felt that we paid far too much just to see a foyer and the main hall.
Movie and The Rockette's. My mother took me to Radio City Music Hall when I was young. We saw a movie "Friendly Persuasion" and also The Rockett's. They performed with such accuracy! Jane H.

Christmas show at Radio City Music Hall. Went for the Christmas Spectacular show. It was everything
I imagined it would be like. It was a wonderful show.
GREAT VENUE. A must see especially the Christmas show. The sound is outstanding and seating is good anywhere. There are many top artists that perform during the year.

"RADIO CITY". A New York CityLandmark! Great Shows & great To People Watch! Folks gather here from all over the World! The Show I enjoy the most, every year, I Do Not miss this show every year is, The Christmas Spectacular! It is spectacular! The World famous "Rockets & santa claus are the Best! For kids of all ages from 1 to 91 the music hall is wonderful, & the Decor is Art Deco, renovated awhile back, a Beauty!!

Visiting with a dance group. Learning the history of such an iconic place was well worth the visit. The tour guide was knowledgeable and wonderful. Meeting a rockette was wonderful, she not only was beautiful but wonderful to talk to.
You must visit. You can make a tour inside if you want from 9 am to 5 pm, is a very important place to receive artist coming from all places in the world

Back Stage Tour. Fascinating back stage tour that lets you go where your average audience member cant. Fantastic guide who was very knowledgeable about the building and it's history. Well worth doing if you're visiting.
Radio City Music Hall. It was very nice. There were so many foods to choose from. The pizza I got was very satisfying and one slice was all I needed.
America's Got Talent. One of the best shows that are a must see. They never fail to have the contestants do a better job on stage than some of the famous people I have paid to go see.

Art Deco. Amazing tour full of interesting facts and observations, the building it self is beautiful full of Art Deco, even the restrooms have to be seen! It's not easy access as there are a lot of stairs, but this tour was a highlight to my trip and I nearly didn't bother with it.
Fun tour...worth the time. My friend and I were very excited to tour this historical theater. The tour was informative and interesting. Great photo opportunities. A NYC landmark not to be missed.
What a sight!. Came for a showing of America's Got Talent. This theatre is so beautiful. I am so lucky to have seen it on our trip to NYC. Do the tour if you get a chance.
We toured the night before the Tony Awards. Very nice backstage tour, and we saw them setting up for the Tonys. Not as complete of a tour as I expected but was fun...
Great Venue for the Tony's. Was there in June for the Tony Awards.. Beautiful venue and great location near great restaurants and hotels and the park.

A Classic NY Landmark. We visited with a backstage tour and really enjoyed getting to see all of the behind the scenes areas and up close views of this classic Art Deco building. Our guide was very enthusiastic and was able to answer all of our questions. We had purchased our tickets online before we came and forgot to pack them. The ticket staff was very helpful in getting the reprinted for us. The tour itself only was an hour and worth the time and money it took. Our group got to meet and get a photo taken with a Rockette. This part was fun but a bit gimmicky. You cannot have out your own cameras or phones and they time how long she spends with you. Once everyone walks through the photo line she answers a few questions and then leaves the room through a different door. Fun but not personal for sure.

The Tour. it is an awesome tour and you get to meet a rockette ! if you love the MTVs, the oscars, and most of all THE TONNY ADWARDS you should go there and have the experience of a lifetime ! get to be close to the stage ! know how it was build, what does it means !
I love this place . This place is beautiful...it has the best shows , especially the rockets during Christmas. Definitely worth going to,you won't regret it!

Watch any show. This is a New York City landmark. I recommend anyone who visits New York to watch a any show they have when they visit. Or at least take some pics outside lol.I went here to see the Christmas show. But I always see it whenever I'm walking around midtown.

Good enough for NKOTB or anyone else. I saw NKOTB here, Yes the New Kids. It was my first real NKOTB concert with my wife, she is the fan, I was along for the trip to NYC so that I could take in the city. I had a great time at Radio City MH. The place a huge and very well lit inside with clean and well located restrooms. There are plenty of great seats in the place, and few bad ones. We were very close the the front few rows and the music / sounds were excellent. I would see any concert in RCMH.
Great venue to catch a show. Been here a number of times to see shows from the Rockettes to DMB. They are always so great and efficient with the lines and accommodating people.
Treat yourself. Organised and so well managed. Comfort and ease of access makes me wish all shows could be performed here.

from the 50'th. It is legacy from 50-60 years ago, nothing special.
If you fund a good show, recommended as any other good show somewhere esls

America's Got Talent. Got free tickets to be part of the live audience for the show, America's Got Talent. Although it didn't cost us $$ to get in we did have to spend our time waiting in lines but we had a great time since we are such big fans of the show. We took time to enjoy the theater itself which is so amazing and iconic, it was an incredible experience overall!!!

Kicking up your heels st RCM. When u come to NYC there certain things that are a must. One of them is seeing the Rockets perform. Venue is rich in history & decor. We'll worth the price of admission. If u plan in advance u might b able to sign up to be a live member of the audience for America's Got Talent & that's free!!
Great Venue. I've taken my family several times to see various shows at Radio City. And, its always a nice experience. The Christmas Spectacular is an annual event for us.
Such a Fantastic Building. My daughter was gaga for this place, and we enjoyed visiting this beautiful building and feeling the voices of history in this wonderful place.
Amazing experience!. This is a beautiful music hall to see a show in!The acoustics are perfect and all the seats in the house are great. It is a once in lifetime experience to share (for some of us).

Full of History!. As soon as I took place in here I could smell the History of Entertainment in the air! Something simply amazing.. From the Soubrettes Lifestyle to the entire Jet Set of Hollywood/Movie/Music Stars. That's a "Must See" to understand how important and beautiful is the Big Apple!

A must see I New York City!. A New York City treasure. Take the backstage tour and here the history of the theatre. The Rockettes are wonderful and worth seeing. The Art Deco interior is beautiful and the grand staircase is great.

Radio City Music Hall is a Classic. I recently saw Kelly Clarkson and Pentatonix at Radio City. We had tickets way up in the nosebleed section. Our seats were comfortable and the sound amazing. The building itself is beautiful and definitely worth seeing. You can get drinks, and popcorn on any level. The bathrooms are vintage but in great condition.

Well worth it. This was my second time on this tour the last being in 2001. Thoroughly enjoyed the tour and had a very informative guide. The decor inside is very impressive and you can really see how it represents a ship. We saw some rehearsal of the new show which was lovely as you really saw behind the scenes and we even met a Rockette. So why not 5 stars... It was February and we had been out all day so I had coats, scarves, hats etc as well as bags with souvenirs in and a 7 year old with me so was carrying everything. Would have been great if there was somewhere I could have put all of this so that I could have walked round freely to take pictures and enjoy without juggling everything.I would recommend the tour as it was great.

The Toour is an interesting behind the scenes look at Radio City Music Hall. We took the radio city music hall tour. Our tour guide was polite, pleasant and very knowledgeable. Great tour, very much worth the admission fee.
Love the Christmas spectacular. We went to see the rockettes show, we were three rows from the stage in the center. Ideal perfect way to spend our daughters birthdays.
Quite an experience. Saw Tony Bennet and Lady Gaga and had a fantastic experience. Felt like we were at the red carpet premieres.

A New York Must. If you are in NYC during the holidays this is a must see and do. The holiday show is amazing and if you get the extra package you get to meet a rocket and santa. A great family event.
Dont miss it!. Went to see the Christmas spectacular with the Rockettes. Absolutely wonderful. So brilliantly Christmassy.

A great tour of a iconic venue and even got to meet a Rockette!. You cannot miss this famous venue! We booked tickets ahead of time to be guaranteed a spot on tour. But I was told they do hold up to 10 or a few more open spots for additional people on each tour. The tour guide was well informed and offered so much information to us.Some areas were closed due to auditions and set up for new venues. I only wish we could have seen a little more of it.It was great to meet a current Rockette dancer and be able to take lots of photos.
Radio City Music Hall Stage Tour. Wonderful Tour. Loved meeting a Rockette! The history was amazing and seeing how the stage worlds was really impressive!
America's Showplace. An Art Deco palace with great shows. Well maintained. The twin organs are a throwback to another age. The Rockettes are an added bonus.

Everyone should see the Christmas Spectacular Live AT LEAST ONCE.. Everyone, regardless of age, should see the Radio City Christmas Spectacular, AT LEAST ONCE. If you can't make it they have it on Netflix (no joke). Although it is something else seen live.If you really want to beat the crowds for the show, then I will give the same advice I give to anyone wanting to see the Rockefeller Center Christmas Tree, show up right after opening and right before closing.Radio City too is just something else on the inside. The architecture, decor, everything about it is just something else.

The interesting and historical Radio City Music Hall worth a visit.. The Radio City Music Hall was worth the tour. Lots of interesting and historical information provided by a knowledgeable tour guide. If it's your first time in NYC, it's a good landmark to visit.
Rockettes are a MUST SEE!. Everyone should see the Rockettes at least once in their life. The shows are always top notch,a nd the theatre is just beautiful

Unexpected opportunity. We walked by Radio City Music Hall and just wandered in to see if they had tickets to that night's concert. We got 3 excellent seats at a good price to see Pentatonix and Kelly Clarkson. It must be worth checking to see if they have newly released seats the day of their concerts.

Worth your time. We had an excellent tour guide who took us all through Radio City Music Hall. He did a great job of telling us the history of the building. We met a Rockette and had our picture made with her. We got to ask her questions. A fun tour!
anazing. hard to describe such a magnificent place! the combination of modern music with the historical charm give you a very entertaining experience

the acoustics are great! you can't miss here.. The acoustics here are great! A lot of great acts passed through here- - - if you really love the Entertainer be sure to get them here. The price of snacks and Drinks are way too high though. It might be best to have dinner before or after the show. A lot of the restaurants in the area have after show specials or pre-show specials. The mezzanine Is not so great if you're not sitting in the front you can barely see. Orchestra seats are always best make sure they are not too far right or too far left - - if not you won't be able to see and you would have paid a ton of money for the tickets. If there's a show check with your credit card- - depending on the type you have you may be able to get it at a special rate. Also, don't sit too close to the stage - - you'll miss everything. Happy concert going- I wish you a lot of sunshine

Sooo overrated. It's cool to think of from a historical perspective, but the shows there now (every xmas the christmas show, for example) are long, boring and overcrowded.The Auditorium is magnificent, but see a better show somewhere else- if you can get a peek inside without a $100 ticket, do it though.
Christmas Spectacular. Radio City Christmas Spectacular is well worth it to see! The Rockettes are amazing. A live nativity in the performance is like nothing I've ever seen! A great experience.

The Home of the Rockettes!. The only reason we decided to visit was because we had done the Madison Square Garden tour the day before. It was interesting to see behind the scenes and to also meet a current Rockette. A beautiful building with a great story to tell.

Excellent tour. The tour was very comprehensive and enlightening about this great theatre. Our guide was knowlegeable and personable. The theatre itself seemed to be in as good a shape as when I first went here 60 years ago. After several renovations, it has kept its original trappings as well as being tastefully updated. It was amazing to hear that several of the unique mechanical and hydraulic lifts are still used today after 80 years of service. The tour ends with a short talk by a Rockette who provides a photo op which was great for our 8 year-old granddaughter.
Great Tour!. Very interesting tour of this historic theater. Excellent guide who took us on a journey through the life of a Rockette. The theater is absolutely amazing!

Amazing experience. I had never been in Radio City Music Hall. It was included in the New York Pass so my friends and I decided to go.I absolutely loved the experience, our guide was nice, knew a lot about it and we were able to watch the set being set up for a Derek Hough performance. The stage is beautiful. You get to take a picture with a Rockette (they charge if you want the picture) and ask her questions about the job.I really loved learning about the history of Radio City Music Hall and it's evolution in time.You don't have to make reservationes, they have tours every half hour but get there in advance because it gest crowded.

Fun tour and meeting a Rockette was amazing. We enjoyed the tour of Radio City Music Hall, our tour guide informative and friendly. We got to stand on the stage and sit in the audience. Meeting a Rockette and having our picture taken with her was a highlight. We bought the picture, it was $21.00, worth it to us. So exciting that Americas Got Talent will be filmed there this fall. One tip is that you do have to walk up and down stairs on the tour. I'm not sure if there are other options for those in wheelchairs, strollers or otherwise unable to walk up/down stairs. You may want to ask if that is a concern before you go. Also you cannot bring any drinks, food or chew any gum while your in the building.

Take the tour!. We decided on the guided tour and really enjoyed the experience! Great price with AAA discount at around $20/person. 75 minute tour - they were setting up for America's Got Talent so it was fun to see all that travels to support that show. Behind the scenes were shared with the group - more than expected. Worth it!
Fun and frivolity. Fun, fun loving and a great evening watching Derek Hough dance! Well his acting is not that great but heck it was fun.

Top of the Rock. Top of the Rock for a expensive drink to end the evening. Don't go if you are looking for cheap late nightcap!!! View is awesome of the city lights. Restaraunt on top floor looked cool-expensive!
Elegant Piece of History. Beautiful building is overwhelming. Don't miss a chance to see where the legendary Rocketts perform. Also the home to Broadway's Tony Awards.

Behind the Scene. I have seen the Rockettes at Christmas but since they weren't performing while we were there this trip we decided to go behind the scenes and really enjoyed our Stage Door Tour. There was so much I didn't know about the theatre and we even met a Rockette. Very affordable and interesting.

Tour is very worthwhile and interesting. We used the New York Pass to schedule a tour of Radio City Music Hall and it was fantastic! We even met a Rockette and had our picture taken with her. This place has very interesting history and is worth touring.

WONDERFUL FUN!. GORGEOUS art deco masterpiece! Wow--the bathrooms alone are amazing. This is a terrific place for a concert or to see the Rockettes kick up those shapely legs. Take the guided tour--wonderful entertainment. And you will meet the ladies and have a photo taken with them, too. FUN!
Worth a visit. Such a grand place, deffo worth a visit even if you don't go inside. Go later in the day as less busy.

What a beautiful building!. We took this tour not really knowing just how beautiful this building is inside. It's an absolutely fantastic example of Art Deco and has been beautifully preserved and restored. The guide was very informative and entertaining. A definite must see.
THERE'S A LITTLE BIT OF KID IN ALL OF US!. It's a "must see" especially the Christmas Extravaganza! Great for all ages. Another New York experience not to be missed.

Historic Hall, fantastic to visit up-close!. We took the tour and went inside. The tour was for 1 and a half hour. We saw the architecture, the paintings and murals on the wall. We were told about the Art-deco style on which this grand music hall was built on. We also got to meet one of the glamorous Rockettes and took photos with her. It was overall an eye opener and I thoroughly enjoyed it.
Do it. Iconic place and see the show or tour. But get tickets before you go and especially christmas show or spring show.

just beautiful from hall to show!. Radio City Music hall is a must see around Christmas time. I took my granddaughter when she was 5 and her eyes were just lit up from the start , through the show, she was just mesmerized and I so enjoyed her beautiful little face as she looked around the music hall in wonder and never took her eyes off the dancers. It was well worth the price, for myself, my daughter, and granddaughter. We were just as taken with the whole place, show, dancers were just outstanding. Girls, boys, young to old, don't miss at least one visit to this iconic new York attraction!

Did the tour. The tour taught you about the history of Radio City Music Hall, and brought you through many places in the theater, including the seats, the balcony area, under the stage, and into Roxy's private lounge and dining room. At the end, we got to meet a Rockette. It would be neat to see a performance there. It was an entertaining 90 or so minutes, but not the most exciting thing to do in NYC.

Backstage Tour. My 12-year old granddaughter (a dancer) loved the tour and getting to meet a Rockett. She liked hearing the history of the largest theater in the world and how it was built and has kept so much tradition. It was about an 1 and half hour tour so allow time. The behind the scences tour helps you appreciate all that goes in to a production like this. They were preparing for the America's Got Talent so we could see what all the equipment and stage prep is needed.

A MUST NYC SEE. Radio City is Music Hall is a beautiful theater. The 1 thing you MUST do if in town is take the tour. It is very informative and interesting, even the kids will enjoy it. At the end you get to get your picture taken with a Rockette
worth the $$$!!!. Have been there in the 1970's, 1990's and recently. It is still wonderful and the updates are outstanding. A must see

Tour is great!. We did the Stage Door Tour on the same day as we did the Rockafeller Centre Tour. Both of these were included in the New York Pass and it worked out well doing them on the same day. We also booked the Inside Broadway Tour for 4pm that afternoon (included in NYPass, but pre-booking definitely required). There was plenty of time to eat and wander between these three excellent tours. One of our favorite days in NYC! The Radio City tour itself included getting to meet a Rockette, plenty of art history and building secrets. Would love to see a show there one day! Beautiful. You don't need to book this tour or Rockafeller days in advance, just get there before lunchtime on the day and ask for your preferred time slot (don't be late!).

An Unexpected Delight. With a free flowing itinerary, my husband and I passed by Radio City Music Hall and was just in time for a tour. Am I glad we did. This place is so rich in history and the design is quite interesting, as well. Our guide did a wonderful job in giving facts and answering our questions. It is an interesting walking tour with a lot of tidbits of artists who have performed there. Will definitely recommend this tour!

Worth Your Time & Money. Wish I would have booked online and saved a little more money, but fortunately they had AAA discount, so I only spent a few bucks more to buy a ticket on site. The tour is 75-80 minutes, and is very informative. Definitely worth seeing if you're a music or theatre nerd. My wife and I both loved it!

A must see. This was originally not on our list of things to do while in nyc. Tour costs $26. Tour guide knowledgeable. Great to see part of American history and technology from many years ago. It is truly a gem of our country. Got to speak with a rockette but had to pay for picture with them. There are a fair amount of stairs on the tour. Lasts about an hour to hour and 15 minutes.
A historical monument. A beautiful theater with lots of history behind it. Go if you are there at Christmas time to see the Rocketes perform

Radio City Music Hall Experience. It is a must to experience of the many different holiday specials that the Radio Music City Hall offers. They are a life-changing and always memorable experiences to share with loved ones and friends. Still remember a Christmas with the kids that lasts forever in our lives. A must to do in NYC
Christmas spectacular. This place was made for you to see every show from any seat! Amazing inside so beautiful and everyone is so nice!

A New York Icon. It's one of those New York must sees for anyone who has an interest is showbiz culture. I was really surprised how big it was and the acoustics were great. We were here to see the Spring Spectacular and it was great to see one of NYC's icons at the same time.
Amazing rockettes. A must stop if you come to the city...I have visited during Christmas time to watch the Rockettes and is a must with family and friends. You will enjoy the show.

Superb Christmas show. We wanted to see a show while staying in New York and couldn't get any of the big shows so we booked the Christmas show at the Radio City Music Hall. Well we were not disappointed. This was a fantastic show - the music, costumes, singing, dancing were all amazing. However the Rockettes were the real stars of the show. Definetely worth a visit!

My times at the Radio City Music Hall. Anyone that likes to see a show here from the Christmas show to American Got Talent to any concert or show this theater is a great place, one of a kind. New York landmark.

Big, roomy and fabulous. I have seen the Rockettes, Keane and Leonard Cohen at this beautiful concert hall. It is an icon in itself and if you can see a great artist perform then you'll be in heaven. Old world charm is here in spades. Love the foyer and snapped lots of pictures.

The Christmas show - a must-see for children AND adults!. We loved attending the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Extravaganza last December. The show was professional, colorful, whimsical and brought back wonderful memories of holidays gone by - a treat for the senses! The old theater is majestic.
Worth getting a selfie at. Didn't go inside, only took photos from the outside, but was very cool to see it. Very busy area, close to the Tonight Show.
A Grand Theatre Still!. This building is a treasure. I enjoyed the official very much. On another evening of our visit we got to see the Rockettes Christmas show, which was another treat!

Amazing place to see your show. I think this is one of the best theaters in Manhattan....I love the look and the feel of the spectacular and music hall...it's one of those places that gives you that grand old feeling of yesterday it is a spectacular venue...I have been here dozens of times and have failed to write a review until today....this is one theater that you absolutely must go to when in New York City find a show and make sure you go....

Show was fantastic but audience control a problem!. Loved the venue, felt very retro. The ticket cost is reasonable and the seats comfortable with a pretty good view all around.Seriously though. Stop people coming in and out whilst the show is on! Mobile phones going off was bad enough but then people talking on them too without any reprimand! Mathis is unheard of in the UK and would not be tolerated. I have dropped two stars for this as it spoilt our show experience!
A nice place to visit. It is an amazing place to visit . See the theater hall with a visit back stage to the actors chambers.
There is nothing like it!. It's such a beautiful part of American culture. There's nothing like. Tours are great- shows are better. If you can squeeze it in - this is a wonderful icon of NYC.
Good show. Christmas show was good but I have seen more spectacular ones before for less so I was not really impressed. I had a good experience but I don't have to do it again.

Took the Guided Tour - Fantastic. This place is amazing and totally worth taking the guided tour. The history of this place is mind-blowing and Tabitha, our guide, was very knowledgeable and made the tour fun and interesting. I highly recommend you putting this on your list of 'must-do's' when visiting New York.
Lovey. I went to see the Rckets perform and it was an amazing show , I had a blast. If your ever in the city you should check out the nightlife scenery and most of them the kids could go.

A must go!!!! At Christmas time! and Easter show!. I have been coming here since I was a child.The art deco hall is amazing! The venues are varied and good! Never miss the Rockettes world renowned synchronized dancers.The xmas show is always a great time to visit Then see the great xmas tree at Rockerfeller center. Good for families! and every age group. Buy your tickets way in advance.Take the tour!

Zarkana!!!!!!!!!. What are great show. It began like as if Beethoven were sitting on mount Olympus pounding on and organ.....exhilarating. Then it opens with a Tim Burton like cast heralding and exemplifying the majesty of the venue with the vituosity of their performance. You won't regret the experience.

Recommended to us and highly enjoyable. Brilliant, brilliant, brilliant. The guide (Olivia) was superb. Very knowledgeable and enthusiastic. Such a comprehensive tour of the whole backstage and front of house areas. Saw previous costumes, various memorabilia, had film show and even a talk and picture opportunity with a real Rockette. 100% recommendation.

Rockettes!. What a fun venue packed with history! We saw the Rockettes Spring Spectacular and it was INCREDIBLE! The best show we've seen in New York, hands down. Work every penny! and the venue is so unique with great views from wherever you sit!
Tour. Great backstage tour including a visit with a Rockette!Excellent tour guide and access to the stage!

An Amazing Place!. We very much enjoyed the tour of Radio City Music Hall. Guides/Docents are fun and knowledgeable about the history of this remarkable place. While on the tour, we were able to watch part of the opening number of a show on stage and visit other behind the scenes spots. I will definitely be back. Worth a visit!

holiday june 2015. my wife and i visited radio city music hall the day after the TONYawards,wow what a place,we did the music hall tour and were realy impressed,my wife had a photo taken with one of the rockettes, we would highly recomend a visit whilst in new york it is a fantastic venue,to go

At least once in your lifetime, especially close to holidays. If you haven't seen the Rockettes at least once in your lifetime - you have to go. You won't be disappointed. The costumes and the precision choreography can't help but put you in the Christmas spirity.

One of the best NY tours we have taken yet. On a whim, we decided to take the guided tour of Radio City Music Hall on this latest trip to New York. The tour was about 25 bucks per person, lasted an hour and a half and takes you through almost every feature of the theatre. The lobby, stage, backstage, offices, and spaces for the Rockettes, were fascinating to see and learn about, thanks to our guide who was personable, pleasant and kept us moving along. Be forewarned, if stairs are an issue, there are a few flights up that are kind of steep. Our group was fine, but I could see older folks or little kids finding it challenging. At the end of the tour, we met a Rockette dancer in costume, and we had the opportunity to have a picture taken with her in front of a green screen that they could create a composite picture for you to purchase later if you chose. She answered questions and helped to provide a face to what is likely the most famous chorus line in the world. I never thought about coming to see the Christmas Spectacular before, as musical theatre is not usually my thing, but after seeing the beautiful space and how much goes into putting on this show, we will very likely look to check it out on our next trip to NY.
Birthday treat. A great venue, went to see Tony Bennett and Lady Gaga, had front row seats on the Balcony, centre looking down on stage,well worth a visit even if you don't see a show.

Stunning! Amazing! Beautiful!. The tour is a fantastic journey not only through the theatre itself, but also through it's history and creation. You get to see a variety of the performers portraits through the back rooms, the home of the Rockettes, the auditorium, an actual Rockette, and more! The theatre is simply beautiful to look at and even more stunning when you learn where everything came from. When my group went, the rockets were rehearsing right on stage in front of us for the spring spectacular and the movement of the stage was unbelievable! Highly suggested for anyone, especially theatre lovers. Any show held here is bound to be amazing!
THE ROCKETS WERE IN STEP!. Radio City and the traditional holiday show with the kick line and the lively performance was great!

Tour. Did the tour and thoroughly enjoyed it. The building and stage are something to see. We also were able to take a picture with a rocket and learn a lot about the history of Radio City and New York.

Place of music and plays. Besides the legendary Rockettes who performed for many years, there are great plays and shows booked almost round the year. Its proximity to Rockefeller centre in midtown is convenient.
Great Show. Christmas spectacular is the perfect name. Great way to spend the beginning of the Holidays with family.
amazing. you can not go to see a show on Broadway without having to radio city music hall ... buy ticktets and enjoy it... :)

More Than Just the Rockettes!. Yes, the Rockettes are awsome! But so many other events have also made history here. They have top rated concerts, sports and shows. You'll treasure your visit to Radio City Music Hall forever!

One The All Time Great Concert Halls. This continues to be an awe-inspiring concert venue. There is so much to see, admire, and enjoy. It is HUGE and quite majestic. Like any good concert hall, there is no bad seat in the place and the acoustics are fabulous. We were here for a Kelly Clarkson concert and it was a great place to listen to that great voice (and winning personality). Recommend you add this to your itinerary if you're visiting my wonderful city. The Christmas Spectacular really is a famous holiday event if you like that sort of thing. At least it's a chance to see this great hall.

Great Experience. This is a New York City institution. It is a great place to visit. I saw the Rockettes Spring Spectacular and it was a really fun place to be for the afternoon. I would highly recommend it.
Wonderful. the tour was great! we got to know this awesome piece of architecture, got to go down the stage and even see the one Tony Bennett at rehersal for that night, awesome experience, is a must.

The Christmas Spectacular. I hadn't seen the Christmas show at Radio City Music Hall in 50 years. This year's show was just unbelievable. I don't know how the Rockettes can dance in heels & change costumes so quickly. A great family show!!!!

Amazing theater, fantastic production value, but don't expect there to be a plot. Saw both the Christmas and the Spring Spectacular last year here. The Christmas show was fantastic, despite the hokey story line gluing the "plot" together. Great for kids. The Spring Spectacular was not as well executed and even cornier. Regardless, Radio City is an impressive place to visit. The sheer size of this theater is incredible and the history is palpable. Do use a restroom before entering if you can, as the facilities are not sufficient for a place this size (the one I used had 3 stalls total for women on the second level, the line was huge and no one was moving).

It doesn't get any more NYC than Radio City. Walk around and in it to fully appreciate the art deco architecture and appointments. It's stunningly beautiful. Catch a show if you can but take the backstage tour to really explore the home to the Rockettes.

What's happening at Radio City Music Hall?. I've going to Radio City Music Hall since 1968. I saw a movie called "Follow Me Boys" about a scout master who transformed lives for years. It made an impact in my life. It also has concerts, and others events, as well as the world-famous Rockette and the Christmas show.

Excellent Tour. This guided tour takes you throughout this entertainment icon over a period of about one and half hours. Great value as adult admission was just over $20 with seniors about $18.You also have the opportunity to have your photo taken with one of the Rockettes (at a cost)
Radio city --excellent tour. I done the radio city tour and was introduced to a rockette -- the tour covers the history of radio city --and I would recommend the tour it was excellent

Beautiful historical hall and wonderful tour. We had a large group of 12 that toured the music hall Sunday morning. We had an awesome tour guide and enjoyed it very much. It was breathtaking to be able to stand on the stage and look out into the hall. Thank goodness this grand building was saved from the wrecking ball! At the end you get to meet a Rockette dancer, who tells a little about what it takes to be chosen as a Rockette. The tour ends with a photo taken with the Rockette dancer that can be purchased. Really fun for all ages! There are some steps involved, so I'm not sure how handicapped accessible the entire tour is. Please check with the Music Hall if you have concerns regarding this.
Great Concert. Our Girls went to see Lady Gaga & Tony Bennett so I wanted a hotel close to Radio City Music Hall - they had a great time.
If you do nothing else in NYC- Take this tour!!!. For a mere $26 you get a hour and fifteen minute tour that takes you back in time. I was mesmerized the entire tour!!!

History wraps around you. The Music Hall tour was a highlight of our trip. From the bathroom fixtures to the carpets and Chandeliers, the magnificence of the place leaves you shaking your head. It is still hard to believe that this 5,000 seat auditorium has been a center of the entertainment industry for almost a hundred years.
It was extremely cool to see.
tour was interesting and historical. the tour showed the inner workings of the theater and its history. met with rockettes , went on stage and visited off limit areas.

Great place and a milestone in music history. Great place and a milestone in music history. So many legends have performed legendary concerts, shows and performance there that it is a MUST visit one around. If you have a chance try to get tickets for a concert to experience the great sound and atmosphere of the venue.
Enjoy. Whether going for a show or just the tour this iconic theater is magnificent to see. The acoustics and the best in NYC. Catch a concert and see what i mean!
City Lights. This show was totally awesome! We were three rows from the stage with no obstructions! The story and choreography were fantastic! Definitely great for families!

Nice musicals. There I had the chance to see The Rockettes, which is a beautiful show, all about American Christmas, but if you're not a big fan of musicals, then do something else.
For those who want to experience what a nice Christmas musical is, it is worth, the deco inside is beautiful as well.
Great Piece of History. If you plan a trip to NYC you have to take the tour of Radio City Music Hall. You may even get to meet a Rockette.

Not What It Used to Be. Rip off. Very expensive. Canned music. Commercial.I know Radio City Music Hall is a New York City icon but years ago it was so elegant. There was a floor show with live music before the movie began (Yes, movie) at an affordable price.Times have changed. There is no longer live music. There are guards at the door with a big garbage can for you to dump your snacks into, because you must buy there very expensive ones.How elegant and inviting does that make you feel?I won't go back.

Fantastic!. This was surprisingly one of our favourite things in New York city. It was wonderful to get a real behind the scenes look at Radio City Music Hall, including areas normally off limits to the public and to meet a real Rockette! I think it was even better doing the tour at Christmas when the Christmas spectacular is on as we got to see part of the show from a viewing area up the back as well as the beautiful Christmas decorations. We were very lucky to have a small group (we had 7 in our group, whereas the rest of the tours that day had been 30+) but we were there Thanksgiving week. Our tour guide was fantastic - very easy to understand, informative and very friendly!It's on the New York Pass so definitely worth a visit!

John Fogerty 1969. John Fogerty rocked Radio City Music Hall. He is as good as ever!!! This 70 year old can rock circles around most of the 30 year olds today. What an amazing catalog of music. One of my Favorite shows.

Backstage Tour. Traveling with a 14 year old dancer, we really enjoyed the backstage tour of Radio City Music Hall. The theater is a fabulous gem and meeting a Rockette was a highlight for our aspiring dancer!
Tony Bennett and lady gaga. wonderful show made even better by being at Radio City. Although they are 60 years apart they meshed together as if they had been performing together for years.
Amazing tour. Ask for a AAA discount when you buy the tickets. Try to get Alvin as a tour guide. His tour lasted longer than the others and was more informative. He's great with kids.

Great venue.. Radio City is a really good place to see a show. It's home to the Christmas Show with the Rockette's but also hosts so many concerts and special events. We saw a concert here and loved it. It's not too big so most all of the seats offer a good view. The sound was surprisingly good also. Very easy to get to as it's right in midtown Manhattan.

Great Tour!. If you get the opportunity to take the Radio City Music Hall backstage tour, I highly recommend it. It lasts about an hour and fifteen minutes, but it is extremely informative and interesting. You will see the whole theatre, behind the scenes, the history of the Rockettes, and even get to take a picture with a real Rockette! The cost is about $28 per person, and tours run every half hour or so.
joywokie. Our tour guide gave an informativet tour of a beautiful building. Enjoyed going back stage, seeing the Rockets' costumes and hearing the history of Radio City Music Hall
Excellent venue. Famous for the Rockettes and many different types of shows such as the Christmas spectacular, it is also a great place to hear concerts of all types of music
Amazing Stage. I went to see the mechanics of the fantastic stage. My wife liked that part, but more the history of RCMH and the Rockettes.
Iconic. It is a must do especially for the Christmas Spectacular. The Rockettes are great. It just starts the holiday season just fine.
Beautiful and Fun!!. The most fun you could have for the holidays. Very festive and set nicely midtown and close to Rockefeller. The whole area is set up beautifully.
Iconic Music hall. Radio city music hall is just like the empire state building.. When you think of New York City they both come to mind as a must see attraction..

Great Guide. This was a great tour and our guide was corky and fun, perfect for the tour. If you have ever been to The Grand Ole Opry you can expect something similar to that for the tour. The perk was that my 7 year old daughter got her picture taken with the Rockette. Great thing to do if you're not too busy!
amazing!!!. Had an incredible night in RCMH. The theather is wonderfull! Dont forget to visit the toillets. Try to get a good concert there.

Great historical venue. Okay - I am a little biased because I love the historical venues found in Manhattan. If you have a chance, and can get tickets, go see a show at Radio City Music Hall. It's a piece of New York that everyone needs to experience. I give it 5 stars :-)

More amazing than I expected!. This tour is highly recommended for anyone who is interested in music, or entertainment in general. We even met one of the Rockettes! Our tour guide was energetic and made the information fun and accessible for all.

Excellent tour. We had no idea that there would be so much to see on the backstage tour. When our tour guide told everyone to stay with the group or chance being lost, she wasn't kidding. There are so many stairways, halls, twists and turns that it would be very easy to lose your way if you didn't stay with the group. It was very fascinating to see and learn all that goes on behind the scenes and to learn the history of the building. Well worth the money. Our guide was very knowlegeable.

Iconic Sign. We Did not take in a show on this trip but we do plan on coming back this Christmas to see the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular as we do every year. The Iconic sign does make for a great picture at night.
Iconic. Just an all around cool place to visit. Whether you are a music fan or not, you should recognize this place and visit it for a quick photo if you aren't staying for a show.

Great tour!. I took my kids, ages 14 and 12, to the Radio City Music Hall Tour using it as an option on the New York Explorer Pass. Our guide did a great job of keeping everyone excited without making the experience hokey or "cheesy." This was my first visit to the Hall and/or the Tour, so I was duly impressed with the decor of the building and the history of its creation. It is hard to believe that so many NYC icons were built during the Great Depression.We were very fortunate to be able to go on stage and take pics from the stage. Our guide informed us that this is unusual since there is almost always a performance and/or a rehearsal going on.Our tour included a chance to meet and get a picture with a Rockette. We did not know about this, so my daughter really liked that part. The selectivity and rigor of this group and their schedule is impressive to say the least!I highly recommend this tour; the interior of the building is an American landmark!
Passing By. We did not stop and tour the music hall, we only passed by while walking toward Rockefeller Center; however, we did take a picture for our collection of New York photos.

ROCKETTES. The xmas show is an instant smile maker.
The theater is very large, so worth paying more for better seats.

Show was terrific!. What a wonderful experience! We attended the Christmas Spectacular and it was a truly GREAT night! We attended with a group of 13 and the show was well-worth the relatively inexpensive tickets. We all had dressed with our bad taste Christmas Jumpers and one of the ushers was really kind and volunteered to take a photo. She came to us and said that we could leave without her taking it as she was swept away with our enthusiasm.
Go Rockettes!. It is not le Moulin Rouge, or a Broadway show...it's perfection on stage and a great entertainment for the whole family. Go with enough time to be seated.

Sound that stuns. It almost doesn't matter what show you see at this spectacular venue. The sound quality is so pure there are no bad seats. The restroom are also among the loveliest of the major attractions!

Rockettes. We went to Radio City to see the Rockettes holiday show and it was as good as it always is :) Go a bit early as it is usually packed before showtime. Its also going to be super expensive but even if you are sitting in the back of the top row of the theater (and we have!) its still an essential NY experience to make sure you do.
Christmas Spectacular. It was a good experience. I took my entire family, they were visiting from outside the country.We loved the show and the venue.
My folks and relatives loved to come here. The Rockettes are an eyeful, great entertainment but the lines can be VERY long for littles ones to wait through.

Don't miss the Holiday Spectacular. The Christmas show is a fun filled spectacular that is one for the bucket list... Everything you would expect, but still great to experience i in person. We took young children and it was no problem, they were mesmerized the whole time.

Great tour showing you one of the most famous theatres in the world. I loved the trip around Radio City Music Hall, it's a very insightful tour and includes meeting one of the famous Rockettes. I work in the theatre industry, so for me its a great treat, but I think that theres something for everyone with great architecture, visiting costume workshops and seeing behind the scenes
Do not miss.. If you are in New York City during the Christmas season-do not miss this show. Last year I went twice! It is a must see for anyone, but especially families.
A must visit when in NYC. A must see during the Christmas Season. The show is phenomenal. Buy tickets on-line early, many shows sell out. Book the behind the scenes tour it is very interesting.

Popped In And We Was So Glad We Did.. Our hotel was right next to Radio City Music Hall, and we walked past it everyday until we decided to visit inside, what a beautiful building. Iv told all my friends if they ever visit New York to come here.

Live the dream at Radio City Music Hall. I have attended two events at Radio City Music Hall and loved both. The theatre is amazing, it would have to be on of the best in New York. They cater to all tastes and the seating is excellent.

Exciting Time.. Fantastic memories are made here. Take a tour of Radio City Music hall. It is beautiful inside. Also during the tour you can have a meet and greet with a Rockette. Plan ahead and get tickets for a show. Christmas time they parade the live animals down the street for a performance there.
Best show ever!!!!. The Radio City Christmas Spectacular is the best show ever, this is my 3th time and i enjoy it as the first, you must attend this show
A must see. Just loved the Rockettes Spring Spectacular. Those ladies really put on a good show. Good story, good music, and the sincronicity between the dancers...amazing
Great Stage. Saw New York Spring Spectacuar with Derek Hough. Wonderful show and the stage was great. We had seats close to the front and it was great seeing everyone close up.
Fantastic.. We went to see the Christmas show which was spectacular. Such a wonderful program. My 11 year old daughter enjoyed getting her picture with the rockets and loved the show as well.

Christmas Spectacular. The Christmas Spectacular show is just that. It changes slightly over the years to keep it fresh yet keeps all of the staples. LOVE the Toy soldiers and the Live Nativity!! Radio City Music Hall is the most beautiful of venues!

Christmas. Every year I go To se The Rockette's, it's such a wonderful and exciting thing to do while in New York City around Christmas time. I go with friends and if they do not wish to go I make it a trip for myself. it's magical, makes you feel like a kid again. The Radio City Music Hall is just stunning, beautiful, and the staff is very helpful.
Live audience if you can get in. Not available anymore but again worth going in to get some tickets to a TV show, you just have to ask to find out what's available

You Have to Go. We have been to Radio City Music Hall several times over the years, and it changes with the times. It is a gorgeous venue, and the Rockettes are always fantastic. It is one of the largest, if not the largest, theaters in New York, and certainly the most famous. A trip to New York would hardly be complete without a visit to Radio City. That being said, it is definitely a tourist destination, and there are more elegant and less crowded places to go. It would be a hard choice between The Rockettes and one of the On Broadway shows. Save the trouble of a decision and do both.

Great scenery but not a big must in a city with so many wonderful things to experience. Beautiful scenery and exiciting history is told on the Radio City Tour, but much to commercial in my opinion. The concert hall is fantastic though.
Well worth a visits. Saw Bastille in 2014... Very good show, efficient visit and a piece of New York history. Would definitely go back again in the future...

Take the Tour of This Art Deco Masterpiece. I shudder to think that this gorgeous historical art deco landmark of 20th century performing arts & entertainment was almost lost to the wrecking ball. Thanks to the visionaries who saved and restored the building to its former glory. A must visit while in NYC and you owe it to yourself to take the guided tour that not only provides full access, but also provides a great deal of the backstage information on the history of this wonderful building.

Radio City The Rockettes. Fabulous show Rockettes. A real tourist treat. A bit corny but so enjoyable and bit of a history lesson that draws you in every minute. Great costumes and actors and amazing precision dancing. Music not too loud iso it dosent blow you out your seat. Good prices for good seats.

A beautiful venue. We went to see the famous Rockettes perform, which is a long-standing show. It was well worth it and highly recommended. The venue itself is famous for the acts that have performed there over the many years and the room has great acoustics and a real old theatre feel. Highly recommended.

Beautiful Music Hall. I was able to attend the Tony Bennett/Lady Gaga concert at Radio City Music Hall. What a treat! The building is beautiful and within walking distance from Times Square. I wanted to tour the building but it was great to a tually attend a concert. Well worth the visit!

Talent Show at Radio City Music Hall. We were able to attend the 2015 Talent Show/Garden of Dreams...it was free and we also got a big box of popcorn and a large Coke! Can't beat that...but the best part of it was the talent! There was a 10 year old boy named Manuel Hodgson singing and he was OUTSTANDING!!

Interesting backstage tour. Having seen the Radio City Christmas Spectacular many times, I wanted to do a backstage tour of Radio City Music Hall for some time. We purchased a voucher ahead of time and exchanged it for tickets in the gift shop next door.Our tour was at 2 pm and lasted about 1.5 hours. We got the full tour of the music hall, learned about its history, got to go backstage to see the hydraulics system that power the platforms up and down. Truly a feat in engineering and even more amazing, the system is the original one installed when the theatre was built. During their last renovation, the system was inspected and needed no replacement. Also interesting is that the military came to Radio City to examine their system and utilized the same technology on aircraft carriers in WWII.Part of the tour focused on the Art Deco decor in the theatre. Very beautiful and the restoration brought the theatre back to life. The tour included a whole history on the Rockettes, including costuming, and we even got to meet a Rockette. Even my husband, who is not a dance fan, found the tour interesting from a historical and technological standpoint. I highly recommend this tour. Hoping we can maybe see a show there soon.

absolutely interesting!. I had never taken this tour before and happened by chance to experience a beautiful building and such a great history. I am forever a fan and promise to visit when I return to NYC
Do Radio City Music Hall !!!. Radio City Music Hall is a great place to be. especially for their great Christmas Shows ! They put on a great display ! The architecture there is also grand !!!

A Must See Tour!!!!. The tour of Radio City Music Hall is really great. Learning about its history and seeing the entire theater was awesome. We went below stage, back stage, and saw a rehearsal hall. We saw several rooms and nooks of the building. Finally, we saw a short film and met a Rockette. We really enjoyed it.

wonderful Art Deco theater. Great holiday shows. As a child it was a highlight of the holidays to see the show + a movie. Worlds largest Stage theater. No movies these days, just live theater and concerts. Home of the NFL draft for years.
Amazing Rockettes. If you're in NYC in Christmas you MUST go see the Christmas Spectacular show at Radio City Music Hall with The Rockettes!!!

The Music City Hall everyone loves.. It is quite different from the old one and the show changes. For some reason it keeps the New York history and unique music .
It is different from the Broadway show,but it has its own special
character. You need to visit it once or twice for yourself.

Went to Spring Spectacular and it was. We had booked this show as Derek Hough was tobe in it but he hurt his leg we missed him but were surprised we LOVED the show and it was such a great tour of New York to music wonderful ...
amazing show. absolutely loved very show we have seen here! The staff was very helpful. I was looking for information on our tickets and everyone was kind and helpful. Best shows ever!

Wow - you won't believe what it is in like inside. This is a hidden jewel of a building. Saved from the bulldozers it an amazing example of Art Deco architecture. The behind the scenes tour is a must.
An iconic building. I didn't go inside, but I spent far too long snapping photos of this incredible building from various different angles. Such a cool old music hall!

A legendary hall, now turned tourist trap.. I've seen several shows here over the past couple of years, and I've also played here as a musician. It's a beautiful place with lots of history, but it is definitely catering to the tourists, these days. Lots of souvenir booths and candy stands, etc. If you can ignore all of that hype, and just go to enjoy your show, you'll have a great time. The architecture is amazing, and it humbles you to be in such a big place, with such a grand history.

Rockettes on New Year's Eve - PERFECT!. I had never been to Radio City Music Hall - had only heard about it on TV, movies etc. Well, it lived up to all my expectations! What a beautiful venue with accommodating staff. We saw the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular at the New Year's Eve matinee show, and even though it seemed like the show was full and there was a line outside for everyone to get in, the staff moved the line along quickly so we weren't outside in the cold too long.Venue aside (which is just wonderful), the Rockettes were amazing. We had balcony seats pretty high up, but still had a great view and could hear/see everything! Would recommend this to anyone who wants to do a festive holiday show that you can truly only experience in New York City.

Tony Awards, Rockettes, Tony Bennett- get in line and kick your legs up high!. New York City has a few iconic venues from Madison Square Garden to The Zeigfield and Paris Theatres and of course Broadway. But nothing quite says glitzy NY like Radio City Music Hall. When you are heading here, check out the offerings as they are varied, and often reasonably priced. Once this place was the top tourist destination in NYC and you can still book behind the scenes tours.
The Rockette's Spring Spectacular was Fun!. I went here with my Sister to see the Rockettes for their Spring Show. It was so fun and Festive. I enjoyed the Spring Hats the Rockettes wore.
Glorious!. What better way to experience Radio City Music Hall than during Christmas! We saw the world-famous Rockettes perform their Christmas Spectacular and it was just that! Spectacular!!

Don't miss out on the Behind the Scenes Tour. As part of the New York Pass you get to visit this amazing theatre and go behind the scenes to see all of the history and wonder that can only be found here. We even met one of the Rockettes which was such a great addition!!!
Bright lights. Nice place to see where several NBC shows are taped. Arnold the terminator was there promoting his new movie.
Cheesey. Spend your money on theater or music. Even for kids, there are so many interesting cultural options. This is over-priced, cheesey and way too touristy.
Fab!!. Went to see TONY BENNETT & LADY GAGA Cheek to Cheek concert. Fab great seats, wonderful sound. It was the best concert anyone could ever wish for.

a piece of history. access all areas, we even got to see lady gagas stage set that was prepped for the evening show she was doing, historical stage mechanics (although it meant nothing to my non engineering ears i could understand the importance of them!) there wasnt a part of the building we werent invited to see, we even got to have an audience with a rockette (who?) unfortunately that was lost on this Brit, but well worth a visit to see the beautiful interior and artwork
Radio City Music Hall. its worth a walk by ~ bit of history, billboards, great photo ops and they say you might just run in to some of the stars!

Hats Off To A Timeless Success. Ah, to see the expression of wonder in my grandchildren's faces as they light up with delight. For those of us who find this synchronization kind of "old hat", go again, and take a child with you. Truly amazing choreography and hard work of the dancers makes for a wonderful show!

Take the Behind the Scenes Tour!. Stopped in to RCMH on a rainy day and took the behind the scenes tour. Not only did we get to go all around the facility, we also met with and asked questions of a real Rockette! Many areas of RCMH have been restored and will make you feel like you have gone back in time. The hydrolic system under the performance stage is still the same from the beginning of the 20th century, which says a lot about the engineers who designed this music hall. The bathroom facilities were over the top and both behind and ahead of their time, and the stories of the acts over the years were very interesting! This tour is well worth your time if you have any interest in its history! We'll be back for a show next time!
Beautiful theater. Depending on what you see here your experience will vary but the theater itself is quite lovely and if you get a chance to see the Rockettes you're sure to be impressed.

Amazing tour of a wonderful venue.. The tour guide is a performer and is able to explain why the features of this wonderful theater enhance a performers ability to entertain. Seeing the workings of the stage elevators, lighting and curtains is worth the price even without the additional fun of meeting a Rockette and seeing the museum quality exhibits scattered throughout the non-public areas. We would definitely do this again.

Must see the Rocketts. The Christmas show is just spectacular and not to be missed. It is pretty much the same show every year so if you're a tourist, once is enough. I live here so I have seen the show many times before. Get tickets early.
Christmas spectacular. First time in Radio City Music Hall. Loved the show! Easy access. Family friendly. Be sure to check out the Rockette display.

Favorite of our Trip. Sounds corny but the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular was so incredibly professional and exciting and beautiful. I had been to the one in Chicago, but this is over the top fabulous, and the hall of course is architecturally stunning. FUN!

A must do. We did the Radio City Music Hall tour which was included in the Citypass we had purchased. Very neat tour. Lots of tidbits of information and got to see many things exclusive to the tour. Had a photo op with a Rockette

No movies anymore but a grand place.. I used to love coming here as a kid. Beautiful and grand space in a grand space with a movie and dancing girls. No more movies, but the shows are terrific and the space is breathtaking.
NYC At Easter. This is a great place to visit, any show! A must on things to do in NYC. And take the tour - great experience.
A Xmas show to die for. We went to see the Rockettes Christmas show and it was unbelievable. The dancing and routines were absolutely fabulous and thoroughly deserved the standing ovation it received
Christmas Show. Excellent Christmas Show. Did actually see this in December 2013 but forgot I hadn't reviewed it. Well worth seeing
Manhattan trip. Great location in Manhattan. If you go and you are there Christmas check out the Christmas show...Spectacular!!!!

Birthday Show. Have to go, saw the final night of the spring spectacular and the last Rockettes show ,what a performance,a must see while in NY, if at a hotel get your concierge to book for you as he will have access to the best/better tickets. Also remember if going by cab the traffic is full on and good luck getting one back.
Interesting tour. Lots of stairs to climb but worth the effort. Sean our Guide was informative & proud of Radio City Music Hall

You've seen it on TV go see it Live!!!!. Seeing where all the production is cooked will make u enjoy watching it after on TV......... I enjoyed visiting the shop where you can buy mugs , T shirts, pens & more that u can take back with you to remember the place ...

Elegantly beautiful... Love this place...Truly a lovely spot for all those top NYC performances.Went there for Tony Bennett and Lady Gaga's Cheek to cheek tour and loving every single minute of it. The accoustics inside is superb.The location is perfect, easy to reach, surrounded by many other attractions as well.Can't wait to go back for more :)
Tony Bennett and Lady Gaga. Beautiful historic venue. Amazing event. Met Lady Gaga at the stage door. Would love to catch another event here in the near future.
New York icon. The acoustics are superb and the interior is beautiful. Iconic theater for NY and America. If there's anybody there that you find at all interesting, make it a definite. Great theater.

A grand old music hall, not to be missed.. We attended this iconic venue in May to watch the Spring Spectacular with the Rockettes. This venue has such history and it was fun walking around seeing the various posters and memorabilia. The lighting isn't very bright in the lobby area or the washrooms but I suspect that is due to it's age. My husband doesn't like musicals but agreed to go because of the venue history. Surprisingly he enjoyed the show and loved the dancing in the rain dance....we went to the show without too much expectation and were pleasantly surprised how much we enjoyed it.The seats are comfortable....would recommend at least mid orchestra seats to ensure a good view of the stage. The staff we encountered purchasing tickets at the box office and in the venue were very polite and welcoming!A must visit when in NYC.

Saw Tony Bennett and Lady GAGA. Easy in and out of this venue. 1920's look and feel. Excellent Acoustics. Tony sang un amplified and filled the room with his natural voice. THis is not a Bennett gaga review, but worth a mention. If you can catch their show, it is triple A+. A Delightful Surprise!

Still gives me goosebumps......amazing!. This landmark is such a mainstay in New York that is compares to the most recognizable sights in the city. So many performers have been there and it's so exciting to enter this beautiful historic building. A must when in NYC. SO GREAT !!!!

Beautiful concert in a beautiful venue.. My childhood dream was to go inside one of the most famous/historical venues in the entire world: Radio City Music Hall. Being a huge Lady Gaga fan, I bought tickets for me and my mom to the Cheek to Cheek show with Tony Bennett. We attended the June 19 show. The acoustics are stellar. At one point Tony was singing a song without a microphone. Being in the second mezannine level we still heard him! The staff was so-so, except for two: one at the merch booth was very nice and another in our level who greeted us very warmly. She got out of her way to take us to our seats! I think that's a way to run a venue like this, since most people have not been here. Would definitely come back for a show from one of my faves or just to see the Rockettes!

Winter in Manhattan. Definitely a must see when the Christmas show is there with the world famous Radio City Rockettes . The theatre itself has been restored to it's heyday and has landmark status. This is a beautiful place and something that you won't soon forget.

Fun tour. We were curious about the "insides" of the famous Radio City Music Hall especially after watching America's got talent. We had a great tour and got to see how big and glamorous the place is.

Stage Door Tour Is Excellent. While I have yet to see a show at Radio City Music Hall, I have taken the Stage Door Tour is a great way to see the facility.My big beef with this tour are the people who claim they don't know any English. No photos is pretty universal. When I visited, they were setting up for Tony Bennett and Lady Gaga and the guide was clear, no photos allowed in the auditorium. While we were sitting in the auditorium and she was giving her talk, what was a 60+ year old German man doing with his iPad? Taking photos and videos of course. When we were sitting in the downstairs lounge for a washroom break, a 40 year old hispanic man walked into the women's washroom to take pictures WHILE WOMEN WERE STILL INSIDE! When we were upstairs and there were dance classes going on to teach future Rockettes, the German man was standing in the doorway taking videos despite being told not to. He also sat on the furniture in Roxy's suite (another thing you're told not to do and he was upset when he was told to get up). He also tried taking pictures of the Rockette at the end of the tour, again, being told not to.Why is this such a problem? It ruins it for everyone else, next time you won't be able to take any pictures on the tour and that would be a real shame.When you do meet the Rockette, some questions you can ask are how many girls audition, how many times can you audition, when do the auditions take place and where are they placed once they are hired, Sometimes people don't ask questions and to me, that is just a waste of their time.
Tony And Gaga-MWAH!. Seeing and hearing them together and apart doing the old tunes was an event of a lifetime. They were perfect! The venue is amazing. Love it.

Free Summer Concerts across from Radio City. One of the saddest things about Tripadvisor is finding an event or attraction which is a lot of fun, but not in the Tripadvisor database! One of these is the Fox and Friends All-American Summer Concert Series, held between late May and late August once a week (usually Friday's). Check the website for details, but they are held early in the day, are free, and have free catered food! This is a great deal, and you can get right up close to the bands. Take the B, D, F, or M trains to the Rockefeller Center stop and you are ther! Simple as that. Enjoy.
Amazing. Had a tour and it was amazing going back in time.Everything as it was all that Art Deco and the best of its time worth doing

Great venue great show. We saw Tony Bennett and Lady Gaga here in June of 2015 and the show and venue were simply amazing. Great acoustics and comfortable seats make this a great place to see some amazing entertainment.
Don't miss this fun show!. Saw the Christmas show - started our holiday season off right Amazing, entertaining, and fun! Don't miss this fun show!

christmas spectacular in Radio City. One of our family tradition specially while my kids was young was watching christmas spectacular at the Radio City Music Hall ever December. Now, we looking forward to the Rockettes show every year. Radio City Music Hall is very special for our family because we watched too many concert for several of our beloved artistes.

An icon. I've only seen the music hall from the outside whilst walking around New York but it's a music and city icon, a landmark. It was surreal seeing it in the flesh having seen it in pictures, shows and movies for as long as I've lived. A must see to take some pictures with when visiting the city.

Classic Venue. Our second visit in the last six months.We came in December for the Christmas show and then last week for the Tony Bennett - Lady Gaga concert.Each trip bring me back to when my parents took me here as a youngster, or when I came with my school.My first visit for a concert and it was spectacular.The show was sold out but the experience was great. Crowd control was a breeze and we never felt crowded . Great management and great, friendly staff.
