Radio City Music hall. This is a must see if you are there at Christmas time. Absolutely fantastic to see. Advise you book before you leave home. The show, dancing and everything else was brilliant.

Iconic building. I have only seen Radio City Music Hall from the outside as when I visited they were setting up for the Tony Awards. I have seen the outside in daylight and at night and it is breathtaking. The photos do not do it justice. You have to visit at night to see the neon, it is a classic and must be seen

Lady Gaga/Tony Bennett and David Gray/Amos Lee. Saw Idina Menzel the year before at Radio City, as well. Great facility to enjoy concerts. Would definitely return if appealing artist(s) were on the calendar.

Top venue. Went to the last show of Rockettes spring spectacular. We loved the venue and the show was fantastic. A little hectic getting out after the show but is all part of a wonderful experience. Would go again and do a tour
great. another must see, but sadly there were no shows at the time so we did not get to go, this would be better if there were rockets performing

Amazing venue. Went to see Gaga and Tony B. The concert was amazing...helped a lot byba great well managed venue...facilities are clean and enough for the venue size...no problem getting a drink. Because of the set up getting out at the end not a big issue. Staff could not be friendlier made a great night even better.

Very disappointing concert experience. We traveled from Calgary, Alberta, Canada to New York to see Tony Bennett and Lady Gaga. The show that Tony Bennett and Lady Gaga put on was wonderful to see, and we enjoyed it very much. But we found it was very distracting to be in one of the most renound music halls in the world and have people get up and down for drinks, to use the bathroom and keep going in and out of the concert hall while there was a performance. We felt very disappointed with the experience in Radio City. We felt that people need to have more respect for the performers.
Remind me of American's got talent. I have never thought that I would have a chance to pass by Radio City ! Really reminding me the show of American's got talent ~~

Christmas Spectacular. We went to see the Christmas Spectacular show and it didn't disappoint. The building was really beautiful inside and even though there was a huge queue outside prior to the show starting, it went down really quickly and we were seated in a short time.Show was fabulous - really recommend it.

Cheek To Cheek. My most recent visit was for Tony Bennett & Lady Gaga. The staff, décor and acoustics are second to none. Radio City is the pinnacle for all performing arts centers. Like Tony said, they just don't make em like this anymore. Bravo!!!
Great experience. This was a great tour! Lots of information. The guide was very knowledgeable and friendly. Got to meet a Rockette! It was a great experience

interesting. We went to the 'All access tour' and had a great time. The guide Alvin did a really good job. He had attention for the guests, told interesting facts about the place and also answered questions with great pleasure. We got to go in to the concert hall, underneath the stage and also backstage. We went for the 3u15pm tour but could not access immediately so go early or book the tour in advance so you don't have to wait to enter.

Big Hall in New York City Must visit place in the city. We have visited using NY Pass. In-side the hall was fantastic very very informative. Our guide was super super cool guys and he gave lot of information to us. Any one visiting New York please ensure you will visit this place too...

Great venue in the heart of NYC. I've made two trips to Radio City - one for the Christmas Spectacular and a tour behind the scenes and more recently for the Tony Awards.As a music venue, Radio City is perfect. It seems that no seat has a bad view and the acoustics are fantastic. The entrance spaces have plenty of room and the facilities are great. I knew nothing of the history so learnt an awful lot on the tour about the background of the venue as well as some interesting stories (as well as meeting a Rockette!)

You can't be a part of the city if you haven't been in here!. The place is terrifyingly awwtastic! If you can afford the more expensive tickets, you'll love to be nearer to the performers. But seated so far away is still okay as they've got big screens to watch from. Seats are comfortable, place is really well organised. You can book your tickets online, with a schedule months ahead of time.
Interesting tour. Interesting tour, architecture, history, design. Be where the megastars have been and still go and hear some interesting stories.

history galore. We took the guided tour and learned so much about the incredible facility. Definately something you should visit. The worlds largest and the tour guides are fun and seem to really enjoy sharing this great piece of history

Christmas Spectacular with Rockettes. I had seen this show before in national tours, but there is nothing like visiting Radio City Music Hall to see the show in all it's quintessential NY glory. So fantastic! It made me tear up, to think about all the stars over the years who had graced that particular stage...whether for the Tonys, or music concerts...so much history, and I got to take it all in. Worth every penny!!!
The Rockets!!!. We did the tour and saw the Rockets Christmas show, a must see in NY at Christmas, great for kids and adults.
Take the tour. Make sure you do the tour you wont be disappointed. The place is special and if there is nothing going on in the theater when you do the tour you get to go on the stage.

Take the Tour. We took a tour with a group of only twelve and it was great and so worth the money. We purchased our tickets ahead of time and stopped in 30 min prior to check in at Will Call, which was their tour guide table just inside the Music Hall. It was great to learn about the significance of everything from the carpet to the wallpaper...everything had a story! Pretty cool!

Check out the Radio City Christmas Show. If you want to get in the mood for the holidays, see the Fantastic Radio City Christmas Show, tickets usually go on sale in August and I think the shows begin in November. Great way to visit this "landmark" venue, get in the holiday spirit and make a memory!

Its magic at christmas. I was so excited to see the christmas show here and it didn't let me down, the place is beautiful and the acoustics are amazing, the seats were a little small but not as small as some in London, highly recommend this place

Wonderful Christmas Spectacular. My husband and I enjoyed the Christmas Spectacular for our Christmas vacation. The performance was great and a wonderful event for Christmas Eve. We bought our tickets early to avoid the lines! Would definitely recommend!
Radio City makes my heart sing.. Radio City makes my heart sing. Music is a happy path to your soul. So much talent running thru there!

Rockette's Spring Show w/ Derek Hough!. Amazing! The show it self was great but the venue was even more so. You can just feel the history as you walk in, the washrooms are a must see, they are old and cool looking.

Beautiful Music Hall. Radio city always was and always will be an Iconic and stunning Music Hall. The shows are usually filled with talent, glitter and fun. The Rockettes have and always will be at home here and spectacular! Other music venues are not to be missed. Don't miss a show at Radio City if you are coming to New York!Th Hall has refreshments and plenty of lounge areas. A plus!!!

Take the tour . . .. Admittedly, I wasn't too keen on taking a tour of the Radio City Music Hall, until we arrived. The guide was very knowledgeable and was able to point out all sorts of beautiful, one of a kind embellishments in this art deco building. From the panels near the elevators, to the restrooms, no detail was overlooked. The fact that the architect took his inspiration for the hall from looking at a sunset over a deck of a cruise ship was magnificent. The colors used in the auditorium and the sheer magnitude made the comparison very real. Take in a show, or a tour . . . just go!

Nearly flawless. I have been to Broadway a few times and to the theatre in London a couple of times so I know how great the performances are. But I was surprised at the quality of the performance. At the ballet, dancers are not perfectly spaced and in line. The Rockettes are. The story line was entertaining and other performers as good as any musical on Broadway. I will return again. This is worth seeing every time your in NYC.

New York Spring Spectacular!. The Rockettes show was AMAZING! Our seats were perfect, nice and close but not too close. Radio City Music Hall is just amazing. The ambiance and the architecture is truly something to see!

See some sort of a musical here.. The musical we saw was Spring Extravaganza it was hokey i guess, but the sets, costumes and special effects were awe inspiring. The theater itself if full of history. You can imagine yourself there in the '40's and enjoying a play just like today.
Great!. Saw a festive Rockettes show here at Christmas time. Radio City Music Hall is a must do. Always entertaining.

One of the best venues in the city!. We saw the Rockets Christmas spectacular last year, and then attended the Tony Awards last weekend. It is a beautiful, stately theater that is actually quite accommodating and comfortable. I am not sure there is an actual "bad" seat anywhere in the house because of the layout and design. Although there can be huge volumes of people in the building at one time, it somehow doesn't last long or feel like it. Well managed, great technical effects. Well worth seeing a performance here of any kind. We heard the tour was a lot of fun and very interesting.
It has to be done!. Been going to NYC for last 10 years.Show is amazing and you have to go every Christmas.BUT,I have now seen the same show 10 times.I just wish they would change something in it.

Unbelievably beautiful!. My husband and I attended the Tony Awards at Radio City Music Hall and were blown away by the gorgeous theatre! I had terribly impractical 4" heels and was worried about surviving the night in the shoes, but very surprising everything but the marble foyer was carpeted and it ended up working out beautifully. The abundance of bars on each level and well maintained lounges were most appreciated! I look forward to attending another event at Radio City Music Hall in the near future!
Had a blast at Radio City. Had a fantastic time on the tour of Radio City. Such a history packed venue, that it was a must on this holiday! Amazing auditorium and backstage areas. Loved it!

Radio City Music Hall. Lovely event center for music and dance - right in the heart of the city at the Times Square Broadway area. I visited Radio City Music Hall during my recent trip to New York. One of the iconic & most recognised Manhattan buildings - it is worth a quick visit if you are in the neighbourhood and recommended to get to see a show in it.

Second visit - just as good as the first! Ask for Danielle!. I enjoyed my first visit to the Radio City Music Hall so put it on our itinerary for my friends to see this time (6 people) Bit of confusion initially about where to go for tickets (included in the New York Pass)We finally were told to enter on the left hand side street (if you are facing the doors) By the way, if you dont have the New York Pass for your visit - get it! saves so much money! We were put in a group with Danielle. He is so full of enthusiasm for this industry is is contagious! There is nothing Danielle does not know about the Radio City Hall and entertainment business in general. They really pick tour guides well in New York - I don't think we had a mediocre one in our visit. The tour was informative, interesting and fun. They seem to have cut out a couple of things since my last visit like seeing the hydraulics under the stage and the table where Judy Garland was sitting at, but still well worth a morning visit and you get your photo taken with one of the Rockettes.I think of all our guides Danielle for our favourite. PS Danielle is a young man.

Great place. Take the Tour!. I've been to RCMH for shows in the past, and the venue is amazing. I recently took their tour, and I learned so much more about the Hall. There is more history in that place than I ever realized. Because of the tour, I now look at the Music Hall in a totally different way. I can't wait to go for another show.

Don't miss this place!. I was part of a group of 40 eighth graders and 10 adults on a trip to NYC and Radio City Music Hall. The tour was fabulous. Our tour guide was Alvin and he was terrific! He shared the history of this wonderful place, while keeping a group of sleep deprived kids (and a few adults) entertained. Our group was also able to see part of the rehearsals for the Tony Awards. We also had our pictures taken with Carissa, one of the fabulous and talented Rockettes. She shared with us how all her hard work and dedication brought her to NYC. I had a wonderful time and would go back again. Thank you very much Alvin and Carissa.
Retro and clean. Can imagine the stars walking the hallways. Nice seats & staff, no rails to seats so walk carefully.

Song and Dance. If you ever get a chance to go see Radio City Hall Spring Spectacular...GO! It was an amazing show and Derick Hough from Dancing With the Stars is an awesome dancer and contributed so much to the show. The only thing wrong was that is ended too soon!
Sue d. We went there it was good to see it near all the shops we find everything was so close and mela hotel is so close to all

Go with a Reason. Radio City is really amazing on the inside, so I would say go if you're going to an event. But don't waste your time if you're planning on traveling all the way there just to take a picture of the sign, unless you're already in the area, as Rockefeller Center is right around the corner.

Space for elephants. Do the tour. You will not regret it. The expanse of this space when completely empty is unbelievable. You get the history of the interiors, a peek at the mechanics of the stage (unchanged since installation & assessed by modern experts as better than anything else they could design), and insider knowledge into the restrooms..!! Meeting a leggy Rockette in full sequinned costume isn't too bad either!
What a historic site.. Much more than the Rockettes in here! Has elevators for handicapped. Be sure to experience tha great hall acoustics.

Radio City Tour Rocks. This tour may be the best kept secret in NYC. It is not a rip off in any way. You arrive with your advance purchased tickets, and you are put in groups of twenty-six. It is a seventy-five minute tour where you go from top to bottom of the theatre, and see it all. We were lucky enough to be there the weekend of the Tony Awards so the cast was rehearsing and we got to watch. You get the history of how they put those great shows together along with the story of the Rockettes. This is a fabulous tour worth the time and money.
Take the Tour!. The best $20.00 we spent in New York. We get a behind-the-scenes tour of the legendary venue, complete with a photo op with an active Rockette! What a value for the experience!

Wonderful. Radio City Music Hall is a wonderful experience and something you should do whenever you are in New York. There are so many different shows to choose from, you will definitely find one for you.
Great to see this place. Had the opportunity to do the tour. It was excellent and highly recommend this. Get to get see the roxy room a the workings of the stage
Christmas special. Visited Radio City for the 2014 Christmas special. The Facility was beautiful and the show was superb.
Awesome Experience. Our Tour guide Payton was so pleasant and very professional in her presentation, it was a delight to be on the tour

Nutcraker. Amazing performance during winter on 2014. I was lucky enough to get reduced rate on the ticket as I waited long enough before the show started. I got them at 1/2 price. If anything and if you're lucky like me just wait and hopefully you will get a really cheap ticket for an amazing performance. BTW this theater is very nice and the acoustic is fantastic.

WOW!! The Backstage tour was FANTASTIC. We toured this in May 2015 as a dance group from Nebraska. It was so very interesting in learning about the history of Radio City Music Hall and seeing backstage. We also got to meet and greet a Rockette! Fair warning, if you've done a lot of walking, the chairs in the Theater are so very Comfy, that you just might fall asleep!

Caught the Rockets Christmas Special !. The holidays in NYC are special. We actually love the crowds(love to people watch), shopping, and are avid foodies. One highlight of our annual trips is always the Rockets at Radio City. The venue is so historic and the show is always better than the year before!

Interesting historical building!. Really interesting tour and worth the money. Our tour guide was somewhat of a Diva who referred constantly to himself as a dancer. He can "kick" higher then the Rockettes and talks about "we" and "us" when referring to famous singers, dancers (like he's famous and "belongs in the club" lol). Apparently he does not know that a Porsche is standing in the Foyer as he said its a Ferrari. A small boy corrected him lol! Oh well, if you have him as a tour guide just don't take him too serious. He's friendly and tries to make some jokes but what's really interesting is the whole building and its history. He also took away already a story that the Rockette would tell us one more time (and he knows that she is gonna tell it to us). The Rockette was cute but apparently learned to say her "text" without emotion. I like how they kept the concept of the history when remodeling but still included high technology on stage. Too bad we were not able to go on stage as they were practicing for the Tony awards. Must see for sure!

Childhood Memories. I first went to Radio City Music Hall in the 1960's when you would see the Rockettes and a first run movie so every time I go to NYC I try to catch a show at there. Whenever you can see the Rockettes its a true fantasy, especially if its the Christmas show. Their Spring Spectacular is equally fantastic. Also try one of the backstage tours of the facility.

Memorable visit. This is one not to miss if you are a visitor to New York City. Its rich history and art heritage should be spread far and wide. They have a conducted tour for about 90 mins. It was excellent.
Rockettes Rock. We saw the Rockettes Christmas show and absolutely loved it!Everyone should go for this super fun show.

Radio City Tour. The backstage tour of Radio city is quite insightful. A venue steeped in history and host of many events the backstage tour gave plenty of information about the venue and the events staged there.
Cool. Radio City Music Hall was cool and even nicer to be seen at night. There is also a fountain nearby that is nice to sit at and gaze at Radio City.

Amazing Venue. Went to see the rockettes Xmas spectacular during thanksgiving and it was a great venue. The building inside is beautiful and makes what your seeing even better. Will do your when there in December 2015
great place for shows. saw the rockettes show,very entertaining and perfect area to see the xmas tree and lights during xmas time
an art deco marvel. it is such a beautiful theater, really worth the time to go and see it for the art deco styling even if you don't see a show!
How high does the leg go?. The holiday show is full of colors, rhythm, pazza, and charisma. The girls are quick change artist. Nth eye look so perfect, but then they are. Do not miss this.

The Golden Era of Movie Houses. In all my visits to New York, I had never been in Radio City Music Hall. I received baptism by fire when I attended the 2014 Tony Awards. I haven't got over the shear grandeur of it. Everything is beautiful. The wide stage, the sweeping balconies, the mezzanine overlooking the lobby. This is an icon of an era that will never come again. There is always something happening there so try to include it on your next visit to NYC. Next on my list is to see the Rockettes on that amazing stage.
Love the Rocketts!!. I go every year for Christmas and I never miss the Rocketts show for Christmas, year to year it doesnt have many changes but its simply beautiful!
the classic stage of NYC. Great arena with excellent accoustic and a decor that will take you back to last century luxury and entertainment

This place is a must see!. Radio city music hall is a spectacular venue. I watched the spring show here and was amazed at the inside of this venue! Definitely if you get the chance go inside see a show
Beautiful building!. Although we did not enter, the hall is beautiful from the outside and really is a historical landmark. It is also located in a fantastic area in midtown.
Come on, its Radio City Music Hall.. What a great venue. Its a beautiful theater. It has sensational acoustics. If you've never been put it on the bucket list.

Take the back stage tour.... This was my second tour, and learned even more about this historic landmark. The tour is a not to be missed activity for anyone visiting NYC... the history and enormity of it is amazing.I would think dull for children under 10, but great for everyone else.

Nice tour. A nice tour of an iconic NYC landmark. On of the Rockettes will take pictures with you that you can purchase (of course). May be even better to attend an event here. I would love to see the Spring spectacular!

Amazing girls. The show is super!!!!, this is my third time. The girls are wonderful , the music, the stage decoration , the costumes, are so great that you can't say anything wrong. It is a show for the hole family. If you go to New York don't miss it.

Family Entertainment. Being a lifetime NYC resident I had only visited once as a child and had it in my mind the venue was primarily for tourists . Despite that dated judgement we decided to organize a family group to attend the spring show .All exceeded our expectation from ease of entry to very comfortable seats to a light hearted fun production that left us all smiling .

Jonas Brothers. We were staying at the Hilton and saw two big tour buses from our room passing by our hotel. We walked to Radio City Music Hall and found out they were playing that night. Their buses were parked out front and the crowd was amazing. Just seeing the sign and knowing the history of Radio City Music Hall was an incredible experience. Unfortunately, we did not get to go inside because of the concert. Next time.
A step back in time. thoroughly enjoyed the visit to this historic sight. The young chap who conducted the visit left no stone unturned.
Fantastic!. The Spring Show was a real treat. Marvelous sets, excellent cast, and the Rockettes are nothing short of miraculous. A bit on the pricey side, but definitely worth it!
Have to see . My hotel was just 2 streats awey from the place and I was pasing it ewry say and enjoing so just go and love it So much historyyy
Dancing Girls and Art Deco. Brilliant, brilliant, brilliant. Loved this place, especially the Ladies toilets. Excellent tour and definitely worth the entrance price.

Rockettes. Take a tour of this famous theatre. Home of the famous Rockettes. You have an opportunity to meet a Rockette and have a photo with her too! Fabulous theatre built without any columns so no restricted views. The guide makes the tour most interesting.
Rockettes never disappoint. You must see it if you live in or come to NYC. I have been around the world and there are few things I can compare it to.
speachless !. We went there to see , "Spring in NY". Fantastic show !Recommend to everybody who visit this great city!
SPRING EXTRAVAGANZA. Enjoyed the usual dances and review of Manhattan in song and dance! The props like rain falling on the stage made for a different reality experience.
Rockettes Rock!. What a great place. We watched the skaters and then in the evening we saw the Spring Spectacular. It just oozes New York.

Spectacular venue. Everyone should view the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular at least once in his life. Sadly, the show is almost the same yearly, but the first time is truly spectacular. Spend the extra dollars and get a good seat on the floor
Great venue. Saw the Christmas Spectacular which certainly lived up to its name! A very slick show! Certainly gets you in the mood for the festive season!

My personal favourite. Just beautiful, a must for movie fans, it is just quite amazing and the tour guide was first rate.Became very emotional as place is full of nostalgia and is very upsetting to think it was to be pulled down.
Awesome

Rockettes and Razzamataz at Radio City. We were keen to see a show in NYC but didn't want to watch something we could see in the UK. This is different and on a grand scale - a major advert for New york? Yes but what an advert. A grand auditorium that afforded good views from wherever. An art deco foyer the likes I have never seen anywhere else. If you are in the city when one of these shows are on (even on a Sunday) - go see! You will come out dancing down the grand staircase like a Rockette!
Second visit - great venue. Originally saw Zarkana and returned to see Christmas Spectacular. Easy to walk to from neighboring hotels. Outstanding acoustics.

Christmas Spectacular it certainly was!. I have always wanted to see the Rockettes and finally got the chance when my amazing husband and adult children surprised me with tickets ( plus flights and a 7 night hotel stay in my favourite city for us all over Christmas) - in honour of a 'special' birthday!The theatre is gorgeous, from the glamorous foyer to the fantastic art deco beauty of the auditorium. Our seats were comfortable and the view was excellent.The show did not disappoint - wonderful, over-the-top entertainment from start to finish. Would recommend.
Tour of Radio City Music Hall. We took the guided tour of the building. It was great to see this icon of American entertainment history. It was quite enjoyable and memorable.
From the outside it is exactly as you pictured it. On a four day visit we didn't have time to visit event where, but had to get a few photos of this iconic building

Best Entertainment Show that we have seen, anywhere. We saw the 2015 Spring Spectacular. It was absolutely superb. A great blend of a terrific Orchestra, singers and dancers who put on a show of such high energy it took your breath away. The shows highlight was the Singing in the Rain segment performed under a real downpour- brilliant. Incredibly the auditorium can hold almost 6,000 peopleThe next day we returned to do the back stage tour which was also first class. If you like Art Deco this is the icing on the cake, well worth the price of entry

A theater venue like no other.... Radio City Music Hall is easily the most beautiful theater venue left in New York City. It is an art deco masterpiece, with grand public spaces. Even after a couple of interior renewals, it still has the railings, wall art, signage and 'sense of place' of the original hall. It is not a cheap ticket, but Radio City delivers a great experience.Radio City marked NYC as the media capital that it remains today. Concerts are a treat there. The acoustics are still amazing...really not a bad seat in the house. The venue now accommodates all of today's latest lighting and video technology, with some of the old time 'razzle-dazzle' features, such as huge projection screens, gigantic backdrops and huge items hydraulically rising from below the stage. A complete entertainment experience unlike anything else, must-see for tourist and native alike.

Very nice building inside.. We did the stage door tour and had our picture taken with a Rockette. This is well worth doing for the history and to see such a lovely theatre when it's quiet and empty. Elegant Art Deco, plush interior.

The Rockettes Christmas show is a must see spectacle!. With torrential rain and crowds all around this was a true escape form it all! Truly a wonder and a fantastic way tos pend Christmas eve in New York!

The Rockettes. Go and see the show of The Rockettes. It is a memorable spectacle. The dancers choreograph with perfect sync. The songs are great and the actors too. Try to buy tickets in the orchestra.

A great show. Nothing to dislike. One and a half hours of top class entertainment, with dancing at the heart of the show. Well done as a loose story line, which basically allows the director to do more or less what's necessary to keep the audience very well entertained.
Interesting tour. History about the start of Radio City Music Hall. Tour involves climbing stairs - which could make it difficult for some people.

GO FOR IT!. Take the tour. You get to see behind the scenes of America's most famous show place. Your guide -- and they are all well informed and interesting -- will provide you with a fascinating history of the place, take you to parts of the enormous complex that you cannot otherwise see, and introduce you to a real live Rockette. If you are in NY during the Christmas season, my family joins me in recommending the spectacular Christmas show.

Dancing Girls and a Great Building. Radio City used to offer a double feature, an orchestra, plus the Rockettes. The stage show is till lavish, but the price has gone up considerably, and the movies are gone. The Rockettes were never chosen for their beauty, so much as for their legs, and I believe recent lawsuits have resulted in a few in the line who are a little long in the tooth. But they all DO manage to kick at the same time, and, especially at Christmas they pull out all the stops with a live Camel and a special appearance by the Baby Jesus (okay maybe not the REAL Baby Jesus, but he sure looks like him!) The building is truly gorgeous but overall I think there are more rewarding ways to spend your money in the City That Never Sleeps.
Spring Spectacular. Incredible performance, the theater was so beautiful. The show was absolutely incredible, Derek Hough was so fun to watch. The rockettes were stunning, show was just stunning

Take the tour. Unfortunately I had just missed their Spring Spectacular but having visited one Christmas I was fascinated to be able to see and hear about the workings behind the scenes of this beautiful Art Deco Theatre. There were only about 15 of us on the tour which was great, guide was enthusiastic and obviously loves the place.

Christmas Spectacular indeed!. I had booked this well in advance of going and had good recommendations from friends that we should see this. It was more than I had hoped for, the scenery, dancers, music was all exceptional, revelling in Christmas joy. Well organised, though toilet line a little long, beautiful building inside, I would go again to see this or another show.

Saw the "Spectacular" Rockettes, Winter time is definatly a time to visit. Came here to see the Rockettes, which was a wonderful event I would recommend to anyone, but the Music Hall itself is an atttraction. As you enter the Grand Foyer you can allow yourself to be transported back to the glamourous 1920's and 30's in an affluent Art Deco style. The theatre itself, following more formal Art Deco lines, with its radiating arches gives you a feeling of intimacy with the stage, yet when you bring your focus away from the stage the pure grandeur of the theatre is incredible.

Christmas Spectacular. I went to Radio City Music Hall for the annual Christmas Spectacular. It is a great show with elaborate sets and costumes. This year some parts were 3D which is primarily one of the few ways the show has changed since I first saw it back in 1979. It's a standard that is an effective way to get someone into the holiday spirit. The facility is something to see with ornate chandeliers, beautiful architecture, and incredible acoustics. The Rockettes never disappoint either, even though they do discriminate against short dancers. I don't think this is something I would do yearly, but is one of those experiences that everyone one who celebrates Christmas should do once.

Excellent theatre. We went with friends to see "New York Spring Spectacular"!! excellent show, great music, great song, great fellings of being in NYC!!! the theatre is amazing, well preserved and you fell you are in the ´30´s!!!!

when in NYC this is a must experience. The Rockettes have been around along time and each generation of dancers are equally as good as the original dancers.. Its all about timing and being in sync.. they always get it right

Backstage to Stage side. We did the backstage tour which was really neat. It was full of interesting information and you get to meet a Rockette. The coolest part was to see part of the show from backstage and then actually sit in the audience and watch the spectacular show.

With the right artist makes for a great outing. Had a great sit enjoyed the show. Long lines but the staff were nice and friendly. The building was surprising bigger inside than I expected. The restrooms were clean on both occasions when I visited another surprise giving the huge crowd.
Art Deco gem. If you like art deco, you have to visit this classic gem -- a simply gorgeous theatre. The shows are very enjoyable, slightly cheesy, but good family fun.

A truly beautiful gem, worth the admission. I highly recommend the tour - it was entertaining, informative and interactive. Never a dull moment. Michael was our very engaging tour guide who kept even the youngest of our party interested (late elementary age). The building itself is incredibly beautiful. I hope we can someday return for a show here, or to see our very own Rockette perform maybe.

Spring show or Christmas Spectacular is a must for travelers. The Music hall is extraordinarily gorgeous and the show is truly spectacular- you Must see the NYC Rockettes to make NYC a real trip... set in the heart of midtown, afterwards go to Brwy or dine at great places nearby.. or just walk nearby 5th ave for the sites and Rockefeller Center- Truly historic!
History, Architecture, and Entertainment. The history and interior venue architecture speaks for itself...a real gem! Don't miss the Rockettes---and you can even do a behind the scenes tour!

nice memory. I been here a couple of times for numerous shows. Most recently, I came here with Lapin last week to watch the New York Spring Spectacular with the Rockettes. If you never been to this theatre before, it is quite the opulent treat. Like most theatres, they don't allow outside food and drink along with having expensive concession stands scattered about. The bathrooms still have some of the old fixtures [and a powder/waiting room!] and is still a nice memory of the past [but lines do get long quickly, so keep this in mind].
Amazing Building. Cant believe they wanted to knock down this iconic building. This is a fabulous tour, I think everyone should do it.

Incredible Experience!. Been to NYC many times and always head to Broadway. Decided to see a show at The Radio City Music Hall for a change, rather than just taking a picture outside for the holiday album. Firstly was blown away by the beautiful Art Deco interior. Staircase and ceiling, even the restrooms are amazing. Secondly, the show itself was so entertaining and professional. I had a tear in the eye when the Rockettes did their thing as I couldn't quite believe I was seeing this iconic performance in person. Thirdly, just sitting there inside the beautiful atmospheric theatre imagining all the shows and history gone on before was moving. Why did I take so long to come here? Next time we'll do the tour as well.
My Radio City Music Hall Review. I enjoyed the Radio City Spring Spectacular. I thought it was very interestingly different how they represented each part of NYC. The Music was great.

2nd time I have taken this tour, it was even better!. This tour was different, we saw the practice room and with a different tour guide it was fun to follow along with a new angle on the history and excitement this theatre brings to NYC. We were with a group of adults, following 2 groups of students...this was interesting as one teen was so thrilled to meet a dancer that he asked her to marry him! We walked right into a tour, never misse a beat or needed to stand in any line.

A Piece of History. The shows here are always great. For an unexpected treat, however, take the tour. There is so much history to this venue. The tour provides great insights--and gives you a sneak peek, when possible, at upcoming shows being rehearsed. LOVED IT.

Spring show fascinating you. Do you think " locket girls are oldfanshoned"? No! They are so professional. MCs of the show visited audience seats and communicated with us, then motivated all of people.Next christmas season show highly recommended.

Back Stage Tour. Fantastic tour of the theater with public and behind the scenes elements covered. Lots of history on the building and the Rockettes including meeting one of the Rockettes and getting a photo opportunity with her. The architecture is Art Deco throughout the building. The background on the design elements and the biographies of the designers brought the building to life. The highlight of my visit to New York, if you have any interest in history or the theatre, don't miss this tour!

Incredible architecture, beautifully preserved.... Art Deco interiors and an amazing slice of New York history. Brendan, our guide, was extremely knowledgable. Would definitely recommend the tour to get a different angle on New York history.
Amazing!. Until you tour, it's hard to imagine the size and how this beautiful theater.is. It's wonderful that this has been restored and maintained for so many generations to enjoy.

Landmark worth visiting. Even if you're not a music hall fan Radio City Music Hall is worth a visit if out are interested in learning more about New York City history. The music hall started off as a movie theatre! I was part of a group tour which benefited from very informative music hall staff, plus a short talk from one of The Rockettes which helped provide some personal context.

Classic American theater. This is one of the most iconic New York landmarks that should be on everyone’s must see list. It looks good among the cityscape in the daylight, yet the evening glows of red neon lights make it really come alive. The 1930’s theater is a well maintained art deco classic. We were fortunate enough to get tickets for the Spring Spectacular in April. The performance was a story about all the great things about New York. The legendary Rockettes were the obvious highlight throughout. The scenes involved places like the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Statue of Liberty and Central Park through dance and music. The Rockettes even did sports scenes done up as the New York sports teams. The audience participation skit was entertaining, as well. At times it seemed like an infomercial or live advertisement for the city of New York, but was still really entertaining. Animated figures and video clips periodically gave the dancers their occasional rests. The sound in this huge amphitheater was amazing as well. Although Derek Hough was not available, Taylor Frey stepped into the spotlight and was awesome. We had a wonderful time during the ninety minute show and are looking forward to the next Radio City performance we can enjoy.
Step Back In Time!. I have seen the Rockettes twice now and have to say that I prefer it to Broadway. Fantastic dancers, choreography, costumes and just an amazing ambience.
Great if you are interested in music hall. Lovely theatre and we went on the tour because it was free with the N.Y pass but wouldn't pay unless I was a real enthusiast
I loved the elegance. The sign from the outside draws you in. It is such a icon and was fantastic to get to go there. Its in a great location easy to get to via public transport.
fabulous. radio city music hall is as iconic as any other attractions in new york city. so glad to have experienced it!
Rockettes. Last show for the Spring Spectacular. Missed seeing Derrick Hough due to his injury! Rockettes were back to the 21st century!

Absolutely wonderful. Saw the Rockettes Spring Spectacular. And it was spectacular!!! My grandbaby of 4 was completely mesmerized. Only thing that bothered me was the people in front of us continued to video tape with their cellphones blocking our view. Very annoying and ignorant.
Great show!. Loved it all. The theatre is an a remarkable architectural monument and the show itself was great. Perfect for all ages!

Radio city Hall. what a beautiful place to visit, we got to see the christmas spectacular featuring the Rockettes,,,wow amazzziiinggg ...the show was more than what i expected, it a truly a beautiful christmas show

Truly spectacular. my husband and I were thrilled to get tickets to see this limited shell of the Spring Spectacular which was 12 years in the making. It is interactive at times with the audience which is fun for all ages. This show had everything you could think of, first the Rockettes, fun and uplifting story, musical, spectacular scenery. Highlights of all the wonderful things about New York City! Why just can't say enough about this show. We have seen the Christmas show but this was so different and so unique and wonderful,Our seats were perfect, center front row mezzanine.

Spring Spectacular. We had the pleasure of seeing the spring spectacular!! It was amazing one of the best shows we have ever seen!! If you get a chance go and see it!! The radio city music hall is a great venue.
Great tour. Really enjoyed this tour. Inside the building is amazing & the decor is original Art Deco style. Would be great to see a show there!
Great show!. Went to see the Rockettes Christmas show, had seen the traveling show, this was much better! Before the show, two organs provide an prelude, the interior is plush
Excellent Show. "New York Springtime Spectacular"Music, Dancing and Story was great. The show is all about New York City and sports, culture, music, shows and more.
Rockettes rocked!. My husband and I went to see the Spring Spectacular and it was outstanding. We both had a smile on our faces the whole time and the Rockettes were incredible.
Large Hall, Great Acoustics. Took in a Cirque du Soleil show there. Great venue with really comfortable seats. A classy place to take in a show.

Amazing Venue!. We went to see the Spring Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall. We've always wanted to at least tour RCMH but were delighted when we discovered that the Spring Spectacular was still going to be playing while we were in town. The show was very well done. The sets, actors and of course the Rockettes was well worth the price. I would highly recommend it. The venue is truly AMAZING!!!
Beautiful place. Went to see the Rockette's Christmas show...nice show, but the theater is so beautiful it was worth the trip. Get to the show early and get lobby pics.
Just amazing. Been here for a few shows. I really enjoy the shows here, staff is helpful and friendly. Loved the Christmas Spectacular most recently - it's all just amazing.

What a fantastic show. Having already done the Radio City Stage tour, my mother and I decided to go and watch the Spring Spectacular and we weren't disappointed. Firstly the tour itself was very informative and having purchased the New York City Pass, it was free to enter, I think normally its around $40. We were shown around the theatre by a very friendly informative guide, and given an insight into the history of both the theatre and the 'Rockettes'. The tour also gave the opportunity to meet and have a photograph taken with one of the dancers. We purchased tickets for the matinee performance the following day and opted for the cheapest seats at £39. There is no such thing as a bad seat in this theatre so I would advise to save your money. The show itself was fantastic, the dancing, the band, the technology knocked the socks off any broadway shows I have seen.
Spring Spectacular with the Rockettes. We saw the Spring Spectacular with the Rockettes and it was more than Spectacular. The use of technology with all the talent..simply amazing.

always a great place to visit. The building is a great example of art deco. The lobby continues with the theme. Even if you do not get a chance to see a show I recommend the backstage tour. Great for kids.

rockettes!. having travelled to NYC a few times before and already seen wicked on broadway there wasn't any shows that took our fancy. However out hotel concierge reccommended the spring time spectacular with the rockettes. The show was incredible! Multi-sensory, the scenes were incredible the dancing and music was faultless. You will not regret I would reccommend to anyone.
Spring Spectacular was amazing. The interior of the music hall brought back memories when we there in the 1960s, growing up in New York City. The staircase and stage were as we remembered them.

what a show!. Ticket purchase was very easy and straight forward even throw 3rd party reseller, which gave us possibility for a discounted entry. To enter was fast with no line also because the fast check in, very confortable with smartphone code. Great show!!
Great show and good time was had by all. Saw the Christmas show and it was just awesome.walked around town and enjoyed Christmas in Manhattan, well worth the trip.
Rockettes Derek hough. Liked better than Broadway shows ...great music dance story. Also took the tour after the show..cool info provided and photo op with a rockette

Rockettes ROCK!. Loved the show ... The multi sensory experience and especially the building. It holds six thousand I'm told. If you like Art Deco ...GO. You won't be disappointed.Can't wait for the Christmas show.The Rockettes are a total joy.
Lovely Building. We watched a show here with the Rockettes. Brilliant accoustics & atmosphere. Design of building is stunning.

Spring Spectacular. Be prepared for security.I was excited to see the Rockettes; I had heard about them but didn't know much. I was looking forward to seeing the theatre from the inside.The theatre was magnificent.I found the show dull and badly acted, and I don't remember much of the dancing.I'm sorry to all the people who worked hard to put the show on, but I couldn't wait for it to be over.
Rockettes Spring Musical. A really nice interactive show. About 2 hrs long. Of course lots of Rockettes. A little hipper than the Christmas show.
Rockette's Rock. Rockette's Christmas Spectacular is all that and MORE! Entire family enjoyed it! Went to the 4:30 show after Macy's Parade.
Absolutely Spectacular. Visited with friends. Loved it. Must see. Terrific "Spring Spectacular" show. Absolutely stunning performance. The show made me proud to be a New York-er.
fun!. Went to Spring Spectacular. Great show with variety of music, dance, and humor. The interior of building is worth seeing alone.So classy and comfortable and iconic.

GORGEOUS VENUE, SPRING SHOW FOR TOURISTS ONLY. I have been going to Radio City Music Hall, since I was four or five years old. My parents took me there for years to see the Rockettes, and other entertainers (I remember best Cab Calloway because I got to shake his hand) and it was fabulous. Just viewing the inside alone is worth a trip to this landmarked building.Now I take my grandchildren to Radio City Music Hall. They've all seen the "Christmas Show" (except the two in Florida), which is truly spectacular and memorable each year. However, a friend and I just saw the "Spring Spectacular" and both agreed ... it's strictly for tourists. Now, I'm not casting any aspersions on tourists ... it's just that I don't have to see film clips to visualize Macy's, the Empire State Building, etc., etc. I can GO there anytime I want!This "Spring Spectacular" had little action by the Rockettes, who are marvelous, so that was disappointing. The rest of the show was a combination of Dancing with the Stars, and the culmination of every movie filmed in New York,from "White Christmas" to "It Happened One Night", and showed pictures of the monumental buildings and sites in NYC. It was totally boring for a Native New Yorker, and as far as we were concerned, a waste of money. Their advertising it pre-Easter as an Easter Spectacular is even more absurd, because the only thing they had about Easter was a person in a bunny suit, running across the stage! This was the ONLY time I was disappointed in a show at Radio City Music Hall.

Spring Spectacular was spectacular!. No matter where you sit, you are likely to have a great view of the show. This show was great in that it gave some history about New York City. The performers were all amazing and the Rockettes didn't disappoint!
fantastic show at radio city hall !!!. it's unique , my wife and I are happy and i suggest everybody to see the show , never see something so attractive !!!!

Show was good, rude ushers. Slightly disappointed bc we bought these tickets before Derek Hogue was injured. The show was still good. We love the Rockettes and DWTS. The replacement for him did a great job though. It is more like a play/musical with the Rockettes added. Definitely glad I got to see it. But, why would you open the doors for 6,000 people so late. We were standing inline outside then were told we needed to go to another door. So we did that and had to wait longer. By the time we got in, they were already flickering the lights and hundreds of people were still coming in. I tried to get a drink before the show and the lady was so rude. She asked if I was in line? Of course I was in line. I did not pass anybody, I was waiting like everybody else. She made me question if I was in the correct line. (which I was) I was so embarrassed and unsure that I just said nevermind. Then when trying to get to our seats, the ushers were yelling and were extremely rude. Especially a tall red haired lady. I had never in my life been to a show where the attendants were that downright awful and disorganized. There was also an issue with a man sitting near me regarding his seats. Not clear what was happening but it lasted until well after the show started and was very distracting. Also, hundreds of people were trying to get to their seats after the show started. Maybe if the opened the doors at a proper time this would not have happened. I have been to RCMH before and nothing like this had ever happened. I was extremely appalled by the people working there. I hope this was a one-time deal.

SPring Spectacular was Spectacular!. First show at Radio City Music Hall - I expected songs & dance - but didn't expect such a good story line and headliner performances. I enjoyed all the performers, arrangements, and dance numbers and of course the Rockettes were exciting to see. I would definitely recommend seeing other shows here - and I'm sure I will visit again!
Definitely Worth The Visit!. Worth a visit for sure if you are in the city. The bright lights of the 6000 seater is certainly one you will not forget!

Great venue. The marquee in front of the building is iconic in its own right. Add to that the legendary performers that have, and that continue, to perform here and this is a fantastic place to see a show when in NYC.

Always a Fabulous Show!. I've been to Radio City for 60 years and they never fail to please. The spring show was fabulous and when they sang "Dancing in the Rain" it actually rained and they danced in the puddles - the staging for the whole show was fascinating. It's always a treat not to be missed.

Absolutely Worth It. Being in a 6000-seat theatre is something in itself, and the Spring Spectacular was quite a show. The Rockettes, the cast, and special effects were outstanding. The show is hoaky, but who cares! It is part of Spring in New York. Worth the price of a ticket --- as close as you can get.

Spring Spectacular. Although we were disappointed to not see Derek Hough in the spring spectacular we were very pleased and happy with the show. It was great for all ages and loved the audience participation. If the run it again we will surely be going back

Back to the good old days. Terrific Spring Spectacular show. Worth it all the way. The rockettes still stepping high and the actors were amazing. Terrific singer amazing voice Laura Benanti. Just too bad Derek was injured, we missed him.

Christmas Spectacular a must see!. Saw the show early in the morning with my sister and 4 year old niece who live in the area. Having done the backstage tour on an earlier trip I was excited to see an actual show in Radio City and this one did not disappoint! The dancing, singing and sets were incredible. It was a thrill to see the look of amazement on my niece's face during many of the scenes, especially the Nutrcraker section. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting NYC around that special time of year.

Just OK. This was probably the least exciting of 4 organised tours we completed in our recent trip to New York. There was nothing specifically wrong and the art deco decoration was impressive to view but one visit is enough for us.
Can't miss.. It is a landmark, remember. And once you get inside, you get impressed e can't stop staring at the high ceiling courtains and to wonder how many great shows have happened there.

Awesome Spring Spectacular Show!. Always liked the Spring show & was happy they brought it back. Flew up from Orlando for weekend to see Show. Spent the extra money for Center Orchestra seats on aisle in row three. Show exceeded all expectations, even though Derek Hough was out with injury. The Rockettes were awesome. Did not want the show to end.

Rockettes Spring Spectacular. This venue is a wonderful place to see a show, acoustics are delightful and all seats are great! The Rockettes were excellent as always, costumes were fantastic. The entire show was a great way to learn about NYC!

Spring FLING!. We attended the Spring Fling. It was an energizing dance show complete with the Rockettes. The Theatre is beautiful, sound is great and the dancers are just outstanding.
The behind the scene tour is great too....who knew about all those floors moving the scenery up and down...very cool!

This show ends Thursday, May 7th - DON'T MISS IT!!. The Spring Spectacular is truly a spectacular show. The dancing, singing, special effects, storyline and lets not forget the Rockettes make for a show to remember whether you are a tourist or local. Besides an awsome show , you will be visiting one of the iconic tourist sites of the Big Apple - Radio City Music Hall! which is amazing. If you go, take a moment to look around the art deco lobby which is site from the past. To top it off, there are discount tickets available because there are only a few days left which makes this show truly affordable compared to overpriced full price broadway tickets. This is truly a New York City experience - a broadway show, the Radio City Music Hall and of course the famous Rockettes.

No Derrick. We elected to go to NYC on way home to rochester from Tampa to see spring spectacular only because Derrick Hough was to star. So sorry he broke his foot. His understudy did a fine job. Thought the Easter bunny aspect was pushing the stupid envelope...add more dogs. Message was nice. Rockettes were great. Our seat were second row center.....wow....still no derrick
Must go / NY Spring Spectacular. Paid the extra for nice floor seats, wasn't disappointed. Nice threater, and was great to see the Rockettes. A must do if you have the time!

Rockettes are Great!!!. We went to see the Spring Spectacular show and really enjoys it. The venue is great with great organization of going into and out of the venue. It seemed no expense was spared for the show and that was truly appreciated!! We walked out feeling stunned by everything and will definitely going to see other shows!!!!

Great venue, disgustingly rude staff!. I went with my husband to see the Spring Spectacular on the 16th April 2015. Show was great, thoroughly enjoyable. However the staff inside where so rude I was shocked. We saw numerous displays of ushers being rude to people trying to find their seats. Toilet attendants raising their voices at people. Personally when I went to get a drink from the bar I asked if they served Red Bull and Vodka (being super jet lagged I wanted something with a punch to wake me up) only for the lady at the bar to start yelling at me - "Hell no we don't serve no Red Bull...Red Bull nearly killed my husband! It gave him a heart attack!!!" I would understand if this woman spoke politely and was making small talk about her personal experiences with the beverage I requested, but this woman was almost in hysterics yelling at me. A few other patrons where even turning heads to see what was going on. Drinks are expensive, snacks are expensive and merchandise was expensive. It really was a shame because it left a sour undertone on what was a really lovely night out at the theatre.

what a place. i,ve been many times to n.y.city and finally had the chance to see radio city ...wow what a beautiful show...and the dancing girls were out of this world..a must for all travelers or tourists you will not regret this fantastic show
The Spring Spectacular is Spectacular!. This new show at Radio City has everything you can imagine! Outstanding special effects coupled with the wonderful Rockettes! A great show for all ages!

Very iconic. While we didn't watch a show at Radio City, it was on the itinerary to see both in the daylight and night hours. Such a vibrant atmosphere with the neon flashing lights, and the celebrity spotting in the street after the show, with complimentary autograph signing. How can one not get caught up in the whole entertainment industry when you'e standing out the front of one of the most historic music scenes in New York.

This should be on your Bucket List. Everyone should see something at Radio City Music Hall. I took my 21 year old son there to see the Cirque and he was moved to tears just by the facility. It is breath taking. See anything - just to get inside and see Radio City.

Not quite Broadway, but NY Spring Spectacular was close. I wasn't sure what to expect from this show but given the line-up you knew it would be up there and a must see. Laura was good, certainly different from her Law & Order SVU appearances and I found myself waiting for the famous Doo-Doo to happen, anyway...Loved the opening choreography, the story was cute, filled with facts about NYC and made you realise how much New York is engrained into everyone's lives from the movies/TV Shows that are filmed here to the attractions and sights, makes you fall in love with New York City all over again! My only "critique" is aimed at the sporting montage and the transition through the sports could've been quicker as at some points it seemed a little slow. I could understand what they were trying to achieve but, even as talented as the Rockette's are, for me there just wasn't much they could do with a hockey stick and it just slowed the story down a little. But all in all I am glad I saw it, light up bracelets, #D and of course some crowd participation was asked for and they got it and snagged a free box of popcorn during the baseball sequence! Favorite moment: The live band, Opening sequence and Central Park scene

Go for a show or a backstage tour!. It's one of the most beautiful theaters I've ever been in. I might think that though because I've taken the backstage tour so many times. My boyfriend used to work near there so I'd often end up killing time waiting for him to get off work and he had passes for the backstage tour so I got to take it at least a dozen times. Each tour is different though, so that actually made it better. I think they have a list of so many possible stops the tour can make, but only time for about 25% of them so each tour guide gets to put his or her own spin on things and you get to see different things all the time. Fascinating details, plus it's beautiful...what's not to love.

Surprisingly entertaining. It's easy to get jaded in NYC but I left the "Spring Spectacular" feeling very pleased and happy with the presentation. The special effects are, indeed, special. The singing and dancing were great (though we missed Derek Hough--broken toe). And the Rockettes are still fun to watch.
Incredible!!!. Definitely very pricy but the level of the performance and the WOW factor is very worth it!! A must see!
You should not miss it. The spring show is superb. Technology and art at the same place, at the same time. The Rocketes are a must.

Maybe Only Once in a Lifetime. We took in the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular and we're so glad we had a chance to see it at least once in our lives. For the senior citizen, it was everything hoped for. And for the little girl, it was entertaining and fun. Tickets were very expensive (in my opinion, purchased on the internet at what was supposed to be a substantial discount) because we hadn't been there before and wanted to be sure we had seats close enough to the stage to really soak it all in. Again, expensive, but maybe it'll only be once in my lifetime, so worth it. Arrive early, because even with tickets in hand, there was a long line wrapped around the theater waiting to get in. We would choose this over the Nutcracker every time, so don't regret the expense. Memories for a lifetime.
Went of the musical The Rocketts. Went there for the first time for the Musical show called The Rocketts. The music hall is huge with ample seating. Make sure to buy the tickets in advance.

Spring Spectacular is RIGHT!. Mom, 12 & 14yr old sonsFirst time at RCMHAMAZINGTheatre is amazing, lobby is amazing, show is amazing!The premise was great, NY in all it's glory.The Rockettes were breathtaking.I highly recommend!

The rockets. Every time we have guests from Italy, we make sure to take them to see a Radio City Music Hall Show. We know that this will be for them an unforgettable memory. The theater is amazing, the sound clear and overpowering and the Rockets incredibly professional and precise in their movements. To top it all, the prices have been going down quite a bit, and this has become a very affordable way to have lot's of fun. A+

Rockettes Spring Spectacular. This show featured the Rockettes and it was a fantastic musical. This show is appropriate for all ages. This may have been my favorite thing in NYC. The Music Hall is very nice. We purchased seats, 6 rows from the stage, and so glad we did. It was worth the little bit of extra money.

A real Wow of a show. We went to see the Spring Spectacular and were not disappointed. Apart from the sheer size and capacity of the music hall the show was absolutely fabulous. This place has atmosphere by the bucketful and is worth a visit.

Wonderful Spring Spectacular. I'll start by saying I'm not a show person but it was my mum's birthday and she wanted to see something at Radio City. The Venue itself wasn't quite as spectacular looking inside as I'd hoped, but we are spoilt as our local theatre was built around the 1860s. Anyway the show was amazing, I loved it (although the need for minions was a little baffling!). The Rockettes were incredible to watch, the effects were great and the way they changed the scenes was flawless. I'd definitely recommend it and would definitely go and see it again given the opportunity.
Excellent place to visit and stay near by.. Great location and a must to experience if you are into shows, shopping and great food. Radio City Music Hall is a must to visit and see a show,

The Spring Spectacular. The Spring Spectacular with the Rockettes was great. The synchronization of the Rockettes was incredible The singing and dancing was wonderful. Amazing to see it rain on stage. There were some great special effects. It was just a fun, relaxing , memorable couple of hours at Radio City Music Hall.

A Great Site to Visit!. Did the tour and loved the entire thing. Learned about the history of this landmark, in it's entirety. Took us through the spaces and got a glimpse of the glamour behind Radio City Music Hall and dancers, with beautiful costumes.

WOW!. I hate to shout, but the New York Spring Spectacular currently running at RCMH is wonderful, full of singing and dancing, and of course, the Rockettes. It's fun for the whole family. It only runs until May 7th, so get there soon. It's a different show than the Christmas show, with a story line and different numbers by the Rockettes, in some cases more athletic, and others more balletic that the Christmas show.

Old times glamour is back!. In the heart of the city, there's this beautiful theater! The neon lights brings back a nostalgic feeling, and the place is just pretty. Amazing acoustics, and great seats available! Look for The Rockettes!

Awesome Spring Spectacular.. We went to see the Spring Spectacular and it was great. Okay - so a Broadway play it is not. But it was very entertaining and great for all ages. We drug my husband along and he loved it too- a miracle! LOL! As expected the Rockettes were outstanding and just being in such a historic and iconic venue was exciting. Highly recommend!
Spring Show. Over the top - I attend the Xmas show each year - the whole Spring show was over the top - 3D effects, real rain, flying, what the "great stage" can do & of course the Rockettes!

this is New York!. Seen the Spring Spectacular and it was spectacular! The show is perfectly organised and there is never a dull moment. Suits every age category, as well as non-English native speakers.
Makes you even forget how old and uncomfortable the expensive seats you are sitting on are!
spring spectacular. This was my first trip to radio city music hall, and it won't be my last! The Rockettes were amazing, and we were lucky enough to see Derek Hough perform!

Explore the history and meet a Rockette!. As an Aussie, I didn't know much about RCMH but really enjoyed the tour, seeing inside and meeting a Rockette! Definitely would love to see a show there next time I visit.

One of the world's most gorgeous entertainment venues. If you can't see a show here, take the tour. But it's a major thrill to be among 6,000 spectators inside this depression-era marvel of art deco elegance. Make sure you visit the lower level restrooms, as lavish and stunning as the foyer above.

Unchanging . . .. I last attended a show at Radio City Music Hall in 1965. It is comforting to know that some things never change -- except the price, of course. However, we were able to snag excellent tickets for $59 each by purchasing them at Radio City Music Hall about 2:00 the day of the performance (at 5:00 PM).

Beautiful, grand Spring show.. Watched the Rockettes Spring Spectacular here and it really was spectacular. Wonderful dancers, actors, singers, lovely music and oh so grand - everything we expected and more. Did not disappoint . And the theatre itself is a beautiful place to visit.

New York Spring Spectacular is less than spectacular. I would say the New York Spring Spectacular is more of a spectacle than spectacular. With its hokey story line around NYC attractions and iconic landmarks, it felt more of a tourist-trap than anything else. Radio City Music Hall is a beautiful venue. If you have seen Radio City's Christmas Spectacular, this show is NOTHING in comparison. In fact, this show was extremely disappointing. The Rockettes weren't even featured as the primary source of the entertainment. They served as more of a backdrop to a very cheesy plot.I think the hype about this show is seeing Derek Hough from “Dancing With the Stars”. Don't get me wrong, his dancing is very good. But honestly, I can watch DWTS if I want to see him dance. I paid to see the Rockettes, and I didn't feel like they were featured as they should've been.Also, there was a lot of hype and anticipation built up by being given 3D glasses upon entrance...only to be disappointed when the 3D video itself is pretty dumb, has nothing to do with the Rockettes, and lasts less than a minute of the show. Also, we weren't even given the light-up wristbands which added to our aggravation and to our 9 year old little girl's disappointment because she didn't have one.Bottom line: before you buy tickets to see this show, read this review. http://www.nytimes.com/2015/03/27/theater/review-new-york-spring-spectacular-barrels-into-radio-city.html?_r=0Another tip: Don't pre-buy tickets to this show. There were people all over the place handing out flyers to buy these tickets at a discount. Honestly, I wouldn't go back and see this show again, even if it was free.

Would rather see the Rockettes. I toured this with a group. I feel there are better things to see in NYC. The tour is of the lobby, vintage bathrooms, theater, and also features a short historical film. They photograph your group with a Rockette and have photos for you to purchase at the end of your tour. They also encourage you to buy souvenirs in their store.
Not bad.. We did the tour of Radio City and it was a bit of a let down unless your a big fan, would give it a miss.
Old time class. What a place to visit, a clear memory of the timeless class from a past era, beautiful, elegant, just a wonderful place to sit and reflect.

My first time. The reason we came to NYC this weekend was because I heard about the Spring show. I have never gone to see the Christmas show and thought this would be fun. Wow! We were thoroughly entertained...it was half broadway show, half dancing, comedy -there was literally something for everyone. The sets were unbelievable and the rockettes were stunning! The theater is gorgeous as well...I'm so glad we went!

Worth a visit. We went on the Stage door Tour using our New York Pass. We didn't know of the history of the Rockettes , who are featured quite a bit in the tour but we enjoyed it anyway. Lots of Entertainment history in this Music hall. The stage and hall is impressive.
Rockets. This tap dancing show was the most entertaining dance routine I have ever seen. Wish I could watch it every day.

Spring Spectacular. Radio City Music Hall is huge and so is the line for the single women's restroom. Lots of good seats and the Rockettes are great as advertised. I was a little disappointed in the other performers but the show is definitely worth seeing.

Great show but expected more.. We visited for the NY Spring Spectacular show with Derek Hough. My wife and daughter were upset to find out he got injured and wouldn't perform.Even so, the show was entertaining with several videos mixed in along with dancing and dialog.I thought they should've showed us less in the way of videos and includes more dancing.

Rockettes Rule. Chose the guided tour. Guide was superb, knowledgable and so enthusiastic. Loved the architecture and art deco decor everywhere including the washrooms. Got to meet a Rockette and was so impressed by the size and the fact that everyone in the auditorium could see the shows (no restricted views) I decided to celebrate my birthday by going to see their Spring Spectacular. Very different and entertaining. Even if you are not into musicals try the tour it is worth it.

Iconic venue. This was my second visit to Radio City Music Hall. I attended a Moody Blues in concert there in 2009 and this time I saw the Rockettes Spring Spectacular. The theater is a sight to see. I wish I had been able to take one of the tours they give, but I did not have time. The show was amazing. Very high tech stage graphics and audience were given light bracelets that would light up at times during the show. Performances of actor/singers and Rockettes were fabulous. I loved the dogs in the show also.
Spring Spectacular . Wow!Great performance, great story, wonderful dancing. And one amazing venue! Holy heck! We expected greatness, but this blew us away! Created some timeless memories!

Over rated and over priced. Christmas show,is so .... Meh. Glad live shows are doing so well but meh. Just not worth the money and the time. The show has lost all of it's charm. They are trying to be a big dazzle show it comes off more like summer stock meets carnival cruise line. Save your money or go spend it on a real broadway show. Just my two cents.

Well worth a visit. Went on the tour of Radio City which i must admit hadn't been on my priory list. But well worth it. Fantastic Art Deco theatre with fabulous wall coverings, carpets, auditorium etc. Even the loos were masterpieces of Art Deco era. Met one of the 'famous' Rockettes. The tour guide was knowledgeable and really approachable. Would certainly recommend this tour.

New York Spring Spectacular. The last time we saw a show at Radio City , it was the three young tenors Il Volo and they were Spectacular. When I heard Derek Hough was going to be on the big stage with the Rockets I had to go. A big fan of Derek's from his work on "Dancing with the Stars" we bought really great seats and I was very excited. Unfortunately Derek broke his toe and did not perform that night. I was crushed. All was not lost. We still had a good time. The show is a cheesy, mash up of touristy , silly, hokey stuff with bracelets that light and 3-D glasses. The scenery is fabulous. Laura Benati is a real professional with a good voice. The young sub for Derek although not a star is a very good dancer, sweet and with a winning way. and the ROCKETTES are wonderful. I hadn't seen the Rockettes in person since I went with my Grandma to see them with a movie called Lilli ( with Leslie Caron). So you know not one of the current Rockettes were even born then. Go just to see them. Everyone in the audience seemed to have a great time. You can't keep your legs still.

spectacular. built in the early 1930s and by the end of the 20th century the hydraulic system to lift up the stage was still state-of-the-art. that says it all, doesn't it? we did the tour and returned the same evening to see the spring spectacular. not our kind of show, but in this scenery: great!
Christmas Time is Magical. If you do anything you must go here during Christmas. It's magical for young and old. The rockettes were great, the scenery, acts, snow and santa!

IT WAS AMAZING!. We went to see the Rockettes Spring Spectacular! The place is GRAND to say the least :) There were people dressed to kill (tux/evening gowns) to jeans/sweatshirts. The seats are comfortable! The atmosphere is energetic! The show was amazing!!! We were maybe 30 rows back on the bottom floor -directly in front of the stage and the view was awesome. There is concessions available. Part of the show was in 3D- but there was no need for the glasses if you didn't want them. They did part of the show in the rain- it was beautiful. Very well choreographed. Very entertaining. I would definitely see another show!!!

Spring Spectacular show. We saw the Spring Spectacular and it was exactly spectacular! The hall is large and beautifully impressive! The show has a wonderful theme of NYC landmarks woven into the story line. The scenery changes were unbelievable including the Statue of Liberty!The singing was great and of course the Radio City Dancers. Go, before it ends!

Spring Spectacular. The Spring Spectacular show was SPECTACULAR!!! It was the first time my 79 year old mom had ever been to Radio City Music Hall. It was overwhelmingly wonderful for her! I was happy I made the choice to cut out one "broadway" show and visit RCMH instead!
Always Fun!. Saw the Christmas show...just wonderful...lines impossible and cost very high! But we obtained a coupon on line to reduce cost. Went with my five year old grand angel and her parents.
the Rockettes. What a superb venue for this show. Outstanding!! Easy to get to and book tickets for the show. No hassles before or after.

New York Spring Spectacular was great. Took my Wife and 20 Y.O. Daughter to see the "New York Spring Spectacular" and we enjoyed it very much. It was a well produced show and the scenery was great. The music, acting and dancing was tops. The Rockettes are also great!! I would recommend this show to anyone. But you better hurry because it ends May 7th. Also, the main star Derrick Hough was injured on "Dancing with the Stars" so I'm not sure what his status for the show is at this time.
Fantastic show. The music hall is an old fashioned venue. The decor brings you back to the golden age of theaters. The show is energetic and lively. A trip here is sure to make great family memories.

Rockettes Spring Spectacular. Wonderful show that spotlights NYC, Derek Hough was surprisingly good...who knew he could sing? Laura Benanti was beautiful and talented but for me Jared Grimes stole the show. The Rockettes as always were spectacular, they are a wonder to watch.

Fantastic experience!. My girlfriend & I went to see the Rockettes Spring Spectacular 2015 with Derek Hough. It was an amazing story of NYC, with guest commentaries from several celebrities! The beautiful, classic music, scenery, and of course, dancing was combined into a fantastic experience I will never forget! A highlight of our 'girls getaway' in NYC! (We even got a picture with a Rockette after the show.)

Spring Show is Spectacular. The spring show at Radio City Music Hall is a very uplifting, high energy look at springtime in New York City. It features scenes from Central Park, the Library, The Metropolitan Museum of Art and the New York sports scene. The segment featuring the Statue of Liberty was so patriotic. This is a must see!

New "Spring Spectacular" Show. Radio City is rolling out a new show for the Springtime, and I think they need to roll a little more. Many of the Rockettes pieces were visually pleasing, Derek Hough is also pleasing, Laura Benanti's voice is fabulous but, the storyline is just okay. Being inside the famous Music Hall is always a thrill. Get there early just to enjoy the lobby upstairs and down.
The Rockettes Rock!. We went to see the Rockettes' Spring Spectacular. And was it ever! Lots of special effects and beautiful sets. And the dancing, of course.

New York Spring Spectacular. Have been to many,many, many shows and this was the best show I have ever seen. The Rockettes were as amazing as usual...but the story, the songs, the dance and the way it was presented was over the top.

Spectacular Show. The show has everything to keep audiences entertained from beginning to end. The 3D glasses and LED bracelets make the young and old interact with the show. The orchestra is flawless and the songs are timeless. Derek's dancing is amazing, the scenery is awesome, and the Rockettes are terrific. You are sure to be smiling throughout the show.

Rockettes spring spectacular 2015. the 2015 spectacular starred Derek Hough. He was awesome. The show is all about the history of New York with special guest appearances from Donald Trump, to the top fashion designers , and athletes from the various sports teams, the Rockettes is a MUST see . You won't be disappointed.

Christmas Spectacular was Spectacular!. I came to NY early for a business trip to see the Christmas special and I'm glad I did. It was quite wonderful. Great music, dancing, and stage design. Santa showed up. There was 3D. It was all quite cool.The only thing I will say, it was mainly families, which I should have guessed, but didn't know. Therefore, great for families and everyone really, but it definitely was somewhat distracting. However, this distraction didn't keep me from really enjoying it and taking it in as a Holiday great time in NY.
