Backstage and Back in Time!. It's like you've traveled back in time inside RCMH. So much of it is as it was. It's a gorgeous building with such great history. A definite must-see.

A Classic Venue for Spectaculars. Friends and I were here to see the Radio City Spring Spectacular, and spectacular it was.I hadn't been in many years, and was pleasantly surprised to see that it was in top-top shape. No shabby carpeting, no worn seats, the bathrooms were spotless.If you want a big dose of Art Deco, this is a must visit. Everything from the fixtures, to the stairways, to the bathrooms still has that distinct art deco look and feel.This is a huge venue, it seats about 6,000 people.If you're getting tickets orchestra middle in the first 20 rows is the best, but since the acoustics are amazing it's good all the way through.We were here for Derek Hough and the Rockettes and I think he went a long way in modernizing the show. The story was just a bit sketchy, but vaguely believable and the projected sets really stole the show.

SPRING SPECTACULAR IS A MUST. What a wonderful introduction to RCMH and the amazing, wonderful, high energy ROCKETTES ! The entire experience is wonderful. If you have any interest in a live show that is awesome, fun, fast paced, and the dancing and singing is wonderful _ GO SEE THE SPRING SPECTACULAR. Wonderful and for all ages.
Spring Spectacular. Great show, just long enough Liked the interactive parts of the show. Dont be fooled, pretty much any seat is good

Best show ever!. We have seen a lot of shows but this one was fantastic. Not one single moment that lacked the wow factor. Derrick Hough was so good and it the performance had just the right balance of everything - storyline, singing, dancing, video, props, all things NY, the Rockettes and of course - dogs. We absolutely loved it!
Nice. We watched the Spring Spectacular and other than the tall guy in front of me, loved it all. Can't wait to see the Christmas show this year.
rocketts. We saw their christmas show which was awasome. The costumes and sets were spectacular.Ronald lake who played on Pit Boss was one of the elves. Sure wish I could have met him.

Bigger than you think. Got our tickets for the tour in a shop next door. The tour we took lasted about eighty minutes. We met one of the rockettes , the famous high kicking dancing group. Very impressive interior. Lots of stairs.
Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. Very child focused, not so much an adult show in my opinion. It was cute though. I feel like one time in a lifetime is good for me.
great show. we saw the spring spectacular, first spectacular thing was the hall itself. The show was good, dancers were particularly good.
Spectacular. Saw The NewYork Spring Spectacular -The Rockettes were outstanding performers. The whole show was phenomenal. Quite possibly the best show I've ever seen

Spring Spectacular was that and more!. My sister and I came to NYC to see Derek Hough with the Rockettes and we weren't disappointed. It was a fantastic show with something for everyone and we loved every minute of it.
Rockettes. What a show, non stop singing and dancing in this wonderful music hall. The Rockettes are fabulous. Really enjoyed it all especially "Singing in the Rain".

Ups and Downs. The sets were truly spectacular. But the story had its ups and downs. The dance number in the rain was the best, and, of course, the Rockettes synchronized dancing was great. I was particularly bothered by the "voice of God" and the appearance of a dead wife of one of the characters.

It was Spectacular and it is Spring. On a lark we decided to go to the Radio City Spring Spectacular. Been a while since we went to the Christmas Show and decided we would enjoy the fantastic Spring Day (finally) in NYC. They really have check-in down to a science. Show your tickets, get the ticket scanned, go on inside. Once inside we saw that there were drinks and snacks available. We ordered 2 drinks, price on par with what you would expect to pay at a concert venue, and had a nice chat with the server. She told us that she loved the show but wouldn't spoil it by telling us what the wristbands were for or any of the surprises. We went to the door for our section where yet another pleasant employee greeted us and gave us our 3-d glasses and booklets. 3-D glasses and wrist bands? Whoa! What is going on here? She got the attention of an usher and we were shown to our seats. Keep in mind these were last minute and not full price but the view from our seats was great. Main floor, left side, row ZZ. While we sat there sipping our refreshments we watched as seats were removed to allow folks in wheelchairs to slip into a row with there friends and family. Seems the back row of some sections, maybe all, have this feature. The guy that was removing the seats was quick, a couple of taps, bing, bang, boom and out comes two seats and in moves the person with their wheelchair. Seems so much better than being seated off to one side or the other. In all we saw four sections of chairs removed and stowed in our immediate area. Like I said, Radio City has it down to a science, no one is excluded. The show itself was spectacular. The orchestra was brilliant, the songs catchy classics, the story line, though contrived, acted as the vehicle to take the audience on a tour of NYC in all its splendor. The special effects and 3-D were magic. I don't want to include any spoilers but more than once we were saying to each other, "How'd they do that?". Add to that the iconic Rockettes with above the head kicks (how do they do THAT?) and the singing and dancing of Derek Hough and Laura Benanti with the rest of the cast and you have a home run. Just ask Bernie. :-)

New York Spring Spectacular. Loved the show! Great dancing and singing! The story line of the show was great and provided a great insight of the must see attractions of NYC. I would highly recommend anyone visiting during this production to see this show.

Spring Spectacular 2015 was mind-blowing. 3-D glasses, lighting LED wrist bracelets, celebrity singers and dancers, stunning visual effects, cameo TV appearances by more celebrities... and of course The Rockettes... what more do ya want folks?
Radio City Music Hall Tour. This tour was wonderful! So much history and nostalgia in such a beautiful space! Wonderfully conducted, very informative and thouroughly enjoyable!

Spring Spectacular. We had the pleasure and opportunity to attend the Spring Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall. It was fun, uplifting with great music, dans, show ... in a great location.Also the kids loved it !

Love seeing this beauty. Hard to believe that when it was built there was so much foresight to making it something that would stay around as long as it has. So expansive and beautiful. Well worth the time and money. Had elevators so that people with a wheelchair can also participate/go on the tour.

Spring Spectacular . Saw the Spring Spectacular show and really enjoyed it. Very entertaining and great dancing. Derek Hough did a great job. Radio City Music Hall itself was beautiful. Definitely recommend visiting!
Radio City Music Hall Christmas Show. waited in line before show and got better price seats than internet prices.Great seats, kids loved it.

Spring Spectacular. Just went to the spring spectacular. It was surprisingly very good. The scenery changes, light changes (including wristbands on audience members that changed colors), 3-D scene, etc., it truly was very entertaining. We sat on the 2nd mezzanine and it was a great view.

Attended Christmas show. Christmas show was just down the road from our hotel so decided to book when we were their. Impressive theatre but show was nothing special and a little am-dram bearing in mind it's in New York.

Great Tour. We wanted to go on the tour to see where our heroes have performed I.e. Bowie and Tina Turner. The place is lovely so much to admire. The tour was very informative and we saw original furniture which has been used by some very famous people. We also managed to meet a Rockette and have our picture taken with her, it was worth the time, we had a 12 year old and a 9 year old with us and they also enjoyed seeing everything.

The rockettes. Fabulous experience for the whole family.,! Admittedly my uncle wasn't that bothered but my aunt loved the show and I loved the experience.,! Cousin George is now dancing (as well as playing soccer)!!

Spring Spectacular lives up to it's name! EXCELLENT!. I went to the Spring Spectacular and was beyond pleased that my seat was 2 rows from the stage! What an incredible production! At some points the show veers on the cheesy side but overall I loved it and it made me proud to be a New Yorker. This is a great visual experience and I was in awe especially at the Grand Central Terminal replica-the way they had the light filtering through the windows and the props-it made you feel like you were at the real place...minus the swarms of people. Derek Hough is incredibly talented and stars in this spectacular show and even sings!! I'd be wrong if i didn't mention the fantastic full orchestra that is the heartbeat of the show. The opening number, "Welcome To New York" by Taylor Swift is an upbeat and joyful way to kick off the show and I thought it was great. The fashion week section was a bit too long and I felt a little overplayed. This is a showcase of NYC and the sets are grand and beautiful in every way but another highlight was Amy Poehler and Tina Fey as Patience and Prudence, the NYPL lions. So many memorable numbers in this show, and so good I bought another near front row seat for closing day on May 7th.This is a great show for families or singles alike and I think there is something for every age. Of course who wouldn't love enjoying a show in this iconic hall? Thank you Rockettes for another inspiring and incredible show! Still photography is allowed with no flash and no video recording devices are allowed. Make sure you give yourself plenty of time to get seated properly and if you don't know where to go there are helpful ushers always nearby. Show is 90 minutes and the subway is directly outside the doors on 50th.

Spring Spectacular. Very good show. Beginning scenes are in 3-D, and the Rockettes, as always, take your breath away. Minor audience participation if you're seated in the orchestra section. You're given interactive bracelets which light up throughout the night. Also, if you're interested in waiting by the stage door for autographs, you need to go out the rear exits and walk to the right. We had to ask because we wanted to wait for Derek Hough, who does come out and takes pictures and signs autographs.

Spring spectacular. This show was amazing & a kid friendly show. There was non stop action from beginning to end with singing & dancing & amazing special effects. It rained on stage, pictures came to life & statues talk. This is a show I would definitely see again & now looking to check out the Christmas spectacular which is probably going to be just as amazing. The rockettes dancing was perfection.

Radio City Spring Spectacular. I have seen the Christmas Spectacular a few times, and wanted to see what the Rockettes did with a new spring show. We had center orchestra seats (Chase preferred seating) and the view was perfect. I enjoyed the show, but thought that the Rockettes weren't in it as much as they are in the Christmas show.Derek Hough and Laura Benanti were great as the leads, but my favorite number was "Singing in the Rain." I am glad we got to see this show, but not something I would feel the need to see again (unlike the Christmas Spectacular).

spring spectacular is an exelent show. Everything in NY city cost a lot of money, but this show was worth it. It has a little bit of everything for a different taste. Nice dancing, nice music, very colorful. I would recommended to all of my friends.

Pretty Spectacular. I'm not a big Rockettes fan, but I'm glad I attended the Spring Spectacular. My wife wanted to see the show because Derek Hough of Dancing with the Stars is the headline performer. I'm not a fan of DWTS either but decided to humor her by going to the Radio City show with her. I didn't think I was going to enjoy the it, but I did. The many scenery changes were impressive as well as the costumes. The dancing and singing were excellent as well as the way the show was created to have the audience participate. I'm hard to please, so take it from me, you'll enjoy this show. It runs until early May so see it if you can.

Rockette spring spactacular. This was a real treat for us. We decided the last minute to go to,the show and I am very glad we did. The show was amazing, the dancing was great as was the choreography. Great experience, worth every penny of the ticket.

New York Spring Spectacular IS!. What a wonderful show celebrating the many facets of this majestic and truly unique world city! This production was wonderfully done and the stage sets were truly amazing. Loved every set and was amazed at the live Singing in the Rain sequence literally in the rain! The fashion sequence was my least favorite but otherwise simply spectacular! Don't miss this! There were a surprising number of available seats so don't worry about getting a seat but come soon before it closes--the seats are the largest and most comfortable you will ever find in a theater! Truly Iconic!
you have to do the tour. great place to see Music and fllm life. beautiful interior art deco. Rockafeller's office has furniture to die for if you like art deco.
Great Family Entertainment. Had a great time at the Spring Spectacular . Visited with our granddaughter who absolutely loved it .

Spring Spectacular. This show featuring the Rockettes, Derek Hough, and many others was superb. It is by far the best presentation I've seen at RCMH. Every moment was filled with either singing, dancing, special effects, magic, audience participation, acting, and lots of imagination. Bravo to all who had the ideas, put in all the hard work, and worked toward a great audience involvement which lead to a great show and many great memories.
Fabulous show: Radio City Spring Spectacular. Loved this show from beginning to end. Great dancing, singing and amazing costumes and sets. Wold definitely recommend!

"Rock-ettes" Away!. The tour was crowded but well behaved-for crowd-that is. The history, concerts and all venues here are memorable and a real treat to see the magic that in a few hours will transform this Music Hall into just that, enjoy!

Spring extravaganza. Great show; giant stage and curtain; special effects made me think that Disney must have combined with a Las Vegas show on Broadway. Talent, music, showmanship. Just go - you'll be glad you did.
Spring Spectacular. The spring show was excellent with lots of Rockette appearances and plenty of music and dancing. Derek Hough was the star and he did a great job. This show is definitely worth it.

ICONIC art deco architecture. the tour was about an hour with a delightful, informative guide. the architecture is phenomenal; original wallpaper and furnishings. the Hall itself was awesome; wish we could have seen a show there. well worth the tour if you're interested in history and architecture

Enjoy the festive atmosphere. My wife and I went to see the Rockettes Christmas spectacular and we were so glad we did as it was one of the highlights to our trip.If you want to get in the Christmas spirit, this show is an absolute must.Great songs, dancing, and stage decoration.The building is very iconic and looks very well maintained.We will definitely come to watch another show here the next time we are in NYC!
Pleasantly Surprised!. My first time at RCMH, and liked it a lot. The Spring Spectacular with Derek Hough was very nice and my husband loved the Rockettes...

The Best Show Ever!. I live in New York. I love going to shows, ballet, flamenco, etc. Last night, I went to see the Rockettes at the Spring Extravaganza. It was, by far, the best show. I have seen the Christmas show but the Spring Extravaganza was magnificent. The Rockettes were beautiful but how they did the show bringing beautiful places, such as the Metropolitan museum and Central Park, into the show was very clever. I loved the show and I would love to see it again, very soon.
It was spectacular. The set designs were incredible changing constantly. The cast was terrific with a great story line and of course the fabulous Rockettes

Backstage Tour. Loved the "Backstage Tour" at Radio City Music Hall. Wish we would have had time to see the Spring Spectacular, but just couldn't fit up into this trip. Had a great time with our tour guide, Ayana. Lots of stairs to climb to experience the whole tour. Ask for the elevator if you have health issues.

Spring Spectacular. This was my wife's and myself 3rd visit to see a show at Radio City (2 x Christmas Spectaculars). This time we were visiting with our 10 year old twins to see the Spring Spectacular and it did not disappoint. The staff were attentive and the show itself was just amazing, like a MGM movie! FISRT CLASS
excellent venue. rockettes always rock. the shows are fabulous and never a dull moment. great theater that transforms all around you
The Rockettes!. We went for the Spring Extravaganza and it was very entertaining. Just seeing the Rockettes was worth the admission price but the historical building was beautiful too.
Rockettes. Even better than the Christmas shows!The Rockettes and Derek were brilliant.It is a shame that not every performance is sold out.

New York Spring Spectacular Is Spectacular!. The afternoon show starring Derek Hough (from Dancing With The Stars) and Laura Benanti was truly entertaining for the entire family! They gave out flashing bracelets and 3 D glasses when you went to your seat. The show was beautiful with dancing and coordinated lighting. It is an original story with a tour of New York City woven into it. You can't help but learn something about the city that you never knew. I don't want to give too much away. It is well worth the time and money. The kids around us just loved it too! Recommended for all ages!
Brill. Nothing to dislike, we didn't do the tour but watched the Spring Specacular, it was fantastic... The Rockettes were great.. Those high kicks!!

Surprisingly good. Saw the Spring Spectacular and was a very enjoyable hour and half. Reminded me of those movies of broadway musicals we used to watch all those years ago. The Rockettes were great and really enjoyed the Singing in the Rain number.

Radio City Tour. We saw the Rockettes Spring Spectacular - awesome show. We also toured Radio City Music Hall - my daughter is a dancer and she got to meet and get her picture with one of the Rockettes on the tour.

The best show in town. We saw the Easter performance , our 4 year old grandson and 7 year old grand daughter, actually sat through the show without one peep. In the same light ,the adults enjoyed as much as the youngsters . Simply spectacular !
a good entertainment hall. It is well organized and space. But in my mind, it lacks originality. It is a little bit to commercial.

You Have To See The Rockettes!!!. I just saw the Spring Spectacular Show at Radio City Music Hall. It was amazing. It's true I wanted to go because Derek Hough is in the show, however I had forgotten how truly awesome the Rockettes are. Whether you are a fan of dancing or not, don't miss this show. Radio City Music Hall and the Rockettes are part of New York City. It doesn't matter if you are a visitor or you live in New York City area, go see the show. Many of us that are residents have this idea that if you have seen the Rockettes once it's no big deal. Simply not true. Don't let this show close without experiencing it! Thank you Rockettes and Derek!

Radio City Delivers Big Time!!. Everyone visiting NYC during Christmastime has to put this on their list. Search around the internet for some discount tickets (if you have a Chase credit card you can get preferred seating and a nice discount), and try to sit anywhere in the first mezzanine, where you have the vantage point to really appreciate the synchronization, style and grace of the Rocketts. Bring some compact binoculars for close up views.What a show!! I'm going back next year - can't wait.DG

Enjoyable one hour tour. I visited the music hall on a guided tour (set at specific times of the day almost every hour) and my guide did a great job taking us through the attraction and explaining various elements of design and decor. There was a movie room where we watched a short documentary, a brief visit in the sound room upstairs where we caught a glimpse of a rehearsal of Singing In The Rain for spring show and in the end, we had the opportunity of meeting one of the Rockettes. All in all a good tour worth your hour.

Terrible experience. I found the lobby staff (box office; customer service) to be surly, and unaccommodating. We had a kink in our plans due to a 7-hour flight delay on a one-hour flight. There was a lot of ‘buck-passing’ on resolving this.In the end we were told to arrive 2 hours before the Rockette show to resolve the issue, which in the end did not get resolved by Radio City / Rockette staff. What a bad impression for international tourists. In the end, it simply just wasn’t worth it.

NYSS Exceeded My Very High Expectations. This was be best musical extravaganza I have EVER seen. Laura & the Rockettes were great but Derek Hough was the STAR and his singing, dancing were amazing and magical. He is one heck of an entertainer. The venue was a spectacle worth seeing - rain on the stage, larger than life set. In fact, I'm going again this Saturday, April 17th. It's that good. NYC is shown to its best advantage and you'll leave with the biggest smile on your face. Worth every cent. Great job RCMH! It is SPECTACULAR!

A SPECTACULAR SPRING EVENT. The venue is fabulous and seating from all areas would be great. The show was an alive and captivating story of NY - the props and scenes were excellent, especially "Singing in the Rain" and "Empire State Building". Show runs for just on 1 1/2 hrs, would have enjoyed more but that's Broadway! Thought the drinks were over priced ($15 glass wine) but one wouldn't break the bank to enjoy your experience. Go see it, well worth it
Rockettes in Springtime. Had a great time with my 10 year old granddaughter who likedNot only the Rockettes but also Derrick Hough. The dancing inthe rain song was unique.
Great Visual. Although I didnt go in on my visit to NYC, I did enjoy walking past the building, especially at night when it is lit up. Another slice of NY
Amazing venue!!!!. Spring Spectacular was way beyond my expectations!!! I love NYC! This is a must see for locals and anyone coming from out of New York. Keep the fire of NYC alive with this show!
Spring Spectacular. Saw Spring Spectacular with Derek Hough. Good time and impressive display of best of Rockettes and the Music Hall. Definitely an NYC rah-rah but good promo!

Spring Spectacular. What a fabulous show and the history and beauty of Radio City only made the show and experience that much better. If you get a chance ...I HIGHLY recommend this show with Derek Hough....you won't be disappointed.
Great fun. The show was fun, a little corny at times, and there could have been less talking and more dancing, but it was well worth seeing. And Radio City was a wonderful venue to visit.

Fantastic Spring Spectacular !!. Went with m friend to see the Spring Spectacular and it was AMAZING ! Foot tapping nearly all the way through. Singing in the Rain was my favourite. Derek and Laura and the the rest of the cast were fantastic! The stage is better than the ones here in he UK! The inside of this building is beautiful. Will need to come back to see more shows when back in New York!

fantastic Show a must see!!!!. Please when in New York go and see the new Radio City show! The theatre is excellent it doesn't matter were your seat is everyone is great and if you get the chance go on a tour of a day to meet the rocketed and get photos taken!! The show is awesome as well as song and dance the light work is spectacular!! Hence the name of the show

Spring Spectacular. On Saturday,April 11th,yesterday,i took in the Spring Spectacular @ Radio City Music Hall in New York City.there were 2 shows one @ 5 pm and another @ 8 pm,i went to the 5 pm.being a gorgeous,spring day in NYC,i arrived early to Penn station via the LIRR and decided to walk the 17-18 blocks to Radio City. here is the not so brief story line,Derek Hough[from DWTS] plays a character in limbo between earth and heaven awaiting his wings.God gives him a task to earn his wings,to help Benny retain his job as a long time NYC tour guide who's in jeopardy of being fired after a billionaire woman[Laura Benanti]who hates to enjoy herself and doesn't like to have fun, takes over the tour company and wants to replace Benny with an automated cartoon version of Benny.Derek convinces Laura to take one of Bennys tours thru NYC.they visit numerous attractions such as the Museum of Art,the NY Public Library,Empire State Bldg and Statue of Liberty trying to persuade Laura to see Bennys value as a tour guide.in a scene from ancient Egypt Tina Fey's voice speaks from a lions statue and in another Whoopie Goldberg is Gods voice.in the end Laura sees the error in her plan and realizes Bennys value.the show is an exhilarating,whirlwind tour de force with numerous superb Rockettes dancing scenes with and without Laura and Derek,both whom are excellent singing dancing and acting.it is a must see show that ran 1 hr and 26 that i highly recommend ! ! running thru early May.oh and i almost forgot,there are several Rockettes scenes with a sports theme one each with the NY Rangers,NY Yankees,NY Knicks and NY Giants featuring cameos by Henrique Lundqvist,Joe Girardi,Carmello Anthony and Michael Stahan exhorting Benny not to give up on swaying Laura.

Awesome Show!!. My mom & I went and truly enjoyed the show. The whole time was nonstop action which blew us away. It was nice to see a spring show considering we usually go to the xmas show. We hope they continue to do a show like this in coming years!!
The best spring show. This was a great show. They must do it again and do more like it. Derek and Laura were fabulous. The sets were exceptional and of course The Rockets.

Spring Spectacular is Spectacular!. Took my kids to see the show yesterday and it was Great! We liked it better than the Christmas show. The "Singing in the Rain" scene and the Statue of Liberty scene were our favorites! Derek Hough and Laura Benanti were great hosts of the show and so talented! We loved Bernie though. ( He came out after the show and signed autographs!) Worth the money.
Spring Fling Spectacular. Our group choose this play to visit. I was not very excited about it but went along with the group. IT WAS AMAZING. A very New York kinda of thing.

Centrally Located. We took the tour of Radio City Music Hall first and were so impressed by the 75 minute tour that we went to the box office to see if we could secure tickets for "Spectacular". The tour also included a personal photo-op with one of the Rockettes. All seats were great seats with no obstructive views so we got a great deal on tickets that same day. The seats had great leg room--I am tall but my knees did not touch the back of the seat in front of me.

What a fun event!. Went to see The spring time show. We were with our grandchildren plus the rest of the family. It was Easter Eve, and the show was Fabulous! Derek Hough not only can dance, he's turned into quite an actor with a very good voice ! Go while you can! Even us grandparents loved it!
An impressive show. We went in on passing and got tickets to the Spring Spectacular" and it was too - a great show, great for kids and adults alike with good amenities.
Rockettes. Rockettes are just something you have to do while in manhattan. There's not a bad seat in Radio City Music Hall.

Spectacular spring show. After doing college tours for 2 days the whole family went to the show. It was amazing! Everyone, including my 17 year old son, loved it. It was the fasted hour and a half, we wish it could have gone on longer.

Spring Spectacular was AWESOME!. We were on vacation in NYC last week and got tickets to their Spring Spectacular with Derek Hough! It was Fabulous! We really enjoyed all the songs and dancing and of course the Rockettes! Who knew Derek was such a great singer!

New York Spring Spectacular. An amazing space with an amazing show! The costumes, the sets, the dancing, the multi-media components were all impressive. It was well worth the ticket price to see this inclusive and entertaining look at NYC. Lots of little kids were there, but the show was delightful for my 15-year-old niece and me as well. It truly is designed for all ages.

Rockettes Spring Spectacular. First time in Radio City music hall - I was very impressed. We saw the Spring Spectacular. It was fast moving, very professional, and great entertainment. Before we realized it, we had watched an 1 1/2 hour show without intermission. Highly recommend it.

Just enjoy the dazzel. Radio City Music Hall is an institution like no other, I have seen wonderful shows here and also sat in the audience as my daughter graduated from NYU, its magic..and any show is worth taking the kids to see, but my favourite is the Christmas Extravaganza!!
Nice to Walk By. Radio City Music Hall is just nice to stroll by and see the outside decorations. Although I didn't step in, it look pretty nice from the outside.

Preserving the Past. I have been to Radio City at least 10 times. Fun to see the rockets and watch a movie ! Now of course you see a show, pricy but you have to do it at least once. Great christmas shows but i wasn't crazy about the Circ de ole. a must for liitle children.

Spring Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall. One fabulous production number after another. Derek Haugh and the Rockettes were naturals together. Non-stop entertainment from America's premier entertainment venue. Hats off to the entire cast and crew for an award winning performance. Will never grow tired of the thrill of seeing and hearing an entire orchestra rise up from beneath the stage. If you see one NYC show in the spring, this one should be it. Show runs until May 8.

The NY Spring Spactacular at Radio City Featuring the Rockettes. I have not seen an Easter show at Radio City in many years but this was a very good updated show. As the others have said the seats were extremely comfortable and most Broadway venues should follow suit. The Music and dance & Special effects were fantastic. & It would appeal to men as well as woman. It was a very enjoyable show and fellow New Yorkers as well as tourists visiting our city should not miss it.
Visit. A good place to go, although not easy to find where the entrance to the tour is - New Yorkers talking so fast it took asking 3 different people!

Spring Spectacular was Spectacular. This show was great old school musical with all the newest tech elements. The Singing in the Rain number was the best. We had a great seat even with being in the second mezzanine.

Rockettes' spring spectacular. My wife and I went to the Radio City Spring Spectacular and was greatly entertained for 90 minutes. Very good show. Great music and dancing. Spectacular as promised.
May be better than their Christmas show.
Plot rather trite, but who cares?

Classic Rockettes Performance. We recently enjoyed the spring offering of the Rockets at this legendary venue. The seating was comfortable, a real pleasure after unfolding my aching lanky frame from so many tight Broadway torture fixtures. The story line for the show was admittedly corny, but the song and dance made up for it all. If you haven't ever seen the Rockettes, you owe it to yourself to do so.

One Not To Miss!. This is a fabulous tour and well worth a visit. The music hall is amazing with fabulous lobby and auditorium. You get to meet one of the Rockettes and see images of all the famous people who have entertained here. Really worth the money, tour lasts around 1 hour.
Pure musical fun. Pure musical fun-ride through the sights and sounds of New York. Highly recommended, for tourists and locals alike, especially families.

Oustanding show!. We definetly recommend to see this show. The whole story is cute and the public was very engaged by the actors and by the lighted wrist bands. The 3D short movie is very nice as well.The Rocketts were absolutely amazing!
a must see. The Spring Spectacular is truly amazing and wonderful for all ages. The front half of the orchestra seats get cast involvement in the aisles. A wonderful 90 minutes of NYC fun.

New York spring spectacular...exactly that. Got our tickets from tkts booth in Times Square on the day of show. Went on sale at 10am for 2pm show. $50 for main floor...seats right at the edge but were ok for the price. Brilliant show, special effects and 3d part was great...rockettes were amazing! Not a foot wrong or out of time in the whole show. Def a worthwhile show for a visit to new york showing you exactly what is the heart and soul of the city...some of the ppl mentioned I wasn't sure of but it was great anyway!

A great entertainment center in need of renovation. Each time I go to the Radio City Music Hall, I am impressed by the decorum that seems however too pompous for our time. It might need to be renovated and adapted to today's scenery needs.
Spring Spectacular. We saw the Rockettes with Derek Houff in the show. As always the Rockettes were fabulous and entertaining. Definitely recommend a visit to Radio City Music Hall.
Spring spectacular amazing.. It was a great show. You can get discount same day tixs in Times Square so go looking. The show is worth paying full price for.
Tour and Rockettes. We took the tour and saw the Spring Spectacular show. Both were well worth the time and money. What a fantastic space.

Spring Spectacular. This show with the Rockettes & Derek Hough was truly spectacular! We liked it better than the Christmas Show. I think Gene Kelly has been reincarnated in Derek Hough. He is just amazing! The theme of the show is a tribute to NYC and it does a wonderful job, especially if it's your first visit to New York!!

Radio city. Rockettes, not impressed!
Felt like I should be 3 and not an adult.
Extremely disappointed!
Felt it was very expensive for what we saw.
The show had many strange things in the show which we had not been expecting.

Great performance. Went to see the Spring Extravaganza, nice show, the Rockets are really impressive, they are giving a show where dance is timed like a clock.
Music was great, the artists are all excellent. The special effects really make you feel like you are on Broadway.
Amazing, worth seeing, even from the 2nd balcony.
a new york institution!. Not to be missed! The rockettes are amazing and the building is impressive. It's just a huge WOW factor in New York City!

The Greatest Showplace..and Performers...in the World!. Radio City Music Hall is one of the greatest American treasures. I truly believe that every American citizen should visit this venue at least once in their life to experience the thrills that so many millions of people have enjoyed during this theater's rich history. Even if no show is scheduled, a tour of the facility showcases grand architecture and opulence that will likely never be created again. There is simply no place like it anywhere on earth.

The tour and the show were both amazing. We did the stage door tour in the morning and just had to go back for the evening Spring Spectacular show. The building was breathtaking and the show was spectacular!

Spring Spectacular. We spent part of our Easter Sunday at Radio City Music Hall seeing the new Spring Spectacular. It was a wonderful show, great music, great dancing , nice scenery and of course the fabulous Rockettes ! It takes you on a great tour of New York City. Highly recommended for all ages.

Always an amazing time. I have been to Radio City Music hall to see the Rockettes 4 times now. This time it was for their Spring Spectacular show and it is correctly named - it was spectacular! The Rockettes were amazing, Derek Hough was incredible, and all the digital effects and props make it seem like a real tour through NYC. I especially loved the "Singing in the Rain" tap dance scene. I wish the show had been 10 hours! The only complaint I have is that it was too short :).

A great venue. The hall is a tradition, a fantastic operation, easy to get to, and although large has great seats throughout the theater. The downside is bathrooms are downstairs, so give yourself some time, especially if it is a family show and you have kids with you.
Spring Spectacular . Super better then the Christmas Music was fabulous Rockettes are the best and Great storyline would love to see it again

Great show always. Went here today for their Spring Spectacular show with Derek Hough. All I can say is don't miss it. The acoustics are great in this historic hall and you can see from any seat. Where you sit depends on how close you want to be to the stage. We were in the orchestra stage left in the 29th row. We had no problem seeing the entire stage. The Rockettes performed flawlessly as always and we just loved watching them. The staging, costume changes and entertainment were more than one can expect from any Broadway show. If you are in New York and there is a show here make it a must do.
Rocket Spring Show. Rocket Spring Show is incredible. Cool special effects, entertaining story, and of course spectacular dancing.
Amazing Attraction. Last weekend we saw the new Spring Spectacular show. Th theatre is truly beautiful and the Rockette's show was phenomenal! Something that every visitor to NYC should experience.

Great show for the money, with a very large cast of actors. Great show, never a dull second. You can see, that the folks care about everyone viewing the show, they even added the Easter Bunny for the kids, well maybe for the adults also, by the great reactions. They even had dogs, they had something for everyone. The best way to tell if a show is great or not, by the amount of folks who get up for bathroom runs. I only saw 2 for the entire show and they were back fast. If you can afford it, put it on the the list to do. If you are a Delta Flyer, Delta has what they call a Sky Club on the 2nd floor, nothing more then a counter that serves drinks and a few small tables.
Nostalgia from a New York Icon. This is a beautiful building Day or Night. Such an iconic building and well worth a visit. At night it lights up and great for photographic opprtunities
Excellent Show. From the theme to the special effects to the talent - great show, very entertaining, well done! You could tell that everyone in the cast was giving 100% +

Love the Rockettes!. Great, entertaining show which includes more than just the Rockettes. My husband and I both loved it! We thought it could have been a bit longer and we certainly did not need to see the Easter bunny in the show, very out of place. You don't always need to include Christmas and/or Easter in these shows!!The theatre is beautiful but huge, 6000 seats!!! So much going on besides the show....food and drink for sale, souvenirs, photos with a Rockette, etc. A note to all, especially the women visiting...use the restroom at the restaurant you are coming from. The line for the restrooms both upstairs and downstairs was mind boggling. As the clock ticked closer to show time I got brave and got out of line and walked straight into the men's room!!

Spring Spectacular is Spectacular!. From the moment we walked in we had excellent service, the place was beautiful, and the show fantastic! Great story line, dancing is a thing of beauty to watch. My teen daughter and I went to see the show. She completely enjoyed her experience, and I did too! Do not miss this show!

Spring spectacular sums up New York. Absolutely the best in Broadway. The building is magnificent not a big crush, and the spring spectacular is absolutely the best thing Ive seen on stage in this genre. Great singing dancing but the sets are out of this world. Plenty to see before the show and a great atmosphere all round. Go for the ground floor seats if possible

New York Celebration. The Spring show is a Celebration of the sights and sounds of the City of New York. We picked up 2 center seats just 7 rows back an hour before the 2 pm matinee. Use your Chase VISA card for best seats and discounts on swag. The songs and dancing are great. I had no idea who Derek Hough was but the young screaming girls in the back of the house did. My husband grew up in Brooklyn, but had never seen the Rockettes. When they line up 36 across and start kicking, you will smile. Go see it.

A must see..New York Spring Spectacular. Had the opportunity to catch the Spring Spectacular @Radio City ..The show features Derek Hough ( DWTS.. Fame)and Laura Benanti, who MC the show as it travels through New York City's landmarks...well ,the most touristy ones..there's bits of trivia for each scene..a "did you know"... With great props..lots of song and dance..and of course the Rockettes( who've been kicking their heels for 80 years!...even I was surprised).. Who are just exhilarating to watch..the show runs till May.....its a terrific show for the family..no spoilers here...and now that the weather is warmer...make it a day!!

Rocketts Rock. we saw the spring spectacular and thoroughly enjoyed the great sets and wonderful dancing. The Rocketts were amazing, and all those leggy beauties moving rhythmically in unison was worth the price of admission. I would definitely recommend.

do it once and be done. I thought the Rockettes would dazzle. Occasionally they did, but technical problems disappointed.It is obvious that they made the Christmas show for children. I wish I had known that. I didn't care to see half the show without a Rockette in site, but lots of Santa and the cre'che. There are so many more wonderful things to do with time in NYC, if you're fourteen years old or older.
A must see when in NYC. I loved visiting Radio City Music Hall. Saw the Rockettes Spring show and it was awesome. This place is a true piece of Americana and a must see when in NYC.

Great fun. I have to say I must live under a rock because I had no idea who Derek was. We thoroughly enjoyed the New York City Spectacular. Our only disappointment was it seemed too short-all of 70 minutes with no intermission. Well worth attending though, Rockettes were great and so was the handsome Derek.
Beautiful venue!. Take the tour! Lots to see and interesting stories! Get to see a lot of places most people don't get the opportunity to see.

The Rockettes Rocked Radio City!. The premiere of the Spring Spectacular was nothing short of jaw-dropping! The choreography, sets, use of technology,and interjections of famous NY faces made every moment memorable. Thanks to Derek Hough and everyone who made this an event to remember!!

Really beautiful. We were able to tour RCMH during the school trip. The place is really neat. The architecture is beautiful. The art deco decor takes you back in time and you can just imagine all the performers that have been through there. You can see many of them on the impressive collection of photos and memorabilia housed inside the halls and gracing the walls throughout the tour. They showed us the hydraulic stage system that was so advanced for its time. You should experience this place if you can because it's a piece of history and you never know how long it will be around. The tour guides were very friendly and knowledgable. We had a photo op with one of the gorgeous Rockettes. Unforgettable place.

Spring Spectacular - Perfect 1st Night in NYC!. We landed in NYC on 3/28 and got to our Hotel around 3 - We went into Times Square to the TKTS ticket booth and were able to get a fabulous deal on tickets to the Show! We had brought our 11 year old son and traveling with Friends and their 10 year old son for Spring Break. We were shocked at how awesome this show was for ALL ages and genders!! Seriously, we all LOVED it!!! The boys we sitting up leaned forward in their seats the entire time! It told a great story of a older man trying to keep his position as a NYC tour guide and he "took" us on a tour of the City! That made it the perfect 1st night and show for our boys being their first trip to New York! It showed them what all to look forward to seeing in the coming days! I could not be more pleased that we went to this show and I highly recommend it to all :) Be sure to download the TKTS app to your phone and check THE DAY OF the show to see if it on sale - It updates throughout the day. This is great to do for all Shows. There are 3 locations in NYC - Times Square, Downtown Brooklyn, & South Street Seaport

Radio City Spectacular. I am a big, big fan of Derek from Dancing with the Stars and equally of the Rockettes. Wow that was a great show from the minute the curtains went up the excitement of the audience was electric. When entering the theater we were presented with 3-D glasses and a bracelet. We were told this was for audience participation. The glasses were used very quickly and it was surprisingly effective. Also the bracelets played an enjoyable part. I don't want to spoil it for the lucky people who will attend. The dancing was spirited and absolutely in sinc. The costumes were colorful and sparkling at times. The sound was clear and the story was original. Derek and the female lead did not disappoint. It was a show for all ages who want to be entertained and leave happy and lighthearted. You should go!!!

A New York Establishment. You simply must go. Especially during the winter season to go see the Rockettes. It was my favorite place to be as a child, and I must admit, it's still a Christmas tradition I treasure.

Spectacular and razzle dazzle. Critics gave mixed reviews but we didn't. I would say if 10 was perfect I would give it a solid 8, If you are coming to see Derek Hough, he really isn't dancing that much. He Is in every scene and SINGS but dances in maybe about 5. The story is very good for tourists and family friendly with chicks, bunnies and real dogs on stage and child actors. Music is toe tapping and colors are bright. The Rockettes as often as I have seen them, are something Ii never get tired of and their pitch perfect leg kicks give me goose bumps. If I have any criticism at all, I think they should have included the fireman and police men at some point in the background. It was fun seeing Derek live and I wish he had danced more

NYC Must See. I can't imagine being in Manhatten and passing up an opportunity to see the Rocketts and the Gorgeous theater reminiscent of grand theaters of the past. The Christmas show is PHENOMINAL! Not a negative to be found .
Spring Spectacular is just that. The Spring Spectacular is a must see! Clever & entertaining, Derek Hough is amazing as well as the fantastic Rockettes

big hall. Thoroughly enjoyed my tour of Radio City music hall.The hall hold's 6,200 people when full and terrific views from all seats in the hall.It has hosted many of the biggest artist's in the business,e.g. Frank Sinatra,Stevie Wonder,Sting the list is endless.Would recommend this tour to anyone especially if you have the New York city pass

What would NY be without Radio City. No visit to NY is complete without a visit to Radio City and we took in the Spring spectacular show. The dancing was slick, professional and a joy to watch. The theme of the show, Spring fashion collections, was appealing to all ages and great fun. For a light hearted night out Radio City takes some beating.

march 29th 2015..... 7:30 pm show. traveled over 1500 miles to be there....was more real then i had expected....more fun and memorable then i had expected....and well worth the time and $$....i have dreamed of seeing the Rockettes for 72 yrs......one less thing on the bucket list...

Behind-the-Scenes Tour. Our group of high school choir students took the 75-minute behind-the-scenes tour. Our tour guide was excellent (wish I could recall her name). She shared a continuous stream of information about this iconic performance venue. We started in the huge central hall, went down into the lower level lobby, sat in the upper balcony, visited the larger Rockette rehearsal hall, watched an 8-minute video, took photos with and asked questions of an actual Rockette. Our tour guide told us that groups are not ever really allowed to go on the stage. My 17-year old said this tour was the highlight of the entire weekend in NYC. Since the tickets were provided, not sure what the cost was. Excited to hear about the new Spring Spectacular show and wish we could have seen it.

Spring Review was the bomb!!. Was sooo very good, I was pleasantly surprised. Rockettes rocked too...very New York themed taking you around the city. Effect were very 21st century. Concept story was good, music and the live band made it a very meaty experience
Spring Spectacular. SPECTACULAR!!! Where else would you wish to see the Rockettes dancing to New York, New York! Dancing in the Rain danced/tapped in the rain. Pretty incredible.

Breathtaking and "Spectacular". You can't go to New York City without seeing Radio City Music Hall. It's amazing to think that at one time in the late 70's they almost had it torn down. This space is breathtaking--the size, the design, the accoustics. We went to see the new show "A Spring Spectacular". While I was dubious of the name, it was nothing short of SPECTACULAR! The sets, the staging, the music, the performers, the orchestra and then of course the Rockettes!! I never would have thought I would enjoy a show with the Rockettes, but this was fun all the way. And all the new technology they've added to this theatre is amazing.

Art deco great tour guide. I loved this, step back in time to they old Music halls of the 30's and 40's, lots of old and new stars appeared here, gut tickets for this tour, well worth the bucks. we were fortunate to watch rehearsals of America's got talent

MINI NYC TOUR. The Spring Spectacular Show at Radio City Music Hall is just that... spectacular! Derek Hough is sensational in this mini-tour of NYC. The balcony is perfect for watching the Rockettes in their perfect formations. Very enjoyable show and the theater is a must-see venue!

The New York Spring Spectacular is truly SPECTACULAR. We are New Yorkers... LOVED this new and innovate show starring Laura Benanti, Derek Hough and the world famous Rockettes. A sweet story line around which to hand virtual visits to NY landmarks like Grand Central, Metropolitan Museum, Broadway, etc. Incredible technology that makes you feel like the sets are truly real. Excellent dancing. Fun songs. Lots of treats for both kids and clever for adults. Highly recommend. All we know who have been have loved it. Make it a visit whether you are a tourist or local. And enjoy every minute in this iconic and one of a kind place.

Radio City Spring Spectacular - simply SPECTACULAR. The new Spring Spectacular show at Radio City is amazing. It captures the heart and vibrancy of a day in NYC. The Rockettes are simply amazing, you just feel like dancing.Radio City itself is such a beautiful venue and is worth a visit. Enjoy

Christmas Spectacular. Wow Wow Wow..............We were travelling to New York from Australia for the Christmas Period and the one thing i really wanted to do was go and see the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular. It was worth every cent. From the photo's with a rockette, the costumes, the music and the "soldiers" i was captivated from start to finish. A dream come true.

Rockettes, Hough, Benanti Rock a Radio City. The Spring Spectacular was great! Full of fun surprises. Great routines. History of NY landmarks told in endearing ways. Rockettes dressed and performing in NY teams uniforms was creative and fun to watch. Benanti's sense of humor and delivery was spot on. Hough's performance was solid, and face it, he's easy on the eyes. Loved the mix of music. Songs from 40's through present, classics & hip hop. Great entertainment for all age groups. Great show-loved it!

New Spring Spectacular is a MUST SEE. Loved it! Very short duration - end of March and into May2015. Story line and seeing Rockettes plus the wonderful lighting effects with wrist bands that Chase supplied makes you never stop smiling & clapping. Truly a spectacular show. (staff were NOT friendly - it was rush - holler - rush) Restrooms-a nightmare of a line for the women's which is a throw back to the 1950's.

When in New York visit Radio City. My wife and I saw the Rockettes there in March 2015. This place is awesome and the show was fantastic. Very clean venue and beautiful inside. Customer service was excellent. Highly recommend.

New York Spring Spectacular. The Rockettes were perfect, arrived on opening night so plenty of 'red carpet' atmosphere. We loved the show and the dancing was superb and faultless. My partner is a dancer and she was in awe, truly a great night and one of the highlights of our stay in New York. If you get the chance to see one of these spectacular shows you will not be disappointed!!!!!
Spring Spectacular. Watched Spring Spectacular on March 2015.Amazing show with lots of dancing and beautiful music.Must see show.Seeing Rockettes live was once in a lifetime experience.

New York Spring Spectacular Rocks!. This was a wonderful evening of entertainment! Seriously, is there anything Derek Hough can't do? I loved the music, the dancing, the humor and of course the Rockettes! I've always wanted to see Radio City Music Hall and it surpassed my expectations. Thank you, New York! The memories of this unforgettable evening will be with me forever!

A treat for the Spring. Getting ready for DWTS this season, we wanted to see this show. We brought another couple with us for the Saturday matinée. Section 5, Row TT were excellent tickets. Love the Rockettees, the Band and the production. Well worth the trip and cost of tickets.

Spring Spectacular!. So much fun! I have to admit, this was my first time to Radio City Music Hall and seeing the Rockettes, so maybe I was awestruck, but I thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience, like a kid in a candy store. An absolute must, if you've never been. Careful on the beverages, as the line to the ladies was a mile long.

Absolute Must See .... I visited in Dec-'14 on a solo visit (Christmas Spectacular).There is no doubt this is a "must-see" while you are in New York. Age no-bar. I saw elderly ladies and little kids having a whale of a time. Book in advance. Note that there are 'flyers' being handed out across Times-Square with coupon codes for discounts. Don't pay full amount if you can avoid.

Fantastic Show!!!. This is a must see show. It was absolutely fantastic. I have only seen the Rockettes on the Macy Parade on TV but seeing them live was amazing. The storyline is just a little bit cheesy but still enjoyable. There are acrobatics, puppeteers, and even many well behaved dogs!All the actors are equally good at singing, acting and of course dancing. I wish I could go back to see it again but sadly I have to go back home.

A wonderful venue with many wonderful shows.. If you've never been here, go for a show. If you have, go for a tour. Lots of history, interesting behind-the -scenes information you don't get from a show. And everyone should see the Rockettes one time in their life.
Fun experience. Radio City Music Hall is a huge venue, but is very easy to navigate. Staff/ ticket takers do an excellent job. We always have a good view, no matter where our seats are located.

Spring Spectacular as good as the Christmas Spectacular. After worrying that our tickets wouldn't be at "Will Call" (we bought them from an outside provider which I would NEVER recommend to anyone), we breathed a sign of relief when the tickets were actually there. We took our out of town friends to see this show - and we all loved it. Amazing music, dancing, choreography, singing...it had a little bit of everything, and each scene was short enough to keep the kids interested the entire show. The interactive nature of the show beats the Christmas Spectacular by just a wee bit, but the Nativity scene in the Christmas show is so beautiful...I can't really decide which one is better. See them both if you can! Loved the visual tour of NYC, especially for those who have limited time on their trip - our guests felt that they had "visited" some of the attractions that we didn't have time to take them to. 4 stars because the women's bathroom situation is really something that needs to be rectified. There is a huge sitting room outside of the actual washrooms that should undergo a renovation for more toilets.

Spring Spectacular . My sister and I took our 8 year old niece for her birthday. If you love dancing, singing and New York, this is the show for you. We had a great time. Who knew Derek Hough could sing and Lauren Benanti could dance?? The addition of the animated talking landmarks was wonderful! Whether you live here or are a visitor, it's a must see!

Stunning. I saw Sarah Brightman there (my favourite singer) and it was an experience out of this world, when the lights were coming down, it was like a sunset. The feel and beauty of the place is unbelievable. I went with family and friends and it was stunning! I recommend seeing a show or concert there for sure! I hope you all feel like I did.

"Spectacular" It Was!!!. My wife and I saw the Spring Spectacular show that was just introduced this month for the first time. The entire production was fantastic from the Rockettes, the orchestra, the visuals, and all the actors / dancers. Kudos to Derrick Hough. He was amazing throughout. His dancing of course was not a surprise but his singing was quite impressive.

Music hall tour. We did a tour, not a show. The tour was excellent because we got to see a lot of things that the public at a show would not see. We also learned the history and some interesting details of the performers and building. Highly recommend the tour.
A Legend. This theater is simply awesome and should not be missed. See the Christmas Spectacular once before you did.
Spring Spectacular Was Spectacular. Lots of energy, beautiful costumes and specia effects! Love Derek Hough :) Rockets were fabulous as always. Singing and dancing were top notch.

Fantastic evening at the Christmas extravaganza. So not only do you get to visit the famous Radio City music hall but the show will just blow you away. For all of the Christmas humbugs like myself, this was definitely the show to inject a dose of Christmas spirit. Excellent venue and show.
Take the stage door tour. and you will travel through time. What an astonishing building it is. The Art Deco ! The History ! Their tour is really entertaining and informative, too.

Radio City Music Hall Tour. We did the Radio City Tour mainly because it was included in the New York Pass but I'm glad we did as for me it was one of the highlights of our first trip to NYC. It was wonderful to see behind the scenes of this iconic venue and our tour guide was so knowledgeable. Highly recommend the tour and I hope that we'll manage to see a show here next time we're in town.
Rockets Christmas Spectacular. We went here for the Rockets Christmas Spectacular show and absolutely loved it! Would definitely recommend it and will be returning next time I am in NYC for XMAS.
Romance and History. The history and romance of this building always draws my attention. Its like walking into a period in time that I hope never changes.

Radio City Music Hall Spring Spectacular. We were sitting orchestra left in Row SS. In the row behind us were very loud guests. Nothing was done to quiet them. I spoke to an usher after the show and was advised all guests are welcome to the shows, even those that ruin the show for others. I spoke to a supervisor at the venue and was advised to contact Customer Service. I contacted Customer Service and they advised that they would provide our input to upper management. We were also offered the option to call to obtain a discount code for the Christmas Spectacular. I am wondering why I would want to attend another show even at a discount?

A must see in NYC. The Spring Spectacular is just that. WOW! What a show. The tour is a lot of fun esp meeting a Rockette. I cannot fathom that the city at one time was considering demolishing this masterpiece of architecture. Thank God it was saved.

Rockette NY Spring Spectacular - Truly was spectacular. The show was great... a little 3-D show, lots of fabulous costumes and dance acts.... loved every part of the show. Lots of highlight moments with guest taped appearances... and even a bit of audience participation. Light humor and lots of fun. 11 people were with us and all said "thumbs up"
Outstanding Concert Hall. It is a beautiful and wonderful place to see a show. The place is huge and a one-of-the-kind experience. Highly recommended.

Spring spectacular..... My niece and I saw the Christmas show together, where we first saw this show advertised. Got the tickets on the 1 mezzanine, perfect view. We sat on the lower level for Christmas but preferred the seats here better. The show was awesome, great music, good story line and the lead actress n actor were awesome. My favorite was Singing in the rain. We can't decide which show we enjoyed more Christmas or Spring! I would highly recommend seeing it.

From the outside.....inside a tardis. What a most beautiful interior and its huge, the tour is 100% a must, great guide and although it's up and down stairs you can use the lift if dodgy on legs it's great.To see all the past and present stars that have visited and we were lucky enough to see a rehearsal in progress.

Spring Spectacular. Bought tixs for my mom and me, not expecting much since these are not my type of shows. Well, I was blown away! The show was top notch, high energy, thoroughly entertaining and engaging. The new props and clever choreography were show stoppers as were the two leads. I highly recommend this show!
Amazing!. Finally been able to have a glance at that famous place which we heard about so many times. I've been there finally!

Terrific place from the past!. Gigantic venue, offers many shows throughout the year including the famous Rockettes, also if you can get tickets they film America's Got Talent here as well. Check it out.

Fantastic Christmas show. We visited RadioCity during Christmas 2014. It was the Rockettes who were performing and it was spectacular! Love the whole show and definitely worth the money we paid even though it's quite pricey!

Christmas Spirit for everyine. I took my grown kids to the Christmas Spectacular show to see the Rockettes!! I knew my daughter would love it but was amazed how much my son and son-in-law loved the show. The costume changes were amazing. The dancers incredible!!! Very, very festive and entertaining. The theater was very impressive. Pay for good seats, up close, no closer than row 4.

Rockettes On Christmas, Put It On Your Bucket List!. Much more than high kicking dance lines, a true extravaganza! Great music, fabulous light show, a Christmas storyline and live Camels on stage! A must see once in your lifetime event. A great treat for old and young alike!

Stunning building and great show. Bought my husband tickets for the New York Spring Spectacular for Christmas and we went to go and see the show last week.The building is stunning, with great views and good acoustic.However found it a bit annoying that no cloakroom was available and we had to stuff our coats underneath the seats during the show (but this is really just a minor thing, not enough to take points off).If you get the chance, get tickets and see a show there. You won't regret it.
Great place to see!. See Radio City at least once in your lifetime. There is so much history! The tour is great and you learn a Great deal. We went to see the Rockettes and they were great as well!

NY Spring Spectacular. What a fun 90 minutes - high energy entertainment - a talented cast, and the Rockettes - a fun romp through NYC with clever technology to enhance the show. Lots of warm-hearted moments. 6000 people seemed very entertained. And of course, Radio City Music Hall is a spectacular place.

Maybe worth a visit. We watched the Christmas show, which is supposed to be a great attraction in the town. The organisation was ok, but we had to wait in a queue that started two blocks away from the entrance.If you have lot of time then it would be worth a visit.

Beautiful building. The Spring Spectacular was a lively and entertaining show. If you like dancing, singing, and an assortment of fancy electronics, go see this show. It is an overview of all of NYC and for someone who no longer lives there, it was fun to have a reminder of all there is to do in the city that never sleeps. They didn't miss a detail of each event: (i.e. when they mentioned the Knicks, they had staff shoot tee shirts with the cannons into the audience, and during the baseball segment, staff went up and down the aisles throwing boxes of popcorn to people who put up their hands). The Rockettes, Laura Benanti and Derek Hough were all wonderful. My complaints: not near enough bathrooms. I do not know if there is anything that can be done, but the line was as long as I have ever seen. And I travel frequently and attend many shows. The yelling staff: they gave us bracelets to wear, and rather than make return boxes visible and plentiful (they were there, but hard to find), they had staff standing and screaming about returning them. One man was almost insulting, as he yelled at the top of his lungs the whole ten minutes it took us to pass him, almost accusing everyone of stealing these things. They could have solved the problem by telling everyone when they handed us the bracelets.

Got $200?. It had a buss and the old hall certainly had a high kick to its grand style even when standing outside on a winter’s night. Through its glass doors it looked grand and deco. If I only pass-go and collected $200 dollars I would have had enough money to buy a ticket to heaven instead of a high kick of cold wind that blew on my rear.

Train. We went to see the band Train on our 21st wedding anniversary and to see them live on such a special occasion was awesome.The sound in such an old building is quite amazing so clear even when you sit right at the back! A real treat.

Amazing Spring Spectacular. A fantastic show that will leave you smiling at the end. It's great for all ages. The technology is fun, the Rockettes are amazing as usual and the song and dance is wonderful.
Rockettes do NOT disappoint. New York Spring Spectacular with Derek Hough and the Rockettes was entertaining and engaging. Highly recommend for the entire family.
Just magnificent. This is an amazing theatre and any show there is a good one but take a tour to fully appreciate this architectural marvel.

Different expectations Spring Spectacular. Purchased tickets to this show thinking that there would be more dancing activity and more Rockettes involvement. Unfortunately my expectations were wrong. While the Rockettes are superb, the show itself is very tilted for tourists. There were some aspects which were fun and enjoyable, like the 3D short film and the rockettes in action, but the rest was average.

A Must See. What visit to NYC would be complete without a trip to Radio City Music Hall to see the Rockettes? I was able to go and see a new show "New York Spring Spectacular" with Derek Hough, Laura Benanti and the Rockettes. Fantastic show in a fantastic venue! I can't wait to go back!
Fantastic Rockettes Spring Spectacular!. Loved the atmosphere and the special effects and of course The Rockettes! It was a well designed and entertaining show; I would highly recommend!

Spring Spectacular wasn't. This is a NYC self-celebration gone wrong. Older patrons like me expect live music and dancing, not high-decibel house music piped in to accompany videos of Donald Trump and NYC professional athletes. The Christmas Spectacular was spectacular but the Spring version is a dismal encore. The talents of the actual performers are really wasted.

Spring in my step show . What a wonderful show for tourists and New Yorkers alike . Scenery, dancing , actors , use of technology , and the beloved rockettes at their best gives this event an easy A plus from beginning to end .. Singing to the end ..

Spring Spectacular was Spectacular. The evening prior we saw a Broadway and the show at Radio city blew them away. The seats are more comfortable, there is more legroom, and the venue is spectacular. The stage is easily two to three times the size of Broadway theaters and the show was great.The Spring Spectacular was high energy and simply fabulous. We would love to return to see the next show.

Spring Spectactular. This was the first time we saw a show like this. I was so impressed with everything. The show was outstanding. We are going to come for the Christmas Spectactular, something I have always wanted to do.
Radio City Music Hall. Ideal place to visit if weather inclement or not. Guides full of enthusiasm and knowledge and gossip about the place. Tour delivered with information and good humour..

Rockettes are great, Derek is great, show is great. This is a wonderful, entertaining and fun show for the whole family. The rocket yes just don't disappoint, and the show is a wonderful tour of the apple. Especially if you are with young kids,this is the show for you. Great special effects, audience interaction and music. My grandkids lived it, and they are hard to please. There was no downtime in this show. A real NYC tribute and glimpse of how shows use to be. Derek is great!

Tourist trap!. I must be the minority here... I found product placements in every scene... even the pre-show where most theatres remind audience to switch of their phones, here at radio city audience was only told not to take pictures with flash. Then the announcement followed by a series of ads lasted 2 minutes. The whole show we have audiences snapping pictures and talking... completely ruined my theatre-going experience. As for the show itself... it definitely suffered from an identity crisis. The show went from 3D to puppetry to a game show then back to a fashion show... everytime the dogs ran across the stage I rolled my eyes. The most consistent act is the Rockettes! This is not my cup of tea... Lion King has awesome stage production too, but the narration is consistent. To me, substance is more important than the fluff... Parents, take your kids to the Lion King, Matilda or Finding Neverland so they'll appreciate true arts. Adults, there is no excuse not to experience real theatres since they are only a block away. Unless you are one of those who like to take pictures and have other phones flashing in your eyes.

walking tour of the theatre was great!. We had a great time looking through the time capsule that is RCMH. So well preserved and maintained it is as if you just step back in time when you walk through the doors. I only wish we had had a chance to see a show to top off the experience.

The Christmas Spectacular that really is.. The show at Radio City during the Christmas holidays is referred to as the Holiday spectacular. " Spectacular" is the perfect word for it and every child should be able to experience it if at all possible.
Spring Spectacular. Fantastic show at a wonderful venue, very grand setting and more space in seating than at a regular theatre.

A show not to be missed!!. This show was excellent. It is different than the Christmas show but still wonderful with the special effects and Derek Hough. If you don't love Derek Hough before the show, you certainly will after it. This is great for children and adults. The rain scene and the talking scenery were awesome. The theatre is absolutely beautiful and well restored.

Spring Spectacular was AWESOME!!!. If you are looking for the best show in NYC, this is it!!!!!! Everything was amazing. Great storyline, fabulous choreography, amazing set and special effects, and spectacular music! Best show ever!

Great Show - Don't Miss It. My wife wanted to see the Spring Spectacular show with Derek Hough and I grudgingly went along. What a surprise! This is a great show; you don't want to miss it. Outstanding visuals, especially the robotic Library Lions. Good story line, cameo video appearances by a number of NY greats, very entertaining. And well worth the price, which was less than most Broadway plays. Catch it before its run ends.

Radio City Spring Spectacular. There is no feeling that matches the one when the Rockettes take the stage and this show was no different. The Rockettes were beyond a doubt the STARS of this show, with second billing go to the Radio City Orchestra who provided an exciting foundation to every moment of the show.Everyone else was there in a supporting role, providing a storyline to connect the Rockettes dance numbers and dance the did. The Rockettes were featured in several wonderful dance routines that allowed them to showcase a wonderfully talented dance troupe. When that kick line formed and charged the audience the excitement was palpable.The story line was derivative, culled from multiple sources, bit served well enough to knit together an enjoyable afternoon of entertainment. The cameos were a bit gimmicky and amounted to more or less name dropping.The show has a ways to go before it matches the Christmas show for "Spectacularity", but was an enjoyable event.If you are in the City, have the time and the price is right, by all means go and enjoy the Rockettes!

Spring Spectacular. This is the first Spring Spectacular and it was definitely SPECTACULAR! Derek Hough was magnificent. It is different than the Christmas Spectacular with more skits but still plenty of singing and dancing. Live animals in the show as well. And the Rockettes ... as usual were perfection. Definitely worth seeing. I highly reommend it.
Radio city music hall. This was the most wonderful and memorable night apart from the show which was amazing.The theatre is art deco and a joy to behold inside.

Great Show!!. This fabulous show should not be missed! REALLY entertaining with GREAT choreography and special effects. I hope I can get back to NYC to see it again before the show ends in early May. Don't miss it if you're in NYC!
Spring spectacular. Enjoyed the Spring Spectacular show. Fabulous singing and dancing. Beautiful tribute to New York! Amazing set decoration. Great for all ages.

Spring Spectacular was just that ... Spectacular. We went to NY to see Derek Hough starring in the Radio City Music Hall Spring Spectacular and the trip was well worth it. The show was excellent! I loved the audience interaction (I won't mention what it was so as not to spoil it) and the singing and dancing did not disappoint. I've been to RC shows before and this one was just as spectacular. I highly recommend it.

Worth a visit. I loved this tour. Was really interesting hearing about the history of the building and the history of Rockettes. Our tour guide was brilliant and knew a lot of information and could answer any questions that the group had. The one thing that let it down was that we never actually got to go inside the auditorium. They were rehearsing for the New York Spring Spectacular, so we were only allowed to look inside the auditorium from the spotlight box at the top of the theatre.However I would recommend to anyone visiting NY to do the tour

Kickin' rockettes. Had the opportunity to see the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall in early December. What a fantastic show. Very iconic and should be a must-see for every American. Fantastic!
Kick up the fun!. Don't miss the Rockettes' spring spectacular. It is worth every penny! Tip:Take the brochure from the people in Times Square for half price tickets. Great family fun!

MUST SEE AT CHRISTMAS. Briliant throughlly enjoyed it the Rockettes were amazing and the 3D effect was so imagnative and worth while Favourite moment: feeling like you were on Santa's sleigh going over the roof tops of New York City
Rockettes!. Not much to say except wow! Most impressive! Saw the opening night of the new Spring Spectacular-and loved it!

Really interesting and well worth it. Had a great tour of Radio City and unlike other tourist attractions this is really well put together and you are made to feel like an individual not cattle. Really interesting info and a very good and knowledgable guide (Kyle I think his name was!). Well worth a visit.

Family and tourist friendly. Radio City is a New York City icon.the spring show is fun for all ages. The Rockettes are worth seeing if you have never had the pleasure. Having said that, this is a cruise show on a bigger scale. If you enjoy cruise ship entertainment this is for you. The show is ninety minutes, no intermission, and tickets are a bit expensive. The theatre is huge and the better the seat the happier you will probably be.

The Christmas Spectacular is a MUST SEE!. Wow!!! From the moment you enter, you're surrounded by plush elegance! Gorgeous theater, very comfy seats (little leg room of course) and an absolutely amazing show! Even my husband was super impressed with the Rockettes! :) And it kept the attention of all four kids ages 9-15

Christmas Spectacular. I was born and raised in Brooklyn and have known about radio city as long as i can remember. But i never went, I was just another jaded new yorker. I now have children of my own and wanted to do something special with them for the holiday season. I really never was crazy about going to see the rockettes or the spectacular because, i thought, ok ive seen tons of santas, and ive seen people dance on stage before... ehhh. Well, i was wrong. This show is every bit and more everything good youve ever heard about it. I was very impressed with the rockettes and their precision and they have some pretty long dance sets, and alot of them. The show was great, the story line was great. I think i may have enjoyed myself more than my children. I would definitely suggest everyone, especially native new yorkers to go see it. We forget all the beauty around us, when your surrounded by it all the time.
step back in time. what a beautifull building art deco we had a most informative tour.lovely theatre it seats 6,000 people,tickets to be purchased from the sweet shop next door.

RADIO CITY SPRING SPECTACULAR. Saw the show on day 3 of it's premier opening. EXCELLENT show - highly recommended!! I've been to the Christmas show and enjoyed that, but this blows that show away! Great information about NYC - a lot of fun, excellent dancing and singing, amazing special effects!! We sat 6 rows from the stage, aisle seats and were in AWE. I would recommend maybe a little further back and more towards the center for best viewing of the effects, but it was fine... Some out-of-towners might not understand who some of the famous cameos are and some of the jokes might be lost because of that, but still a fantastic show...not to be missed!!!

WOW, the tour was AMAZING. Used our New York Pass for gaining entrance to this place. The tour took approx 75 minutes and certainly a must do. The tour guide was very informative and querky too. When we went to the observation area to look down at the stage it took my breath away. They were rehearsing for the Spring Spectacular show so was difficult to take photos but when they were off stage had the opportunity to do so.
