The stage is the biggest and most technical stage in the world. We also had the opportunity to speak to a Rockette and also have a photo taken with her. Generally photos are $25 although they do more for special offers. Definitely a MUST do during your vacation to the Big Apple!
Spectacular !!. Watched the Christmas Spectacular Show. The rockettes were truly brilliant. Its a must see performance
Spring Spectacular. The Show was great. Staging, costumes, Rockettes,everything.Would have liked it if Derek Hough would dance a little more but other than that I would say.. worth seeing.

Enjoyed the Tour. My wife and my daughter went on a Radio City Music Hall Tour and enjoyed it. They wanted to take in some places to see in NYC and they picked the Radio City Music Hall Tour. They were impressed what the ladies do to get ready for the show. They even got a picture with one of the Rockettes. They would recommend the tour.
Spring Spectacular. Fabulous show! Derek Hough & Laura Benanti were spectacular! Rockette's put on a great show, as always!

Spring Spectacular is a Fabulous show. Saw this fabulous show today with a group of friends. It was fantastic! the Rockettes were amazing as always, and the choreography was a little edgier than I've seen in the past. Great special effects and movie shorts enhanced the show. A must see!

Radio Days. We took the tour using the City Pass and found it fascinating.The tour takes in the building from bottom to top, including the various beautifully decorated lounges.As the auditorium was being used for rehearsals for the Spring Spectacular we were unable to enter but were given a 'birds eye view' from next to the projection room.The tour includes a short film and a photo opportunity and discussion with a Rockette.
Amazing. First photo I snapoed was the outside of this place.Features in sooooo many movies!It's a stunning building and there's always something interesting going on.Worth a visit.
Any rockett type show is the best. Christmas spectacular and spring rockets are the best show for the money and the theater is antique beauty.
Must see. When visiting NYC, check out what is going on at Radio City. Must check out the interior of the hall and the architecture!

Spring Spectacular. WOW! What a great show. It is really for the entire family because it appeals to everyone! It has the Easter bunny, Despicable Me, it replicates Fashion Week, Time Square, and the Empire State building. It also has skits about all the sports played in NY. It takes you back in time a short film on immigrates that came to NY. Just an overall fantastic show. Of course the singing and dancing is just right to keep everyone's' attention. You will not be disappointed!

Spring Spectacular. As with the Christmas production this is a lavishly staged program. As usual the Rockettes are outstanding and performances by all the performers is well worth the time and expense. It is a fun show and gives you a sense of Springtime in NYC after the lousy winter they have experienced this year! A great tradition as well!
A must see. A beautiful building and plenty to see and doWatch out for the opening times so best book in advancea must see if you are around Times square
Interesting Story. Not sure we would have taken the tour if we didn't gave the NYC lass but it was really interesting to learn of the history of the Rocketts.

Very surprised. I have to say that I was very surpised with Radio City. I did bot know what to expect was I was pleasantly surprised by the whole tour. Our guide was really great and her knowledge was incredible. We saw areas of this magnicifant theatre that I did not know existed. Oh and to meet a Rocksette at the end of the tour and to ask her questions was a great experience.
Christmas Classic. its a must when you visit NYC during the holidays, great show in a fantatic theater, kids will love it

No.1 Must See for all NYC Tourists. Forget Wicked, Lion King or any of the other Broadway shows. Instead go to Radio City and watch the amazing Rockettes show and see why this troupe is such an important part of the Manhattan tradition.We attended the Christmas show and was blown away by not only the very talented dancers but also by how the event used different multimedia aspects to enhance the show (including giant snowball drones!). You really have to see it to believe it! ! !

Beautiful Theater!. We saw the Rockettes here. The theater is incredible and worth seeing. Just walking around the lobby is visually a treat. The Rockettes Christmas Spectacular is something worth seeing at least once.

"Just can scream WOW". It is so beautifull inside. I was 22 when came there for my Christmas show and will never forget the impression that I recieved after watching it. It is more than entertaining, it is really spectacular. I suggest to come there with friends, as it is more interesting and after you can have a cup of coffee outside while discussing the performance.

SO GOOD!!!!. We saw the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular and it truly was spectacular. Not the sort of thing we would usually go and see but after seeing it once it is very tempted to go back every year to get into the Christmas spirit!
First visit to New York. My daughter pointed out Radio city music hall while we were on the sightseeing bus and explained to me all about it ...
Really good shows. Went here to see the Rockets and was blown away. You can buy some wine and enjoy the show. Watching a broadway is a must in NYC

Great tour. Very interesting and entertaining tour of the Radio City music hall. Really worth a visit if you are a tthe Rock. See the wonderful Art Deco building, learn about the stars who played there and meet a Rockett. Simply Brilliant.

Must See. i will definitely recommend this place and the history behind the building I enjoyed my tour, a lot of information and great pictures to take, my wife liked the architect of the building and we got to meet one of the Rockettes Gals and take pictures with her.

INCREDIBLE!. Traveled in December with my hubby. We did the backstage tour (included with our New York City Pass-check that out too). Glad we chose to do, gave us nice history on building, architecture, important people throughout history to visit/play the music hall including BIG events to this day. we then had purchased the Christmas Spectacular Rockette Show tickets, DO IT DO IT DO IT!! A great show for all ages! very entertaining! will do again when get back to NYC!
This is a must see and visit.. Always get a warm fuzzy feeling pas through these doors. Just so many warm fond memories. This is just a wonderful I-con.

Fantastic venue! . Came here to see the Christmas spectacular! We were visiting from the U.K. On a holiday and were really excited to see a Christmas show in NYC. We were blown away it was really funny, festive and amazing. The venue itself is very grand and spectacular, the staff were very friendly and attentive. Would recommend for a show we will return when ever we come back to NYC! Hopefully soon!

Enjoy the Rockettes for The Christmas Season. My husband and I visited our daughter in NY for Thanksgiving. Our son flew in to join us too. We loved the Rockette's Christmas show. It was fairly inexpensive and very entertaining. The theater is beautiful and one of a kind probably. Scenery was shone up on top of the arched ceiling, special effects were really cool. I forgot to my my 3 D glasses on, but the rest of the family enjoyed it. We arrived about 30 min. early and I had called ahead about parking my electric mobility. They were very kind and helped me find an elevator etc. The souvenirs are very expensive there, even a little refrigerator magnet. We went on Thanksgiving evening. I purchased tickets online and received them way ahead of time. The show was worth the money. Wish I hadn't been so tired from fixing a huge feast earlier in the day.

Surprisingly wonderful. We had a fantastic tour of Radio City Music Hall. We did not know what to expect, but the historical Art Deco building is amazing -so beautiful, designed around a cruise ship. The tour guide was very knowledgable and we got to meet and have our photo taken with a Rockette. Definitely value for money.

Doesn't matter what you see here!. This is an iconic destination, worth viewing the deco style and walking up the grand staircase! Prices are high for refreshments but you are at RCMH!! The Grammys, America's Got Talent and so many other things. And the famous Rockettes!

Always the same; always good. Yes, the Rockettes are still playing at Radio City Music Hall, just like they have been since 1932. There are 80 Rockettes, 36 performing in each of five shows a day during the holidays. Nope, the height requirements have been the same for years: 5'6" to 5'10 1/2". I would have lost that bet.

Wonderful retro building and tour!. Although there is no show there now, there is a NYC Spring Spectacular coming soon. However, there are daily tours of this beautiful, iconic theater and the tour includes and building and even meeting a Rockette. Tickets can be purchased at the gift shop next door.

Should have read up before I went!. It was good and very interesting, but to be honest I had never heard of it before I went! Appreciate now that it has quite a history in the entertainment world, but only after the event. You could pay to have your picture taken with one of the resident dancers (stunner!), but none of our trip wanted to! Saw an award ceremony from there (TV), the week after returning to UK. The décor has to be seen to be believed.
Rockettes Christmas Spectacular 3D. This was a great show last time i came I was a little girl and I had the same feeling going back 30 years later. The show was great and entertaining!!

Spectacular. Love going for the Christmas Spectacular. This year however, I am going to go to the Spring Spectacular. Looking forward to seeing Derrek Hough from Dancing with the Stars. Stop off at Magnolias Bakery for an after show sweet trea
worth a visit. See a show here - the kids loved the Christmas Rockets show, well worthwhile. The history of the place and the grand setting makes it a place not to miss.

Magical. The first time I was here was when I was a little kid. A friend's parents took us to see a movie (back when they used to show movies here). They wanted us to experience this amazing palace from the golden era of movies. It was life-changing. I was overwhelmed by the beauty. I'll never forget it. I knew I wanted to be a part of that world in Rockefeller Center in New York City.... Many many many moons later I worked across the street and we used to gather at the windows and watch the elephants march down 51st Street in a line in to the side stage door when the circus came to town. --- That street entrance provided many amazing sightings (MTV stages and VIP limo arrivals)..... It was like a window on to another world! Everyone should come to Radio City at least once in their life.

Had a grand time.. We loved seeing the Radio City Christmas Spectacular! A first for some of us, others not. The show was nice from the traditional Christmas theme, to the other aspects/story lines in the show. Enjoyed the flyover of NYC with Santa!Of course the Rockettes..so amazing to see the talent.More pros- could meet a Rockette before the show, and not feel forced to pay for a picture to see her. The program they sell for a small fee really was a hit with my children. Good food options, and not too costly inside.Cons- Of course so crowded, but what bothered us was the selling of all the alcohol at what we felt was a family event. I'm sure the profits are why they do it, but wish that part wasn't there. Had a few 'rowdy' people in the row in front of us, no ushers seemed to address it.If you've never been, would recommend. Be careful about buying tickets..so many prices out there from Ticketmaster directly, to personal sellers, etc. quite overwhelming, and still not sure if I got a great or a good deal, but didn't pay full price, so that was good..I think!

Rock around the Clock. Well it is old-fashioned, but it is truly a place I love - and I go there every time I hit NY.For music enthusiasts it is a must, and the performances there are always top-notch.Put it on your "must-see" list people....

Memories of Past Days. First time in New York and as it was so very cold we decided to find an attraction indoors.Well, how glad we were that we decided on this place. The girl who spoke about everything was so good at what she did. She had such a lot of knowledge on everything from artists and the people that made the clothes, people that did the stage etc. Its a good 90mins tour but one thing they didnt tell you when you bought the tickets is that there are heaps of stairs to climb. the lady did say she could get someone to take me in the lift but that just made me determined to climb them even if I was slow.

Rocking at Radio City. We did the RadioCitytour, it was so interesting hearing about the many different shows that have been put on here. It's a beautiful building with so much history . We even got our photo taken with a Rockette. We watched the christmas show, it was magical. Great memories were made!
Breathtaking. I am not sure what I expected, but the Museum was so very worth the few hours we spent in there! This is so well thought out and beautifully displayed.

A must do activity in NYC. We have been coming to NYC for years but never went to Radio City figuring it would be too commercial and a tourist trap. We were so wrong! The production was top notch entertainment. My daughter was 4 and she was mesmerized by everything. The theater is truly beautiful and the quality of the show was unexpectedly amazing. I highly recommend this for anyone.

SPECTACULAR. It was my first time here, and have always wanted to go. the Christmas Show was amazing. I'd like to tell you more but that would be letting the cat out of the bag. It's just an all around great experience, there is a bar if you'd like to have a cocktail, snacks, the staff is amazing, and very, very friendly. if you ever get a chance to see a show there I highly recommend The Radio City Music Hall!! enjoy!!!!!!

Great show :). this place is great! the shows there are amazing and you shouldn't have a bad time there unless you hate sitting in a chair for a long time while watching other people dance or act or do something else. Kids really enjoy but it actually depends on what your children like.

Big Apple day 1. We stumbled across this whilst exploring on our first morning.
It was Fantastic!
A beautiful building in art deco style
Lovely tour guide
A good hour, well spent.
Also had a photo taken with a Rockette

XMas in NY must!. Radio City Xmas Spectacular is a XMas must and will put anyone in the XMas spirit in no time! Show can be outdated sometimes but remains a NY tradition.. Go online to get tickets as they can get real pricey even last minute..

No Other Place Like It. I love this place, I try to see The Christmas Spectacular every year & it is. plus the big stars playing there, But just to be in that 5000 seater theatre is such an experience not like any other theatre I have been to. and full of history. Its unthinkable that they wanted to close it the 70's with its famous Rockettes. I would recommend anyone to do the back stage tour its just amazing, The hydraulic stage alone is worth the price of the ticket, And to see all the old costumes from bygone shows + all the Art Deco features it will stay with you.
Worth seeing again and again!. Wow! Here's evidence of the glory days of theatres in New York City. Every space is beautiful art deco! (Even the ladies' room is pretty!!)

Superb Christmas Spectacular . Cheesy it maybe but everyone adult and child should try and see this fantastic New York tradition. The 3d effects were marvellous, the story as schmaltzy as can be and the atmosphere joyous. Just get in there, drop the cynicism and have a great time.
Great Tour!. 4th time to NYC and first time seeing this tour. I would consider it a must as this is a NYC iconic landmark. You also get to meet a Rockette!

Americas got talent . Had tickets to see the show, was 10 feet away from howie, Howard and Mel b so amazing to see how her whole show was made.tickets are free the lineup to get in was blocks long would go again
A Must See Experience. If you're there for a show, that's great. If not, try to take a tour. It is MASSIVE and beautifully maintained.
Christmas spectacular. One word.......FANTASTIC!!!The show was brilliant, the dancers amazing and it was truly spectacular. I've booked my next ticket for the March show, and can not wait.

Christmas show. I got tickets for my family for the Christmas show. I had seen it when I was a child and we were in the City for a holiday experience so thought it would be a good way to spen a rainy afternoon. My teenage daughter lives dance and enjoyed the dancing, my son was skeptical but the 3D element won him over, it was well done and festive.
The Rockets. For Christmas it's a must do. Great for the family and very entertaining. Definitely worth the extra for better seats and I did the family photo with the performers, well worth the cost!

Worth a look for newbies. I don't think this is going to rock your world, but it's really worth a look if you're not familiar with all the cultural amenities of New York City. You might actually be better off Broadway or something, but is always room for a new experience. This might as will be one of them.

Loved this. So Much History. Taking the tour through Radio City Music hall was like entering a time machine. From the radio and TV specials we remember as young children, all the way up to modern day programming. It was so much fun going on the tour, getting to hear all of the fun, quirky facts about what happened there, behind the scenes. We had a blast and were talking about it for weeks.

Amazing well worth the visit and tour. We had Joyce showing us around, she was funny, knowledgable, friendly and interested in us. The tour was well over an hour and the things you get to see and learn is great. Wasn't sure my 10 year old would like it, but he did.
Fun for Christmas. It's always fun to see the Christmas show. One year is not much different from another, but it's a good way to spend a cold snowy afternoon and get in the spirit.

An Outstanding Christmas Show. We took in the Christmas Spectacular in December and it was outstanding. The history and decor of the venue is impressive and the show was very well done. Certainly great to get you into the Christmas spirit. Highly recommended.
Radio City Christmas Spectacular was spectacular!. We loved the Radio City Rockettes! The show was so much fun; colorful, brilliant sets, costumes, and music. We're making it an annual tradition!

Radio City Christmas Spectacular. Every year I make it a point to get tickets to the Radio City Christmas Spectacular starring The Rockets. This is a great show to see if you are in Manhattan during the Christmas season. The kids will really enjoy it.

A part of NYC history. I actually took a guided tour of Radio City. The guide was very knowledgeable. We got to go backstage and visit the lady's powder room and the men's cigar lounge which is remarkably preserved since the days gone by of elegance and good taste. The history of this wonderful place is incredibly rich. We were also shown the mechanism behind the stage which is very intricate. At the end we got to meet a Rockette but the part I liked less was being held there while everyone had a take a photo with a Rockette which they were going to try and make us buy after the tour. Other than that I highly recommend this visit.

Even if you just take a tour absolutely worth going to. This is a beautiful old building, and if you have an opportunity to see any kind of performance there I believe you will love it.Of course one of the very best things to do is to get to see a Rockettes performance -they are absolutely amazing. But it is a very flexible than you and I have seen everything from Cirque du Soleil to Aretha Franklin. It is a very large hall so if you can afford to sit downstairs do.But if you have no time for anything else, at least take a tour of the building

amazing.. if your here during the Christmas season. do not miss the rockettes Christmas show. it takes a lot to impress me. this show and the grander of the building it self will be a memory of a lifetime for you.

A Stunning Theatre!. Largest theatre in the world. The Art Deco design is amazing as is the whole experience. The Christmas Show is a must see. On top of that is the Rockettes! Enough said. Took my three year old daughter there to see Fantasia. Memorable experience and that time was 36 years ago!

The Christmas Show never gets old. I have seen the Rockettes strut their stuff many times; I've travelled with Santa (in 3D) flying to NYC from the North Pole; I've marvelled at the enormous stage, the fantastic production numbers, and the final nativity tableau (with live animals - including camels!). It's all good and never gets old. This is a must see if you are visiting NYC during the Christmas season.
Such History - Wonderfully updated. I adore Radio City! The rockette's, the history, the mood! It was like stepping back in time. Highly recommended.

amazing accoustics. This is a great spot for a concert. The size is the perfect in-between for someone looking to go somewhere more intimate than MSG and more elaborate than Irving Plaza. The sound here is amazing from every seat.

Rockettes were great!. The building alone was like being in a museum down to the original restrooms with sitting areas for the ladies. It was like a step back in time. The show was everything we had hoped and more!

Radio City Music Hall Tour. We went on a tour of the Radio City Music Hall as it was part of the New York Pass that we had purchased prior to our visit to New York in September wasn't sure quite sure if I was going to enjoy it before we went but was very pleasantly surprised and happy did.Firstly your greeted by a few members of the Music Hall and your then given your own tour guide for your walk through Radio City which includes some of the back stage production and an incite into the running of the Music Hall.Would recommend this if you visit New York.
Should see. A great performing hall, auditorium in the world. Its beautiful and you will learn about the history of the place and all sorts of events that has happened in it.

Christmas Show. I was taken here for a surprise date. We where able to spend the day walking around the city. We did the afternoon show which was perfect to set the mood for the day. There is a lot going on with the show so sitting in the middle toward the back gave a better view of everything overall.

great fun. visited here in June 2013 we had a new york city pass which got us in here I would have paid for it though its worth going too, think they have events on at certain times too we had a tour around the place and it was fab :)

Bringing back the magic of Christmas. I went here to see their new, re-vamped show, complete with 3-d glasses! The Rockettes are so exact and well-rehearsed that I cried (Have I mentioned that I'm a ballet teacher??). Go. Buy tickets front and center if you can. Bring the kids!

Breathtaking Xmas Spectacular with the Rockets superb !. This show was one of the best family Xmas shows I have ever seen it is quite simply what Xmas is all about Rockets were spectacular and the Nativity complete with 3d snowflakes a real camel and sheep amazing watching the children's faces when larger than life father Xmas came on priceless ! If you only do one show in New York at Xmas this has to be it for children and young at heart adults

Amazing!. Radio City Music Hall is an amazing place. From outside, on the street, you cannot imagine how huge and amazing is this place. If you can, it is worthy to do the tour and know more about the history of this place and about its architecture aspects. We did this and we simply love it!
Radio City Music Hall Tour. This was a good tour to find out the history and see the beautiful costumes the Rockets have worn over the year's. This is a must see in NYC.
Good one. One place you do not want to miss when you visit NYC. This is just next to Rockfeller center - and if you miss this you can watch in movies. Go and have fun !!
Christmas Spectacular. The show was so festive and enjoyable. The rockettes are amazing. This is definitely something everyone should see at least once in their life.

RADIO CITY TOUR. Not a lot of people know about this wonderful part of Radio City. Our delightful tour guide excitedly told us all the history and interesting facts about this icon of NYC. It is inexpensive .... about $15 a person. Takes about an hour. If nothing is going on on stage, you will get to see the hydraulic system that controls the huge stage above and it's secretive history during WWII with armed guards. You will not be disappointed.

Just great. I have loved this theatre since I was a little kid. My favorite show is "Rockets Christmas Spectacular". It's a nice place to go to a play. It's sorta like Broadway but different at the same time. That's why I gave it a 50 Star!!!
Take a tour. Magnificent space! The 7 ton curtain, the moving stage (with hydraulics the US Navy studied back when) the art deco design - wow. You really should take a tour.

Must see for tourists. Christmas show is fantastic.. The Art Deco interior is just breathtaking. You feel like you are in an earlier era. The Rockettes Christmas Spectacular is a great show for kids of all ages.
christmas special. i went to see the xmas special the theatre was brilliant the show was very good an amazing building they have a lot of top acts appearing at the music hall so well worth a visit

Christmas Spectacular was a great way to start our trip.. First time in NYC and we took in the Christmas show. It was great! What a Grand theater! We had our tickets in advance as we didn't want to miss the show but you can purchase tickets at the discount ticket place . The line up for the washrooms were huge so plan early. Unfortunately we didn't have time for the backstage tour this time. Well worth it to see a piece of history!

Wonderful back stage tour. Booked a Sunday morning back stage tour of RCMH and had a wonderful and knowledgeable guide. The tour, the history, the art deco and the history were worth every minute. You will not be dissapointed.

Great dancing, piece of history, but prices highway robbery. The xmas show was the only thing my teenage daughter wanted to do in NYC, so glad we went, but the tickets and absolutely everything inside were extortionate (eg $20 programme, food and drinks incredibly expensive). As a brit I found the show cheesy, but my daughter liked it, tho marred by the big New York family around us whose kids talked at the top of their voices throughout with a dad who was pretty aggressive when asked to try and keep his kids quieter. The actual place is beautiful and a piece of history but not worth the amount you spend to experience it.
Get Tickets for the Rockettes!. They put on a show to remember and it definitely made it feel like Christmas in the City. It is my thought that any seat in the place would be a good view.
Beautiful Theater. Went with a large group to see the Christmas Spectacular and we weren't disappointed. Fabulous show, great seats and beautifully decorated for the holiday season.

Rockettes - WOW!. We loved the Christmas Spectacular!! However, our seats were in the back of the orchestra section and one of the ushers stood with the doors open talking to his friend throughout the entire show!! It was ridiculous! I thought they were there to prevent interruptions not create them. Please go see the Rockettes you will not be sorry - but tell the ushers to button it up!

Should have visited sooner. We try to drive the 4 hours to NYC several times a year. In December we went up for the Pinstripe Bowl and decided to get tickets for the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City. This show was outstanding. The Rockettes were fantastic and more skilled than I thought they would be. We can't believe that we hadn't visited this great venue earlier during our trip. The hall is beautiful. We are already making plans for their spring show.
Very nice music hall. Saw the Christmas special show in Dec 2013. Loved the ambience and the theatre. The show was also pretty good
Go and see the Christmas show for sure!. Yes, it is all it is billed as and more! You will certainly get your money's worth as it is an excellent show and entertains from start to finish!
Radio City Music Hall. This tour is simply awesome. We had a great time on this tour. The history of this hall is incredible.

behind the scene tour. Took a behind the scenes tour. Loved the history and the story behind it. So if u enjoy that you should go. The building has been restored to the original grandeur. They take you to parts of the building you wouldn't think are there. The building is huge and u get to meet one of the Rockettes and take a picture with her. The tour is about 1 1/2 he long about $25 p/p

Underwhelming. It seems that little has been done to preserve its history except for some old photographs and a few books. Smelt dirty although I may be wrong. The only brochure was unhelpful. Not recommended

Christmas Spectacular. Went to Christmas show in early December. It was just as great as I remember. My friend loved it . I sat next to 2 young children and they were so engrossed in show they never made a peep during entire show.

Amazing Christmas Show/Rockets. I never get tired to what the Rockets. And this year wasn't different. My daughter love it. As a mother I enjoy my daughter happiness. The only bad thing I would say is the line to get in and the long lines in the bathroom. The bathroom lines is understandable by the one out side the should get it a bit more organize and get a more friendly staff.The show is amazing, so it worth the long lines.

This Tour is a must do.. I have taken this tour three times now and loved it every time. You get a very informative and entertaining guide.You get to see behind the scenes and hear all the wonderful stories. You even get to meet a Rockette and have your photo taken with her.Highly recommend this tour.

Christmas Spectacular. Best Christmas show! This is a must do if you are in New York during the holiday season. You can't beat the Rockettes. Beautiful production. (Hint: best seats are the balcony- first rows. You see everything instead of looking up at the show!)

Rockettes delight. Skill and dexterity were the order of the day. The xmas show was fun especially for kids. Very smooth and well organised. Good service from caring people. The show was not that original but fun and had the xmas spirit in abundance

The Rockettes ... need I say more. We went to see the Rockettes for the first time in about 10 years. What a difference! With 3-D glasses, tasteful light show on the walls and ceiling and of course the incredible Rockettes. The show is spellbinding. You wonder how 30+ women can all move so synchronously. Of course Santa was there as well. He's the one to tell you when to put on your 3-D glasses.It's not a cheap night, or afternoon, out but it is well worth it ... even every 10 years.
Such fun!. RCMH is a must see when in NYC. The theater is so beautiful and the Rockettes are so entertaining. Everyone should see the Christmas spectacular at least once.

The most christmassy show i have ever seen. we went to see the Radio City Rockettes before christmas 2014. This is a polished and well rehearsed show and it did not dissappoint, there was a good mix of songs and storyline and the show was the right length of time.

Fantastic. Seen the Rockettes perform here and the theater is fantastic. It creates great sound and the architecture is simply brilliant. As an NFL fan this is also the home of the draft which is very special.

Christmas Show. We brought some out-of-towners to the annual show and we were all pleasantly surprised.
The theatre does a nice job in keeping the show as up to date as possible over the years. Cant get enough of those Rockettes!!
Coming back for Tony Bennett and Lady Gaga in June. Cant wait!!

A must-see!. A Christmas extravaganza! We love going here to see the Rockettes and Christmas Show. The venue is beautiful and huge and the show is spectacular, especially if you've never seen it before. We got last minute tickets and sat way up high but that didn't diminish the experience. Get there early-early to avoid the long lines way down the block (and it's a long block!) and to hear the twin organs played before the show.

Another architectural masterpiece in NYC. Have been MANY times since a child in the 50's. Yes, the Rockettes are great, and the venue is terrific acoustically for concerts, but the BUILDING is the real treat. Restored to the original including carpets, lights and wall coverings. Take the tour at least.

Deco lovers will be in heaven. Sean was our excellent guide. The interior of Radio City is STUNNING, you get a thorough explanation of the history of the building, the shows, visitors, events and the Rockettes and their costumes- and you get to meet a Rockette!
Rocking Good Time!. The tour was neat, not too long, and kept us interested. We had a good time seeing where some of our favourite celebrities have been.

It's a trip worth doing to tick of your to do list. Ok yes it's cheesey but it worth the visit, Make sure you book tickets for top of the rock so you are not queuing for ages...make sure you do the night trip...amazing views

Poirot would have loved this place. This place exhales history from it's pores. Art Deco opulence and a timeless atmosphere makes the Radio City Music Hall a true theatrical experience. If you have the chance while you are in NYC you must treat yourself to a show in this theatre, especially if it is a Rockettes show. Since 1933, The The Rockettes, the world famous dance troupe have been expertly performing magical dances and are an integral part of The Radio City Music Hall's history. It is travelling back in time with all the grandeur that Hercule Poirot would have loved.
Good concerts. I seen Mariah Carey in concert in 2003. She was absolutely amazing. Absolutely the best concert I have ever seen by far.

Christmas Spectacular-and it was.. Great venue- got ticket a couple of days before a post Xmas performance on a 2-1 deal. The Rockettes are amazing and the show was suitably over the top and fun. Expensive snacks and souvenirs but optional so not an issue. If you're in NYC at Xmas go along.
Radio city Rockettes. We love the show, for those who happens to be in NYC during christmas season i recommend you to see the show. Our family love it.
Spectacular. An absolute must if you're travelling to New York at Christmas. We took the whole family and everyone raved about the show. Perfect for getting in the Christmas spirit!

Beautiful venue, awesome show. We visited here to see the Christmas Spectacular and were not disappointed. The venue was beautiful inside and out and had a lot of room to mill about before the show. There were a lot of concession stands on every floor. The only issue was the bathroom. They are definitely not large enough to accommodate the large number of people when the show is over. But that was really the only issue. The staff was all very courteous.
Good fun. Interesting, and even do your own weather presentation, nicel located for including plenty of other touristy things.

Can not beat the acoustics in this venue. Gorgeous venue. Sound is awesome. Steps were not steep like some theaters. Seating is comfortable with nice leg room. People that have to pass through the aisle have no problem. Staff is hardworking to make your experience a pleasurable one.

It was truly a Christmas Spectacular. We booked tickets to see the 5pm show on the afternoon that we landed, our plane was slightly delayed and so hummed and hahhed about whether to rush to the show or to just head straight to the hotel...in the end we decided to ditch the bags at left luggage at Penn Station and make a run for it, am i pleased that we didn't miss out, it was amazing!There's a 3D show, 30 santas dancing, the scenery is incredible and actual camels! 3 of them!The lines are very busy outside and you do worry that you might not get in on time but they get through the queue very quickly and the door men and all so friendly and polite.We were right at the top and our view was still amazing.Radio City itself is a beautiful building and the chandelier is incredible, they said no photo's once inside though and they did say you couldn't bring in camera's but I had mine in my bag and they didn't say anything....I didn't take any photo's though as I like to stick to the rules.If you get a chance to see the show it would be on my not to be missed for an NY Christmas
Joe Bonamassa. We went to a concert which was great. The acoustics for live music is fabulous. The building makes you feel that you are in another era which to me is good thing

All about the Christmas Show. Beautiful old theatre and it's steeped in tradition. The Christmas Spectacular is amazing and well worth the money. You haven't done Christmas in New York if you didn't see it

Great Venue!!. Went to a Blues night here last friday night and really enjoyed the atmosphere! The whole setting was just fantastic, great seats and decor! the staff were very friendly and done a great job in getting you seated!!
Felt like a kid again. Hadn't been to see the Christmas Spectacular Show since I was a child. Enjoyed it just as much now as then.

Loved it!. We went at Christmas time to see the Rockettes Christmas Show. It was certainly worth it! The show was fantastic, great for all ages. We went to the first show on a Saturday and when we came out the line to enter was stretched all around the block. Use the restrooms first thing you get there, they get very crowded later on (located down the stairs on lower level). All in all a great show to see at Christmas!

Loved the Rockettes. If you can book a behind the scenes tour - do it. It's great to hear the history of the building and those who have walked the hallways. It's an amazing building and if you can book a show afterwards, it's well worth it. Especially the Christmas Spectacular. Our kids (6 & 9), loved it.
Great show. Spectacular, amazing show. The Rockette's are truly amazing. The scenes were fantastic. Highly recommended

Amazing Christmas Show. The Christmas Extravaganza was out of this world, we booked Front Row Seats, but they were a little low for my 7 year old and they didn't offer booster seats.However this show is out of this world, a real family must if you visit NYC before Christmas, my girls are 7 and 14 and they both loved it. Really excellent entertainment!

WOW. Went to see the Radio City Music Hall Rockettes. Talk about beauty, talent & precision all in one place. This is a must see. We were luky enough to see the Christmas Spectacular and there is only one word for it, AMAZING! I can only compare the precision of this group of talented art to watching the Marine Corp Marching Band, and that is a must see if ever you get the chance.

Fabulous!. We watched the Christmas Spectacular here and loved it. Beautiful inside, not too massive so sitting towards the back isn't an issue. The food and drink however is a fortune!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
FUN. Not only it was Christmas but with the excitement of the parade, what other attraction says NYC like this one.. It was a great way to see people and also a great performance.

Nice show for the kids. the spectacle that is the christmas show is worth seeing at least once in your life if you are in NYC. Good sets, routines and music and the best set of dancers you are likely to see for a while.
Christmas Spectacular. The place is fantastic all in itself, but the Rockettes' Christmas Spectacular Show is simply incredible.
Beautiful venue. Was here for a TV taping of AGT and a performance by Maroon5...loved this venue it is quite stunning. Would love to return and see something on stage.
The wonderful Rocketts. You must see this show for the Rocketts dancing , which is amazing. Its very American but that's why you are there. Gretat!

Radio City Christmas spectacular. Truly amazing! Absolutely incredible show, the rockettes were fabulous and the nativity scene with live camel was a highlight. One not to miss if you're in NYC at Christmas time .
Picture!. We only saw it from the outside when going to the rockerfeller centre but it is amazing and colourful to just look at :)

Rockettes were out of this world!!. OMG it was so wonderful we went to RCM on Christmas Eve to see the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular and it was just that. We sat on the first tier balcony, view was amazing however looking around I dont think it would matter were you sat it seemed you wouldnt get a bad seat. The show was incredible, fun entertaining, colourfull my only complaint it went too quickly. It really made it feel Christmassy to us, visiting from Australia and away from family we were feeling a little low but this really lifted our spirits. The dancers are amazing perfectly in sync and the costums were beautiful. The initial mad crush to get into the theatre was a little crazy and disorganised but that was ok was so worth it.

Best Music Venue Around. We have been to Radio City Music Hall many times for concerts, shows, Christmas etc - for good reason.By far its the BEST music venue in NY and possibly anywhere.The elegance of the place, the size, the level of professional productions, but most of all - the MUSIC.The sound system for any type of show is off the charts great.We saw Joe Bonamassa last night.I cant even explain how good he and his band are, but playingat Radio City - made the show even better, if that's possible.If you've never been there - you MUST good.If you have been there - you will go back again.Enjoy!!!

Great Deco Theater. We'd booked Joe Bonamassa tickets for Radio City as soon as we could, had seats fairly near the stage which was a treat. The old theater is still quite stunning, and crowd control went very smoothly for this sold out show. Even the ladies room line went pretty fast! We had a great evening and think everyone should visit RC as part of the New York experience.

GREAT CHRISTMAS SHOW POOR SPECTATORS. The place is spectacular, the christmas show with the rockettes is to see. But the people attending the show are disrespectful. Many came late and left their cell phones open. Many more moved in the middle of the show. There is too many people with food and drinks that make noises. They should review their policies for spectators because the enjoyment of the show suffered. Nothing to say against the show, the performance.

Great Christmas show. Went to see Christmas show which is excellent best Christmas show been to see in a very long time. Place is really lovely and you would think that there's over 6,000 people in there with you.

Lets Dance. To stand on the stage where so many artists have performed is great.The guides are so full of knowledge it was so good listening to the history.Seeing the rooms which have many stories about them,go on the tour to find out,you may even meet a dancing performer?

Pure magic. Professional, dynamic, amazing, spectacular, brilliant.
The choreography was outstanding and put the 'White Christmas' show we saw in London a few days earlier to shame.
If you go to New York during the Christmas period this show is a must for all ages.

Christmas program. It was exciting to see the Rockettes and the Christmas program. We were given Santa hats as we entered, so we could all be a part of the fun. The ladies kept the kick line lively and fresh. It was a good way to start the holiday season. This show lasts an hour. People who arrive late--very late--should sit in a special area of shame on you.

Smiled the entire time!. Talk about absolute perfection, the Rockette's are truly amazing. My face hurt from smiling and being in awe of the performance. You use 3D glasses at the beginning, and they use various props during the show. The snack and restroom area downstairs was so full we couldn't even make it down there before or after the show, they sell bulk candy, toys, and snacks I think. Not sure my son appreciated the show enough to make it worth what we spent on tickets, but hopefully it'll be something he always remembers and appreciates getting to do.

CHRISTMAS MAGIC!. Loved the Rockettes....it was a great show! The venue is beautiful and the ladies in the show were amazing. The scenes were very pretty... Loved the 3D portion...wish the glasses would fit better...especially for children! A must for the holiday season!

Christmas Spectacular!. Wonderful! This was definitely the highlight of our Christmas trip to NYC. The music, dancing, and staging were all spectacular. The best part was hearing the reactions of nearby children. This was the quintessential experience for a first-time visit to the city. The theater was awesome, and our center orchestra seats were worth the extra expense.

We go every year. We go every year during Thanksgiving. My daughter is 6 and she loves it. I love it. My husband loves it. It is one of the greatest shows of all time, in my opinion. So amazing and perfect for people who seem to have lost the magic of Christmas (as I had). We go to Manhattan during the holidays and see many great shows. But the Christmas Spectacular is truly something everyone should see.

The Christmas Spectacular. To be honest, we went last year and were hoping for something different this year. Unfortunately, much of the programme was the same and we were somewhat disappointed. The Rockettes are excellent, but we expected more.
The Rockette Christmas Show. My 2nd time seeing this show. Its a great show. Not just replicated. Totally enjoyed and definitely a kid favorite! Really modern with 3D. Very engaging.

christmas spectacular. AMAZING!! The show really got you in the mood for Christmas, and what beautiful surroundings. The ladies rest rooms are just amazing with the original ladies powder room looking splendid in all its art-deco glory

GREAT Tour!. Take the tour. I've been to Radio City 2 times for shows but taking the tour really made me appreciate it so much more. You'll learn all kinds of neat information about the hall and it's wonderful history. It was fun going behind the scenes!
What a Show!. We went Christmas eve to the rockets. What a great show. Really entertaining & a big variety, Kids loved it.
What a theatre. Went to see 'The Roquettes'. We were not disappointed. Theatre is amazing. Americans do these shows so so well. Theatre worth a visit in itself.
Radio City Music Hall. This is another famous place that you will find here. We did not catch a show but took the tour which was very interesting. I recommend that you visit this place.

Christmas spectacular. We saw the Christmas spectacular here on Xmas day and it was one of the best shows I have ever seen. A must see. The theatre is beautiful and very old world. The Rockettes are fabulous
Radio City, nuff said. Rockettes show is one you need to see. It is great all around. Loved the Christmas focus, all the different scenes and dances. Loved the nativity at the end! We'll be back!

Christmas Spectacular. Although I saw some excellent Broadway shows, we thought we would have a look at the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall. We had already done the back-stage tour on a previous visit, and thought it would be interesting to see a live show on the big stage. It was excellent, although geared up for the younger members of the audience, but the Rockettes were worth seeing, and the sets, orchestra, and all other aspects of the show were well worth the visit.

Great night out!. We saw the Christmas show here whilst on our visit to NY with our two teenage Daughters. Lovely theatre. Great seats. All of the seats had great views. Didn't really eat or drink here so can't comment on their services but overall a great night out.
Radio City Christmas Spectacular. Great venue and this show is a excellent 90 minute family show combining singing, dancing and humor.

Christmas Spectacular. Forget all the run of the mill shows on Broadway & go and see this brilliant show. Suitable for all ages. It will delight you all. The Rockettes are fab with their slick dance routines. Lots of brilliant special effects. Can't recommend it highly enough.
Nice guided tours. They have guided tours few times a day. Nice chance to see the buiding from the inside and learn about it's history, visit backstages and make a photo with rockettes=)

Wonderful Christmas Show. We saw the Rockettes Christmas show and it was fantastic. Our grandchildren loved the special effects where Santa flys above you and through NYC. The dancing Santas was unbelievable and the Rockettes are beautiful to watch.

Christmas Spectacular was S P E C T A C U L A R !. The venue was huge. We enjoyed being close to the stage as we could see the performers. We saved service fees by buying at the box office the day we planned to attend...It was Christmas Eve so of course we paid a premium.

Kickin' it with the Rockettes. We were expecting much less and were surprised with how much we enjoyed the Rockettes Christmas show. It was spectacular and more than we were anticipating. Couple of important things.... If you can go to a matinee, you will pay about 1/2 the price of a Sat evening ticket. And, the ladies room is located in a totally inconvenient place. It's quite a haul to get there. There are moms with lots of kids so the line moves slowly. Plan accordingly. Once the show starts, sit back and enjoy a very traditional and beautiful Rockettes show.

Christmas Spectacular was simply amazing. The Christmas Spectacular show had something for everyone. Our group ranged in age from 8 to 70, and everyone, male and female, found something to enjoy in the show. The facility is crowded throughout the show, and the line for the bathroom can be quite long, but it was worth it. I was amazed by the effects in the show, especially the snowflakes. The dancing hasn't changed in a long time, and that is a compliment! Well worth the time and the money, for a once in a lifetime experience.

The Christmas Spectacular starring The Rockettes. This was an amazing show. Never have I seen a show like this back in Australia. The costumes and set designs were breathtaking. I was amazed at the various set designs and the stage movements. The dancers (Rockettes) had such perfect straight lines - many hours of rehearsal no doubt! The 3D effects were terrific. A must see if you are in New York during the Christmas period but book ahead to see!

Sneak peek behind the scenes. We didn't go and see the show, but instead opted for the backstage tour. Our tour guide was great fun and really knew his stuff. We got to meet Barbie, a lovely rockette who was so friendly. We saw Santa too!I'd recommend anyone to get a place on this tour.

The Rockettes were beautifully amazing!. We were able to score tickets on StubHub and it made the experience even more amazing! The show was one of the highlights of our trip! Great family show! I made the kids stay after the show just so I could soak in Radio City Music Hall as long as possible! It is a classic beauty!

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. Still very good, though the more digital lights/computerized it gets to be, the more it takes away from the Rockettes. This I find to be a disappointment, the show isn't as good as it once was. We will not be going to see it live anymore.

Fun spot to photographs during Xmas. The Radio City Music Hall famously hosts the Rockettes Christmas Specatular. Another fun thing to do is to photograph the building during the holiday season. In addition to seeing the famous vertical 'Radio City Hall' sign, you will also find a tall christmas tree structure made of bulb lights, which change colour from white, purple and red. Unfortunately due to crowds, it can be difficult to make your pictures in the evening when the nightlight makes for ideal photos. What you can do is head out early in the morning, before sunrise and take the photos before the streets fill with people. Further, a great spot for picture taking is near the adjacent Associates of America building, behind the pool with the giant christmas tree ornament display. Here you can fit the giant ornaments in the same frame as the Radio City Hall christmas tree and sign (see accompanying pictures).

Christmas Spectacular. First time in Radio City Music Hall. It is a great venue for a show and we enjoyed every minute. We were there for the Christmas Spectacular and it was a great show. I would go back to see it anytime and highly recommend it for next Christmas!
Great NYC Treasure. The Radio City Music Hall is like no threatre experience out there. Whilst crowded, it is a very charming experience, especially during the holidays.

Great views from any seat!. Went to see the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. Was a lot better than I expected. I was expecting only dancing, but it had skits and whanot. Was a great Christmas Day Activity!

Christmas Spectacular -> Must do for Christmas!. This was exactly the show I could expect for Christmas - full of magic, snow and holiday music. We actually took the morning show tickets and it was full of kids so the atmosphere was filled with Christmas joy and children chatter! And I definitely recommend to take tickets farther from the stage, that you could see all the impressive and synchronized performance of the Rockettes! So don't doubt and enjoy this voyage back to the childhood's fairy tale.

Christmas spectacular. Rocketts were as good as imagined, show overall amazing and a true spectacular!!!Bring you money and enjoy some of the most expensive popcorn and candy floss around! $100 for 4 candy floss (with memorial hat). So glad we went

Bravo the Rockettes!. I like live performances. During my visit to New York, I wanted to see a Broadway show but my wife was not thrilled by that idea. The compromise was the Christmas Show at Radio City. What a wonderful compromise. Both of us with thrilled by the show. There is something about putting several shows per day that make one marvel at the organisation. Every runs so smoothly. Every time that I go to New York, I will always try to catch the show. The Rockettes are unbelievable!

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. I was surprised by home much I enjoyed this. I had seen the Rockettes in the Macy's parade and was not greatly impressed. In person, with live singing, it's much better. The orchestra is excellent with good, lively and not sentimental scores. The show flows smoothly with a minimal amount of contrivance to tie the numbers together. Tickets are a bit dear, but going to a matinee can help. There are also some discounts out there for shows not too near Christmas. Can be part of a great Christmas tradition.
Feel the magic. You can feel the magic as Soon as You get in the room. This big chandelier makes You feel soooo Tiny

A must seat least once in your life. This was the first time I took my daughter to see the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular and she loved it and couldn't take her eyes off of it. I saw the show for the first time in 2007 and not much had changed so seeing it once every 5 years or so is just enough. Get there early because the line to get in was very long but moved rather quickly. We sat in the front row in the balcony and they were great seats. The theater is classic and is how I imagine it would look many years ago. I hope this place never closes.

Christmas Spectacular truly is spectacular. OK people - no group on earth does synchronized dancing like the Rockettes. Add to this almost mechanical preciseness... live animals, 3D effects that make the audience gasp and you have a GREAT show.Bathroom Warning - lines are very very long for women so please go before you get there. There is no intermission so you only have the before or after option for toilet break along with 5000 other people.Line before show - the line wrapped down the street and into Rockefeller center before the show. Next time I might cab up 5 min before show, skip the line, as you have assigned seats.

At least once in a lifetime!. Some people go every year as a family tradition. But go with your children (or grandchildren) at least once if you can while they can enjoy the spectacle. 3-D, the iconic Rockettes, Santa, camels, ice skating, etcetc.. The Christmas show performances are finished for this year, but there will be a new show in the Spring.The tickets are expensive but if you get the tickets in person at the box office you will save the service charge. We did this and also found the ticket-seller to be very helpful to get good seats. Look for discounts on line or by mail, of course if you want them for a matinee during peak season, discounts are practically non-existent. My only criticism is that due to crowd control, we were rushed in to the theater, and rushed out as soon as the show ended to reload the seats. Bathrooms lines were long, and we would have liked to do the photo with the Rockettes or even get some souvenirs but had almost no time even to see the theater which is beautiful. New York is crowded in December!
rockettes christmas spectacular. Wow, this is a Phenominal Show. My 16 year old thought it would be boring but Loved it. Radio City in itself is a sight to see. I definitely recommend balcony seats.

Excellent venue, excellent show. Took our kids and grandkids to see this iconic Christmas show. The theater is spectacular in itself, a wonderful throwback to Art Deco styling and the days when big was really beautiful. The Rockettes were great to watch - how they manage all those costume changes in such a short time is amazing. Best by far was the Toy Solders Parade, which I guess is so good that it has remained pretty much the same since it was first introduced in the 30's.Where else can you go to a show that finishes with a nativity scene with live camels and sheep on stage accompanied by two mighty Wurlitzer organs - LOLTotally over the top really, but nevertheless a great evening's entertainment, and at 90 minutes just long enough for the grandkids.

Christmas Spectacular is right!!!. New York at Christmas holds it's own magical appeal, but add to it tickets to see the Rockettes perform the Christmas show and prepare to be filled with the glee of the season!! People from 1 to 100 will love seeing this show and witnessing the beauty of this theater.

you just gotta go. I won tickets for the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Show. The last time I went was 35 years ago when my daughter was small. If you are visiting New York, or even a jaded New Yorker, you must go. The show was spectacular; the architecture and the beauty of the Hall are spectacular; NYC at Christmas time is spectacular.
cold. this would have been excellent which the show the rockettes was but the theater was freezing!! The show and the place were brilliant just a shame I had to keep my coat on.

We loved it very much. One morning when we were walking in NYC we passed close the Radio City Music Hall and we decided to see this show at 11h00m am and we loved it very much. Excellent rithme, the rockets are doing a excellent show.

“Christmas Spectacular”. Christmas Spectacular has made Christmas time in Big Apple more fun! It is entertaining, delightful, and heart-warming. The show is always different every year, and enjoyable to all ages!

Christmas Spectacular was brilliant...just brilliant!. Superb show for young and old.Rockettes were soooooo good.We also did the tour a couple of hours before the show and had our photo with a Rockette.A must-see show.

Once a year... A must when in New York City. Christmas time in Big Apple comes alive with performance at the Radio Music Hall and Rockettes. We see show every year and, although it is year after year, it is always different, entertaining, delightful, heart warming, elegant and very Newyork-ish for Christmas time. We learned to avoid crowds and holiday traffic, the best time to see show is after December 25 to closing. And if Christmas is not your religion, it is still worthy seeing performance as it is a NYC cultural event.

Crowded- long lines. But not to be missed!. Went for Rockettes- which was amazing! Wonderful energy, costumes, choreography, innovation! Loved the show! Beautiful lobby and comfortable seats but poor traffic flow. Long lines at bathrooms. Overall a great experience.
Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. I loved this show. it was way more than either of us expected it to be. Was the highlight of my trip.
Wonderful show. This is a fantastic show but only lasts one and a half hours, not good value for the money but entertainment very good hence the rating.

Rockettes, Rock. Went to see the Rockettes at Radio City on December 23 with my wife, daughter and her spouse and we all thoroughly enjoyed the show. It was fast paced and very entertaining. The Rockettes were amazing, beautiful and so well synchronized. The show was ninety minutes long and full of energy for the entire ninety minutes. Great job Rockettes…see ya next year.

Just as Wonderful as I Remembered, but Updated. My parents took me to see the Christmas show when I was a child, so I was excited to return and share the experience with a friend. We went to the show on New Year's Eve, the last day it was performed this season. Even after all their performances, the cast was still energetic. The Rockettes continue to amaze! All of the actors and singers were excellent, and the costuming gorgeous. The theater itself was beautifully decorated for Christmas. I was so happy to see that after all these years, this family show continues.

Wow, it is red and huge.. The Theatre was just drop dead gorgeous. The lobby was Christmas red and huge sparkling chandeleers. In the theatre it was the absolute largest auditoreum I have ever seen. The Rockettes were wonderful but expensive. The streets were so crowded at Christmas but it was worth it.

The Christmas Spectacular is just that. Saw the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular and it was just that. The kids loved it. Amazing sets and special effects. Rockettes are amazing and a classic for NYC in December.
Rockettes!. Great performance, fun way to round out our holidays! Went to the show on the 28th of December and it ended the Christmas season with a bang!

Nothing like it at Christmastime!. This old-yet-new production was wondrous indeed! Loved the Rockettes, the Christmas music, and the drones. The Holy Family tableau at the end was beautiful, live camels and all. RCMH staff manages the huge crowd extremely well, it was very organized for a packed house.

Just a Wonderful Show. For the 8th time we were able to see the Radio City Rocketts Christmas Spectacular. What a great show and we think this one was the best of all that we have seen. Well work you money and you leave with a great big smile on your face. This year we even had snow falling when we left the theatre and loved it. Nothing to dislike about this theatre or the show.

Don't miss this show!. Really did not want to go but boy am I glad I did!
The building is stunning and with the amazing Christmas tree just inside the entrance - you get a really festive vibe. The show turned out to be fantastic and worth the (expensive!) cost.

Christmas Spectacular!. The Rockettes Christmas show was great fun! Our whole family really enjoyed it, and I normally wouldn't call us fans of dancing. The music was great, sets were interesting, and dancing was fun to watch. I would highly recommend this to anyone!

A Chirstmas Show for the Whole Family. We had 13 members of our family enjoy the show as much as the Broadway show Lion King. The youngest and the oldest of the group seemed more exhilirated by the show! I was amazedd at the entire facility and its luxurious decor. We were so blessed to visit such a great show and iconic piece of American Music history!

Christmas Show. The Rockettes Christmas Show is really a surprise. I had been to a show as a kid and remember the highlights being the soldier line and the live animals in the Nativity scene. This year, the additional lighting and computer graphics on the ceiling really were impressive. It was very Disney-like. Well done traditional parts (chorus line kicks) with exciting new aspects like the 3D parts and train along the arched ceiling were a welcome surprise.I would not return next year but would go back when they re-vamp the story line again. Costumes were beautiful as well.

Christmas Spectacular. Do it. If you want to feel festive and be genuinely impressed and enteratined, I can't recommend this highly enough. The blend of 3D cinematics, ceiling projections, stage and set design, music and 'Broadway show' was everything we hoped it would be. One of the highlights of our trip to NYC at Christmas.

Christmas Spectacular is SPECTACULAR. The Christmas Spectacular at Radio City is actually a breathtaking experience. The choreography, costumes and performances are top shelf for young and old alike. It is very hard to put into words how very beautiful this show really is. The dancing is tremendous. The stages settings are amazing. The 3 D portion of the show is captivating.The end of the show brought tears to my eyes, although I am a bit saddened that they used live animals on the stage. If you go to see this show, it is well worth the price for seats in the mid orchestra section from about 10 to 12 rows from orchestra. Also, it is good to get there early as children and adults can have their pictures taken with Santa and/or with one of the Rockettes. I could easily see this show every year!!
Old Fashioned Music Hall - Great Fun. Real old time feeling but catering for 6000 people at a time. Such a lovely experience and pleased we did it. Recommend a visit.

Christmas Spectacular was SPECTACULAR!. Get there early, especially if you are female and need the restroom before the show. There is no intermission, and you don't want to miss the show, nor do you want to miss the twin organs playing before the show starts. The line to get in is also spectacular, bag checks and ticket checks do take a few minutes, even thought they have three lines to get in once you get closer. Once in, every seat in the house is good, but keep in mind, the premium seats are premium for a reason (think confetti, santa coming in up the aisles, reasons kids will long to sit in those seats, but you will be perhaps reluctant to pay the steep prices for those privileges). It is (obviously) a very large theatre, so if you are sitting up top, opera glasses are nice to have. Now, on with the show! Sme things have changed through the years, keeping it fresh. Still, not a show to go to every year for most of us. The most important non-changes are the Rockettes and their precision. They are fantastic, just like you think they should be. The scenery and costumes are marvelous, the props are unimaginable when you think of "props", a bus isn't usually one you imagine. The music is equal to the show on the stage, I don't know how else to describe it! One other tradition that has never changed (and hopefully will never be changed) is the final scene, the nativity. We love it. Go once if you can, you won't be disappointed.

The Christmas Spectacular is truly Spectacular!. We expected this show to be a bit cheesy or tacky, but thought it was something we should do, being in NYC at Christmas. We were very pleasantly surprised! The show was a lot of fun; it made me feel like a kid! The storyline is lighthearted and the Rockettes are amazing! I would recommend this show to anyone, no matter what age!Radio City Musical Hall is also absolutely beautiful, and was even more so with the Christmas décor. The staff was pleasant and moved the crowds along quickly. And, the seats were comfy!

Excellent Venue for Classic Show. We saw the Christmas Spectacular this past December. It was a great show. Classic entertainment at it's best. We went for the matinee--cheaper tickets and easier with kids.
Rocketts Christmas Show. I enjoyed the Rocketts show. It was very entertaining and the costumes were beautiful. The performance was delightful and dancers were great.

Rockettes Christmas Show. Been to this place a couple times before and was totally blown away by the Rockette Christmas show, so worth making the trek up to NYC in December. Great show to see as a family. The nativity scene was the highlight of the performance.

Christmas Spectacular. The Radio City Music Hall is an absolutely beautiful building, even more amazing decked out in Christmas decorations - 5 stars.The Christmas Spectacular was a peculiarly American experience, schmaltzy and OTT. It may be a tradition but it was a little samey throughout and I felt like I was the only one in the audience not getting it - 3 stars.I am glad that I have seen it once but I definitely would not go again.

A truly spectacular show. Buy your tickets online before you get to New York. Queues are huge and when we eventually got to the booth they wanted ID to go with the credit card. We ended up paying with cash leaving us $1.50 for the rest of the day! The show was hugely entertaining with marvellous special effects, costumes and dance routines including 100s of dancing father Christmases, a real live camel and 3 sheep all impeccably behaved. You get a good view from anywhere. Beware of fidgety children and parents pointing things out to them.

An absolute MUST if you're in NYC for the holidays. I had been to RCMH way back in the 70s as a kid and really had no desire to see a kitchy show, but my wife talked me into going to the Christmas Spectacular. Bottom line - we had a blast. The show is fast, entertaining, plenty of Rockettes kicking, a 3D segment, the venue is fantastic, and the time positively flew by. The best part for me? Hearing all of kids squealing when Santa (our MC for the show) took the stage. Only three things that were minor annoyances:1) concessions are ridiculously expensive.2) there was a constant murmur/hum of people talking. I've never understand why people would shell out that much money and find it necessary to talk during the show3) the late arriving crowd - for the first 15 minutes our view was constantly blocked by late arriving people. This is really curious as the staff has the whole 'get em in get em out' process down to a science.Should any of those deter you from going? Absolutely not. Doesn't matter if you're 100, 5, or any age in between, this is a wonderful show that will really enhance the holiday spirit.

Radio City Christmas Spectacular. This show needs its own category as it was definitely one of the highlights of our trip to NYC and right up there with the Broadway shows we've seen on previous trips.The Rockettes were fabulous, the show was visually stunning and not just for little kids - very old school New York glamour. I took my 17-yr old who is usually uber cool and even she loved this. Tickets were not cheap at about $175, but we had a great view from the front row of the first balcony. A grand venue, well-stocked and reasonably priced bar - what more could you want.

Brilliant. Went to see the Christmas spectacular and it was fantastic.The Rockettes truly excelled their selves.It was captivating from the onset.It is a beautiful building also.Need more ladies facilities.

Highlight of our trip!. Rockettes Christmas Spectacular was just that. The toy soldier segment is amazing and those kicks...how do they do that? The 3-D beginning was an unexpected treat, too. And kudos for including the Nativity scene.

Rockettes a MUST SEE in NYC. This is the second time I have visited NYC at during the holidays and have seen the Rockettes both times. Their show is a MUST SEE! The theatre is grand and over the top. This time we sat in the Orchestra Section - 3rd Row, Right Side. Great Seats! They also allowed us to enter thru the VIP entrance and avoid the long line/crowd. Loved the 3D Portion of the program, tin soldiers, tour bus, reindeer, rag dolls, everything was entertaining! Don't miss this show if you are in NYC.

Entertaining show. The Rockettes Christmas show was very well done with lights, decorations, music, dancing as well as a mixture of Nutcracker, Noelle, Santa Claus and other beloved themes pertaining to Christmas. Great show to attend together as a family tradition.The lines to get in are long so it is better to get there at least one hour before the show.

Great show for all ages. First time at the Christmas Spectacular and first time in Radio City. That Hall has a beautiful lobby and stair case and the chandelier is stunning. The show was much better than I expected. I thought it would be all about dancing but they did a very nice job mixing in stories and other dancers/actors which made it very interesting to my 6 year old as well. It's definitely worth it!! Would go back again.The only comment is that they need to do something about the entrance and lines. We bought the tickets on line and opted for the eTicket option. At the main entrance they sent us to the side door because that's were ticket holders are allowed in. We went all around and got on line only to not be allowed in because we 'didn't' have tickets. We showed them the email with the tickets that we received but since it only had a bar code and not a QR code, their readers couldn't scan it so they made us go all around again to the main entrance to then have the tickets printed at the box office. They should correct that eTicket option to read differently or include the correct code in the email. Would have rated excellent if it weren't for this issue.

Excellent!. We enjoyed the show, its geared more towards children which we didn't know!! Prices for cotton candy is $12.50..., a bit ridiculous!!All in all its 90 minutes of packed fun!! The Rockettes are amazing!!!!

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular was Spectacular!. The Rockettes Christmas Spectacular was nothing short of spectacular. It's more than just can-can moves. Starting off with the Rockettes as reindeer, then a "tour" through New York City, the rockettes as Raggedy Ann dolls, as toy soldiers, with an amazing collapse of the soldiers that has to be seen to be believed, and of course a dance number in bright sparkly costumes and can-can moves. The synchronization of the dancers is absolutely amazing. There's a side story with Santa Claus, a tribute to the Nutcracker, and a surprising tribute to the true meaning of Christmas with a manger scene at the end of the show. Overall, this is a very entertaining show for young and old alike and definitely a must-do during the holiday season in NYC! I bought tickets off the Radio City website and they had a buy one -get one free deal which was great!

Huge, amazing, historic concert hall. The lobby alone is worth the price of admission at Radio City. Saw the Christmas Show, it was great. But the theater amazes by itself. I can't believe how big and grand the place is. Two organs, a huge arch over the stage, even the men's and women's lounges downstairs are lovely. If you get a chance to see a show here, don't miss it.

CHRISTMAS SPECTACULAR. This was amazing to see. I hadn't been to Radio City since the 1980's. My mother had mentioned the Christmas spectacular and how she had seen it as a child growing up in NYC. My daughter and I saw it and yes it is a spectacular must see. If you are in NYC during the holidays you must see the Christmas spectacular

The Rockettes never disappoint!. We attended the Christmas Spectacular for an 11:00 AM show (got the tickets through Groupon and saved quite a bit but sat near the back of the Orchestra area) and enjoyed every minute of this show. It was my second visit, but the first for my husband. When they performed the toy soldier routine where they all lean back in line, everyone was in awe, including us. Make sure you get there in time to stand in the LONG bathroom line (for the ladies - men had no wait as usual), but also go downstairs to see the beautiful displays there. The main entry area is stunningly, magically beautiful. Costumes were fantastic, and the dancing great. Nothing disappointing here! We got out about 12:30 and still had the afternoon, so this was a good show time for us.

A Highlight of the Trip. We attended a 1 pm weekday showing of the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular during the week of Christmas and arrived 45 minutes early, not knowing what to expect regarding lines or crowds. While the will-call line was terribly long, the line for folks with tickets in hand was non-existent and we walked right in. It helped that an employee was standing on the corner with a sign indicating which way to go, and that the "search" of our bag was courteously performed and brief. (It should be mentioned here that all representatives of RCMH were friendly and helpful.) Once inside, we were amazed at the beauty of Radio City Music Hall. The art deco style, soaring ceilings, rich colours, immense chandeliers, and old-fashioned lushness were gawk-worthy. There were several counters at which to purchase popcorn, soft drinks, candy, hot pretzels, alcoholic beverages, etc, which could be taken into the theatre (refreshments from outside are not allowed). Prices, as expected, were high, although a drinks and popcorn combo was available which saved a couple dollars. Many climbed the long staircases to the upper levels, but there are elevators, tucked a bit away from easy view. Just ask if you cannot find them. Restrooms, located throughout, retained their historical charm, complete with adjoining lounges, hand-dryers with foot pedals, pedestal sinks, makeup mirrors, and little phone booths with stools.Our seats were located in the mezzanine, but due to the design, shape, and acoustics of the hall, there truly is not a bad seat in the house. In fact, sitting up higher allows a view downward on the Rockettes' formations that's not available from the orchestra seats. A few minutes before the performance, Christmas songs were beautifully played on the magnificent double Wurlitzer organs. The show itself began on time, lasted exactly 1 hour 30 minutes, and was simply... flawless. The Rockettes were amazing, the orchestra was superb, the story lines and timing were appropriate for all ages (and for holding little ones' attention), and the effects (some seen with provided 3-D glasses) were fun. The Wooden Soldiers routine was a favorite, as was Santa flying through NYC on his sleigh. It was a perfect show for getting into the Christmas spirit. The crowning glory, though, was the portrayal of the Nativity story. Besides the fantastical costuming, passionate musical accompaniments, and live animals (sheep, camels, donkey (which were met with audible delight by the audience), this 10-minute scene was show-stopping. It is so rare to see such a joyful and unapologetic display of the Christian Nativity, it brought tears to my eyes. Bravo and thank you!This was a highlight of our Christmas in NYC. Highly recommend for 2015.

christmas musical. we booked tickets to see the Radio City Christmas musical, and it was fantastic, the Rockettes were so perfect with their timing. The way they did the line up of Nutcracker Soldiers, then they linked arms in front of each other and fell slowly and precise like dominoes falling. It was the most spectacular thing I have ever seen.
