So perfect and in sync.The hall itself is so pristine even though it is a vast amount of years old, there was Santa Clause in the foyer to get your photo with. and a Rockette lady was there to get pictures too. A venue you must visit when a musical is being shown, fantastic night.

Fun for everyone. We went to see the Christmas Spectacular and it was everything promised. The foyer was beautifully decorated, the theater elegant, and performance -- well, it was spectacular! The dancers, music, and stage were perfection. There were several acts that embraced the spirit of the holidays on so many levels. The show ended with a beautiful living nativity with live camels, a donkey, and sheep, as well as vibrant costumes. The Rockettes never fail to entertain and inspire. Very pleased and impressed with the show.

Put the Christmas Spectacular on your bucket list!. The venue was lovely and convenient to get to. Must see this theatre at least once. Even seats pretty high up were enjoyable - music, lighting, and particularly the dancing were wonderful. This show even had the manger scene and readings from the Biblical text! A pleasant surprise.

Radio City Christmas Spectacular. We enjoyed the Radio City Christmas Spectacular! It is a great show especially for families. The kids were enthralled with the performance. It is fast paced and moves smoothly and perfect for the season.

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular Rocked!. My two daughters and I loved the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. It was very entertaining! I would like to say thank you for including The Living Nativity. It was simply beautiful! I could watch the performance over and over again and it would never get old.

Attended the Christmas Spectacular (and it is spectacular). It had been about 20 years since we last attended the Radio City Christmas show.
It was just as spectacular (maybe more spectacular) than the first time we saw it. A "must see" event. Everyone should attend at least once in their lifetime.

Christmas Spectacular a must-do in the festive season. Quite an old-fashioned show but with all the glitz and glam you would expect...and the Rockettes are amazingly in sync.It is almost worth just buying the tickets to see the interior of this beautiful theatre.I loved all the singing and dancing and the Christian story of Christmas and would recommend anyone with kids to do this if you are in NYC over the holiday season. The show starts right on time and goes for 1hour 30 minutes. The band is wonderful and the costumes spectacular!

Christmas Spectacular was Spectacular!!!!!!. The Christmas show was in a word AMAZING!!!! The Rockettes, were AMAZING!!!! This show need to be seen in person. It is a must see on any holiday trip into New York City! There was not one thing I could say negatively about the experience!
Family fare. Great experience. The 5 year old was enchanted. The 7 and 14 year old said they wanted to come back next year. This was a gift to my son, daughter-in-law and my wife.

The highlight of our trip!. Ok, seeing our daughter was the highlight, but I can't review her. :) We had always wanted to see the Rockettes in the Christmas show and it was everything that all of the other reviewers and history has said it would be. Delightful, entertaining and generally a feel good show. We were impressed that they did a living nativity, including live animals. So many shy away from any religious association and only do secular Christmas entertainment, which I find sad since it is Christmas. Souvenirs aren't cheap but what would you expect! If you have the chance to go, DO, you won't regret it.

Most Wonderful Time.. We went to the Christmas Spectacular whilst on a 5 day holiday in New York just prior to Christmas.The show is fabulous & was certainly for me the highlight of all the many things we did during our stay.Be aware that some shows can get very busy and the crowds & queues gathering outside can be a bit overwhelming. The hall itself is a spectacular venue, right from the entrance hall through to the main auditorium. The Christmas Spectacular is a long standing tradition in New York. This type of dancing is not always my thing but you cannot fail to be staggered by the performance.The special effects used are very good, especially the 3D. All the performers are clearly of an exceptionally high standard. My only criticism is that as they try to fit in as many shows as possible, each show starts right on time. Not a bad thing you may think. Unfortunately, due to the crowds, the queues & people not anticipating just how busy NYC is at this time of year, there is a constant stream of people coming in to the auditorium during the performance. At our show, some people arrived even an hour in to the show. Difficult to devise a solution here. Maybe put a no admittance notice if say more than 15mins late. Alternatively maybe ask the late comers to sit or stand at the back of the hall so as not to disturb everyone already seated. This may seem a bit picky but it was a constant distraction throughout. If you're in NYC & looking for a festive show, I would have no hesitation in recommending the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City.

Christmas Spectacular was Spectacular!!!. I highly recommend this amazing rocket show. There was something for everyone and it left you floating on air. We would go back again. It was everything we hoped for and more. Great for children as well as adults.

Loved it!!. I went to the Christmas Spectacular in Novemeber of 2014 and I loved it. Our seats were in the middle and viewing was still great!! I really enjoyed the bus scene and thought the girls did an excellent job. The Music Hall is huge and it's worth visiting to see the huge chandelier in the foyer. I will add that my husband and the other men with us did not enjoy the show. They were bored.
Christmas Spectacular. a must see if you are in NYC in December - the annual Christmas Spectacular featuring the Rockettes - great show

Rockettes Rock!. Saw the Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes and it was simply amazing. They put on a wonderful show and the added 3D segment is great! Radio City is near Rockefeller Center so the Christmas tree, Today Show and ice skating rink are all close by. The staff were well organized and courteous, and the Hall is beautiful. A must see during the holidays.

MUST DO -- Everyone should experience this!. We took our kids (11 and 8 year old) to see the Christmas Spectacular. And, boy was it spectacular, one of the best shows I have ever seen in my life! We booked this show because I could not get tickets for the Lion King nor Aladdin. This was much cheaper so I was not expecting much. I thought, how much more can they do than what you see on the the Thanksgiving Day Parade? Well . . .A LOT more. This was a true treat. Worth every penny and every single minute we were there. Visually stunning, incredible choreography, amazing number of dancers in perfect synchrony. And, the theatre is gorgeous too! You have got to see it!

Magical show. A complete Christmas story. The Rockets were the best as expected. We enjoyed all scenes but especially the ending, which emphasized the true meaning of Christmas. Entertainment for the whole family!

Loved the building, Loved the Christmas Spectacular. 81 years of toy soldier perfection. We absolutely loved the show. The Rockettes were beautiful, athletic, and perfectly in sync. Seeing the Rockettes in this theater should be mandatory for anyone visiting NYC.
Christmas Spectacular. Words cannot adequately describe the beautiful of this theater. The performance was spectacular with precision beyond my expectation.

Amazing Christmas Show!. We booked tickets to the Christmas Spectacular before we travelled. It really was spectacular! It was pure Christmas from start to finish - a must see! The theatre itself is stunning, really beautifully restored to it's former glory (only the ladies restroom area let it down slightly but i will forgive!) and the Rockettes were just amazing to watch. Can't recommend enough, I loved it!!

Great Theater Experience. A friend and I saw the Christmas Spectacular show during a visit in December. The theater is beautiful and was decorated very nicely for the holiday. The stage is very large and sound system is great. We had seats in the first row of one of the mezzanine levels and they were fantastic. We were able to see everything happening on the main stage as well as side areas. I would recommend eating before going into the theater as choices are limited and very expensive. We also purchased our tickets prior to our trip and might have been able to do better on the cost if we had looked into some of the deals you can get in the city, but we were very happy with our seats and location. Your bags will be searched upon entry. Lots of beautiful building details, even in the restrooms.

The Rockettes!. Loved watching this special Christmas Spectacular with The Rockettes at the iconic Radio City! It's just as pretty on the inside as the out - very festive and candy cane cocktails to watch the show with made it even sweeter. Recommend it!

A must see!!. Made my first trip here to see the Christmas show and absolutely loved it. Incredible scenery and special effects. The best show I've ever seen. A friend of a friend also gave us a wonderful backstage tour where we got to meet the camels from the show. Awesome!!
Great Theater. It is a beautiful old theater, but the seatings are comfortable and clean. The stage is big and the show (we watched Xmas Spectacular) is a delight!

A must for festive season visitors. What a great show this is , see the wonderful Rockettes dancing superbly and watch as children delight in the magic of Santa .....have seen 3 times and only ever improves as years go by

2014 Rockettes Christmas Spectacular was truly Spectacular. An all-out dance and music extravaganza! Beautifully done with great accoustics and a beautifully well done theatrical sets.
A must see in New York during the holidays!

90 minutes, but don't pay full price. It's a must visit when in NYC. Yes, It's touristy and expensive, but everyone should see the famous Rockettes, particularly during Christmas. There are discounts online, such as Travelzoo or Groupon, and discounts when you sign up with the Radio City website.My seats were in Center Orchestra, row L, and I found it to be a tad far. It was even more frustrating that an asian lady with poofy hair kept moving, blocking my view, so I had to move and shift to be able to see. During the show I had to go to the ladies room and found out that the back few rows were not taken. I actually had a better view in the back, than behind Poofy Lady. I'd rather get closer seats than centered seats next time. Perhaps that's my preference, but closer seems better.

Christmas Spectacular is Spectacular - maybe not so much for boys!. Attended the show with my 10 year old son. I thought it was amazing, really loved it. He liked it, but definitely did not enjoy it as much as I did. A few years ago I took my other boys (then 12 and 10) and they, too, thought it was ok. In the words of my 12 year old - "too much singing and dancing." Ha! I would not hesitate to take a family here, but girls will probably enjoy this much more than young boys. If only I had a daughter . . . Show is about 90 minutes, with no intermission.Tips: Seating: Last time sat in 1st row balcony, this time row NN center orchestra. I much preferred the view from up close. Try not to use the restrooms before/after the show if you can help it. The lines are longer than any I've ever seen anywhere. Also, the crowds outside the theater are insane and make it hard to cross the street.
The Rockettes were Magnificent!. Everything was lovely. The show, the dancers, and the atmosphere. A bit pricey, but worth every cent.
Christmas Spectacular. The Christmas show at Radio City is always great. We saw it on Christmas day and it was a packed house, they add small updates every year.I would recommend this show.

Christmas spectacular.....is!. Decided to take my visiting nieces to the Christmas spectacular at Radio City. I was concerned that my childhood memories were cloudy and that the kids would find it too corny. Luckily, I was wrong and everyone in the party greatly enjoyed the show, especially the digital special effects and camels. It is a lively, happy and beautiful show that pretty much everyone except the Grinch will enjoy. Be sure to get discount tickets!

The Christmas show is not to be missed. We got to see the Christmas spectacle at Radio City in 2014. Spectacular spectacle. Only 90 minutes, as others have noted, but perfectly delightful. Incredible visual effects from computer graphics of toy trains arching over everyone in the huge hall on the gold curved ceiling. And the Rockettes were exciting. They did a toy soldier routine that was precise and well-drilled and fantastic to watch, down to the slow-motion toppling of all the soldiers with a shot from a stage canon. And then there were the globes that rose in unison from the orchestra pit and hovered together over the audience, driven by drones (?). Breath-taking! If you missed this year's show, there's always next year, but you really do have to book tickets in advance. The lines are incredibly long, otherwise. Everyone will love the experience, old and young alike.
Christmas Spectacular. We went to see the Christmas show and it was beautiful and magical. The set changes were great, songs everyone knows and loves and the fab Rockettes.

True Christmas magic!!. It was wonderful to hear the reading of Luke Chapter 2 and see the magical gathering around the Christ-child's birthplace. The TRUE story of CHRISTmas was headlined.Santa's back plot of the magic of Christmas was also heartwarming and entertaining...tue multiplying Santas was especially neat!The theatre itself was incredible. The grand lobby was amazing. The Rockettes were like a well-drilled army.We purchased tix a couple weeks in advance, which is highly recommended around the holidays. We felt sorry for those waiting in line for tix.Don't miss it. Enjoy!! Merry Christmas!

Grand show, but... I don't disagree with other comments about the grandeur of the show, but pay attention to discounts readily available for the show tickets. We felt that, given the length of the show time (~90min), the full face value was pricy compared to other Broadway shows like Aladdin.
Xmas Spectatular. This was wonderful. We really enjoyed the show. I would suggest to purchase tickets ahead of time if not you are waiting in a long line.

The grown ups enjoyed it more than the teen. Having grown up watching the Rockettes on TV all my life, I was looking forward to seeing them in person at Radio City Music Hall. The show did not disappoint. We splurged and bought orchestra seats, but did find a discount on the web a few days in advance. (As another contributor mentioned: look around, there are discounts to be had.) The skill and precision of the dancers is impressive, and the quality of the costumes, sets and production makes it worth the cost. One of things our family enjoyed most was hearing the little children around us talk excitedly about the show, Santa, etc. So cute. A great way to get into the Christmas spirit.

Christmas Spectacular show was a beautiful experience.. I went to the Radio City Music Hall for the first time on Dec. 27 with my mother and my daughter to see the Christmas Spectacular. The show was amazing. Our seats were in row A of the first Mezzanine. That was a great spot to see everything that was happening both on & off the stage. We are all looking forward to seeing our next show here.
Amazing Decor. Like travelling back in time to the Art Deco era, a lovely building to admire. Christmas Spectacular show was amazing and had something for everyone.

Spectacular Christmas show in a spectacular theatre. The New York City traditional Christmas Spectacular at the beautiful Radio City Music Hall is a festive feast of fun that everyone could and should enjoy.From young children to adults who remain young at heart, this show is a 'not to be missed' celebration of Christmas. Hosted by Santa and featuring the high-kicking Rockettes, the show is absolutely magnificent. Traditional elements that continue from year to year include the Rockettes' march of the wooden soldiers and the astounding Nativity including real animals, some sheep, a donkey and two camels.Both the theatre lobby and the auditorium are works of art and provide a perfect backdrop.I'd recommend it and look forward to going again, maybe for the backstage tour as well next time.

Christmas show. The Christmas show is a wonderful experience. I took my children when they were 6 and we just went back 15 years later. It was a true way to get into the Christmas spirit. The nativity scene brings tears to my eyes . So beautiful. Great show.

Absolutely stunning!. I had the pleasure of going to Radio City to see the Christmas Spectacular, and it was amazing!! I have never seen a more beautiful Christmas show anywhere. It was everything I had hoped it would be and more, and I was so happy that they included the Nativity (which is, after all, what the holiday is all about). I could watch this visually stunning, great-for-all-ages Christmas program over and over again!

Very nice Christmas spectacular show - tip for tickets. We just came back from the Radio City Hall. Saw the Christmas spectacular. Very nice show and worth to see.However, don"t be stupid and buy tickets at the original / face value price. There are plenty of discount options around, before and during the Christmas season. Whether it is a discount code provided by Chase or in the Path, there are plenty of discount options around, just look for them.We were sitting on the 3rd balcony in row A - top view.
Radio City Christmas Spectacular. It was an amazing show - loved it! The show was stunning and the dancers were magical along with the various characters that played in the show.

Amazing spectacular.... Wow! Gorgeous theatre & comfortable seats. The whole show was wonderfully put together ... We saw the Christmas Spectacular .... It was truly magical ... It was like you were enjoying a musical and a little play. They had real, live animals ... The visuals were outta this world, the choreography was impeccable and jaw-dropping ... It was one of our highlights during our visit to NY ... I highly recommend checking this out. It brought out the kid in me ... ;o)

Spectacular. Thai was the second tome seeing the Rockets. Once in Atlanta 2009 and Christmas day 2014 in New York.expensive but worth it. The best part is their not afraid to protay what Christmas is really about. They had the wise men and told the story about the birth of our Lord and savior

Christmas Spectacular!. We saw The Rockettes on Christmas Day at Radio City. This was our first time at the Rockettes and LOVED it. Although the show is only an hour and a quarter, it was the best attraction during our whole visit in NYC.
Christmas spectacular. So awesome! Every person in the world should go to this!! Incredible! The costumes were great! The dancing and timing of the rockettes were perfect!
A must see. The Christmas Spectacular is amazing. Go and see it. You will not be disappointed. And the Hall in itself is an incredible building. Makes up for NY Skyride earlier in the day.

Fantastic!. We were recommended to go to the show through a colleague who'd visited a few years back.We loved it. It was over the top Christmas fun, full of dancing and music- just what's needed around the festive period.We visited as a group of friends and loved it- definitely not just for families.We booked through the today tix app as Ticketmaster were sold out. The app worked really well and we met the rep outside the venue which was efficient.Definitely recommended!Tip- the women's toilets gets very very busy as there aren't many, so go before!

A NYC Tradition for the whole family. It's been Years since I was here. It is a must for people of all ages. The music hall entrance way is worth the price of admission...the chandeliere is just amazing. The show is a bit retro...but that's what cool about it, as well as those high kicking Rockettes. Young or older it's a fun way to celebrate the season.

Holiday Show is truly spectacular!. This was our first time seeing the holiday show, and it did not disappoint. The Hall itself is beautiful inside and out. With so much put into each impeccably choreographed number, the show was greatly entertaining and a feast for the eyes,. The Rockettes were as impressive as their reputation would indicate. Bravo! What wonderful Christmas tradition!

Spectacular must-see show for the family!. Talk about getting you and your family into the Xmas spirit! This one does it. Loved the music, the dancing, the costumes - with our favourite scene being the nutcracker falling backwards onto the ground. Even the teenagers and the guys liked the show - they were surprised as to how much they enjoyed it. I would see it again the next time I'm in NYC. The only suggestion that I have is that ushers should not let people in who are late for the show until there is a change in scene so to avoid disturbing patrons enjoying the show. I found that very distracting.

Christmas spectacular is simply ... spectacular. Really enjoyed the Christmas Spectacular. Worth the money. Make sure you arrive at least half an hour before the show as the queues are long to get in and the show starts right on time. The interior of the building itself is fantastic and the show worth what we paid. Recommend it.

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular a Show to Remember. We went to the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular not really knowing what to expect, but it lived up to the hype, it was definitely a Spectacular show! Firstly, the venue is amazing, must go back and do the tour of Radio City as it looked amazing, but was hard to see much when you are surrounded by thousands of people squeezing through the doors. The show had it all .. great costumes, singing and dancing. It really put everyone in the Christmas spirit and left you with a feel good feeling when you walked out. Was a great Christmas experience.

Amazing show!. Amazing experience at Radio City Music Hall where our son's acapella group opened for the Rockettes' Christmas Spectacular.We stayed at ROW NYC which was great and were able to walk around the city without any trouble getting around. Of course the opening act was fabulous and the Rockettes were pretty amazing as well. We have a fun overnight in NYC....looking forward to visiting again soon!

Christmas show was rocking. went with wife and two young children to the Christmas spectacular. The show was brilliant and worth the money. We got half price tickets last minute on ticket master. The logistics are well taken care of and if you have tickets in your hand before you arrive it's no stress and in your seat in minutes. The exit was smooth and we were out with no fuss into the street.

Most amazing Christmas Special. Visited with my family. We saw the Radio City Music Hall Christmas special with the Rockettes. It was truly a magical experience. I would highly recommend it for all ages. There's a reason that it continue to be so popular after so many years. Outstanding! I would tell you to get there about an hour early. The streets around it gets very crowded. You wait in line outside for them to check your tickets to get inside. Once inside you have an opportunity to walk around and experience the Hall. The music starts about 10 minutes before showtime. And it's a 90 minute show that is truly excellent to behold.

Incredible show. This show is a must do during the Christmas season in New York. The sights and sounds of this show are stunning. There is not a bad seat to this show. It would be amazing from anywhere in the theater. The nativity scene, toy soldiers and nutcracker segments are the most impressive in this show.

Wonderful Show at Radio City Music Hall. We were there for the Rockettes Christmas show. We have seen then before, but not at the Radio City Music Hall. It was much better there with all of the special effects and the stage production. It was such a wonderful show. It was expensive, but once you see it with all of the pizzaz you will know why and well worth it. Although the price for the tee shirts and snacks do not have to be so expensive. You will enjoy it.

The Christmas Spectacular is, well, Spectacular!. We have seen this show at least 12-14 times over the last 40 years and it just gets better and better. There are a variety of new numbers and the collective effort is amazing. Music, choreography, colors, costumes- just amazing. If seeing/experiencing this majestic theatre isn't enough, seeing the rockettes perform seals the deal. Two cautions- this time we had center stage middle orchestra seats (row A-great seats) but they are just a bit above eye level to the stage- if you have children be aware- they will have trouble seeing over the person in front of them.Also, with no disrespect meant to non- Christians - please don't go to the show if you wont sit through the final scene "the nativity". It's disgusting that people get up, pack their kids, bags, coats, etc and create such a rude distraction, and leave at this sacred part of the show- it's called a "Christmas" show for a reason. Leave us Christians at least one sacred moment in a time where we have been striped and compromised of so much of our faith!See the show- and deal with the rude people!

Spectacular!!. This was my first visit to the Radio City Music Hall and the production was the Christmas Spectacular … and it was spectacular. Santa arrived at the Music Hall via the audience’s use of 3-D glasses. The show consisted of two parts: (a) Xmas and (2) Nativity. The special effects were outstanding and the performances were excellent. The Rockettes were in exceptional form. My Lady remarked that the production was as good as what we’ve experienced by the American Ballet Company.If you’re in NYC during the production of this Christmas Spectacular … this is a Must See event!

Beyond Amazing. Christmas show was spectacular. Wanted to see it again right away.. Iconic landmark venue did not disappoint. Rockettes Christmas Spectacular was all that and more. Found tickets through SeatGeek and paid well below what our seat mates did. Show was amazing and yes, we wanted to go right back in. Venue is huge but intimate. Go see anything here.

Holiday Show. on November 29th i took my girlfriend and her lil brother to thee 2 pm Christmas Spectacular @ Radio City Music Hall.the last time i had seen this show was some 45-50 years ago as a little boy.it was a great vibrant colorful show featuring the Rockettes and a great 3-d scene[they gave all audience members 3-d glasses] & with many scenes of the holiday season.my favorite scene was of the Rockettes on top of a double-decker site seeing bus riding throughout Manhattan.a must for all to see ! !
Must See the Christmas Spectacular!!. Took my 10 and 2 year old for the show. It was wonderful. It was a bit pricey but totally worth it!!! Wonderful show for all ages :) Must see while in NYC!!

Took Grandkids to Christmas Spectacular!. It is my tradition to take Grandkids to RCMH Christmas Spectacular! Took # 7 & # 8 Grandchildren! Had wonderful seats in orchestra! They were thrilled by it all! Loved Nativity!

Septacular can't discribe the show.. While I have seen the Christmas Septacular in different parts of the country, this was my first time in NYC at Radio City Music Hall.It is something that should not be missed . There is no word to describe what you saw but Septacular.
Rockettes Christmas Spectacular show is fantastic. Great performance. Well worth it. Book online and look for a discount code. I was able to get Orchestra seat tickets 50% off.

A New York Icon. Radio City Music Hall is more than just a concert hall, it is a symbol of New York City. Aside from year-round concerts featuring the world's most famous performers, the venue offers a wonderful holiday show in the winter called the Christmas Spectacular with the world-famous Rockettes and a live Nativity scene (you can get discount tickets to this on Groupon or other discount websites). Radio City also has an interesting Backstage Tour where you get to meet one of the Rockettes and learn the history of the theater. And, they offer dance classes led by a Rockette as well. You can also get package deals with hotel, shows and other NYC attractions, which can be found on the Radio City website. It is a part of NY history that should not be missed.

Great Christmas show. The Rockettes are one of the most iconic things about New York, and this year's show did not disappoint. Been going since I was a kid, and glad that it is never the same show twice. Line to get in before showtime, but probably similar elsewhere. Awesome to be able to take your pic with some of the dancers in the lobby too.

A review of the theater itself, not a particular show. Seems like no bad seats in the house.. This is a review of the theater, not of any show in particular. I visited Radio City for a taping of America's Got Talent. The staff was very kind and helpful. The rules for the show (no food, not photographs, etc) were clearly posted. The seats are actually quite comfortable considering the age of the theater, built in 1932.Something I noticed is that there doesn't appear to be any seats without a good or decent view of the stage. The theater appears very wide and the curve makes for nice viewing angles.I've been to many theaters in NYC over the past 20 years and this is one of the best laid out I've been to.

Loved The Christmas Spectacular. Went to see the Christmas Spectacular on Friday Dec 19 at the 4:00pm show. What a great show, and I so enjoyed the boy that played Ben. What a cutie! The theater was simply beautiful and the show lived up to its name "Spectacular".

Must see Christmas show. Took my daughter and husband and we loved it from start to finish. The Rockettes are brilliant and the showmanship is amazing. Love the nativity at the end which brings us all back to the meaning of Christmas.

Must see Christmas show. Took my daughter and husband and we loved it from start to finish. The Rockettes are brilliant and the showmanship is amazing. Love the nativity at the end which brings us all back to the meaning of Christmas.

Christmas spectacular show. We were "wowed" by the Christmas spectacular show, an unabashed musical and dance tribute by the Rockettes to everything beautiful about the Christmas season. The dancing was truly spectacular, the sets amazing, and the singing beautiful. We had tears in our eyes by the time it was over. This is a must for families and anyone who loves Christmas.

Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes was Spectacular!. Fun day in NYC. Going to Radio City Music Hall was like going back in time. The building is historical. The show was fantastic. The Rockettes are fabulously talented dancers and the choreography is amazing. The show is very well put together in terms of the dance numbers and scenery changes. And what scenery! The props are amazing too. Totally entertaining and joyful. Planning to go again because seeing it once is not enough. Many things are in walking distance such as Port Authority, the Rockefeller Center Christmas tree, Skating rink and Top of the Rock where you can walk around and view the city from the roof on top of the Rockefeller Center building, and Bryant Park where there are shops set up and a skating rink among other things right in the park. Central Park is not too far of a walk either. And of course there are restaurants galore in the area and many street food vendors. I highly recommend the traditional pretzels and roasted chestnuts.

Christmas Spectacular. Well worth the money. Seeing the Rockettes has been on my bucket list. A little on the expensive side but well worth the money. Plus got to see the fantastic tree at Rockfeller center

Christmas Spectacular: Overpriced . . overrated. Yes, the Rockettes are terrific. Visit them when they are out of town & not at Radio City. This has become such a commercial business it sucked the joy of the Christmas spirit away from us. Long lines (even if you have a ticket) to get in. They inspect your bag and take away your water bottles so you can have the privilege of paying $5.50 for a 16-oz bottle of water once you are inside. Be ready to break the piggy bank once you are inside, especially if you have children along. Popcorn is $12, Candy is $8. The price of the tickets were bad enough but these prices are insane for a 1-1/2 hr show that was only about 30 min. of Rockettes & the rest so boring even the children around us were more interested in the toys they got in the lobby than what was on stage. This used to be a great show but not since it has become nothing but big business. Save your money for a real play the kids will remember.

Great Christmas Show with lots of new acts added. The Christmas Show is even better this year! It will hold your attention with amazing scenery, video wall, great music, 3-D scenes, great costumes, and amazing dancing by the Rockettes. Our 6 year old granddaughter was mesmerized the entire time and all the adults loved it, too. The backstage tour is terrific and you will learn so much about the workings of the show. Highly recommend it for all ages

Physically challenged people left out in freezing cold. we were there with an elderly lady who uses a cane. went to the entrance for physically challenged. people there in wheelchairs. entrance time supposedly 1 pm for a 2 pm show. we stood outside in the freezing cold for more than a half hour as they let others amble out. no place to sit. I thought it was outrageous. Brutally cold. so inconsiderate.then we get to our $100 seats -- and the Christmas Show is a visit to Whitelandia. With all the black dancers in NYC, they can find ONLY ONE BLACK ROCKETTE or other performer?????

Christmas Spectacular Was Wonderful!. This show never gets old. This is the 2nd time I've seen the show, and it was just as well done as the 1st time I saw it. It manages to capture the classic feel with some 21st century updates. A must see at Christmas time in New York

A 'Never to be Missed' Christmas Spectacular. Now going on to being in my 40's, this is the third time I have seen the Christmas Show at Radio City Music Hall. First time was with my Mom when I was quite young....2nd time was with my Mom, Brother, and a bunch of students Chaperoning a trip. This time, I got to bring my wife, my daughter, my Mom, and two sisters....I couldn't have been happier.The line was extremely smooth getting in. It was crowded, but this is NY, not Texas. I was impressed with the flow they kept and how helpful the staff was in getting you where you need to go. I literally walked in with my family and smiled like a child in seeing the magnificence of even just the lobby area of the theatre.The theater was amazing, and the 2nd act is in 3D - so you get some 3D glasses on the way in. I tell you, I could reach out and touch everything....A big Canada Goose almost bit me ;)One of the things that I appreciated so much was that there were certain parts of the show that changed with the times (look out for the Freedom tower), but others are timeless, like the Toy Soldier Act and more importantly - the Living Nativity. It's not a 'slow' part of the show, by the way, it is the essence of Christmas. It is a beautiful part of the show and a live story of the Birth of Jesus...but that may not be for everyone...even if they do walk a 1/2 dozen live(stock) animals across the stage, including camels and sheep. (Look at a Nativity, you get the idea.)The Rockettes were flawless. I guess as you grow you learn a respect for the talent as well as the show....They were going at high gear at every appearance during the show. But Spoiler Alert*** They need phenomenal dancers for the in-between acts, just in case anyone is expecting to see the Rockettes dance for more than an hour an a half straight without a break. I just don't want to ruin anyone's expectations.This show has 'wowed' me for more than 25+ years....and since they said no "flash photography" and the tickets were deservingly expensive, I was one of those people taking pictures with my cell. I guess I could though....paying for tickets 14 rows from the stage in the Orchestra. Do not miss this experience....you may have to wait until next year at this point, but put it on your "to do" list!
Radio City Music Hall. Did not know what to expect but good visit and interesting facts. OK to do if you have specific interest.

Excellent Christmas Spectacular. My second time - a must see when in NY.
Rockettes, wonderful sequences and amazingly uniform group dancing.

A Spectacular indeed. I had no idea what to expect as this was a prearranged surprise. Everything was magical. Production values absolutely top notch . Precision in the execution and enough gravitas in their message to leave with a wonderfully satisfied Christmas feeling. The rickshaw ride after just made the whole experience totally magical

"Christmas Spectacular"- yes indeed!. What a wonderful show - for kids and adults alike. We took our children and grandchildren and what a show it was. I worried that it might be too much dancing that might not hold a just 3 yr. old 's attention. She was fantastic- very attentive and excited as were the 11 yr. old twins. We were seated in the first mezzanine toward the back and the seats were great. All the kids could see very well and we were able to see the floor open periodically with new delights. Wise to get there early a line forms around the building those with tickets and those needing them. The line goes quickly if you have your tickets in advance. The show tickets are expensive but worth it saving for it. The dancing music and choreography is spectacular indeed. The live animals was a wonderful treat. Popcorn bucket I believe was $12. A wonderful experience for families and worth every penny!

Brought Back Childhood Memories. Born and raised in NYC, I've only been to the Radio City Christmas Spectacular once when I was a teen with the family and once when my kids were young. This Christmas, as my Dad is entering his 80s, I've decided that this is one "touristy" thing that is worth reliving. It's hard to get Christmas presents for him when Dad says, I have enough clothes, food doesn't taste the same anymore. This is an "experience" gift. We caught the 9am show. Finding a parking spot in Midtown Manhattan early Sunday was relatively easy! The lines outside went quickly since most of the people had printed out tickets at home. The building is as I remember it in it's art deco glory. Things were restored and refreshed but I'm glad they kept the original look. The bathrooms are clean and I even remember the foot pedal hand dryer in the wall. There are working phone booths with the folding doors next to the ladies lounge! Photo op! The Christmas show itself was a bit different than what I remember. More lights and more use of the ceiling as a projector screen gave it a grander feel. The Rockettes are still the main attraction. Such precision and uniformity! Very impressive indeed. All the dance and song numbers were top notch. Needless to say, Dad was happy, humming along with the Christmas carolers on stage. I'd say that if it's been awhile that you've seen this show, go back again and have warm feelings again! It's the perfect show for first time visitors to NYC. Great for any age, lots of different scenes (my fav is the Nutcracker scene and the Nativity scene with the live animals).

Phenomenal. I didn't know what to expect - this was something my wife really wanted to do and I was along for the ride. But it was great. We both really enjoyed it. Truly something that anyone in the family could get into. Especially loved the Nativity scene...just awesome.
Christmas spectacular. I have been to this show before and must say that this year's performance was over the top. Enchanting and exhiliarating from beginning to end.

Super!. If this Christmas spectacular with the Rockettes doesn't put you in the Holiday Spirit then nothing will. The dancing, music and choreography were fantastic. There were even live camels, sheep and a burro in the last nativity scene. We'll worth it and the Radio City Music Center was a beautiful historic site.

Great venue. Truly enjoyed the songs and dancing at the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City. Only issue was they allowed photography during this show and an excessive amount of late arrivals. I don't know if this is a show or venue rule. Either way, it took away from this well done show.

Yet another brilliant NYC art deco building. ...with a great show inside. The Rockettes have been around for nearly 100 years and are well worth a visit in this amazing building. The choreography is clever, and the show (we saw the Christmas extravaganza) at c90 minutes short enough for the kids to sit through it.
4th show of the day. Classical US cheesy but at the top of its game everyone needs to see it once. The Rocket tiller girls high kicking is awesome

No need to see more than once.. This show has become somewhat of a tradition with my little family. That being said, I personally find it quite boring. Every few years they make a few updates to the show, but overall it is highly repetitive. We go because my girls love it and are young enough not to remember it from the previous year. Once they get older, we will have to replace this tradition with a new one. The Rockettes are very good, if not a bit stale. The same routine, year after year. The Nativity Scene is also nice, I especially like the camel. The whole Santa thing is old. If you have seen it once, no need to see it again.

Christmas show. The radio city Christmas show is the best show I have seen in a long time. There was something for all ages from the dancing from the rockets which was superb to the animation of the arrival of Santa. Well worth a visit.

Christmas spectacular.. The show is very good. That is my first time there, and i fall in love of the place, is beautiful. TIP if you want cheap tickets in a very good place, look for the last play in the day. You will find very good seats 20 or 30% less than Other schedulles.

Christmas Spectacular Show - Brilliant. The christmas spectacular show at the Radio City was fantastic, it was so good that I didnt want the show to end, thanks to everyone in the show that made this very spectacular,

great venue. this was my first visit to radio city music hall. i was with my 2 friends and her daughter aged 16.The staff you and if you had any problems were happy to helpwe had tickets to see christmas spectacular. we got the tickets before we went to new york and had tickets. only thing i would say the show was very american and would not go to see it again.

New York Christmas Rockettes. I had seen the Christmas Spectacular in Dallas a couple of times but was not prepared for how much more Awesome the NYC show was. We had seats in the orchestra section - row M. Great seats!!! The acoustics were very good, sight line excellent. I'm old school when it comes to certain things and this show did not disappoint with the spectacular dancing, songs, percision, sparkles! Oh, and I lOved the 3d part as well. SO fun!-- My only complaint was that people were allowed to enter the show almost half way into the show ---very distracting. :( Overall, well worth the money and sets the mood for the Christmas Spirit for sure!

christmas spectacular. start to finish the christmas spectacular was amazing. the theater was beautiful, the performances were perfect, and every act was so well done there was never a moment we didn't enjoy. exceeded my expectations.

Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes!. My friend and I bought tickets to go see the Rockettes at the Radio City Music Hall. It was a fantastic show! Made it feel like it was truly Christmas time. Our seats were great and we were on the top of the balcony and reasonably good prices. If you are in NYC at Christmas this is one of the things to definitely do!

The Rockettes at Christmas time should not be missed.. If you are in New York at Christmas time this is one presentation that should not be missed. The local New yorkers who fill most of the seats will agree with me.
Holiday Spirit!. The Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular is a must-see to experience the spirit of Christmas. Very entertaining.

Convinced us the New Yorkers do know how to put on a great show. A 90 minute show and a little pricey but I would pay the money again next year. This was a really glossy performance, including £d sections, camels, sheep, singing dancing etc. It was all a bit corny but VERY well done. I would recommend this show

Discount vouchers in Time Square. I was trying to get discounted tickets for the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular 5:00 matinee show but that time wasn't available at TKTS in Times Square. While starting to walk back to the hotel I stumbled upon two Radio City workers dressed in red Tin Soldier outfits handing out discount vouchers for the Rockettes show good "today and tomorrow. Prices starting at $45". I lined up at the Radio City box office at 3 pm that afternoon, presented the voucher and asked for the "cheapest tickets for the 5:00 show". They gave me seats at the 2nd level mezzanine for $45 each beside a couple (no voucher) who paid $70 per seat. The view was exactly what I wanted, far enough so I could see the whole action. The show was as entertaining as described by the other viewers.

Performaners great. Ushers terrible.. I've just left the radio city spectacular and a good show was ruined by poor organization and audience members. After being sent to the wrong seats and the ensuing confusion with the usher we were sent to the right seats and just caught the opening act. After 20 minutes a large family of 10 came in and were seated behind us. Ok, not too bad. But as soon as they were settled out came their dinner. Oh yes, why bother eating before the show when you're allowed a family meal on the first mezzanine of the music hall. The same family talked through the performance with no official interruption. We were interrupted though...... twice. Someone had left the show leaving their bag behind, mid row and we were asked halfway through the performance for her bag. Never saw a lady leave. The usher left. Only to return 5 minutes later for a bag under a seat. It had been there from a previous showing. The show itself was good. Only ruined by takeaway bags rustling, coercing children to eat and constant talking from behind. Heaven forbid I'd try to take my SLR in there and not dropped it off at my hotel first though.

Nice show but tickets are real pain. This is indefinitely worth the effort and an effort getting tickets it is. We arrived an hour and a half before the 11:00 showing and ending up going to Times square for discount tickets to the 2:00 showing. As well choreographed as the show is, the ticket process is that bad. Get your ticked well in advance and you'll be better off.
Fabulous show.. Loved the production, but some of the staff were curt to the pint of being rude.Come on guys, it's Christmas.

Everybody should see the Rockettes at least once in their life. I have seen the Rockettes a half-dozen times over the years and they never fail to impress. I wish everything in America worked as precisely as the Rockettes dance, it would be a much better country. Their sets, costumes and especially their dancing are terrific. I'm already planning on seeing their new Spring Spectacular in a few months. As an added bonus is the beauty of Radio City Music Hall itself. They don't make theaters like this one anymore. The chandelier in the lobby is worth the price of admission. Do yourself a favor and go see the show - you won't be disappointed. And while you're in the neighborhood, pop around the corner to see the Christmas tree in Rockefeller Center and St. Patrick's Cathedral on 5th Avenue, both delightful. Even Scrooge could get in the holiday spirit roaming around this area. Merry Christmas, everyone!

A BEAUTIFUL CHRISTMAS SPECTACULAR!!!!. My husband, son and I had the most amazing experience after watching the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall. The historic venue turned into a holiday extravaganza accompanied by a full orchestra and amazing lighting that takes you through a magical adventure. Great for all ages-- a MUST SEE if you're visiting or live in NYC. You can also enjoy the Rockefeller Center Christmas Tree which is right up the block from Radio City.

If Nothing Else, See This!. If you can only go to one show over Christmas in NYC, this has to be it! Spent three nights in NYC and this was my favourite part of it. Radio City Music Hall is such an iconic place. As soon as we stepped in to the lobby we were in awe. We made it to our seats early and caught the reading of a night before Christmas, then the show started. The show was out of this world. Loved every act. If you are a Christmas fanatic then you simply must go! The Rockettes are crazy great!

Great live show experience. We've been to NYC before, but never to the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. We took out 7 year old daughter to a 7pm show. The show was great. However, much of it you have seen on TV shows, parades, etc before. The big finale (Snow) was not as awesome as hyped. My daughter like the multiple Santas dance the best and I like the one with the NY bus and going through the city (it really played with your eyes/mind) and the Nativity scene. Yes, you can meet a Rockette ( I assume she is a substitute since she is there up until curtain up and immediately after the show) before the show, but you cannot take a photo on your own camera. If you want to purchase your photo, the cheapest "package" is $35. They do give you a "free" program and 3-d glasses that are needed for 1 song. Other souveniers are able to be purchased. The ornaments start at $32. My 7 year old liked it and it was a 90 minute show (straight through - no intermission) which was an appropriate length of time. Buy the best seat with the cheapest price you can afford. We sat in the mezzanine in the center close to the back and saw the show well. Wished we were on the floor so we could have seen a little closer and had the snow fall on us. You can take photos during the show without flash.

Now this is a Christmas must do. I was just a teenager the last time I saw the Rockettes at Radio City Music Hall. Coming to NYC for a Christmas season weekend, I thought this was a must do, especially for my daughter and her boyfriend who had never been there. The show was absolutely wonderful. The Rockettes are perfect. They have modernized their show, incorporating everything great about the theatre, even adding 3-D projections. The orchestra was wonderful, the Christmas displays, the costumes, the music and even the storyline. Loved, loved this show!

Radio city Christmas Spectaular. Want to get into the Chritmas spirit? Take in this spectaular performance at Radio City Music Hall. A great combination of live theatre, 3D animation and of course the fabulous Rockettes and Santa. A must see if your in New York City.
Christmas spectacular is truly amazing!. Nothing to dislike and liked everything, even the public toilets are spectacular with comfy chairs and chaise lounge for your use

Don't miss the Rocketts Christmas Spectacular and a Santa photo after the show!. Don't miss the Rocketts Christmas Spectacular and a Santa photo after the show!
A Truly magical experience. And the Santa there was the real deal!

Christmas Spectacular. If you arrive and find, as we did, the line so, so long just go to the other side of the building where we found hardly a line. Viewed show from second mezzanine, row B seats 601-605...and had perfect view of entire stage. It appeared there were no blocked views. Lasted 1.5 hours and it zooms by. Really worth the trip at least once if you get the chance. Live animals in the last act...just an American Christmas show...with all that means.
Saw the Rockettes. What a fabulous Christmas Treat....truly set the stage for our visit to NYC for holiday shopping, museum visiting and just walking!

Lots of fun. Have never seen this show and am so glad I traveled to NYC to see it. The theater is beautiful and the show was really fun. Before the show began 2 organs came out of either side of the theater (from behind curtains) and played dueling carols. Not hi-tech at all, but they organists were real showmen and I can imagine something like their little concert being done in the 30's when this first started. Later they threw in 3-D, an excellent ballerina, and of course, the Rockettes. The only thing missing was a really show-stopping singer. Now that I have seen, and thoroughly enjoyed the show, I would not want to return every year, as some people do. I'm more of a enjoy it once type of person. Note- The snacks are outrageously over priced ($26 for 2 drinks and a popcorn). I'd coach kids that snacks would NOT be part of the experience.

it's a whole different show in the first 8 rows spend the extra money. I thought the guy bringing us to our seats was lost as he walked us closer and closer to the stage. I bought my tickets a few months ago and did not realize what great seats we purchased. We saw their smiles up close and the sparkle in their eyes. Up front you get snow dropped on you from above and tinsel even floating Christmas tree balls. We looked back and saw hundreds of people with no snow or tinsel I wondered if they were able to enjoy the beautiful show as much back there.

Radio City Christmas Spectacular. It was our first trip to New York, and we had the great opportunity to attend the Radio City Christmas Spectacular. We were blown away! The building is incredible and the show was perfect. This was a great way to start the Christmas season!
Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. We had a wonderful time at the show. It was a classic and well done. Particularly enjoyed the choreography.
2014. Christmas Spectacular 2014 did not disappoint! We brought our 9 year old grandson & 5 year old granddaughter for the first time, and they were mesmerized!

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall. What a wonderful event!!! Everyone should see this show at least once in their lifetime. We brought the whole family. Are kids range in age from 14 to 6 and they all had a good time.

Radio City Music Hall Christmas Show. Went to the Christmas Show at Radio City for the first time since I was a kid. The Theater really is beautiful if you get a chance to look around. They say to arrive early, which does make sense however they don't open the doors until one hour before the show. Even if you already have tickets, you will be standing in line outside. Once they start moving people in, I have to say it went quick. The show starts exactly on time, no intermission and it's about 90 minutes. The show was very nice. We had seats in the 2nd mezzanine, Row BB, the section all the way to the left facing the stage.We were in the second row. The seats were very good I have to say. I got a deal on the tickets through Groupon and I'm glad. I would not have paid full price for the show. It was nice, but not worth a full price ticket. When you exit the show, it's a little crazy. People are everywhere taking pictures. You can have your picture taken with a Rockette, but prices start at $35 and go up to $100. The prices are not listed anywhere. I went to the desk and asked. If you go downstairs, Santa is there and you can take a pic also. Not sure how much they are. Once you leave the theater, you can't go back in, so get all your pictures, etc done before you leave.
This show is incredible!!!. What's not to like? It was amazing even though I've seen it before, the ladies with me were equally enthralled, one a newcomer to NY.

Terrific Show!. We went for the Christmas Spectacular and I guess I wasn't expecting much more than seeing the Rockettes dance and kick across the stage...boy was I wrong. This was a truly a great show! Many magical moments, and much more than I had expected. We loved it.

Worth your time when visiting New York. I didn't know what to expect but this show was fantastic. My wife and I we're thrilled with the content and the flow of the show. It was exciting to see how well the plot was interwoven throughout the show including Santa Claus and Nativity elements of Christmas. We would definitely go back again.

Christmas nyc. Coming to nyc where I grow up seeing the show every year made the holiday season. now I can share the show with my daughter and my grandchildren that being said the show is as good as ever you must see this show if your in nyc.

" It was a Grand Production". The Rockets did not disappoint. I had seen the Rockets before many years ago, and was not looking forward to going; boy was I wrong... It was one of the best productions I remember seeing. My hats off to the entire group of professionals envolved with this production.You don't want to miss this Christmas show if you are in New York this December...Get your tickets now !!

christmas show. Went today to the Christmas Show at Radio City. Haven't been to see it in years and it was just great. Recommend highly for both kids and adults. I think everyone should see the show at least once (if not every year) so you can really get that holiday feeling.

Rockette Christmas Show. Walked in and was just blown away with the way the place looked. Its a beautiful place. Im not going to go into detail just say that the show was fantastic and the building is a wonderful place. I don't think you can get a bad seat. A must without a doubt to see a show here.

Christmas and Spectacular!. My husband confessed that he had never seen the Christmas Show at Radio City - - so I swung into action and immediately got tickets. He adored it! The beautiful Art Deco lobby, The Swarovski Crystal Christmas Tree and the wonderfully friendly staff put you in a festive mood the second you enter. Then comes the show!! Awesome. The Rockettes are fiercely synchronized and their costumes are gorgeous. The show is high tech and old-fashioned at the same time. A great combination of past and present, modern and sentimental. The Nativity Scene is a work of art. Everyone should see this at least once! Merry Christmas!

The Christmas Spectacular is "Spectacular".. The tickets were reasonably priced. Although I visit New York City often, I haven't been to Radio City in 38 years! Wow. The theater is beautifully maintained. The Christmas decorations were perfect for a 1930s atmosphere.The show was more than just Rockettes. We all enjoyed the 3D scene, and all the music and dance put everyone in the mood. I loved the Nativity scene the best! Although children will love it it is not just for kids.

Amazing Venue. I've seen pictures and heard stories, but being there proved it all. I saw the 2014 Radio City Christmas Spectacular. The show was impressive, much more than I thought it would be. The production uses the venue so well, with lights and projections on the walls and ceilings, performers on mini stages above the sides of the orchestra seats, and Santa making an entrance through the crowd. I sat in the front row of the second mezzanine and the view was great. The sound was great, too. The seats were very comfortable. The lobby is overwhelming and fun to see from all levels of the venue.

Add this to your bucket list..... We just completed our 13th trip to NYC, our 4th during the Christmas season. A "not to be missed" experience is the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall. From the opening number to the extravagant finale the show is mesmerizing. My 7 year old granddaughter sat on the edge of her seat exclaiming, "That's amazing". The Rockettes are flawless, the 3D imagery is captivating, and the variety of the performance keeps you energized. If you haven't been, add it to your list. NYC at Christmas is a true American experience.
Christmassy. Went to see the rockettes Christmas show, absolutely fantastic. The dancers were fab the little ballet girl was amazing the 3d part was funny, such a good night really recommend.

A magnificent Christmas show. I was pleasantly surprised by how excellent the production of the Christmas extravaganza was. It is a not to be missed show. Of course, the Rockettes were marvelous. My grandson and I particularly enjoyed the Rockettes as toy soldiers.
xmas spectacular. a must visit show and place i have now been 4 times and every time i still get the same thrill as i did the first time i went

Great Show. I went to see the Christmas Spectaular on 11th December. It was an amazing experience. It's great fun for everyone, I really enjoyed it. The hall itself is breathtaking. I left after the show feeling really festive and went to Rockerfeller to see the tree, great evening. Could not say a bad word about it. Would definitely go again.

Love This Place! Go!. We have seen the Radio City Christmas Spectacular a few times in the past, and this year was again absolutely amazing. Everything from our visit with Santa upon arriving in the theater to the souvenirs and wine were perfect. This show is THE thing to get you in the Christmas spirit. The theater is comfortable and there doesn't seem to be a bad seat, the music perfect, the staff (for the most part) friendly and helpful. We look forward to this event every time we come to the City for Christmas. We love being welcomed by Santa each year, even though we are considered "grown ups." The pictures, though, were a bit costly (over $100 for four pictures and frames) and the wine overprices, but we expect that in this City, at this time of year. All in all, definitely ALL worth it. Go to this theater for ANY show. You'll be glad you did.

A GREAT show!. We decided to go to the show on the spur of the moment, and we thrilled we could get great seats at almost the last minute. My husband and I agreed that it is the best live show we have ever seen anywhere! The quality of the numbers, the creativity, the music, the special effects - it was all wonderful. I highly recommend the show!

Christmas Spectacular not just for kids. We bought tickets as a last minute idea on the day of the show. It was our first time seeing the Rockettes perform and they were excellent. The entire show was very entertaining and great for all ages.

The Christmas Show with The Rocketts. The Radio City Music Hall was beautiful when we walked in. An old building with all the show type greatness....with the beautiful old decor of old Hollywood. Music, costumes, sets, employees and how the process ran was top notch. Getting that many people easily to a show, giving such a fantastic show and getting people out was nice. I was impressed with the Rocketts, their dancing, and costumes - was beautiful! Thank you, great fun date for my husband and I hover.

Great Show. We were here for our first Christmas Show in over 20 years. Wow, what a nice surprise. The show had a lot of electronics added to it since I last saw it and it was a wonderful show for all ages. The music is sensational and the dancers beautiful with such precision. There were other performers in the show also and they were all excellent. Highly recommend.

THE spirit of Xmas. If the Christmas Spectacular doesn't put you in the mood then nothing well. We only went because our 7 year old daughter was keen but we all had out hearts melted and were blown away - even my 10 year old boy was forced to admit he loved it. Absolutely spectacular!!
Fantastic. If you want to get into the Christmas spirit, this is the show for you. We got great seats and the performance was fantastic. I am so glad we were able to get tickets at the last moment.

Christmas show was spectacular!!!!. The Christmas Show was superb! We were in the top mezzanine and could see everything very well. We were so impressed by the Rockettes and their routines. Absolutely flawless! The special effects were terrific. I highly recommend this attraction for anyone that visits New York before Christmas!

Can now "check off" of my Bucket List!. Had the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular Show on my bucket list for years! Finally made it! The theatre was just beautiful! We had seats in the first mezzanine and had a great view of the whole stage. Although an announcement was made prior to the start of the show that "no flash photography" was to take place, the woman sitting next to me (and one other in the whole theatre) apparently couldn't comprehend what that meant! I even told her, and she took a few more pictures anyway or handed her phone and/or camera to her daughter who was sitting next to her to take the picture. So, even though she was an adult, she didn't know how to "follow the rules". She was annoying and, although I looked around for a staff member to tell her to stop, there was not one inside the theater (by the door). The show was "SPECTACULAR"! It was everything I thought it would be and MORE! And, the staff who were outside, prior to the doors opening up for the 4:30 p.m. performance, were just terrific! They got everyone lined up and had our tickets scanned, so when the doors did open, everyone filed in in an orderly fashion. The staff have this down to a science, and should be commended for their hard work and patience with getting the masses of people into the theatre! A show of a lifetime! Thank you to all involved in putting on this amazing Holiday Performance!! Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year to everyone!

A Must See! . The Christmas Spectacular was great and even better than I expected. We took our 6- year old daughter and she loved it. Great performance to keep little ones engaged. The 3-D effects were wonderful. I do wish they had more bathrooms! Make sure you go before you even enter radio city music hall. Lines were long in the beginning and we almost missed the opening. However if you sneak out during the performance there are virtual no lines for anything. Souvenirs were expensive as well as concession. But worth it. I also thought the nativity scene performance was beautiful and well done. Would recommend this show to anyone!

Simply Awesome!. Awesomeness wrapped up in a great package! Christmas Spectacular was the best. The employees were all helpful, outgoing, and personable. Loved it!! Beautiful building, and the Decorations gave it a great holiday feel. Don't do NYC without going here.

rockettes.. simply stunning!. We booked tickets for this show for our last night in NYC. we loved this show!!! It is a must if your visiting around Christmas time. It was truly magical with fabulous dancers and you leave with such a good Christmas spirit feeling.Very professional and a beautiful building. A highlight of our trip. Thanks

Christmas Spectacular is aptly named. We absolutely enjoyed the Christmas Spectacular show at 9:00 AM on Sunday. The show was fantastic. The costumes were incredible, the Rockettes were awesome, and the show overall was great for getting us in the Christmas spirit. I would certainly recommend this.The line to enter was quite long--make sure you go early so you don't miss the start of the show!

First Timer. This is the first time I've been to Radio City Music Hall for the Christmas Spectacular, and it was absolutely spectacular!
I don't think there is any bad seat in the auditorium, and there are a few performances on the side of the hall.
It was great experience, and is everything i expect if not better!

Amazing Show. We visited Radio City Music Hall to see the outstanding Radio City Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. The theatre itself is spectacular with beautiful chandeliers hanging from the centre. The show was amazing, our whole party (various ages and male and female) loved it. I would recommend it to anybody visiting NYC during the holiday period.

Spectacular? You bet!. What can I add to what has already been said? My first time seeing the holiday show....a lifelong dream come true. High energy...total entertainment. The staging, lighting, sets...amazing. I was once again a 6 year old seeing the magic of the season. The Rockettes ...WOW!!! Treat yourself to a new tradition this year!

Last minute decision. Wondered initially if we'd have time to fit this one in.....but having seen that heavy rain was forecast we decided to go for it.....and it was well worth it. Great 3D opener. 90 minutes just flew by. Never seen the Rockettes before and they were so well rehearsed - didn't put a foot wrong. We were on the 2nd mez which worked out at 1/2 the price of the Orchestra seats and in our opinion gave us a far better view of the action. Thought at first it was just going to be a show for kids but was way wrong. Money well spent - and we didn't get wet !!

Christmas Spectular - great in general just don't sit too close to stage. We bought tickets for 3 and we were literally 3 rows from the stage, hoping that we can see things more clearly as it presented right before our eyes from the stage.I am in my early 30's and the music was way to loud for me, with the poorly designed music channeling, everything is hooked up with a speaker.We seat in the center and the base is crazily loud and there were some notes that was just really loud. I think it has to do with how they channel the music and they really don't need to put speakers right off the stage. Instead they can locate them on the side and on the back too where people are far from the stage and it would make the best use of them.The performance was great you get to see all the kicking and dancing very clearly. We have been going to ballets and symphonys and not used to speaker musics from stage performance, and that takes away of most of the enjoyment.Otherwise it is a fun thing to see with the kid as we just watched the ballet nutcracker the day prior to this.There is no down time in this show which is perfect for kids like mine who needs constant excitements for them to sit still.Probably won't do it again, once is enough. The show was great but we all live in NY and just think it is a great holiday kid thing to do.People there treats you like a piece of rock from the floor.

Great holiday entertainment. FIrst all forgot a camera, didn't bring my phone very disappointed I couldnt take any pics of the lobby, and theater. It was beautiful. Great marketing on memories. Loved the show, and great seats everywhere.

Another Christmas at Radio City Music Hall. This show has Santa coming out into the audience, once you put on your 3-D glasses. He takes a trip all around NYC and the music and the sites are great. We also enjoyed the Rockettes. All of the costumes and the dances were really good and in steip, especially the nuctracker scene, where all of the tin soldiers fall down in slow motion. There were ice skaters, dancing, great songs and last , but not least, a GREAT nativity scene with live animals. This is a must see, if you have children old enough to behave and stay awake.

Rockettes!!!. 1st time ever here & watching the Rockettes. Flawless performance. Loved the Wooden Soldier routine. Santa 3D tours of NY were cool too. Had row QQ seats which were nice---until two 6 footers sat in front of us. Oh well......seats farther back have a little more slope. LOVED that the Nativity scene of Christ's birth is still in a NYC show!!!! Live camels too. MERRY CHRISTMAS to all......

Amazing Radio City Christmas Spectacular!. SPECTACULAR is a very fitting description for this show! We really enjoyed it from start to finish. The show is one and half hour long. The 3D show with Santa, the stage, the props, the lighting effects, the orchestra are just so impressive. The choreography of performers, specially the Rocketts are so flawless! I just wish they let people take photos while the performers are on the stage for a couple of minutes at the end of show - for souvenirs. There's a photo booth outside where they will take picture of you with one of the Rockettes, very pricey though (a couple of printed photos with digital copy will cost you $70, $50 if you prefer digital copy only). I did not see the price posted anywhere, it's somewhat of a tourist trap I think. They should be upfront with the pricing by posting it around where it is visible so the people will not waste their time falling in line to ask how much and they will also save their staffs' trouble explaining the pricing scheme.

great Chrismas Show. We traveled to NYC to see the Christmas lights, markets and a show. We selected the Radio City Christmas Show. It had been about 40 years since I had seen the show. It was excellent. The music, performances and costumes where all excellent. It was a very enjoyable day. I will defiantly return to see the show.

Christmas Spectacular. First time ever seeing this and it was very enjoyable. The routines by the Rockettes were one the best synchronized dance routines I have seen. This definitely a show for all ages. Everything from beginning sequence with the 3D glasses to the Nativity was enjoyable. If this show does put you in the holiday mood then I would not know what would. All I can say is go see it!!

Great Show. . We had a great experience since it was our first show in New York. The Rockkets is great show my kids had a lovely time. Drinks were little expensive. The over all a wonderful experience. A must visit attraction in NYC.

An absolutely necessary tradition!!. Radio City Music Hall is an absolute must to visit, and especially at Christmas time w the trees and decorations.The Christmas show HAS to ve on everybody's list to do. Rockettes are amazingly synchronized, the show is flawless!!!The nativity is so touching. The music is to perfection. What better place to be to hear top notch musicians than znY and this show.Three words of advice...go see it!
Sparkling!. Guaranteed to put you in the holiday mood! A Christmas classic! Go for the good seats up front! I would say that it is fun for any age! Get there early, lots to see!
rockettes xmas show. was very good, we enjoyed the show and was something different. they must practice forever to get some of those routines that perfect

2014 Best Show. We've been coming to see the RCM Christmas Spectacular for years, and our whole family thought this year's program is the best thus far. From some of the older classics, to the nativity scene, to the traditional Christmas carols, the show was simply as advertised -- spectacular. Best show in NYC, and we've been to all of the major Broadway shows, and loved them all.

The 2014 Christmas Spectacular was Wonderful!. My wife has always wanted to see the Radio City Christmas Spectacular so we planned early and purchased tickets for a Sunday matinee. The overall experience was simply wonderful. We arrived early as recommended, and gained entrance fairly quickly. The interior of the Music Hall was decorated for Christmas, with Santa Claus available for pictures, as well as a Radio City Rockette. We were able to purchase a glass of wine and walk around the facility. We had purchased orchestra seats, wanting to ensure we had a good view of the stage. After visiting the first balcony, we discovered that the views from that location may in fact have provided a better view. One of the friendly ushers confirmed that fact, stating that even from the last row the views were very good. The show itself was extremely enjoyable. The music and dance sequences were very professionally performed with a live orchestra and organists. Lastly, the Rockettes were simply incredible. The variety of routines they performed were intricate and spot on. The costumes were impressive as well. Of course I cannot forget the finale which is the live Nativity scene, with live camels, donkeys and sheep. It was an emotional ending to an incredible show. Overall, it was a wonderful afternoon. One of the other guests sitting behind us advised that he comes every year, and the show always changes. I suspect that we will be visiting New York again during the Holidays next year, with tickets to Radio City at the top of the list.

Christmas Spectacular was exactly that..... Spectacular!. We traveled to NY to see the tree and do all the tourist things we've heard about all our lives. This show ended up being one of the highlights of our trip. I especially found it refreshing that it was actually a Christmas show, complete with the story of the birth of Christ. If you only have time to do one show while you are in town, this is the one you don't want to miss!!!
Breathtaking Beautiful. In NYC, you must go in the Radio City Music Hall! It is so beautiful. Staff is so friendly! Saw the Rocketts Christmas Show and it was amazing! Will go back!
Rockettes are Amazing. Saw the Christmas Show! It is a must see if you are in NYC during the holidays. Staging and performance are incredible.

Christmas spectacular was excellent. . Definitely loved the show and suggest seeing it at least once. The down side was the amount of people talking loudly throughout the show. Lots of kids for 1pm on a Friday. Not sure what it's like other days. Definitely an experience worth seeing especially if you get the discount tickets.

The icing on the cake of our New York visit.. The Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular is a wonderful festive Christmas attraction. We went as grandchildren, mother and grandmother and all loved it.The orchestra played with gusto and the visual effects were very exciting.The Rockettes were amazing with their precision and gorgeous leg kicking.Hard to pick favourites but the 3 D effect with Santa in his sleigh over New York was thrilling and the NY sightseeing bus travelling through the city we loved.Enjoyed the true meaning of Christmas scenes and well done the sheep, camels and donkey.An absolute joy for the family...... long live this great NY tradition.

Christmas show is a must-see. What a fantastic show! My wife and I went because, well, you are supposed to see the Rockettes when you are in New York. We knew we would enjoy it and would appreciate the dancing, but we did not expect to enjoy it as much as we did. The dancing was amazing, as expected, but the entire production told a great story and it was so creative how they used the dancers in different ways. Everything - the theater itself, the orchestra, the lighting, the production, the costumes, the choreography, was top-notch. If this show doesn't get you into the Christmas spirit, nothing will.

Radio City Christmas Show. Went to see the Christmas show with the family including two kids. The Radio City theater is huge and so impressively decorated. This show is a top notch production and includes the Rockettes classics everyone has heard about such as "Toy Soldiers" which has the best precision dancing you'll ever see. Highly recommend for families but small children (under 5) may get restless.

The Rockettes Rocked Christmas!. The Radio City Christmas Spectacular was nothing short of spectacular! From beginning to end the show captivated us and would be enjoyed by young and old alike. The only negative was the latecomers who were ushered into the hall all the way through the first 30 minutes of the show and at times completely blocking our view of the stage. Other than the nuisance latecomers it was a magical evening which I hope to be lucky enough to have the opportunity to repeat again in the future!
