Fabulous Christmas tradition. We went last night to the Christmas spectacular! What a wonderful time for people of all ages! Lots of singing and dancing, and of course the amazing chorus line! This year includes a short 3D segment that has Santa whizzing by right in front of your eyes on his sleigh, which was quite entertaining and had the audience ooing and ahhing. The show is about 90 minutes long and was a great evening.

For a true holiday experience don't miss the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular. What a fun show. It's the rockettes, meet Broadway, meet amazing visual effects. NYC at Christmas is magical. The Christmas spectacular is icing on the cake. So festive!

My dream!. As a little girl I had always dreamed of seeing the Rockettes and finally I got to see it! It was everything I had dreamed of! My trip to NYC was complete because I got to see this show! Thank you!

Rockettes rocked it. Haven't seen the Christmas Spectacular in probably 25 years. It was lots of fun. Definitely new technology with the scenery. They do a great job and just walking into Radio City Music Hall in December is festive!

Late comers should be banned. I originally thought we had great seats. Up front, pretty close to the stage. However, while watching the 3D movie (2nd act) late comers arrived and totally ruined it for us. There were so many latecomers!! They should have a quick mini break after act two to allow them all to be seated. For the price we paid (there were five of us) we shouldnt of had to have the whole movie scene ruined. Other than that we really enjoyed the show. Great staging! Really enjoyed the bus scene. Also they had a lady directing traffic in the ladies room and as a result, the long line went really fast. Definately recommend the show. Next time we sit in balcony.

A Wonderful Show. Just been to see the annual Radio City Music Hall's "Christmas Spectacular". What a truly amazing show stopping show. From the world famous Rockettes. To the fabulous scenery, and costumes. The only let down, was that for about half an hour into the performance they were still letting in scores of school kids. However, while the kids sat quietly, the teachers kept coming and going. Which was a tab annoying.

Just Awesome!!!. I was not certain what to expect as I thought that the show could be dated, etc. Was I wrong! The show was well worth the money. I enjoyed every minute of it. I was totally entertained!

More wonderful than expected. While on my bucket list trip, seeing the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular was at the top of my list. The entire experience was beyond expectations. I'm in a wheelchair but the entire staff was so accommodating. The theatre is beautiful. The show was one of the most spectacular that I've ever seen. Ive seen the Rockettes on tv my entire life, so when they came out, I cried. It was magical. There were lots of children and the show kept things moving continuously which kept the little ones attention. I was amazed by the talent and over all quality of the show. The entire experience surpassed all my high expectations.

Fab Christmas show. If yu are in New York at christmas Time I highly recommend this show for getting you in to the christmas spirit. The Santa flying through the theatre (via your 3d glasses) is such fun, the dancing immaculate particularly the Toy Soldier routine (not a foot wrong) and the living Nativity is one to see and remind you that christmas is not all about trees and shopping ..please do go

A must see show. What a fab show to see. We had booked it before everyone started telling us that we must see it. Tickets were relatively expensive but it turned out to be well worth it. A real feel good show.

Truly Spectacular. Everything lived up to expectations. There was a 3D section at the beginning of the show, very diffrent for a theatre I thought, nice touch. The theatre is huge! Great atmosphere. The Orchestra were fabulous. The Rockettes were amazing, their timing was spot on and the choreography was perfect. The whole show adds to the NYC Christmas experience, a must see.

Do not miss theChristmas Spectacular!. We wanted to get into the Xmas spirit early so we bought tickets for late Nov.We had kids ages 7 and 14.Our tickets were middle section EE. These seemed awesome as they are close to the stage.Once the show started we realized if we were further back we wouldnt have to keep looking behind us or to the right/left sides.I would recmd Orchestra center section 400or either side section 300 or 500Best seats in my opinion are MM-ZZThe Rockettes were amazing. I would suggest going every 3 years.We attended 4 years ago and felt we spaced it out perfectly.The show does not change much so every year could be over kill.Afterwards we got coffee and cupcakes at Magnolia Bakery. This was within walking distance.Coffee/Tea/Chai?Hot Chocolates all were delicious and hit the spot!
Fun in the city!. The most amazing show every! The Radio City Christmas Show is a tradition for us each year! LOVE IT!

FRONT & CENTER - WHAT COULD BE BETTER?. When visiting New York City in November we were pleasantly surprised to find that the famous Radio City Rockettes were presenting their CHRISTMAS SPECTACULAR. And we were able to get same-day tickets that ended up being in the front row. This was really great at my mother is visually challenged. The show was truly spectacular - I would highly recommend it to everyone. It would be especially fun for families with children.

Went for the Christmas Spectacular and loved it!. I've always wanted to see the Rocketts at the Radio City Music Hall so this time around, given that it was November and I had my husband and 5 year old son with me, I booked us in to see the Christmas Spectacular. We loved it. My son's mouth was agape the whole way through the show. Our seats were first row in the first mezzanine and they were perfect. Close enough to really see the show and with nobody in front to block the view. The foyer and hall were both beautiful and with the snow falling outside, it just made the whole evening feel so Christmassy. I'd definitely recommend attending this show if you have kids. It's magical.

Christmas Spectacular Show. Wow! An amazing show to be seen. During 90 minutes you enjoy being a kid again! One thing that was annoying is that the theatre let people walk to their seats anytime during the show which is very disturbing.

Touring Radio City Rockettes at Houston's Hobby Center. If the Rockettes are coming to your community during this Christmas season, beg, borrow, or steal the money for the tickets. Its been 8 years since they were last in Houston. At that rate I figured my granddaughter would be 20 and away at college, and my grandson would be 12 and just not into the kick line.The little one was not able to go - flu. My granddaughter and her friend were mesmerized. I spent most of the performance with tears in my eyes with nostalgia. I just know the little guy would have loved the Toy Soldiers on Parade and the dancing Santas. Give yourself a treat to see the glow and excitement in the eyes of your special loved ones..
Christmas Show. Great Show! Only 90 minutes long - buy your tickets directly at Radio City Music Hall for far less that what the online prices and what you will get charged at the hotel.

Spectacular, indeed!. This is one show that absolutely lives up to its name! The Rockettes are stunningly beautiful dancers. The costumes, sets, lighting, special effects, and performances (both the Rockettes and other cast members) are top-notch. If you are in New York during the Christmas season, absolutely go see them. Each production number leaves you wondering what could possibly top what you just saw--(ice skaters, bus, toy soldiers, dancing bears?), then you see the next number, and, voila! The show's climax is the nativity scene which was so beautiful, I actually cried. It is probably one of my most favorite shows ever (and I go to a LOT of shows).

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. We took our boys (10 and 8) what a beautiful place and great show. The Hall is grand and all the seats are good. Look for vouchers being handed out on the street for discounts if you haven't already bought your tickets.

Our Annual Family Tradition for 15+ Years. We've always loved the RCMH Christmas Spectacular. However, there were a few years there - back-to-back- when they changed NOTHING...now they keep some traditional numbers in, but make it exciting even for those who go every year.We were there yesterday- front row, orchestra...it was SUPERB. We had a grand time and will be back next year.It's truly a feast for your eyes and years...little ones of ALL ages, and big ones, too, feel the spirit of Christmas with each note played by the wonderful RCMH Orchestra!!!!!!

The Rockettes Rock. This show really puts you in the Christmas Spirit. It is a 90 min show including Santa...3D effects...Dancing and singing. Our family has really enjoys this annual tradition the past 3 years.

Awesome show!. If you're a first time visitor to NYC, this is a MUST SEE attraction. The iconic Radio City Music Hall is a great piece of New York's history. The building and architecture of the building alone is worth the price of admission. We went to see the Rockettes Christmas show and it was really impressive. We had seats in the Mezzanine with a great view of the stage. I think the tix were $59 each and probably the best money I've spent when we were visiting NY. There were around 75 people lined up along the street when we arrived to get in and we never waited longer than 5 min to get into the building. Not sure how long the show was, probably an hour or hour and a half, but very entertaining from start to finish. The Rockettes are worth seeing if you're a first time visitor. I really think this should be rated much higher on the NYC attraction list.
Christmas Spectacular. An amazing performance perfect for the family. We got first row seats on the 3rd level mezzanine and it provided a great unobstructed view.
A must see. If you are in NYC for a visit make sure to see a show such as the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall. A once in a lifetime experience you and your family will cherish forever.

Must see Christmas Show in large beautiful building. Ideal show for family or just to get in to the christmas spirit. Second time we have had the pleasure of watching Christmas Spectacular at this opulent Music Hall. When we previously visited New York we had been lucky enough to get tickets to an afternoon perfomance. For this visit we purchased tickets before leaving the UK and had prime seats for one of the evening shows.The dancers timing is so precise and fabulous to watch as well as stunning scenery with great effects at different stages of the show. You must also remember to wear the 3D glasses to get the impression of the sleigh going over your head or snowballs/flakes flying through the air towards you. Paid about £75 for out tickets (per person) and was an excellent night out.

They Put The Spectacular in Christmas. Show was a great mix of singing, dancing and acting. Santa, Jesus and the Rockettes what more could you want? Only downside was outrageous price of food. The "special" was a large popcorn, 2 bottles of soda, a Christmas hat and a plastic cup all for the price of $26,

Beautiful place to see a show... Watched the Rockettes at Radio City. It did take almost a half an hour to enter the building and get seated, even for a 11:30 a.m. show. Sat in the first mezzanine and the seats were great. I would prefer these over the lower level towards the back. Restroom lines were VERY long so avoid if possible. The building is much larger than it looks like from outside. Stunning place!

Radio City Holiday Show. Great show for families, lasts about 1:15, has great singing, dancing, even a section in 3D! Rockettes of course involve several types of dance (tap, synchronized). Fun for a family on vacation around the December holiday season in NYC. Suggest you go to Times Square Tkts booth for 1/2 off of tickets prior to the show.

A Must For the Christmas Season in NYC. The show was all we hoped for and then some. The 3D effect at the beginning was fun and the Rockettes were precision perfect in all their routines. The dancing Santas were my favorite secular part of the show but I was pleased that the true Christmas Story loses out the show, complete with the camels as I had always heard. The entire show was entertaining and it certainly put me in the Christmas spirit! The Christmas tree chandelier in the lobby was a beautiful sight.

Amazing Christmas spectacular. My first visit there, beautiful crystal chandelier Christmas tree in foyer, very busy and hard to find where to go for our seats. Inside theatre was amazing and I was gobsmacked. Show was fab
Christmas still means something!. Saw the "Holiday" show and it is fantastic. No different from when we saw it a few years ago, timeless.

I returned after 40 years. When I first saw the Christmas spectacular it was before the tech age so it was amazing to see the differences. As an older adult I don't like the super loud music that is common today. I did enjoy the 3D part complete with glasses with Santa and sleigh riding right to me and snow flakes it would seem I could reach out and grab. The segment on the city tour used to be a low point but now with computerized backgrounds it was a highlight. The Nutcracker segment was familiar and fun. the Rockettes continue to amaze with their perfect synchronizations and I couldn't count the number of costume changes they did which had to create a chaotic scene back stage!I see there are many discount coupons out there most of which seem to expire Dec 15. search for Radio City Christmas Spectacular Promo Code.The 2 organs playing in sync from each side of the theater before the show was impressive.If you found this review helpful please note below and consider adding this reminder to your own reviews. I appreciate being reminded.

GREAT CHRISTMAS SHOW!. We went there on Thanksgiving day with the kids (3 and 7yrs) and they had a great time! CHRISTMAS SPECTACULAR is just perfect for the family who doesnt want to spend a fortune in Broadway shows, still, its top quality and at a fair price.The only strange thing is that we bought the tickets online and it said we could use the App instead of printing the ticket, but in the Venue they didnt seem to have the technology to read the bar code...Other than that, great place, location and a wonderfuly family show.
Santa's show. The Christmas Spectacular was well choreographed and stunning costumes. The audience got into the show, lots of singing:)

Rockettes Christmas Show at Radio City. This is a must if you are going to NYC during the Christmas season. The sets are absolutely amazing, The Rockettes are so much more than women in a line kicking their legs up. The show puts you in the Christmas spirit, they have a little of everything including a scene of the true Christian birth of Jesus. I loved it and would go back again.

Rockettes Christmas show. Loved the show, it was our first time there. The lobby was beautiful. Hung out in the Ladies Lounge before the show. Waiting to get in was a bit confusing, no one knew exactly which door to be by if you already had tickets. Prices of souvenirs/food was outrageous. Wish I had purchased an ornament at a gift shop I'd seen earlier in Bryant Park - it was half the price. The show itself is a must see.
Don't miss it !. Went to see the Christmas spectacular starring the rockettes, absolutely fantastic Typically Americano

Fantastic Christmas show. Queued for hours to get tickets for this show and it was worth it. Typical vaudeville with great sets and atmosphere. Great Christmas experience and we are sure the new spring show will be just as good. Lots of space once we got inside so most likely you would not need to book as the Theater is vast

A Great Way to get into the Holiday Spirit. We saw the Holiday Spectacular. Very entertaining, continuously changing scenery. 90 minutes, no intermission. Felt it was worth it getting orchestra tickets.

The Backstage Tour is great!. By all means, see the Christmas Spectacular show. But, if you are looking for something else to do, try the tour. It was a lot of fun and educational. We learned a little about the history (fascinating to me!), how the amazing stage works, got to see the lobby, auditorium, etc and hear some little known facts. We saw rehearsal areas and got to meet a Rockette, hear her explain a little about them and answer questions. Lots of fun for those that want to know and see behind the stage. When they aren't doing the show, the tour takes you actually backstage. We didn't get to do that in December, it's too crowded backstage prepping for shows.
Christmas Show- Rockettes. A little kitschy but overall a good show. Puts you in the holiday spirit for sure. The Rockettes are amazing! The hour and a half show just flew by. Great for families.

beautiful building but disappointing show. Beautiful building.Watched Rockettes Christmas show not sure why they rave about it to be honest.Some of it good like dance routines and costumes but ended abruptly and quickly. OK if you like corny over the top.

Christmas Spectacular!. This is truly a great way to celebrate the holidays in NYC! The music hall is so beautiful, the orchestra and performers were exceptional and the whole evening put us in the Christmas spirit. The Rockettes were so much fun to watch and the live nativity was beautiful!
Christmas with the Rockettes. Loved the Christmas show with the Rockettes even though we had no children with us! A wonderful, New York Experience for all ages.

Superb show is a must see. We took the overnight bus from our area to NYC and the Christmas Spectacular was the top attraction. Great dancing,singing and costumes in a show that works well for all ages. Beautiful facility decorated just right for Christmas really gets you in the holiday mood. A must see for all!
Brings Christmas to life!. This was a fantastic show for young and old alike. We had great orchestra seating on the left and really enjoyed the Christmas Extravaganza show!

Great show; new numbers. Still a mob sceen getting in and out, but a really good show. Two or three new numbers (we are arguing). Fortunately, the video game number is gone. Raggedy Ann new number was very good. Kids had a great time.

Super Holiday Show. Three generations of family immensely enjoyed this truly spectacular performance. The Rockettes are fantastic. My favorite is their "March of the Toy Soldiers" where they march and fall with exact precision. The show is a classic and wonderful experience. The performances ranged from a tour of NYC, the Nutcracker, and culminating with the Nativity scene. The Rockettes had numerous gorgeous costumes. There were fireworks on stage and confetti sprinkled on the audience. The performance is short (1.5 hrs) - perfect for kids. Get in the holiday season and see it. Some discounts are available via Chase VISA. We had orchestra seats - just perfect.

Phenomenal!. Hubby & I blown away by this phenomenal show. This is not your Grandma's Rockettes show. Remember seeing it as kid & it's morphed into an visual extravaganza, including 3-D. Great bang for the buck & charming.

Great show and tour. Went to take a tour and loved it so much I bought tickets to the Christmas spectacular. The Rockettes were simply worth the price alone. The live nativity was quite impressive and they even used live animals. This is a much if you are in town during the Christmas season!
Rocket Christmas Show. This was an excellent show! This was geared for children and adults. Great value for your entertainment dollar. A must see.

Nothing like what you see on TV!. Took my daughter this past weekend to see a show. We were in awe! Much more "spectacular" than you can even imagine. Seeing it on TV doesn't even compare. We had great orchestra seats, they were worth the extra cost. The highlight of our weekend in NYC! Definitely get and PRINT your tickets ahead of time, the line for tickets and will call were very long. Can't wait to take my other daughter some day.

True start to Christmas. The last time I saw the Christmas Spectacular was probably 10+ years ago. And it was just as I remembered. The Rockets are stunning and I am glad they added more variety into the show. It was a great show to see to kick of the Christmas season. Only negative I had was the people that showed up late, about 3 numbers into the show, which was very distributive. Word of advice whatever the show start time is be there at least 20 minutes before because the show will start promptly.

What a Spectacular show! totally worth it!!. We went to the Christmas Spectacular in November. The show was more that we expected. The choreography was superb! from the first scene to the last! The Toy Soldier and the Nativity which they had real animals. were my favorites. The theater was decorated amazing. I was so happy to see my Mom and my wife with a smile from ear to ear! I recommend this show to everyone!!

Made you feel like a child again !!. Christmas spectacular and what a spectacular show it was the true spirit of Christmas for young and old !! Makes you feel very festive and the rockettes are amazing and so are all the others in the show and the 3d bit is amazing and the floating snowflakes !! Wow wow wow !!

Rockettes get better and better everytime!. This was my sixth time seeing the Rockettes over the years. They seem to get better all the time.The shows are great to take family and friends. Will go back again in the years to come,

The Christmas Spectacular. After seeing the Rockettes on TV all of my life I got the chance to see the Christmas Spectacular. It was more than I expected. We purchased the tickets the day of the show and was able to get great seats. The theatre was beautiful and the show just wonderful. The costumes were so beautiful and the music,dance and storyline outstanding. I'm so glad I took the time to go. A Christmas I won't forget.

Christmas Spectacular well worth it. We went to see the Christmas Spectacular on while visiting NYC. This was a terrific show. It was full of visual surprises. Well worth the admission price compared to other shows in NYC. Buy the best seats that you can get. Dollar for dollar, this is the best entertainment buy in NYC.

Christmas Spectacular is Spectacular. The Christmas Spectacular totally exceeded our expectations! The hole show was mesmerizing and the choreography of the Rockettes is outstanding. We especially enjoyed the March of the Toy Soldiers, it was done with such precision. Another highlight was the live Nativity scene with 6 live sheep, 3 live camels and a live donkey. Wish the whole family could have been with us (from 3 years of age to 84 years) to enjoy this fabulous Christmas event.

A holiday treat!. Went to Radio City Music Hall for the 2014 Christmas Spectacular with my 12 yo daughter.. The show was beautifully done, the venue is absolutely gorgeous.Thank you to the rockettes for a wonderful holiday memory! All of the kids in the audience seemed to be as captivated as my daughter was?

The Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes. If the fantastic decor of the Radio City Music Hall with its grand ceilings and beautiful festive details takes your breathe away, then you'll love the show inside! Whether you are old or young this show is sure to put you in the Christmas spirit! Kids will love the costumes the singing and the beautiful, mesmerizing effects (including 3D!!) and adults are bound to be impressed by the perfection and precision of The Rockettes synchronized dancing! I'm 21 and have been to many shows including the ballet, opera, musicals, plays serious and silly.. and this is by FAR the best one yet! Every single part is perfectly done and done with such passion and flair that I have sworn to return every single year! A MUST in New York City!

Seen it once? Then you've seen it all!. Nov 2014. Went to the Christmas spectacular last week and it was the same show we saw 3 yrs ago. They should change the name from Christmas Spectacular to Christmas same old-same old. We got 1st Mezz tickets at TKTS for $35/ea, so it wan't that bad.

Best ever at whatever price. This was EXCELLENT and surpassed our expectations by miles!The Christmas show with the Rockettes is just magnificent. We all as an adult family, just beamed with pleasure for 90 minutes.Well worth the £100 or so it cost and better value than the Broadway show we went to see too.Hey I love the way you get a programme free with US theatre productions. London should adopt that for the huge prices we pay there too!We would have gone to see the Radio City production again across the 5 days we were in NYC its that good. Perhaps the management should do a pay full price for one attendance and then offer a see it again price at say 40% of the original. But if they fill all performances and theres 3 a day then they would not be bothered about discounting the prices!!

Awesome. Didn't go inside, but just seeing and walking its exterior was fun. I love historic places and just seeing this famous sign gave me chills. Such a powerful place in American performing history. If you get a chance, try to go inside-if not just seeing this place is a treat.

Christmas Spectacular. We went to the Radio City Christmas Show last week. It was amazing. This New York tradition has been an institution for over 60 years. It is the perfect run up to Christmas. The Rockettes performed amazing routines. The finale was an brilliant nativity including 2 live camels!! Tickets are quite expensive but we were in the stalls, balcony seats would still be a great view. Shame about all the tourists raising their cameras and coming in late, they should stop all photography and latecomers.

Beautiful theater. Every time we visit to see the Rockettes and their Christmas Spectacular show, we love the way the Radio City Music Hall looks. The lobby is beautifully decorated for the holidays. The theater is amazing! The light effects really showcase the theater.

Christmas Show, featuring the Rockette's. Walked to Radio City Music Hall from Broadway, at Time Square.The show was excellent. The show featured 16 performances and featured the Rockette's.If you go, make sure you get 3D glasses because the third scene was a fly around the North Pole with Santa through the streets and we didn't have glasses, so it was a blur.Excellent show! I got tickets via Living Social. The ten O'clock show was cheaper then the 7:30 show, but that may be because we saw it before December 1st.Get the 3D glasses and see the show.

Wonderful Show. The Radio City Christmas Spectacular was the best part of this trip! I went with my sister and her girlfriends and we all loved the show. The dancers were magnificent, of course. The music and the special effects gave me goosebumps! I would definitely go again!

A great Christmas Show. We had been told to get tickets for the Radio City Christmas show the last time we visited New York in 2012. We pre-booked the tickets in England before we left. We thoroughly enjoyed the show, a perfect lead up to the Christmas Spirit. We wished that late comers (some,after the show had been on for 40/45 minutes) were not allowed to enter the theatre after the first ten minutes.

Rockettes Rocked Winter Wonderland. the 2014 Christmas Spectacular was a true positive uplifting and exciting tribute to New York, to the meaning of Christmas and family. Rockettes really rocked every number on stage. This was the highlight of our New York City Holiday...

The Christmas Spectacular IS Spectacular!. I have been waiting 55 years to see the Rockettes, and they did not disappoint. Oh my goodness, from the beginning to the end, the Christmas Spectacular was an amazing ride. The dancing, the magic, the lights . . . the talent! I was transported back to a simpler time, and I fully expected Jimmy Stewart to appear. The Rockettes have a rich NYC history, and their show is phenomenal. Don't miss it.

2014 Christmas Spectacular. Saw the show with family and everyone loved it. I don't see how anyone could not like it. No matter what age you are it's a great show to get you into the Christmas spirit and is well worth going to see. For the best up close view I would suggest sitting in the orchestra within the first 20 - 25 rows. If you want to see the dancing formations from up top I would suggest the mezzanine. My only complaint is that there were no "flashing lights" or announcement to signal the show was starting and to take your seats. We were mindful of the time and got to our seats just before the show started after checking out everything in the lobby. However, many other people were still in line for souvenirs or snacks which resulted in a lot of people coming to find their seats after the show had started. Not huge deal, but was distracting and a little annoying.

Rockettes Christmas show. Visiting New York City and making an effort to get tckets to this very special show is well worth it. It will leave a lasting impression, especially on your kids, if you can find the time. We went to the 9 am show, which started right on time, and kept us thouroughly entertained. We've seen the show twice with over 15 years between visits and plan to see it agaon much sooner then later. Make your plans, you won't be dissappointed. It's on the corner of 50th and Avenue of the Americas. Enjoy the holidays!
CHRISTMAS SHOW. what a great show, the dancing, singing and staging were as professional as it gets. A wonderful experience for the whole family

Don't Miss It. The Radio City Christmas Spectacular is just that~~ SPECTACULAR! This tradition is one that every family should share. The Rockettes are all absolutely PERFECTLY in sync with each other ALL THE TIME! Never is even a hair out of place. The Santa theme is wonderful, and the live Nativity is breathtaking. Every family should take advantage of this magnificent show!
Great Christmas tradition still continues. show is a bit updated and still maintains the classic scenes that I remembered from 20 years ago. Class act the entire time!

2014 Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular. My husband and I decided to go to this show on our annual NYC trip instead of our usual Broadway show, partly because I didn't feel like paying hundreds of dollars to see The Book of Mormon, but mostly because I remembered seeing this show many years ago as a child and loving it. We got great seats in Mezzanine 1. The show is a joy from start to finish. The sense of excitement was obvious with the crowd even out on the street.We were handed Santa hats as we went in the door. The lobby was gorgeous, with a Christmas Tree chandelier covered with thousands of crystals, and of course all the beautiful Art Deco details that are like nowhere else.The show was wonderful! The Rockettes are so very amazing, all the same height, with their beautiful long legs, happy faces and unbelievable timing. My husband said over and over, "how do they DO that?" And he was the one who was really only going to the show to humor me.The show was approximately 90 minutes, with no intermission. We happily drank our bad wine from the bar (my one suggestion - stock a better wine for $10). The show is designed to touch the child in all of us. The costumes were amazing, and a full orchestra and two organists added so much to the show. The sets were beautiful and quite visionary. In the Nativity segment (yes, they actually did a whole Nativity number with quotes from the Bible, surprising in this day of political correctness and I say more power to them for that, it was enchanting) we thought we were seeing a film of camels and donkeys projected on a screen. It wasn't until we were outside later and saw the animal trailer that we realized they were real animals!In short, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves from start to finish, sang along with all the songs, even my husband, and highly recommend this show. If you can't go this year, go next year! Radio City had always put on a first-rate show and this year it was superb.

A Classic Christmas experience. We chose to make the Christmas Spectacular our first Radio City event. It was also the last event of a four day trip to NYC. We saved the BEST for last. Truly a breathtaking experience.

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. It was our first visit to the Radio City Music Hall and we were lucky enough to be there to see the Christmas Spectacular - which was truly spectacular!The theatre is beautiful and the entry process for the large crowd flowed well.The very talented Rockettes were fabulous! We had a mixed family group from grandparents to children and all enjoyed the show.

Beautiful theater, Christmas Spectacular a little long.. Theatre is just gorgeous. Really great view even from 3rd Mezzanine. I know you have to get your money's worth, but the show is pretty long. Not sure of all the show times, but maybe a morning show would have been better. Really enjoyed all the singing, dancing, and story line.

Christmas Show - WOW!!. Totally blown away... Husband was happy, kids were happy, I was happy... Kudos to all the people who put this show on... WOW! Every aspect of this show was impressive! The employees...at the door, selling merchandise and the ones who lead guests to their seats... all very nice! (p.s. my left arm rest kept falling off - Aisle seat, row A of the first balcony, seat 601)

Fantastic Christmas Show. We spent an enjoyable Sunday Evening watching the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City. This is a real family show and even has a 3d aspect to it. The sets were delightful, certainly gets you in the Christmas Spirit!
Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. Do not miss this! Even my husband enjoyed it and he didn't want to go. Everything you would expect and more!

Great Christmas Show at Radio City!. I can't say enough good things about the Radio City Music Hall Spectacular. We saw a production on Thanksgiving weekend and it was a great start to the holiday season. This year everyone was given 3-D glasses for the portion of the show that was a 3-D movie. The Rockets were exceptional in their precision routines, etc. Since I saw it a few years back they have incorporated multi-media projections on the inside of the theater. All in all, you can't go wrong seeing this wonderful production. Worth every penny!

Christmas Spectacular. Always loved the Rocketts..Many years ago I saw this show, and decided for Thanksgiving to treat myself again. it seems to stay similar each time you see it? They are wonderful performers..but, the show lacks new excitement..Some parts I could of sleep thru. But, I do think everyone should see it at least once..

Don't miss the X-mas show. It brought us to tears and had a bit of everything. The Santa Story, great dance routines, great songs, surprises high and low and on the sides! I purchased my tickets in my NYC Vacation Package & included 2 nieces from Rhode Island who met me in NYC over the Thanksgiving weekend. The music, 2 organs, dancers, and nativity scene brought us to tears of joy. What a surprise when the camels calmly walked across the stage! If you miss this, there is a Spring Event planned also. Customer service was excellent too.

Christmas Show with the Rockettes. What a great theatre! Way cool inside with a grace and style you don't see anymore. Plus, the Christmas show was excellent. Had a great Christmas message with some good singing and outstanding rockette dancing!

Great except for audience. Christmas Spectacular itself was very good. The audience was astounding. Screaming children may be expected, but not late comers constantly being seated for the first 20 minutes of the show and then intermittently for the next 20 minutes. Very distracting, especially if you are sitting on an aisle.

Radio City Music Christmas Spectacular. Another must see show to see while in NYC is the Radio City Music Christmas Spectacular Show starring the Rockettes. You will screaming & clapping for joy through out the entire show. The show is a total of 1 hour & 30 minutes long.

Great show but poor organization of crowd. Our ticket information suggested we arrive at Radio City one hour before show time in order to check out decorations and photo opportunities before the show. They did not open the doors until 40 minutes before the show - 20 precious minutes later than what they advertise. We were only in the city for 12 hours so that time could have been spent more wisely elsewhere. Once we were allowed inside, we were herded into a massive hall where it was too packed to move. The doors to the theatre remained closed so we were at the mercy of the crowd. There was no possible way anyone could take pictures or pose around the hall. The hall itself is beautiful and the show was fantastic. One other complaint was that they continued to let people into the theatre during the first four acts of the show. It was noisy and we couldn't see overtop of the massive amounts of people still trying to find their seats. I've never been to anything else in NYC where this has been an issue. Due to this we weren't really able to get into the show until everyone was seated by act 5. I am glad we got to see the Rockette's - definitely something everyone should do sometime during their lifetime.

Christmas Show. The three (my wife,pre teen daughter and myself) took a drive onto Manhattan to see the Christmas Show featuring the Rockette at Radio City. Tha staff was is the holiday spirit and the interior was done up very well which put everyone in a great mood.Photo opportunity with a Rockette was available before and after the show and the refreshment / merchandise areas were busy.The show was great and featured 3D during Santa's sleigh ride through Manhattan. The music was was great as always without being too loud. Special effects during the show was good as were the Rockettes.I would recommend this for all ages as part of a Manhattan holiday experience that won't be forgotten.

Beautiful theater wonderful show. So my Grandparents would take me every year in December when I was a child. It has been many years since I was back the but Radio City did not disappoint! The show was fast paced, exciting and up to date. New technology integrated into the wonderful song and dance routines to keep your attention the entire time. And as always, those Rockets are high stepping and amazing to watch. My favorite always has been and still is the March of the toy soldiers. I don't want to spoil it but how do they do that without falling over. A little expensive but well worth it.

Unexpectedly Delighted!. Don't miss this show if you're in NYC around the holiday season! This is a fully immersive production that embraces you with holiday spirit. The theater is like a great big airplane hangar with graphics projected onto walls and ceilings that extend the design from the stage into the rest of the theater. The performances appeal to children and adults, and address both the religious and secular stories of xmas.One complaint: many people were taking pictures and filming video during the performance despite a reminder at the beginning of the show to turn off technology. It's distracting to other guests.

Radio City Christmas Spectacular... Radio City Christmas Spectacular is a beautiful show for all ages. The Rocketts are amazing and super talented, and the Christmas show is perfect for the whole family.

Christmas Spectacular Definitely IS. No visit to New York City is complete without seeing the Rockettes. Their reputation precedes them, and the theater itself is full of history. This year's Christmas Spectacular is 90 minutes packed full of glitz, glam and glow. It's a non-stop trip including music, fantasy (including a terrific 3-D production), gorgeous costumes, and even a message. And -- oh yes -- those terrific Rockettes. Go -- you won't be disappointed!

2014 Christmas Spectacular was.... Spectacular. I had never been to this show, but we absolutley loved it. Seeing it through the eyes of our 7 year old daughter was the most magical memory. The show runs about 90 minutes (no intermissions). Apparently it is different each year, and whilst I cannot comment on prior years, without question this 2014 show was out of this world. It starts with a 3-D experience and ends with the birth of the Baby Jesus; all the while being narrated by Santa Claus himself. The Rockettes are crazy good; I was exhausted just watching them! Certainly worth the price of admission.
SO BEAUTIFUL. We saw the Xmas show with the Rockettes, soooo amazing, sooo beautiful, and so worth it! Get the morning show, its much cheaper through travelzoo!

Christmas Spectacular was.....Spectacular!. Five children range in ages from 33 to 84 attended the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall and all of us were thrilled with the show. Yes this show is pitched toward children but there was no part of the performance we did not like from the organ prelude, to the 3D sleigh ride, to the bus tour of New York and the amazing precision of the Rockettes. At ninety minutes without an intermission the show was about the right length but it would be wise to arrive early as there were throngs of people scrambling to get to their seats. The 11:30AM start time on Saturday was great as it allowed for a lunch just after the end of the show.

The Radio City Christmas Spectacular is SPECTACULAR!. This 90-minute show is phenomenal. The grace and precision of the Rockettes were simply amazing. We wished the show was twice as long. I'd see this show every year if I lived there.

Wow wow wow. A show in a different league. Tried to book this through our hotel concierge but the tickets price was doubled, so we went down to the ticket office and waited until it opened and bought our tickets there. We were seated on the 3 mezzanine level which was high up but did not spoil the viewing. We had also been given a discount voucher whilst walking in time square, we quoted this code and were given additional discount. So our ticket cost approx $39 dollars, which for this quality of a show was great. The show itself was amazing. The Rockets were something else, I have ever seen a dance troop so in time,the costumes were brilliant, as we're the dance routines. This show was magical for adults a children, a must if you are in New York .

Christmas Spectacular not that spectacular.. My boyfriend and I went to see the Rockettes at Radio City last weekend and I wasn't that impressed. I saw the show about 5 years ago and NOT ONE thing had changed. Considering the high price of the tickets, you would think they would try to upgrade and change some of the scenes. It was the same 3D beginning, and reindeer, sightseeing bus, and soldier performances. I would consider it a "bucket list" item--once you've seen it once, there is no point in going back. Radio City Music Hall itself is a beautiful venue and NYC at Christmastime is always amazing. Wish the show had been better.

Radio City Christmas Spectacular---great show!!!. This is the 2nd time I've seen the show and I would see it again... over and over! It's well done, keeps all ages entertained, and who doesn't like the Rockettes?!?! The auditorium is much larger than you would expect from outside and the seats are pretty comfortable (even for those of us with longer legs). Popcorn and a drink were included in our group tickets, but I didn't buy any other souvenirs so I can't comment on that process or cost. Overall, we were all pleased with the performance and experience as a group.

Rockettes were a terrific 'kick off' to Holiday Season. We recently attended the Rockette's Holiday Review at Radio City Music Hall. This was my first time seeing the Rockettes and I was impressed with the quality of their holiday production. Everything was terrific - we especially enjoyed their amazingly synchronized dancing, dazzling costumes and creative staging. Additionally, the staff were incredibly kind and helpful. My mother was in a wheelchair and they went out of their way to ensure she was well taken care of. The experience put all of us in a wonderful holiday state of mind.

Radio City Xmas Spectacular - lots of fun. i really enjoyed this show and thought it was tastefully done. The Rockettes are amazing at what they do and it was great to see a full range of their dancing abilities. I would highly recommend this to anyone in NY around the holiday season, regardless of your age.What I would not recommend was the merchandise and photos with Santa and / or a Rockettes which were very over priced.
AMAZING. Fantastic way to kick off Christmas - my 17yr old was not happy about going until she saw the show and was blown away. Very talented dancers and a fab experience
wonderful show. it gets better and better every year- the Christmas show is a must see for anyone visiting BYC this time of year.

Christmas Spectacular, Radio City. We had a wonderful time at the Christmas Spectacular Show. We attended the November 28th show, which was a great way to start of the Christmas season. The rockettes are amazing and have worked so hard to put on such a fantastic show. We were amazed!!!

Radio City Christmas Spectacular Starring the Rockettes. It’s great entertainment for all ages. From the 3D animation at the start to the end, it was a highly entertaining show and a great way to get in the Christmas mood. There were 14 scenes including one of “The Nutcracker” and the famous “The Parade of the Wooden Soldiers”. The Rockettes were perfect in their dance routines. If you get to the show early enough, you can also get your photo taken with a Rockette in the Radio City Hall mezzanine.

Rockettes Christmas Show. Great show. All I expected and more. Loved the Toy Soldier act.Wonderful evening with the family. The popcorn was very reasonable and great to buy a beer to drink while watching the show. Lovely evening to introduce the children to theater.
An Icon. We saw the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular and it was a great show. The venue is gorgeous, and I'm so glad I finally got to visit it after all these years!
Magical. Second year in the row seeing the Christmas show. We loved it, the show is for young and old. Nothing gets you in the holiday spirit like this fantastic production.

Magical moment. I went to the show with my family - wife and kids age 6 and 9 and we all loved it!! Dancing was fantastic and we had a great time. The show was 90 minutes in length and that was perfect for young kids. Overall, the show was SPECTACULAR.

Christmas Spectacular - Wow, what a show!. Of course, it's The Rockettes and they were, as always, perfect and amazing. However, the actual story and the special effects and the scenery and the 3D effects and the music, and...I could go on but I need only tell you that my 5 year old granddaughter sat mesmerized for the whole show. That's a hard act to follow.
the Christmas Spectacular show. we went to the 2pm show it was absolutely fantastic, the 3 D santa ride was great, the dancers fab just the whole package, if you get the chance to go its a must

Wow!. Christmas Spectacular is amazing! We had seats in the middle about ten rows back and the were perfect. Those rockettes are so talented, the costumes are incredible and the show flies by in no time. Really good and will go again.

Much Better Than Expected. We booked our tickets in June for Thanksgiving week. Had great seats on row QQ. Our first time in Radio City Music Hall. What a beautiful building and theater. Had very low expectations of the Christmas Spectacular show and we were all completely surprised at how wonderful it was. Great story, great staging and of course, great dancing. I highly recommend this show to anyone in town to see it.
Rockettes Christmas Show. Loved every moment. Staff were friendly and helpful. We were on the top tier and the view was still amazing. Not a bad seat anywhere. Put the show on your list while in NYC.
Christmas Spectacular - awsome . If I could I ell give 20 stars. One of the most amazing shows to go with your kids. Adults and kids under 2 years will enjoy the show.

Christmas Show...Never grows "old". Haven't seen this since I was a kid. Special Black Friday outing with my wife. It's like I never left. They did not disappoint! Even the 5 minute 3-D Glasses part with Santa flying to NYC was a great Special Effect! The Rockettes are....well, the Rockettes were the Rockettes! Lord only knows how much they practice to get that Perfect level of Synchronization down pat. Not to be missed if you bother to plan in advance!

Radio City Music Spectacular. Having lived in NYC for about 7 months, this is my first Christmas and I am definitely enjoying it. I went here on the night of Thanksgiving and it was a great thing to do. The people, the atmosphere, the show, were all superb. It will definitely going on the list of Holiday traditions!

Beautiful venue ~ fully enjoyed the Christmas Spectacular!. We enjoyed the Radio City Christmas Spectacular on Thanksgiving Day. Good stuff - very entertaining!If you're planning to visit Rockefeller Center (Top of the Rock), stop there to get your tickets & select a time for after the Christmas Spectacular. This made for a great time at both places!

A true spectacular!. Seeing the Christmas Spectacular for the first time my friend and I were truly impressed. There was never a lull during the entire show- nonstop entertainment. The Rockettes of course are the main attraction and the stars of the show. Their routines and dancing abilities are legendary. Highly recommend!
The Christmas Show. This show was beautiful and extremely well done. The Rockette's were flawless and the music was wonderful.

Christmas Spectacular. This was one of the best shows I could have taken my daughter to. She was mesmerized by the dazzling choreography and the elaborate set changes on stage. The program was well thought out and did a nice job of balancing traditional winter concert music with spiritual seasonal music. Radio City Music Hall is a great venue. If you get a chance to go you should!

Radio City Christmas Spectacular. I remember seeing this show as a child, and the magic is still there! The 3D parts were amazing, especially the one with the Rockettes on a tour bus going through parts of Manhattan. The Rockettes' dancing is still a great show. The Nativity was very nice, but less impressive than I remembered (but I guess real camels and donkeys and sheep seem bigger when you are a kid!) My husband had never seen this show and really enjoyed it. Our seats were very comfy. They allow you to take photographs during the show. The show lasts 90 minutes. Very well organized admission and seating.

WONDERFUL AND SPECTACULAR SHOW. You will never want to miss this wonderful show even if you've seen it before! The Rockettes are absolutely amazing and entertaining...so talented. I loved the show and will always continue to go see it every year. The souvenirs are a bit expensive but if you're a visitor to New York, you should buy at least one to remind you of the show. The singing and dancing is very entertaining and really gets you in the holiday spirit!

The best Christmas event ever. I ive in California but try to make it to NY every year to see the Rockett's Christmas Spectacular. I've brought family and business colleagues from Europe, Canada and the US whenever possible and they all loved it too. My daughter has attended since she was young and she is now 14 years old. When on business, I attend the show alone. Great dancing, amazing sets, and a true celebration of Christmas. I've seen the traveling show in California twice but it hasn't come in several years. I highly recommend this for everyone!

free tickets. My wife recently won 2 tickets to the Christmas Spectacular during a seminar in NYC. Neither of us had ever been so we went even though it was on a weekday morning at 11:00 am. We walked up about 40-45 mins early and easily got through the ticket holders line. You cannot bring any drinks inside, just FYI you must finish them or throw them away. The seats were comfortable and the show seemed to start on time. It is non-stop for nearly 90 mins. Fortunately, there were only 2 people in the entire 4 rows in front of us which made it easier to watch the show. Unfortunately, we were both a bit sick and the show wasn't as easy to enjoy with clogged sinuses, etc. Choreography is fantastic, it was a bit more kid oriented than I expected not knowing what to expect. There was a 3D part early on that was neat where you are flying through the city, they provide glasses. We sat in the 2nd Orchestra section off to one side and the view was fine, would be better from the middle of course. It was the least cramped seating I have experienced in the local places like when I saw The Addams Family, Mamma Mia! and Spider-Man: Turn off the Dark. I'd definitely return to this location.

Christmas Spectacular is always amazing. I've seen this show 3 times in 15 years and I still love it. Music, dancing, sets, are all so amazing. It's a great show to really put you in the Christmas spirit.Radio City Theater is the most comfortable theater I've been in. Seats are comfy and the amount of legroom is very generous.

Christmas Spectacular. Loved the show and the 3D part with Santa! Lovely theatre! Could feel the magic just waiting for the show to start! The 90 minute show flew by so fast. Only thing I didn't like were the pricey souvenirs and the rest rooms on the lower level.
Rockettes Christmas Show. This was simply spectacular! The show was everything I'd wished for and more! Amazing costumes, beautiful sets and even snow. A dream come true!!!

Spectacular Christmas Show. We saw a great show at Radio City Music Hall. We were there for the 9:30 showing of the Christmas Spectacular. I was in awe seeing the Rockettes live for the first time. My daughter and husband loved it, too. My 12 year old son....not so much, he fell asleep...hmmm. It was interesting that the show started prior to everyone being seating, but I guess this is a show and not a play. Fortunately, we were in our seats enjoying, but others were still shuffling in to the theater. The seats were super comfy and the theater was nice and big. It was a fun night. I am glad that we finally experienced Radio City Music Hall.

rockettes get you in the mood for Christmas. the Rockettes show at radio city music hall is wonderful. I have seen it 4 times and it is magical each time I see it. They change the show each year and I have seen traveling shows and 3 at radio city. if you can see it at least once in the city, you will not be disappointed.

Christmas spectacular starring the Rockettes is Spectacular!!. I tried to get tickets online while in NYC, but because I am Canadian ticket master wouldn't allow me to. I ended up walking to the ticket booth at radio city and the teller honored the ticket master deal of buy one get one tickets! The staff are very professional and the atmosphere in the building is exhilarating and we'll decorated. Adult beverages were perfectly spiked. The title of the show I saw says it all. If the Christmas spectacular doesn't get you in the Christmas spirit I don't know what would! The songs, the decorations, the seamless synchronization of the Rockettes, the characters we all love this time of year you are sure to love and enjoy.

Always fantastic!!. Enjoyed the Christmas Show and loved it again- always fun. We had great seats and concierge was friendly as well. Snacks and drinks a little pricey but so worth it. Their candy cane drink is yummy and perfect this time of year =)Even though we have seen this show before, there are new things and the scenery and set is wonderful. Loved the snowflakes and the nostalgia of it all!!

Radio City Christmas Spectacular is Phenomenal!. I took my son to see the Radio City Christmas Spectacular in NYC on Veterans Day and we absolutely loved it. We got there early and were able to get a picture with one of the Rockettes. The show has a little something for everyone - including a 3D portion. My son wanted to see it again right away! I highly recommend putting this one on the holiday agenda. We purchased our tickets in advance online and it made it easier to get in. Note that there are no refunds for the online purchases, but they have a resale sight to help you recoup some of the money if you have to cancel after purchase.

The Christmas Show. We went to an early showing of the "spectacular", and weren't disappointed. There are lots of new things, pushing large scale audience involvement up a notch from the time before (radio controlled snowflakes!!). The athleticism and grace of the dancers removed this show from the realm of kitch and nostalgia, and created a sense of wonder for the adults in our party. Of course, the children got all Christmas-sed up, and are now scribbling their lists. Avoid the ultra-high priced candy offerings, and come early to enjoy the sheer Deco glory of RCMH.

Love, love, love The Christmas Spectacular!. This is one of the best shows out for the holidays. The shiw and the dancers are amazing. I would recommend this show to any age group 5-95. I guarantee you will love it.

Christmas Show. Amazing...Wonderful...Precise...Technology...DancersYou will never see the full Radio City Music Hall show in another city. The sets and technology enhance the already spectacular historic building which enhances the precision of the Rockets. Great show for young and old.

Best Christmas Show ever!. From first curtain to last, the Christmas Spectacular held the interest of each member of our group, from age 5 to 62! The Rockettes are always awesome, but this time, the dancers opened dressed as LIVE reindeer and they closed with a touching Nativity scene that put the Christmas meaning back into the performance. Whether you were down in the orchestra or up in the balcony, the 6,000 in the audience roared with approval. Have been at Radio City Christmas Shows before, but have never enjoyed more than in 2014.
Rockettes!. We saw the Christmas show. I t was wonderful! The rockettes are awesome! The stage set, the special effects were so cool! We were in the balcony, I wish we were closer.

Great Christmas show. We bought our tickets the day of the show, 4 seats, fairly close to the front, good seats. The show was fun! Great for families, thoroughly entertaining. 1 1/2 hour show, great movement of patrons in and out, and great staff. Just pure fun.

Christmas Spectacular at Radio City- please don't miss it!. This is a classic christmas event that shoul be a must see at this time of the year. I don't have words to express the beauty of this show. Please, If you have to decide among the so Many shows available here, don't miss this one. You will feel a Child again and believe that dreams may come true!

Fantastic!. Me and my partner went to see the 7:30pm Christmas Spectacular show on the 14th NOV. We sat on the third mezzanie on row C, which were great seats, we could see everything! There is no need to purchase the expensive tickets for the lower levels! I absolutely loved the show and would 100% go to see it again, but my boyfriend wasn't that impressed.We paid full price for the tickets, but there are girls around Times Square giving out a $50 discount! Go and see it!

The best show we have seen. From the time we entered the line to pick up our tickets until we were seated in the orchestra seats row RR, the staff were courteous and friendly, then the show began!! Brilliant choreography, music, lighting and great sound. Audience was captivated until the end.. The Rockettes were spectacular!! A must do for anyone in NYC..

Amazing show! This exceeded my expectations with every single act!. This is probably one of the best shows I've ever seen! The Rockettes are amazingly talented and the production and all of it's technical and special effects make this an incredibly memorable holiday experience... including drone snow flakes! My wife and I loved it. Very much worth the ticket price... and take your kids!

Christmas Spectacular - Still the best show in town. If you come to New York and have time for only one show, go to see the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular. It may be cheesy and touristy, however, it is all you want from Broadway - sing, dance, special effects and of course RADIO CITY MUSIC HALL!

Christmas Spectacular!!. Saw the Christmas show and it was fabulous!! We had orchestra row seats ( received a special code for buy one ticket get one free) The special effects were great! Very nice way to start the holiday season!

Still has the magic. The show was absolutely wonderful and the Rockettes are a national treasure. The only problem is the lack of bathroom especially for women. The Christmas show gets the holiday season off to a wonderful start.
Rockettes Christmas Show. My wife and I went to the Rockettes Christmas show. What a great production. Glad we made it a priority to see while we were in New York.
Glitz and glam on NYC. Radio City Christmas spectacular with the amazing rockettes. What a show! Those rockettes are absolutely amazing! Radio city is also a wonderful place to visit.
Christmas Extravaganza. What a wonderful show! Went with my son and daughter who truly loved it. Unique, traditional, flambouyant and hugely enjoyable!

Very good . We went to see the Rockette Christmas Spectacular. It was amazing! Show was great. It was a little hard to get in and many people weren't to their seats when the show began. We saw a rat in the isle!!! I'm not one to complain, but a rat?!? I guess you can't do anything about it. Other than that, I loved it.
If you can visit. We got tickets off groupon for the rockettes amazing show but so is the venue you have to see it to believe it.

Truly defines "Christmas Spectacular!". Whatever you may envision as the ultimate Christmas holiday show, The Christmas Spectacular at Radio City will far exceed your expectations. Utilizing amazing visual and technical capabilities and covering every conceivable aspect of Christmas, this show is a must-see if you are visiting the city at this time if year. Do you think about the nativity? About rag dolls and tin soldiers? About the excitement of Christmas in N.Y.? Or Santa's workshop? Or scenes from the Nutcracker? Can you imagine a creatively stunning experience that covers it all and more, accompanied by a full orchestra and a talented cast of singers and dancers along with the perfect synchronization of the Rockettes? From a 3-D ride on Santa's sleigh, to fireworks, to huge snowflakes that float out over the audience, the show is a jaw dropping WOW from the time it starts to the closing scenes, leaving you to ask, "How do they do it?" and planning when you can come back again.

Raving about those Rockettes. We wanted to see "The Rockettes Christmas Spectacular". It was amazing. It was flawless throughout and when the toy soldiers did their routine, it was awesome. There was a segment near the beginning where we had to put on the 3D glasses they had given us. That was fun.We bought our six tickets for the upper level in the third row back. We were all happy that we sat there because the show was action packed and if we had've been in the lower levels, I think that some of the view would have been missed. So...by all means, purchase those balcony seats and enjoy the show. More expensive may not be the best seats here.The 4 and 7 year old children with us were mesmerized the whole time. The Santa routine was especially enjoyed by them.Loved it all. Thanks alot for the memories!!

Christmas Spectacular 2014 is Wonderful. Spent eight days in New York City enjoying shows and of course the Radio City Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes. Not only did the Rockettes do a wonderful job, but Santa Clause narrated the show and there was ballet, march of the toy soldiers, and great music. While we adults really enjoyed the show, the kids around us also had a wonderful time. It is about an hour and three quarters long, with several show times. Lots of fun for all.

Rockettes Christmas Show. What a terrific show!! With the addition of 3D Surprises for the young as well as old. This year's show is sure to please all ages.You might do better on ticket prices by getting them at Radio City the day of the show when they open ticket sales. We saved, I believe, $15.75 per ticket. Enjoy!

Love it❤️. This is an iconic American venue.Always fun.Never disappointsDo the CHRISTMAS show. Wonderful After the visit or show wander down to Rockefeller Plaza and watch the crowds. During winter the ice rink is fun

The Rockettes Christmas Show. What can I say? Spectacular and well choreographed it was an experience well worth checking out. Plenty of children for this institution. It's obvious that a lot of time and money has been expended on this show. There is a 3D experience near the beginning and 'snow' at the end. 90 minutes of non stop music and fun!

Totally Enjoyable. We went to see their Christmas Show, primarily because we thought our seven year old granddaughter would enjoy it. I am not embarrassed to admit that we enjoyed it just as much as she did. A great spectacle, beautifully planned and faultlessly executed. I only wish they could collect people's mobile phones at the entrance.

Christmas amazement. NYC 1st timer I'm worried I have spoiled myself by seeing this brilliant festive show. Dripping in sequins, glitter and Christmas style, the show (without interval) has everything you would want to start the season. Brilliant choreography danced with ruthless precision by the outstanding Rocketts. A 3D sleigh ride over NYC, an abbreviated Nutcracker, a full Nativity with real animals & a non-creepy Santa holding it all together as main narrator. Radio City itself is a wonderful space.

Seriously - Don't miss this at Christmas!. I thought it would be cheesy, but I was blown away at the production values, the precision of the dancing, the fun themes, the 3D Santa tour, and the smiles on the kids around us! Yes, it's a bit pricey, but it was a visual treat worth every cent. It wasn't too crowded, we got great seats. The Rockettes are on stage for most of the show, and how they remember all those dance routines and have all that energy is beyond me. They are consumate performers with astonishing talent. Some of the routines are new, but many are the traditional ones you expect, and don't fail to delight everyone. (They had a video game portion, which they could have left out, but kids seemed to enjoy it.) Even though were were all adults, we all left with smiles on our faces. Like all the great Christmas traditions, if we are in NYC for any part of the season, we will go back. Don't miss this - seriously, it is such a New York Christmas event that you will be sorry you didn't go.
NYC Classic. We saw the Christmas Spectacular for the first time. Such a wonderful and creative experience. Highly recommend it!!

Spectacular, indeed!. I can't believe I have never seen this show in my 28 years of existence! From the moment I entered Radio City, it felt magical and Christmasy. Going in November was definitely a good idea as it wasn't as crowded as the December crowds.The Rockettes are spectacular and the music really gets you in the Christmas spirit. Definitely worth a visit and I plan on returning!

Christmas Spectacular. We went to the show this past week, we had Groupon 50% off tickets( $45 each) which made it more affordable for a family of four. Using Groupon does limit your options both in date of show and seating, but for me the trade off was worth it. (My boys (9 and 7)not so much. I think closer to Christmas might have made it better for them. The 9 year old rated the performance 3.5 out of 5. They were just as impressed with the Toys R Us on Times Square!) We sat in the Orchestra level along the side, if you buy tickets here get as close to the center aisle as possible. I was right on the aisle and the very left part of the stage was cut off. No big deal really, you don't miss much. The show itself is wonderful, lots of old standards presented in a new way. The 3-D portion is really well done and adds depth to the stage show. The lighting is great, the orchestra ( a full live orchestra) is fantastic and of course the dancing is impeccable: these are the Rockettes! If you are visiting from out of town this is a must see. Note: you can not bring any food or drinks in , bags are checked and we had to throw away some bottles of water.All in all this is a great show.

Radio City Music Christmas Show. Just came home from New York. Our trip took us to Radio City Music Hall to see the Christmas Spectacular. This was a fantastic thing to do. The show was amazing. It was worth the trip from Boston. We were in the first row of the Mez. and they were spectacular seats. Colorful, beautiful music, Santa, and a 3D show that made it so much fun. Little children came in there Christmas outfits. All in all it was so worth it. My favorite part was the Rocketts. They are true althetes in dance. The precision!! I don't want to spoil it but the end brings the glory and marvel of the season to life. Just check out the real life animals on stage. Merry Christmas even if its early it gets you into the wonders of Christmas.....Only complaint is the bathrooms. Long long lines so go early....We went early. The theater is beautiful inside and we wanted to explore. We found at the 51st entrance a back stage tour. We took it. It was about an hour. It took you to the back scenes of the building, not the stage. You did see the private box of Rockie, a private lounge and met with a Rockette. It was very interesting. They told a lot about the history of the building and the shows that were held at Radio City. I would not take young people they may find it a bit boring but we enjoyed it (50 somethings). There are stairs to climb.
Rockettes Christmas Show. Fantastic - for all agesI have not seen another show like it - Magical. An addition to the 'must do' list.

A kick for the X-mas spirit.. We got ticket through an agency the day of the show for the Xmas Spectacular since we couldn't get through the theater's own site. The show was spectacular even though a little pricey. These Rockettes will certainly kick you into the X-mas spirit.

Deffiantely spectacular!. The Christmas Spectacular was absolutely amazing! We paid a lot for tickets at the very front of the first balcony but I'd recommend paying the money because the seats were fabulous. The Rockettes created a true spectacle for all ages and it kept us entertained throughout. The 3D part of the show was really good too, and the gift shop sold beautiful Christmas decorations which we couldn't resist. I would recommend anyone visiting New York over Christmas to see the show, it was truly memorable and something I'd love to see again.

Spectacular Christmas Show. I went with my 73 yr old mother and 11 yr old son and we all were glued to our seats from start to finish for a solid hour and a half with no breaks. I've seen the show in the past but it has been totally revamped from start to finish and its so much better. Its truly spectacular just like that name says. My son rates this show 11 out of 10. Go!!!

Many, many lights. a place where a plethora of lights will make it visually amazing. there can be a plethora of people as well, so if you are coming here at a set schedual, be sure to arrive early. glitz & glamour take all here. a true american location.
Excellent The Roquettes Again. Must see in this christmas season in New YorkWell organized, On time Show The show is using of high tech visuals,lights,sound Excellent synchronization by the Roquettes

Christmas Spectacular. We saw the Rockettes in the Christmas Spectacular on opening day (second show matinee). The Rockettes lived up to their reputation and Santa was cute too. I was especially impressed with the live nativity scene. Great show for kids, and a beautiful venue.

Rockette's Christmas Show Superb. Radio City Music Hall is such an iconic building and being inside is a great experience, but add the Rockettes, their Christmas Show and you have a night of fantastic entertainment. Better than the show we saw on Broadway.

It is a good introduction to the lights and music of Manahattan. If you are a new visitor to Manhattan it is probably something to do - it is glitzy and sparkly and shiny, things you can talk to your friends about afterwards. I went with a friend from South Africa who was visiting her sister, and the 3 of us had a hard time staying awake during their Christmas Spectacular. I actually was the only one who made it without closing my eyes during the whole show, but I felt like it several times. There's no story, just pretty girls parading in almost perfect synchronicity. I think it is a very good show if you are into this kind of attraction.
Rockettes lived up to their reputation. Christmas show was worth the $240 I paid for 2 tickets. The soft drink that I paid $5.50 for was not.

Christmas Show!. This is the first time I have been back to the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Show in 30 years! I bought my husband and daughter and we all loved it. It is amazing how generation after generation this traditional lives on and I hope we get to come back next year after the tree is decorated that would be even more fun. Keep up the good work Rockettes!

Christmas Spectacular was just that and more.. We were able to bring two of our grandchildren (ages 11 & 14) to their first experience in NYC and the experience of seeing the Radio City Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes had their eyes popping all afternoon. Even for someone who's seen the performance in the past, the show was fresh and lively and the Music Hall is still one of my favorite spots in NYC. This show should be on everyone's "bucket list" of things that must be experienced in their lifetime. Hope to bring two more of the younger grandchildren here next year.

Christmas Spectacular. The show was great. It does take a long time to get into the building, because they check everyones bag to make sure you don't have food or drinks. Once in it was easy to find your seat. The line for the ladies bathroom is crazy, but mens room had no line as usual. The show starts on time, so be in your seat a little early. Stroller parking is available for free inside the venue. Kids loved the show, and feel it was worth the money.

I'd fly back to NYC just for their Christmas Spectacular!. This fabulous Art Deco gem should be on everyone's to do list, whether to see a show or to go on a back-stage tour. I would defy anyone not to be impressed, not only by the sheer scale of this 6,200 seat theatre, but also its elegance, beauty, and history. I've just experienced the Christmas Spectacular for the first time, and I would go every year from now on if I could! It was truly amazing, with huge lavish and clever sets, fabulous big band music, and of course the legendary Rockettes - their fantastic precision makes the dancing set pieces look effortless, when you just know how much hard work they must put in to make it look so good, and to be so entertaining - fabulous fun, and a lovely start to the Christmas season.

Tour and Christmas Show were fantastic. Having taken the tour around this iconic building and seen the famous Rockettes dance group in rehearsal for their legendary Christmas Show, we couldn't wait to see the actual show itself a few days later. The gorgeous art deco building is a wonderful setting for this spectacular traditional event, and the Rockettes are reputedly the finest chorus girls in the USA. So enjoyable, it was aptly called "Joy to the World."

The best of the best! Christmas Spectacular. Wow! Family tradition or first time, go to see this show. I sat in the front row a few years ago and this time I sat way up high. There's no such thing as a bad seat at Radio City; so, do not put off seeing it if you cannot afford Orchestra seats.

A little hokey, but a NY signature. We visited because my wife has been bugging me to go for ages. The Rockettes are a NY tradition. There were some moments that were truly amazing, like the march of the nutcrackers. There was an interesting story woven throughout with Santa and two kids. It was very cool to see a live camel walking across the stage at the end as part of the nativity. I wouldn't see it twice, but worth a visit once. OK - here's a hint. The lines for the bathroom are long long long, especially for the ladies. Go first, and have a nearby place to visit afterwards.

What a way to start the holiday season!. Dazzling, spectacular and memorable. What more can be said about the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Show starring the Rockettes? it was an hour and a half of shear pleasure. The use of 3-D glasses during one number was a lot of fun as were the bubble encased snowflakes floating over the heads of the audience. The costumes were fabulous and the choreography fantastic. So glad we were finally able to enjoy this wonderful show.

Christmas Spectacular!!!. first visit to the christmas spectacular with 5yr old twins- AMAZING show- old school rockets and santa, dancing, snow, rain dear, etc- the sound, the show, the feeling- brings you back to old NYC christmas and everything works perfectly- beautiful hall and just a great show- all the seats give you a great view so don't worry about getting too close- in fact the higher seats give you a better view of the entire stage and things that go on around the stage- A MUST IN NYC!!!

Great show. The Christmas show was great fun and truly put us in the festive spirit!The Rockettes were flawless and having never been to the venue before I was impressed with the size and seats we had in the orchestra section.

Christmas Spectacular in every sense. My friends recommended we catch the show. Our family decided to do it the right way and traveled to NYC. The venue and the show were fantastic. Wonderful effects, Rocket dancers delivered and spectacle was divine. We loved it.

Must see New York City experience. 90 minutes of pure Christmas enjoyment for the family. It is always great to see the rockettes do their famous routines. Read other reviews and go to the website for more information (I can't do it justice). The tickets can get expensive as you get closer to Christmas so try to get tickets in November or get weekday tickets. Try going to coupon sites to get promo codes where you can get good discounts (I managed to get tickets for $39.5 for a Sunday performance). Ticketemaster fees are very high but you can avoid them if you get tickets at the Radio City box office. Orchestra level seats are good if you are close to the stage and in the middle, the back seats are rather far away so you might as well get the first mezzanine which is good since it overhangs the orchestra seats.Parking is always hard to find around the holidays so avoid it by taking public transportation or try parkwhiz or get there early where parking lots have $25 deals for 4 hour parking.

The ushers need to learn the seat map of the theater . I LOVED The Christmas Show.I am still furious about the fact that we were moved twice after the show was started. We were fifth in line when the doors opened. WE WERE NOT LATE! The ushers sat us in the wrong section. They work at the theater they should know the seat map. We were moved after the first act came on. Then they tried to move is again. Then they realized their mistake. And be prepared for the staff seating late comers during the show and interrupting your show! Had I not flown in town, and spent a ton of money for this trip it would not be a big deal!
