Study the seat map before you go! The show is amazing!

Management should be ashamed - GREAT ROCKETTES PERFORMANCE. First, the performance was amazing. The ROCKETTES moved with perfect precision. It was enjoyable watching the children's (& adult's) faces .MANAGEMENT SHOULD BE ASHAMED!Arrived at the theater on Fri. 7 Nov. 45 minutes prior to the 730pm performance to find the queue wrapped around the building and longer than 2 blocks long. The queue did not move until 7pm. Thousands of guests wanting to get to their seats began pushing once inside was very chaotic and DANGEROUS. Their were many children and elderly guests caught in the pushing. As the band began to play, the majority of guests were still attempting to get to their seats and the pushing worsened. We arrived at our seats on the main floor just after the ROCKETTES took the stage. For the next 15 minutes, views were interrupted as guests found their seats. This is not the first performance at this historic venue. It will unfortunately, be my last. Horrific way to treat your customers. Shame on you. This should have been enjoyable and you ruined many people's evenings.

A Fun Time at the Christmas Spectacular. Very enjoyable performance by the Rockettes! The beautiful Christmas music by the liveorchestra was terrific as well as the scenery on the stage. The beginning of the performance opened with a brief moment where the audience used 3-D glasses, definately a nice touch. The performance was hosted by Santa, of course, and it concluded after 90 minutes. Definately enjoyable for adults and kids under ten.

Christmas Spectacular!. We took our 6 1/2 year old granddaughter and daughter to see the Christmas show in early November to take advantage of a Groupon special. Our granddaughter gave the show 2 thumbs up-a rare honor. My husband and I hadn't seen the show since our daughters were young, and thought it has changed over the years, we would give it 2 thumbs also. The dancing is out-of-this world. Flying with Santa in 3-D is new. The live nativity scene has lasted the ages. The Christmas message given by Santa is timeless.

Spectacular is the right word. A powerful show that blew us away!!. We just watched the show this evening. It blew us away. There is so much put into the show. The lights, sound. Even the ceiling comes alive. The rockettes precision is incredible. Ignore the messages saying it's for children. It's not - 2/3rds or more of audience were/are adults. You don't have to be a kid for the magic of Christmas to shine through in this show and touch your heart. It made our last night in New York a perfect end and left is with a wonderful memory. Don't miss it.

RADIO CITY ROCKETTES!!. My favorite holiday tradition is definitely seeing the rockettes at radio city! If you're in town for the holiday season, you have to see them! It's a great way to set off the festivities! Radio city is beautiful and truly a once in a lifetime experience!
Christmas Spectacular is a must see . They don't do things by halves with a Rockettes show. The Christmas Spectacular was just that - spectacular! A must see show for Christmas. Children loved it.

Very Interesting Tour. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour of this NYC icon. It has been refurbished beautifully in the art deco period and seeing the behind the scenes was very interesting. Meeting a Rockette was a highlight and the tour was good value for money. Be aware though that there are quite a lot of stairs to climb as the lifts don't access all the areas.

all year round attractions. the radio city music hall puts on shows etc all year long . lets not forget their annual x-mas show ,which parents & kids love to see each year. oh then their are the rockettes . i rest my case.

Tour of Radio City Dazzles. The Art Deco building and the mechanics behind the stage is reason alone to check out this spot. The back stage door tour, complete with a visit with a Rockett adds further glamour, Can only imagine how cool it would be to see the dress rehearsal for the Christmas Show as the tours keep on during regular show staging. We did this on our last morning before we left NY as it was a timed schedule thing we could fit in and was walking distance to our Marriott Midtown east hotel. It was a nice slice of a NY staple and certainly dazzled.
Awesome. Lots of history. If you are here over the Christmas holidays, the Christmas Spectacular is a must see. Get your tickets early.

Beautiful Art Deco theather.. As visited this theatre for the first time I was overwhealmed by its grandeur and beauty.Like you travell back to the roaring tenties. Splendid preserved decorations and ornaments.
nice old school music venue. nice older style building that is worth a visit.nice when lit up at night. tour is a little expensive but worth it

AGT at Radio City. Thrilled with the level of organization, friendliness of staff, cleanliness of facility. America's Got Talent was a free event, and we were so impressed with the kind caring staff on board for the event.

Gorgeous!. This is such a beautiful and elegant venue for a concert or show.All Orchestra seats are good seats! Only down side is, depending on crowd, concerts can be a bit lame if you want to get up and dance. i sat in the 4th row for Donna Summer years ago and the usher asked me to sit because people behind me couldnt see. FIVE minutes later, Donna Summer herself said GET UP! Priceless!
Rasuo. This building is done up to pretty at Christmas it's a very great place thee is a tv studio on the ground floor sports shows I believe

Loved the history of Radio Music Hall. I went to Radio Music Hall when I missed out on Letterman. The tour guide, Jacquie, was very knowledgeable about the history of the building and the Rockettes. I learned so much and am very happy that I decided to do this tour at the last minute.

worth the visit. we had some free time so wandered over to Radio City Music Hall and took the hour long guided tour of the theater. The history, meeting a Rockette and architecture was so interesting. Our tour guide, Sean, had a vivacious personality and made the tour fun as well as informative. The groups are small (only 6 on our tour) so there is lots of time for questions from the tour participants.

Take the Tour.... I strongly recommend that one takes the Guided Tour of this magnificent complex. It is like walking into a history book, replete with the world's most famous entertainers. Meeting a Rockette is a real bonus too...We were fortunate to watch a rehearsal of an upcoming 'America's Got Talent' show, while we were there. Our guide Alvin, deserves full credit for making it an unforgettable experience.

The Rockettes were Rocking!!. We went to see the Rockettes christmas spectacular and it really was spectacular!! No wonder this show has been running for so many years... it really got my boyfriend and I into the christmas spirit!

Do Not Miss the Tour. Good value and not to be missed. The tour was well organised, and the guide informative. Buy the tour tickets from the gift shop next door.The interior was restored to it's former Art Deco glory in 1999. In addition to the theatre, the tour includes a visit behind the stage, a meeting with a Rockette and the VIP suite. The architecture and art is stunning.

Best Concert Venue!!!. We saw Bastille in concert here and it was epic! I would suggest if you can't afford floor seats get the second mezzanine its stadium seating so there was no bad views. extremely over priced drinks and food get dinner before you go! Also bring a water bottle you can fill it up at the water fountains.

Throughly enjoyed it. I saw the Christmas show for the first time and lived it. The building inside is superb, totally over the top, but in keeping. Inside the auditorium, there are organs on each side of the stage. The show, featuring the Rockettes, was wonderful and very festive and I am so pleased I booked and saw it.
Great place to see. Great place to seeVery old style outside but that makes it great to seeNot very busy but great for photos

Interesting. I did not expect much of it, but was gladly surprised. The Radio City Music Hall has a very opulent architecture and decoration.I took the tour and it was very interesting. You also get to take a picture with one of the Rockettes (Music hall dancers that were originated -and still perform- in this amazing theater).The visit takes about an hour, and if you have the New York Pass, it's included. Piece of advise: DO NOT take beverages!! Carpets are super expensive and they do not let you take them with you! I had to throw away my coffee (and I had barely had a sip!).

Fabulous Old Building. As there were no shows on at this venue during our New York visit we decided to take the one hour tour. Plenty of tour times to choose and we thoroughly enjoyed ours at 11.30am. Our guide was fantastic and very informative. The spacious sophisticated building is beautifully maintained in its era and the Rockette story is fascinating. We recommend this great tour to anyone who finds time to enjoy it.

An American Art Deco Classic. This landmark Manhattan Venue has been the scene of a vast amount of history. It is known world wide as the home of the Rockettes,still performing, the scene of many concerts, still in use, and the sport of the NFL and NBA draft classes. Countless red carpet film first has occurred here and every christmas there is a spectacular produced with at least 5 shows daily with legendary performers .The hall itself is decorated with past era grandeur and lots of glitz that make it a great phot ops study. I remember as a child being taken here for the holiday show and loving all of the noise, colors and people that abound here. Tourists routinely take tours through the vast hall and you can sometimes see the animals with their trainers hovering outside the 51st street stage door waiting to perform. An amazing place that should be visited while in the city.

Christmas Spectacular. This show was absolutly amazing great fun for all the family and not a long show around 90 mins,if you are in the city in the winter months go and see it , it will put a smile on your face and the christmas spirit in your heart!!

Rich with beauty and history. Radio City bills itself as "the showplace of the nation", and after this tour I can say that this claim is no exaggeration. This theatre stands alone in its size, beauty, and functionality. We were guided by Alanda who obviously loved her job and and walked us through the incredible artistic and engineering high-points of this landmark. Radio City is a New York must-see, so take this tour and enjoy!

Wow. Just wow.. My wife and I saw the Rockettes on our trip to NYC last Christmas. It was amazing. I had no idea that their show was like that. Those girls could put a military honor guard to shame with their precision. Would highly recommend.

Showtime!!!. One of the coolest Music Halls you are ever going to find. What an awesome history and some many decades of events that have taken place here. You are just taken by its beauty and have to wonder what stars and such have you shared this experience with having been here. A true New York Gem.
Brilliant tour!. We took the tour of Radio City with a fantastically knowledgeable and entertaining guide named Michael. I cannot recommend this tour highly enough to anyone visiting NYC.

Beautiful building. Did the tour as part of the NY Pass, was guided and we met a Rockette. There was a rehearsal underway in the main auditorium for the American version of the X factor and we were allowed to watch that and the dancers rehearsing in another part of the building. The interior of the theatre is beautiful art deco and we were told that it could have been lost forever.

An Amazing Venue. We did not know a great deal about Radio City Hall and only considered the tour after it was discussed in The Rockefeller Centre Tour. An absolute correct decision to join the tour. The associated history and stories of the Hall are simply amazing. The tour explains the significance of the planning and design decisions made and bring life to the theatre. The tour takes you to areas that reflect the ingenuity of the engineers and designers who both built and restored the building. As a tourists we had no idea about The Hall and are so pleased that we know more and will highly recommend at others follow our footsteps and learn about a great American story.

Beautiful building with rude guards, tour with ridiculous extra charges. Radio City Music Hall is a beautiful building. I've been there for the finale of the America's Got Talent and for a Backstage Tour. The building was recently restored, and both the stage and the building are amazing.The Backstage Tour was informative and interesting for the most part. Unfortunately, they don't allow any video, and there's not a chance to remember all the info they give you. It was still educational and entertaining. There were a couple of problems with the tour though. First of all, it doesn't really go "backstage". Yes, it goes to some areas not normally accessible to public, but really it just goes through a few hallways with pictures - that's about it. You don't really go to the areas that the acts use to come on stage, or get to see the hydraulics that operate the stage. I've done Bally's Jubilee backstage tour in Vegas, and that was totally different - you got to go backstage and see how all the props worked, etc. So from that perspective the Radio City tour totally failed. Another really annoying thing about the backstage tour was that while you got to meet a take a picture with one of the Rockettes, they didn't let you use your own camera and charged you $22 for the picture they took! That's in addition to the $25/person admission tickets. I always find that kind of nickel and diming disgusting. OK, you charged me $25 for an hour of a tour of mostly public areas. Fine. But then you won't even let me even take a picture with my own camera? Again, to compare this with a Bally's Jubilee tour, there you got to take a picture with a showgirl fro Jubilee. Actually, the showgirl was your tour guide. And I believe those tickets were only $15/person last year.Taping of America's Got Talent was fun but very poorly organized. We had to wait in line twice - once to exchange the tickets for the vouchers, and once to actually get it. And that was a several-hour line, mind you. However, the worst part of the whole thing were the disgustingly rude security guards. They treated people like cattle, yelling at people, herding people, etc. That really detracted from the experience. I've heard many times that New Yorkers are ruder than folks in other area of the US, but Radio City Music Hall security guards were definitely some of the rudest people I ever had to deal with. Totally nasty.So if you decide to spend your time on seeing a show or doing the backstage tour, I hope this review helps you to set your expectations right. It is an amazingly beautiful building with rude people working there that will nickel and dime you to death.
Cool!. Even though I just walked by it, it was really cool to see it in person! After seeing it on T.V. all the time, it was really neat to see it in person!

Fabulous Building But Ho Hum Tour. As a lover of Art Deco I was really keen to see inside this fabulous building. The building did not disappoint but the hour long tour was about 30 minutes too long for me. I would have like to have seen more of the building and especially the bathrooms, but I was not interested in the back rooms, Rockettes, famous people who played there and stuff like that. A bit more Zing needed.

MUST DO. We went there for the Christmas Show which was amazing. Very much liked that one could buy a cocktail and enjoy it in theater. The show captured your attention from the start and held it all the way. Just when we thought it could not get much better it did. One of our favorite evenings in New York. Just made our Christmas. The ambiance just put a smile on ones face.

Unexpected!. My wife and I decided on the spur of the moment to do the Radio City Music Hall tour. We bought our tickets and weren't expecting much. Was very interesting tour. Beautiful building with so much history. Was time well spent and money well spent. What was the most interesting to me was when returned home and I was telling my elderly father, who happens to have been raised in NYC, I found out his father had been an elevator operator in Radio City Music Hall for many years. So glad I got to see a place that had a person connection to my family that I never knew about.

Excellent tour-met a Rockette!. RadioCity Stagedoor Rockettes Tour was fabulous. Highly recommend this inexpensive tour. We have taken this tour twice now, and each time it was conducted by a tour guide named Alan. He was excellent and very professional and explained the important history and architecture of the Radio City Music hall. At the end of the tour you have the amazing opportunity to meet a real Rockette. The lovely Rockette we met on both our tours was named Becky. She was charming, very professional, well spoken, and answered the many questions our large group asked of her. Not to mention she was dressed in a beautiful Rockette costume and looked stunning. We were also able to pose for a picture w Becky, who kindly instructed us on how to stand so we looked great too! We purchased the reasonably priced photos at the end of the tour and they are our favorite memories from our trip to NYC.

Must see Christmas Show. If you come in the winter, especially in between Thanksgiving(to see parade) and stretch it out to Christmas(or pretty close to Chistmas), its beautiful to walk around. Usually right after Thanksgiving, up goes Christmas. The windows at Macys and Bloomingdale are incredible. Hopefully, snow will fall. But, you need to see Christmas show.Magical. Even the adults feel like children. I live here and I go EVERY year!!
Christmas Spectacular show. I had an amazing experience here I loved the show. The building is amazing I will definitely go back soon and definitely recommend for everyone
A must see. What a great a tour with an awesome tour guide. The theatre is beautiful. While there, we got to see "America's Got Talent" being shot. Included in the tour was a visit with a Rockette.

Behind the scenes tour a must do. We took the tour because we had been to the Christmas spectacular and cirque de sole, we love the place and wanted to know more about the history.Alan took us through the history, the decor, the renovations and I got to cuddle a Rockette what a thrill, he was so nice, passionate about the theatre and his knowledge was boundless, put this on your list....Alan and Penny

Awesome. Radio City Music Hall is a very excellent place to visit the world famous Rockette's put on one amazon Christmas show for the holiday season. I have got a chance to see the show and it very awesome . you get a chance to check it out if your in New York City around the Christmas Holiday.

Fine if there's no other event going on, but.... I attended a Rockette's performance at Radio City Music Hall with my parents a couple of years ago, via a bus trip from RI, and unfortunately, we were not aware that the date and time we picked was the same date and time for the Rockefeller Tree Lighting. We opened the side door to exit the Music Hall to get out into the street, and there were hordes and hordes of people on every side street and main street around the area. We literally had to hold hands to try to get back to the bus that was waiting for us, pushing our way through and trying not to get trampled. It was as I'd imagine it is on New Year's in Times Square, an experience that personally I would avoid at all costs. So good performance, fun to do once, but DO NOT do it when there is another big event in the city. We were lucky to make it back to the bus on time--several people did not.
WOW!!. Awesome tour. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and friendly. He explained and answered our questions. Radio City is full of history and a amazing place to visit while in New York.

Rockettes are Fantastic!. We went during Christmas time to see the annual show.It's a magical experience for everyone, young and old alike. My grandchildren absolutely loved seeing the Rockettes perform. If you're in New York around this time of year, make it a point to see the Christmas show. You'll be happy that you did.
Great time. Best place to go for Christmas holiday..Great way to feel holiday spirit in Nycshow was very interesting
Many shows. Radio City is part of New York. If you come to visit the city, you got to go to a show in Radio City Music Hall.

Very Interesting Tour. I enjoyed the tour of this historic art deco theatre. The interiors were gorgeous and you could just feel the history.Got to see a Rockette and talk about what is involved in being a Rockette.Recommended.

Wonderful tour. This tour of the Radio City hall was excellent. Lasts one hour and the guide gave lots of information about the building. The building is great if you live art-deco and the concert hall is massive.

Breathtaking stage. I took the radio city tour and was taken back by the overall area of the stage of the stage. I had been there for the NFL draft but never quite felt it was a beautiful theater. probably because it was crowded with football fans. back to the tour. The give you a history of the theater and it's inner workings the architecture is Art Deco and it is grand. The technology is up to date even thought some it is the original. You meet a rocket the and take in the history. Some of the views inside are breathtaking. It is well worth the hour of your time. Also the bathrooms are from a more elegant era when theaters were almost like cruise ships

A special experience. Friends took us to the Christmas Show and we were not sure what to expect, it was spectacular! The famous dancers were tremendous and the special effects quite stunning. The theatre itself has lots of stylish features. Altogether a great experience.
Must tour Radio City Music Hall. This should be on your "New York to do" list. The building, history and background looks arelovely, beautiful and informative. Even if you hate tours, this is a must.

Christmas Show. Fantastic visual, dancing and musical performance. Really captures the spirit of the Christmas season. For anyone that truly enjoys the festive Christmas holiday season and just happens to also be in NYC.....this is a must see.

Radio City Music Hall. This is such an iconic part of New York. Visitors to the city as well as residents who have never been here, this is a place you must visit at least once. The interior is beautiful and all the seats have wonderful sight lines. I have attended many concerts here and the Christmas spectacular always makes my to do list.
ASmazing Theatre. Home of the famous rocketed. If you can, take a tour of radio City where you go back stage and they show all the inter workings.

Brought in a new year with Jill Scott!!. Radio City always delivers and being there watching Jill Scott perform is something I will never forget!!!
She was incredible! Luke James opened for her and he was entertaining to watch (not sure what to really say about him...LOL).
great tour. The tour was great behind the scenes of the Hall. The tour guide was very knowledgable and we even ot a picture with one of the Rockettes.

Great venue and tour, be cautious if taking a DSLR camera. My wife and I have been to the Radio City Christmas Spectacular twice and have enjoyed the show and the venue on both occasions. Even if you can't make a show, I would recommend taking the tour or at least stopping by outside for a great photo opportunity.My only hint of caution would be that on our most recent trip, security at the entrance tried to stop us from taking in our DSLR camera that we had been using for pictures throughout the city. They said it was a professional camera and couldn't enter. They offered to check it, but I wasn't comfortable leaving such an expensive item with them. After talking for a few minutes they agreed to let it in, as long as we didn't take pictures during the performance. I would suggest leaving the DSLR at home and taking the point and shoot.

The Tour is Ecellent. I went to see the Christmas Show in RCMH. It was very good, we did the tour the day before and that was really interesting, if you're into music and the arts, you'll enjoy this tour.

El tour es fantastico! Fabulous tour of Radio City!. Hice al tour de Radio City con mi esposa, que es de Argentina, en Abril - fabuloso!! Nos muestran la entrada, en el escanario y salas de descansa, todo en estilo Art Deco! Estupendo!!I did a tour of Radio City with my wife, who is Argentine, in April this year - fabulous! We were shown the entrance, the foyer with a high atrium, all the rooms, the stage and the wonderful rest rooms for both men and women with massive sofas and chairs to rest on. All in Art Dec style - wonderful! It's a must for anyone visiting New York!

Iconic, Elegant, New York!. Enjoyed a wonderful visit to Radio City Music Hall for Dave Chappelle's recent shows. The show was obviously a lot of fun, and RCMH is such a nice venue. The interior space is really simply gorgeous. Even the restrooms were architecturally interesting and beautiful. The staircase is amazing. The lighting provides such a nice ambiance. The theater is stunning as well, and the seats are very comfortable. The place is wonderfully maintained, and you can tell why this is a NYC landmark. I hope to be able to see another show there.
Stage Door Tour. Loved the tour, but meeting the Rockette wasn't so great. She was very rehearsed and not very friendly.

Amazing building and fascinating tour.. Really friendly tour guide (and very knowledgeable) with some fascinating information about the building, history, events etc. Got to see loads of the building and meet a Rockette as well. Highly recommended!
A must see!. We took the "behind the scenes" tour of Radio City Music Hall. It was well worth the time and $. Don't miss it!

They could make it much better…!!!!. This is New York City….they make enough money from every tour group to do something a little more dramatic than walk you around the building and then show you a 10 minute stupid video that has little to do with the site itself….I wouldn't waste your $$$$ on this tour unless you feel you have to see the inside of the building for a few minutes and use their bathroom.They could make the tour so much more fun and exciting if someone really cared about it!!!!

Amusement Hall. Amazing. This is what I want to say about this attraction.During my visit in NYC I traveled around all of the glamorous portions of Manhattan and the beautiful city and fell in love with everything about it. I was fortunate enough to take a tour of the Radio City Music Hall and I have to say that this immaculate, amazing place filled me with passion and even more love for the City.I was with a group of friends and we were able to meet some behind the scenes staff members and see that nooks and crannies of the hall. This was incredible.I would highly recommend visiting this establishment and soaking in every adventure that the city has to offer.Best wishes,Shaun
Radio City Music Hall Christmas Show. Wonderful show by the world-famous Rockettes. Fabulous choreography and execution. Cute story with talented singers. Great family event.

No bad seat in the house. I have attended two events at Radio City Music Hall. The first was seeing "Christmas Spectacular" on a trip to Midtown Manhattan when she was in 2nd grade. The weather was rainy, but it didn't dampen our spirits. We chose premier seating since my niece was with us. It was so great to be up close and personal with what was happening on stage. It is a beautiful auditorium. Being closer kept my niece's attention on the action. The 2nd visit was with adults. We found out then, that all seats are good, and that it is nice to see the action a little further back so that you feel the experience that is being created for you, rather than seeing them create the experience for you closer to the front. Without a doubt, I would return to Radio City Music Hall for other performances. I live in Ohio, so I pack my NEW YORK-Midtown/Theatre visits with as much as I can possibly do. I <3 NYC.
Walked by the Music Hall. I didn't get to go in, just walking by, I would have liked too but didn't have a chance. I will go back the next time I'm in New York City

Unmatched Anywhere in NYC.... My boyfriend and I went to see the Christmas Spectacular. What a show!!! The Rockettes were fantastic but the real star was the Hall itself. Being regular visitors to NYC and having been to almost every Broadway and off-Broadway theater over the years, we had just never seen the Rockettes at RCMH. Boy, were we blown away. The décor of the Hall is elegant and beautiful and the seating is leaps and bounds in comfort and roominess over traditional New York theater seating, with every seat perfectly angled so no one gets a bad view. And the sound...the sound quality of this venue is amazing. The voices stay crystal clear, while the music is studio clean and free of any echos or unintended feedback. Simply perfect. The dancers, well, what can be said?!? They're the Rockettes; the pride of NYC. And like RCMH, they should be.

Special. We went on a tour of the Music Hall in advance of seeing a live taping of America's Got Talent.The history of the Music Hall, as well as the list of performers who have been at the hall, are both impressive and interesting.Everything at Radio City is done for a good reason. The attention to detail and desire to restore the interior to be true to its historical roots is impressive and makes a visit there a pleasure.
Loved the Christmas spectacular. A must see if you go at Christmas. Everything about is is entertaining and the kids love it. It really gets the Christmas spirit going. The dancers are faultless !,

A Must See at Night. Night life is the best to see Radio City. We did see the Rockettes on the top doing a number for America's Got Talent. Busy street scene on Avenue of the America's. All part of the Rockefeller center complex. The complex is massive and there are some charges for some attractions. Did not take in any shows on this trip.

A true part of NYC history. I have taken the tour and also seen the Christmas Spectacular. Both were wonderful. We really enjoyed the behind the scenes tour. It was such an exceptional peek at the rich history this venue has played in this city. Getting to stand on stage and experience the sound and view was really fun!

Wow!. Incredible venue. Wether it's a show or a concert, the seating is great, the sound is very good. Great location too as it is near lots of places to eat and bars, just round the corner from times square

NOTHING COMPARES.... Nothing Compares...First visit in over ten years and the old lady still shines.Everything is large here - the architecture, the high ceilings, the stunning lobby - the incredible theater itself stands alone.Acoustically wonderful. We enjoyed a Yes Concert where each musicians instrument was clearly soundly defined - A pleasure. Seats are spacious and comfortable - so unlike the various Broadway theaters just west or the awful Madison Square Garden. Seat angles are perfect as you're not visually blocked by those in front of you.There is no better place to watch a performance of any kind.

Take the tour. The inside tour was interesting and worth doing. Seeing a show was not an option for us this visit, so this was the next best thing! Tickets were easy to get on the spot at the sweets shop. Our guide was terrific. Good for the whole family.
See the Rockettes. They were amazing to see. We had to wait for two days for tickets,but it was so worth the wait. Even my wife who only went because I wanted to really enjoyed the performance.
I love Radio City Music Hall. Pretty Big, and the staff is great, I always come here for performances and the Christmas Spectacular every year.

Don't leave New York without seeing it!. We had a prescheduled tour of Radio City Music Hall and I liked it a lot more than I thought I would! First of all, the hall itself is amazing, beautiful, and enormous. The tour starts out with wonderful historical facts. The Rockettes are super cool. The tour gives a vivid display of their history. You even get a chance to meet, speak, and take a picture with a Rockette. I didn't take one, but my little girl thought it was neat. The architecture itself and all the stairwells is worth the tour!
Christmas spectacular: highlight of our trip. This was the quintessential christmas in New York experience for me! So american, so festive, so fun! Loved it!

A must see. We decided to take this tour to cool down as it was a hot day. I did know quite a lot about this venue. The lady that showed us round was friendly and able to answer questions. Loved the Art Deco, this building has been looked after. We met a Rockette who was able to answer questions and tell us all about the dance troupe. Had a photo taken which turned out very well.

The Rockettes are the stars of the show!!!. When I was younger my parents used to take me here where they actually presented live stage shows including the Rockettes which was followed by a movie.Since that time things have changed. The Radio City musical hall currently stages the magnificent Christmas spectacular every year between Nov and Dec featuring them, Santa Claus, secondary singers and dancers,and now 3D glasses which you can keep.Radio City musical hall is decked out in an art deco style. During the holiday season they have two grand Wurlitzer organs playing before the show starts.Although they have touring companies of the Rockettes there is no better place to see the full line than at Radio City. Known for their famous unison "kick" they dance with precision and delight audiences of all ages.Each year they change a couple of musical numbers but their famous dances including the 12 days of Christmas, the Nutcracker, the Wooden Soldiers dance complete with the cannon "shooting" the line where they all "fall back" on each other are still intact. They also show a glorious finale production of the Nativity reminding the audience about what Christmas is all about.They normally do 4-5 shows per day due to the short season but is long enough for children and adults alike to enjoy a wonderful stage show with great computer backdrops to use your 3D glasses.I'll never tire of them. They make the visit so worthwhile.

Beautiful historic tour. Took the tour and had Kyle for our guide. This theater was absolutely beautiful and historic! Kyle was the most wonderful guide and had exceptional customer service! A must on your tour list if visiting NYC. Loved it!!!

Absolute glamour, held in its tradition. Highly recommend the guided tour, get to see behind the scenes, stage etc. without the tour you do not appreciate the history and get to be informed.Worth it, would live to see a show here, WOW

Christmas Spectacular!. While in NYC in December we attended the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall, it was excellent! The theater is absolutely beautiful, the show was amazing, and the staff were very helpful. This is truly a must do if you are in NYC in December!

Amazing venue with average guide. The venue itself was amazing. It demonstrates the grandiosity of the deco era but maintains its contemporary feel with ongoing concerts by popular artists. This was a draw for my family with teenagers in that it brings the old and new together. Our guide was okay but was a bit curt and impatient with questions at times. Be aware that there are several stairs to take on the tour
Audio Tour. Our tour guide was wonderful. I hate I can't remember her name but I think it was Joyce. We were very happy with the tour!!!
Fabulous. Loved the tour, so very interesting and are guide was really lovely, will have to come back soon for the Christmas show.
Fantastic!!!!!. An amazing night out, we loved every minute. The show was fantastic, especially the but that was in 3D!!!!!I would of back every year if I could, it was just great!!!!!

Amazing Theatre. Had tour of this back in April fantastic Art Deco building a lot of features retained so feels like you are stepping back in time as the guide mentioned the entrance is as decadent as the old ocean going liners of those days. The theatre itself is just overwhelming no obscured views where ever you sit no wonder the Tony awards are held here. The tour gives you access to almost all the building including back stage and at the end a meeting/photo opportunity with a famous Rockette. I would thoroughly recommend this tour if you are visiting New York especially for the first time like we were. A must on your list of places to go.

Christmas Show. Attended the Christmas Show with my older teenage children, really more suitable for a younger child. Still we enjoyed the show, all thought there was a lot of pressure to buy merchandise on the way into the show.
Dave Chapelle. Great show! Dave Chapelle was funny from the beginning to end. It was well worth the price of admission. We even got a free tshirt afterwards.

Aretha Franklin 14th June. We came to see Aretha in June and she was fantastic. We were in the 2nd Mez row e and was surprised how good the seats were. Spacious compared to others places we have been. The hallways are very grand and you walk around with your head back. There were so many fabulous chandeliers. Some have said the drinks were expensive but we had drinks in other places in NYC that were more expensive than this hall. A Chardonnay wine was $10.50, imported beers $9.50, water and other soft drinks $5.50/6.50. The queues outside were our only hiccup, it was a little chaotic and didnt get in until the jazz band had already started. If you get the chance to see a show they are definitely worth the money.

Idina Menzel's Amazing Performance at Radio City. Idina Menzel performing at Radio City was a once in a lifetime experience. Talk about defying gravity: her voice alternately exploded, whispered, belted and soared, taking the audience on an incredible ride throughout the evening. Having risen to fame on Broadway for her amazing voice in "Rent", then moving on to originate the role of the wicked witch in "Wicked", and currently in the cutting edge musical "If/Then", she performed songs from all of those productions. She is also the voice of Elsa in the animated Disney movie "Frozen" so of course she had to do "Let It Go" the current top 10 hit song from that film. In addition to performing a wide range of songs with an incredible orchestra behind her, she had a lot of fun entertaining the audience. It is magic when an artist of such vocal talents can laugh at herself, and Idina proved to be magical. Her on-stage costume change in lieu of an intermission - complete with wardrobe malfunction - was hilarious. As opposed to her memorable Broadway performances where she must stay in character, here Idina broke down that 4th wall with a wrecking ball and endeared herself to the audience. Her between-song patter was alternately bawdy and sweet. Anyone who might not have been a fan before the show was most certainly a fan walking out the door.

Aretha Franklin!!!. Happened to pass Radio City Music Hall on the way to Rockefeller Center and who is performing that evening...ARETHA!! We were able to get tickets for that nights performance. She was amazing and so was the hall. Best night ever!!

Tonys and tantrums. Whisper it by NY theatres are actually by London standards rather grim, cheap architecture but high prices. RCMH however bucks part of this trend, a fabulous gold auditorium provides theatre goers with a wonderful experience and is certainly worth a look

Tour this if you have time.. Set appointment times help to schedule your time in the city. Gorgeous Art Deco interiors and informative tour. If you are lucky, you will be able to see someone rehearsing on the stage.

A lot will depend on the show.... We had Aretha Franklin and it was awesome.... Not a lot more to be said. The venue is epic, the sound quality and unobscured views are terrific. The organisation superb, no real queues. Only downside was they started with a comedy act - not sure in keeping with musical concert, the main show was then 30 minutes later after the act has finished.

Christmas Spectacular - Fantastic. My sister booked the tickets to the Christmas Spectacular and that is exactly what we got.It was a fabulous show if a little pricey for the actual time, as it lasts around 1hr 15mins, it really did finish too soon. The dancers were brilliant and the stage and production were just magical. The theatre itself is very comfortable with good big seats and plenty of legroom.If I was back at this time of year again, it would be my guilty pleasure though!

A premier entertainment experience. We have attended the Rockette's Christmas Show on two occasions and it is a can't miss show. If you are in New York during the Christmas Season, do yourself a favor and see this show. Both entertaining and touching. Highly recommended!

Must see while in NYC. The next time you are in Manhattan, I urge to catch a show at Radio City. As a native New Yorker, I have seen hundreds of shows at this venue over the years. It's a great place to see a musical act, a play, the Christmas show, or any other event they are putting on. It's a great place for families to see a show.

Rockettes Christmas Show. Saw the show while in town. It was really a fun time. Always something happening on or near the stage for the entire show. Staff was great and helpful to get to seats, was even time for younger audience members to visit with Santa after the show. Recommend for anyone to see if they are in midtown.
Lovely Building. As an NFL fan I felt it would be an injustice to not see the site of the Draft - Radio City Music Hall. Beautiful building, staff are nice, would recommend

Booking is a must. what a great building to tour.... all the original carpets, pics on the walls the penthouse apartment with its original furniture together with the wonderful tour guide culminating in a short film all about the heritage of the building and then a visit with one of the world famous Rockettes with whom you can have your picture taken.... great value for money and a wonderful building to visit
Great Family Fun. The venue is magnificent from walking in the main door to the toilets. The Rockettes perform an amazing show. A real feel good show for all the family.

Good fun. As theatre is so expensive in New York we decided to eke out our budget with the relatively cheap Christmas show at Radio City. Buying tickets on-line and collecting them pre-performance was straightforward, and we enjoyed a drink on the balcony overlooking the huge Christmas tree(as we were there just pre-Thanksgiving, these were the only Christmas decorations to be seen in the whole city). The place was full of kids of course -. not to our taste, but then it was a family show! The performance was very well done, we enjoyed the Rockettes' well-drilled routines and came out feeling we'd had a good time. A bit tacky, but nice and Christmassy. Give it a go!

Nice place with spectacular neon. This is a nice place with spectacular neon and very close to e.g. Rockefeller Center, Top of the rock observationdeck, etc. Its rather iconic but also worth a picture. we liked it.Mr. & Mrs Wiborg from DK

Radio City Christmas Spectacular Can Grow the Heart of a Grinch. We visited here on December 13, 2013 for the Radio City Christmas Spectacular. The experience started with a long queue that involved picking up the tickets I purchased online at a discount back in early October from will call. Despite having already paid it was quite the line. As the show time approached the queue moved quick and security began instructing there be only one person from each party in the ticket pickup part of the line.Once inside I was caught by what a spectacular appearance the place had. We first headed up the stairs to the second floor. As some members of our party were using the toilet I found a great photo opportunity with my daughter. We were overlooking the place from the second floor and there was a nice chandelier, with views of the crowd and the Christmas decorations. That was about all we did though for exploring the outer area but I got some great photos.We then headed to our orchestra seats which were accessed from the lower level. We were handed a program and 3D glasses. My mother as flipping through the program says “OMG, this is the show with the rockettes. She was mostly NYC green but when she then said “I haven’t seen this since I was a teenager when my Grandfather took me”, this made my day. I had never been this show but I remember the family next door as I was a child going every year and looking up online I knew it had a long history. The fact my mother had some history with it too added to the anticipation.The show itself far exceeded all expectations. The Santa part of the show, the overall story, the skit with rockettes as toy soldiers, the Macys part etc. were all awesome. We were totally in the Christmas spirit when this was done. Including my sister who had normally been a mini-grinch but starting with this to our experience at FAO Schwarz (which I’ll add a review for soon) the following night, to some interaction with needy, then to our actual Christmas with our family her heart that was two sizes too small toward Christmas grew to the size of ten grinches. Story book analogies aside, I had a wonderful Christmas and this show was the start that helped set the mood.

Great tour. We used our NYC pass to go to the music hall for a tour. The tour was excellent. We were able to stand on the stage and look out at the 6000 seats. It was worth the time to take the tour. We really enjoyed this tour.

Take a nice picture outside. If you're a fan of music, you should know that there were a bunch of important events there in the past. So take a walk there even if there is no show at the moment, if you visit at night is better because of the lights. Plus, there are a bunch of attractions nearby, so it is worth paying a visit to the area.
Interesting tour. Enjoyed the fact-filled tour of this interesting building. Lots of memories for the more mature! It's wonderful to see it having a renaissance.
Very Interesting. We took the backstage tour. It was really interesting. Our tour guide Cassie was very knowledgeable. We got to take a picture and ask questions to a current Rockette.

Rockettes Christmas Special. We watched the Rockettes Christmas Special at the Radio City music Hall. Getting tickets was easy early in November, and our seats were excellent. The performance was enjoyable, however, I only gave three stars because it was very short.
backstage tour. This tour is very informative and it is well worth the hour tour. The beauty has been fully restored to its original grandeur. The technology was impressive.

Radio City Music Hall. This past year's Christmas show at Radio City was outstanding! We went on a Superior Bus Tour, and it was great! Dropped us off right at the door. No waiting in line for tickets. Had great seats. This will be an annual event!

Storied concert venue in rock plaza. While in Rockefeller plaza, stop by radio city music hall and catch a concert or better yet catch the Christmas spectacular with the rockettes if you can! This is one of the most famous Christmas shows that's been around for decades. Children of all ages love it and it's definitely a quintessential thing to see while in town during Christmas time. Radio city also hosts many concerts and it can serve as a very intimate venue so you really feel like a part of the action. Cirque du soleil also does shows here on occasion so you can pretty much catch all sorts of shows in one of nyc's most storied venues!

Fun, fun and more fun- great Christmas show!!!. Wow, what a show! You get into the vibe of this place from far as you can see the red lights and huge Christmas tree on their roof. The inside is also very impressing with a big entrance hall and all those heavy velvet curtains. The Christmas show was really spectacular- just like its name...The dancers and the lights on stage gave me the feeling that I'm attending something special. Never been to a Christmas show before, as I'm not from the united states, but it was all I was expecting and then some. The fact that you're allowed to take pictures is great- not like the cirque du solii shows where it's not allowed.

A must for people who appreciate art and film. A great tour. Relive experiences of history and film taking in how the film industry celebrates with grand quality evidenced in the Art Deco beautifully and lovingly restoredMake the time for this you will not be disappointed

colourful building. This was another building we wanted to see on our whistle stop tour of New York, and it did not disappoint. It stands out from the other because of the wonderful coloured lights and the art deco building.

CHRISTMAS SHOW. All I can say is simply amazing. We got tickets for the last show of the season and it made our trip.We now know we will never miss it again if we are in NYC around Christmas. The Rockettes are amazing not to mention just to stand in the grandeur of the restored lobby in awe.Next time I would like to take the tour also backstage which I hear is also amazing. GO!! You will have the thrill of a lifetime!

Amazing venue steeped in history. I went to Cirque du Soleil here last year and loved it, we were fortunate enough to get a tour the week before and so coupled together made for a great experience. The seats are comfy and all views are good views, definitely something to put on a bucket list!

Magical christmas spectacular. A last minute change of plan found my 7 year old and I at the radio city hall, for the Christmas Spectacular, and wow we were in for a treat!! After queuing for a while we were greeted by friendly staff and ended up with great seats...The show was just magical, Christmas had come early for us, after the show we met Father Christmas which was a bit pricey for what you got, but added to the magic of the experience. Beautifully decorated radio city hall is definitely worth a visit .

Phenomenal experience!!!!!!!. You MUST go to Radio City Music Hall. It was a trip our family will never ever forget. It was breath-taking! Really, an amazing place to see if you go to New York, you won't regret it! We attended the Christmas Spectacular, we were just blown away! The dancers were incredible! We have a tiny (not so tiny) dancer and she fell in love with this show! It is entertaining for anyone of any age!!Have a great trip :)-the bestfamilyever

A fabulous Christmas Show. When visiting Manhatten in December, visiting Radio City Music Hall was high on my priority list. This wonderful Art Deco building had enchanted me nearly ten years ago and I could not wait to see another show. I was not disappointed. We waited in line at 10am, to get tickets for the afternoon performance. The show was fantastic. Lavish sets and talented performers. If you get the chance you must visit this theatre. The experience is unique and although it is expensive now, it is worth it I promise you.

Go see something there!. Beautiful, old NY venue. Again, I don't know why I waited so long to check it out, but what a lovely surprise. I guess they have sporadic programming, but we saw Rodriguez perform the night after he played Barclay Center. It was intimate, warm and enjoyable. Such a spectacular setting. It really feels special. Staff all seem to be in a good mood.

A great show. We attended the Christmas Spectacular the seats we had were fantastic right near the stage.The Rockets dancing was brilliant as was the singing and the three D displays during the show. We really couldn't find fault with anything and had a great time.

A little gem!. I wasn't that keen to visit as I had never heard of Radio City (sorry!) but what a lovely surprise this place was!If you like art deco you will LOVE this! The building has been beautifully restored and is packed with amazing art deco details. It is worth visiting for this alone.I really enjoyed the tour too and would definitely recommend it.

Magical Christmas show with the rockettes. My boys had been so excited about going to see this show. The theatre is enormous and the Christmas decorations are magical. A fabulous show. Disappointed at the end when they had cordoned off the road outside leading to Times Square as we all 1,000s of us) were stuck like sardines - my sons were quite scared as we had to battle against the crowds to get back towards the Rockefeller.

Excellent. We got tickets from the TKTS booth in Times Square and paid about $60 for a 5pm show. We thought we would be towards the back, but we were around the 7th row. The show was absolutely phenomenal and I would definitely say it's a must-see for anyone in NYC at Christmas. Definitely go through the TKTS booth too!

Amazing Theatre. Didn't get to see a show however, we toured the theatre. This theatre is beautiful and full of interesting history. So advanced for the period it was built in and remains advanced to this day.

You Fell Like You Walk Into The 1940s,1950s. Bought the “New York Pass” and included tour of Radio City Hall. Management has spent millions on making it look exactly how it looked many years ago when it first opened. Rich in history, you get to see many of the public areas but also get a glimpse of some “back-stage” action like a dressing room and meet a Rockette dancer. Tour guide shows you all the things that they used back in the day and how they used to allow people to smoke in the buildings back in the day and the damage it caused to some of the precious items. You get a free button for completing the tour for memories and there is a gift store.
Rainy Day. Exciting just to see this place! We didn't get to go in...was locked on this rainy day. Thank God for umbrellas.

Old School and just as seen in the movies!. The WOW factor happens when you see the huge retro Radio City Music Hall sign walking towards it from blocks away. It still looks the same as it did years ago and the inside is as impressive as any other buildings you will ever see. It is totally worth it to do a tour of this iconic building as so much as happened in there in the past decades...you even get to meet a Rockette! :)

Brass, Hard Lines, and Neon Lights!. Three things you'll learn quickly about Rockefeller Center and everything within it and that's lots of Brass, Hard straight lines, and Neon lights! To be honest, before I toured Radio City Music Hall, I had never heard of the Rockette's and apparently, they're kind of a big deal :-). We got to go behind stage and see their dressing room, their many assortment of outfits, and we actually got to meet and talk to one of them! There's so much more I could tell you but I'll save it for you to find out when you get there! New York is a beautiful city and highly suggest you stop by Radio City Music Hall!

Loved it!. We were here to see the Rockettes in the Christmas Spectacular in December 2013. The show was amazing and even though the hall was full it was very well organised so it didn't feel crowded. The refreshments were located in various locations for easy access and quick service. I can't wait to go back.

Nice Theater. It's hard to believe that a few decades ago this place almost went out of business. Such history and it was almost gone. Since that time shows are there constantly. Concerts of different genres with top talent. Of course over the holidays is the Holiday Show with the Rockettes. It has good seating and good sound and the entertainment is always good.

Christmas Extravaganza Show!. This is a lovely theatre place, we saw a great show with good seats which were nice and comfortable and good view of the stage and all the performers! Well worth a visit at Christmas time.

Christmas Extravaganza. My wife and I had a great time at the Christmas show. It was our first visit to the RCMH and it was a lot of fun. The Rockettes are a classic part of NYC. It was really neat see the amazing dancing and showmanship. It is a must do type of thing, at least once while you visit this great city.

Great backstage tour. Visited on 2nd march from the outside this building isn't anything special to look at but once you step inside its wonderful, the main entrance is so lovely, first stop was the toilet area, well back in the day they sure looked after the female guests with a lovely seating area with individual dressing tables. The actual auditorium is so big it holds 4500 people. We got to meet one of the current Rockette dancers. Worth the visit.

Best Christmas show in the world. As soon as your kids are old enough to sit for an hour and a half, take them to see the Christmas show at radio city. It's exciting, nostalgic, religious and totally enjoying. It's a must do on your bucket list!

Check online for vouchers, we got 40% off for going on a Tues. We went to see the Christmas Spectacular in Dec. I checked online for vouchers first, we got 40% off the tickets which meant i paid the same for good tickets as i would have to be "in the gods" You just enter the code at the end of the booking and it automatically deducts the amount. The precision & timing of the Rockettes was amazing, they have added some movie 3D bits, so that it is a little more up to date, but to be honest, the dancing and singing was enough.The building is very grand, it is part of the atmosphere, however the drinks are very expensive, and the cloakroom is a nightmare, so be warned.Its a NY tradition, you pay the same as you would to go to the theatre and it equally as good a night out.
A step back in time!. We went on the backstage tour and much to my surprise it was amazing! Learning about the history of the theater and the rockettes. Don't miss it!

Fantastic entertainment. Hubby and I went to the Christmas spectacular show on Christmas Day. We booked tickets back in the UK before making our trip to New York. We had both been looking forward to this show and were not disappointed.We had a designated time for picking up our tickets and initially we had the dread of standing in a queue for ages, but the procedure for getting inside was impressively quick and efficient for the people congregated outside.The wait was worth it as the inside had a wow factor, as was expected an impressive Art Deco interior and the most enormous and beautiful crystal chandelier. The sweeping staircase led up the seating area and provided great photo shots of the lobby below.The show was fantastic entertainment from beginning to end, providing a 3D show, singing and dancing with the Rockettes and even live animals in the nativity at the end of the show. What can I say, this whole experience was pure magic.Don't let the price of the tickets put you off. Go along and enjoy the experience.

A well oiled machine. I went with family to see the Christmas Spectacular. The line outside was overwhelming and immediately disappointing. Fortunately there are so many workers that usher you through that the wait was minimal. The place is beautiful, no doubt. Lots of vendors inside but they all sell the same plastic garbage, nothing nice that you would want to display in your home. The show is amazing and has to be done at least once in your life.

The Christmas Show. The show is fantastic. The Rockettes magnificent. We were a family group of eleven ranging in age from mid-seventies to seven. The whole experience was exceedingly rushed. There was very little time to get from the pens on the sidewalk to our seats on the balcony, Some of the children didn't get the 3D glasses as they entered and they were barely seated before the show started. Ours was an evening show and I believe there were five shows on the particular day we attended. I trust that the Rockettes were on some sort of comfort roster but I couldn't help but feel that the audience should also have been treated to a less frenetic experience.

Take the Tour. If you haven't taken this tour, do so. I was not too excited about this tour but I was happily surprised at how well it was done. It's an hour well spent. First if all, our guide, Alvin, was a wealth of knowledge. Secondly the history of this magnificent theater built in 1932, was fascinating. Thirdly, if you are looking for authentic Art Deco period furnishings, this place is a must see. Even the bathrooms have original sinks, etc. It takes you back in time, when life was a little more glamorous and refined. They encourage photography, so we were happy to snap away. Great hour of history and money well spent. Oh, and you get a chance to talk and ask questions of a Rockette, which was icing on the cake. Take the tour.

Rockettes Christmas Show was Unforgettable!. Our family LOVED this show!! The dancers were absolutely fantastic and the show offered a variety of dance, musical numbers and a very inspirational Nativity storyline. We took our 6 year olds and they were mesmerized by the entire show. We would do this again, in a heartbeat. Go!
The Rockettes!. What's not to love. It's decadent American theater at its best. We loved the Christmas show. Thank you, RCMH.
Christmas Spectacular. If you are in New York at Christmas do not miss this show, it is out of this world and as the title says, 'The Rockettes Christmas Spectaculsr' is Spectacular, do not miss it.

Was OK. We saw the last show on the 30th December. Was worth the ticket price to see the Rockettes, but as it was past Christmas, the story was a little pointless, but we knew that when we booked. Will be magical for younger kids. Fabulous building/ theatre and will return the next time I am in New York to see another show.

Old school glitz and glamour. The radio city music hall is a must visit for anyone wishing to step through a door in to a bit of history. Inside teh building is all old world glamour and charm. We saw teh Rockettes in teh Christmas spectacular and it really got us in the festive mood.

awesome. if your spending christmas in new york then radio city hall christmas spectacular is a show that you must see, whether your a kid, teenager, adult or oap you will love it. yes the tickets are expensive but the whole experience is faultless, the show is fantastic. we will go back again sometime for another christmas in new york and one thing for certain is that we will definatley be going back to see another christmas spectacular show at radio city hall.

The Christmas Spectacular is properly named. Having seen Radio City Music Hall's Christmas Spectacular three times in the last fifteen years, the most recent being Christmas Day, 2013, I can honestly say the word to describe this musical is "spectacular." To me it is the best of both the secular and sacred showcasing the precision chorus line dancing and choreographic artistry of the incredible Rockettes. From holiday music on dual pipe organs before the opening curtain, to toy soldiers falling in domino effect, to a ride on Santa's sleigh, to the holiday sing-along, to the majestic pageant complete with camels creating the solemn Nativity scene, we see the world of Christmas. An integral part of this production is state-of-the-art technology, the lighting, sound, staging, even 3-D flows smoothly from scene to scene. The variety of costumes, scenery and musical arrangements from the marvelous orchestra evokes wonder in me. I particularly enjoyed the creative dancing in The Twelve Days of Christmas and the wonderfully convincing Santa. All of this happens in Rockefeller's beautiful 1932 Radio City Music Hall that seats 6,000 within the spacious half-dome auditorium that becomes a kaleidoscope of color and mood changes. To have a panoramic view of the immense stage and orchestra, I recommend sitting in the mezzanine. Expensive? Yes. But to see the best of the best in cast and production, I'm thrilled to attend and encourage you to experience the Christmas Spectacular at least once in your life.

Worked the Masters of Ceremonies Hip Hop Legends Show. Radio City Music Hall was an amazing venue that I had the pleasure of experiencing from back stage and behind the scenes. The show I was working sold out and the roar of the audience was deafening sometimes as legends of hip hop came together on stage for the first time in 25 years. So my review might be skewed...definitely see a show at RCMH if you can!
Legal!. Assistimos no Radio City Music Hall o show que acontece todo final de ano o Christmas Spectacular "The Rockettes",um show alegre, legal de assistir.

This is a trip down the way things were for our grandparents and parents.. This is an elegance that reminds us of yesteryear. America a safe secure country proudly humble. A vision of a future andba hope. America and Motherhood and apple pie. We all spoke English, all were in the country legally, through hard work and jumping through the hoops-many turned away at Ellis Island. America had never lost a war, as we had fought hard for the freedoms we had.Yes, those were the days.Do visit and revisit how things were.

40's at your feet. Plush, expansive and timeless. Chandeliers, red carpets, magnificent entry ways.....you could stare at the architecture for hours. We saw the Christmas Spectacular here which was so delightful. The seats are comfortable and tightly fit together, so ladies, leave your giant handbags home and bring a clutch. Bar with snacks and drinks with typical usual and customary NYC prices, so please don't be shocked. However, this is a landmark.....you will not forget the experience and you will want to come back year after year.
Christmas Spectacular is amazing. Seen the Rockettes at the Christmas Spectacular and it is amazing. Something everyone visiting New York should experience at least once.

Do the Tour. Prior to seeing the Rockettes in the Christmas Spectacular (which was fantastic and better than I had expected), we did the Radio City Hall Tour. This tour showed the extraordinary way the stage and building were constructed in the 1930's and gave an insight into the staging and variety of the shows. We met a Rockette! but didn't get to go backstage because there were so many shows on. Would highly recommend this tour and the show.
first trip to NYC. We saw Radio City Christmas Spectacular. It was magical and amazing. Went to the 11 am show the tickets were a tad less to go at this time.

Back to the good old times. For 90 minutes you will be transported back into the world of the 40's. And you can feel that right from the moment you enter the big hall at the entrance with its magnificent chandelier and red carpet steps, the left for gentlemen and right one for the ladies. The show is just fantastic, very cheerful and the rockettes do a great job of entertaining you with perfectly synchronized dance movements. Around 1300 costume changes are made in those 90 minutes, go figure!
Christmas Spectacular. Went to the Radio City Music Hall for the Christmas Spectacular Show and it was fantastic! A mixture of traditional "Musical-like" parts and 3D-Movie-parts, really fun.
Christmas Show. Wow, This show was amazing . I wasn't sure what to expect and was surprised with the Christmas story that was depicted. Worth every cent.

amazing. i loved the awesome architecture of the interior the arrangement of the theater the washroom is grand. the washroom has a lounge telephone nearby, and the washroom facilities is clean. also inside the building are small shops that sells souvenirs. Just grand

My 5th time seeing the Christmas Spectacular!. The Christas Spectacular never disappoints! My entire family goes once every 4 years or so and we love it! The seats don't have much legroom but you quickly forget once the show starts. The restrooms queues can be outrageous so I'd suggest going before the show or sprinting out when intermission starts. Food inside isn't cheap so I'd eating beforehand and purchasing maybe a souvenir mug or other item. But all of that aside, it's a wonderful show and my family enjoys it each time. They make minor changes (of course they keep the classics) so we've never seen the exact same show. At least I think so!
Amazing. Saw the radio city hall musical spectacular on Christmas Eve, which we had booked months in advance. Best show I have ever seen. Worth every cent. !

Christmas Spectacular. For so many years I have heard about the Rockettes and seen them on TV but I decided this was my opportunity to see them in person. First class seats were pricey but well worth it. When was the last time you donned 3-D glasses..........quite an experience. What a lavely way to spend Christmas night

Unexpected 5 Star show. My daughter and wife wanted to see the Christmas show, me... Not so much. We waited in a long line to pick up the tickets and I was even less thrilled to be there. Of course minutes into the show, I quickly forgot any previous discomfort and the combination of singing, dancing and pure spectacle elevated the entire audience. Yes there is a Santa Claus, and he's on the best stage in town. I could not have spent a better Christmas Day. Spectacular is over used today, but it's perfect to describe this show. The Nativity scene will stay with us forever, just amazing in all respects.

a must see !!. we were in NYC during december. 1st time there. went to see the radio city's christmas spectacular show. its a must see to anybody who hasnt already!!.  would see it again, on my next visit to NYC as well. kids will love this, great for the whole family. its magical. oh it has 3-d effects in the show as well.

So glad we did this. We saw the Christmas show and it did not disappoint. Keep in mind that this show is geared towards all ages, a couple of the acts are clearly geared towards young children, not something I personally enjoyed. The Rockettes were amazing, however for me the Nativity at the end of the show brought tears to my eyes. It was impressive to see a Christmas show that touched what the true meaning of Christmas is about.
Wonderful Christmas Spectacular. The Christmas Spectacular was terrific, and nearly as I remembered it as a kid with some updates - good & bad.

Great for kids but a bit cheesy for me. My family went to the evening Christmas Spectacular on Christmas Day. The venue is stately with a traditional lavish foyer. We had good seats in the middle of the row on the mezzanine. The theatre has a curved ceiling and walls which are used to good effect for projecting snowflakes etc onto. I liked the dual theatre organs. I also liked the 3D projection (they hand out 3D glasses) which was a cool aspect of the show. There were several really good parts of the show for example a double decker bus which turned on the stage when the projected street-scene background moved past creating the effect that the bus was really driving. My wife and daughter both loved how Christmassy the show was. We loved the nativity scene which highlighted the real reason for Christmas. I am 6'6" tall and the seat rows were too close together with my knees aching at the end of the show. The Rockettes' synchronisation was flawless. The Toy Soldiers falling over was good but went on too long. I decided to write this review because my enjoyment of the show was mediocre despite most reviews on Trip Advisor indicating that whilst a lot of people thought it might be a bit cheesy before going they really enjoyed it despite their misgivings. Well, I went with high hopes but found it very cheesy. Advice: only go for the kids.

Rip off prices. The outside of the building looks great! If you're queuing to buy tickets be prepared to wait! I think there were about 15 people in front of us and we waited 45 minutes for a ticket booth, very bad organisation and there were no indication as to ticket prices. We see a lot of shows in the UK so are prepared that tickets can cost as much as £80 per person. So when the gentleman at the ticket booth said seats in the stalls or tier above were $160 each we nearly laughed at him. And for $95-$105 we could get tickets so far back they'd normally cost about £20-£30 in the uk. We decided to give it a miss. I'm sure the Christmas spectacular is great but we don't work hard all year for those prices. Radio City Music Hall would benefit from a better queuing system and I assume a quicker booking system.

UNBELIEVABLE SHOW!. What a great show - I have never seen anything like it. Everyone who goes to New York needs to see a show here! The Christmas show was so awesome! We thoroughly enjoyed it - great special effects and I still can't believe there were real animals on stage - including a camel!!! Loved, loved, loved it!!!! And so wonderful that it ended with the Nativity - heartwarming to see that Christ is still in Christmas in NY!

Great Show. We attended the Christmas Show again this year. It is a show that changes each year and each year it is a great performance. This is a large theater but every seat feels like it is in the action. The acoustics are phenomenal. Every seat has a great sight line and there are no dead spots in this venue. It is very easy to travel to Radio City. Many of the subway lines either stop at Rockefeller Center where Radio City is located or the subway lines have a stop within walking distance.What can you say about the world famous Rockettes. There are great.Radio City is more than the Christmas Show. Concerts are also staged at Radio City.If you plan to go to one of the shows, we would suggest arriving early to have enough time to enter the theater.

Rockin' with the Rockettes. We saw the Christmas show at Radio City and it was spectacular. Cheesy and sweet, it was brilliantly executed and staged. The Rockettes are the highlight, with their precision and artistry. I'm sorry I didn't have time to do a backstage tour, something I'll be sure to do the next trip to New York.

Christmas Show Spectacular. This was my first visit and I was very impressed at the organization at Radio City Music Hall as well as the venue itself. It is beautiful inside and massive. I was already impressed before I even seen the famous Rockettes do the Christmas Show. There are at least three levels of seating from what I could see and it appears that most seats are good. (Can see the stage) The show itseslf was fantastic. I heard that they changed some scenes over the years and that for the most part; people were very happy with the show. I loved the show and would definitely go again and plan to take grandson when he's older as well as daughter. I think the show is tailored for all ages and well worth the price. Very talented actors/actresses and dancers; they are professional and it shows. The show lasted about two hours and the time just flew. There are stairs to climb inside the bldg.. Not sure if there's an elevator for those in need. There are food vendors on all three levels so theres easy access to snacks and sodas as well as bathroom facilities. Staff is very friendly and helpful.

Christmas show extraordinaire. The show was fabulous from beginning to end. It incorporated things for all ages and moved at a great pace. The only negative thing that I can say it the tickets were a bit pricey.

We Enjoyed Ourselves. My husband and I took our 9 year old son to the show the end of December 2013. We had front row, center, 1st Mezzanine and had a wonderful view of the stage. We truly enjoyed the show. It has changed a bit since I saw it last with the addition of the 3D but it was a fun touch. The Swarovski crystal Christmas tree chandelier was beautiful and as a family tradition we always get our picture taken with the Goose Girl. Food is crazy expensive but it is Radio City Music Hall. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is just due to all the flash photography that they allow to happen. They ask that people refrain from using their flash but nothing is ever done about it and this has been a problem for years. PEOPLE STOP TAKING FLASH PICTURES!! It ruins it for the rest of us!

Christmas spectacular. The Rockettes, the theater, and the magic that was created for young and old alike was so much fun! The theater itself is a sight to behold, from the beautiful chandeliers in the lobby to the comfortably upholstered seats. It was well worth it.

Fantastic show, highly enjoyable, made the trip to NYC memorable!. This was my favourite part of our entire Christmas trip to New York. It was fabulous. Radio City Music Hall is an absolutely gorgeous sight inside and out, and lovely to get photographs of. We had fantastic seats as my mum queued at Seaport for an hour and got us seats five rows from the stage for half the price!The show was over in a flash, it was 90 minutes long, and we felt like we enjoyed it so much we didn't see the time go at all, we were sad to see it end. The dancers are fantastic, and the choreography and precision is impeccable. I have been to productions before at the Apollo theatre in London and it didn't have a thing on Radio City. The 3D movie was fantastic also, with the provision of 3D glasses we felt like we were part of santa's journey on his sleigh. The whole show was magical and a wonderful Christmas experience from start to finish!!

The Christmas Spectacular Was Spectacular!!!. This was my childhood dream come true. The Rockettes were gorgeous!! The show in my opinion was flawless and even had a 3D part. Who knew a live show could have 3D?! Not me! Loved the old Music Hall and feeling all the talent of the past and present lingering in this famous place.

The Rockettes Christmas Spectacular was even better than the hype!. We went to a Sunday morning show to get an early start on the day and to, hopefully, avoid the crowds. It was a good decision~ The show was fantastic - the Rockettes, impressive! We got our tickets ahead of time (highly recommended) and enjoyed the emails leading up to the show. It wasn't clear to us whether we were not supposed to take pictures - or just not use a flash - so we didn't take pictures. The emails helped share the show with others since we had no pictures. (People were taking pictures and video with no regard anyway.) Funny as it may seem, we will always remember the efficient and friendly restroom attendants - they have a thankless job and they were wonderful!

Radio City Christmas Spectacular. My husband and I saw the fabulous Rockettes Christmas Spectacular for the first time last month (December 2013) at Radio City Music Hall and the show really lived up to its name - it was spectacular! The theater is gorgeous, the dancing, music, costumes, staging, lighting and special effects were all incredible and the creative, separate stories they depicted were thoroughly entertaining - involving everything from a girl & her mother discussing gifts at Christmas, to Santa to Jesus, and even included a life size video game enactment of the battle between good & evil. We especially enjoyed the nativity scene with live camels, sheep & donkeys. It was very moving. Overall, a really enjoyable experience and had a great time! Would absolutely go again next Christmas!

Rockettes Christmas Special. Had a great time watching this show in Radio City Music Hall. The theater was big, beautiful and had very comfortable seating as well. It's nice to have family here during the holidays to watch shows.

Radio City's "Christmas Spectacular" aptly named.. 3-D background show very creative.
