Altogether; festive, fun, fantastic, family friendly and enjoyable no matter your age, gender, nationality, etc...The Rockettes' performance exceeded my already high expectations... synchronous, sexy, sensational soldiers!

Fantastic Christmas Show. Combination of outstanding dance, live music, beautiful visuals and props. The whole family thought it was great. I thought it was going to be some old fashioned dance routine but it's much more impressive than that. If you go to New York you have to see this show. 90 minutes, no intermissions, be sure to take that restroom break ahead of time.
Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. The theater and the show was incredible. The Rockettes themselves are amazing and add in Radio City Music Center makes it a spectacular show indeed.

Fantastic venue, talented performers, lacklustre production. We'd read some phenomenal reviews of Radio City, and so we just had to go there while we were in New York. The Christmas Spectacular was playing during the time we were there, so that's the one we went to.The venue is enormously impressive. It's a gorgeous Art Deco building (I'm a huge fan of this genre) and is properly big inside too. We went for some of the cheaper seats, but even from the top tier at the back the view was perfectly acceptable. The orchestra pit and the various mechanics of the stage were engineered and used very impressively too.Before the performance started we were entertained by two Wurlitzer organists, which was pleasant enough, and then we were into the song and dance show. That, frankly, is where it all started to go a bit pear shaped.Unsurprisingly the music was all Christmas themed - great stuff, no problem there. The problem was, though, that the choreographer seemed to have got bored halfway through writing each of the numbers (and, for that matter, the show as a whole). Take "The 12 Days of Christmas", for example: as they worked up the numbers we had appropriate numbers of dancers dancing to each number (five girls for the gold rings, one for the partridge - you get the idea) but then when they got to about seven or eight they seemed to stop counting (I don't recall the song mentioning "an arbitrary number of pipers piping", for instance) and the numbers stopped corresponding.The dancers did seem to be very talented. They clearly knew what they were doing, and the parts of the show that were decently choreographed were extremely well performed. Sadly, I found the choreography unimaginative (the mantra seemed to be: "if in doubt, get a line of girls to do some high-kicking") and it didn't really seem to do the performers justice.As the show neared its end, I realised there was something I'd forgotten about that was mentioned at the beginning: namely a request to behave in a way that wouldn't frighten the animals. How did I realise this? Simple: just when you thought they were lining up for a big, final number ... WHAM - an impromptu nativity play was conjured up. With sheep. Real sheep. Real, bored-looking sheep (well behaved, mind you). I did an amazing job of restraining myself from giggling at the sheer surrealism of it all, but then the woman behind me started and I just couldn't help myself. And then came the camels - also on their best behaviour, it should be said. I found myself gazing into the eyes of one of them, thinking: "What on earth are you doing there?"; he had that look of: "Dunno, mate, I've been here every night for a fortnight and I've not figured it out yet". I seem to recall that there was a donkey in there too, but he was very much a bit-part actor bringing up the rear. At least it was a change from yet another high-kicking line, I suppose.I know lots of people have enjoyed the Radio City show: we chose it because of the great reviews it got on TripAdvisor, after all. I just found it really disappointing, that's all. It had the potential to be brilliant, but a group of dancers who I strongly suspect are talented (and an orchestra whose members clearly are) were let down by lacklustre production, unimaginative choreography and a complete lack of any kind of storyline.And upstaged by a flock of spurious sheep.

Christmas Spectacular!!!. We went to Radio City Music Hall to see Christmas Spectacular with the kids and it was indeed a spectacular X-mas show!! I think it's the best on in North America, at least. My kids loved it and we liked it as well. The only issue is the number of people there during holiday week. It was crazy!!! I would recommend going there either before Christmas week or after New Year.

Old time favorite. Radio city is iconic, if you have never experienced this theatre, especially during Christmas it should be on your list. The Christmas show is spectacular, for all ages. I have been here many times even as a child, now as an adult I still get excited to go. The Rockettes steal the show, the are truly CLASSIC!!

Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall was Spectaculous. This is a great show to catch on a cold wintery night in New York City. The venue is quite large. The seating is comfortable but a little tight, especially with everyone wearing heavy coats and scarfs into the show and having to store them somewhere on or under their seat.The show is top notch. It is a perfect mixture of dancing, singing, and 3D techno display intermingled in a lovely Christmas story. You are in the heart of Broadway so the quality of the dancers & singers is outstanding. It was a highlight of our trip and would love to see it again next Christmas.

Magical Christmas Show. Took an 8 hour flight with a 7 year old to see this show. It is truly amazing and keeps you entertained completely for an hour and a half. The Rockettes are fabulous and I've no idea how they keep going with so many costume changes and routines. Santa stole the show however with a 3D sleigh ride over the audience and through New York. This is a must see show for both young and old and really gets you into the Christmas spirit.

Rock the Night Away!. Fantastic shows, big crowd everywhere but when the show started, everyone were quiet. One thing I hate: unpleasant theatre staffs near the gate.. Don't forget, you guys have jobs because people like us watch the shows...I hope the management sends them to some training on how to relate with guests/ audiences.
Family Christmas Trip to NYC. The most fabulous show in NYC. We were sooo happy we reserved tiks in advance to be 4 rows back from stage. Words fail to describe the experience it was so exceptional.

This is a beautiful place!. The chandelier in this building was magnificent! It was a beautiful place, and it was very clean.We watched the Rockettes here. The employees were very knowledgeable about the seating, which was a really big help, since it was a big place, with lots of seating.We would definitely go again.

Impressive! I don't regret it at all!. The radio city itself as a place is really nice, comfortable and impressive. It is really big with a good audiovisual sense.During Christmas it was really busy and if you didn't have your tickets booked in advance you had to wait some time.If not, then it was an easy process to get them in hand.We have seen the "Christmas Spectacular" and it was unbelievable. It was rally nice and we didn't regret giving that money for tickets for that show.Costumes, music, performance, everything was fantastic.If you haven't been there, don't have second thoughts going there.They have quite a few shows throughout the year so you will always have the opportunity to see them!

Rockettes are amazing. Awesome show, 3D footage was great, rockettes dancing were the best. I would recommend this to everyone visiting NYC. You can't miss this one. I won't give too much away. I recommend doing the Radio City Tour prior to seeing this show or after the show.The only bad thing which makes me only give 4 stars is the crowd control. We had will call tickets, arrived 30mins early and still could be seated at the beginning of the show. They do not seat you when show has started until the next scene (there are no intermissions, just switching from scene to scene). There was a ticketmaster pickup line but the agents were still selling tickets and took 15-20mins for the guy to decide where to sit and how to pay. They were still seating people throughout the show. The ushers don't care if you record so everyone had screen shining cell phones out and that was very annoying. I don't want to take away the Rockettes hard work so I definitely still recommend this show but arrive very early.

Worth the tour fee or take a ticket to a show!. RCMH has remarkable shows, architecture, & talent. Every seat seems perfect. Whatever your taste, this special place is worth making the stop to tour or see a show. You won't be disappointed.

The Rockettes are so cool!. We saw the Rockettes on December 26. We had great family time. The show is 90 minutes. Not as long as other shows in Broadway and it's perfect like that! The Rockettes are so good and the costumes are awesome. This is a perfect family show!

Excellent Performance, well worth it!. I have heard of the Rockettes for many years and finally had the opportunity to see their Christmas show. They did not disappoint! Amazing precision, fun and entertaining.

Rockin' Radio City. This building is a gem! To see it, book a show or book a back stage tour. You will stand in awe and be inspired! If you are in NYC at Christmas time, you MUST see the Rockettes. What talented athletes these women are! The 90 minute show is an escaped from the hustle and bustle of the city. Many components of the show have occurred for years, but one does not tired of seeing the living nativity, the falling wooden soldiers, and so on. The technological attributes of this show have really sophistically developed over the years. You've seen the show in your home town? That's great, but trust me, there's nothing like seeing the show in the Radio City venue.

Rockettes Christmas Show was great. Expensive snacks, great show, line up was long but moved quickly.Our seats were fairly high up but the view was spectacular. It would be a good idea to bring small binoculars. They even had a Santa and Rockette dancer to visit.

Fantastic!. Its just a beautiful building, and its well worth doing the backstage tour. We went to see the Rockettes Christmas Show and had a brilliant time, its a bit like a proper old Hollywood 30's musical show and in such fabulous surroundings its impossible not to enjoy!

A Dream Come True. Myself, Husband and 3 teen age children attended this show. Wow it truly was spectacular. The precision was amazing! This is something that I always wanted to do and it did not disappoint one bit! My husband was kind of just going along to be a good sport and I was so pleased when he ended up loving the show. Our 3 kids were in awe as well! Just do it!
Cool show. The girls loved seeing the Rockettes!! The show was really neat!! The building itself is awesome inside!!!

breathtaking. Christmas spectacular with the Rockettes on Christmas day was truly an experience. Though it was a line up to get in - the show was amazing and comfortable and the seats we had were great. It was a magical experience and we were excited to share it together with our 8 year old for our Christmas day celebration.

Great show. We went to New York the week before Christmas and had a wonderful time everywhere we went but one of the highlights was definitely the Rockettes Christmas spectacular. What a great show. We had seats right up at the front which were worth the extra price and had a thoroughly good time.

Rockettes!!. My mother, daughter (age 7), and I saw the Christmas Spectacular. Thoroughly enjoyable! Everything about the production was family friendly and flawless. The Rockettes are athletic and precise. The story is sweet. The orchestra, other dancers and actors, and singers are terrific. Well worth a visit. Be warned: Radio City Music Hall does not allow you to bring in food or drink and the prices inside are very high.

We Saw the Christmas Spectacular...Again!. This is a performance you never get tired of! Something for everyone at Christmas, from the Rockettes numbers, to the Santa Claus numbers, to the birth of Christ. The 3D effects are spectacular, and of course, the Music Hall is something everyone should experience!

Christmas Rockettes. As always the Christmas shop was truly amazing. Never disappoints. The queues can be quite long to get in but they went down quickly. The show is only 1hr 30mins so don't expect and interval.

Christmas Nostalgia at Radio City. Quintessentially New York Xmas experience, well worth the entry price. The venue is huge and typifies the concert halls from a different time which all adds to the couple of hours where you get to immerse yourself in a show which is well worth the visit some dancing, singing all tied into the festive season.

Christmas Spectacular / rockettes. I felt like a child from the very first minute, the lobby was amazing and all the previous excitement fills you with energy.
The show takes you on a ride throughout the most touching christmas melodies and icons. The rockettes are flawless. I particularly enjoyed the most the soldiers segment.
Rockettes!. Great seats to relive my childhood with an updated twist. Fun! The incorporation of digital and 3D was really enjoyable.

The Most Christmas-Like Experience This Year. We were warned that the show would be a bit `twee' however we are really pleased to have gone as it was the most Christmas-like experience we enjoyed this year. At 90 minutes it's not too long and even though we had seats in the second to back row of the stalls it did not hinder our view or enjoyment. The show is well choreographed, the sets are varied and appropriate for each individual performance/ act and the Rockets are great dancers and a treat to watch - they are extremely well synchronised given the number of performers. Our favourite act was the Birth of Jesus, where live animals are used on stage (sheep, camels and a donkey), which adds to the atmosphere with a huge cast - a truly enjoyable extravaganza. Points to note, if you book tickets on-line be sure to take ID - we talked our way in to exchanging our voucher for tickets but only just! The venue is memorable but the queues for refreshments are long with a poor selection of confectionery; take something with you. We booked through Gray Line New York and I believe purchased lower-end value tickets but all was fine and we very much enjoyed this last attraction ending our 5-day break on the day before New Year's eve with a real Christmas feeling. Even our 16-year old daughter came away like a child again!

CHRISTMAS SPECTACULAR SHOW IS MAGIC NOT TO BE MISSED. This show is awesome the rockets Christmas were unbelievable really puts you in the Christmas spirit, the north pole, Santa ,toy soliders, you have to were 3d glasses for some of it really brings it to life, the live nativity with real animals is cool. It is a must see if you are in N.Y during the Christmas season. Arrive well before your time so you get seated before it starts and they start on time. They do a bag check no food or drink allowed in. The souviners are a little pricey but th chocolate cocoa in the take home cup for $5 was yum and you get to keep the cup. I can see how Americans can make this a family tradition each year. We loved it .

New York Radio City Rockettes Show. THIS YEAR was absolutely awesome. We were fortunate to get here during the Christmas holiday everything was decorated, the show (also in 3D) was just wonderful. Even my Hubby, (who usually falls asleep) loved it.Hope you make it next year...I was told they only change every 6-8 yrs...

On my bucket list!. Watching the rockets at Radio City Music Hall was on my buckets list. We booked tickets to the Christmas show and it did not disappoint! The kids ( ages 5 and 8) were entertained as were my husband and I. The show was amazing. We each had a favourite number... mine was the classic toy soldier number..... awesome!

Our first visit to Radio City Music Hall. We were there for the Christmas Spectacular and it was fantastic! It is something I have always wanted to do and I was not disappointed. It is a beautiful place and the dancers were amazing. We sat on the first row on the 1st mezzanine and it truly was a perfect seat. We waited in a long line to have a photo taken with a dancer and then felt very rushed when it was our turn, as though we barely had time to take our place and they had already snapped the picture and were moving us out. For the expensive price I feel they could be more considerate about trying to get a better photo.
Christmas Spectacular. It’s no wonder they call this the Christmas Spectacular, everyone should see this before they die.The timing and the precision of the gorgeous Rockettes is jaw dropping.
Great show but get there early. Get there early! From time opened doors until show started NOT enough time to get everyone inside. Made us wait until after show started to seat us.

Christmas Spectacular. Made the trip to New York with my daughter and sister to see the Christmas show. We walked almost two blocks to the end of the line and were very worried we would not make it into the show on time, but the line went super fast and we had plenty of time to get in and relax. None of us had seen a show there before, and we loved it. The Rockettes were amazing and we loved the 3-D mini movie. It was definitely worth the trip to New York!!

christmas spirit. the rockets Christmas was unbelievable really puts you in the Christmas spirit, the north pole, Santa ,toy soliders, you have to were 3d glasses for some of it really brings it to life, the live nativity at the end will make you cry.a must see if you are in N.Y during the Christmas season!!!!

Nice but not what is used to be.. We saw the show the Friday after Christmas with a group of 11 ranging in age from 3 to 50 years old. We have seen the show several times over the years and sorry to say it has been much better. First off, my Mom was only able to buy 8 tickets per person through Ticketmaster. Luckily, my Mom reached us immediately after placing her order (although we were out of town) and we called Ticketmaster and got 3 seats nearby. The other turn-off is entering the Music Hall, where they herd guests like cattle. They had various lines including an express line, will call and then 3 separate lines if you already had your tickets. My sister had her daughter napping in a stroller and had trouble getting into the Hall. Best advice is to enter early. Also, the lines for the ladies room were very long. The Rockettes, as always, were great and we enjoyed the staging, music and of course the Nativity scene at the end. The other major turn off were the scenes with the Michelle Obama lookalike and her daughter Kayla. We are at this show to escape and relax. They added nothing to the show, were preachy and reminded us that the First Family was on a tax-payer funded 10-day vacation in Hawaii (which we can't afford). Lastly, the price for a large popcorn in a take home tin with 2 drinks, a Radio City cup and an elf hat was $25, pretty steep. Many delis near by sell drinks and popcorn for a lot less. Given the price of the tickets and the experience, we can't say we will be returning anytime soon. We will likely go back to Broadway, as we all saw Spiderman the year before and were surprised as to how good it was given the bad publicity.

As American as it gets. Kicking Rockettes, popcorn tubs with flashing lights, Santa, 3D fairies whizzing around your head, the tumbling soldiers, the nativity scene - yes, dear people it's America at its greatest, most nostalgic best. Buy tickets a few days before and direct from Radio City for the best deals, otherwise this can get pricey.

Christmas show at Radio City Music Hall. Pleasantly surprised with this show. My daughter is a dancer so this was a must-do but I didn't expect the dancing portions to be interspersed with a Disney-like mini-movies and theatre vignettes. It was very entertaining. Show was 90 minutes. My only complaint is the way they have people queue up outside and then get into the theatre. Very disorganized - much like a cattle call. They could take some lessons from Disney on managing large groups of people getting in/out in a very short period of time. Wouldn't necessarily repeat the experience on a future trip but glad we went since it's a New York classic.

DAZZLING!. I've been to the Chrismas Spectacular in Tampa, Florida and it was great but to see it at Radio City Music Hall in Manhattan was special! I was able to get orchestra seats (very close to stage) for $70/ea. including delivery to Florida. Rockettes are AMAZING! Show moved along quickly and getting in and out was easy with tickets purchased in advance. The theater was grand and we took a lot of photos as it was really decked out in Christmas Spirit. There are plenty of souvenirs to purchase at decent prices. Photos with Rockette were a little pricey but my 14 year old daughter and also dances, had to have it. The show started at 4:00 pm and was over by 6:00 pm and my favorite part of the show was the famous Rockette Kickline! Amazing Precision!

An Excellent Christmas Show. The Rockettes are amazing. I forget the number of dance numbers they did, and I don't know how many dancers (counted 36 at one point); but with four shows per day, they must be in good shape. The breaks between numbers for costume changes were filled with interesting stuff and I found the two short 3-D presentations very good. I do wish that I didn't have to get up several times from my aisle seat to let late comers climb over me or have other late comers block my view of the stage; why couldn't they just wait until the next show? I found an online discount for the show, but I would have gone even if I paid full price. I love live theatre and this was another example. I also liked the two organists that played before the show.
Loved it! Great experience. It was my first time, I took my 10 year old we absolutely loved it! Our favorite part was the amazing nativity and of course the toy soldiers. Quality show well worth it.

2013 holiday show was outstanding. I was extremely impressed by the holiday show, which combined the iconic high kicking dance lines I remember from old movies with modern technology. There were scenes that included use of 3D movies projections and a very fun double decker bus sequence with the Rockettes. When the show was coming to a close, I initially was upset in that the show seemed to be only 20-30 minutes long, but to my surprise about 1.5 hours had passed. I highly recommend seeing a show there!

Christmas Spectacular a must-see!. If you are visiting NYC with your children or really are a sucker for XMas then you most definitely need to see this show! I got my tickets at 50% off at the ticketmaster website.

Kitschy but cute. My husband and I brought our 11- and 6-year-old daughters to the Christmas Spectacular on December 23. It's a very classic NYC experience and my daughters were thoroughly entertained by it and thought it was the best part of their day in the city. For me, it was a little hokey and over-priced. But at 90 minutes, it wasn't too long for a youngish child to sit through. There's no intermission and they just breeze through a variety of different acts that included dancing, acting, singing and 3D experiences.

Amazing show! . We visited radio city for the Christmas Spectacular and the Rockettes gave a stunning performance...our young kids enjoyed the show and even sang along. I've given this place four stars in place of five since they have a real crowd management issue. We got there well in advance of the show and they kept us waiting outside the hall, along with many others like us. Finally, they couldn't get everyone seated before the performance started. So a fairly large crowd waited in the foyer and we all missed the start of the performance.

A memory, but could be more considerately managed. We took our daughters into the city to celebrate our oldest's birthday on Dec 23rd. They loved the show, especially the Rockettes' tin soldier segment. If you haven't done this at least once, be sure to treat yourself. The only complaint is how show management continues to seat late comers throughout the show. We were constantly disturbed during the show by people being seated even an hour into the show. I can understand maybe 10 minutes, but they encourage bad behavior by allowing anyone to come whenever they want - this needs to tighten down to not ruin an expensive experience for the 90 percent of the attendees that know to arrive on time.

Fantastic!. I had never been before and took my Mom who was visiting for Christmas. The show was fantastic!!!! Yes, it was crowded getting in, but they had easy-to-spot signs directing people to line up on 51st Street. The line was really long, but moved very quickly. (We got in line around 8:45 for the 9:30 p.m. show and were inside around 9:05 p.m.) It was a little confusing where to go inside to find our seats, but the staff were really helpful. Women's bathroom line was very long, but moved quickly and we were in our seats long before the show started.My only "warning" is to not expect a quiet, theater style show. There were people selling popcorn etc. up and down the aisles and many people coming in late with drinks from the bar. Also, many people got up to leave (to beat the crowds?) before it was quite over. However, even though we sat near the back, we could see really well. Hint: If you buy tickets early to a 9:30 show, you can get really good seats for under $50.I was afraid it might be a little too cheesy (I am 37), but it was great--yes, it was a little cheesy, but perfect for the holidays! The special effects were awesome. I would totally go again if tickets were under $75 or so.Hint: When you are leaving, head East (towards Brooklyn) on 51st Street and walk over to 3rd Avenue or so instead of getting caught in the mayhem of 6th or 5th Avenue.

A Spectacular Christmas Extravaganza. This was my first visit to Radio City Music Hall, though like the rest of the world I'd heard of this famous landmark and the Rockettes. This was a Christmas present for my grandchildren (11 and 8) and, on my own, I wouldn't have seen their Christmas show or any other performance. However, by the finale, I had become an admirer and a fan. It was one of the best shows I've ever seen. The costumes are incredibly beautiful. The choreography showcases the versatility and talent of the dancers, who are now a diverse group, as are the other cast members. I was very pleased about that and also the themes, which represent the spirit of Christmas.Trying to determine what I like best is hard to do when a show seems to get better and better with every scene. The 3-D element was great fun and my grandchildren's favorite. I thoroughly enjoyed the simulated bus tour through Manhattan. Here again the choreography was superb and original and the digital graphics a visual delight. The show ends with a very moving Nativity Scene, again with extravagantly beautiful costumes. Here again an illustration of the reason we celebrate Christmas. The entire audience appreciated this and applauded wholeheartedly.The singers and orchestra complemented the show from start to finish underlining "Music Hall." It was a treat to see the orchestra pit rise at the end so that the audience to could give the musicians the face-to-face applause they deserved for their contribution to a spectacular evening. I understand why this is an annual tradition for families.

wonderful show. The Rockettes Christmas Spectacular is just that. What a great show with wonderfulentertainers, costumes, music. Very comfortable seating and although we were on 3rdmezzanine would say there are no bad seats. The 3D episode was fantastic. A show forall ages.

Wonderful show!!!. My husband and I really enjoyed the music, dancing, and theatrics of the show. I don't want to give away too many surprises from the show, but the nativity and bus scenes were especially spectacular! For snacks, they offer pop corn, pretzels, and hot dogs. They also sell sodas, beer, and a special cocktail. I loved every minute, and I'd gladly pay for tickets again in the future!
Rockettes. EXCELLENT SHOW!! Great entertainment and awesome Christmas show. Dancers and entertainers were great. Talented group of dancers and stars. Highlight of the trip. :)

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular is just that!. I had never been to the Music Hall before, and I absolutely loved it. It's one of the largest stages I've ever seen, with perfect acoustics. We saw the Christmas show, and I highly recommend it for the whole family. Wonderful special effects (but not too many), and the fabulous Rockettes. I would love to see another show at this amazing old theater.

Rockettes Rock!. The program was absolutely wonderful! We enjoyed every minute. We bought cheap seats on the first row of the 3rd mezzanine. We could see everything and really enjoyed seeing the formations that they danced in that probably weren't see by those on the floor. You should GO!
Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. Don't go to New York around Christmas without seeing the Rockettes. The show is phenomenal and ticket prices reasonable for New York.

Spectacular Christmas Show!. My husband and I went to see the Christmas show which is an outstanding variety show and would be great to take kids to. The venue is wonderful. My only complaint is that the back of the theater was cold during the show because they allowed people to walk into the theater after the show had started. If you have a large bag or camera, you have to check it at the door.

True Christmas Show!. This show was fabulous, from the Rockettes to the 3D animation it truly was spectacular. This is a must if you're in NYC over the Christmas period, if you can appreciate great choreography, special effects and innovative lighting then you're on to a winner.

Family Fun!. A trip to NYC during the holiday season is not complete without seeing the Rockettes at Radio City.....what a great hall and the show was updated , energetic, and fun for everyone. No intermission in this show but a quick run to the downstairs restrooms during the show worked out fine. The rockettes performed the staples - the wooden soldier dance, the Santa Claus dance and the beautiful Living Nativity. I especially enjoyed the Snow dance and costumes - very pretty. $20 for a huge container of popcorn, soft drinks, and a souvenir was reasonable....got to keep the container too! Wine was a bit pricey but that is expected at venues in NYC ... Radio is so centrally located a quick walk over to see the tree at Rockefeller Center at night was special.....enjoy the whole area when you are there!!!!!!

Amazing!!. This a must when you are visiting! The Christmas show they put on is amazing! The quality of the performance and the structure of the building itself is incredible. So much well kept history. Truly awesome! I would recommend getting a floor seat mid section closest to the stage!

2013 Christmas Spectacular. This was the 2nd time I've seen the Rockettes Christmas show, and it did not disappoint. To me, what was truly amazing, was the quality of the orchestra playing the show...I did not hear one misplaced note or anything remotely out of tune. Absolutely amazing.

One word….WOW!. Went to Radio City to see the Rockettes and the show was absolutely amazing! The live orchestra, lights, every costume change, live animals, the list goes on and on, it's just beautiful. So much thought goes into this and it's definitely worth the money. Radio City is a really pretty building! We went into the ladies lounge on the 2nd floor to use the restroom, it was really neat because in the lounge they had several "vanity type spaces" with lights and chairs to get ready. My girls thought that was really neat. A lot of people don't know that Radio City is the largest indoor theater in the world. The stage has hydraulics and it's just really cool. Worth a trip to see this!
What a show. Magic.This was first class. Glad we went. The cast and show was the best I have seen. A MUST if you go

A show that earns it's name.... Spectacular indeed.The list of what is NOT in this show is shorter than what is. Each interlude was more creative and entertaining than the one before. Not often do the words "is that a live camel" cross your lips, and that after indoor fireworks, remote controlled snow flakes, indoor mini ice rink, and a double decker bus.I was doubtful, just sure that the show would be over-priced and cheesy. And it is cheesy, but also really wonderful and at the end I felt I had gotten my money's worth because it was such a high quality and entertaining production.I loved the compressed nutcracker, the dance extravaganza of the 12 days of Christmas and the Christmas story complete with geographically correct livestock.Brave the crowds and experience a spectacular New York Christmas tradition.

Fun Christmas. Little girl threw up right in front of us, but we still enjoyed show. Amazing dancers! Definitely uniquely NY feel and Christmas fun. Suspect 3-D part affected the girl in front of us. The ushers were pretty insensitive about young girl and told parents they would have to clean it up.
Extraordinary!. Our tour guide was Rob. He done an excellent job with the history of the building and shows. I loved every bit of the tour. We even got to see the famous Rockette line!

Christmas Special. Really enjoyable show, if a little Pantomime-like at times, the variety of music, dance and "show" was superb - and all the family from 7 years old to late 70s - enjoyed it. The entry halls (with the stunning christmas decorations) are also a sight in their own right. Great venue, and personal - despite being so huge.

Christmas 2013. Went to Radio City Music Hall for the Christmas Show with the Rockettes. Great seats dead center stage and row SS. Not too close but perfect. The Hall itself was amazing. The show great.
The Rockettes. This show is amazing. The work that must go on to presend this Christmas Production is fantastic. The lighting, consuming and beauty of their production has to be seen.

The Christmas Spectacular. For once in my life I went to an event that was correctly named! The Christmas Show with The Rockettes WAS Spectacular! I was blown away by every bit of this show. It should be on everyone's Bucket List; it is that good!
Christmas Show. Wow, incredible Christmas show! I loved the seamless use of 3D effects, animations and choreography.

It was SPECTACULAR. I took my mother and husband to see the "Christmas Spectacular." My hubby and I had seen this in 2012 in Austin and were quite disappointed in the canned music and lip-synched performances. This one, however, with the live orchestra and singing along with the fabulous location, is a can't miss experience! Plus, you're right down the block from the Rockefeller Center and the magnificent tree! Reserve your tickets and just GO!

Christmas spectacular and the Rockettes was great. This was the only show we saw on this trip and it was worth it. Great for the family and kids and close to places to walk around afterwards (5th ave, Rockerfeller,etc.). The show was 90 mins without intermission but with a Broadway Christmas theme. Would recommend. Remember to use their promo codes as we got reduced prices with them and great seats.

Great show!!!. I had seen the Christmas Show about 40 yrs ago and wanted my daughters to see it...I was as beautiful as I remember it!! I ordered the seats in the spring so I got the pick. The seats I chose on the second balcony-1st row at the edge were I think the best in the house! unobstructed view w/ the special effects right in front of us.

Awesome!!. Went to see the rockettes yesterday and they were awesome, really good place to have plays at and there is alot of seat room too, i didnt feel ill bunched together so i really enjoyed myself. If i were you and you are reading this i would go see a play at the radio city musichall it is amazingly big. I loved it and i hope you take my advice on this, thank you.
Excellent Show. Wonderful entertainement with a beautiful finale. I recommend for families and anyone who loves Christmas.

See it at least once. Act1013's review of this was dead on. Beautiful venue that everyone should see at least once. Walk back in time to the Art Deco age with what looked like original bathrooms, gorgeous details, and video clips of the Rockettes through the years. Don't understand why so many people bring little kids (even babies) to shows like this, so be prepared for kids being there. Loved all the traditional Rockettes numbers including the soldiers, reindeer, and 12 Days of Christmas, but did not like the new technology sequence. Obviously this was added for the kids' benefit. Way too much dialogue in this mom & daughter scene...we're there to see the Rockette's! The Rockettes did dance during part of this scene, but there was too much going on between the live video game and lights on the ceiling to focus on the Rockettes....definitely over stimulation and took away from the feel of the show.The building was beautifully decorated for Christmas with a huge crystal chandelier in the lobby, Santa on the downstairs level, and tons of festive light. The downer? The big light covered wreaths were gorgeous, but the Chase advertisement strewn across the middle took away from it. I understand sponsors & all, but come on!

Loved the Christmas Show!. Hadn't seen this show since I was a little kid and it was better than ever with the Rockettes dancing, gorgeous sets, and unbelievable 3d film integrated with the live show! Worth every penny!
Wonderful Christmas Show. Radio City Music Hall is a beautiful venue, the Christmas show is fabulous a must see, my 11 year old granddaughter loved the show.

Amazing Place. This was our second visit to Radio City, this time to see the Christmas Spectacular. It definitely lives up to its name. Laser lights, Santa and yes of course The Rockettes made it a very special event. It's like a Broadway show on steroids.

Wish it was the "traditional" version of the show.. This venue is iconic and beautifully decorated for Christmas with a crystal tree hanging from the ceiling. I saw the Rockettes show here the Sunday before Christmas. As you can expect, the show was sold out and the place was packed. There were mostly families with young (and very young) children in attendance. Be prepared for children talking throughout the show and yelling at certain points of the show. The show itself begins with a children's version of The Nutcracker, which is played out by plush toys. The Rockettes also do their trademark dancing and high kicks. My favorite act was the soldier dance - it is truly unique. My least favorite part involved a long and drawn out bit about a young girl and her mom deciding whether to get her a video game for Christmas. This was by far the low point of the show for me, with a lot of dialogue and cliche punch lines. This portion of the show does culminate in a 3D "video game" which some people seemed to enjoy. While I understand the need for the show to try out new technology, I felt that this took away from the overall experience. Apparently this is a new addition since last year's show. Thankfully, the show ended with a Nativity scene with a lovely narration and great scenery. I recommend catching this show if the prices are reasonable for your budget, especially if you have young kids. Otherwise, spend a little more and book tickets well in advance to see the New York City Ballet's The Nutcracker.

Christmas Spectacular - Awesome. A wonderful experience. The Rockettes were fantactic, the scenery well crafted and the closing Christmas scene the highlight. The closing with a living manger scene, complete with camels and sheep, evoked thunderous applause from the "full house".

Christmas show awesome. The show amazing. Get seats in the orchestra section. Gets you in quicker without wait (premium entrance). We bought cheap wine for my wife and realized that the counter on the left sells better wine. Girl should have told us.

Amazing show!!!. I loved the show! I would love to go again and again. This year they had 2 parts using 3d glasses which was so neat! The tin soldier dance was great. All of it was well done and engaging. Nice theatre. We sat in 2nd mezzanine which was ok but wish we had gotten closer.

Amazing. We recently went to see the Radio City Christmas Spectaculer. It was the most magical, amazing show. The rockettes were super the attention to detail incredible. The building is beautiful. If you get a chance you must see this wonderful feel good show.

2013 Christmas Spectacular. I took my 14 yr old daughter for the first time. It was amazing. The theatre was huge and very impressive. The stage and screen were the largest we had ever seen. The sound was incredible and the 3D parts of the show were excellent. All in all, the 90 minute show was well worth the experience. Highly recommended!

Wonderful Christmas Show. Rockettes were amazing and the whole show was just perfect start for a christmas holiday. There was amazing music and scenes. I was impressed how they used lights and pictures on a ceiling and walls. I cannot say which part of the show was better than others, we enjoyed them all. Using 3D was a big plus.

Annual tradition!. We love seeing the Radio City Christmas Spectacular each year! Radio City is a beautiful venue for starters, the Rockettes are amazing to watch in their precision, and the show in general is so much fun for the whole family. Our kids are 6 and 8 and this is the third time they have seen the show. They loved it just as much as previous years, and are already looking forward to returning next year! We prefer 1st mezzanine seats since are kids are still small - they get a great view of the show from this area.P.S. Any negative reviews of this show should be dismissed as being written by "Scrooge". It's impossible to not enjoy this show! As for complaints about prices? You're in NYC at Christmas-time - why is this surprising to some people?
Christmas show was good. My wife and I really like the show. It was great to be back in radio city. It still looks as great as it did when I was a kid!!!

Return to Wonderland. Recently decided to go and see the Xmas show at RAdio City . Honestly I realized that I had not been there for about 50 years and that there no longer was a movie included with the Rockette show. It was a thrill and joy to see it even without the movie and I don't even celebrate Xmas. I recommend it, at least every 25 years if you are an adult and every 10 if you have children

Christmas Spectacular. Attended from out of town, husband and I with our 10 year old son...he fell asleep for a few minutes in the middle of the show (we had had a big day at the thanksgiving parade) but otherwise really enjoyed it
Rockettes were great!. Great show. First time I seen it in 3D! Facility was in good condition. Seats are large and comfortable.
Great Christmas Show!. The Rockettes Christmas Show was beautiful and even included a couple of 3D scenes that made it special. Recommend it to anyone visiting for the Holidays.
Spectacular!. Wonderful show, beautiful venue. The Rockettes were amazing "Christmas Show Spectacular"...was just that! My 12 and 13-year old children loved it. A must-see in NYC at Christmastime.

Beautiful place, great Christmas show. Radio City Music Hall is just beautiful. I was surprised, as I had not looked at pictures or anything before visiting...so pretty inside. A really neat venue. The show itself is very good. I am so impressed by how synchronized these girls are...very impressive! Christmas show was very family friendly...good, clean show. Friendly staff to help you find your seat...overall a great experience.

Spectacular spectacular. Went with our 6 and 8 year old kids. Had decided to just do one show in Manhattan and chose this one. Thought it might be a bit cheesy but it wasn't at all. It was great. About 90 minutes no interval but lots of variety and really kept the kids interest which is pretty impressive with my easy to get bored 6 year old boy. We had the "cheap" seats high up but they were fine. 3D movie bits were a nice touch.

Great show if you are prepared to be treated like cattle. Great show once you are in, but the way people are treated before and after the show is appalling. Staff shouting and yelling at everyone, only one person per family allowed to queue up at a time to collect tickets etc. it's a shame that the quality of the show doesn't extend to the entry and exit arrAngements. Make sure you arrive 45 mins before the show if you want to ensure you get in on time - and bring plenty of patience with you! Also seating can be a bit hit and miss especially for kids. If they have an adult sitting in the row in front they will struggle to see anything.
Still in Great Condition!. I was impressed with the condition of Radio Music Hall considering how old it is. I love that they keep the old look without it looking run down. Seats were spacious.

Must see in Chrismas time - Christmas Spectacular. This is the one you have to go and enjoy during Christmas season in NY city. Not only the show, but everything in the Radio City Music Hall is set for Christmas. We enjoyed the show about 15 years ago, and now there is a 3D segment, and everything is still full of fun and joy.However, go to the bathroom (especially women) before you come to the venue if you have a chance. It is well organized, but very crowded. And I am very grateful to the personnel working at the bathroom...

Christmas Spectacular. Absolutely amazing. Probably the best show I have ever seen, very entertaining beautiful costumes fabulous dancing so perfect. Would go back to New York just to see this show and I think I can vouch for my three friends who joined me.

You must see the Christmas Spectaular!!. We had seats in the center front row on the balcony and had a great time watching the Rockettes perform along with the entire show. Although quite crowded, the staff does a great job getting everyone inside ( it was freezing outside ) and to the proper seating.
Great show!. The show was great! Made you feel like I was on the grey line bus with the beautiful scenery! We had great seats. Loved the flying snowflakes and getting covered in snow.

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. Took the trip from Boston to see the Rockettes even though we had seen them many times before and we were not disappointed. They also present a new theme to the show every year so there is not way to be bored with seeing them again. Just be sure to give yourself plenty of time to get there and find a place to park. NYC at Christmas is mobbed and traffic is horrendous but still worth it. Puts you right in the Christmas spirit.

Amazing!. Not only is the Hall absolutely amazing, but the Christmas Spectacular did not disappoint. We all enjoyed every aspect of the show, from the classic moments, to the new, it was worth the price of admission to attend. I would recommend to anyone!
Christmas Spectacular. First time to this venue and first time seeing the Rockettes. Totally loved the show and the chance to see the rockettes was really fun!

The Rockettes Christmas Show. My sister and I visited the Rockettes Christmas Show on Dec 16. If you do nothing else while in NYC, go!!! This is by far one of the best shows we have ever seen. Almost 2 hours of dancing, 3-D entertainment and laser show. People were on their feet at this performance. We sat in the 2nd mezzanine and could see the stage perfectly. We will try the 1st mezzanine next time.
Beautiful Christmas Show. Haven't seen the Rocketts in ages. The still put on a wonderful show. This year they had part in 3D. Costumes were beautiful and dancers excellent .

Fulfilled a childhood dream. From childhood, every Thanksgiving I would watch the Macy's Day Thanksgiving Parade as part of our family ritual. I remember how my father, who grew up in NYC, rave as the Rockettes would provide their annual routine. My dad would egg on me and my siblings to see the show if we were ever to get to NYC. After many decades, I took advantage of a "Living Social" special and a friend, in the middle of the week, and I had orchestra seats for the Christmas spectacular. The integration of the story line was seamless. The show complete with a unabashed nod to NYC advertising/ tourism, and a 3D component was beyond wonderful,---- amazing!!!...this baby boomer allowed her little child to take in the sights, sounds, and the precision of the world-renowned group of women. My spirit was filled to the joyful brim ...words do no justice to this experience. Despite long lines, the folks @ Radio City know how to move people quickly with great customer service skills.

Amazing!. We got tickets at about 6:45pm for the 8pm show on Tuesday for the Christmas Spectacular! We could have had main floor tickets for $100/ ticket, but had great seats on the second level for $79 each. There were more open seats then taken, but I assume it was the day of the week. Great Show! Great Venue! Popcorn and 2 pops $25, picture with one of the Rockette's $35-55.. so if you have tons of $$ do it all!
Christmas Pageant. Thoroughly enjoyed the pageant, the Rockettes are excellent and well rehearsed. the 3D experience was a first for me in a theatre situation and was good.

Radio City Christmas Spectacular. I went last night for first time to see the Rockettes. with teen and small children they all loved it.. for adults its good for kids its great!! .The theater was clean ,the bathroom as well . The decor and the rest was good , the employees where happy and very helpful.. The show superb , I loved it and planning to be there every year with my kids.

Saw the Christmas Spectacular w the Rockettes. As soon as you entered the doors you knew this was a great place to see the show. All lit up in Christmas decorations and music and when we entered this grand hall it was amazing to take it all in. Great show to see there and the stage was very large and multiple areas moved up and down and spun around with performers on them. Great acoustics and fell in love will RCMH.

Great Christmas show!. I like: Wonderful Theatre! great Christmas show! Beautiful! Entertaining! and enjoy a lot the Rockettes. I didn`t like: they permite the entrance of public during the show and was a lot of people passing in front of me during the first 20/30 minutes of show.
Must see. A must see at least once. Big and over the top. Thoroughly enjoyed it. Kids would love it but something for everyone.

The Show Was Great; Audience Was Not. The Christmas Spectacular was truly that-- absolutely incredible. We enjoyed every minute and appreciated the Nativity Scene at the end. The only thing wrong with this entire performance was that the ushers did nothing to try to control the unruly field trip kids seated all over the balcony. We had paid a lot of money to see the show, and these middle schoolers were all over the place-- in and out multiple times, holding up bright video recording devices (don't ask me why- they couldn't get a good shot at that distance), and talking throughout the performance. We should probably pay for more expensive tickets for a less obtrusive experience, but they were still very expensive and that's what we could afford. I didn't expect it to be ruined by children that had no supervision and absolutely no idea how to act at a performance like that. Having said that, it was a lovely show and I did enjoy it despite the distractions. I hope the Rockettes will continue to do this type of performance for many more years.

Christmas Spectacular not so spectacular unless you're 5!. Heard the was the must do Christmas in myc tradition so we booked it. Prices were huge so i shopped around online and found a coupon for save 24%, i'd suggest you do too as we got 1st lebel versus 3rd level priced seats because of the disvount. First off i'm glad i went to see such an iconic venue everyone was polite and welcoming the seats were comfy and the view is amazing. Expect to pay $25 dollars for popcorn in a souviner tub(cant just buy popcorn) everything comes in an expensive take home cup! The show- loved the formation dancing of the Rockettes, the story was mediocre, kids will enjoy. Glad we got cheaper seats its a lot of money for the show delivered but a delightful venue.

I was shrieking along with the kids!. Had the joy of watching the Rockettes Christmas Special last December 7th, 2013 along with thousands of others. It was fun, the lobby was decorated and there was the palpable holiday cheer in the air. The show was amazing and the 3-D show had me shrieking along with the kids. My husband said that part of the fun for him was hearing me shriek and apparently being delighted. It is so worth it to go and even though the lines look insurmountable, I made an observation that might work for you too: we went to the on call to get our tickets and from there, the usher just let us join the line already in the lobby instead of falling in line outside the building, which went for a few blocks.It is great fun, the Hall is immense and and very impressive. When you are in NYC and especially around the holidays, go see the Rockettes. They are amazing! Loved it, loved it, loved it!

Wonderful Theatre, Christmas Fun. We loved the spectacle of the Rockettes and found the playful storyline of the mother/son video game to be ok, not that effective, but lengthy. Loved the additon of technology...has to be the largest LED bigscreen in NYC! Great use during the Rockette/double decker bus skit. We were saddened the story of Jesus' birth was limited to the final 5 minutes of the 90 minute show...like a "have to", not as the show has included it in recent years. Its one of the most powerful and beautiful parts of this great institution.
Christmas Spectacular. Radio City Rockettes! What more must I say! Great show! Beautiful! Entertaining! We had such a great view from ORCH 6 Row HH. Will see again for sure.

Christmas Spectacular. I had a wonderful time at this show. The 3D effects were great and the kids sitting around us loved it. I would definately bring my family back to see it. I loved the diversity of the program and that they ended with the Christmas Story-the birth of Christ. It was wonderful.

Absolutely a must-see!!. This is definitely a must-see attraction during the Christmas season! The location is gorgeous - make sure and take lots of pictures of the lobby and the chandelier! I think any seat would have a great view, but if it's your first time, do yourself a favor and spend the extra money to get good seats. TOTALLY WORTH IT! Everything about this show is top notch: from the friendly staff, the Rockettes kicks, and the lighting/3D/special effects.

Christmas Program. Five "starts" does not even begin to be enough for this show. This was on our bucket list for years and we finally made it. Now...we would like to go back every year. The full scope of the show from the chorus line to the 3D effects were beyond imagination. Especially appreciated that they have an unapologetic traditional Christmas program as part of the show. In today's politically correct environment that is unusual.

Disappointing if you've seen it in the old days. I was embarrassed to have brought my family to see the Rockettes Christmas show, after having built it up. This show is a sad imitation of a once-great legend, and if you watched the brief segment on the Thanksgiving Day Parade telecast, then you've seen all there is to see, and saved yourself $150. Per ticket.You're probably saying to yourself, "Well, I should at least see this once". That's the fatal mistake. You think you HAVE to see it, but you really don't WANT to watch corny entertainment like this anymore. It's time to take control of your emotions, and spend that money either upgrading your Christmas presents, or donating it to the Salvation Army. I think Celtic Thunder on PBS has better production quality, and I can't stand Celtic Thunder. If you love Celtic Thunder, don't own a smartphone, and think that Kraft Mac n' Cheese is the best-tasting macaroni & cheese you've ever had, then you'll probably like this show. If you are still deeply captivated by childhood nostalgic feelings for a long line of dancers briefly kicking their legs in unison, and you've got $150 to throw away, then you'll probably go anyway. Take my advice, and go on a less-popular day & time, so you won't feel cheated out of your money like I did.

Another one ticked off my Bucket List!. When in Rome... so when in New York, do as the New Yorkers do and go see The Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. We loved it! We didn't pre-book, rather lined up the day before and bought good seats for the following afternoon. The Radio City Music Hall is beautiful and a classic theatre. The show was just as we'd expected... fun, colourful and traditional with a few modern twists. Ladies, you must visit the powder room... it's quite something! We're Aussies, but we so enjoyed joining the locals for this Christmas tradition!

Rockettes rule!. We went here for the Xmas show and it certainly did not disappoint. Mezzanine seats, front centre are definitely pricey but made a great experience. The Xmas show was fantastic and featured a lot more of the Rockettes than I was expecting. They are amazing and how they can possibly remember so many routines is incredible! Really recommended and great organization to get everyone seated and the show going with so many people.

Amazing As Always!. I see Radio City Christmas Spectacular almost every year. Every year they change a scene or two. And every year it is better than the last!!! This year, unfortunately, i was not ecstatic about the storyline with the young girl and her mother. ( last years story line about the mother not being able to find the gift was a better scenario than not wanting to buy her child a video game - in my opinion) but that scene is still one of my favorite new scenes that was added!! I love the video game performance!! My one problem with Radio City is that once the show starts they are still seating people...... It ruins the 3D experience in the beginning of the show. The whole time i had people blocking my 3D experience because the ushers were constantly seating them. In my opinion i do not think that is right and i believe if you are not prepared and get to the show on time then you should not be allowed in once the show begins. It is not fair for everyone else in the theatre who got there on time and are already enjoying the show. Other than people still being seated 40 min into the show. It is a must see and it is a show that anyone would enjoy!!

Rockettes and Back Stage Tour. I went to Radio City Music Hall to see the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular which was truly fantastic. I had seen the touring show a few years ago, but it was a dream come true to see it at Radio City Music Hall! I had wanted to go since I was 10.Although the theater is large, it is set up in such a way that it would be hard to find a bad seat anywhere, even the back or the mezzanine, so don't agonize too much over your seat like I did. Just find one that fits your budget and go with it, it will be fine.After the show I did the back stage tour and learned more about the music hall and it decor which was really interesting. They also take you to the top back of the theater where there is an observation room to look out at the stage. IT's here you get the full view and can see that the theater was designed to look like a sunset. The observation room also has an old original movie projector which is cool. They don't show many movies there anymore.If you have the opportunity to visit, I absolutely recommend seeing the Rockettes and if you like history, definitely go on the tour. It's only an hour and you might learn something to talk about at your next dinner party.

Christmas Presentation. We took our 2 small children to see this production. Yes the lines are long, but mover very quickly. I honestly thought personally I would be bored as I'm not one to appreciate the arts. The show was very entertaining and obviously very intricate. The Rockettes were amazing and truly something everyone should see at least once to appreciate how gifted they are. Truly amazing, especially to a little girl. Worth every penny!!

A Must foe all ages. I haven't been to Radio City in years. We took our 3 year old granddaughter and hard to believe it was beyond our expectations. The performers were excellent and the sets magnificent. We had a ball.

Christmas SPECTACULAR. The rockettes is my yearly gift to myself . I went with my son (4) nephew (7) and niece (14). They added and changed some numbers and it was absolutely beautiful. The only issue ( and happens every year) is they only open the doors 30 minutes prior and it's not enough for people to get in, get a snack, use the reason room and be seated . This leads to people all over the aisles and rows well Into the third number . Orchestra seats are 150 and up so it gets a tad annoying ! I find the 430 show always allows us to get reservations at the popular spots ( sea grill , del friscos grill , rock center cafe ) before or after . Sea fire being my favorite of the three . The kids also love our stops at one of more of the following : NBC store . M and m world , Hershey , magnolia bakery and of course the tree ! A must do at least once if not yearly for the family !

great show, fantastic special effects.. Second year in a row and even better in 2014. The video background is very well done. The 3D effects is very good. We were in the orchestra, row T which is too far back. The Santa workshop with the lighting on all the walls and ceiling was great. Shop for discount tickets. The price for food and drinks is ridiculous, get something to eat and drink before you go.

Rockette's Christmas Spectacular. We saw the Rockette's Christmas Spectacular at the Radio City Music Hall and it was fantastic. I had no idea it was so large and grand inside. The sound was a little on the quiet side, but other than that, it was amazing.

The Rockettes were awesome. Saw the Rockettes Holiday show. Fantastic. It was the fastest hour and a half I have spent since I saw them a few years ago.The show is never disappointing. Highly recommended

Christmas Spectacular...... They really know how to put on a show. My wife and I enjoyed the Christmas Spectacular more than I can say. The Rockettes were perfect. I especially enjoyed the toy solder portion. A must see a Christmas.

Christmas cheer!. Beautiful sets and costume designs, talented dancers, VERY much NYC and a wonderful way to embrace an American Christmas. Especially loved the way they did not shy away from telling the story of the birth of Jesus Christ. Quite refreshing and a lovely celebration of all the wonder of this season.

The Christmas Spectacular. It was exactly that --Spectacular! We had $70 seats in the second balcony. The theater is huge holding about 1500 people. The technology was outstanding with 3D flying humbugs and remote controlled snowflakes in hug balls that went out over the audience and returned to the orchestra pit without a problem. The dancing was the usual Rockette precision and the manger scene included 3 live camels, a donkey and 4 sheep. What a show.

Christmas Music Spectacular is Awesome!. This holiday show is excellent. It combines current video/audio technology with the tradition of the Rockettes. You also can't beat the venue. Radio City Music Hall is beautiful and reminds you of the history behind the venue and the entertainers who played on that stage. I hope they continue this tradition for many years to come.

2013 Xmas Show. A great show in a great thearte. The mix of the old and the new is just brilliant. This is the second ime I have seen the show, the first time was 4 years ago, it is updated and just fantastic. A brilliant way to start the Xmas season.

Far less cheesy than anticipated. Our trip was dedicated to NYC at Christmas and this was a "must" on the list. Far exceeded my expectations!! All three generations in our party (ages 14, 43, 66) enjoyed the show. For us, Christmas is not a secular holiday. Although I had been very entertained, I remember wishing for something non-secular. My jaw dropped when I got exactly that -- an amazing musical nativity, complete with live camels, a donkey and sheep. Simply unforgettable -- I wanted to stand up and cheer.

A Lifelong Dream Come True. I smiled during the entire performance -- it made me so happy. I've always wanted to see the Rockettes live and they did not disappoint. Their toy soldier performance was absolute perfection. The Rockette that allowed us to take her picture before the show was a doll even though we were probably the 100th family that she posed with. The 10 AM performance had lots of children in attendance and that just added to the fun. Keep in mind that you need to use a different entrance if you already have tickets. Don't waste your time with the masses of people at the main entrance.

Incredible. I took my oldest to see the Rockettes three years ago at home, and it was awesome. Ever since we bought a DVD of the Radio City Christmas Spectacular, we've dreamed if seeing it in New York City. The Music Hall is a wonderful, historic theater, reminiscent of the Fox Theater in Atlanta, including the organ at the beginning.The show is first class, and the tickets were surprisingly affordable, given the location. I really like how they use graphics and 3D to "expand" the stage by projecting on to the walls next to the stage. The acting and singing are very good, and the Rockettes don't disappoint. We really like how they maintain and respect the true meaning of Christmas, with the scripture reading and dramatization of Christ's birth. The use of live animals was cool. We got our girls' picture with a Rockette, and the price was reasonable. Souvenir dolls were also reasonable at $30.

Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular 2013. My wife and I went to see the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music hall yesterday, and it was simply an amazing and mesmerizing experience. We had Orchestra seats in the middle section, and could not have been happier with the seats. Yes, it cost a pretty penny, and yes, it was worth every one of them. My wife had always wanted to see the Rockettes, never having done so. Last year we wanted to go, but it was later in the month and sold out. I have never seen the Rockettes either, before yesterday, and now I'm both sad that I didn't, and glad that I now did see them. The precision and beauty of the Rockettes performance was something to behold, and I found myself being transported into another world. There were some 3D segments that were pretty entertaining too. My advice to anyone who has not been there yet is to do it, and do it sooner instead of later. The audience was well-behaved, without the usual cell phone yakkers and texting distracters. We saw the 11:00 show, and then went to a very nice lunch at The Sea Grill in Rockefeller Center, which I will review later.I worked in NYC for many, many years, and always held the typical New Yorker's cynical view. "Ah, it's a tourist trap!", or "It's for kids!" Gee, for some reason, those are the people who seem to have all the fun, and at my age, I needed some fun. This was fun. That whole day was fun. We took mass transit into and out of the city, and I am so glad we could, because driving into NYC during the holiday season can be a nightmare, and finding a place to park that is reasonably priced and close to the venue is virtually impossible. I highly, highly recommend this show, and hope to be able to see the new show coming in the Spring, 2014. Do yourself a favor. Go there. Now.

WOW! Now there are drones as well as SANTA!. New this year are the ten drone snowflakes...super wowie...kids will love it. Ive been going for over forty years, and the basics are still great, but the new laser trains on the proscenium arch and the snowflake drones, which even change color as they fly, are simply stunning. The Rockettes are still incredible, too.

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular was Amazing!. We took in the matinee this afternoon (since it was cheaper). But no matter what you pay for a ticket you get your money's worth. The dancing was absolutely fantastic. I could go back again and again to see this Christmas show. Food and drink are very pricey! $5.50 for a bottle of water.
Christmas Spectacular. Great show! So much more than I was expecting. For all ages, do not miss it! Everything from the Rockettes, live animals, children, 3D and Santa.

Radio City Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. The Radio City Rockettes Christmas Spectacular is filled with continuous entertainment as the ladies take you on a magical tour of the streets of New York. I loved every minute of the holiday production. From the beginning to end, it was superbly executed in all aspects of the show. The Rockettes are amazing, making every movement in sync. They smile naturally making everything look flawless and effortless. Other cast members including singers, dancers and actors executed their roles profesionally. The show also uncluded several Santas dancing and a spectacular re-enactment of the nativity scene with living camels and goats on stage. The sets were all beautiful and realistic, pulling the audience in. The costumes, the lighting, the graphics, the timing, the video projection screen. Everything was spectacular like said in the title of the show itself, Christmas Spectacular. It was definately a memorable sight to see and it couldn't have been better.

Still magical after all these years. I grew up on Long Island and went to this show when I was 9 years old...over 50 years ago. The magic is still there, they updated as needed and kept the tradition and spirit of the season.Loved it!! The Rockettes are just the best...still and always!

Awesome Christmas Show. Another wonderful Radio City Music Hall experience! First Christmas show I've attended, and I was not disappointed. Wonderful dance numbers, beautiful costuming, even a 3D experience! This is a not to be missed experience!

Rocketts!!. It had always been a dream of mine to see the Rocketts Christmas show. It was truly amazing. The dancers were flawless, costumes amazing, and they even had live camels for one number!! The theater was beautiful, the ushers were helpful and cheerful. They offered an early morning show at lower prices. If you are in NYC you must go. No regrets!

The Christmas Spectacular is truly spectacular. This was the best show ever! The special effects along with the wonderful Rockettes made for a very memorable show. We visited NYC from Indiana, a girlfriends weekend with 6 ladies. This show was the highlight of the weekend for me. Worth the money spent to get to NYC.

Fun holiday show!. Caught the morning show of the Christmas Spectacular. It was a great show and relatively inexpensive for a Christmas show in NYC. The performance was varied enough to keep it interesting for all age groups, and had great use of effects. The choreography is stunning. It's a fantastic show to really get you in the holiday spirit, would highly recommend!

Back stage tour. We did the back stage tour and it was very interesting. We were there in September, during the America's Got Talent competition. Some of the finalists were practicing, so we could not go in certain areas, but it was interesting to see the people and we did get to watch one of the acts. It is a very nice tour with a lot of information. We even got to meet a Rockette, she met with us and told us about her experience of performing there. We did this as part of the package deal through NY Pass.
Spectacular. We saw the Radio City Christmas Spectacular and it was just that. Great for all ages. Very entertaining and put everyone in the holiday spirit.

Outstanding Entertainment. Went to see the Radio City Christmas Show as part of a school fundraiser for my daughter. I had not been to Radio City in years and had expectations of seeing a tired old show that had not been revamped in years. Nothing could be further from the truth! The theater was bright, clean and clearly showed meticulous attention to detail. The show was fresh, upbeat and had outstanding performers. For almost 2 hours we were totally and completely immersed in the performance and the choreography that made the Rockettes world famous. I wish I could give the show more than 5 stars. It was family entertainment that kept the entire family entertained. Well worth seeing.

A must see!!!!. Nothing gets you more into the spirit than going to see the Rockettes at Radio City music Hall. The best show! It is magical. For me the highlight is the live Nativity Scene. Reminds us what Christmas is really all about.

Amazing history brought to life. Although I made my visit in June, I have only just realised that "attractions" could be included on Tripadvisor!On the day I visited I was lucky to be in a small group of just an Austrian couple and myself. Our group was shown around by Eloise.The depth of knowledge shown by Eloise was breathtaking and fascinating.She was a credit to Radio City.My ticket was included in my NY City Pass, but I would say that I would have gladly paid for the ticket as the tour was dimply 5 Star!

It is spectacular. Went to the 2013 Christmas show with a friend and had a wonderful time. My first experience with the new 3D glasses and they really make you believe. It is also wonderful to have a show that acknowledges the part Christ plays in Christmas.

LOVED the Rockette's Christmas Spectacular!!!. Bought our tickets on Ticketmaster, line moved quickly getting in. I had to google if they served alcohol at Radio City Music Hall, LOL They do! Although, drinks are pricey, you do get to keep the plastic cup and they have cool light up stir sticks, so you can easily spot the rest of the lushes in the audience. LOL We had a blast! The Rockette's were AMAZING!!!! It made me want to come home and sign up for a tap dancing class, it was THAT good. ;) Must see!!!!
A great place to see a show. We have just seen the Christmas Spectacular show - an excellent evening's family entertainment. Wonderful theatre building too, which adds to the atmosphere.
Christmas Show. The 4 of us attended this show last Tuesday the 3rd of Dec. This was an amazing production and would highly recommend it to anyone including children & adults alike!

A must do when in NYC. The Radio City Christmas spectacular is great. It boasts being modernized, and unfortunately although the use of technology is great, the show lost some of the tradition with the makeover. We have been to the show many times over the years and were disappointed with the latest version. It was also reduced to just under an hour and a half. Fortunately the Rockettes are fantastic as always.
Christmas Spectacular. Loved the Christmas spectacular. Many of the things they had when I was a kid back in the 1970's with some new things that use 3D glasses. Recommend for kids of all ages!!!

City Icon. I took my son to the Christmas show this year and we had fun! My pre-motherhood visits to the NYC did not include Radio City Music Hall but since this was my son's first trip to the city, I wanted to take him to the show. We had fun, but I doubt we would go back again. Not because it was not good but because unless you have a family tradition, it is not a show worth going back every year. But it was fun!

Great show!. We took our 6 year old nephew to the show. He loves it especially the video game part. I think they are doing a great job keeping the show updated to what kids know now. We went to the 9:00 show on a Saturday to get good seats at a reasonable price.

Xmas Spectacular. I hadn't seen the Xmas show since I was a child. Happily, I can report that it is magic! My wife and I had the time of our lives watching the Rockettes, particularly the march oh the Wooden Soldiers. We can't wait until we have grandchildren, so we can introduce them to this timeless show.

Wonderful Show. What a way to get you into the Christmas spirit but to go to the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular!! It was a great show and the Radio City Music Hall does a wonderful job of moving the line. They scan your tickets so it took not time at all to get in. Our seats were great in the orchestra section and I bet there is not a bad seat in the house. The Rockettes put on a great show and everything is just as they say it is.....Spectacular!!

A Holiday treat for the Family. We took the train from Philadelphia to enjoy a visit to NYC with my sister and 6 year old niece. We had a busy schedule that included the Macy's Thanksgiving Day parade and shopping on 5th Avenue but the highlight was the magical Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Musical Hall. We bought tickets a week before and the second mezzanine was the only available section. No problem at Radio City where there is not a bad seat in the house. The theater itself is an Art Deco palace but the show was truly spectacular, let's just say that a tired six year old was on the edge of her seat smiling during the entire show. The pace of the show and the added state-of-the-art lighting were great but the highlight of course were the incomparable Rockettes. Such energy and precision........a must for any visitors to NYC during the holidays.

Rockettes Christmas spectacular wait to buy tickets or go late. We paid 99 plus fees when waiting until just a few days before show. I knew I didn't want to spend top buck and just searched for the best prices and tickets for the time we were there....ended up going at 930 on Friday night and were center row 18 main floor. It runs 90 mins with no intermission. All 3 generations truly loved the show and feel we got our money's worth. Radio city is beautiful with comfortable seats. The Rockettes were fantastic. There was a little "bit" in the middle with mom and daughter with Santa that got a little long....other than that the staging was great and truly enjoyable...they even had live camels!!! If it's in your budget then go....but remember you don't need to pay over 150 per ticket....be flexible on your times and wait...with about 6000 seats and shows every 2.5 hours you're bound to find something in your price range.
Love the new show. It's been several years since we saw the Rockettes, and this show was great. I can't believe they do 5 shows a day.... lots of energy!

Great show for young and old alike. Classic Christmas show that the whole family will love. It is fun to watch all the little children in their holiday finery so excited for the show. My college and teen kids still love the show. Don't bother with the popcorn that will set you back $12 and is SO SALTY you will be forced to buy a drink - another $6! Wish I had skipped that. Fun time. Be sure to see the tree in Rockefeller Center while you are there.

Christmas Spectacular. This show was loads of fun!! There was plenty of singing, dancing and delicious eye candy costumes and sets. The orchestra was marvelous. If you take a look back from floor seating to the center upper level seating during the show there was a live broadcast monitor of the conductor conducting the music which we found interesting. When purchasing seats I would prefer lower orchestra level as we had although I was not sure at the purchase time to get upper center or not.
