I liked being close to the stage and seeing all the wardrobe. This is a must see this holiday, no doubt. The staff are wonderful and the venue is warm and captivating. The kids were engaged the entire show.

brilliant!. An amazing venue, really beautiful decor inside. We saw the Christmas Spectacular - and the title didn't disappoint! In fact when we visited 2 days before to book our tickets at the ticket office the man was so very helpful and got us great seats at a great price! This was a real treat and well worth a visit.

what a nice show for the family. we enjoyed the Christmas show over the thanksgiving holiday, it was well worth it. The kids loved the show and there is not a bad seat in the house. we sat in the 3rd mezzanine in the center and we could see everything just fine, it is a great family show and they do a great job. I would say it was a good value for the price of the tickets, my girls want to go back again and even my son enjoyed it and he was very excited to go at first.

A must do .. but. Although I have been to NY many times, I have never been to a performance and since this was Xmas .. well, I had to do the Xmas spectacular. We had great seats, note that Row SS is further forward than Row S, Row GG further forward than Row G etc, but although it is a large theatre, I think it is well designed that most seats give you great viewing. The Rockettes were wonderful, the other acts entertaining and a definite thumbs up to a great show.HOWEVER - Radio City - please hold back latecomers - I cannot tell you how many people walked in, and continued to stand up blocking views waiting to find their seats while the performance was under way. Also, please stop ALL photography during the performance, no effort was made to tell people to stop taking flash pictures, or even those constantly holding up their cameras and videoing or photographing away. So a BIG 5 for the performance, and 3 for the management of Radio City.

Rockettes' Christmas Show impressive despite lame 3-D film add-ins. The Rockettes' Christmas show is impressive. The opening reindeer number is fantastic, the toy soldiers number is fun, and the final Nativity scene is magnificent. They jammed in two 3-d film pieces which were out of place and painful. Still, the choreography, orchestra music, and precision dancing more than carried the day for all ages - even teens. Get there a bit early as they start on time and don't allow many mid show seatings.

Christmas show. I hadn't been to see the Radio City Christmas show in over 10 years. Definately a great show to see. Go online and choose your own seats. My date and I sat eight rows from the stage on an aisle seat and ticket prices were $150 each (plus applicable fees of course). The show was well worth the money. It wasn't crowded (we went on a Tuesday for the 2PM show) at all. The show is not something I would want to watch every year, but having not gone in all those years made it enjoyable. The Rockette's were good but high kicking gets old after a while. Their wooden soldier routine, though old, is still cute to watch. The most amazing thing is the costumes throughout the entire show. And this year (perhaps recent years not sure) they gave us 3D glasses for two parts of the show. That was very good.

Christmas Spectacular at RCMHall, check that box!!!!. One of my must do bucket list items. It was absolutely breathtaking. The Rockets were superb and the entire show including the 3D portions were so entertaining. Making plans to go back next year with my granddaughter. Buy tickets online to facilitate entry. Very we'll organized in spite of large full house crowds.

Spectacular. First time visit to Radio City Music Hall. The Christmas Spectacular was exactly that!!!!! The Rocketts and the entire cast were so in unison that you actually watched for someone to make a mistake, but it never happened, unbelievable, the amount of precision is 100%. The dancers alone are worth the visit, but, the entire show was so technologically programmed and the surprises never stop. It was one of the most enjoyable shows of my life. The scenes are a tour of NYC and cover interests for children of all ages. An absolute must for anyone visiting this time of year.

A dream come true. Since watching 'Annie' when I was little, I have always wanted to go to Radio City Music Hall to see the Rockettes. Last weekend we did it and it was everything I could have hoped for. The building is beautiful and there is not a bad seat in the house. The only issue - not enough ladies washrooms. The lines are long.

Must see over the holidays!. Our experience was Wow! This was a show on my Mom's Bucket list, we brought her to NYC for her 80th Birthday. We have heard her speak of the Rocketts since we were kids. It was a Joy to be there with Mom. The entire show was spectacular and the Nativity portion at the end was heartfelt and glorious!

Not to be missed while in NYC!. We really enjoyed the Christmas Spectacular at the Radio City Music Hall this year. I went with my 2 daughters and 2 1/2 year old grandson. We also did the backstage tour right before our show. The tour took bout 45 minutes and was very informative however I expected to see more. It was nice to see the massive theatre when it was empty and hear the history as well as amazing physical facts of the building. We even saw the camels being exercised on the stage. We toured the back hallways viewing the retired costume display but only from the doorway ( I would have like to get a close up), saw the private reception room and watched a short film. But the best part was meeting a Rockette and having g the opportunity to get pictures with ( extra charge but worth it). This tour is not suitable for children under 6, quite a bit of walking and needs a good attention span. Now on to the show...Awesome! We purchased tickets as a larger group a month in advance for the matinee, so the price was very reasonable. The Rockettes did not disappoint! My grandson was enthralled and we enjoyed every minute of the show. The scenes were beautiful and the dancers precision was perfect. This theatre is technologically amazing adding to the wonder of the whole experience. From projected scenes on the ceiling to dancers up the sides on platforms to the stage turning, rising, tilting and lowering this building is as wonderful as the show! We loved every minute of it...The Radio City Music Hall is not to be missed!
Christmas Spectacular. The Rockets were awesome. The background was the coolest. The nativity was cold chill beautiful. AAAAA++++++
Christmas Spectacular!. Simply, Awesome! My second year in a row with half price tickets from Groupon/Livingsocial. I'm all ready for Christmas now!

Spectacular Christmas spectacular!. I had always wanted to see the Rockettes Christmas show, even though some of the reviews said it was cheesy. I was pleasantly surprised at how fantastic the show was! I was entertained throughout, and was blown away at the intricate and technical sets. The scenes were quite long and energetic and the dancers never seemed to tire a bit. We had seats in the first row of the third mezzanine, and even though far from the stage, we had an excellent view and were able to fully appreciate the precision of the dance lines and how in sync the dancers were. One drawback was a metal support holding a mirror ball that partially blocked my husband's view, which was not disclosed when we purchased the tickets. We were also taken back by the prices at the concessions and souvenir kiosks...everything was outrageously expensive. The security men were also quite rude to us and others when we were waiting in line to enter the theater, and were yelling and generally treating us disrespectfully, as if we were stupid. That left a bad taste in my mouth since we were paying guests. I would still highly recommend seeing the show though since it is so entertaining and well-produced.

Very Accommodating. We went to see the show and realized we bought tickets to a earlier show on the same date. Staff was very accommodating, and although we were seated in the mezzanine, we were able to move closer before the show started. My sons first time, and we loved it. We will be back when I hear they make a new show. Thanks again.

Christmas Spectacular may be our new tradition. I saw the Christmas Spectacular - my first time seeing the show and my first time to Radio City.I thoroughly enjoyed the show, especially the parts featuring the Rockettes. However, my parents - who have been going yearly for eons - thought the show lacked this year and has been going downhill.The venue is nice, and a must-do...but it seemed a bit out-dated, and the lines get crazy long.

Christmas Spectacular 2013. Sure..things don't change much over the years at RCMH but it's still a treat to stop by to enjoy the show and the Rocketts. I think there may be more interesting shows and attractions but for those of us who have seen much of what the city has to offer, I believe this should be a must see!

What a Fantastic Show!. We went during the Thanksgiving Holiday and found even getting the tickets was an easy trip. We purchased the tickets through the Hotel's Front Desk (Ink48) we went the next day and stood in line for a short period and picked them up. The show itself was out of this world, my wife and I are in our 60's, and like the young kids watching, I to was totally amazed. From the start of the show till the end was a standing ovation.Everyone should attend this spectacular.

2013 Christmas Show. First time ever to see this spectacular show with The Rockettes. We took our 13YO grand-daughter and I'm not sure who had more fun, she or us. It was really a treat. Professional dancing, professional singing, first-class sets and staging. Ornate deco style theater. The entire experience is one that everyone should enjoy at least one time. So glad that we went, it was a wonderful memory.One note though. the line for the ladies room was very long so try to avoid if you can.

Spectacular Christmas show for Santa believers. Always wanted to see the Rockettes and they had some beautiful costumes. Definately lots of extra Santa storytelling for children. The sets were impressive.

CHRISTMAS SPECTACULAR JUST OKAY. I really enjoyed seeing the Rocketts but the show was just okay. The kids in the theater seemed to enjoy it and I was glad I got to see it since I was in NYC. However, I would not rush back to see it. It seemed somewhat boring to me. I wish I had taken in a Broadway show instead of it!

A spectacular only to some. First, let me say my personal opinion is that everyone should see it at least once in their life. This is my 4th time. It brings back memories of when I was a child. Show is 90 minutes (no intermission) and has been updated. What hasn't changed is the nativity scene, the fall of the wooden soldiers and there is always ice skaters and Santa of course. The scenes and the venue are spectacular if you stop to think what it takes to put on this show. I brought my 26, 21 and 18 year old. Their response to the show was "it's ok". So if you are bringing teens, expecting them to love it, they will not. It is geared more towards younger kids, and the parents who marvel in watching it through the eyes of their child. Other advice I can give - take the time to look around, the venue is amazing, and dress warm, the place was quite chilly. I had decent middle orchestra seats, and sill had to lean left or right to see the stage which I found quite annoying. While you are there make sure you take the time to walk over to Rockefeller Center to see the tree.

Christmas Spectacular. Definitely a production for kids under 13 years of age. Cons: Completely disorganized getting everyone in the building. Not enough Radio City employees working outside and inside the building. Huge numbers of late comers were allowed in well into the third act. This was not only distracting, but we couldn't see because of the people standing in the isle. There was no regulation over camera and video use by the staff so this was also extremely distracting.

Rockettes Rock. Had a wonderful time with elderly parents and young kids watching the Christmas Specatcular and special compliments to each and every staff member - they helped with my Mom and her cane, they helped with my lost glove, they helped with the restroom visit, they helped with getting us out of there, they were quick with the goodie sales (yikes $5.50 for bottled water, welcome to NYC) and they helped two times with pointing us to the plaza/tree afterwards. The show was very very very good - everyone enjoyed it. Sounded a little too miked for my liking, but the live music is wonderful and not found everywhere. Love the classics (santa dancing and toy soldiers) Kids enjoyed the ending video game. I don't have much to compare to since I went 30 plus years ago the last time, but it is a show to remember. I would have no desire to go every year.

Wow!. What a great Christmas show. We have a 2, 5 and 7 year old and everyone loved the show! It has a mix of singing, dancing, and 3d film effects. It was fast paced and entertaining! If you look carefully online, there are coupon codes to save money on tickets too! Go early to see Santa in the lobby and visit the Consierge for free buttons for the kids!

Bring back the magic!. My family and I saw the Christmas Show last night. The show was "updated" several years ago. We had been annual attendees of this show until I read of the update. I took time off before returning and I really wish I had. The magic of Santa's Workshop has ben replaced by a seriously boring, uncreative and pedestrian "video" game. My teenagers were rolling their eyes over the unsubtle "lesson" - play with your kids? Really? I spent money for this piece of advice? here's my advice - listen to this idea and spend your money buying the VIP pass for the Rink at Rockefeller Center instead. Enjoy the laughter of your children while drinking hot cocoa and ice skating without the lines. Thats where the "magic" is - it sure as heck is not at this show where the "perfect" gift from Santa is a video game. Bah humbug. Seriously awful and disappointing. The Rockettes were amazing. See them when they are not in this awful Christmas Show! Please bring back the elves, the workshop and Mrs Claus and get rid of the snarky Mom with the bad contemporary jokes. They fall flat.

What a beautiful building!. I love old architecture and this building is so beautiful. The dueling organs before the show was a great opening. When we walking into the lobby we couldn't miss the big beautiful chandeliers. The show was good but I loved the building.

Loved it!. It was such a pleasure coming into the city today to see the Christmas Spectacular show. It was a first for my 8yr old and we very much enjoyed the show and the experience. The Rocketts were AMAZING!!

X-mas spectacular is really spectacular. Went to the X-mas Spectacular show this and last year with my family, and we absolutely love it.Yes, tickets are expensive, but you can find discounts on the internet, or go early in the season. Also all seats give very good views of the stage, so it is not necessary to have the expensive seats in the middle.The show has something for everyone, and the story portrayed near the end about a mom and a daughter finding the true meaning of X-mas is heartwarming. And the Rockettes are true professional dancers in their own right. If you are in New York during the holiday period, go see this show.

Awesome Holiday Experience. After a super long day of the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade we went to the Radio City Christmas Spectacular! Its great from opening to ending! I highly recommend this show for ANY age! Santa keeps the kids captivated and the magic of the dance will take you away! Can be pricy, but look online for discount codes. We used TZoo2 and got orchestra seats that were perfect for an awesome price! Over 30% off ticket value. The only bad thing is the food costs. $5 for a sprite, or any beverage. Candy bar is outrageous as well. Eat before you come.Radio City Music Hall itself is beautiful with its architecture and decorations! check it out!

Home of the famous Rockettes. One of my favorite places to visit with the family. If we we are in NYC we traditionally take the children to see the Christmas show. This tradition has been going on for 3 generations and it is a wonderful one indeed. The show is breathtaking and fun!

Very good Holiday show. I have to start with the beginning. Try to book a discount ticket as the price is pretty high... And don't go there to pickup your ticket at 8 am as advised by the website because the ticket box opens 90 minutes before the first show... Try to be there 30 minutes before the show time because 6000 people means a lot of crowd. They are very well organized but a crowd is a crowd. The Rockettes are amazing and the show is enchanting for all ages. They even bring every day few camels and those are just passing through the stage...

Radio City Christmas Show-The way to start the holiday season!. We saw the Christmas show on Thanksgiving evening and it was so beautiful and entertaining. The Rockettes had some really terrific dance routines. I loved the costumes and the energy and the amazing choreography. I have seen this show once before but this one was so much better. It will be one the best memories I will take away from our trip here. It is one of the best ways to spend the evening with the ones you love!

Fabulous. The venue alone is worth a visit but the show was just flawless.First of all, we paid a fortune for premium seats. Don't do it! Every seat in the house appeared to be fantastic. While some parts of the show were geared toward younger families, we were still blown away. The rest of my party had never seen the show and I had not seen it in over twenty years. I am certain that it is a far better production (even taking into account modern technology and expectations) than it was many years ago. It rivaled any Broadway show we have seen. Worth every penny.Keep in mind that there are several food and beverage counters and gift shops so arrive early. While the crowds looked overwhelming, the staff was incredibly proficient at getting everyone where they needed to be.

Spectacular show and venue. Having heard about Radio City Music Hall and the Rockettes for many years, we decided that while we were in NYC we would try to see a show there. Knowing how popular it is we were surprised at the ease of obtaining tickets on the net from Sydney. Our surprise was heightened when we arrived at this amazing venue. From the minute we picked up our tickets from the box office, and entered the magnificent foyer, we knew this was something special. The usher showed us to great seat, just five rows from the stage, and looking around while waiting for the show to start gave me a feeling of almost being on the stage itself. What a magnificent arena this is. Then the show started. What can I say about the show. All the way through I was looking to see if there was any way I could fault it. No not one. It was perfection. The singing dancing music everything...Spectacular. Thank you for a wonderful wxoerience

Go see the Christmas Spectacular. Great show, very American. Will definitely get you in the mood for christmas. We didn't get expensive tickets, we sat right at the back on the 3rd mezz and it was great. A must do in NYC
Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectecular. If you are going to be in NYC from now to New Years - don't miss this show - it is absolutely brilliant! Best seats are in the first mezzanine.

Wonderful show!!!. We loved this Christmas show! It was glitzy and fun and energetic and really puts you in the Christmas spirit! The Rockettes are amazing and we loved everything they did. We loved the special effects and the living nativity! The only part that was less than spectacular was the storyline about the little girl and the electronics games, etc. That was kinda ho hum and seemed out of place. Just stick with the traditional stuff! We loved it and would definitely highly recommend the show to anyone traveling near the holidays!

Really interesting tour!. I went on the Radio City tour recently and thought it was fantastic! I have often passed by Radio City and saw the line for the tours but never had the opportunity to take the tour. Tickets are purchased on the north side entrance at a very reasonable cost. There are tours every hour and the tour itself takes approx. 1 hour. I was lucky to be in a small group, just 7 of us so the person leading our group was able to give personal attention. I really recommend this tour for anyone who is curious about the history of Radio City and the Rockettes. Of course a highlight is meeting a Rockette and having a photo op. Kristin, the Rockette also gave us some background on the training they go through and their work. The tour takes around the main areas of hall including a number of behind the scene areas. Having seen a couple of shows here, I had only seen the lobby and the main public areas. We were taken into way up in the upper area of the hall where the lighting crew works and we were also able to see the spectacular end of the Christmas Show. The guide provided us with a wealth of information on the history of Radio City and famous performers from the past and present. At the end you are provided an opportunity to purchase the pictures with the Rockette. I found it sort of found amusing that all the married guys chose not to take a picture with Kristin....lol

Christmas Spectacular. Just saw the Rockettes at Radio City with the kids (7,5,3). I thought it would be exciting to sit close up for the kids, we had second row in the BB section. The seats were too close, so don't spend the extra money for those seats and try to sit further away, you don't get to enjoy the perfect line that the Rockettes create when you are that close to the stage. The show is fun, I haven't been since I was a kid and some of it has changed but not much. The Rockettes are always beautiful and the toy soldier scene was a favorite among my children. The show runs straight through with no intermission (this actually worked for my kids because their attention span only lasts so long). Book it, don't stress about the seats even if you are in the mezzanine you will be fine. Also, if you have girls that are 8 and older you can book tickets through American Girl. For $ 100 you get a dinner at American Girl, craft and tickets to the XMAS spectacular. It is a great deal! There are also opportunities to meet a rockette and a photo op. Of course the dates and times are limited if you book through American girl. Good Luck, Happy Holidays and enjoy. Nothing beats NYC during XMAS season....its simply the best!

loved it. I have seen this show twice before,threw the years.It has changed threw the years. Which I think is a good thing. Because if you want to see it again & again,its not the same old thing over & over.Of course the rockettes are great! Amazing what they do. I like the story line. I love the 3 !!
Christmas spectacular. The Rockettes do it again! Fantastic Christmas show will put you in the holiday spirit. Beautiful costumes and fun songs brighten your day.

thought it would be a bit better. I was really looking forward to this as it was advertised none stop on the TV and thought it would be a great experience! It was just for my husband and I, (didnt go with any kids)The queues outside went down really quickly which was good really as it was -3'C! A quick bag check and in we were.There were good areas of the show which i really liked, e,g the soldiers and when they all fell down, the tour bus sight seeing scene. But i didnt enjoy the dancing teddy bear bit, just a bit dull, no impact to the point where i got my phone out..The santa that would come out and speak to the audience I found quite hard to understand what he was saying most of the time as he was putting on an old voice accent.It covers a lot of christmas songs and it will make you come out feeling a lot more christmassy.I dont want to put a downer on the show,THe Rockettes were amazing and will make up for the weak bits in between.I got my tickets through Groupon so I got them at a discount price which was a plus and got really good seats so get them through them, you can only watch them in November though..

lovely old building. The venue was fine,Jack White concert ended abruptly after 45 mins....not too impressed with that as it was a 10 hour drive to see him. What can I say.....audience was good, venue was interesting to see, people working there were nice and friendly. The date visited was actually prior to the options listed, it was Sept 2012

Christmas Show. Great show enjoyed by my two daughters in their 40's and grandson 10 and grandaughter 7.The seats we had were third mezzanine dead center last row. The seats were great and the children can stand as there are no seats behind the row.. Definetly worth the 45$ plus 15$ in charges as oppossed to the more expensive orchestra seats.

Amazing. Did the tour years ago and it was great. My sister and I actually got to kick with a Rockette, a memory that we will remember forever. This visit to NYC the main reason for our visit was to watch the Christmas spectacular. It was awesome! Great job girls!!! I was surprised at how quickly the line for pictures with a Rockette went through.

Rockettes Didn't Miss a Beat!. Amazing show! The Rockettes didn't miss a beat. Favorite scene: Scene 6- New York at ChristmasLeast favorite scene: Scene 13- NativityMe (24 y/o), my nephew (9 y/o), and Mom (52 y/o) all enjoyed the show! It's great for all ages. 90 minutes straight through. I love the scene about Christmas in New York, esp. the ice skating in Central Park since I took my nephew earlier that day ice skating at Wollman Rink! This show really puts you in the holiday spirit. The outfits were glitzy/flashy. The scenes were incredible. I probably wouldn't have paid full price, but the Groupon deal I purchased ($65/seat in the orchestra section) was definitely a great value! We were pretty close up. Even if we were in the mezzanine/balcony, I think we still would've seen just fine.Sorry for no pics of the show- they don't allow flash photography and my phone will not take good pics without any flash :(

my first time to see the Christmas Show .... The Rockettes were great and the more traditional numbers - bus driving through the city with Rockettes on board fantastic! But the part with Mom and little girl about 'comprimise' and the extended video game sequence in Santaland really missed the mark in my opinion and the younger kids sitting near us just didn't get it. Stick to the traditional stuff !

TRULY SPECTACULAR. My wife and I attended the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular and were not disappointed. The show was fast moving, an 1 1/2 in length, and included beautiful sets and costumes, great actors, and of course the Radio City Rockettes. It is a show for the entire family both young and old alike.

Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall. I have not been to the show in years and it was great to see it after such a long time. It is very commercialized now but it is still fun to watch. Definitely worth to see it at least once.
Christmas Spectacular. The show will absolutely thrill you. What a wonderful show to start the holiday season. Trying to figure out how to get all of our Grandchildren to see this awesome show!

No show? No problem!. If you get a chance to take the Backstage Tour at Radio City Music Hall, do it! I have been there for shows, but this behind the scenes peek is something to experience. Not only do you get to hear about the history of the Hall (builders, art deco décor, stage, seats, sound magnification), but this small group tour takes you from the highest row to the stage itself, from the meandering hallways to the Rockette dressing room! Yes, a real Radio City Rockette visits each group at the end to answer questions. Can't ask for more than this.

Christmas Show was Excellent. Booked online VIP package and received seventh row seats. A must visit during the Christmas season. A bucket list trip with once in a lifetime seating . Awesome show of course .
HO HO HO what a great show!!!!!. Was awesome. Kids and adults will both be thoroughly entertained. A must see at Christmas time! HO HO HO!!!!!
Christmas show. This is the show I have never seen before. I wish our son was with us. Best 100$ spent in NYC during our 4-day trip

Wow!!!!. Christmas spectacular is just that, SPECTACULAR!!! Attending this was on my list of things to do, and finally made it happen this year. The entire experience was great, from ordering the tickets online, getting in line to pick up the tickets, going around the corner to stand in line to get in, everyone you dealt with was helpful, pleasant, snd seemed to enjoy what they were doing. Of course, then you get inside and WOW! It takes your breath away. Even loved the ladies lounge. Made the boyfriend come with me, and he turned to me after about the third number and said he was getting chills! Mission accomplished! We both really enjoyed the show. He wants to get tickets next year to send his Sister and her kids who live in the Bronx, but have never been. It is not something that I could do every year, but it is absolutely something not to miss if you have the opportunity.

They don't call it a Christmas SPECTACULAR for nothing!. What a great show! This is my second time seeing the show, but the first was more than 25 years ago. Everything from the singing, to dancing to the sets and lighting were all excellent. We were seated up in the second mezzanine because the only seats down in the orchestra and first mezzanine were way to the side. I had read somewhere that the centre seats were better, even if you had to go to the second mezzanine to get them and we were glad we did. Plus, the height enabled us to see the entire stage and get a very nice view of everything. The best word to describe the show was "impressive"!

Overall Wonderful Experience. Upon entering the building, the lobby is beautifully decorated and transports you to an earlier era. The most gorgeous chandelier hangs in the center. We were seated in the second mezzanine, and had great views. I don't think there is a bad seat in the house. The organ music was very nice before the show started. And once it started...wow. We were a large group, ages 7 to 70. It was fantastic. Everyone enjoyed it. Although- the classic parts of the show were much better than the newer ones. The nutcracker, tin soldiers and dancing santas, for example, were fantastic. Once the show segued into the more recently written part (finding a happy medium with video games between parent and child) it seemed dated already. If they just stuck with the more classic themes, it would have been better. That being said- the youngest and the oldest in our group loved every part. Afterward, Santa (the best looking one I've ever seen) and a Rockette were available for photos in the lobby. We did the photo with the Rockette, because they aren't as easy to find! There were lots of concessions and souvenirs available. Take a side trip to the 'Ladies Lounge'. What a hoot! A total throwback, with chairs in front of mirrors for reapplying your powder and lipstick.I think it is a must if visiting New York at Christmas time. Enjoy!

not what we expected. This was my second visit and not worth the time or money.we booked through the website Viator. I was charged €69 per ticket instead of $69. So please be careful.Seats were very average.The show was advertised as 2 hours, however we were out on the street in 90 mins.Not good value for money.The main reason for seeing this show was the Rockettes, but the majority of the programme was a sketch with a mother and daughter talking to Santa.I would not recommend it this year.

Christmas Show didnt disappoint. Went to see The Rockettes Christmas Spectacular, 1st time at the Radio City Music Hall. The sheer size of the hall is amazing and the nativity show was 1st class, real donkeys, sheep and camels! Yes camels! Not an everyday sight on the stage! The show had no interval but wasnt too long either. Thoroughly recommend it!

Christmas Spectacular 2013 - bigger and better!. Radio City Music Hall is simply a NYC must see - the 'grand dame' of theatre opulence and magnificence. The 2013 version of their Christmas Spectacular is a family-friendly extravaganza >>* Sleigh Ride - leading off with the fabulous Rockettes (better than ever!)* Santa Flies to New York (in 3-D!)\* 12 Days of Christmas* Nutcracker* Parade of Wooden Soldiers (classic - not to be missed!)* New York at Christmas* Department Store* Here Comes Santa Claus* Closer Than You Know (visit to the North Pole)* Santa's Video Game (in 3-D!)* Closer Than We Knew (a reminder of the best gifts in life)* Snow* The Living Nativity* Joy to the World90 minutes (no intermission) of fantastic entertainment; well worth the price! Please everyone - just leave your cameras at home and take in the Spectacular as it's happening; it's meant to be experienced live and in person.(probably one of the largest set of rest rooms of any theatre in the world)Great incorporation of new technology with classic entertainment with the always beautiful Rockettes! They have a brand new show outside of the Christmas season featuring the Rockettes gearing up for 2014 also! It's called 'Heart and Lights' - great preview; should be dynamic.Highly recommend!

Radio City Christmas Spectacular ..... Fantastic. Visited NYC and went to see The Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. It was the highlight of my trip and a great start to the holiday season. From the fabulous decorations in the lobby to the great show. Had goosebumps especially the Nativity scene with real camels, sheep and donkey.

Christmas Show 2013 is Spectacular. We went to the Christmas Show this year for the first time ever. What a fantastic theater. It was breath-taking to walk into the theater and see all the beautiful lights and decorations! The twin-organs provided beautiful music and the rockettes were outstanding. I loved the toy soldier routine that they performed flawlessly. The show was well worth the time and money. A must see!

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular 2013. My wife had never seen the Rockettes and this was the time.She loved it and so did I. The singing the dancing, the kick lines, Radio City Music Hall itself, all wonderful.It is a truly amazing experience for adults and children alike. The costumes are beautiful, the lighting is great, the 3D parts of the show are really fun especially for the kids, and the orchestra is excellent. It is a joyful celebration of Christmas but not in your face religious.The Rockettes must practice for months to get the dance numbers down to absolute perfection. They make marching bands, ice skaters, synchronized swimmers, and most military drill teams look sort of pale by comparison.We sat in the first row of the first (of 3) mezzanines and the view was perfect. We could see everything including the way the choreography was working.Highly recommended.

SUCH A ICONIC BUILDING... This was the first time our family visited Radio City Music Hall. We went to see the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular Show. It was so worth the time and money. We all thoroughly enjoyed it...every scene was better than the next. It is the best way to start the holiday season!

Radio City Christmas Spectacular, a must see Christmas Show.... I went with 4 girlfriends, it was on one of thems bucket list.. We were all amazed and loved it.. We all want to come back next year and bring our grandchildren.. I reccommend a trip to NYC and definately a trip to the Christmas Spectacular.. The Rockettes are beautiful, talented women.. I can not believe it took me 53 year to go to this show... Everyone needs to experience it.

Very entertaining. Lots of color. Love the Rockets. The show was very good. The 3D is very interesting. Almost caught the candy cane. Expected to see a bit more ornate to the music hall. The walls and ceilings are actually very plain. The place is huge. The seats are very comfortable. Would have liked an intermission during this 90 min. show, but I guess where would you put all the people? All in all a very nice day. Of course, New York city is the star of the show. No place like it in the entire US.

Christmas Spectacular was SPECTACULAR!!!!. WOW!!! What a show!!! Everyone visiting NYC this time of the year should see this show to get in the mood for the holidays! Absolutely beautiful production! I will absolutely see it again in the future!

Mike & Donna at the Christmas Spectacular. This was a fantastic show full of great music, dancing and surprises. The Rockettes were at their best and so was Santa who was a big hit throughout the show. The seats were great and the staff was very helpful. The show is worth the price.

Best show in NYC!. We took our daughters & grandkids, ages 4 & 5 to the Radio City Christmas Spectacular yesterday. We all loved it, & the kids were mesmerized, delighted, & entranced! Do not miss it!

Rockettes Christmas Show!. I was lucky enough to be in NYC for the first time during the Radio City Music's Christmas Show! What an amazing experience! The performance was incredible! Those folks are so talented! The dancing, the music, the sets - OMG - it brought tears to my eyes! I am so grateful that at the last minute (literally), I was able to get tickets and go to the show! The special effects including a couple of 3-D portions simply blew me away! The dancers are incredible! It is one of the things I will ALWAYS remember from my first visit to NYC!

Xmas Rockette Show. To start with the hall itself is spectacular! The show was superb! The Rockettes were wonderful....such timing.....practice does make perfect....they are a testament to that. The only down side ....it wasn't long enough esp. for the $$s it costs....there could have been a few more numbers we felt.

Simply Stunning Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. WOW!!! The Rockettes performance of their Christmas spectacular at Radio City Music Hall is a must see for the entire family. I feel very fortunate that I was given tickets to attend this stunning performance. Radio City Music hall is run like a well oiled machine. Entry into this large facility is seamless and quick. Once inside you are transported to a place of sparkle and wonder. We sat in the second mezzanine, which is perfect for seeing the whole stage. The 90 minute show starts on time and no entry is allowed once the show begins, so plan to go early. The Rockettes are fantastic. Their costumes are beautiful in color, sparkle and entirely represent the song and words of each different theme. At times I counted as many as 48 dancers. The performances were told in a story, with precision - like perfection. Some parts are in 3 D and glasses are given to you when you enter the auditorium. The stage was huge and multi functioning with many possible arrangements and layers. parts of the stage could be spun in circles, some dropped down and dancers popped through the floor, three levels of stage could occur easily and the orchestra pit came up and down at any time. The costumes featured fuzzy furry bears, and cartoon characters, toy soldiers, three wise men, two camels, little kids, Christmas elves, a train, the North Pole, a NYC tour bus, and tons more. In one part we were immersed into a video game in order to save Christmas from bah humbug. With the ceiling and walls under a simulator effect, you truly felt transported onto the back of Santa's sleigh, or in the North Pole inside Santa's toy shop. There are robotic, remote controlled huge snowflakes that appear through the floor and float around and then retreat back into the floor. There is no intermission and the costumes changes are many. No food or drink is allowed, nor any zoom lens camera's and your purse and bags are checked outside radio City Music hall. Absolutely the best show to see especially at this time of year. A perfect gift. For anyone who has kids interested in dance, like my special southern belle Larissa, this show is a must see. The stage hands are exceptional in the many set changes and rapid flow of one scene to another with the stage curtains pulled into several different varieties of shapes. It is very busy in this areas, so I highly recommend taking a cab or walking from where you are staying. We went by tour bus with WADE TOURS, so they just dropped us at the door. Truly magnificent!!!! A Christmas Spectacular indeed!!!

great show for all ages. The Radio City Music hall Christmas show is still great and wonderful show for any age. They have modernized the show with 3D and modern takes on old traditions. But the Rockets still steal the show with their grace and beauty. always loved the Toy Soldier act.My only complaint is the total price. I bought the tickets on line well in advance of the show. By the time I was done I paid $49 above the printed ticket price for an Orchestra seat. You pay a handling charge and shipping for each ticket, not for each order. What a rip off.

A must -see - Rocketttes. This show is amazing and if you are limited as to what to do - seeing the Rockettes is well worth the money. If you have time, take the tour of Radio City Music Hall also. Everyone that we encountered was pleasant and helpful.

Guided Tour. We did the guided Tour of Radio City Hall and it was very pleasant. Our guide gave us very good explanations about the story of Radio City and the Rockettes. Later during the tour we got to meet a Rockette.The theater itself is very impressive, I can't believe a theater this big actually was primarily used as a cinema, watching a movie with a crowd of 6000 people must be impressive.During your tour you will visit the bathrooms in the lower level which are quite exquisite and your tour guide will explain you the meanings of the decoration.

Christmas Spectacular 2013. Great show for all ages, even old retired folks like us! The production quality is amazing, as is the theater. Check out the lobby chandelier. The dance numbers were fun and the 3-D well done. The final nativity scene was extraordinary and brought a lump to the throat. Snacks and souvenirs are expensive but the show is just the right length, a satisfying mix of song, dance, and magic.

NYC icons: Radio City and The Rockettes. Radio City Music Hall is a beautiful piece of old NY architecture, right in the heart of Manhattan. The theater is beautiful and grand. The show is spectacular. Highlights for us were: the amazing use of multimedia with 3D effects - it was so well coordinated with the live dancing; the tour of Manhattan on a GreyLine double decker bus; real ice skaters; the toy soldier routine ending in the dominio effect - very cool! Santa's narration was a bit hokey, but they had to do something to provide time for changing sets.The Wurlitzers at the beginning and end of the show were fun, too. Don't expect to get any bargains at the shops in the theater.

Radio City Christmas Spectacular - 2013. This was my first time at the show and it was awesome. I went with my 15-year old son, my girlfriend and her 10-year old son. We drove into the city and parked in a garage near the theater. We totally had a blast. Seats were in the middle orchestra section so they were pretty good. I would highly recommend this show to everyone, at least to see it once. The Rockettes were great. They incorporated some 3-D film into the production. The venue was very crowded but I don't think they were sold out during this particular show. They probably get more people closer to Christmas. We also spent the extra money and took a picture with a Rockette - so cool! After the show, we walked around the area for a while. They were just putting together the tree at Rockefeller Center. You could conceivably make a day of it, if you plan it right. Of course, this is New York so I think things are very expensive around Radio City, which is just one big tourist trap. But, we knew what we were getting into, so a good time was still had by all.

Christmas Spectacular!!!. Great Rockettes show for all ages. Stunning dance numbers that require such amazing talent. 3D show that is also very cool... Chairs are comfortable and the Radio City Music Hall is worth seeing on its own. The souvenirs are really nice but SO expensive. Eat before the show as the food is crappy (old, dry popcorn and dry pretzels) that cost an arm and a leg.

Christmas Spectacular 2013. This was my first visit to Radio Music City Hall. The lobby was beautifully decorated. We sat toward the front of the theatre but don't think there is a seat in the house that would not be a good view. The Christmas Spectacular was an amazing show with a huge screen which gave us some 'how did they do that?' moments. There was also projection onto the side walls of the theatre. The 'bus tour' of the Manhattan streets was very impressive. The nativity scene at the end was amazing. Definately worth seeing!

It's beginning to feel a lot like Christmas.. They have really changed up the show over the last few years. There were parts that we needed 3D glasses for animated clips. Santa and the Rockettes were great as always. The show is entertaining for all ages. After the show my daughter got to pose for a picture with a Rockette. The pictures were expensive but it made my child's day. We had a good time.

Rockettes Xmas Show. What gets you in the mood for Xmas more than the show at Radio City featuring the Rockettes. Timeless entertainment; 3D production made it extra special. Santa was great and many of them! Nice story and of course the Rockettes were superb with their toy soldiers, snow flakes and legs. Everyone loved it. I thought it was best to be in first mezzanine since the show is not only on the stage but on the sides too. Stage is huge and production covers the whole area. You have no problem hearing from any seat. Tickets online are the easiest; always a line up at the entrance, get there early, show starts right on time. Great way to spend the afternoon. Lobby is decked out in snowflakes and chandelier is gorgeous.

2013 Christmas Spectacular. It was amazing. The Rocketts out did themselves. The show had 3D effects that were fantastic (3D glasses provided). Simulated a interactive video game. The orchestra was at its best. The size and scope of the props amazing as the audience was taken on a tour of Manhattan via bus and the Rocketts. The size of the stage is impressive. Largest I have ever seen. The manger scene and procession with camels and other live animals was inspiring. Show ended with the magnificent pipe organ. This is a not to miss event if you are in NY for the holidays,

What an awesome place to visit!. We took a fast trip to NYC and Radio City Music Hall The building alone, was worth seeing! The Rockettes put on an amazing Christmas show! Radio City Music Hall, is so well appointed, and the acoustics were fantastic.

Just as good all these years later. I saw the show Saturday with my daughter. I had not been in fifty years and she had never seen it. It was just as special as I remember. The Rockettes are amazing! and it does put you in the holiday season. I will say its a little pricey.

Christmas Spectacular. My husband, grown son and I thoroughly enjoyed the show on it's opening week-end. The special 3D effects were so well done, the costumes gorgeous and the stage sets were beautiful. The rockettes routines were so entertaining and my husband is still talking about it. Don't miss it!

Christmas Spectacular is for both the Young and Young At Heart. One of the most heartwarming and visually enticing shows we have ever been to. The venue,of course, is superb,but it really how the spaceisutilized that brings it to a whole new dimension. DO NOT MISS THIs SHOW.

Christmas is spectacular. Went to the first day of the 2013 Christmas spectacular. It truly lives up to its name. The theater is absolutely gorgeous, never having seen it outside of the movie Annie. The show is a wonderful blend of digital projection, singing, and of course, the Rockettes precision dance team, who can leave any military drill team in the dust. Before and after the show, there is an opportunity to have your picture taken with either Santa Claus, who serves as the host of the show, or with one of the Rockettes. If you are in New York from early November through the end of December, make sure to see the show.

Beautiful. We took the tour of Radio City Music Hall while waiting for standby tickets for Jimmy Fallon. This turned out to be one of my favorite things we did while visiting NYC. Having never seen inside of it before, its beauty was amazing. The tour is very interesting and informative. The groups are small enough that you have plenty of time for photos, and can hear the tour guide clearly. We even met a Rockette during the tour. The stories, photos and history of the building itself were informative and enjoyable. Would love to attend a show here if I ever have the opportunity.
A Christmas Spectacular. The best show in NYC. I enjoyed it and I will now make it a tradition to see this show every year for the holidays! Thank you to the rockettes for putting on an amazing show!

Take The Tour. I went when there were no shows going on and it was AWESOME cause you can go Onstage and behind stage since there are no crews running around Its worth the fee and you get in right at your slotted time. The tour goes through all the building and you get to meet a Rockette. So if you are in NYC check to see if any shows are going on and if not get in on the tour. You can go when a show is going on but you dont get the same experience.

Amazing venue to catch an event. This is one of the best venues to catch a show or concert. There is always tons going on, so if you are in NYC try and see this historic landmark. We got free tickets to a taping of America's Got Talent from the NBC Store so we got an opportunity to see Radio City Music Hall.This is a great venue with a ton of great seats. The acoustics of this place are amazing, and they put on a great show. I am definitely glad we had a chance to experience this venue.

Radio City Music Hall definitively rocks!. I went today and it was really amazing. Make sure to do the tour with Anne (not sure if its the correct spelling but, just in case, she´s red hair!) Her english is very cleared and she´s very passionate about theatre (and it contagious!). Love to see people that love their jobs! Check it out!

Nice evening out. I had the pleasure of visiting RADIO CITY MUSIC HALL during the months of Aug-Sept of 2013.I had attended AMERICA GOT TALENT six(6) different times. The majority of the staff is very helpful, then you have the staff that does not like their jobs and it shows. This would pertain to the staff that keeps you in line, while they chat it up with each other. Then at the last minute rush us all in like cattle. I perfer the first tier, you are able to see full stage. The lines during break at the concession stands are endless. They have more stands but they remain close. This could be a burden, especially if your at the end of the line. Same holds for the bathroom especially the Ladies room. Think outside the box go to a different upper floor you'll find the wait is extremely severed. All in All, had several nice evenings.

go if you have extra time. We went on this tour and it was good, basically shows you the theater . We did meet a Rockette at the end . If you have short time in New York, I would probably skip this tour, takes 1.5 hours and you should book it ahead of time.

Radio City Christmas Show!. Excellent! Excellent! Excellent! I have gone and seen the Christmas show more than 3 times, and every year it gets better and better. It's a show literally put together for all ages. The seats are comfortable, the staff is always pleasant and friendly, and it's always easy to get in and out, no matter how crowded it is. If you haven't seen the show yet, BUY TICKETS! You won't regret it.

…A shell of her former grandeur…. With great anticipation I approached RCMH about to see Tony Bennett in concert, with the memories of former visits to this great movie palace vivid and alive in my mind, I just knew this would be one of those special “why I live in NYC” moments…then I arrived.All of the attendants are minimum waged employees, doing the least they can in every aspect of their position. From the outside recorded announcements (maybe someone articulate next time?) to the “security” (why even bother people with this farce when you don’t even take a cursory look in packages and purses?) to the seating attendants (those folks who didn’t even have one of those mini flashlights to help find your way and kept guessing where and what row our seats were located?), this was a sad, sad farce.The only thing that saved the evening was of course Mr. Bennett.Cell phone camera’s with flashes going off, people recording on them as well did not distract from his performance.I can’t imagine why I would return.
AWESOME VENUE!. Attended the Hillsong Conference and found the venue to be historic and amazing. Not a bad seat in the house. BEAUTIFUL!

Ban cell phones from shows. Travelled 800 kilometers to attend Tony Bennett concert at radio city music hall in New York . Looked forward to it for months. The show was ruined first by all the latecomers . The show started at 8:00 pm Everyone was settled by 8:45. Tony sang until 9:20 pm. What's with people in new York? That 's RUDE to your fellow theatre goers and to your entertainer. We're not talking one or two people here. What was worse was the amount of people holding up cell phone cameras with bright lights to take a picture, which, let's face it folks, no one can make out. Why not just buy a DVD? Or why not just live in the moment and enjoy the show and let others around you enjoy the show? In Paris at the Olympia theatre the staff use a laser pointer on anyone trying to take pictures or video. Works well. Why can't the staff at Radio City take measures to control this annoyance so others can enjoy the show they paid for. Close the doors when a show starts and late comers be damned . They can enter at intermission as in a play.Or, is this the entitled American way?
Rockettes Christmas Show - A night to remember. What a production. 3D very effective. You would think you were just travelling along 5th Avenue. Well worth the trip

Classic beautiful building with tons of history. This is a great tour. The guide was excellent and loved what she does. The building is a site to see from the lobby to downstairs. It is in remarkable shape and the art deco decor simply fantastic.

Excellent Show. I have seen the Rockettes twice and each was a slightly different show. The both times the backstage tours were also different. Interesting piece of NY history and I think great for all ages.

Just the ticket. We were visiting New York with friends and they did the backstage tour as part of a City visit package. We decided that we would prefer to see the theater as it should be by going to an actual performance. Our friends joined us for a totally magical evening in this lovely building. I booked online before our trip and fast tracked to the box office to collect tickets before the show. Be warned that restrooms are on the lower floor and get very busy.

Greatest Theater in NYC. If you ever have a chance to go to a show at Radio City Music Hall, don't miss out. I recently heard Il Volo, an Italian group of singers, and really enjoyed the show. Go early to get through security and go downstairs via The Grand Foyer, a gorgeous room full of golden colors and great art work. The staircase and mural alone could be in a museum. Downstairs is a lovely lobby with places to get drinks and snacks. Don't miss the bathrooms- real old time New York elegance and lighting. The stage itself is gigantic and the sound system loud! Anywhere you sit, you can see and hear the show. Each level has its own bathrooms and lounges with views of the great lobby below. I bought my tickets online in advance and was able to choose my seats from a seating plan so I knew my location when I arrived.
Worth seeing. Just saw it from the outside but would recommend doing so. It is worth the effort to see it. Great New York tourist spot.

Radio Music Hall review and tips. This place is REAL New York. A massive theatre with so many seats the seat plans were confusing at first but download the plans and you can work out the different pricing structure. We went to see the Christmas Spectacular in December 2012 so this review is for people looking to book seats for the 2013 show. Do not use buy/sell sites - I found these unreliable and not very credible. Buy direct from the theatre website well before the date you want to go.The "restricted view" seats only have the sound man standing in the middle in front of you, but the view is by far restricted because the man is lowered into his own section. So do not let this deter you. Expect to pay around $80-100 dollars for average priced seats.The show itself was amazing! I will say no more to avoid spoiling the show for you!Expect LOTS of queues around the vicinity of the music hall. The crowds are controlled by police which go around the block. So keep children and your personal belongings very close to you.

Tour lessened by reality tv. We went on a tour of this attraction only to find we were not able to actually go to stage or hall area due to tryout and filming of a reality tv show. Americas got talent had it so we could view. Another reason to hate reality tv. What we were able to see was rear areas , lobby and videos. We did get a picture with one of the Rockettes. There was a room about 6 floors up that we could view the stage area.

Really disappointing RCMH, but the show was not - it was good. Went to see Il Volo last night, very, very good experience - they were incredibly good. However, Radio City Music Hall is NOT what it once was. Cheesy commercialism, they allow rude, drunk people to harass others during the show, and make one throw out perfectly good bottled water in favor of overpriced crap inside. When I was little, and as a teenager, visited this place many times. It was beautiful. Food and drinks were not allowed inside, nor was it sold inside (and now they sell alcohol!!!). You could enjoy the iconic salted hot pretzel while waiting on line. They also have too many bright lights everywhere - if you are seated in the balcony, good luck seeing anything on stage! They have two distracting screens on either side of the stage, advertising the same crap every few minutes. Yes, this once beautiful, iconic, classic example of Art Deco has gone completely downhill. Very, very disappointing.

Excellent. Took this tour a part of package we bought. Very glad we did it. The place is awesome. The history is amazing to hear about during tour They do have elevators for those like me whose knees just don't work like they used to. The money spent to rehab the place was tremendous. Just missed by a day rehearsals for America Got Talent show, but we would not have been able to see them anyway.

Didn't think I would enjoy it as much as I did!. We were in NYC for a girls trip, and my Mother in Law was very interested in Radio City Music Hall. We surprised her with the tour, and I was surprised at how much I enjoyed it! We were fortunate to tour Radio City Music Hall in between events. If there is a show going on, they are unable to take you back to where the staging happens, due to props filling up the area. I was so glad we were able to see the intricacies of the stages from behind, as well as hearing the history of the building. It is quite a work of art. Fun to get to meet a Rockette and hear a little of her experience. The tour is over an hour and very informative.

Loved it all!. Our Guide just made this tour top quality. We had a fantastic time, she told us wonderful stories about the stars, the owners, the building. The hall itself is magnificent and the way it has been restored in the Art deco period is wonderful, you can just see the toffs of the 1930 heading into a show. to top it all off my Daughter loved meeting a Rockett it made her day and now she wants to be one!

Amazing hall with amazing acts. Have been to many shows at this amazing music hall and my last event was the LIVE airing of America's Got Talent. There are no bad seats in this place no matter how far away you are from the stage. I suggest you always try to get center seating to truly capture the best view. You're not allowed to bring any drinks or food into the hall, but there are snack areas and bars for those who want them.

Art Deco at its best. We had been on a back stage tour in March 2013 and were utterly blown away by this stunning, voluptuous example of Art Deco design. Glass, carpet, wood, steel decorations on the doors - all of these combine to make a truly unique venue.And the ladies loos - well, a real treat in decadenceWe enjoyed the tour so much we bought tickets for a concert, just to see the marvelous place 'in action'We have just seen Sarah Brightman in concert. Her magnificent voice filled the auditorium fantastically well.This is a great place to visit if you love design and architecture. It's an even better place to visit to see a live show.

Beautiful art deco building..another NYV landmark. Beautiful building full of history. Such a treat to visit! We enjoyed a festive Rockettes Thanksgiving show. The only downside was the price of drinks n the bar, but it is a tourist joint after all

Great enthusiastic tour. Went here with our 7 day New York pass (well worth the 230 dollars). They had rehearsals for the semi finals of Americas got talent going on which we saw 2 acts. The stage is awesome, when we come back we will watch something here. The young lady Emily I think was amazing, clearly loved her job and not fake like so many other tours can be. Someone who was informative, cheerful and really knew her stuff. Also get to meet a rockette which was cool. No big sales pitches here just a great place that is proud to show off its history with a great team of people. NBC tour is 1 street away and Rockefeller tour near as well both free with New York pass. This is a great tour

If you're into history, this is a hidden gem. Went on this tour as an end-of-trip time-filler, and it turned out to be my favorite stop! Don't want to "spoiler" it too much, so suffice it to say you go up down, over, under, forward & back throughout all of RCMH, and will learn some neat things about the place & its history that the average person would probably never know otherwise. You'll be wowed by the sheer size of the theater & lobby. Tour stops in 10-12 distinct areas and passes through many others, includes a video, photo op & Q&A w/ a Rockette, chances to view a lot of their old costumes - and bonus: our tour happened to be during a Rockette's practice session! Photos are allowed anywhere (except Rockette's practice), so have your camera handy. Misc. tips: - Average tour size around 20 people, so try a later Sunday afternoon (or off hour) tour for a much smaller group. (Ours had 5.)- Be prepared to climb A LOT of stairs throughout various parts of the tour, but definitely worth it. Pretty sure they also have elevators for handicapped accessibility. - The tour is free with the New York Pass (not to be confused with the New York City Pass).

Irish Girl Singers. Last January we went to a show at Radio City and I haven't been there since I was a teenager.It was wonderful to go back and see the great place where as a child and a teenager I had attended many Easter and Christmas shows. The show was wonder the decor great everything was wonderful including the help they were all good people

Radio City Music Hall for the America's got Talent show. Family had opportunity to view week 2 of the live Tuesday night show. The venue is still a great facility for entertainment and there is not a bad seat in the house.

Don't waste your time with the tour. Don't bother taking the tour while the filming of AMERICA'S GOT TALENT is in production as it is very boring and you absolutely miss the atmosphere of this great theatre due to loads of restictions due to contractual obligations. You can't go here, can't take photos there, don't look over there. The only view of the theatre is from a glassed in viewing box .....very disappointing and a total waste of time and money.Then there was the confusion about the price of a photo taken with a Rochette....great photo though! The theatre itself is beautiful and I'd love to see a show/concert there.Giving them the benefit of the doubt perhaps this one and only negative NY experience us due to filming of AGT??
Great place to Visit. Radio City Music Hall is very nice and beautiful. Its one of the stops to visit before you leave New York.

Holiday Magic. My hubby has never seen the Radio City Christmas show- I ordered tickets for the day after Thanksgiving in July! It was a wonderful winter day for a train ride down to NYC !! After a fast pit stop at Magnolia Bakery for cupcakes and hot chocolate - it was time for the show!! Radio City was deck out in its finest Christmas deco!! If you get to the show early go up the large stair case for a meet and greet with a Rockette!! You can not use your own camera for a photo opt. But you can purchase this magic moment!! It's a thing to do!!
Must do on anyone's list!. This tour was great. Our tour guide, Tan, was funny and informative very professional. We had alot of fun on an otherwise rainy NY day.

Fascinating Radio City. We took a tour of Radio City.......fascinating place with so much history. It was great to see how it has been restored and all of the magnificent original wood that has been preserved. Our guide was excellent as we went behind the scenes.

Bad information about "stage" tour. Yesterday we did the radio city music hall "stage" tour, paying 20 $ each. We were not told that the tour was restricted to only corridors and hallways because of ongoing events. We came here interested in the beautiful architecture and construction and not to look at posters of celebrities and watch a badly done, completely uninteresting video (that we could easily have seen on YouTube) in a chamber . We had informed ourselves out of interest before we took the tour and got to know less during the tour than we read before. That should absolutely not be the case.We felt totally pranked - if we had known that we neither could access the auditorium, the stage, the foyer nor the suite, we would have saved the money for a next journey to New York. I would have wished to know how the "stage" tour was altered to specific events to decide for myself to take the tour or not.Please excuse any mistakes that are because of the foreign language.Very disappointed.
America's got talent at the greatest showplace in the world. I went to see America's got talent at Radio City - place is great looking forward to the other shows there.

A lovely Art Deco Concert Hall. Great place to visit and an Art Deco Marvel.The tour show you some of the wonderful features that are the Spirit of Art Deco.You get to hear about and meet one of the Rockettes, who still perform in shows at the theatre.We could see the USA's Got Talent set although they were not filming at the time.A great place to visit for anyone interested in Architectural style.
Great Experience. We attended a concert here recently and had a great time. It was fun just being inside the historic location. Its every bit as nice as I expected.
Cirque du soleil Zarkana 2011. We had a great time what a show!!! I believe they do a different show every year. The show lasted 2 1/2 hours with half hour break in between. Worth the money :-)
Top hat. Great theater! Enjoyed a taping of an NBC television show. Excellent seating and staff at this NYC landmark.

Take the Tour. The exterior of the building gives little away about the absolute delights of the interior. We took the tour with the NY Pass (which itself is a good value if you have the energy to visit 5-6 attractions per day!). As other have said, the guide was knowledgeable, informative, spectacularly enthusiastic and really brought the tour alive But, frankly, the theatre speaks for itself. Its scale is impressive but it's the decor that makes the place so special - don't miss it!

Two for One: Zarkana and Radio City Music Hall. We saw Cirque du Soleil's Zarkana at Radio City Music Hall. It was a fabulous show! And the beauty of Radio City Music Hall never ceases to enthrall me. We sat on the front row of the mezzanine (usually my favorite spot); however, for this show I wish we had been in the orchestra section because the actors moved in and out of this area during the performance.

Do the tour; you won't regret it!. We did the Radio City tour a few days back using the NY Pass. The guide was very knowledgeable, we got an insight into life in the theatre and got to sit in the highest seats in the house. Tickets are normally about $20 and I'd recommend it to anyone!

Christmas Show. A once in a lifetime experience. If you bring the children, great, if you go just with adults, great as well. Have done the Christmas Show now four times. Gets better each time. Highly recommend it

Christmas Show. We have been to the the Radio City Music Hall's Christmas program three times. The second half was such a great surprise. Be sure to go early enough to hear the historical organ being played. Make your tickets early.

A quintessential New York venue!. I've been to Radio City a handful of times for concerts. I am local to the area and would visit more frequently if more of the artists I listen to included Radio City on their itineraries. The venue is fantastic - not too big, not too small, kept in excellent condition. For an indoor venue, the sound is really great, too! Radio City is definitely a must-see when visiting New York, whether you catch a concert or take a tour. You won't regret it!

WORTH GOING TO NEW YORK CITY JUST FOR THIS SHOW. We travelled from California to New York to see this show. After seeing a commercial on tv for the holiday show I decided I would like to see it. We planned a visit to New York around seeing the show (6 days) and included many other tourist attraction. Bought tickets (fifth row center) in August. Sometimes the expectations are so high they can not be met. This was not the case for the Christmas Rockettes show - it was everything we expected and more. Absolutely the highlight of our visit. That was December 2010. I must say we enjoyed it so much we returned again in December 2012 to see the Rockettes show again. I gave it an excellent rating (wish there was a higher rating available). I would recommend getting the best seats one can afford - it is well worth the money (save on something else such as a few meals if necessary). It was alsoworthwhile to do the backstage tour and get a history of Radio City Music Hall as well as the Rockettes.

Radio City Music Hall Tour. Tour was great, got to stand on the stage floor, go underneath and view mechanics that make the stage go up and down. Met a real Showgirl and took pictures. Lots of history on this tour

beautiful and so historical. we went and saw the christmas show and was not disappointed. Radio City is such a beautiful building inside and out and the show was fantastic. really happy to have been apart of it. well worth seeing it

Simply the Best. Radio City is so many themes built into one. It's a shame that the bib big arena's have taken some of the hall's thunder away from it. But Radio City will always be radio city. You should go see this fantastic place.
A must see Tour. Radio City Tour is an excellent way to learn about the history of the Music Hall. The tour guides are very friendly and are very knowledgeable of the Music Hall.

Put it on the NYC 'to do' list..!. The Radio City Music Hall Tour is definitely one of the 'don't miss it' attractions of NYC. We had hit a rather bad spell of weather when we visited so did the tour 'to escape the cold'...boy, am I glad we did..!! Our tour guide, Joyce, was a breath of fresh air...she held our attention throughout the tour and was so well informed. From start to finish it was like taking a step back in time, the place is seeped in history, fame and fortune with plenty of 'behind the scenes' stories of intrigue...if those walls could talk...!! The 'restroom break' was one of the highlights of the tour (seriously!) the facilities have been kept in original condition - I will say no more...go see for yourself...you will be impressed!The tour ends with the 'traditional' photo-shoot (like most tours do). The Rockette we met was a delightful young lady who has been dancing with the Rockettes for 10 years so she had many a story to tell. Verdict: Thoroughly enjoyable!

1 of my favourite places in new york. i loved this place. it has been renovated to exactly as it was when it opened 80 years ago and it absolutely stunning. my husband isnt a huge theatre fan and he found the tour really good aswell. unfortuantely we didnt see any shows there and would love to see the annual christmas spectacular with the rockettes but walking around this gorgeous glimps of the golden age of cinema is well worth the trip

Got to see if in new york. Radio city music hall you got to go if in New York I grew up going to for Easter and seeing the Christmas show. We would see a movie and see show. You see the rockets and live animal ex camels.

Christmas Spectacular. Love the Music Hall and Show. Very retro, fun to be there. Easy to find seats. Friend Staff and a wonderful show. Yes, we took pictures. I will have to get them out some time. a MUST see

A must see in new York!. Love every thing about radio city hall! Took the tour and it was great the tour guide are great and very sweet! My kids all enjoy very much. Something worth doing in the city.

Unexpected and Brilliant. My son recommended the tour and it was far better than we expected. The entrance lacks the grandeur the is within. The building is in the Art Decor style with huge guilt mirrors gold ceilings etc. The surprise is that the tour takes you up to the top floor where you enter the rear seating to look down on the once largest stage in the world. The young lady tour guide was full of information. Unfortunately we could not go back stage as scenery etc from the previous nights 'Tony' awards was being removed, but we we dide meet a current Rockette.Well worth the visit use your NY Pass to save time and money.

Camp as Christmas. We went to see the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular - and it was just that. 36 high kicking, perfectly timed pairs of legs performing the most amazing dance routines. It's a New York tradition apparently and sells out upto 6 shows a day! Took my football loving husband here for his birthday and even he loved it. Booked it months in advance here in the UK and picked up the tickets there which was fine. The theatre is huge, and tickets are hugely expensive. We sat in the middle of the balcony and had a great view at about $100 each. The nativity scene at the end is so over the top - real donkeys and camels on the stage - just hilarious. Very Christmasey show and if you like your entertainment a little on the camp side then this could be the show for you.

Amazing Theater. If you are interested in the history of theater production, the tour of Radio City Music Hall is a must see. The tour includes a back stage view of the technical mechanics of the theater's stage which has multiple levels and numerous apparatus to transform the area during a production. Quite impressive! We also saw the dressing areas and back stage offices where stars of yesterday were entertained. We saw gorgeous costumes of the Rockettes. We visited the public areas and, at the end of the tour, we met a beautiful, current Rockette, in costume, and she told us about the life of a Rockette. It as a great tour.

2nd Mezz at Tony Awards. I just wanted to post a review to mention that the so-called "partially obstructed" view seats in the 2nd Mezzanine, Section 400 are actually quite good so long as you avoid the first couple of rows behind the soundboard. My friend and I were in row K and never felt as if we missed out on any of the view.I deducted a point from my review because arriving at the event was crazy, with a line of people in formal wear stretching all the way to the other end of Rockefeller Square. Also they could have turned up the air conditioning, the entire venue felt uncomfortably warm, not just the mezzanines.
Meet a roccette. Excellent tour interesting and informative the building is beautiful even the restrooms!, the Art Deco building and the sweeping staircase are a site to behold
Christmas Show. Since a kid I have always made it a point to see the Rockettes and the Christmas Spectacular. This is a New York treasured tradition!

Blast from the past. Enjoyable visit. More like something you'd get in UK with some old tour guide but didn't detract from the visit.our passes (New York passes) worked here and got us in early.Bit too quick in parts as some great photos around the place needed looking at

Superb tour :). We visited Radio City at the end of May, we had the New York passes so this gave us free entrance- we were not disappointed!!My mum was particularly impressed as she had always wanted to visit this amazing venue, the tour guide was excellent and had great knowledge of everything!!Special mention to the tour guides as my mum needed to use the lifts as her knee can't handle too many stairs- this was no problem at all.We even met a rockette, super experience- thank you radio city!!

Just say Ma'am. We wanted to see the place, but had no interest in the shows here. We saw people turned away as they entered the building. We also entered expecting to be turned away. We asked "Ma'am would you take a picture for us please?" and the lady said we must not be from around there and gladly took a photo of us and never told us to leave. Looked like an old building full of history. Would love to come here to see the NFL draft or something. Nice workers, just use the magic word.

Good and long tour. Great tour guide who was quick to laugh and very aware of everything concerning the hall. She is fun. Awesome decor and history. Very interesting how the stage works. Very long tour and a lot of walking through small hallways and many stair steps.

Great Show, not so great members of staff!. We arrived early to the show and I am so glad we did, we had to collect our tickets from the box office as it was an international order. We had our bags checked and my husband had his camera and camcorder confiscated. (we had been taking in the sights on the way to the music hall) We didn't have a problem having the camera taken away but then to spend the entire show distracted by dozens of camera flashes I then have a problem. No members of staff tried to stop anyone using a camera and we had to mess around after the show waiting in line to collect our camera. It should be the same rules for everyone, I understand some people will get through but the sheer number of cameras being used was a joke.During the bag check they also make people bin any food or drink they have with them. We didn't have any but I could understand why people try to get their snacks in.
