I think it was about $15 for two bottles of water.We joined a queue to have our photo taken with Santa- another overpriced idea over $50 for one large and two small photos. Definitely not worth it.I received an email before we travelled stating we could collect a free pin badge for guests, don't bother wasting your time as none of the staff would point me in the direction of where to go.All this aside the building is amazingly beautiful and ornate looking.We were seated for the show in the rear mezzanine and paid $148 for two tickets. Although the music hall is huge we had an amazing view, it is just a shame we had two noisy drunks shouting all the way through, disturbing us and many other guests.Again the staff did nothing about it and it was only when the pair of drunks walked out half way through that we could enjoy the show in peace.All of this complaining doesn't take away the talent of the Rockettes I have always wanted to see them in a show so this was amazing for me and all in all it was a good night out! Just a few little tweaks that would turn a very good experience to an amazing experience.I did email the Radio City Hall with my comments but never received a reply!

A step back in time. Great tour... from the start in the lavish restored lobby to the backstage, to meeting a rockette this tour was a great step back in time to the golden age of film... if only the walls could talk... loved this tour for the interior décor and history content. I would highly recommend it.
Draft. Well it wasn't so much Radio City Music Hall that was amazing but the NFL 2013 draft! It was a great theater though to be in
Stunning venue. We went a stage door tour and had a great time learning about the venue, technology, artists and shows that make the Radio City Music Hall such a remarkable place.
rockettes. we saw the rockettes last year, and it was just amazing! wonderful musical piece. the girls are perfect dancers (i didnt know such a thing even existed!).

Very impressive. Not knowing much about this place I was impressed with all the things the building has been through over the years and what it represents for the city. Took a tour as part of a combo with the Lincoln Centre (which I recommend) and it was just a great time. You get on stage, under the stage and in and out of all the nooks and crannies of this place!
Lovely building, great concerts. Radio City is another iconic NYC landmark. It is beautiful inside and has great and diverse concerts that appeal to virtually everyone.

See The Rockette's. There may be better audtoriums and the Ballet at the Met has better dancing but this is here so much history happened and coninues to do so.Present ownership has spent bucks maintaining and updating the historic venue.Go at Chriastmas time for paegent

pretty cool. saw the rockettes christmas spectacular and it was unlike anything i have seen before! the theatre was really nice as well. it is so big! i was not expecting it to be so big! i really couldnt get over it!

Christmas Spectacular. WOW! That's it . . . just kidding! This show was AAAAMAAAAZING! Never been to the City but my husbands from Jersey so we went for the Christmas show. WE had so much fun. We had great seats. Front area, center! I wasn't sure what to expect and was nervous if my son would last the whole show without having to go to the Bathroom and wanting to leave, etc. Let me tell you . . . the minute those girls hit the stage we were all in AWWWWW. They were amazing. I don't think my son moved the entire show. I think my mouth was open the whole entire time. We laughed, we clapped, and we even cried. The end was so emotional for me and I am not one to cry in movies or anything but this show did it. . . I cried. After the show we had backstage passes and had a personal tour. I was even more impressed of how small the back was and how old some of the backstage gadgets were. The people that put on the show and that are physically in the show obviously are hard, dedicated people! I would recommend this show to anyone. If you have kids don't be afraid. . . I saw children younger than mine and they didn't move the entire show either! Everyone was in Awwww and just sat back and watched in amazement. This is a MUST SEE

History, History, History. What a magnificent building and the history is outstanding. The who's who of entertainment have graced the stage of this wonderful Music Hall. The design is from the 20's and made to give people the impression of being on a grand cruise ship. The tour is worth it very good and the guides informative.

Fantastic. Was there for the Rockettes 80th Christmas Extravaganza & was blown away. Both my Mom & I thoroughly enjoyed it and bought a DVD so that we could show others back home. Enjoyed all the decorations in the lobby & getting our picture with a Rockette

walking on history. It was a wonderfull expirence to see a history place, the tour is very informative. I got my chance to get a pic taken with a Rocket dancer witch make the perfect memory to take home .

Great Tour of a Fabulous Venue. This review is for the tour of Radio City Music Hall (RCMH) which I attended with a group. Our tour guide did a great job of informing us of the rich history of RCMH and the decor is very beautiful. We toured behind the scenes areas, the upper balconies, and were able to meet a Rockette and ask her questions at the conclusion of the tour. Definitely plan to visit for a show sometime, most likely the Christmas Spectacular which is supposed to be out-of-this-world. Definitely worth a visit while you are in NYC.

great venue for any band!. The venue is amazing and the acoustic is unbelievable. I saw Bon Iver here and it was one of the best concerts i've seen in the city. The combination of the great sound and the beautiful venue made it an amazing show and I got goosebumps from it. I can't recommend it enough and if you get a chance to see a show here, you shouldn't think twice

Just like I remember.... I saw the Christmas Spectacular her when I was kid with my parents and now I am back to see the 2013 NFL and it was great -- just like I remember and I cannot wait to see my next event here.
Nice night out. Nice night out - well peformed at the theater, early seating advised.Would go again..............................................
Great Concert. I've been here many times for different concerts over the years and the sound quality is superurb. It's a great place to see a seated show.

One of a kind. Go to see this art deco gem. Go to see a wonderful performance. Don't choose, do both in one in one visit. I'm a native New Yorker and I love this building. Don't be shy and go to the bathrooms, they are black and white temples to the Art Deco God. Check out every detail from the ceiling to the lamp fixtures to the hand railings. All incredible.

Circe du Soleil. ...was fabulous! This is such a beautiful, monumental attraction to visit in NYC, and I would absolutely recommend that people see shows here. The high ceilings and big archways felt so grandeur and regal. I want to go back. I hope you visit.
If you are here at Christmas.... You cannot miss the Rockettes Christmas spectacular. Changes every year and is great fun for the whole family, of course. It is an amazing venure.

The stage is HUGE!. My senior class got a tour. To be honest, most of us were pretty bored but that doesn't mean others will be. We got to meet a Rockette which was cool. You can take your picture with her, but then it's like $20 to keep it which is lame. The most amazing part is the stage. It is so gigantic pictures don't do it justice you need to see it for yourself!

Walk back in time. We went to watch the Rockettes in their Christmas show, WOW truly amazing, my children love the theatre, and sat in total ore throughout the show.Take the backstage tour before the show, such an insight into the history of the building and the show biz world, well worth it.They sell a wide selection of merchandise, and you can have a photograph taken with one of the Rockettes.The seats we booked were from the floor plan a concern for me as they seemed so high, but when we got there they were perfect, loved the while feel of the theatre.

Fight Night. I was in New York with my nephew to see a Yankees game and see the sights. I read in the paper that Radio City Music Hall was hosting a World Champion Boxing Title match and figured I try to get tickets despite being sold out. we were very fortunate to score 2 tickets just outside the entrance and we had a great time. The elegance of RCMH combined with boxing was a bit odd, but it seemed to bring some class back to a sport that has long ago seen its golden years. We were up in the 3rd mez, 3rd row and we had great seats. This was only the second time ever that RCMH has hosted a fight and all I can say is that they did first class job in doing so.

New Years. Spent New Years in Radio City at the NAS concert. Radio City Music hall is a spectacular venue for music and musical productions. If if New York City it is a must see, promise you will enjoy it.

Bring back those memories if your childhood. As a kid, my parents often brought us to Radio City for the stage show/movies. Not to be missed are the annual Christmas Show and concerts here are AMAZING because of the audio experience & that there's not a bad seat in the house.

Pleasantly surprised!. My husband scheduled this tour for us and I was not really excited about going. Boy am I glad we went! From the moment you enter, the hall is amazing. Our tour guide was wonderful - very knowledgeable. We saw and learned so much. I liked it so much we returned for the holiday show. A must see in NYC!

A Must Do Spectacular. If you come to New York City there are things you must see and Radio City Music Hall is right at the top of the list. The enormity of the theatre, the majesty of the grand foyer, the excellence of the spectacular productions shouldn't be missed. And the Rockettes.....? Wowza!!!! We went on the backstage tour at the Christmas Show and walked the stage, saw all the livestock in the show, the costumes, the mechanics of the stage hardware, it was terrific. Go!

Tour. Our school group got a tour of the music hall. What a great venue. I would love to see the Rockettes perform there. Our tour guide was great. Very informative and he looked like he really enjoyed his job.
awesome. if you visitig NYC this is a MUST...of course the Rockette's wold be best but if you could just get a glimpse of anything here it would be worth it.

Leonard Cohen at Radio City. This had to be the best highlight of our stay in New York and there were many. To see a living legend in a fantastic venue was amazing. The building has been renovated but will all its original features still there. To have that topped off with a fantastic concert by Cohen made our holiday one of the best ever.
Great view from any seat. Beautiful .. I went to Gabriel Iglesias Stand up revolution. The view from the back was great. Beautiful building from the inside. Good sound.

A must when in NYC. This is such a magical place. Whether watch a concert or the Christmas show you can't help but get chills down your back when watching any performance here. Everything I have seen here has become a lifetime memory.

Christmas Spectacular was just that. We made our first vist to Radio City Music Hall to see the Christmas Spectacular and were thoroughly impressed. The venue is of course without compare, and the show was one of the best we have ever seen in terms of pure enjoyment. There were lots of families with kids, and we look forward to future visits. Regardless of who you are, don't miss this one if you are in NYC when it is playing.
Rocketeers- Christmas Special. Went here for the XMas special and it was spectacular, full of entertainment. ambience is excellent and you can get a decent ticket price if you book in advance.
Christmas show. 3 young ones, all enjoyed the building, one enjoyed the whole show, 2 thought it too long (me too) but great fun. Toy soldier was the best hit. Very special treat.

What a show!!. The Spectacular Christmas Show is a definate must see in winter and really puts you in a cheerful Christmas spirit. We had 2nd row seats and saw the Rockettes really up close. Their performance is outstanding.

Radio City Music Hall Tour. Great to go behind the scenes. Since there were no performances going on we got to go on the stage which was an extra treat! Saw a Rockette and got picture with her. A little long (1 hour); but worth it.

A Xmas show to remember!!. We went in December for the Xmas show it was amazingreally made me feel full of holiday cheer and excitement, take the whole family and see for yourselfDefinitely a show not to be missed

Must-See Holiday Tradition. Take the whole family -- the show is truly spectacular, and so is the venue. This gives you the chance to see an amazing holiday tradition AND one of the most impressive spaces in the world. (How can they fit that theater inside that block in Manhattan?)Your family will enjoy this, and you will too. There is something for all ages. My nine-year-old was enthralled, as was my 14-year-old. And they both enjoyed it just as much five years ago.Finally, if you have a son or daughter who takes dance lessons--and in particular anything with tap, or clogging, or Irish hard shoe--this is a great way to show them that live dance is alive and well and the Rockettes and the rest of the performers in their show are embodying that.
The Christmas Show. On December 1 2012 we attended the Christmas Show at Radio City Music Hall, the show was excellent and it was a great begining of the Christmas Season for my husband and myself.
cool. Just viewed it from the outside but i was pretty neat to see places i have only seen on tv. good location
A must see. This attraction has so much history. It is one of the top attractions visitors want to see. Great shows and a fun experience. Tke advantage of the tours that they offer.

Christmas show was great. I got discount tickets (check for discount codes on their website), about 75 dollars each for about halfway back, so for that price it was certainly worth it. Great show, amazing visuals and costumes, including a fun 3D videogame themed part (with glasses handed out). The requisite kick line is of course awesome and iconic (if somewhat repetitive). But the highlight for me was the toy soldier routine, and the dancing Santas. They also did a routine with a real tour bus onstage going by NYC landmarks, and the background screen moved in time, making it look like they were really moving. Very cool! We took our 7 and 11 year old boys, and they paid attention the whole time (not an easy feat!). That in itself is the highest praise.The theater itself is just as impressive as the show, a truly beautiful art deco gem. Makes you feel like you're in "The Great Gatsby." And Rockefeller Center is right down the road, so head down there before or after and see the tree during Christmas time.

Christmas Spectacular! Worth seeing.... We chose seats in the orchestra at the end of a row towards the middle and had a great view, there are seats on the ends with no one directly in front because of the curve and this was great for my 8yrold otherwise he wouldn't have had a clear view. The show was great and varied, the dancing segments sometimes went on a little too long for my son but be he loved the 3D segments. The theatre itself is great, very impressive. Our only complaint was that the late arrivals, upto 20 minutes late in to the show, blocked our view on many occasions as they leisurely found their seats, frustrating!

A Deco Masterpiece. They don't make buildings like this anymore. The interior is "high concept" Deco at its finest, with columns faced in black mirrors and a tall tall tall proscenium stage with hydraulic lifts for giant organ. Don't miss the tobacco-leaf wallpaper in the ladies' room.

High class place for visiting. Great place with many expensive things make this place is a perfect to watch movies or shows. Beautiful building in high class facilities and technology and they have nice bathrooms makes for a pleasant concert-going experience. This is really a place worth visiting for tourists. This is a grand theater with comfortable seats. Noting a bad seat in the house. Nice and expensive place to enjoy many performances, but everybody must try here.

Amazing !. We had seen the unforgetable "Xmas spectacular" already. Decided to do the tour of the theatre. It was fanatstic to visit it without the audience. Thsi is an amazing piece of architecture form 1932 and still state of the art. For the "Art Deco" buffs this is an absolute gem ! A few "secrets" are "disclosed" to you, you can speak (nad take photos) to one rockette ( at a price ! ). Fabulous !!!
Great experience. Wonderful venue. It is not too big. It is not too small. Whatever you see there, whether it is the Rockettes or another show.
Rocketts Christmas Spectacular '12. Awesome show, great for the price also. Those girls have such an amazing talent. Radio City Music hall is also very beautiful.

Rockettes. What a show that was!!! Our tickets were a little overpriced but it was an experience to see them. What talent they have. What I didn't like was the tickets had to be purchased online and they had a $17.00 charge per ticket. I thought that was rather high. But the show was fantastic. It's a must-see while in New York any time of the year.

Destination spot in NYC. This is a NYC landmark and major venue. Was recently there again for a concert with the American Symphony Orchestra and was struck by two things: the art deco space is truly magnificent and the acoustics are terrible. The sound is miked and comes out from overhead speakers. It was sometimes harsh and had a very muffled quality with occasional reverb overlays. I'm not some auditory purist but the problem was significant enough to be an issue and it became increasingly irritating. They need to overall the amplification system if the theater is to do justice to virtuoso performances. The Christmas show is a classic with great special effects and it rarely disappoints.

If you've never seen it, go. If you've seen it, pass.. I've been going since I'm a child. I watched it go from a movie and a fabulous live show and a lot of terrific vaudeville type stuff to a lukewarm show without a any of the previous thrills. The Christmas show is the highlight but it's nowhere near as good as it was even ten years ago. The synchronized dancing is worth seeing, the wooden soldier thing is fun the first time, the Nutcracker segment is nice but it could all really use an update. If you're new to the city, though and you're there in December, watch the roof for a few minutes. That's kind of fun.
home of the Rockettes. beautiful art deco theater. It is very large. If you don't want to catch a show there, you can take a tour of the theater since it is beautiful

We recommend it.... My husband and I travelled to NY last December to celebrate a special New Year and decided to see Christmas Spectacular. We loved the show, the Rockettes were simply spectacular and the 3D effect was perfect...we enjoyed!!!; it is worth visiting the Radio City Music Hall for this show in Christmas season!!!

Radio City too large. Radio City, perhaps world famous for its Christmas shows and Rockettes (dancers), is far too large to enjoy its activities unless you're in one of the seats near the stage. The entertainment consists largely of pop singers and groups, the variety shows banal.

So Good that it Should Become an Annual Family Tradition. My family and I drove 4 hours to Manhattan to see the Rockettes in their Christmas show. It was definitely worth it, and I am definitely interested in returning next Christmas, and each year after.The Christmas show is divided into more than 10 acts, each with different themes. A couple of acts involve 3d animation that is very effective.By far my favorite act was the Toy Soldier act. The precision marching of the Rockettes is outstanding and very memorable.Getting tickets was straightforward though the $70 per ticket for a floor seat was a bit much. I was worried that further back on the main floor would not be good seats, but nothing to fear, as all seats on the floor seem excellent. To make the trip to NYC a little less expensive, we drove and a nearby parking lot for only $46/day, which by Manhattan standards seems a bargain.

If you can.. If there is someone playing that would like to see I'd go. The venue is really good but I wouldn't go just for the sake of it. The atmosphere is brilliant and the sound quality was good too.

The xmas spectacular was spectacular!!. Came to RCMH during the holidays to see the Rocketters Christmas spectacular, and it was a great show! Eventhough we had to wake up pretty early to get there, but it was worth it!

nice teather. This place has a creat lobby and beutfull christmam decoration.
I recomend to whacth a good show and enjoy the place as well

Radio City Christmas Spectacular. In New York for Christmas - you have to do the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall. It simply is Christmas. We went on Christmas Day afternoon to see the show. The Hall itself is stunning. And then when those Rockettes strut their stuff it is amazing. They way they stay so beautifully and perfectly in line is a mystery but so wonderful.We really enjoyed this show and felt it was a wonderful way to spend Christmas afternoon. I highly recommend.Also we had first row mezzanine tickets and they were perfect. The height allowed you to really see the whole show.

Wear good walking shoes for the plethora of stairs. Of all the sites I saw in NYC this one was the most long and drawn out tour as well as strenuous. The building is so huge that you a great deal of time is spent transitioning from room to room, many of which are on different floors. We got to take a break in the ladies lounge as a group and I needed to take the break because I had just gotten off a Stairmaster. Regardless, of this the tour was very factual and covered the entire history of Radio City Music Hall. At the end of the tour you get to meet a Rockette which was my favorite part. I was not impressed that after paying admission for the tour that you aren't allowed to take a picture with the Rockette for a keepsake. Instead they charge you a ridiculous amount of money for a picture taken by a photographer. This angers me.I went here as part of a tour wih my university and it was aleady paid for, I otherwise wouldn't have gone. It was ok and worth seeing once I suppose but it isn't for everyone.The building was big and grand but it is dated. I would have been more impressed if the deccor were modernized. Everything was laid put in a museum style with Rockette costumes displays. They were nice but it was as if everything was stuck in time. For such a grand venue that has hosted awards shows and concerts I expected it to hold a certain elegance and prestige, while instead it held as more of a history lesson. I got some value out of the tour but if I return it will be to see a live show and not to admire the building.

I'd always wanted to see the Rockette Christmas show and it lived up to my expectations.. We thoroughly enjoyed the show. The costumes, the music and the 3D effects were great. The hall itself is beautiful with a massive chandelier and old elegance. The lady's washroom is a must see with its original colored sinks and tiles. Fun!

Incredible. I've come here every year since I was a child for the Radio City Christmas Spectacular. I very highly recommend it. Try to get a seat a bit higher up - you can see the formations of the dancers better this way (e.g., that perfectly straight kick line). From close up it is still beautiful, but you can't fully enjoy the precision.

Always a great time. Although it's been some time since I've been here, I have seen many shows here. The Christmas show is definitely a treat! Most seats are great views. It is a must visit especially for tourists to nyc :)

Very Good, but expensive.. When I was a little girl growing up in NYC we went to Radio City Music Hall twice a year, Easter and Christmas. The Rockettes were there, but they also showed a family movie in those days. We weren't well-to-do by a long shot, so it must have been affordable. Sadly, that same family income would not allow you to take your children to see the Christmas show now. It is VERY expensive! More than the Tony Award winning play we saw the next night! The show was good and we were glad we went, but probably would not go again due to the cost and that they don't change the show much from year to year. We sat in one of the balconies, so we did not get the best seats, but they were about $100 a piece. This is what you pay for a Cirque du Soleil show in Vegas. You get a lot more for your money at Cirque du Soleil.I was also put off by all the "Circus" selling in the lobbies. You know, the stuff they sell to kids to light up and twirl, etc... No need for that here, just another money grabbing attempt.It makes me sad that the average NYC child can no longer go to Radio City for a show due to the greed of the Music Hall.
Rockettes. We watched the Rockettes Christmas Show. The show was Amazing. The Hall was fantastic, the show was amazing. The sound was great!

Wonderful Show. We went to see the Rockettes and their Christmas special in December and it was absolutely wonderful. I love how they included strong family themes to the show as well. Radio City is very large however the ushers are fairly helpful with finding your seats.There are concessions available as well that are the typical high priced fare and this theatre is gorgeous inside.The show was great and quite engaging for a 90 minute preformance, found it interesting how they included 3D into the show as well. The Rockettes are truly talented and definitely something you should see in your lifetime! Don't miss out!

Christmas Special. What an unexpectedly delightful Christmassy thing to do - not just for kids! The Rockettes were fantastic. The Parade of the Wooden Soldiers was so very clever. Just to see the amazing size and opulence of this venue is a must-do in New York - a city full of surprises.
WOW effects. saw this show about 10 years ago, and this years program was so visually gorgeous except for the jarring and unpleasant video game simulation--completely wrecked the mood
Really beautiful theathre. Came here to see a new Cirque show on opening night. Such a beautiful theatre and really not a bad seat anywhere in the house. Very easy to navigate.
Grand Hall. I was leery of the Rockette's Christmas Special when I heard 3-D, but it wasn't childish. The hall is a must see regardless of what show you see.

Beautiful theatre. Such a nice place to see a show. Beautiful huge theater. Great stage. Could be anywhere and see stage. Very clean. If there is a show you want to see that is here- you will love the theater and (hopefully the show also.)

Rockettes Christmas Show (85th anniversary). Saw this show on Christmas Day 2012 and what an absolute delight. The most,colourful,fun,beautiful,enchanting show.I would def see it again if I could afford to go back to NY!Radio City is such a beautiful building,shame it was let down by a couple of things ie the attitude of the door staff (rather abrupt)and the $5 coffee that was stone cold and then the podium where sugar,milk etc was,which was empty and dirty.Apart from this a truly delightful building and amazing show.
rockettes Christmas Spectacular. Great show. Must see. I enjoyed it immensely. My granddaughters thought it was off the chain. I would see this agian. It is worth te price.

Christmas Show !. Ok father of 3 girls plus the wife, going to Radio City and Rockettes XMAS special was not high on my personal list, but take one for the team. Boy was I wrong. First what a beautiful building and theater. Second great lobby, refreshments including adult beverages NY prices but who cares, it was special. Last, what a show, simply fun, fast paced and entertaining. Great way to get in the holiday spirit, sat in the orchestra 2nd section back bought tickets through a broker... shop around we go great seats via Stub Hub for a little over face for a 4:30pm Sat show, which was a great time to go we did 30 Rock, the tree, lights and then off for a dinner after the show. Highly recommend.....maybe next time we can we do Bruins vs. Rangers ; )
Love the nostalgia of Radio City. Best Place to see a concert of the spectacular christmas show.Loved this place since I was a kid. A real New York tradition is the amazing christmas show!

G-O-R-G-E-O-U-S interior is a must see!. The first floor lobby is large and gorgeous. Inside, the theatre is elegant - lushly furnished. Made us feel like we were back in time during the "old days" of theatre-going.

Beautiful building, centrally located to Top of the Rock. What a great location, so much around here to see and do. With apartments to rent on top for your stay in NY it is an ideal spot to stay and visit

Magnificent Experience & Show!!!. What can I say about the Christmas Spectacular! This was my first time going as it was a surprise 50th Birthday gift for my mom. There were 10 of us in the group. My family and I are very big on Christmas and this show put us right in the spirit! We went to see the show the first weekend it was opened. One piece of advice is to check the christmas spectacular website often as tickets go on sale on there from time to time. We were able to secure tickets in the Orchestra section for $49 per ticket! We purchased them the week of the show, but we ended up saving about $50-60 per ticket, so it worked out great. The show itself is a MUST SEE especially for children and the big kid in all of us adults. This was the 85 year celebration, so I'm not sure how it was different than shows in previous years, but all in all it was a wonderful experience for my parents, siblings, wife, children and myself!

Radio City Christmas Spectacular. Our party of six decided to see the Radio City Christmas Spectacular during our trip to NY. After seeing The Nutcracker Ballet at the Lincoln Center, we expected the show to be as spectacular as it claims to be. Unfortunately, it was not that great. Here's why we thought so:#1 Messy queue outside the building. #2 They let late comers coming in during the show thus distracting others.#3 They let people taking photographs/video during the show, the flash was quite annoying.#4 Some parts are boring that they serenaded my husband to sleep.#5 The show failed to bring the climax of the story. We didn't even realize that the last part was actually the ending. What we love about the show:#1 The Rockettes costumes! I really love them.#2 The 3D addition to the show (except the game 3d, was quite boring).So having said that, I don't think I'll come back for more next time. But for you who would like to see The Show, I'd recommend you to get Mezzanine One seats.

Rockettes Christmas Show. It was my first time to watch a show at Radio City Music Hall. The place is grand and beautiful, and is very impressive.The Rockettes Christmas Show is a feel good show, but the story is plain and simple and a bit boring at times. Not recommended for small kids as they may not be able to sit still through the entire show. Great visuals, sound and dancing all throughout.

Christmas Spectacular. This was our 2nd time to see the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. We loved it both times. It was, however, over too soon. We could watched for hours more. If you are in NYC in the Christmas Season you should not miss this show.

Spectacular Christmas..... All my friends told me Christmas in New York was quite the experience and as I was planning my very first trip up to NYC this past Christmas, they all said make sure you go to the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall. So I bought tickets for my very first evening in the city. And I wasn't disappointed. They were phenomenal and boy can they get those legs high. I got a seat in the first row of the balcony and it allowed for an excellent view of the whole stage. At times it seemed like I was a bit far away, but if I had been down on the floor, it would have been more difficult to see everything that was going on. So go and see the famous Rockettes and see if you can get your legs up that high.

Radio City is a Must See in NYC. Centrally located in midtown, it's worth a stop in just to see the beautiful art-deco lobby. @ Christmastime (Thanksgiving through New Years) the Christmas Spectacular featuring the Rockettes is a must see at least once.
Christmas Show is magical. My entire family loved the Rockettes Christmas show. It puts you in the Christmas spirit! Everything from the music, dancing, characters to Santa Clause.

Rockettes. You can't beat the Christmas show! Beautiful, fun, and totally kid friendly. Staff were professional and helpful. The theater itself is gorgeous. Next time, I plan to do the backstage tour.

Kid friendly. The Christmas spectacular is very kid friendly. The show is pretty expensive. The rockettes are amazing! The theater is huge and beautiful! The end of the show the pipe organs took my breathe away.

Great Holiday show. We went to see the Radio City Christmas Spectacular show in November 2012. It was a perfect start to the holiday season.We all, including my mom and my 5 year old daughter, enjoyed it very much. The rockettes are great and can put on a show!We enjoyed the dancing, singing and the Christmas decorations.I hope we will come back!Visited November 2012

Magical Radio City Music Hall. Radio City Music Hall located in Rockefeller Center in New York City.It is also known as Showplace of the Nation, I think it is still a leading tourist destination in the city. Its interior is a city landmark .Christmas Show is really magical here, lots of kids and also lots of adults and old people gather here for the magical evening and spectacular show of light and music. The tickets I think are little expensive but it is worth the money. The hall itself is clean and neat, The staff is well organized and the seats are roomy. The whole hall seems majestic.

Gets you in the mood for Christmas!. I took my mother to the Christmas Spectacular 'Rockettes' show during our trip. It is certainly spectacular, these guys know how to put on a show!It was a little cheesy for me, but glad I went along. It is a family show with plenty action, singing and amazing dancing from the Rockettes.I'm not a big fan of Christmas, but this show really gets you in the mood!

Always A Great Show. The effects make you feel like you're right in the middle of everything. The show is always impeccable and a great way to celebrate Christmas. So many beautiful and fun moments in the show and appropriate for children. Look online for tickets. You can find really good deals for great seats, and there are so many good restaurants that cater to show times.

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular Show better than broadway plays. First time watching the Rockettes and it was amazing and very impressive. I would honestly prefer it than any other Broadway show especially if you have little ones. It is really nice ending it with the Nativity Scene because that is really what Christmas is all about. Let's all respect everyone's holidays and if any chance you don't celebrate it then please don't ruin it for others. Just like we respect and let you celebrate yours.

Brilliant Show. Went in December to see the christmas radio show and had a blast. The effects story and dancing are out of this world and a must see if your a musical fan. Yes is traditional to see a show on broadway but if your here in December and want a show this is the only one you should go with. It much bigger than what I expected but dont be afriad to get a cheaper seat further back because you wont miss anything especially with the effects.

Christmas Show. Having been to New York numerous times we finally decided to go see the Christmas Show at Radio City Music Hall. There were many shows each day and we chose to go to the 5:00PM show. We purchased our tickets on the day of the show. We were surprised to find that part of the show was in 3D and we would need to use the special glasses they supplied. What an experience! Objects literally came flying at you. How this was done continues to amaze us. The show was quite good and the singing and dancing did not disappoint. I would certainly recommend this show for next year if you are in New York during the holidays. The theatre is beautiful in and of itself.

Rockettes. We watched the Rockettes on Christmas Eve and it was stunning.There dancing is so in sync and the costumes are beautiful.Enjoyed the entire show and especially loved the 3D part of it - the show just adds to the Christmas Vibe in NYCDefinitely a must do whilst in NYC during Christmas.

The Rockettes were worth it. We didn't know what to expect, hadn't really heard of it before, but knew that visiting NY over Christmas - this was a must rather than any other Broadway show. The prices were the most reasonable compared to the Big Shows, and once there, after a bit of a queue to collect our already booked tickets (which wasn't easy in the cold) we turned up half an hour early and the theatre was stunning. The stairs laid out with red carpet and beautiful chandeliers. Once in our seats, which were comfortable we were shocked to see such a stunning stage and theatre area - huge but beautifully laid out. The show was a knock out. The Rockettes were choreographed to precision. Would definitely recommend this show to anyone of all ages.
AWESOME. Amazing venue...really nothing more to be said!!! The BEST! See anything you can there... but if at all possible, see The Rockette's!!! FABULOUS show!!!

Iconic New York. Radio City Music Hall is, of course, one of the places you must see in New York (along with 50-100 others!). We went for the Christmas show, which was light-hearted, fun, had some good use of modern media (3D, projection screens). The theatre itself is just magnificent and worth seeing as well.And what can you say about the Rockettes? Awesome dancers, very quick change artists, great use of settings, and the deserved stars of the show.The "living nativity" scene was poorly done and should be cut, in my opinion...it was a relief to have the Rockettes come back and close the show.
Rockettes. The Christmas spectacular 85 th year celebration was magnificent. The dancing and timing was breath taking
Nice surprise. Beautiful show, great dancers and special effects...it's perfect for those who are in New York for the first time, like myself.. Also, the Christmas concert was great, magic

85 and Forever Young You Are!. We can never grow tired of Radio City Music Hall and its Christmas Show and the ever-endearing Rockettes. Before going, my granddaughter watched the 75th anniversary video 8 times, and now wants to take dance after seeing the show live two years in a row. She is hooked, and we are glad. I went for my first time back in the late 50's and now we are taking grandchildren, and loving it as much. So clean, so beautiful, so refreshing! My husband had no problem getting around after having hip surgery, and the staff was very accommodating. It helped for him to have gotten an aisle seat. He, too, loved the show.

85th Anniversary Christmas Spectacular with Rockettes was FANTASTIC!. This was my first time visiting Radio City Music Hall and the Rockettes - and it was FANTASTIC!! The venue itself is amazing - entry was quick and painless even though the line was pretty long - it moved quickly! Once inside, it was beautiful - our seats, which were on the first mezzanine, were great - we were center stage, 3rd row back, and could see everything wonderfully. The show was amazing - the props were great, the dancing and choreography was fantastic - I just cannot say enough wonderful things!! This is a "must see" anytime I come back to NYC!!

worth the wait. As an ex professional dancer i have waited for 40years to visit Radio city and i WAS NOT dissappointed. The Christmas Spectacular was amazing even my husband was enthused by the show:) well worth a visit.

A wonderful place to visit in NYC .. It's an awesome place to go see x-mas shows, the Rockettes , or any other just wonderful atmosphere , happy, alive, bright, just beautiful. And so much more to see and do around the city.I love it.

Spectacular Christmas Spectacular. No matter what age you are or how you celebrate the holidays (or not) this is an amazing show. Perfectly choreographed and fun for everyone. It is now 3D, which I thought would be a bit distracting and gratuitous, but it was really cool. There are no bad seats per se (try to get front row mezzanine) but I could not see over the folks in front of me. Had to keep moving my head all around (I'm sure blocking those behind me). Seems the rows are not raised enough or something. Also, they let people in well after show begins, this is unacceptable. We are talking dozens and dozens of groups of people up to 45 mins after show time. It is rude and distracting and if you are more than 10 or 15 mins late you should be denied entry. And of course those folks had to wave and talk to their friends and take there sweet time sitting down--just rude.
Awesome Christmas show!. Liked that we got our tickets at the tkts office, and paid half price for seats in the 6th row, center! Great show, the Christmas show!

The Christmas Spectacular - an NYC Christmas must see. If you happen to be planning a trip to NY for next Christmas then I'd recommend adding the Rockettes to your must see list. We went on Christmas Day and had seats in second row of the mezzanine level. No matter what age you are the Rockette's help you feel like a kid again. Amazing blend of music, dance and special effects that bring the wonder of Christmas to life.I can cross it off my bucket list - suggest you add it to yours.

Really gets you in the holiday spirit. I go to see the "Spectacular" which is aptly named, every 2 or 3 years. While it has always been amazing, the latest show is updated and modern with 3-D features, a heartfelt story line, and of course those long legged beauties outfitted in a variety of holiday costumes. I have bought everything from the cheap seats to the expensive ones, and don't think there is a bad seat in the house. Truly an event for all ages and one that will make any Scrooge-like tendencies disappear.
Beautiful Venue. Went to see the Rockettes 85th anniversary show. It is a must see if you are in New York during the Christmas season. It was my first time going, and will be returning soon.

Not worth the price of tickets. Taking the price of admission in account, I would much rather take my family to a Disney show. The Rockettes first act was great. Then it just seeemed they were doing the same dance with different costumes. I don't think it would hold anyone's attention for anything longer than the 90 minutes it ran.

the Rockettes. excelent show, worth to wait till xmas to see the show... i recomend it to everyone, its family show to "must see" if you are in manhattan on dic.
i love the xmas 2012 show...
one tip... go after lunch or dinner... the food its too xpensive... 30 bucks for 2 cokes and popcorn i think its too much...

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. Had been to New York twice previously and had threatened to go to the Christmas Show, I wasn't dissapointed. This truely is a spectacular show in spectacular surroundings. Don't worry about the seat you buy, we bought the cheapest seats, way up in the gods and the view was excellent. Really well designed theatre (even though it was built 80+ years ago), there isn't a bad seat in the house!!!! Well worth a visit.

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular Was AMAZING!. I'll be honest, this wasn't the top of my list of things to do in NYC in December. I'm so glad we went - I was amazed. The 3D was a surprise, but the best part was when the Rockettes fused together like ribbon candy-AMAZING! I'm so glad we went, will go back!

Loved it!. It's a must see when in the city during the Christmas production. For the 2 of us, I chose to buy tickets at a non-prime time. Prime costs a bit more. Our seats were in the first mezzanine in the 3rd row. My husband would prefer to spend more money and sit much closer on the floor. Next time, I'll be sure to do that. If you like to see the 'whole picture', the first mezzanine is great, but if you want to see the faces of the performers more clearly, then pay the money and sit closer.It was pretty easy to buy tickets online and I had them mailed. I was able to choose exactly where we would sit - nice feature.There is a food voucher that can be purchased when you get tickets. If you plan to get drink and popcorn - that's the way to go to reduce costs. Don't miss it!

Rockettes were great.. but. Rockettes were great. Something my wife and I have always wanted to see in NYC during Christmas. However, the show itself was very random and the only time we enjoyed it was when the Rockettes were on stage. They weaved a very boring and typical storyline about a child and mother looking for the popular Christmas gift which didn't make much sense with the beginning or the end of the show. Also, the living nativity scene at the end was neat, but also didn't fit with the rest of the show.Overall, I enjoyed the Rockettes themselves, but overall the show was a bit of a let down.
Horrible. This place is terrible, You'd expect some place so crowed to have better seating so everyone can see and definitely better security! I'll stick to the small theaters.

Not for all ages. I thought really long and hard before spending hundreds of dollars to take our family (6 year old twins) to see this show. Unfortunately, they were bored to tears. If I really looked at it through their eyes I could see why.....it's a bunch of ladies dancing act after act. Although the songs are familiar they make them so long and drawn out that it made the kids bored and they kept asking when it was going to be over. We'll wait a few years before trying again. On a positive note it did start on time and the orchestra was great. The soldier act was amazing with the syncronization.

What memories are made of.. I don't know about the rest of the year, but the Christmas Show is fabulous! The Rockettes are amazing and the 3-D was so much fun. My friend that I went with remembered seeing it when she was a young child. Yes, it is what memories are made of.

Great Christmas Show. The Radio City Music Hall Rockettes are great and the show changes a little every year. I love that it still ends with the nativity scene. It brings back wonderful memories of when it was the special thing my dad and I did every Christmas. A great visit for young and old.
Unbelievable. The Rockettes are must see. Some tickets are expensive but worth it. The show is very up to date in spite of running 85 years.

A-mazing. I have enjoyed seeing the Rocketts perform in the Macy's Thanksgiving Parade all my life and was eager to see them in person on my first trip to the Big Apple. They did not disappoint! Their spectacular show offers something for everyone in the family - even the men enjoyed it - for it's artistry as well as the pretty dancing girls.. The 3-D element kept the children interested. My all-time favorite is the "Toy Soldiers" routine. I have seen most all of the big shows in Vegas and this show holds its own with any of them. The only down-side is that they allow late-comers to enter the theater during the performance, disrupting the show for everyone - not cool;. If you can't get there on time, you should have to wait to enter at least until a number is over. We missed a lot or the 3-D portion due to stragglers. Worth the price anyway.
A Must See in NYC. We love to see the Radio City Christmas Spectacular. Great show with singing, dancing and 3D effects. The show is entertaining for all is good, clean, Christmas fun.

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular: over-priced and average show. For the price of the tickets for the Christmas Spectacular, we had expected a show that would not be that relatively short and would not include 3D movies for more than a third of the show. If I want to see a movie, I'll go to the cinema. The incorporation of the story of the birth of Jesus Christ did not fit into the overall show at all so from that perspective, the show was put badly together. We ordered champagne and got it in cheap plastic and way too small glasses. After the show had started, they still let people in who were late which was very annoying. Also people were makimg flash photography all the time even though it's clearly stated this is forbidden. Rightly or wrongly we had expected a more classy experience which it was clearly not. We would not go there again that quickly.

Very poor. We went to see the Christmas show with the rockettes and found it very poor in terms of the show and value for money, if I could do it again I would go see a broadway show instead of this!!

A Holiday Must-See. Great way to celebrate the holidays. The show has been updated to incorporate a 3D experience, so it's multi-media, not just leggy women dancing. But the Rockettes' synchronization is also a sight to behold. We took our two teenage children, and we all really enjoyed the show. Radio City Music Hall is an iconic theater and well worst experiencing.

Top Tier for any event!!!!. I love Radio City!!!!! Great place to see anything. The location is the best in NYC with many attractions , fine dining and easy public transportation at your finger tips. The venue itself is inspiring and the acoustics and view are second to none.
A must be see!. My wife and I went to see the Christmas Spectacular and loved it. As great as the show is the venue! Any trip to NYC should include this great national treasure.

Excellent Christmas Spectacular Show. We live about 60 miles North of NYC and come down here every Christmas. We usually see the Christmas show every few years. This year the show was excellent since the last time we saw it. I would say about 50-60% of it was new acts along with a 2nd 3-D show this year. We normally get seats in the 2nd mezzanine center which is reasonably prices and easy viewing. Would recommend the show, worth the price we paid.

Just Outstanding!!. The dancers did not step out of place once, they are incredible! Although its slightly annoying that they didnt sell the seats on ground floor yet made everyone sit on the third floor, would of been nice to move some people down to see the show better however the view was fine could see everything not too high up! Would 100% reccomend to anyone going around Christmas time.

Rockettes Christams Show New York USA December 24th 2012. We have just returned from New York for our Christmas holiday. We have never been away for christmas before and wanted some good christmas entertainment. We decided to go to the Rockettes Show at The Radio City Music Hall. Wow - as you went in it was decorated beautifully, lovely chandoliers and decorations. The show was superb, there were 36 dancers (the rockettes) across the front of the stage, their dancing was excellent, all in time and they were beautifully dressed. There were also singers and children in the show who were also excellent. There was also a 3D film that was also great fun to watch! The christmas message was put across in a delightful way. the whole show was introduced by Santa himself!! My family and I throughly enjoyed the whole show and would certainly recomment it. One tip though buy your tickets from Times Square ticket office when you get there, they are very expensive to buy online before hand.

Rocketts Christmas Fantastic!!! 2012. The Christmas Show at Radio City Music Hall is fantastic!! Perhaps the best show I have ever seen. It had it all. If you like Christmas, this show is a home run and very family friendly. It has three D, Santa, of course the Rocketts, pipe organs, a great live pit, fabulous sets and more. At times you really felt like you were traveling the streets of NYC .. right from your seat.. Loved it...

Loved the Christmas Spectacular Show. Never expected to like the show as much as I did. It's certainly not just a bunch of high stepping female dancers - although they are the stars of the show. The cast was much bigger and more diverse than i expected. Best parts from my perspective were all the visual effects (I'm a photographer so I get into all that stuff.) There was excellent 3D movie selections (complete with 3D glasses) and the coordination of the live performers and the animated background movies was superbly done. Sit up close to the front of the balconies so you have a full view of the ceiling. Many videos and special effects occur directly above you.

Good Christmas show. We went to see the Christmas Specatular. The 3D element was unexpected & good. Seeing santa a few days before Christmas was good fun but the Rockettes made the show amazing dancers I would have liked too have seen more of them. Good show we had excellent seats for a good price. I would really recommend & it will get you feeling very Christmassy!

Christmas Spectacular!. Can't say enough about how fun this was. The dancers are awesome, the music wonderful and the whole experience was fantastic! Huge bathrooms on the lower level but, again, never seems to be enough for the ladies. Overall a very good time. Highly recommend!

Fabulous!. Wow! I wasn't even wild about having to go to the show but hubby wanted to do all the touristy things so we went. I'm so happy I did!! What a great show! I loved it and so will you. The holiday show is spectacular and the last set is quite moving. A must do! Go, you won't regret it.
Very nice show. The show was very nice but would have preferred a night showing. We booked the 10:00am show because this was the only time where we could all sit together.

Improves every year..... I have been with my family a few times now over the past 12 years and what makes the Rockettes Christmas Show wonderful is how it keeps up with the times and evolves each year whilst retaining the superlative quality of the dancing and costumes. Truly amazing.

Radio City Christmas Spectacular. Radio City Christmas Spectacular was definitely one of the best shows I have seen in my life , it equals or surpasses the Bolshoi , it was beyond what I expected and definitely if you are in NY for Christmas till new years ,it is a must see . fantastic ,Thank you for the show .

Always a pleasurable experience. We visited Radio City for the Christmas Spectacular about a week ago. I see this show every year and am always seated in the Orchestra in the center. This year my boyfriend wanted to bring his family, so we opted for less expensive seats up in the back of the 2nd Mezzanine, and off to the side. I was a little nervous that being up so high, the kids wouldn't be able to see the stage as well & it would take away from the show. I was happily impressed when we arrived at our seats that we could see everything just as well as we could from the Orchestra. This is such a great venue, that it really does not matter where you sit to get the full effect of the show. As for the show itself, what can I say, its always good!

The Rockettes Rock. Wow, the rockettes were totally in sync and unbelievable. We saw four shows while in New York. All fantastic all different. The 3D xmas scenes were the best. This show is Highly Recommended for anyone who is traveling to New York

Just breathtaking!. I normally hate musical, razzmatazz type shows but my wife persuaded me to come and see the Rockettes on Christmas day. Well what can I say? The quality of the show and dancers took my breath away. Their timing, skill, agility and simple showmanship were all of the very highest quality and very much worth the visit. I would go back again. And again. Don't miss it if you get the opportunity

Still good and family friendly. It's easy to poo-poo the Rockettes as outdated or mere glam. Not so. If you don't take their training for granted, you see a highly precise and creative presentation--especially the toy soldiers and the actual bus with full-stage HD backdrop. But the appeal is not just Christmas: It's the stunts, routines, costumes, themes, and use of side platforms in the still-impressive auditorium. Impressive orchestra, too. Thanks for noting if this was helpful!
Annual visit to see the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Show. Show was great...just as i expected. Looking forward to planning my 2013 visit to see the show again.

ROCKETTES CHRISTMAS SHOW. WOW! Great show for kids and adults. A New York tradition that never gets old. Went with family with teens. Everyone had a great time. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!Comment: Watch out for the bathroom lines and... there is no coat check.

50% off tickets abound. Went to NYC.with the family to see the Rockettes. While waiting in line for tkts. agents distributed half priced vouchers for all shows. Proved to be worthwhile... the New show and the Dancers were terrific NOT TO BE MISSED

Overall a very good show.. I love watching the Rockettes. This year they changed the show and I wasn't as happy with it. They added this mother/daughter scene that was a morale story you were smacked in the head with and there was a lot more animation. I suppose it is to appeal to the kids but I missed seeing more of the rockettes. They had a great 12 days of Christmas routine and the live nativity scene is always great.

Christmas spectacular is unbelievable. I wasn't sure what to expect -- thought it would be cheesy. Not at all ....... This show is over the top Americana, but well so well done! I agree with the other reviewers ..... everyone should do it at least once. The Rockettes are great to watch -- no idea how they remember the routines as they are quite elaborate. I was happy they told the Christmas story during the nativity scene. And the live camels/sheep/etc. were really something. My jaw dropped for 90 minutes.

Carnival atmosphere, not classy--don't go. I visited NYC for the first time in mid-December. I had seen the Rockettes traveling Christmas show, but was excited to see them at Radio City Music Hall. The venue was poorly managed and many in the audience had no regard for others. We arrived 20 minutes early to a line that stretched a full block long. People were pushing and shoving and cutting in line. The show started on time, so the beginning numbers were interrupted by people taking their seats late. We sat about half way back in the orchestra section. Instead of taking in the show, scads of audience members were taping and watching it through smart phones and tablets and taking flash photography. It was like sitting in a dark movie theater while the people in front of you recorded the movie. This lack of civility ruined the show for me.

A great show for people of all ages!. I saw this show the weekend before Christmas and it was WONDERFUL. We attended the 9:30pm show and really the only downfall was they email you to suggest coming early to look around Radio City but then you get there and are forced to wait outside until they let the people out from the show before. Other then that little downfall, the show was AMAZING! It was a great show for people of all ages. I personally am a competitive dancer so I don't just give all shows 5 stars but this one was great! The only thing I"m still unsure about is I think the tap sounds are recorded which is pretty disappointing but I'm sure they might do this so everyone in the theater can hear them. Great show to see at Christmas time!
Great concert venue. This is a intimate place to go to a concert or event. I went to a concert here and it wasn't filled up so they moved us closer for free.

Holiday show was extravagant!. Great show, hard to say much more. Everyone should do it at least once. The organist before and after alone are a show worth seeing. The Rockettes are as great as ever and the routines are simply amazing.
2012 Christmas Show. Excellent production. Kids had a great time. Arrive early, crowds on the street in the evening are crazy.
The Rockettes. Great show, excellent price at 50% off today! Loved the rockettes, particularly the item when they fell backwards as the soldiers! Loved it!

Christmas Spectacular. If you're in the city and can still get tickets, I'd highly recommend it. I've been to the show many times while living in NJ, and once at the Fox Theatre in Atlanta, but not to Radio City in the past 16 years. It's truly a magical place to see the Christmas Spectacular. I took my daughter for her 12th birthday, and we both truly enjoyed it. New and old mixed together to make this show what it is today. As it's an anniversary year for the theatre and Rockettes it just seemed more special than years before. It's a definite must see for young and old alike!

Brilliant show. A must if you are visiting NYC in December. Brilliant, amazing show. Superb theatre. If you are happy for the experience, we would suggest taking the cheapest seats (or the next level up -$30 or $50 on the day we went. Buy them at the box office just prior to the show. We could see everything and thoroughly enjoyed the 90 minute show. Would definitely recommend.

Awesome Christmas Show. I have been a few times before but not in a few years. I went with my wife and 7 year old daughter as my daughter really wanted to see it. We all loved it. My daughter was mesmerized for 90 minutes and it far exceeded my expectations. The last time we went we were in the last row of orchestra seating. This time we were much closer and the seats made a big difference. If you go, pay the extra money to get a little closer. I don't think anyone pays list price for this show. There are tons of deals. We paid $70 per seat including fees through Groupon and we bought our tickets only a week before the show. We were about 14th row orchestra.

Christmas Spectacular. We just visited Radio City Music Hall for the Christmas Spectacular. The show did not disappoint! We had a great time. We had 3rd mezzanine seats, rows 3 and 4 and would definitely recommend them if you are watching your costs. There were a lot of families around us with small children who also enjoyed the show. We arrived about 30 min prior to the start of the show, no lines, we went right through Security and were in our seats in no time at all. Lines for the restrooms were extremely long after so I would suggested, if you need to go, try to get in before the show actually ends. It is a 90 min show with no intermission.
Awesome!. It was our first trip to NYC so we had to do the Rockettes! Their 85th anniversary Christmas show was over the top. Don't miss it!

Sadly I didn't get that WOW feeling!. First of all I have to say the Rockets costumes were totally amazing and their dancing faultless, especially when doing all the high kicks and difficult dance moves. Well done girls. A very professional and enjoyable show. The first 3D film was great but the second one didn't do it for us. Afterwards, we should have been buzzing but sadly we felt the show missed something. The final scene was fantastic and did bring the real meaning of Christmas home but perhaps a little more humour from Santa, a clearer story line and more familiar Christmas music could have evoked that Christmas feeling that we all look for at this time of the year. I would recommend you go and see it for yourself as the choregraphy was spectacular.

RADIO CITY CHRISTMAS SPECTACULAR ROCKETTE'S 85TH.CELEBRATION. The Radio City Rockette's graced us with their wonderful, out of sight performance while on Tour here in our area at the "VERIZON THEATER" in Grand Prairie TX. It was no wonder there were no camera's allowed. It would have ruined the whole event. The show was so Beautiful!! The show also included a great "Santa Clause". They had a Manger Scene at the ending that was to die for!!!! It was so vibrant,colorful, beautiful and solom. You could have heard a pin drop. I have always wanted to see the Rockette's in person and now I have!! It was worth the wait !!THEY WERE WONDERFUL!!! We saw their performance on Dec. 8th. Their last day here. If any one of you ever go to this Verizon, and are Handicapped as I am, be sure to tell one of the parking guides, (they all have walkie-Talkies), you will need wheelchair assistance. We didn't know about this at first . One of the young people on wheel chair detail noticed me strugeling and abouot to cave, told me not to move another inch, that he or one of the others would be right there. They rolled me all the way to our isle. Then my girlfriends took over again. I never would have made it with out their assistance and that wheelchair! This was a free service, so i tried to tip them. I think one of them finally accepted. They were very nice and helpful and yes they have handicapped parking. I do not know about strollers or lockers / storage. This was a musical about 2 hrs. long (maybe a little longer) with an intermission in the middle, which all of us smokers appreciated very much. It was warm and not too windy. Thank God for ''smoking areas"!! One more thing. It just goes to prove that no matter how old you are and not too disabled and if you are lucky enoough to have a friend like I have, you can still get to see and go to places you thought you would never be able to enjoy. I do not get out very often but when I do I make the most of it, thourghly enjoy myself and have a BALL !!!! I hope all of you do the same .

Fun Christmas show. I’ve been very fortunate to have seen the Christmas show with the Rockettes many times. I went this year and believe it was one of the best I’ve seen. Some parts of the show were repeats from previous years, but it is always a very entertaining show, worth the money and will get you in the mood for Christmas.

Disappointing- hardly a Christmas spectacular!. Expensive, cheesy and not worth the money. Maybe its because we are from the UK and haven't been brought up on shows like this but we were all rather underwhelmed ( two adults and three children 10-14 yrs old) Yes the dancing was very impressive especially the soldier scene and the nativity scene was moving but aside from that, the Christmas spectacular was disappointing. Would definitely not bother going again. Having said that, the family next to us were entranced by the show!

Spectacular Christmas Show!. I recently went to the anniversary Christmas Show. It's been updated with 3-D and other techno changes but the show is still superb. The segment of the Nutcracker, the Parade of the Toy Soldiers and Santa's ride through Manhattan is fun. The Christmas story at the end of the show is very well done.The Music Hall is in its' excellent Deco splendor, it's maintained very well.
Don't MISS. Rockette's Christmas Spectacular a must for your holiday trip. Spend the money to get the best seats available. Awesome show for any age!

What a show!. The Rockettes Christmas spectacular, is just that, Spectacular. I loved every second of the show and was amazed by all the positive comments my husband made about it afterwards.An absolute must see to get you in the festive mood. Would recommend without hesitation.

Radio City - The Christmas Spectacular. THIS is what New York is all about. New York's most gorgeous and lavish art deco interiors (there are even armchairs in the restrooms!) are teamed with the Big Apple's most breath-taking theatre space to deliver the ultimate entertainment experience. To really 'feel' the vibe, I would recommend the Christmas Spectacular, the world famous Rockettes' annual festive feast of high-kicking, sequin-glistening dance, impeccably staged and worth every cent. From the extravagently decorated lobby to the ample seating of the perfectly designed auditorium, Radio City Music Hall deserves every rave review in the book. If you can, take the backstage tour in the day (you get to meet a Rockette in all her glory) and go see a show in the evening. Glitzy, glamorous showbiz heaven!

Rockets Christmas Show. I have been several times, but this show has them topped with the normal high energy show, but a couple of 3-D parts. This show is great for both the young and old. The large hall is still a beauty

Good theatre experience. Unique arquitecture, where all the old time classic mix with today theatre and fashion.great staff helps you to your seats, good beverage selection and most important of all good seats.

Great Christmas show. We just attended one of the famous Christmas shows at Radio City. All I can say is WOW! It was very entertaining--from the famous Rockettes, Santa, ice skating on stage, all kinds of high tech digital effects, great 3D, wonderful live music and a bus on stage that does an amazing tour of NYC (the set keeps changing showing you NY at Christmas). Today they put on 4 shows--on weekends they have 6 shows during the day. This is a very popular 1 1/2 hour show in this gigantic, historic theater. After the show take the time to walk around, outside, especially in nearby Rockefeller Center, seeing the Christmas lights and displays in the city..

Rockettes still amaze. Though I had been to the Christmas show years ago I really had no desire to go back, but our friends wanted to go so we did. It was so well done, and has gotten so much better and we plan on repeating again next year. However - there were two mothers with two toddlers in the seats behind us (the seats are tight) and they never shut up even though rows of people tried in every way. RCMH should never sell two seats to four people - the chidren's faces were inches from our heads, making their shrieks right in our ears, and they were out of control, the mothers were worse. Still, we will be back and choose different seating options.

Ring in the Holiday season at Radio City. What a show! We had the pleasure of a family outing in NYC and saw the Radio City Christmas Spectular...What a Show...for children and adults alike!The 3-D portions of the show were un-real. The Rockettes were legondary.The Radio City Music Hall is a dream...easy in and easy out.Rockefeller Center Tree is less than a block away.Radio City really delivers!

CHRISTMAS SHOW. This is by far the best show at CHRISTMAS you and your family can see if you can.By your tickets early for the best deal, if you love CHRISTMAS this is for you. Every time we go it is great and worth every penny it cost, and if you can take the tour of radio city.

Radio City does it again. radio city christmas spectacular is the most fantastic show that encompasses animation, dance and live animals. I haven't seen anything like this in the UK. It sets us up for christmas, the rockettes are truly amazing, their precision is awe inspiring and put together with father christmas in person and in 3D as well as the nativity with live animals it is a truly wonderful show.

A must if you're around at Christmas. A well-produced, glitzy, fun holiday show to get you in the Christmas spirit. The Rockettes are fabulous - the tin soldier finale is incredible! - and the 3D sequence touring Manhattan is fun. Adults or kids...e erroneous will love it.
Fun show for Christmas. Saw the Rockettes show Dec 2013, very fun for everyone. Look for 1/2 off days as well. Well worth it, at full price.

Christmas spectacular, a great show for everyone!!. Beautiful show, spectacular, honors its name. The Rockettes are fabulous, gorgeous. This show is suited for children, adults, grannies, everyone. If in New York City during Christmas time you must not miss this show. A great way to enhance the spirit of Christmas!!!!

Excellent Christmas show!. Recommended by a few family members so we tended the show as part of my daughters birthday celebrations. Well worth the money - my daughter is now a rockettes fan-excellent choreography!

Christmas show is a MUST. Rockettes are outstanding! Hall is gorgeous. 2 Wurlitzer organs are superb. Christmas nativity at the end is extremely moving!Now - management needs to seriously handle the crowds. They take our water bottles - but they sell sticky cotton candy, soft drinks, popcorn, messy snacks...and they allow people to take those into the theater. Honestly, people CAN go without food for 90 minutes. Food noises and smells was distracting. But, what is REALLY distracting is that management walks latecomers in during a number. Excuse me, but if we paid that much for our tickets, can't you please hold back those people until a dance or number is over with???If you treat the audiences like you should, then respect for the place and the performers is what you will get. This is not a cheap movie. Performers are outstanding!!!

Very festive!. This was a trip with my office staff, a treat from our boss (an awesome boss!) We had front row seats, theater is very beautiful. Loved the Rockettes!! The rest of the show dragged when they weren't on stage, I kind of closed my eyes for a bit as did my pregnant co-worker..lol The bathroom lines are huge, but an attendant directs the traffic so it moves quickly. This is an amazing show and glad I finally got to see the rockettes but don't think I would need to go again.
Christmas Spectacular. Everyone should go to the Rockette's Christmas Spectacular. It was awesome. The 3-D animation was so real. Seeing the music hall itself is a real treat

Went to see the Rockettes - Excellent!. The only thing that keeps me from giving this a 5 out of 5 stars is that is WAY too crowded on the main concourse when you entry the lobby to the building. Radio City Music Hall is beautiful inside and there is so much to see and that is what everyone is doing.....seeing/looking. Taking pictures. The back-up and traffic jam it causes before you can reach the stairs that take you up to the mezzanine are terrible. There has got to be a better way to usher the mass of people into this (and I would assume other) shows. Perhaps they could usher people in by seating area?Once you are inside, unless you are seated in the Orchestra, there is no reason to stay on the main floor lobby. Most people head up the stairs as there are also bars, bathrooms, souvenir stands and concessions up there that are mush closer for the mezzanine seats.We were there for a 9:30pm Friday night show that was NOT sold out. I can't imagine if you showed up for a sold out show!We sat in the first mezzanine and our seats were good. I probably would have sat in the orchestra if I had it to do again. I sometimes hesitate to sit too close to the stage in a performance like this, but it appeared that the orchestra seats in this venue were set up really well and that you aren't too close for great viewing. My husband and I went by ourselves, but it would be a great show for families. Our children (ages 1-11 years) would have loved it. I do not know if they allow strollers, but I cannot imagine how you could move in there with one. If you are taking small children I would certainly leave the stroller at home. Prices at the concessions were high, but not terrible in comparison with other venues I have been to that are similar. For instance, we got a large popcorn, 2 drinks and 2 souvenirs for $20.The show absolutely blew us away. We expected just "dancing girls" and some awesome choreography and we got so much more! There were several story lines and "acts" throughout the show and the Rockettes were not the only performers. It was an incredible Christmas show that even told the story of Jesus' birth - what an unexpected and wonderful surprise! I would highly recommend this venue and the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular show to anyone able to go see it!

Spectacular show. The Christmas Spectacular is a must see when in New York during the holidays. This show covered everything Christmas. From the Nutcracker, 3D movie to the toy soldiers (my favorite) the Christmas Spectacular has it covered. Make sure not to take anything in, we lost about $20.00 in unopened European candy that they would not allow in the building. The great show made up for the loss. I would certainly go back again.

Very disappointed.... My wife and I frequented Radio City Music Hall as children when they offered a double feature with a stage show featuring the Rockettes between the two films. Prior to this past weekend, our last time there was probably in the 1970s. Back then, it was still a show place regardless of what was being performed. The art-deco motif, the sound of the organs filling the hall, the spectacular stage and shows performed on it and the shear expansiveness of the larges auditorium in NYC, all combined to make a visit to Radio City an unforgettable experience. Now, patrons are herded in like cattle. Upon entering the main foyer, one has the sense of being in a carnival or circus. Wall to wall people and vendors walking a midst them selling programs and promotional products and toys with flashing, whirling lights...all well over priced! Want a cocktail, water or soft drink? Better have a large bill fold at the ready! We ordered a vodka rocks and paid $12 for about 1/2" of liquid at the bottom of a plastic low ball glass. While the show and the Rockettes are still very, very good, the filth in the places significantly detracts! The carpets were very soiled and stained and there was pop corn and other litter in the aisles and under the seats.We had touted going to Radio City as a part of the NYC Christmas experience and were embarrassed after encouraging friends to spend their hard earned funds for something that was nothing like what we remembered and were led to believe still existed based upon the Radio City web site. We fear that, continuing on it's current path, Radio City's days may be numbered.

Paid for VIP, got VIPANTS. My partner had bought us some VIP ticket to see the rockettes as a christmas gift - after a bit of faff at the ticket office we were handed our tickets and a sheet explaining what our VIP tickets entailed. This letter explicitly said to arrive 90mins before the performance started, which made sense considering our tickets included a buffet, open bar and a chance to get a photo with 2 rockettes.So, we dutifully turned up and waited at what we thought was the appropriate line (we'd asked 2 guards, so we were fairly sure we were in the right place). And were hearded into the music hall and sent down stairs (next to the toilets) and waited ...and waited...and waited...no VIP credentials, no open bar, no rockettes, just cheap popcorn sold at a hugely over inflated price with screaming kids. We didn't ask 1, but 2 staff members, specifically stating we were VIP ticket holders, but the both assured us we were in the right place.I ended up having to demand the manager, who tried to pin the blame on us, saying we had arrived too early. When i asked for a refund of our VIP tickets we got sent from staff member to staff member and then sent up to the roxy suite (were we should have been the whole time!). It was 5mins before the performance and we had missed our chance to get a picture with the rockettes, by this time we were fed up and just wanted to see the show and get out of this terribly organized flea market.I had no problem with the performance, was very well put together and all that we had been expecting, but was thoroughly, amazingly disappointed with the front of house service.For a long standing establishment it was shoddy and embarrassingly bad service.
Always awesome. We saw the Rockette's "Christmas Spectacular" again and it was even better than the time before! We recommend the early shows if you have been doing lots of walking and sightseeing!
