Day of show tickets. We were able to get tickets the day of the performance at a rate much better than quoted on the internet a week earlier. The show was very well done and exactly what I expected of the Rockettes.
Great Show. Enjoyed the Christmas Spectacular and the arena! Great experience seeing the Rockettes!! We were running a little behind, so we didn't get to look at everything :)

Show was lovely. The show is consistently great, it was not my first time. It was, however, my first time with my 4 year old and, in my opinion, she was a little young for it. Santa picture downstairs was great, cotton candy with radio city christmas hat is a $12 must for the kids. One thing to keep in mind, the line for the ladies room was very long...if your kid has TO GO, maybe you should put them in pull-ups.

O.K. for kids not so GR8 some for adults. Went w/family to see Christmas Spectacular show on 12/12, show was interesting in the beginning but after a while(say thirty minutes) it became ho-hum. 3-D animation was a little weak. Not as much Rockettes as I thought there would be. Everything was overpriced at concession stand. If you can get deep-discount tickets then go for it.

Beautiful & entertaining. My first visit to NYC & went to see the Rockettes Christmas show, which was beautiful! The building, however, was also nice, & historic. We had seats in the 1st mezzanine, which was a good area~no trouble seeing the show. The show was incredible, using so many awesome effects & costumes. The 90 minutes flew by! Food & drinks are available & VERY expensive, however! A 20 ounce coke was $5, so save your thirst for afterwards!
Spectacular. Christmas spectacular featuring the Rockettes is a must see. So much history in this Theater. Will definitely be bringing more of the family for this show.

Commercialized "Gimme, Gimme, Gimme" with lots of product placements. This is one of the most depressing things I've ever done at Christmas. It seems like the same spirit that leads people to get in fights over sales on Black Friday.First, when you get there, they will go through your bags. Heaven forbid that you have a water bottle, because they will make you throw it out (so you will buy their overpriced water inside). They claim to have 'security' concerns about water. Yeah. Right.Once you've gone through that humiliating ritual, you enter a large room, festooned with many corporate ads. I'm sorry--the tickets are more expensive than a Broadway show (and it seats many more). I don't want to see ads everywhere. But the ads aren't just in the theatre, throughout the show, many more ads will pop up. The Rockettes are impressive hypothetically, but, really, how many times do you want to watch people doing a kickline, when no one seems like they're having fun and there's no point or story?Yes, you will get highlights of the nutcracker, if done by stuffed animals. But, frankly, I'd rather put on the recording of the nutcracker and have the 1st and 3rd grader who live in my building do the whole thing for me with their stuffed animals. It would have more heart than this heartless, commercialized travesty.There is a sweet story of a mother trying to find the toy her daughter wants. But the moral is that they play a video game together. Not that they volunteer to help someone needy. Or talk to each other. Or bake together. They play a video game (where they don't have to actually <gasp> talk to each other or look at each other) to come together.All in all this is one of the most depressing things I've ever seen. If you want to see what NYC looks like at Christmas time, go for a horse-drawn carriage ride through Central Park (for way less than this), ice-skate in a park and buy hot cider at a local market. Or go window-shopping and buy chestnuts from a street vendor. If you want to celebrate Christmas go see little kids do the Nutcracker anywhere. Or a Sing-Along Messiah. Or see Ahaml and The Night Visitors. Or Midnight Mass. Or buy an advent calendar, set up a creche and read the Bible. Or read a secular story. Or volunteer at a soup kitchen. Or scrapbook with your family. Or do Karaoke and sing with your friends. Or put on fun music and dance with your family. This has as much Christmas spirit as the people who skip Thanksgiving dinner with their family to buy stuff at Wal-Mart.

2012 Christmas Show.. Wonderful for all ages and timeless. A must must see in the city, make it a Tradition. Follow it up with a visit the Rockefeller Center. As a couple or a family this show is always a great investment. The lines are long for the rest room, however, the sweetest women gets you in quickly guiding the line...

Christmas Spectacular is cheesy, but also impressive, fun and worthwhile. I went into the Christmas Spectacular expecting a cheesy show that I might rate two or three stars. In fact, all of our party felt the same going in, and by the end every one of us walked out impressed and in a more holiday mood than when we entered. Is it cheesy? Yes, but it's also a fun, colorful, upbeat, entertaining holiday show.The dancers were, of course, pretty amazing, but for me, the star of the show was the staging. In the scene where the Rockettes tour Manhattan, you could swear you're watching a movie and not a stage show. The background imagery and motion of the bus on the stage are so perfectly matched, it felt like a tour of midtown. And the background projection of Santa's workshop was so unbelievably clear and bright, it took me some time to realize it was a projection and not a set. The 3D was also very good. I thought it was a little hokey, but my wife enjoyed the "video game" section, which marries dancing, singing and 3D video into a real-life video game.Our party uniformly gave this a thumbs up. I never expected I'd say this, but I think we'll return next year!

Rude staff no compassion. I've booked for the 10 am show on a saturday. Have spent $600 on 3 tickets to have a great seat for my 10 years old so she can experience and feel the Christmas spirit. Upon arrival we were informed that there is no 10 am show that I"ve booked for but my ticket is for the 10 pm. They have re assured me that they could give me a standing seat in same level as I had my tickets. We have ended up on the 3rd orchestra level by the very back door on garden chairs. When I went down to talk to costumer relations they have told me if I don't like it I can exit the show. We have stayed since it was a long trip to get to the city and I have also taken a day off. As I looked around I noticed that there were plenty of seats on my price range that they could have offered, but they didn't since I have bought my tickets from ticketmaster not from them. So who gets the money?!!! They did not care at all.... very disappointed and an happy with the service. The show was nice if you can see that far....

Christmas Spectacular 2012. We loved attending the Christmas spectacular. I think it is great that the show both embraces all of the great things about Santa Claus and the Christmas spirit and also beautifully covers the true meaning of Christmas. Totally put us in the Christmas Spirit. The Rockettes were amazing and the costumes were gorgeous! Liked that they incorporated some cool new 3D features. The only downside I could possibly think of would be that they could benefit from more bathroom facilities...forget about trying to go after the show (unless you are a guy of course). The line took up the entire downstairs. A little chaotic when the show gets over with people all over the place going in their own directions, but were very very organized and seamless when getting to our seats at the beginning. Loved the show, and would definitely go again in the future!

Spectacular. First time seeing the Rockettes and they were better than I could have imagined. The theater is a beautiful setting for this amazing Christmas show. The performance will entertain all ages, young and old. The costumes were beautifully done, especially the nativity scene which took our breath away!

Love the Rockettes, the story line not so much. This theater is beautiful and we LOVED the Rockettes. The storyline, not so much. The Santa section/video game story went on waaaayyy to long. In fact, it almost seemed as if the Rockettes were a second-thought. We loved the Nativity scene and the Rockettes, as usual, are AMAZING. I only wish we could've seen more of them! This is one of those iconic performances that everyone should see once. Hint: wait until the day of the show and get a flyer (we got one for 50%).

They need to consult an Imagineer!. Show was incredible! I can see why everyone raves about it. Lots of dancing, but it dragged a bit in the middle. When the dancers were not on stage, I wanted to take a nap. My only problem with the entire experience was the crowd control. They crammed everyone in the theater at once with no direction. People were squished in and everyone was going a different direction. Considering the number of performances, they should have this down to a fine art. They need to consult a Disney Imagineer on crowd control before someone gets hurt.

Fantastic way to get in the Christmas spirit.. Our second trip to NYC and first in December and I couldn't wait to see this show. Arrived early to soak up the atmosphere around the Rockefeller tree and inside the theatre. The theatre is stunning inside and the show more than lived up to expectations. Every scene was fantastic. Outfits were beautiful and the 3d scenes brilliant. It really got us feeling festive. Only gripe is latecomers getting in the way when you are trying to watch the opening scenes. If you are going PLEASE have some consideration and arrive before it starts. In my view late arrivals should not be admitted.

Christmas Spectacular was superb!. The soldiers were my favorite part. Amazing how well they stay in sinc with one another. A lot of practice pays off! Expect to pay $28.00 for popcorn and two virgin Rocketinis. Great view from first mezzanine row k off right center. Ties the true reason for the holidays in at the finale. A fun evening to get dressed up and go out with famiy and friends.
not worth the price. A good show for kids. Entertaining & splendid costumes. Latecomers were distracting. Storyline was average.
Christmas Spectacular really is... A "bucket list" event for us was to experience NYC in the Christmas season. The RCMH Christmas Show is something to behold - long may it live!

Great Holiday Show. Attended the Rocketts Holiday Show at Radio City. It a great way to end a day of shopping at Macy's and then take in the Christmas Tree at Rockefeller Center. As always the Rockettes give a great performance.
Rockettes. Went to the 9:30 show on Friday night. Great after a stroll along Fifth Avenue and dinner. Fun way to start the Christmas season.

It is Christmas in New York!. Attended the 11:00 a.m. show at Radio City on December 10th, and it was spectacular, as named. The costuming, choreography, and creativity were top notch and the 90 minutes flew by. The 3D segment with Santa riding his sleigh was great. The classic Rockettes numbers hit the mark, and the Christmas scene at the end is an historical part of celebrating Christmas in the city. We arrrived right when the doors opened, and enjoyed having the extra time to check out the deco details of the building. Give yourself that extra time to enjoy the overall experience of this New York landmark. The discount for using a Chase card for purchases there (and great seating for the tickets) added to the value. Look forward to going again another year!

Fantastic show - what we saw..... Not our first trip to see the Christmas spectacular, in fact my third show and my wifes 4th so we knew what to expect.As we normally do we bought the tickets weeks in advance, bought the best seats available (Orchestra 401 row SS), and settled down to watch a great show.I'm not a theatre/arty type fan but I can appreciate the talent of the dancers and everyone involved in the show, where this show lets itself down is the drive for corporate greed in that tickets for the show are sold at huge discounts to any drunk off the street right up to showtime. There was a constant stream of people entering the theatre fully 20 minutes into the show, people who are there not because they want to be but because they got in on the cheap, a couple in front of us who were clearly drunk arrived at 8.20pm and then got up and then got top-ups for their drinks twice during the show and what time they did spend watching the show they were talking and giggling all the way through.Absolutely no consideration for others.What disappointed me was the theatre having no way of controlling when people could take their seat despite the interruption they caused, when paying $100 for a seat it's a little annoying that others get to sit right in front of you at a fraction of the price you paid only for them to ruin the nights entertainment for many people.The show itself is fantastic but I'm not sure we'll make the effort next year....

A Wonderful Christmas Show!. We had tickets for the 2:00 show and began to line up at 12:30 after hearing they open the doors at 1:00. This gave us time to go in - grab our free popcorn and soda - then find our seats. The show was absolutely amazing - more than I anticipated it to be! The 3-D moments - the props - the dancers were so wonderful! I especially loved that they included the nativity scene - that was so beautiful! When we knew the finale was going on, we head to the back of the theater where we finished watching the show so we could head out and avoid the crowd. We will definately return!
Holiday Extravaganza. We saw the Holiday show. Simply incredible. The lights, the sounds, the music and of course the Rockettes! Superb performance!!

Radio City Rockettes!. We saw the Christmas Spectacular. Over the years I've seen the Rockettes on TV & the Macy's Parade and have been dazzled... however, nothing could have prepared me for this show... I actually cried in the middle of it because it was much more than I'd ever expected. To be able to be sitting there with my 1st born & daughter was the icing on the cake!

Great for all ages, sexes.. The radio city music hall Christmas show is a fabulous attraction for all ages, religions, sexes.It is joyful, fun, interesting, exciting and a lot more adjectives. And the main attraction for many is the syncronization of the Rockette dancers.  Although the performance ends on a religious theme, that is a small part of the show and I believe anyone of any religion can enjoy it. One caveat---I think it would help if you were familiar with the songs and they are mostly well-known American Christmas songs. Knowing the tunes help alot. But they seem to have a lot of foreigners in the audinece and everyone loved it. You will leave the theater feeling happier.
rockette's rock. wow a must see if your in NYC for the holidays, the way the did this show was excellent, costumes great, great singing and of course great dancing Well done rockette's.

Going downhill. Disappointed, the show is getting shorter, and the price is getting higher, could be a profit machine now, when some days they must be 5 shows or more,they are using 3d effect film to fill the show and the storyline moved a little still got the bus, and nativity scene wount be long before that is filmed and the show is cut to an hour, Rockettes good and santa is , but greed is spoiling a family show that was my last show

Amazing show the rocketts.... We got our tickets on groupon saving lots of $$ and we had the last row in the middle ,,, no seats are bad and we so enjoyed this amazing show. I would see it again In a minute.... The staff that help you find your seat clearly enjoyed their jobs taking photos of guest and chatting while we waited for the doors to open..go see this amazing show, it will certainly put you in the spirit of Christmas.

Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular. We attended the Rockettes' Christmas show here in early December. When we were walking up to the theater, we noticed a long line of people out front, who lucky for us, hadn't bought their tickets yet (I was worried that it was the line to get in). We were directed to the ticketholders' entrance, bags checked, etc. Inside, there were concessions, Christmas souvenirs, a candy counter, wine/beer/soft drink concessions. Pictures with a Rockette or Santa Claus were available near the stairs for the first mezzanine or all the way downstairs, respectively. Our seats were first mezzanne, about three rows up, a little to the right of center, which for the price we paid were adequate. The theater inside is beautiful - medium lighting to create a certain kind of holiday ambiance. (I got some practice with low-level lighting images - non-flash - with my Nikon D5100). I did notice that there were people taking pictures with flash cameras - supposedly flash photography is disallowed and strictly enforced, but that's not what I saw. I feel bad for the people who might have been distracted by this behavior. The show itself was great - 3D glasses, lights, dancing, and singing. There is a loose storyline that had something to do with a mother wanting to get some kind of a doll for her daughter. Afterwards, we bought a Christmas tree ornament and took a picture with Santa Claus.

Radio City Christmas Show - Yawn. The Radio City Music Hall's Christmas Show is a must do I guess, but the show was uninspiring, and fairly lame. It felt like I was treated like cattle rather than a human, and the show had to skip an entire scene due to technical difficulties.

Rockettes Xmas Special. Attended the Sunday morning show. Well worth the cost. The talents of the entire cast were well exhibited. I can only imagine the hours of practice that went into preparing for a live audience.
The Rockettes do it once again!. The performance just gets better and better. I usually don't like 3D but even that experience was a delight.

Excellent show but spoilt by people arriving late. Went with a friend to see the Christmad Radio City Show. It was a good show but marred by people walking in at least an hour after the show had started, standing up to take photos and talking all through the show without any of the staff stopping them it was so disrepectful to the performers who were very good. It is an expensive thing to do and for it to be spoilt like that, wouldnt spend the money again, there are lot better shows in NY than that!

Christmas Season in New York. The world is a special place during the holiday season and New York City is no exception. The decorations, the sound of 'silver bells' being rung on the street corners by the Salvation Army, crowds of shoppers, Rockefellar Center's Christmas tree and the quintessential Christmas experience of attending the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular. This event holds a special place in my memories and my heart; from the entry of Santa Clause to the Rockettes it is a joyous celebration of Christmas. If you are looking for that very special event to share with friends and family I stongly recommend considering this one. The venue alone is worth the trip, add to it the music, dancing and live Nativity - you too will walk away with wonderful memories. Add this to your Christmas wishlist.

Christmas Spectacular 2012. The Christmas Show in 2012 was lame. It was more a 3-D movie than the Rockettes. The show was 90 minutes. For the cost we expected more acting and a true show but instead we watch a film on the big screen. I-Max would have been cheaper. Some children seem to enjoy it (note: SOME), but the adults did not. Many were using their i-phones durning the show and many adults were carring on conversations. The employees did not ask anyone to turn off phones, not take pictures, or be quite. Many were filming the show with their I-phones. This was a distraction. This show has become a tourist attraction not worth the price. We also went around to view the Christmas Window at the stores in NYC (except Macy's). The store displays were not Christmas at all. They mangaged to remove Christmas from Christmas. The crowds were larger than ever. Skip the show and the windows not worth your time or money.
How do they do it?. The Rockettes were astounding. Precision like I've never witnessed before! Excellent holiday show with some 3D added in for effect.

Great Christmas Show!. The Rockette's Christmas Spectacular lived up to its reputation. It was really great! We've seen it for the past several years, and it continues to thrill and fascinate. The Rockette's are by far the highlight of the show! (i'm not wild about the "video game" segment), but the Rockette's are definately worth it! I also really enjoyed the Nativity segment!!! It is, and will remain a Christmas tradition!!!

Words cannot describe it. Radio City is one of those places you have to see for yourself. A truel jewel of New York. Take in the Christmas Spectacular or a concert. There is nothing ot match it's Art Deco facade or accoustics

Great Christmas Show. We made reservations for a mid-day, mid-week Rockettes Christmas Show. We had really good seats on the orchestra level. I would suggest seats in the middle, if possible. We sat on the side and could not see some of the side action. The show would have enjoyable for a 5 year old as well as an 80 year old. Good, wholesome family entertainment at a reasonable price.

Rockettes Show. If you are in NYC do not miss the Rockettes show. It is a wonderful Christmas program and well worth the ticket prices. 2nd time seeing it and I would go again. Times Square is exciting to be near and this show makes you know you are in the big city,.

Great for grandkids and grandparents too. My wife and I saw the Christmas show with our 8-year-old granddaughter; her first time and our third, I think. It was great. She was engaged the entire time and said it was "amazing". It was thrilling for us to see the traditional routines and the new ones too. Live orchestra, the big organs, the lights on the ceiling were enthralling. Even the lobbies were decorated and spectacular. Well worth the money as there is no show like it anywhere we have traveled.

Good Family Show. Good family show. Engaging for children and entertaining for adults. Enjoyed seeing the Rockettes for the first time. 90 minutes was just the right length. Make sure to go downstairs to the lounge. Huge restrooms.

Strong Start...Disappointing Finish. The show started off wonderful as it has for so many years. However, there was a 3D and video game segment that was added and it just brought the good Christmas feeling to a halt. It was unnecessary, too long with no clear message. The dancers, costumes, and sets were amazing as always but overall we were quite disappointed.

Radio City Music Hall. The anticipation of standing in line to enter the Radio City Music Hall and to see the Rockettes celebrating their 85th year, was thrilling! Once inside it is really crowded but so worth every minute of it. I was able to purchase another ornament to put on my tree at home, which makes my 4th one. Every time I see the show I purchase another one. Waiting in line for the free popcorn and water/soda was a joke. They ran out of soda, had warm bottles of water, and the popcorn was salty. I don't think they should offer these for free. By the time we got the water and popcorn, found our seats, sat down, the lights dimmed. That was too close for me. I like to have a few minutes before any show starts. The show was stimulating with the 3D glasses and the new video game which I have not seen before. The precision of the Rockettes is just incredible. I love the toy soldiers dance, the way they fall down like dominos is unlike anything I have ever seen in a show. I enjoyed seeing the costumes from the 50's, and 60's, etc. Of course the Nutcracker seen is delightful. I thoroughly enjoyed the show and will see it again in the future. I do wish that parents would not bring newborns to the show. We had the unfortunate experience of a little baby crying the entire time. That really ruins is for everyone else.

More Than The Christmas Show. Although for many people Christmas just wouldn't be Christmas without seeing the Christmas Show, it just isn't really my thing, but the building has an interesting history and you can take a tour. I did it once with a visitor to NY and I enjoyed it.

Christmas brilliance!. :) :) I felt like a kid all through my visit here! The sparking brilliance of the crystal Christmas tree at the foyer, the bling all around, the plush loos, the absolutely red carpet welcome from the staff and the comfortable seats. The whole place was awesome.The show in itself was absolutely amazing too! The lighting, the special effects, the 3d show, the music, and above everything the Rockettes! For someone who lovessssss Christmas music, this was custom built to completely wow you! It does get a little too kiddie at times with the dancing santas but I guess they do have to cater to the entire crowd. Overall well worth the money and time spent! I loved every minute of the performance.
Radio city music hall. I saw Radio City Music Hall "Christmas Spectacular" It was a nice show. Funny. It also had some great 3D elements. The theatre itself is a nice theatre.

Christmas Spectacular. The very best show ever, I have seen it many ites the 85th Anniversary show is not to be missed. My group was dazzled, the girls, the costumes, the numbers and the Christmas spirit. You must go.

Lively "Spectacular". The Christmas Spectacular was a good idea for the family visiting from overseas. They do not speak English too well, but they could see enough to know what the show was about. I am sure they never saw anything like the show featuring the Rockettes.

CHRISTMAS SPECTACULAR WAS STUNNING!!. I try to see the Christmas Spectacular every few years and it never ceases to thrill me. The Rockettes were superb this year - their technical execution was really tight. The 3D experience added a joy sand excitement for the kids. And, of course, the Living Nativity at the and was reverent and appropriate for the season.Plus, being at Rockefeller Center during the Christmas season is always a great thing.

A must if you visit New York!. This historic music venue is a must to make a trip to New York complete.We saw the Christmas Spectacular and it lived upto its name!The Rockettes were celebrating 85 years and the whole show was a great Christmas show suitable for all ages

Best out of three. Went to see the Radio City Christmas show and out of three shows I enjoyed this the most. It was also the least expensive. There show included 3D scenes that added to the enjoyment. The Music hall itself is not only massive but spectacular. A must see show if your in New York at Christamas

Top notch entertainment for all ages. Christmas Spectacular thrilled us and our guests - three generations. Well staged and costumed with first class music and special effects. The Rockettes never cease to amaze with their precision. The Music Hall is an art deco wonder.

Amazing performance. Saw the Christmas spectacular with the Rockettes and the show was fabulous. We had expected that it would be good but it was breathtaking. So nice to see that in this time of concern in expressing Christian beliefs so as not to offend, this show brings Christmas back to its origin..
Something for all ages. Wow, what a show
Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. Fantastic show - even at 9AM on a SUNDAY morning. The dancers were brilliant and the choreography first class. The two 3D video screenings were amazing.

Radio City Christmas Spectacular- shame on you!. Love, love, love this traditional show, and look forward to the same scenes year after year... BUT SHAME ON YOU RADIO CITY for removing one of the most touching and beautiful parts of the show where there is a narrator speaking about Jesus. This part was included around the part of the show where they do the Nativity scene, just before they end the show with Joy to the World. In this world of having to be politically correct, may I remind all of you who are shelling out good money to see this show that it is A CHRISTMAS SHOW? What's next? are they going to omit the work "Christmas Spectacular" and do away with the concept of the show????

OK, nothing special. Went to a morning show. Nothing much to say other than it's ok if you've got nothing better to do it's worth a look if you can get the cheap tickets $39ea. Probably better if you've got kids with you they seemed to love it.

Spectacular birthday gift!. I took my wife to NY for her birthday this year and we caught this show and I have to say it was one of our favorite part of the trip. We were greeted with a glass of champagne by the RCMH staff as we walked in. The staff was very friendly helping us to our seats. The show was breathtaking, to the point that we are planning another trip to watch it again with our children.

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular should be rite of passage for all children. Wow!!! We went thanksgiving evening to see the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. We went the previous day and did the radio city music tour and that was great too then we went to the box office and got tickets in the orchestra seats for $49 each as we had a discount leaflet we got off a man in the street! What can I say, the theatre is beautiful and when the show started was overwhelmed with the wonderful Rockettes producing an awe inspiring Christmas show to really begin the festive season. The nut cracker was adorable, the High kicks great but my highlight was the toy soldiers sequence. Amazing and I can't describe to anyone how fabulous it was. This is so magical I truly believe it should be a rite of passage for all children in the USA as Pantomime is in the UK!

Radio City Christmas Spectacular Dec 2012. My daughter and I went on a bus trip to see the Rockettes at Radio City for their annual Christmas Spectacular. It is a nice show to see--lots of good dancing and some special effects, but not overkill. It is something everyone should see at least once in their lifetime!
Rockettes Christmas Revue. Perfect way to start the holiday season. The transistions between routines was smooth. Kids loved Santa. The Nativity was spectacular with the live animals.

Perfection. We ordered tickets through group sales, since we had 9 in our party. This was cheaper than ordering through TicketMaster, even with a discount code (although I had to tell the person I could get tickets cheaper on-line with his first price, he then came down to a price below).Will call was easy. The show is the best part of the Christmas season in NYC. It shouldn't be missed by anyone at any age. Bathrooms are crowded, so plan accordingly.Food and souvenirs are priced like they would be at the circus or an amusement park. I get promotional codes for the on-line store, and order my daughter something for Christmas each year after she has seen the show and looked at the souvenirs.I recommend sitting in Orchestra 3, 4, or 5 in seats from LL to TT, but not in front of or behind those rows. Too close in this production could cause you to miss the overall spectacular performance.

The Rockettes Rock But The Christmas Show Was A Repeat. For the past two years my teenage granddaughter and I spent Thanksgiving weekend in the Big Apple sightseeing and shopping. Another reason for our visit was to experience the Christmas Show at Radio City Music Hall. Seeing the Rockettes lives on stage is an absolute thrill. Their precision is always impressive. However, the Christmas Show this year was the exact same show we saw in 2011, nothing added - nothing changed. Even the dance routines performed by the Rockettes and their costumes were the same as the ones we saw last season. I was especially surprised because the Rockettes celebrated their 85th anniversary this year so I expected something commemorative would be added. "Santa", the show's MC, only made a brief reference to the 85th anniversary. We wanted to make the Christmas Show an annual event as part of our holiday NYC trip but we will be skipping Radio City next year.

The Christmas Spectacular Extravaganza. Wow... This works for everyone...you get to see the beautiful Radio City building and the 85th Anniversary Christmas Celebration. Fabulous staging, costumes, music, dancing, The Rockettes and and and. We went to a 1000 performance on a Friday. It felt strange at first to be going into the theatre at that time of day, but on the plus side, it gave us the rest of the day for other sights and it was full of families, so we got to see the show through the eyes of toddlers as well. Highly recommended.

Updated Classic Christmas Show. The Rockettes are a classic so I had to see them. The dancing parts are supurb. The short acting skits are average. There are two short 3D segments, which I didn't feel were necessary, but since they are appealing to the youth... We bought discount tickets on-line and picked them up at the Will Call ticket window. This actually saved us time on the day we went, because the "have ticket in hand" line was way longer. Note: The theater is huge! Nice show suitable for all ages.

Christmas Spectacular...yawn?. I hadn't seen the show in nearly ten years but was in town with my parents, spouse, niece, and in-laws (who had never seen it at all), when we were able to get $300 orchestra seats for $79 each. The seven of us were very excited. The theater was just as beautiful as I remembered and the show had some new acts, including 3D segments. Unfortunately, a group men arrived late and were seated right and front of us, effectively obstructing each of our views of about half of the stage. Though I can't really fault any particular aspect of the show itself, overall it just failed to meet my expectations. In retrospect, I feel it was only worth $30 p/person if I had to put a value to it. Interestlingly enough, about five of the seven of us confessed after the show that they had difficulty staying awake, even I frequently found my attentiveness drifting, though none of us was fatigued prior. I guess it is something to behold once in a lifetime, or maybe it's better for children. But for four seniors, two adults, and one teenager, it just fell short.
GREAT Family friendly show.. Great Family Friendly Show. Christmas Spectacular was beautiful. Had my grand daughter's attention thru the whole show. A Must See at least once.

See the Christmas Spectacular. If you are in NYC during November and December, see the Rockette's Christmas Spectacular. 85 years and going strong, it is a little piece of Americana. Beautiful theater and a fantastic show. A little something for everyone. We had great seats and there was plenty of leg room. Just like other reviewers, know that the show was not sold out and with such a great venue, you need not pay as high of a price as you think to get a good view. It is a family-orientated show so we did have two children behind us kicking seats and playing with their light-up, overpriced battery operated souvenirs throughout the entire show. With the mad crush to get everyone into the theater we had little time to pause and take a walk around. Shows are booked pretty close together so if you are interested in really looking at the great old place, book the behind the scenes tour that is offered.

Incredible show @ at incredible venue. Went and saw Zarkana, which was amazing. The music hall is well laid out and the stage was easily viewed from our seats. As typical, the refreshments and snacks were super expensive for what you get.

Christmas show is not to be missed, even if you do not have kids with you. This was our second time to see the rockettes and we were afraid it would have gotten old, but between the dancing, singing, sets and the technology we loved it just as much as the first time. This show is filled with energy, history and cool technology. You will not be sorry if you go, it is worth every minute. On top of that it is the 85 anniversary!

Not what it once was.... Saw the show for the first time in years last week. While the building itself and its magnificient chandelier are reliably stunning, the production was a disappointment. Very little playing of the fantastic theatre organ. The opening is slow and the cheery "We Need A Little Christmas" and other orchestral holiday tunes are gone. The Rockettes are terrific as usual but the very long dance number is just too long. Thankfully, the Nutcracker, Dancing Santas and Wooden Soldiers numbers were left in. Then the mom/shopping sequence brings back all the holiday worries and pressure that you're trying to get rid of!! And the video game sequence---well it's long and for anyone over 45---it's boring and strange. The 3D effects are fun but not in the video game. Personally, I don't want any shooting in my Christmas show. And the Rockettes in the tour bus? That is very long and ...why aren't they on their feet? ...the overall effect no longer has the masterful buildup to the commanding and deep male voice describing the Nativity at the end. A few smiles during the show, especially for the dancing Santas, but overall, a disappointment. Many seats downstairs in the main rows were empty. The producers need to install a show that is more evenly-paced, inspiring and more of an escape from holiday stress like the show once was. I think most attendees are repeat visitors who know the old show well.

Great Christmas show. Went to the radio city Christmas show. This is spectacular. Took my family and really enjoyed. We got seated quickly and the staff was very professional. We sat in the 3 rd mezzanine in the front row. These are inexpensive seats however they were better than floor seats. If heights bother you this will be tough. Highly recommend. It will bring the kid out of you
Where were the stars.. Circled it on foot but did not see any prominent actors. It is in the area where there are several other attractions famous to New York.
Rockettes. It's an icon, world's largest stage, chandelier, stage curtain, lounge, etc...it's a beautiful theater and the Rockettes are great.

Lovely. We watched a xmas show which was really good - it had good special effects and was very entertainingIt was a nice atmosphere - the building itself was beautiful.We sat on the upper circle however we had a good view and could see everything.However the refreshments were over priced and the bathrooms were very far and had Qs..There was also a large Q outside which you had to wait in even though you had tickets however it was quite quick.

Rockettes are the real deal. Saw this review (Holiday/Christmas) with my wife and daughter and we were in awe of the precision and stamina of these young ladies. They are very unique and while there is a lot of "Line KIcking" going on, each number they performed was very well done. Really enjoyed this show.
Christmas Spectacular is Amazing!. We took our two young children to see the Christmas Spectacular for the first time. It was amazing. Great entertainment and fast paced.

A lovely place to see a show.. I just had my experience at Radio City. This large well maintained theater put on quit the production. I saw the Radio City Christmas Spectacular. It was a great show. The customs, flow the 3d visuals, everything was great. The Rockettes did not dis-appoint. The seats were very comfortable and had leg room. After the show you can walk out and being in the heart of Manhattan you can do or go just about anywhere or doing anything. The show is about and hour and a half which is nice.

We really enjoyed the Rockette's Christmas Show. The building is very flashy, you can't miss it. Inside was just beautiful, glamorous really. They were celebrating their 85th anniversary and had it decorated up for the occasion. The chandelier is just gorgeous. They have memorabilia on display, which is interesting. They sell odd things like oversized candy. A 2 lb package of Reese's Cup, extra long Twizzler's, a Snicker's bar that says slice to share, etc. We got the souvenier popcorn bucket and drinks and received a "free" jester's hat and something else I can't recall. It's fun for the kids to play with. You could also get your children's picture with Santa Claus before the show in front of a fireplace setting. The show was great, highly recommend it if you enjoy watching synchronized dancing. We had upper level seats, not quite halfway back and we could see everything just fine. We are tentatively planning to take our kids with us next year so they can see it.

Beautiful Theater. We went to see the show. The rockettes were amazing! And they show was cute. The 3D section was awesome. We spent $50 on a glass of champagne and popcorn but it is what it is. The theater itself is gorgeous. I loved the Crystal Christmas tree. If you arrive early enough you can get your picture taken with Santa or a Rockette. I wish I had known that ahead of time because I wouldn't have gone on the backstage tour. Overall the show was great and I'm glad I got to experience it.

Empty but full. We were sold $129 seats and told only ones available, evening of the show at their box office. Don't believe them. The theatre was nearly empty at the 9:30 show and it was super. Wish they were honest and able to sell cheaper seats. The Rockettes and Christmas show was the best ever!

Rockette's Christmas Spectacular. This is a great show for children (about 4 and up) and adults. There was something for everyone and a great way to kick in the Christmas season. I really enjoyed the 3d part of the show, the Toy Soldier and the Santa dance. I would get there about 1 hour early to take pictures, look around, get food or gifts.

Good on a Budget Show Experience. If you aren't into paying $180 for a broadway ticket for each member of your family...the Rockettes are a great way to see a quality show in NYC. With a Living Social discount our family of 4 paid $210 total for o-kay seats (not a bad seat in the house) for the xmas specatular. The show was extremely similar to one seen in Richmond, Virginia a few years ago, yet nonetheless entertaining and a good option for budget entertainment in NYC.

Smiling in Gotham campy "Spectacular". The Christmas Spectacular has run at Radio City every yr since 1930s and I expected camp kitch syrup sweet pastiche for tourists. I was convinced to go by a native new yorker who spoke of walking out smiling. She was right. But so was I. Loved the grand art deco theatre and visually enthralling and concise segments in show; disliked the gratuitous logos of sponsors (cruise line, bank, bus tour) and watch out for 20% markup by ticket resellers linked from theatre's page. 3 generations of family walked in and there was something for everyone. Leggy girls w long history of costumes, virtual tour of city, dancing bears in mini nutcracker ballet, heartwarming Santa Xmas plot, manger w live camels, 3D video games and more, all in fast paced 90 minutes.
Radio City Rocks!. We saw the Rockettes Xmas show which wasnt the best show we've seen but had some great special effects. The theatre is incredible.

Impressive Building. This theater is HUGE! The lobby is beautifully decorated, especially for Christmas. It stays pretty warm up on the third mezzanine (especially after you climb 3 flights of stairs) so don't worry about dressing warm.

The Rockettes. I have been to the Radio City Music Hall twice , the first time was to see Elton John who was great as usual but i have seen him more than once but the other time I went to see the show that made Radio City famous , there Christmas spectacular featuring the high kicking famous rockets and the Nutcracker , you know the X-mas season is in full swing back east when its Rockette season , you really do feel more of the X-mas spirit in and around New York because of the change in seasons , the ice skating ring , there amazing Christmas tree , its home !

NYC Tradition. When in New York for the Holidays you must make time to see the Christmas Spectacular! My husband and I took our daughters 5 & 8 and had so much fun! They were in awe of Radio Music City Hall, they met a Rockette and Santa Clause, as well as enjoyed a fantastic show. This is a must-see at Christmas!
Rockette Christmas Show. Amazing precision and very entertaining holiday show. The show has enough to keep adults and children entertained.

christmas show definitely worth watching. We just saw the christmas show. It had been awhile since we had seen it prior, I am guessing 10 years. My kids wanted to see it so I got great seats from tkts and a discounted rate. The show was great, kids loved it. Just the right length. Definitely worth seeing if in NYC during the holidays. The bus sequence was my favorite, along with the classic solider march.

Excellent Christmas Show. We booked tickets online and got great seats. Tickets were ready for collection at the desk. There was a great buzz around the place with people wiring to get in. Inside the huge chandelier shone brightly and took our breath away. The hall was huge and we got 3D glasses to use for certain parts of the show. On came the Rockettes with music and dancing. The atmosphere was great with all the Christmas tunes. Santa Claus was a big part of ref show with a Christmas Story including a nativity scene which wax lovely. This is s great family Christmas show not to be missed when in the big Apple. Thoroughly enjoyed by all the family.
The Rockettes are still great!. First time I've seen the Rockettes in 40 years. Not only did I enjoy the show, but so did my daughter and grandchildren. Looks like it will become a family tradition.

WOW. Saw the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular while we were there. Such a beautiful theatre and the show realy was a spectacular - a lot of fun. I can only imagine how magical it must be for children to see this

Magical, musical adventure!. This is the second time we have gone to see this show and it was wonderful. The theater itself is something to see! Its all in Art Deco style decor and just beautiful. If you have kids I would definitely recommend bringing them. It is an experience that they will treasure always. The show itself was excellent and very entertaining. The seats are so comfortable and there really isint a bad seat in the house.

highlight of my trip. this has to be the greatest show we have ever been to. we love christmas so this is a great way to end or begin your trip at christmas. the only thing i find not good is when people buy tickets others as well should have respect to be on time and not interupt others after the show has begun and when the host says, no pictures people should respect that as well. otherwise fabulous

Christmas kick-off Rocketts "Rock". Just returned from the Rocketts 85th Anniversary show Nov. 24--ABSOLUTLEY FABULOUS!Great for kids of all ages! 14 scenes, wonderful 3-D holiday theme.Wonderful way to kick-off your Christmas Holiday!

thrilling - Lives up to all the hype.. finally took my 8 and 11 year old for the show , However for the whole family it was a thrilling 90 minutes. Every scene was amazing - you can watch the rockettes all day they are so beautiful and fascinating. 3 D aspects were fun and well put together. I cant really pick a favorite part of the show. nativity scene had real animals - camels , sheep and a donkey - my kids were thrilled!cast was fabulous and so were all the costumes.Try to get a seat in the orchestra to really enjoy your experience.sign up on the website for upcoming deals and steals , i finally paid only $ 64 for an orchestra seat Row W but teh view was great. radio city itself is impressive so take time to enjoy the foyer before you go in.Unfortunately i picked a 10 Am showing on a sunday and it was filled with parents bringing their 3 year olds who could not care less about a show of that nature - my advice is to pick a night show with a mostly adult audience.I was annoyed that they sold some light up toy at the souvenir store before teh show , so hundreds of kids flashing while the show is going on is distracting.souvenir book is $ 20 cash only. Thank you Rockettes for an unforgettable day - every kid in teh world should have the fortune of seeing this show.

Christmas SPECTACULAR!!!. We loved this show. We have wanted to go for a while and got a great deal through groupon. The rockettes are a must see at least once in your lifetime. The synchronization is amazing to watch. My favorite was the toy soldier scene, it was amazing. This show is a perfect way to get into the Christmas spirit. We recommend this to everyone of all ages. I do think, however once you see it, it's not worth seeing every year. Its great for kids, couples or friends and family. What a show! They have even incorporated 3D which enhances the experience as well. Show last an hour and a half with no intermission.

Rockette's Rock!!. Went to this wonderful show on Friday night, 11/23. Hubby and I had orchestra aisle seats.  6200 seats and Santa came and gave me a hug and a kiss!!!!The Rockettes were the best! Every performance was fantastic! 3-D movies were so damn good. Outfits and dance routines were just out of this world. Performance got a little boring with the story involving the woman and 'daughter' that I almost fell asleep.

Christmas Spectacular a Must!. Holiday Spirit galore! One of us had never seen this theater before and the other a veteran, and we both loved it. Online ticket special for $49 cannot be beat! Beautiful, fun, and the audience is really in the spirit.The classic toy soldiers - I have seen it many times - is a delight. The Santa 3D in the beginning and the video game was clever, loved the tour bus and the live nativity. Plan to arrive at least 45 minutes before showtime if possible. The lines are long getting in and it's fun just to wander the lobby.
expensive. but still classic. I miss it. I can't afford to go. The show and the building is the best in the world.
Wow!. Fantastic show! Got 1/2 price tix for the show at tkts. Great family show the kids will love as much as you! 1-1/2 hours of pure magic.

Fantastic. The Rockettes were amazing so entertaining. Well worth every penny my entire family loved it. I can't believe how wonderful every segment was our favorite part was the soldiers falling. Awesome!!

Christmas Spectacular. We took our 3 year old grandson to the 10 am show the day after Thanksgiving. We paid 50$ a ticket, for orchestra seats. This was an on-line special. The show was great. Some of the routines were a little long for a 3 year old, but overall this was a truly spectacular Christmas show. We live 1 hour outside of NYC. We drove into the city and parked on the street( not easy to do), but if you get there early, some garages have specials. We walked to Times Square after the show to see the Disney Characters and take pictures. Our grandson loved this, but they do ask for a donations if you take pictures with them. Overall a great day.You can buy souvenirs for 20-30$
Excellent Christmas Show. Totally impressed with the Christmas Spectacular Show! Set design, performers, scenes were all beautiful. Such a treat!

Christmas Show. First time there and loved the place. It still looks like a theatre from the 1940's but like it was recently built. Had seats by the rail on upper level and heard and saw everything like we were up close. Ushers were helpful and seemed like they really enjoyed their jobs. Souvenirs and drinks are expensive but that is to be expected.

Christmas Spectacular. I can't write in words how we all loved the show. The 3D santa going to New york at the bsgining is amazing so don't be late for this its a must see. The show was fast colourful and gave me the feeling of Christmas when I was younger. My Aunty who is in her late 70s said it was her favorite show that she has ever seen and she goes to London to see shows often. There is no break and it on for about an hour and half long so be ready for that. It doesn't matter what seat you book there is a good views from all around the theatre. Please don't go to New york this Christmas without seeing the show. I was told that the show changes every year so I might go back to New York again in a few years just to go again. Happy holiday and please treat you and your friends /family to a lovely amazing show <3.

It really is spectacular. We arrived early to take in the whole experience. From the 3D sleigh ride in the wonderful Radio City theatre we knew we were in for a treat. While the nutcracker and video game were good, the highlights were the Rockettes in 12 Days of Christmas, Wooden Soldiers, Tour bus and the spectacular Lights of Christmas. Then the Living Nativity at the end was breath taking. What a great way to start the Christmas season!!
Lovely. Saw the Christmas show, in Row JJ center. It was great. 3D was fun, bright and colorful. loved the toy soldiers effect.Definitely got me in the xmas mood.
They Let Bears on Stage.... Thank you Grizzly Bear and Radio City Music Hall for making my trip amazing. Floating in orange. I had the honor of sitting near the front...

Great show!. I visited for the first time Radio City Music Hall and saw the Christmas Spectacular and it was great!! Although we seated in the last row of the theater we enjoyed the show and could see perfectly. The choreography and music were excellent! I recommend the show !

Rockettes Christmas show was NOT worth the money. While visiting NYC I decided to get tix for the Rockettes Christmas show, I mean how much more New York can you get. I was totally disappointed!! I got a discounted tix on Travelzoo (still paid $60) The show was only 1 hour long. The girls were great and their dancing was beautiful but the rest of the show lacked excitement. The ending routine was not even the girls dancing. I actually dozed off. The children around me seemed to enjoy it but I was completely bored

85 Years of Wonderful. If you are anywhere near NYC or plan to go there near the Holidays, PLEASE go to the Radio City Music Hall 85th Spectacular Rockettes show. It is the best show I have seen, (And we go periodically to NYC) The theater is grand, the organists wonderful and the Rockettes performance was flawless. They incorporated old and new seemlessly. I was afraid that the Nativity scene would have been eliminated, but there is was......complete with the live animals.It should be on your "must do" list for your visit to NYC.

First timers. We were lucky enough to be able to see the Rockettes Christmas Performance. Was a little disappointed in the fact that we had booked an aisle seat and the usher politely ask us to move in because of a person in a wheelchair, so we did, unfortunately, the person who supposed was in the wheelchair was obviously very able to be mobile and moved to the inside seat, and her husband (who was not in a wheelchair took the aisle seat)... not cool on their part. Then they spent the whole time talking and video taping the performance. I was surprised the usher who continually walked by let them do that. It was annoying to the rest of us around them. I finally leaned over and asked them to stop and be quiet. We did express this to a supervisor after the performance and he apologized. Next time, sorry but I'm not moving!

Ok show, not great. We saw the Rockettes Christmas show this past weekend. The theater is beautiful and worth seeing - but that was the best part of the visit. I wasn't impressed with the Rockettes show. There didn't seem to be a plot and the show didn't flow well. What disappointed me the most was the dancing; it just wasn't that good. The dancers formed nice straight lines and had beautiful costumes, but the dancing was kind of boring and not what I would have expected for a professional group.
85th Anniversary Holiday Show. This is not your mom and dad's Rockettes show and the 3D experience puts it over the top. A must see when in NYC before the New Year.

Radio City and the Christmas Spectacular. The last time we saw a show at Radio City was in the early 80s. Long overdue for a vist. We took a chance to see a Friday 5 pm show and armed with discount coupon/code we scored orchestra seats on the side for 1/2 price an hour before the performance. The hall, celebrating its 85th anniversary was wonderfully decked out for the season. We walked around a few times to take it all in before going to our seats.The show was really very good the highlight being, of course, the Rockettes. The Christmas Show theme with the requisite Santa was geared more for the kiddies, but really kiddies of all ages. If you are in NYC, it is well worth taking the time to see this show.
show. We just returned from a trip to NYC for a show at Radio City Music Hall and O what a show it was fantastic and I would def suggest seeing this if you haven't already!!!

Sadly, the Radio CIty Christmas Spectacular is not the show it once was.. I was lucky enough to see the Christmas Spectacular show every year during my childhood. It was consistent and magical, and I looked forward to it every year. The last time I saw it was 2001. For the past ten years I have been dreaming of taking my kids to the show. This year they were finally old enough and we had saved enough money for the VERY expensive tickets and weekend in NYC. I have been talking about the show and my childhood memories of it for weeks. WHAT A LET DOWN! The show is nothing like it used to be. While the Rockettes are still great, and the Toy Soldier routine is good, the rest just wasn't. Whose idea was it to replace the classic Dickens' Christmas Carol scenes with a 3-D video game? I LOVED the scenes with Scrooge and Tiny Tim. The new video game scene and "Frantic Holiday Mom" scenes did not even remotely compare. The whole thing felt disconnected. Even the live nativity scene has lost its splendor. We spent almost $400 on tickets for the show, and sadly, this is not a show I need to see again. I am so disappointed. This was one classic that didn't need updating!
Christmas Show. A .. maz...ing!!!!!!!!!!! Best show ever seen. Could not tell which was real, film or 3D!!! Well worth a visit gets you in Christmas mood big time. The Rockettes are surreal!!!!!!!!!

Amazing!. This show was awesome and to think we almost didn't go because of some bad reviews I read. It's a lesson to all who read the reviews, even if someone doesn't like something make sure you read between the lins. For instance the reviews I read didn't enjoy it because they've been going every year since they were young and recently they made a change, the reviewer didn't like the changes. However for me, I'd never been so it was all new to me and let me tell you, it was the best show that I've seen on broadway. Our favourite was the toy soldiers and we haven't enjoyed 3D in the past but really enjoyed this. The bus drive through NYC was also wonderful. Music, sets, costumes, singing, video game, dancing, something for everyone! One reviewer mentioned the religious content seemed a lot-really?! 5 minutes was a lot? One scene which I'm not a religious person at all but felt this was done well; great costumes, live animals, pretty great stuff. If anything I felt it didn't fit. Everything else was so upbeat and it was more somber. Oh we'll I guess they want to have something for everyone and they most certainly do. We loved it and HIGHLY recommend it!

No theater quite like it. The sheer size of it is admirable. This theater is a staple in NYC history. We have seen many shows here over the years but for this review we saw the Christmas Show again. The Rockettes and Radio City are a package deal - the show is a tradition in NYC. Even though it is expensive, you should see it at least once.Hint: It is better to be up higher in the first rows than to be in orchestra in the rear rows....and cheaper too!

The Rockettes are simply awesome!!!!. We have seen the Rocketettes on our tour the last two years in Nashville and Washington, DC. Although those shows were very nice, there is simply nothing like seeing "the real deal" in Radio City Music Hall. Our expectations were very high, but the show exceeded them. I thought the food and merchandise were way overpriced, but that's probably to be expected. Nevertheless, I would consider the Rockettes are "can't miss" NYC attraction.

Radio City Christmas Spectacular 2012. Took my daughters here for the Christmas Spectacular, and guess what? It was SPECTACULAR! The show has a little something for everyone, even some 3-D parts! The Rockettes's are celebrating their 85th year, so there were even some vintage costumes shown! Great family activity for all ages!
Good show, nice staff!. Had a great time. Music hall is a beautifully art deco building, inside and out. The current show has plenty of the classics and a couple of modern 3D segments. Well done!

Good show - very rude staff. We booked our tickets in the UK for the show and arrived 20 minutes early to pick them up. The staff outside yell at you and send you in all directions. Collecting tickets and being showed into the theatre took 20 minutes and when we entered the auditorium one third of people were seated and everyone else was forced to stand because we were not the only ones who got stuck in the crush to get in. When we got seated we hadn't been given 3d glasses - appalling service. The show was amazing the experience was appalling. We payed $250 for 2 tickets!

Christmas Extravaganza featuring The Rockettes. If you enjoy Christmas, you will love this. It was a cornucopia of Christmas joy, wonderful sets, and spectacular dancing, executed with military precision. The march of the Toy Soldiers was absolutely breathtaking. This year it's the 85th anniversary of The Rockettes, so it was extra special, with a little history thrown in. Suitable for all ages and there is an awesome 3D show, although very brief, fits in nicely. There was also sheep and camels too....I KNOW! You'll do yourself a disservice if you elect to miss this show. Superb

Christmas Spectacular. I'd never seen the Rockettes, and I am very happy that I made the trip to NYC this holiday season to do so. We had seats in the highest possible section, but the show and theatre are so well arranged, you don't feel that you are missing out on anything. The shows start PROMPTLY at the time listed on your ticket. My only complaint is that they let families into the theatre after the show started, and not betweeen songs in the show, just whenever they get there. Two families of five were crawling all over each other to get to their correct seats, which happened to be the two rows directly in front of me. There were two ushers there, and they even had to bring a manager over. It was very distracting and unfair to a paying customer who managed to get to their seat on time. I went to a matinee show, so maybe I should have expected more noisy kids to be there, I just thought Radio City would have handled the situation better. Still, great show and a lovely time overall.

Christmas Spectacular 2012. The Chritmas show was really spectacular, and was also 85 year celebration for the Rockettes. The sequence of scenes were well timed and flowed well into one another. 14 scenes in total with two 3-D animation scenes. Was a great show to watch and Never to be missed

Wonderful evening. I've seen the Rockettes other places, but nothing beats the view at Radio City. What a beautiful venue. The show seems so much more spectacular here. Looks like there was not a bad seat in the house.

Rockettes Better than Ever. Just attended the annual Christmas Show at Radio City. Over a dozen beautifully executed scenes with dancers equal to Riverdance in quality. Beautiful pagentry, music and thematic delivery.

My sister may not have been selected as a Rockette...... Have attended many a great show both live and recorded at this venue and although my sister was passed over(she was too short??) during her audition, it STILL has a special place in my heart.

Just an FYI. I was seated in Row "W" in the orchestra in 3 end seats. The floor is not level. I was carrying my 2 year old when I stepped into the row and the uneven footing caused me to fall forward on top of her.Bathrooms were VERY clean.Staff was extremely friendly and answered every question with a smile that I had or heard someone ask.The Christmas Spectacular was wonderful.

Don't Miss the Christmas Spectacular if You're In NYC in Season. We hadn't been to the Radio City Christmas Show in well over a dozen years, but we decided our two granddaughters, 3 and 6, were probably old enough to appreciate it . . . and, boy, they did. They loved it. The dancers are as great as ever and the toy soldier number is still perfect, especially the ending. And the live animal nativity scene was a hit too. If you have young girls who take dance class, there is no doubt it's worth a special trip during the holiday season.I also need to really thank the ticket staff at Radio City; they can't be beat!! Somehow, I screwed up the dates on my ticket order and never bothered to check them. We all showed up at the 51st Street 'ticket holders' entrance and when our tickets were scanned, they were rejected. It took the ticket lady a minute or so to figure out what was wrong; they were for the night before. Before I could even begin to kick myself for being stupid, she reached out and grabbed my arm and said, "Oh, don't worry, Sir. We can fix this. You just need to talk to my supervisor right over there." Feeling a little sheepish, explained what happened to the supervisor, and she said, "Easy fix, Sir," and was on the radio to an inside supervisor. In less than five seconds she told me she had to keep my tickets, but walked all of us through the line and told us to go inside, up one floor, and see John. By the time we got to John, he was waiting and had already set up five special seats for our group in a small alcove like corner at the rear of the 1st Mezzanine. The view was great, and the girls could stand and move around with out bothering anyone. What a great group of people!!

Beautiful Theatre - terrible show!. It's such a shame that such a beautiful iconic theatre is churning out the old fashioned drivel that is the Rockettes Christmas Show. My mum was really looking forward to watching this but we actually walked out half way through it was that bad! Unoriginal dance, and totally ruined swan lake with ballet dancers dressed up in oversized animal costumes. The only redeeming factor was the orchestra. It's no wonder two thirds of the seats in the stalls were unsold. Spend your money on a far better Broadway show!

Christmas Spectacular. This was our first visit as tourists and the show was the main reason for the visit. The hall was amazing and not crowded (thankfully) probably a combination of being early in the season and being so close the hurricane Sandy. I do not think it would have been as enjoyable if it was a packed house. The show was good, but with parts I could have done without.
Awesome Show!. A very spectacular, fun show. The precision was almost unreal! Definitely a must see. Was there 12 oe so years ago - even better than I remembered. Great job by all.

If your there for Xmas you must go to the Xmas Show. Radio City Music hall is a great theatre and is vast in size. The tour is very interesting as you receive a lesson in the histroy of the great hall together with being shown around and a treat from the rockets.The Xmas show is just wonderful. It has been going for many many years and captures teh spirit of Xmas wonderfully. Don't miss radio city its great.

Love the Rockettes - other parts were just OK - LOVE the building!. I really love the Rockettes - their costumed are great! My favorite is the toy soldier dance because of the precision! Amazing. The other parts were a little cheesy and cutesy - kids seemed to enjoy it. I did like the projections across the ceiling of designs. They had two organists who popped out at the end which was cool. The highlight for me was the building! Loved the murals and the awesome chandeliers and Christmas decorations! I love the Rockettes and RCMH but do realize some parts of the show are a little cheesy. My husband did not really enjoy it - LOL! He's a Southpark fan so he made snarky comments to me which I think entertained him more than the show! Me, I love silly Christmas stuff so I enjoyed!

Waste of time. This was a very disappointing tour. We found it to be very un-interesting and not worth the time! We weren't even allowed to go into the main stage area, we were only able to see it from a viewing window above. We thought it was very boring and a waste of a few hours!

Rude, racist security and others working there. After the show, they wouldn't serve my wife and I drinks. They said no drinks 30 minutes after the show. It was only 15 minutes after the show.When we tried to exit the building, a row of security people blocked us and would not let us exit - they said all must exit on the other side of the building. That's funny, we just saw some others leave through these doors (not going to get into the details - draw your own conclusions).Also - avoid the 2012 Christmas Spectacular - not good - too short, too much 3d video (I came her to see the Rockettes - not cartoons). The older performances were better. Never again.

Beautiful Hall. The Hall is a beautiful example of Art Deco style architecture. It is authentic NY of yester-year! We have been for the Rockettes Christmas show several times and its always a spectacular holiday treat!

Beautiful Landmark. I had tickets for the Christmas show & was unable to attend due to the Northeastern snow storm. I was traveling from California. Both JFK& LaGuardia was closed.The guest relations representative was very pleasant BUT no refunds. I was lucky enough to be able to give them to a friend who lives in NYC but otherwise most people from out of town would lose their ticket. No credit - very sad for this institution.
Christmas Show is a MUST SEE. I have seen the Radio City Christmas Show several times over the past many years, and every year they do one better. A great way to get the Christmas Spirit

Great Night at Radio City. The show is always a pleasure toall ages. Be sure to glance at theceilings and wonderfully presservedart deco interiors. Just this is worththe visit. A bit pricey for families.

Maybe not for 30-somethings?!. I had some visitors over from Ireland at Christmas and I'd never been to the Radio City Chrismas Spectacular myself in the 3 years I've lived in NYC. So, decided this would be the ideal opportunity. Maybe it was because we went in with such high expectations, but we unanimously thought the show was disappointing and failed to keep our interest throughout. I found myself glancing at my watch after 15 mins and was glad when the curtain came down. We were also a little surprised at the religious aspects, not bothered by it as a group of Irish catholics of course...just surprised! There are some good bits, mainly when the Rockettes are on stage but overall I would rate this as an unsatsifying NYC experience (for adults!).

Love the Rockettes.. Ok this is the Baston of Art Deco. The place is simply beautiful. Sound carries and there is not a bad seat in the house. No good places to eat nearby, but this is the place to be at Christmas.
BLOW YOU AWAY. went to see the radio city rochettes christmas show. nothing to say but WOW. definitely worth the time and money, great show

Rocketts Radio Christmas in NY. From the time you disembark the train at Grand Central Station until you enter the Radio City Music Hall there is a bustle and hustle like no other! The Music begins and you feel your spine tingling! Christmas is in the air and you feel as tho you are in a dream. It is magical! the most ever moment that you want to hold on too! You are mezmorized! From the acts to the curtain call! Truly a wonderful time. Rocketts a wonderful performance. Seeing it in New York fantanstic! Recommend you make reservations in advance. Seeing on the floor awesome! Taste the delectiable hot pretzels. Be sure and visit the gift shop. I love my ornament! Each year on the tree it brings heart warming memories!

great concert venue. i have seen many concerts here--from lady gaga to b 52's and a ton more...small venue...much better than MSG...as a little girsl i saw first run movies here and my poppy took us to horn and hardart after...still very art deco...a must!
Christmas Show. I love the building.........take the tour if you can. Love the marvellous Rockettes, and the Christmas show is such a treasure for all, and un missable.

Art deco from its best. If you like art deco, it is a must to make the stage tour. The hall is very impressing. Normally I would not go to a Christmas show, but when I saw the stage it was the first time that I taught about to take a trip to New York in December.

Iconic theatre. Radio City Music Hall is an iconic Art Deco theatre so when we wanted to see a Broadway show, we booked the Cirque de Soleil Zarkana. It allowed us to have a look at the theatre as well as show that we could all enjoy and maybe the catch the phenomenon that is Cirque de Soleil.We have been to several theatres in the West end of London, and looking round the Radio City Music Hal is impressive and the show was fun as well.

You Just Have To. Fun for the whole family, especially the Christmas Show. You may feel a bit like you're entering the hall of the Wizard of Oz. That's because Radio City is a beautiful art deco design too.

Great acoustics for concerts. Visited Radio City for a Metric concert. The hall is gorgeous and huge. The sound is about as good as it gets. The only minor issue is that during a concert, when the audience is standing, the sight lines are not very good. When every one sits it is perfect, which I am sure is how it was designed to be utilized.

Beautiful !!!!!. Great place to see a show. Had the opportunity to see the Nutcracker performed there. I was impressed with the staff and how organized and friendly they were. The tickets were purchased by some friends which allowed us to tour backstage. If you go to NY, Radio City Music Hall is a must see. Oh and the show was "phenominal".
High Steppers. Corny as it may be they put on quite a show here. Bring the whole family and make everyone happy for a change.

We did the backstage tours. I learned thing I'd never would have guessed about the Rockettes, the theater's history, architecture and operations. All this time living in NYC- and never knowing these factoids!
A Must See. Radio City speaks for itself. A MUST in your lifetime. Great place to see any type of show. Beautiful place.
Great place to see a show!. Great locale to watch a show....saw a comedy show, which was terrific. The staff keep everything organized and are friendly! Overall, great experience!
Its NYC. if you go to NYC and dont go to MSG,, then you haven't been to NYC.. its one of the main things you have to say you went to. like the coloseum in Italy..

Go to the Christmas Show. We loved the Christmas show. The theater is really lovely. The building is old world inside. It did get crowded, but they manage the crowd control very well. Souvenirs were reasonable for where it is. Look for discount tickets to the show.

Interesting. I think one of the best tours I did this entire trip was at Radio City Music Hall. I even got to have a photo taken with a Rockette of course you have to pay for it if you want it. This tour is well worth the $19.95 you are charged. It last about an hour and you get an in depth tour of the hall.

Beautiful venue. We saw Cirque du Soleil - Zarkana which was aboslutely outstanding. Cannot recommend it more highly. The venue itself is beautiful and absolutely massive! I have been inside many theatres but none as big as this!

Huge Venue. Holds 6,000 people, too large for a concert in my opinion but a historic NYC building, renovated to return to it's Art Deco glory. Go se the Rockettes at Christmas time. A tour of the building is worth it.

It was good. We never heard it before until we went inside and it nice to look around and few things to buy.. I wouldnt say much about this, only if you see the films you will recognise the building!!
Concert. Came here to see a concert. Very neat theatre/hall. We had great seats and loved the show. Some of the workers could have been friendlier.
great Christmas show. It is a must see when you visit Manhattan in the Holiday season.The show is great!The stage is absolutely gorgeous.You are going to love the Rockettes.

Cirque Du Soleil - Zarkana. Excellent theatre & unbelievable show! I loved it! We were located in Orchestra, very close to the stage. The tickets costs 90 dollars each one.If you go to NYC you should go to this espectacular show!Excelente teatro e increíble show! Lo ame! estabamos ubicafos en la parte de Orchestra, muy cerca del escenario. Los tickets costaron 90 dolares cada uno.Si vas a NYC no se pueden perder este show espectacular!

credits to a good tour guide. the place was good but w/o a good tour guide, i dont think i'd have a great time. the tour guide gave a good amount of history of the place and her sense of humor lightened up the whole group. kudos to her!

I never miss the Christmas Show.. Santa Claus looks different to me when he arrives at Radio City Music Hall. The characters are great but at this age I enjoy the excitement of the audience. My grandchildren are now grown so I enjoy the giggles and comments fron the audience more now than ever before.

You get to meet a Rockette!!. This was one of the more interesting tours we did. Interesting to learn about the stage mechanic and meet a real rockette and get a photo with her. We decided to book in for a Cirque show after the tour which was well worth it. Cool to say you've been there. Would love to return for the Christmas Special one year!
Loved the Rocketts. My husband and I went to see the Christmas Spectacular. If you are visiting Manhattan during the holiday season you've got to see this show. Your kids will love you for it!

Beautiful old theater. The decor is timeless. We took a tour of this theater, and I honestly wasn't expecting to enjoy it too much but it was great. Very interesting history, and you get to have your picture taken with a rockette!

I was lucky enough to see Cirque du Soleil Zarkana there. My niece and I decided to see the show as part of our first visit to NY. The venue is probably one of the best places I have been to, perfect setting for such a wonderful show.
Christmas spectacular.. We attend this event almost every year and have always enjoyed it. They produce a slightly new production each year and we have never been disappointed.
The Rockettes. This a very lovely show and something everyone should see once in there life time. The Christmas show puts you in the holiday mood even seeing it right after Thanksgiving.

the Christmas show.. we took a bus trip to see the rockettes in the Christmas Show at the center. It was out of this world. The kids and yes me too, loved the 3d show. If ever u have the opportunity to go. Do it!

Grand old dame with a great art deco theme. Been in the Big Apple so many times, already running out of idea what to do, decided to go to have a stage tour of this place. According to the website, you can buy ticket on line or you can buy it on location. Once I got there, the sign stated that you can buy it from the sweet and gift shop. I walk around the block and could not find it. It turns out that it is right next door. The ticket is just under $20. It is an hour hour, I had 23 persons in my group.
