The theatre is beautiful, built from the 1930's full of art deco stuff. The stage is amazing, 10,000 square feet, the seat is what wow me. In Europe, all the theatre seat are very tiny and small. I am a petit person, even though I find it hard to squeeze myself in. Here in Radio City, I have room on both side, I spoken to an American girlfriend, she said she has to sit sideway when she went to a theatre in London. We also went to meet a Rockette, one of those girlie dancer. All in all, it was fun to know about this iconic place. I enjoyed it.

Popular Place for Years. Because I like smaller more intimate places to see performances, it is not excellent for me. The last time I was there I got the best seats I could and they were just too far away; if you don't mind this, it will probably appeal to you...

Iconic. Another NYC icon. I have been to concerts here as well as the Christmas show with the Rockettes. The location is central to the subway and there are several p[laces to eat nearby before or after the show.

Sign is the best part.. I am glad they restored the theater, but it has few interesting art deco elements. The behind the scenes tour involves walking down white hallways up and down stairs. There was a short show on the stage mechanism and a brief talk by a Rockette. There was a photo taken with her for $20. The best part is the free view of the sign outside!

Visit, see a show. You can not only see a show but also take a backstage tour. Such an amazingly beautiful theatre, be sure to go downstairs and visit the restrooms. Even those are nice. Particularly pretty when decorated for Christmas.

Impressive. This was my 3rd Cirque du Soleil show and it didn't disappoint. First, I don't care much for a story I like more the impressive things the acrobats do. There is a story of a brokenhearted magician if that interests you.The acrobatics are impressive and I especially liked that it's not just acrobats but a lot of different talents that are showcased.The setting in itself and all the scene changes was particularly impressive. It amazes me how muchh effort Cirque puts into the scenario and the costumes. Definitely recommend although it's moving to Vegas now.

Cirque du Soleil-Zarkana. This was our second Cirque, and it had a darker feel than the one we saw in Hollywood. The theme was "magic" and it was accompanied by alot of gregorian chant like music. Kind of dark and creepy and the baby (prop) that feel into the magical well remained trapped inside, apparently a three legged monster so when you left, it felt a little unresolved. The actual circus acts were, as usual, phenomenal, but the visual and auditory onslaught that accompanied it were not uplifting. You just kind of shook your head and said "wow" at the end. Then went scurrying into the night to find a quiet place to rest.

Enjoyed Zarkana. This show was fun and a good introduction to Cirque Du Soleil. I've seen their shows in Las Vegas and after reading reviews here, I wasn't sure what to expect. I enjoyed this show even though it wasn't as "grand" as the Vegas shows. I would recommend it.

Cirque Du Soleil - Zarkana. Cirque Du Soleil always amazes me and this show was no different. I must say that I've seen three other shows in various cities, Totem, Quidam and Ovo and this show didn't compare with the others in terms of "ooh and ahh" moments. It was a good show, but I wasn't wowed to the level I usually am with Cirque. Radio City Music Hall isn't the best venue for this type of show either. The seats are all level, so it's difficult to see the stage when someone is sitting in front of you. The space between the seats is really narrow, so you're either stepping on someone's feet or getting yours stepped on unless you stand up. Many people came in late and didn't sit down right away. This made it difficult to view and enjoy the show. Overall the show was good, but I've been to better.

Such amazing talent!. Zarkana is another great Cirque show. It keeps you at the edge of your seat, amazed at the acrobats tumbling through the air and giggling at the silly antics of the clowns. The acts are just long enough to keep you interested without becoming tiresome. The costumes and sets take your breath away, and that's before the various apparatuses used to complete the tricks! As an added bonus, Radio City is a beautiful setting for a show. The theater is a masterpiece in itself. I definitely recommend getting to see this one before is closes down. Discount tickets are available at livingsocial.com. We sat in the fourth row mezzanine and the view was perfect.

Rockettes. I saw the Rockettes last December, and the show was INCREDIBLE! The costumes were awesome as were the dancers. Everyone should be so lucky to see the Rockettes at Christmas time. When you leave there, walk to Rockerfella Center to see the Christmas Tree. I watched a man propose to his girlfriend there :-)
Saw Zarkana - awesome!. The theater was really nice--had good seats. The show was one of those that you don't want to miss a minute.
Cirque Du Soleil Zarkana. Awesome show and RCMH is a great venue. It's classic without feeling old and everything from the lobby to the stage area feels grand and fabulous.

beautiful venue. Every visitor to NYC should see a show at Radio City Music Hall. It is one of the most beautiful venues in the world. The art deco decor throughout is breathtaking and maintained impeccably.Just saw Zarkana (cirque du soleil) there, the show was ok, it's much better seen in a tent setting, but radio city mh shines. It's an architectural icon not to be missed.
ZARKANA. off broadway cirque was another spectacular sight to take in while visiting new york. The talent was amazing

Zarkana. We were there for the Cirque du Soleil show Zarkana. The show itself was awesome. It was my first Cirque du Soleil show and it will not be my last. It was the most weird / awesome thing I have ever seen. The Hall is beautiful. Walking in the hall it was unreal to see a hall with such history. I can't wait to go back. The staff were very friendly. One man even opened up a closed exit so it would be a shorter walk for us to central park.

Rockettes rock!. Have seen the Rockettes many times in my life and in various venues. This visit we attended the Rockettes Christmas show and once again, it was amazing! Radio City Music Hall was beautifully decorated for the holidays and made for a memorable night!

Great for any venue.. RCMH is one of a kind. Seating wise, great seats, even high up, but I like orch. or first mezz. seats. Sound through-out is great, so clear not too loud. Have seen many, many concerts there. Last night, I saw Cirque Du Soleil, Zarkara there. Great show for kids and non kids..This place is a beauty to behold. Whether it's a concert or a show, you'll enjoy RCMH.
Zarkana. Watched Zarkana at Radio City, first time we have ever been there in the many trips to NY. The place is awesome. Fab building and huge....think its a must at some point!

Cirque Zarkana= ZZZZzzzzz..... I was so excited to see Cirque Zarkana as I have enjoyed a previous show but this was such a dissapointment. Cirque has gone away from the acrobatic fun and excitement and have replaced it with boring clowns and cheesy acts. I could have had a better time in Times Square or Central Park watching the street performers do their thing. This was a waste of time. There was actually someone sleeping behind me and I don't blame him. Such a dissapointment! SKIP..

Excellent production:. We attended the Sunday afternoon matinee and took our 14 and 16 year old nieces.The performances were superb. As always so much to view onstage.We highly recommend this production and found it very entertaining.

Take the Tour. Backstage tour in insightful. We are native New Yorkers & enjoyed seeing the behind the scenes of a place we have gone to our entire lives. The art deco style is so beautiful. Go early in the day before the tour is filled with so many tourists.
Beautiful. Love this building. So pretty and the history behind it was just awesome. So glad this place was not made into parking lot!

Went here for Cirque de Soleil "Zarkana ". Took my parents for the Cirque de Soleil show "Zarkana" while it was at Radio City Music Hall. Loved the experience. Loved the show! The stage looks beautiful. I didnt see much more , since we didnt walk around. But would definitely come back here for another show if there is an opportunity.
Worth the trip. The Christmas Show is one of the great shows of NYC during the holidays. The theater is a great tribute to Art Deco architecture.

Another great cirque show. Zarkana was very impressive and should do well along with the other 25 Cirque shows thier.
Great old theater only second time there. Leaving soon so if you have the chance get to NY City and see this show.

Cirque Du Soleil's Zarkana. I don't know what impressed me more - the venue or the show. Radio City is a beautifully preserved part of NY's heyday and the period features remain wherever you look. The show is stunning and somehow fuses acrobatics, comedy, and fantastic scenery.

Rockin' Radio City. This is one great theater. The decor is fab, as are the lounge areas. Truly a slice of history. Excellent visibility from all areas, marvelous sound system, super comfy seats. Definitely go!

The best show experience ever!. My family and I went to watch the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular, and boy, I tell you.. it was more that spectacular! We were so amazed with the performances! They was the singing and the dancing. We the rockettes move they move at the EXACT same time its crazy! Planning on spending christmas in Newyork? Great choice. Just make sure to visit Radio City Music Hall and watch their shows. I guarantee it would be the best show experience you have ever had..

You Gotta See This Place. During our recent trip to NYC we were in Times Square and decided to take in a last minute show by Cirque de Solei: Zarkana, which was in its last week at Radio City Music Hall. Our original plans fell thru and my wife and kids were glad they did. What a beautiful venue.We were very pleased with our choice when there we so many other options. If your in the area and the show interests you gotta see this place.
Awesome Show!. Went to see Cirque Du Soleil with my boyfriend and we sat in the first mezzanine and they were great seats! We can't wait to go see the Christmas Spectacular Show!
Cool Place!. This was surprisingly one of our favorite attractions! Great history behind the studio even though we aren't history buffs.
Loved Cirque du Soleil. We enjoyed the Cirque show, tuogh not the best they've done. It was a great way to show my teens the beauty of Radio City, and the place has been kept up beautifully.
Rockettes. For locals and visitors alike a must see at Christmas time with the Rockettes doing their thing. Bring the kids.
Went to see a show. We went to see Circue du Solei at the radio city music hall. A very good venue. Good views, comfy seats, good location.

One of the most beautiful theatre I visited!. I went to see Zarkana in August 2012. I really enjoyed the show but I also discovered that this is one of the great show halls that I have visited in my life. The entrance is huge with large ceilings and beautiful design across the place. The actual hall has perfect acoustic with great viewpoint from wherever you are seating.

Gorgeous. We went to see Cirque Du Soleil and we had a great time! I feel like you could sit anywhere in the audience and get a great view. The entire place was very clean and beautiful! The only down side was that drinks were $10+ a piece, but I guess that is to be expected in NYC.
Fabulous!. Seeing anything here is great. They did herd us in and out very quickly before and after the show. It is fun to check out the bathrooms. All are different and unique.

love it. I don't know if it is fair ro review because I never went in the building or saw a show here, but I do have to say I walked by this building so many times during my visit and it I loved seeing those lights every time! I can't imagine my trip without seeing this!

America's most beautiful theater. Without doubt, this art moderne masterwork is second to none. Visit the ladies' powder rooms (no, they're not the toilets) and men's ex-smoking rooms (also not the toilets) on all levels plus the basement to see excellent art deco design from about 1930---aluminum wallpaper, infinitely-reflecting mirrors, etc. The auditorium has fine views from every seat, and is spectacular, including a moving orchestra floor, grand organs, and the Rockettes at Christimas. The lobby with its vaguely philosophical mural and grand staircase is junked up with ads and crummy things for the Christmas show, but at other times its grandeur can be appreciated.

Good, too short. the show is good - lots of acrobatics, some very impressing.Clowns parts between the different parts are ok - as i am not a fan of clowns.The show lasts jsut a bit more then an hour and we felt it was very short and ended by surprise for us...
Spectacular venue. Looks so pretty and all seats have a good view. I saw Rodrigo y Gabriela here and also Florence + the Machine.

Cirque Du Soleil on Broadway :). We visited the Radio City Music Hall to see the Cirque Du Soleil show. What a marvellous building and some great history with in the walls. The show was spectacular and a real feast for the eyes. Perhaps a bit pricey for the relatively short length of show compared to say a London West End show - no interval and, in effect, the first half of a London show only but the price of a whole show!! Still when on Broadway catch any show - they are all fun. Don't worry about getting back to your hotel afterwards - as we walked out there were literally hundreds of pedal cycle rickshaws all battling for our trade to take us home or to any other city venue - parked right outside the exit doors several deep!!!

not impressed. first off i recently saw a off boradway show like this in union square called traced and it spurred me to see zarkana thinking that since this is cirque du soleill the acrobatics will be stunning! i was mis guided! first off i dont know what language the show was in .. i could not understand the story line.. the set was amazing and the acrobatics were flat! only a few were notable, the man with the hanger, the sand artist.......and thats it. the other show had better acrobatics! luckily i got a deal and paid 49$ and not full price. I was expecting so much more..oh plus the staff a RCMH minus the sugar lady and one male attendant treat you like cattle and are extremeley rude to like EVERYONE

Cirque de Soleil was Amazing!. We saw a Cirque do Soleil show at Radio City Music Hall and it was amazing on so many levels. First, we purchased tickets on-site for 40% just before the matinee which saved us a lot of money. Second, there was a slight issue with our seats and they quickly corrected the situation and moved us to a more appropriate and even better area! The show itself was amazing. From the talented performers, to the creative choreography and technologically advanced props, there was nothing left undone! I also liked the fact that I could sip a glass of wine during the show. Myself, my husband and my two teenage daughters would go again.

Not a bad seat in the house!. My husband and I recently saw Zarkana at Radio City and had a fabulous time!!!! the seats are so comfortable and there isn't a bad seat in the house! The theater is so beautiful and staff has always been very helpful!

Magical!. It is a must see with kidsWhether u go to watch a show or just do the tour it really worth The place is so beautiful , an art deco architecture who transport u in another timeThe ambiance is spectacular It was a delight to see our kids so pleased

Attended matinee of Zarkana. Excellent Cirque de Soleil performance. This is the 4th one that I have viewed over the years. The performers are world-class and each show is different. The Las Vegas Shows are different from the Orlando and New York shows and vice-versa.

Venue alone worth the trip!. What a beautiful Art-Deco inspired venue! We saw Zarkana, the Cirque du Soleil show, which this lovely theatre only enhanced. Seats seemed to all have fantastic views, although the highest and furthest-back seats could be a struggle if your vision is not great at low light levels. Only recommendation is to avoid will-call. That line was very long!

Iconic. Even if you don't see a show here, go for the tour. Its huge and that stage has so many trap doors and elevators and moving orchestra pits. Plus the Art deco decor is awesome. And to think you could go there and see a regular movie and a show any day of the week.

Great Venue. Went here to see Cirque du Soleil Zarkana. It was very clean, plenty of restrooms. They separated the lines between people that already had tickets and will call, which really minimized wait time. I had 1/2 bottle of water that they wouldn't allow me to bring in. The ushers were very friendly and nice.

Stunning!. I was very excited to see a show at the Music Hall.It is the most stunning theatre foyer you have ever seen.I saw Cirque de soleil, Zarkana.I sat in the first mezzanine, about 5 rows from the front, in the centre. It was an excellent view. Seats are very comfy.I only paid $69 too from an offer on facebook!The facilities are immaculate, very clean.Get there early to enjoy the spectacular foyer before you go into the auditorium especially the Cirque show because the performers come out for photos pre-show.
Beautiful, every seat is wonderful!. Seen many a show and many a rockette here! Every seat id great and the setting is stunning! A must see if you are visiting NYC! Enjoy
good show!!. Good time, good location, great show. I enjoy the place is clean and it good to be able to attend any events beause the history that building has.

Nice.. I love radio city music hall. I've been there several times for the radio city Christmas show and for the Kenny Rogers performance. Both times I have enjoyed it and I recommend this place for people of all ages.

Zarkana was amazing!. Firstly, Radio City Music Hall really set a nice tone when walking into the venue by playing perfect muic to compliment the show. Radio City Music Hall in itself is a breathtaking venue, words cannot describe how gorgeous it is. This was my first Cirque du Soleil show and I absolutely loved it! It was a little shorter than i would have liked (90 minutes) but I was enthralled the entire time. Also, snacks at the venue were pricey. A must-see show!

What a great little tour with Joyce. We went on a tour of Radio City Music Hall with Joyce who was wonderful. She was so nice and you can tell she loves the beautiful old building and her job. The tour was really interesting and my daughter had her photo taken with a real Rockette. The building was very Art Deco and has been fully brought back to how it was in the 1930,s.
Saw Zarkana-WOW!. An iconic building, great shows. WOW! What an amazing performance. It was so much fun. You’ll be saying wow!, WOW! on a regular basis. I Love Cirque de Soleil.

See Zarkana!!!. What a treat to be able to see Cirque du Soleil in Radio City Music Hall, a NYC landmark theatre. The theatre is beautiful inside, it's easy to imagine going there many years ago when it was THE place to see a show. And I can't say enough wonderful things about the show - it was fabulous. I was enthralled and thoroughly entertained. Good fun for the whole family. See it before it closes in September!
Christmas Show. EVERYONE should come see the Christmas Show. It was fun yet very moving. i finally saw it in my forties, and it still was a one of a kind, terrific show.

THE WORST. I have seen many many shows and that goodness it is closing this week at Radio City Music Hall. What a waste of money and time. the reviews that people gave are false. I think the B or C crew were performing that day. Stick with O in Las Vegas or the show in Orlando at Disney.I want my money back!!!!
Tour. Did the Radio City Music Hall tour on a whim and found it to be fascinating. The guide was knowledgeable and the hall has been restored back to it's original 1930's decor.

Zarkana - Wonderful, but too short!. Zarkana was our first Cirque show and it was wonderful, but too short! We bought our tickets at TKTS for the same price as Mary Poppins and One Man, Two Guvnors. With all three venues we landed great seats. The two Broadway shows lasted about 2 1/2 hours, where Zarkana was only 75 minutes long. The woman next to me actually asked, "do you think that's it?" Also, I had no idea about the back story, and the story is told in a language other than english. Free programs weren't provided, so you are stuck purchasing a program if you want to learn about the performers and the story. I ended up Google searching Zarkana after I got home.

The superlatives are not enough. We went on the guided tour which took 1 hour & 15 minutes. Our guide was Joyce and she was simply wonderful. She took us into another world, the post depression era and annArt Deco world of the arts. We got the background, the story & the romance of this beautiful place. We were able to see young women auditioning for the Rockettes and we actually met a Rockette who shared about her life as a dancer in this iconic place. This is a must see place.

Entire family enjoyed the show. I've seen La Nouba in Orlando and wanted my family to experience a Cirque du Soleil show so we decided to make it a day in NYC. The show did not disappoint and my kids loved in (11 and 9). I also heard smaller children laugh a lot throughout the show so don't be afraid they are too young (I'd say 5-6 and above would be just right). The performers were fantastic, the sets gorgeous and constant action captivating. Cirque du Soleil always makes me feel like I'm in the middle of a really awesome dream, I'm not quite sure how they do it, but they do. The highlight for me was the Sand Art - absolutely amazing - I would have paid just to see her for an hour and a half!

Great Show. I've seen 10 different Cirque shows over the past few years and Zarkana doesn't disappoint. While there are a number of bad reviews - it's a great overall show and fantastic venue if you've never seen Radio City Music Hall. The show itself is very typical Cirque - clowns, acrobats, gymnysts and lots of great visuals and technology. It's not fair to compare this show to the Vegas shows which have their own catered theatre. We had a discounted coupon for the show so we paid 40% than the face value. While there are a few scarier scenes, there's enough here to keep a young child (6+) focused and excited. Having never been to Radio City Music Hall before, i had no concept of where to sit. We ended up in center section "E" and row "F" which is about 20 rows back from the front when you factor in the orchestra seats. Perfect seats - I think anywhere in the centre on the main level works. Unlike other Cirque shows, very little little happens away from the stage or in the air so no need to sit up higher or further away.

Great!. It was truly a great show from the beginning to the end. I have seen the Cirque du Soleil in Macau before. But, this one is better. The stunts and tricks are marvellous. It is a very very entertaining show - good for both kids and adults. The deep and wide stage of the Radio City Hall provides an excellent place for the performance. You may see similar stunts and tricks in other cirques. But, the one is more creative to put the stunts and tricks together. The only minor downside is that they keep on playing the same 20-second melody (for 20-30 mins) before the show began. It became quite disturbing. Oh, just a small tip in case it is your first to visit the Radio City Music Hall - you should also go to see the restroom in the basement. It has a huge powder room that you will not find in other performing venues.
A New York Classic. There's no stage extant like Radio Citys very unique one. The Christmas Show is a must. Go up the street for the Rock Center Christmas Treet

Cirque du Soleil Zarkana - Stunning but only 90 minutes. We saw Zarkana at Radio City in July, it was mind blowing, the stunts and tricks were absolutely stunning, my only slight critisism is that the show was only 90 minutes. But it is breath taking for every one of those 90 minutes

Christmas Show. I went a few years back and truly is worth seeing one in your life. The show is great and the kids loved it. Very crowed in the lobby areas and stairs but just take your time. Go by all means..

We saw the UK band PULP here for a few dollars more than the price of a tour of the hall.. This is something which I would highly recommend, an evening in this most beautiful, old fashioned but beautifully refurbishedand huge hall, with comfortable seats and good acoustics. The band Pulp was unknown to us, but it was the experience of spending a couple of hours sitting in this old beauty of a hall which we found extemely enjoyable. The tickets we purchased at the box office at the Rockefeller Center the day before the concert were only 35 dollars per head, which I think was a bargain.

Zarkana Cirque du Soleil at Radio City Music Hall - So much fun!. First of all, everyone who visits NYC city should see Radio City Music Hall. It is a grand theatre in the deco style, and is really awe inspiring. I'm a native New Yorker and no matter how many times I go to Radio City, I am always impressed by it's grand design, decoration and the wonderful stage. The acustics are great and it is located in Rockefeller Center on 50th St and Sixth Avenue.I have seen movies, the Christmas Show, the Rockettes, concerts and it's always been exciting!This week I saw Zarkana with my husband. This is a presentation of Cirque du Soleil and we enjoyed it immensely! We had no idea what language it was in, but that was not important! The acrobats, tumblers, clowns and the whole cast were totally entertaining. The costumes are wonderful and the set design is great too. It is a really captivating show and you will have a magical time. Great for a date, for kids and the whole family. Lots of fun!! Ninety minutes of pure entertainment.
huge theater. This is biggest theater I have seen in my life. I mean it is huge. We have seen Zarkana there, the show was average, but I loved the theatre and the architecture.

Incredible theater. We learned a lot... It is a very interesting tour! Very unique theater... Cirque du soleil was there and our guide let us watch a lil... You get to ask questions and take a pic with a Rockette at the end which is cool... Nice souvenir!We enjoyed it very much!Hard to find the selling point though... We were directed twice wrong to purchase the entrance tickets!

The Christmas Spectacular was just that; Spectacular!!!. My wife and I attended a performance of the Radio City Music Hall's Christmas Spectacular. What a show and what a great experience. If you love the colors, sights and sounds of the Holidays then this will be sensory overload. Every aspect of the performance was enjoyable and fun. We recommend that you go as early as you can (as early as they will let you in) so that you can enjoy the view of RCMH and use the restrooms before the show begins. I loved it, my wife loved it and I will try to talk her into going again next year!
what a perfomance. Attended a perfomance of cirque de soleil. Outstanding performance, and an amazing building. A definite must see

Good concert at Radio City Hall in NY. Went to see Widespreadpanic at Radio City Hall in NY. Had an excellent time with our group of friends. Showed up in NY the day before the concert and we all ate and drank well within the city.At Radio City Hall, the venue was set up right and easy to get in and helpful people working at the gate. Our group made our way to the upstairs bar and shortly after the concert began. WSP put on a great performance and will be back again for another concert at this venue.

Santa & The Rockettes, How can you go wrong?. This past December was my 1st visit to the Radio City Christmas Show in almost 35 years. It's bigger, better & more fun than I even remember as a kid. The show was worth every penny and there's hardly a bad seat in the house, due to the design. Trinketts & Keep Sakes are NOT over-priced and neither are the Movie House Snacks.The show now has a couple of 3-D portions which is fun for everyone - BUT it's not for the entire show and you can still see just fiine if you choose not to wear the 3-D glasses (provided for you) during those portions.
Christmas spectacular. I had a very enjoyable time watching the Rockettes. The only draw back was the LONG lines outside. Overall, I had a fun time and would come back.

great place for concerts. Every time I attend an event here, I think of the Christmas show when the family saw a movie, then the Rockette show. This was an annual event for us. The grandeur of the art deco always makes me feel special

Zarkana - fun for all!!. I took my three children to see this show on Friday night for the 8pm showing. It was awesome. It was a great experience for all ages, boy or girl. The Hall is spectacular. We sat in the first row of the second mezzanine, stage left. We had great seats that didn't break the bank. We enjoyed our popcorn and drinks as we watched the fast paced, highly entertaining show!! We were captivated for the entire 90 minutes.

Beautiful theatre. unlike so many theatres in NYC, this one did not require any climbing up narrow rows on a high ledge. It is modern and spacious and allowed a great view of all the action in the show.

After So Many Years, This Theatre Remains a Wonder. Living in NYC for most of my life, I've had many opportunities to visit Radio City Music Hall. I stil have many fond memories of this magnificent theatre, from when I was a young boy. NOw in my sixties it is amazing to me that after som many years, this theatre remains a wonder, The shear beauty of it is worth the visit; from the restrooms, to the lobby's, walls, ceilings, theatre portion, this theatre is breath taking. And if you are fortunate enough to see a good show(which most at this theatre are) along with it, you can really say that you got great value for your money.This past week my wife and I were joined by a couple of very good friends and we saw Zarkana a Cirque Du Soliel show. I'm glad we went. The show was excellent. What more can I say?
Gorgeous Facilty. Loved to see a building of this age so beautiful. The bathrooms are the size of a shopping store and appear right out of a movie from the 1950's.

If you've been to other Cirque shows, skip this one.. I did enjoy the evening very much, but I have seen other shows and they don't do anything new here. Radio City itself is a destination but the place almost seems to big for the performance. My niece is 14 and she almost fell asleep, Overall I wish I would have picked something else as this was are only show in the city on our trip.
CHRISTMAS SHOW. 4TH row center seats which were extraordinary! Everything about the show was very enjoyable and I don't think the price was over the top
A showcase. The Cirque de Soleil was on in this unique venue and fitted like a glove. One can hardly want more spectacular.

Wonderful show. I took my two teenage daughters for their birthday. Zarkana was a wonderful show from start to finish. The show was high energy and kept you on the edge of your seats. The tickets were reasonably priced and you could see from any seat. I would recommend everyone go to see this show before it closes.

Zarkana at Radio City Music Hall.. Many times, when we a hear a bad review about something, we don't expect anything from it, and we can get many surprises. Maybe this is why i loved Zarkana, after reading so many bad reviews. I enjoyed everything starting from the theater to the acts. I saw many cirque du soleil's show, and i have to say this is one of the best. A return to the original circus acts, but with new and innovatives effects. The story is pretty confusing, but the essential part is based on the acrobatics, sometimes not perfect, but amazing.
Zarkana. Went to see Zarkana and was blown away. The show and venue are world class and would return in a heartbeat.

A Cirque du Soleil gem. If you're looking for a way to get your kids off their iPads and away from their video games, take them to see Zarkana......a truly magical experience! No one in the audience moves or speaks for the entire performance, and the stimulus is so powerful, you feel spent at the end. Radio City Music Hall has great acoustics, and the amazing visual effects can be clearly seen from anywhere in the theater. Zarkana was fantastic in every way.......the fastest 2 hours you'll ever spend!

Great show in a beautiful setting. We got discount tickets for the show and did not regret it. Beautiful theater and a very nice show, it starts slow, but then you are mesmerized for the rest of the show. Very nice that there is no intermission, just 1.5 hours of show and you get to have an early supper. I recommend to go and see it before it closes.

Loved the Hall..Zarkana Though Was Disappointing. We've seen Cirque in Las Vegas so this was not at all what I expected. Not to be mean, but I've seen many of the same acts in a Chinese acrobat performance in Myrtle Beach. The kids will like it but if have seen Cirque in Vegas, take in another Broadway show instead.

Stunning show, but not for everyone. I've loved the several CdS shows I've seen before and was really looking forward to Zarkana. First of all, Radio City is amazing, certainly one of the greatest theaters in the world, and is a real attraction itself. Zarkana itself was thrilling, with amazing staging lighting and effects that really took advantage of all the space. I found the "story" a bit elusive, but it isn't really about the story. The circus acts were all great, and pretty much like other CdS acts I've seen. I enjoyed the music as always, but at times it was a rock concert volume, much too loud for an elderly guest I went with. Otherwise, the colors are lurid, and there's an element of darkness and menace about the whole thing that I found slightly off-putting. It didn't have the charm that other CdS shows I've seen ad in abundance. Still it's a magnificent production and I'd certainly recommend it with the caveat that it might not be so good for very young children or elderly guests who like things a bit more restrained. Also I got discounted tickets on goldstart.com, which seems to be a good deal.
Great show and facility. Saw Cirque de Soleil at RCMH - wonderful facility, it is much larger than ever expected. Row TT in the orchestra was a great seat.
tour. I'm not usually into tours, but RCMH has one of the best - you get behind the scenes and get to meet one of the Rockettes!

Wow,. I was hesitant to see Zarkana because of mixed reviews, but wanted to see Radio City Music Hall and got a bit of a discount on tickets through the Broadway Box website. I really liked Zarkana and Radio City Music hall is beyond fabulous. I have seen 2 Cirque performances - Michael Jackson and Quandam which I thought were great. The set designs were amazing to me in Zarkana with clever use of screens lights and tied in to the performers - very clever and creative effect. there are 2 tight rope walkers who also perform in a double ring contraption and are a wonder in balance - they manage to jump rope on both the tight rope and the metal ring which was incredible.. My favorite performer was the girl who draws pictures in sand. I have never seen any talent like this in any part of the world and was fascinated by her! Many others that held my awe were the male contortionist and a couple using a ladder to do stunts. There are also trapeze artists and a group of humanist that stack themselves in all kinds of ways. I also liked the juggler at the opening. There were a few misses as others have mentioned but they were minor and in no way took away from overall show. Clowns were funny and entertaining,too. I would see this show again!

Historical, Massive Theater. Everything about Radio City Music Hall makes all events that much greater than they can be anywhere else. A beautiful theater and stage. The Christmas show has gotten a little dated in my opinion, but still definitely worth seeing for a first-timer.
So Grand and Famous. Awesome theater with a huge stage and nice lobby. It is a great place to see a show or concert!
Racist security. Security only patted me down and nobody else. This is not an airport. Either all should be checked or none.
Saw Cirque du Soleil. Radio City Music Hall still has a romantic air to it. I was in the mezzanine and it was a great place to see the show.

Zarkana Was so so so dissapointing !!!. We have seen "o" in Vegas and loved it . We took our 11 yr old grandson to see zarkana .... What a dud .... Hated the music .... Terrible ! The juggler was good .... Acrobats fine Radio city music hall is always wonderful to see. but in general Zarkana was awful !!!
Zarkana. Radio City is a great venue...full of history. One thing to say about ZarkanaRadio: AWESOME!! I'm already planning on my next Cirque performance!

Excellent, wish it was longer!. We lined up at TKTS and bought our tickets for the Orchestra centre at eye level of the stage for $80 each. First time to Radio City and it was fantastic. The whole setup and stage was stunning and really catered to a fantastic show. The performance was AMAZING. This was our second Cirque show and it didn't disappoint. Great for the whole family finished in 1.5hrs. We only wished it went for longer!

What A Beautiful Experence!!!!!. In Auguest 2009 my family and I went to NYC because Radio City was having a kick off to the holiday season and there wasa kickline that was going through 5th ave and it was going snow for us. When the rockettes came out they did their famous kicks and they said who ever had a pink bracelet come out and join the kickline so cool did that and very awsome experence after we did the kick the first 200 people that had done the kickline will get free tickets to the show i was very Excited. My family always wanted to seethis show. Then in 2010 they did the same thing but no tickets. So my mom saw on the computer that optimum was having a contest to win free tickets to the show but you also get a backstage door very cool. My mom won and got the ticktes and went and saw the show. I recommend this show its a christmas spectular and its a family show that the family will love!!!!

Overrated. When I was a kid, this was my favorite place to go at Christmas time and an annual event for me. Not so much anymore, either at Christmas or at other times. Ordinary shows (although the Rockettes are always in sync!) but the lights are great and you should go by to at least take a pic.

Zarkana. First and foremost, isn't this theater just lovely? Always a pleasure. As for the Cirque du Soleil, well that was interesting too. The Wheel of Death reminds me of one of the carnival rides and I loved the Cyr wheel/hoops and clowns.http://www.cirquedusoleil.com/en/shows/zarkana/show/images.aspx

Don't miss the back stage tour!. We had tickets for cirque du soleil, great theater, awesome view, we visited every rest room, so glamorous! We took the backstage tour the day before, we had a great time, fun, and they show us around, rehearsals, not much of back stage as I want it, but we enjoyed, they started on time and it was a small group.

ZARKANA - RADIO CITY MUSIC HALL. It was my second time I went to a Cirque du Soleil show, first was La Nouba in Downtown Disney in Orlando which was great, but Zarkana went beyond my expectations,, it's a bigger show and it is just amazing. It's its last year in NYC, so if you happen to be in the City don't forget to go to Zarkana. As it is presented in Radio City Music Hall you have the opportunity to know this beautiful place.

Worth Every Penny. Took my grandaughter, age 6, for for birthday. Went to the first show of the morning and it was a good choice, gave us the rest of the day to see NYC all dressed up for Christmas. Show itself was charming and delightful.
Christmas Show!!!. Always a treat, the Radio City Rockettes are in fine form!
Cirque du soleil. Was lucky enough to see a Cirque du Soleil show at this iconic venue. Great show in a great venue.

Great place, poor staff. Went for the NFL Draft. All food/drink was the same $5 so not really great value, but okay for New York. Radio City Music Hall ushers did not care if they obstructed your view. When asked if they could move they said no, and more ushers came and they all stood talking to each other.
radio city. the building outside is amazing,walk around it and be amazed

Art Deco palace. Loved it! Had a great guide and wandered around this beautiful building soaking up the atmosphere and glamor of the era. The history is fascinating and the vision behind the full Rockefeller plaza is so interesting ... a must see.

Zarkana show was excelent. Very good show, dont miss this show if you are nearby!
It was my third show of cirque du soleil but the show room is perfect and you have an excellent view from anywhere
great ambience. A great place for a concert. Good viewing from any seat

Mesmerizing. Great spectacle. Thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. Great set design, great customs and an amazing cast who are truly skilled in their trade. Awesome special effects in the background which did not take away from the human element of the show. Highly recommend. Radio City is a great venue to see this show.

high steppers. Worth a visit by any tourist, or for anyone who hasn't been there in a while. Must see a Rockettes' show. Then walk around Rockefeller Center, view the statue of Prometheus, crane your necks at the tall buildings, and if in winter, photograph the tree. Then walk over to 47th St to look at the jewelry in the Diamond district. And you can buy whatever you want, as long as you have the money.
A true classic with Great shows. Beautiful theater with incredible acoustics and wonderful shows.

Loved the show and the Theatre. This was my third Cirque Du Soleil show and my first time at the Radio City Music Hall. I must say, the Radio City theatre is so beautiful that is almost part of the plan. The show itself was beautiful and impressive because of both the acrobats and the visual effects. You can get get discount tikets from Tkts (http://bit.ly/AGxHe ) and the show is leaving the city on Sep. 2.if you have the chance, go see a Cirque Du Soleil show, it's just an awesome experience :)

Stage door tour. This was brilliant and we highly recommend it. The guide was highly informative and pleasant and to see the gorgeous interior including the restored art deco apartment was a treat. Well worth including in any planned itinerary of the Big Apple.

WOW! What a Magnificent Theatre!!!. We went here for the Cirque de Soliel production Zarkara which was exciting and daring. It was a terrific production but first and foremost, I was captivated by the Radio City Music Hall. A must see for any tourist.

a Manhattan landmark. I used to come here as a child, I took my children here every year and now it is another generation. It is still well maintained and producing the excellent family entertainment one can expect.

Not a circus fan, but a Cirque du Soleil fan!. When our teenage boys learned we were going to Cirque du Soleil, they were not happy. Fortunately, the show won them over. Radio City is an incredible theatre, and the performance was absolutely jaw dropping! Less thrilled with noisy neighbors who had to comment on every aspect of the performance, and people who had no problem making half a row stand up to let them leave their seat in the middle of the show, but you can find jerks anywhere, I suppose. The performers were absolutely amazing, my favorite was the man/woman team who both walked up a ladder (with no supports) then the woman balanced on his shoulders as she took another ladder and climbed to the top it! My sons actually enjoyed the clowns (we are not big clown fans here). Everyone should see this show once - it was truly amazing!

Very Disappointed!. We went to Zarkana by Cirque du Soleil at Radio City Music Hall on June 13th, the performance was very good except the drawing segment was way too long. We paid well over $100 per ticket and we must say we have been to $5 circuses that were better run! People, whole rows, were being seated 30 minutes, even 45 minutes into the performance. Then again one whole row that was seated 45 minutes into the performance decided they wanted snacks and drinks and again stood all at once to exit and then returned one at a time so each time the whole row rose again. This is just one example of the rude activity that went on during the whole performance. If this is what goes on at Radio City on a regular bases, Cirque du Soleil should reconsider their connection with this facility. We complained to management afterwards and presented it as a constructive comment from concerned patrons and were told to get over it and contact Cirque du Soleil directly because that is how they do business at Radio City!

Zarkana. What an amazing experience for myself and my family! The plot was not understandable, but the spectacular performance of the acrobats and performers made up for it. As always, any and every event at Radio City is well worth the time and money.

Get in early. I went to see Zarkana by Cirque du Soleil which started at 8pm. I bought my ticket through the concierge which has some extra charges involved but was worth it. I had a WW seat at Orchestra level which was great! Get there early so you get in quick. Buy your merchandise straight away to avoid lines. You can't take any food or beverages in with you and they check your bag upon entry. Water was reasonably priced inside though. Don't be afraid of waiting for the toilet after the show as it moves very quickly for so many people lining up. Such a beautiful old worlde charm that you can imagine the era that it was built in. Truly a magical experience. The show was awesome too!

Cirque du Soleil-Zarkana at Radio City Music Hall. This was my 1st Cirque de Soileil experience and I was not disappointed.This show is a very busy circus-like show full of acrobatics, theatrics, comedy, special effects and trapeze all pretty much going on simultaniously. The talent is unbelievable. The show keeps you on the edge of your seat most of the time and laughing the rest.This show is worth a look.Radio City is a great venue for any show.
The Christmas Show. Where else can you see the Christmas show? There is an old world elegance here, The seats are cushioney and soft - not a bad seat in the place.

Cirque du Soleil's Zarkana. This show features a lot of hi tech imagery which is different from the usual Cirque shows. Some of the tricks have been done before by others, but the show was still terrific with the usual fine music, theatrics, costumes and non-stop action. Again, I didn't like the clowns, but I usually don't like Cirque clowns.

Beautiful but late arrivals interfere with enjoyment. We ended up really enjoying our experience but the first 20 minutes of the show was consistently blocked by people arriving late and walking down the aisles. Really frustrating. There doesn't seem to be any policy in place for people who show up late....and there was A LOT of people showing up late. Really disappointed in RCMH for that.

Good and plenty of bad too. The good... It's a beautiful auditorium.The bad...Having your bag searched and being forced to throw away any drinks or candy you are carrying. Just plain profiteering - not security (bottles of other fluids are fine). I have NEVER been to a theatre that does that. The rule is buried in their website!Since everryone is late from being checked for hidden Evian (or else they're just rude), people joined the performance whenever it suited. People were coming in constantly for the first 15 mins of the show and intermittently all through. Shockingly bad manners. Theatre staff seem to think it's normal...The stalls are not very sloped. I am 6'3'' and had my view heavily blocked by the guy in front.
Great theatre. The tour was fantastic. Seeing all the Art Deco things and the 6000 seat old theatre. Guide explained everything.

Christmas Show Musical. First time I had been to a play or musical and I enjoyed it. Timing was not slow, enjoyed the music and the "story" was understandable.Took the train into NY and made a day of the shops & the sights of "the big city" at Christmas time. I'd do it again but now it's one less thing on the bucket list!

Worst Cirque Du Soleil I've Seen (among the 14 I saw). If you never saw any Cirque Du Soleil show, you might love it. If you ever saw one, you won't.Le Cirque Du Soleil tried a musical-ish twist on this show leaving it almost tasteless. The music does not fit the acrobatics and is super cheesy. The first half is just plain boring. The second half is okay. For the price, for a Cirque Du Soleil show, it is not good.And it was not only the worst Cirque show I saw, it was simply bad.Go see something else, there are so more other shows in New York City!

A Legendary Hall. What a rush I got entering Radio City Music Hall for the first time in many years. My grandparents would take my sister and I there for a just-released movie (usually Disney) and a performance by the legendary Rockettes. I am happy to say Radio City Music Hall is just as I rememberd it....grand and beautiful and the perfect place to see a show. My girlfriends and I were there for the Barry Manilow concert and the theatre made the event even more special. Still full of helpful ushers and comfortable seats..i swear there isn't a bad seat in the house. I plan to go back soon and catch another in their great cncert series,,,,,
Amazing. Wonderful, interesting tour. We had a great guide named Alvin. Can't wait to see a real event there.

Stage Door Tour. We went on the behind the scenes tour, it was very interesting and we got lots of facts about the building and its history and the decorations. It all ended with a visit of one of the Rockettes and she showed us som of the dresses they use.

Great Tour. Took the tour while in New York and thoroughly enjoyed it. Beautiful theater. We had purchased the New York Pass which this was a part of. At the end of the tour one of the Rocketts was there and we were able to have a picture made with them and ask questions. She explained the selection process and that was interesting. Once you are selected to be a Rockett each year you still have to prove you are good enough to remain. Very good and Interesting tour.
Sounds Great!. Attended Anita Baker's season opener; absolutely wonderful.

First Gig...lasting impression.. I was in NY for a visit to friends and they surprised me with tickets to a gig in this wonderful Theatre. The minute you walk thru the doors u can sense how special this place is. Staff superb with a great mixture of young and old, professional and helpful. The sound in the theatre was excellent and the viewing perfect, though we did have top seats.All in all a great night and highly recommend a visit!!! Ps Darius Rucker Rocks!!!
A Beautiful Theater and an ICON to NYC.. I have been coming to Radio City music hall since I was a kid and it never gets old. the thrill of being in this wonderful theater is magical.

The best shows in NYC is here!. It does not matter the day of the year they always have good shows for all age groups just name it they got it,very clean the place,good service and food all around and out side over all depends what are you looking for!
Make sure. you see the Rockettes, it was amazing! I thought it would be young ladies doing their high leg kicks, but it is so much more than that!

Make it onto a Broadway Stage. The biggest theatre I've ever seen and the most amazing stage and you get to stand on it and look out onto the auditorium so many performers have seen. Beautiful art deco foyer and surrounds and interesting to see the workings of the hydraulics and walk past rehearsal areas and dressing rooms. If you're very good you might even meet a Rockette. Worth the price of the tour

Great behind the scenes tour and historical perspective.. Got a tour of the Radio City Music Hall and loved it. The tour itself took about an hour, and we were treated to a wonderful behind the scenes look. Also got a picture and a chat with a live-in person Rockette!

Go once in your life!. Amazing old theatre! We treated ourselves to The Rockettes Christmas Spectacular show. The show itself was cheesy but a Christmas must once in your life! The theatre itself is worth a look.
Christmas Show. Christmas wouldn't be Christmas with out the Radio City Christmas show. There is not a bad seat in the house.

Christmas Spectacular. Worth the trip just to see the Rockettes do March of the Wooden Soldiers. Recommend springing the extra money for good seats, as close to middle as possible about 8th to 12th row. Because of the big dance numbers you don't want to be too close.I had to take off 1 star for Radio City for The Living Navity because Radio City took away the very moving, "One Solitary Life". I do miss some of the old numbers like Marshmallow World and I understand they need to update shows from time to time but I believe taking away "One Solitary Life' was a sad misstep.Radio City itself is a wonder to behold. Arrive a little early so you can look around. If you are off season, take the backstage tour. It is very interesting. If you are there for Christmas season, then of course you want to see the tree at Rockefeller City mere steps away. Check out the store displays on 5th Avenue and St. Patrick's Cathedral. If you have a little girl, American Girl Doll is in the neighborhood also. For lunch, tea or dinner with dolls in attendance, you will need advance reservations.Make your special day at Radio City Music Hall complete by adding other things to do in the city. For dinner, I recommend Carmines on 44th street just off Times Square. Family style Italian. Reservations a must.Radio City Music Hall and the Rockettes are American Icons. Not to be missed !

Fabulous. Visited Radio City in March 2012 with a group of students. The tour was fabulous. We loved seeing all parts of the Hall, from the basement to the top. LOVED the bathroom with the beautiful mirrors and wall decor. If you like Art Deco style this is a MUST.We will tour there again.

Concert at Radio City. The concert was excellent, the acoustics were superb, the music was brilliant (Rodrigo y Gabriela and C.U.B.A.) I was impressed that the crowd was well behaved and respectful. In this case, the concert started after 9 pm, not 8 pm as it said on the tickets.

Memorable birthday trip to New York. Came here December 2004 for my 21st birthday and my friend and I were treated to the Rockettes Christmas special. We were within the first 5 rows from the stage and had such a wonderful view! This show was over the top and spectacular..larger than life! I will always remember this and hope to someday make it back to NY to see it again.
The Christmas show. Attending the Christmas show is a family tradition. It's great!
Tired venue but legendary. Great acoustics. Been many times. Once beautiful. Now old. Needs to be updated.

Good Acoustics, Clean Venue, Huge Space. Radio City is one of the most well kept event venues in NYC. The Acoustics are fabulous too. The only drawback is that if you really want a visual on the performers, you need to be aware that the space is HUGE. Keep that in mind when you are booking your seats. You may think you are sitting closer than you really are.
Classic. Beautiful, like walking back in time. The sound was great but almost too loud at times, I would wear concert earplugs if I go back.
Oprahs' Life Class. The atmosphere was great and the hall was magnificent.

A New York City Icon. This gem is a beautiful place to see a show. I have seen many bands here over the years, and the acoustics are truly superb. If you get the chance, get yourself in to experience this space.
A Classic.. This is a classic and old-school venue. I must to see a show here. I saw the Christmas Spectacular here and it was just so lovely. Just to stand in the space is a treat.

art deco fantastic. We did the backstage tour for an hour and it was great. If you like Art Deco you will love this tour. We even met a Rockette. The guide is extremely informative and it was well worth the money $20.
A Christmas Show. The Christmas Show was really great. We all loved it! A must do for all NYC visitors! If you've never been, make sure you go this year!
Christmas Spectacular. What's not to like about Christmas in NYC? Theater is larger than one would think. Show is a must see atleast once in a lifetime.

This place and its history is amazing - it is a must see!. This was one of the highlights of our trip to NYC. From the outside we expected to see a grand old music hall. Inside it is an amazing art deco venue. What was even better was the history of the place as explained to us by our fantastic guide. It is a must see!

Amzaing Art Deco. Radio City Music Hall is a great place to visit - if you are lucky enough to catch a show you can wander the building (check out the lavatories on the lower level) and get a sense of history. Do a tour if there is nothing playing.
Beautiful Theater with Lots of History. The tour is well worth the price and time. A nice behind-the-scenes walk through this great old theater. Very educational.
Amazing!. What a great tour! The inside of this builing is absolutely beautiful and the stage itself is a great piece of engineering. Well worth the $20!!
BonnieWeller. Just walking up the steps puts me in magic land. Going through the entrance doors was as enchanting today as 50 years ago.

How do you get to Radio City? Practice, practice practice!. I saw "You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown" here about 40 years ago and have loved the place ever since. The Christmas Show is an annual event for many families & generations.

Celebrities!. The day we attended Radio City was the night of Amnesty International. It was amazing to see the likes of Liam Neeson, Richard Branson, Russel Brand and many more, walking down the red carpet and waving to fans :)
Great Concert!!!. My boyfriend and I went to see Juan Luis Guerra here and it was fantastic. the sound was great and the view was perfect. I would come here to see a concert any time.
great space. saw the rockettes at this venue, beautiful space with lots of old NY charm, they do lots of shows and musicals here so its worth checking out
Rockettes.. While this venue has many more concerts, it's most identified w/ the Rockettes - and after seeing them once, it's enough.
Great Experience!. This is a spectacular venue right in the heart of NYC! We were lucky enough to attend the Secret Policemans Ball and see Coldplay! Magical!

December in New York City - Spectacular!. My husband and 3 year old daughter went to NYC for 5 days in December and had the BEST time! The city is all lit up and magical. We loved looking at all of the Christmas windows, Cold and All - we walked as much as we could.. it was so nice to be outside. We saw the 'real' Santa at Macys, the Christmas Tree @ Rockefeller Center, watched Ice Skating, Horse Carriage ride in Central Park (nice but you feel bad for the horses), FAO Schwarts, ToysRUs, American Girl store, Mary Poppins, great restaurants, great hot chocolate and coffee, Zabars Deli, we walked all over. Probably the most favorite was going to the Radio City Christmas Spectacular (Rockettes) which was fabulous! It was fun to get all dressed up and go. Our daughter didn't move and LOVED every minute of the show. We bought the DVD and she still loves watching it. Wish this could be an annual tradition!
ROCKFOLLIES XMAS SHOW. My Mum and I saw the Xmas show in 2010 and loved it. it reminded us of old pantomine shows we used to see in Scotland. Ideal for my Mum and a great night out.
The theatre to end all theatres. There is no other auditorium in the world that can hold a candle to this palace. Atr Deco enthusiasts will suffer an overdose in here.
yes. Great place to see the infamous chrsitmas spectacular, but try to go on the backstage tour. really neat!

Great Tour. Took a tour of the hall about 4 years ago and had a great time. The tour gives a good look at the history, architecture, and decor of the interior, and ends up with an opportunity to meet an actual rockette. For a piece of american history, this is a sure thing.
Radio City Backstage Tour. A small look at the huge and intricate music hall. Everything about it is superlative from the the art deco design to the mechanics of the (probably unique) stage.
a jewel. I visited for the Rockettes show once and right away I felt in love with it.
deco delux. i've been to a few concerts there and went 2 yrs ago to the christmas show. I forgot how gorgeous the interior is. Sumptuous ny - harkens back to the 40' and 30'. well worth the visit
Amazing place!!. The beauty of Radio City Music Hall is, you must see, specially if you come in Nov.-Dec. to see the Christmas shows. Anyway they also have very good concerts.
Zarkana. Saw Zarkana at RCMH. Great show and theater. I recommend both.

Memories. I've been going to Radio City since I was a little girl and I never get tired of it! The Christmans show with the Rockettes & Santa is the best! Costly, but if you're from out of town, it's a must at Xmas.
Love the Show. A NY landmark. The shows are awesome! Can be a little pricey at times but hey, it's midtown.
I go here every year. See anything here or just go on the tour. It is a grand hall with great acoustics.

Christmas Spactacular!!. OMG The Rockettes and the Christmas show were amazing! Brought the Grandkids, 5 & 8 and they loved it! Got pictures taken with Santa and a Rockette and thoroughly enjoyed the 3d show. When you're in NYC at Christmas time, this show is a must see!

Excellent show - be careful of your big camera. The Christmas show is excellent without any doubt. One little thing is their camera policy. If you tell them that you have the SLR, they won’t let you to take into the Hall. But if you have the smallish but still powerful camera or if you bury the SLR deep in your shopping bag, you can bring it into the hall. People use big camera to take photos everywhere inside during the show.

Christmas Spectacular for kids of all ages!. I don't know how they've kept this tradition alive and current for so many years. Enjoyable from beginning to end!While the tickets can be a little pricey, I don't think there is a bad seat in the house.

Good day with plusses. Saw the Christmas Show for the first time. Knew a Rockette and my family was graciously given a tour of the sets, scenery, and stage after the show. Got a couple "secrets" of how things are done because of the tight storage space and other idiosyncrasies of the setting. A nice part of a day visit to NYC.
Cozy. Compaired to Madison Square Garden Radio City is smaller vut it is still a big place. I been there to see shows and I always try to get center isle seats within the first 10 rows. WONDERFUL

Amazing place. It is a great place to see and hear all about the motorised stage eat actors who had been there but the elderly lady that took us round really did make a meal of it and it took ages to go round. She was very informative but i am afraid that my concentration was waning before the end.and gr
Must see the Christmas show once in your life. The Rockettes are a part of American History.. See them once and especially at christmas. Be prepared for lots of screaming kids!

Fantastic show!. I took my 7 and 10 year-old to the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular the week before Christmas on a Saturday morning at 9AM. I haven't seen the show in 20 years. It was fantastic! There were the old standbys of the soldiers, but the addition of the 3D segments and the live nativity at the end were amazing. It was a great way to get in the Christmas spirit!
Perfect stage.. I saw Zarkana over here and was magic. Cirque Du Soleil invented the show to talk about the crazyness of a empty theater based on Radio City.

rocking to the rockettes!. Beautiful building inside and out. we saw the Rockettes Christmas Show and was totally in awe at thewhole show. We were recommended to see it and was so glsad we did. Webought the tickets through the hotel who found us excelent seats near the front. The only thing we did find annoying were the people who were constantly taking photos and talking on their mobiles through out although this was not allowed.
Fantastic!. Fantastic place for everyone! This is one of the more unique places to see in NY. I'm so glad they saved it from destruction in the 70s

The real show is the theatre itself. The decor goes back to the Art Deco era and you will feel grand as you enter. The lobby makes you stop and takes your breath away as you imagine the grand movie palaces of the past. Extremely busy Christmas time, of course, but worth it. At other times, it's the scene of concerts, shows and award shows (the Grammys have been here). There are tours, of course. After, see Rockefeller Center, visit the NBC store, the Nintendo store, etc.

great concert venue. I went to see Antony and the Johnson's perform with a 63 piece orchestra. It was so beautiful. MOMA had put together the installation along with a laser show. Truly one of the best concerts. RCMH is huge. I had front row so could see great, I'm not sure view from back?
RCMH. The most perfect sounding venue. The interior decor is modeled after a 1920s luxury liner
Delightful!. Just wonderful, perfect for the start of the holiday season. We really enjoyed the dimensional scenes! You don't have to be a kid, just escape and enjoy the fantasy.

Great Theater. I have seen the Rockettes Christmas show two times here... both time were great. The staff is friendly, the sound is perfect, the stage is awesome...If you happen to see that an event you are interested in is happening here, go to see it!
A Landmark. For many decades, this art deco showplace has been a favorite.
The Rockettes. Over Christmas time the show there is mandatory. It's amazing to stop on Sixth Avenue and to stare all these lights and movements

Christmas Spectacular was.....SPECTACULAR!. The whole production was simply amazing. The performance was stellar and it made me feel like a 5-year old again! They really put you into the Christmas spirit. I love the 3D shows and the Rockettes were amazing. Radio City Music Hall was also huge, clean and organized. Good selection of food and drinks. Although the lines were long, it was very organized.
The Rockettes Christmas Show. It's only in winter and it was very entertaining for all ages.

Radio city Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. While on holiday in New York this December , we decided to take our 3 young adult children to see the Rockettes Christmas show. What a spectacular venue the Radio City Music Hall is...its huge with really comfortable seats, really friendly ushers who even offered to take a photo of my family and the show is an old fashioned extravaganza, filled with gorgeous girls who do some incredible dancng, wonderful costumes and amazing sets... a really worthwhile night out when you visit New York... thoroughly enjoyable!!!!
Christmas Spectacular. I had always wanted to see this show and it was wonderful. The scenery, dancers and music were all great. I'm so glad I finally got to go there.
A must see in NYC. Always enjoyed the Christmas Spectacular as a child and continue to do so every year as an adult. There's nothing like it!

One snowy nite. Well, we go to see the Rockettes @ Xmas. Unfortunately, I got a great deal of tix for 12/26/10, the date of the Snowstorm to End All Snowstorms. There's one thing about New Yorkers, in a pinch, they'll always help out. Folks were coming out of the theater, helping to push out the few cabs stuck in the snow. We had to walk 30 blks to catch the train in a blinding wind. I stumbled on a curb and a drunk guy picked me up (out of the snow). The show is a tradition. It's great to see the real animals in the Nativity Scene. I'm not much into the 3-D stuff, but I always marvel @ the atleticism of the Rockettes and their high kicks.
The Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. How can you not love the Rockettes? At Christmas, nothing could feel more New York than a show at Radio City Music Hall with the Rockettes.
Amazing sound. The special effects that can be done with the space is very cool.

Wow this place never disappoints...fantastic!!. I've been to Radio City several times over the past 20 years for different shows and have never been disappointed. I've seen the Christmas Spectacular a few times, but it had been many years since I had gone and decided to take my 14 yr old daughter who had never been. Radio City Music Hall is a beautifully decorated auditorium and lounge and just about everything in the building is luxurious, including the bathrooms!Wow, what an amazing show. The 90 minute show goes by so quickly because you are so entertained by the costumes, the music, the stage set changes, it's all so amazing and done right before your eyes. The actors, dancers,singers on stage are always very professional and do such an amazing job during their performances. The orchestra is also fantastic. It's always amazing to watch the Rockettes perform as well. Tickets are pricey for shows at Radio City Music Hall, but if you've never been it's worth the price to experience it at least once.

Xmas Day with the Rockettes, NY tradition for some Aussies. I hope its a New York tradition anyway :)
Loved the theatre with the decorations and the chandeliers, we sat in the dizzying heights of the top section front row but after our vertigo subsided it was an excellent view, we could see everything and the rockettes and santa were very good.
Rockettes Christmas show. Amazing Christmas show with the Rockettes. Really enjoyed ourselves!
Christmas Show. Wonderful family experience - kids still talk about it!
Spectacular Show. Wonderful performance. did not disappoint. We loved it. We pre-purchased our tickets from ticketmaster and would suggest that option as the Will Call desk gets a little backed up!

Spectacular entertainment, incredible costumes. My stepson's girlfriend is a Rockette so, never having thought to see this show, we went and saw her perform along with the other lovely incredible young ladies in their amazing sparkly costumes (the swarvoski-draped "bathing suits" cost $9K each she said). Despite sharing Radio City Music Hall with 6,000 others, we had seats good enough to see everything and understand what was going on. The scenes are very well done, the songs cheerful and appropriate and this is just plain good old fashioned family entertainment with some amazing dancing. I recommend springing for the more expensive tickets to get closer. Nice thing is you can take your drink into the auditorium with you (although they don't know how to mix a martini -- yes, in NYC! -- so I had a rum and coke instead). Don't miss this!

Grand New York Tradition. The building is beautiful with good acoustics. The shows are always good (depending on your taste) but the Christmas Spectacular is just that! The Rockettes are amazing! You can take a tour of the theater during which time you'll learn how everything works; not too expensive and worth it, if you're into that sort of thing. Check for times/prices.

Do the Backstage Tour. The entire theatre was gutted and rebuilt to its original grandeur some years ago. As great as the shows are that you see there, even more gratifying are the backstage tours of all the stages and the elevators that lift and drop them, plus views out into the most beautiful theatre. "Art Deco" describes the theatre's design, Its Art Deco at its very best.
rockettes christmas show not to be missed. Fab dancers, great show and the theatre is great inside. Friendly helpful staff
For Cirque du Soliel.... This is the most beautiful venue. The show was brilliant but I was really thrilled just to be in the venue itself.
Famous. World known for many things. Theater is HUGE and some seats are far from the stage.

Radio City Christmas Spectacular. We were only in NY for three days but wanted to see a show whilst we were there and so booked to see the Radio City Christmas Spectacular. Loved it. Walking into the theatre foyer is particularly striking partly because of the Christmas decorations but the theatre itself is beautiful. Our seats were front row on the Third Mezzanine which I thought wouldn't be that good but they were excellent.The dancers are amazing, choreography brilliant. Just a great show for a December evening.

amazing building, great Christmas show, backstage tour excellent. Used NY City pass to take backstage tour - very interesting with excellent guide and a chance to meet a Rockette- and on strength of tour queued two hours in Times Square for half price tickets to Christmas show. The show was a lovely reminder of the old time London Palladium shows with a long line of Tiller girls kicking in time . The auditorium is breathtaking and the lavish foyer amazing. Not to be missed if you like classy 30s bulding and decor.
nice shows. radio city music hall, name speaks for itself. it's just a theater really but it's so much more bc it's in nyc and it's radio city.
Rockettes rock!. All the seats are good seats and the Holiday performance was a great experience.

The Christmas Spectacular is a MUST. You must experience this. An amazing show with incredible effects, this show is NOT just for kids, my husband and I enjoyed it more than we can say. It was a definite highlight of our trip.

Rockettes Christmas Tour. FABULOUS! THE BEST CHRISTMAS SHOW I HAVE SEEN! this is what Christmas is all about! beautiful building aswell, stunning decorations and a wonderful performance, do go see it!

Always a classic ! Be it a concert or a show !. I've been to Radio city for countless events . I've seen the Xmas show many times as well as seeing Iron Maiden there in the 80's . RC has kept up with the times while still remaining a classic !
Great Christmas show experience. The show was great and lasted just the right amount of time for a 5 year old, with an intermission.
Christmas Spectacular. Excellent show, breathtaking performanceThese dancers are the best

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular very good!. Brilliant show well worth seeing once, but what is going on with people continuously (right up to the last numbers!) being allowed to come and go and wander the aisles finding their seats? So annoying! Beware that they don't let you take any drinks that happen to be in your bag, so you have to buy their $5 sodas instead!

Radio City Christmas Spectacular Starring the Rockettes. Excellent show! Highly recommend for all ages. It's a great show to get you into the holiday spirit. Arrive early to allow time to get in line and find your seats.

Rockettes Christmas spectacular. First, RCMH is wonderful! We went to see the Christmas show and I have to say, its a must for anyone going during the holidays! We had willcall tickets for the show, and the lines were so fast I could not believe it... I waited no more than 10 minutes.. they know how to get their guests in and out that is for sure! Just to see the inside of RCMH is an experience... .must see chandelier... makes you really wonder what the "old" days were really like. Drinks etc were somewhat pricey, but no more than any other place like this, but you got souvenier drink glasses, etc... so I didn't feel like I got pinched. Staff moved with grace and the lines at concession stands were just as quick as the will call line... I was impressed.
It put me in the Christmas spirit. Lovely theater - Watched Christmas Spectacular with the rockettes

Amazing Experience, Not To Be Missed. Having visited New York several times, and attending other shows, Christmas meant only one thing ! Radio City ! It was brilliant and brought the Christmas Fuzzy Feeling to this not-so-mature Child ,!! Bravo!
Rockettes Christmas Show, Rocked!. My 5 year old daughter seldom sits still, however, she was transfixed by the performance. We all loved it. $8 for a tub of popcorn was a rip off though.
A NYC icon!. Every other year, we come here for the Christmas Show. It is in the heart of Rockefeller Center. It is clean and always kept up-to-date, without taking anything away from its history.

Seeing it live is the best. I live in Grayson Georgia. I had two friends tell me not to waste my money and just to watch the show on TV. Thankfully two other friends told us to see it in person. The holiday show involved wearing 3D glasses and truly you couldn't get the effects on TV that you get in that domed building. I wouldn't miss if for the world and you shouldn't either.

Great show - Great place. We went to Christmas Spectecular show. Really worth while THE money, great 90 min show with combination of dance acts, 3D video and projections. Just a very Nice show to go too on a Christmas day !

One more for the bucket list. Large concert hall with perfect view from each and every seat (yes really) will delight everyone in your party. We visit during the Christmas Spectacular, which was without a doubt one of the highlights of our trip to New York for our 12 year daughter. She loved the grand foyer, and thoroughly enjoyed the production. We took the backstage tour (don't waste your money here, all you see is a lot of long hallways with closed doors, and a viewing area high above the auditorium. We expected to be able to see the workings and backstage area's as we had on tours of other venues, my daughter was disappointed). DO take the time to explore the grand theater on your own, it is gorgeous!

A Great Show and Getting Better. the opening 3-D video of Santa flying through the city is my favorite partand the world's widest digital screen really enhances the background with sharp videos ... no more backgrounds dropped from the ceilinglove NYC in the winter ... if you shop around the Internet, you can find great seats at half price
5pm seating. Great show sat in the front row. Highly recommend with child.
Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. A well-polished and very entertaining show for the entire family to enjoy. Very talented performers!! A must-see for the Christmas holidays.
Rockettes Christmas Show was Great. First time taking my five year old to NYC for the holidays so the Rockettes were a must-see for us. The show was great!

Spectacular Christmas Spectacular. After doing a backstage tour of Radio City a couple of years ago I have dreamt of going to their all-american, all-singing, all-dancing Christmas show and lucky me went this Christmas! The setting of the show is fabulous enough - beautifully restored art deco building in the middle of manhattan where every seat is a great seat (and there's 10,000 of them - it's the largest indoor theatre in the world I believe), the Rockettes - the most amazing dancers and the clever staging all added up to a once in a lifetime experience for me and my family. Even our cynical older teens enjoyed it. Needless to say it doesn't come cheap - we paid nearly $100 per seat but it was worth it.If your budget doesn't stretch to that, then the backstage tour is well worth it and you get to see the beautiful building without loads of people in it - it's absolutely stunning.
Spectacular. We saw the Rockettes and the show is a definite to see. The costumes and sets were amazing.
