Just OK. Ok, so it was easy on the eyes, very colorful costumes, some special effects, lots of sparkling on stage. While the Rockettes, in my opinion, mostly just performed very simple moves, those were done quite professionally and were pleasant to watch. There was no plot, just seemingly unrelated songs/dances with the only thing in common being Christmas theme. Some performances were quite boring, meant for kids only. For example, The Nutcracket scene with mice and teddy bears performing ballet in fat suits was quite strange, as you obviously cannot appreciate ballet without seeing the graceful moves, which in this case were buried under the fat suits. I think most kids liked the show, I would say it is a decent thing to check off your list when visiting New York with kids. As an adult New Yorker, this was my first time seeing the show, and I'm not planning to return any time soon.A note on the timing - be sure to come at least 45 min prior to the show, there is a line to get in, and although we had premium seat and did not have to wait in line, there was still a lot to do prior to the show (take pictures, etc).

wow. Big, brash, razamatazz and huge fun. We went to the Christmas Spectacular and were delighted to find that when Radio City says 'Spectacular' they are not playing fast and loose with the hyperbole. The lobby is glitz itself filled with sparkling starry chandelier, lots of mirrors and sweeping Art Deco gold staircases. The Rockettes were gorgeous - high-kicking their way through exacting routines all produced faultlessly with a fantastic live orchestra and chorus. Each new scene was more jaw dropping than the next. We were called upon to put on 3D glasses for a couple of numbers, a skating rink turned up in another, fire works were fired in another and the live nativity scene was complete with sheep, superbly dressed camels, donkeys and a pre-raphaelite angel suspended in the sky with 20ft wings that... yes... flapped! O. M. G.... as they say.

Beautiful. We came here to watch the Radio City Christmas Spectacular which was a fantastic show but the venue it self is absolutely beautiful Nd would recommend seeing - I would love to do the tour next time I'm in NYC!

Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes--Rockettes 5 stars but Plot 3 stars. This was my 2nd year in a row to go to this show. LOVED the Rockettes---they get 5 stars!! But the PLOT this year gets 3 stars. Last Christmas (2010) the plot was so moving with the young boy wondering if Santa Claus was still real. But this years plot (2011) was ridiculous in my opinion. It revolved around a young girl's mom desire to get what she thought was the perfect gift for her daughter...some dumb doll that was sold out everywhere. Anyhow I didn't like the segment regarding playing video games. I'm 39 yrs old with a 14, 12, & 9 year old. We thought those segments were poorly done. We hope they change the story line next year.
Christrmas Spectacular. This was an awesome show and well worth the expense.
It never gets old. Still putting on excellent shows with quality service while centrally located in Manhattan,

Rockette Christmas. Did the RadioCity Backstage tour and then had to check out the entire show. While we were there it was the Rockettes Christmas Follies. A truly wonderful show for young and old. To have live camels and elephants on the stage during the nativity scene truly was a great delight. Loved every minute of it.
Christmas show excellent. What an amazing show at Radio city music hall, you must go to see this show
Fun for Kids. Great treat for the kids. The addition of 3D segments was great.

City Music Hall. Great shows all the time, but do the tour, have your photo taken with a rockette and stand where the great stars - Frank Sinatra, Judy Garland etc stood to perform. Aan absolute must.
An Historical Gem. it's a theatre like no other in the world and should be seen.

Makes one feel like a kid again! Amazing Christmas Show!. This is a MUST when visiting New York in December. We try to get tickets in the middle section of the orchestra area. Sitting there makes one feel as though they are in the middle of it all. The theater is extraordinary! Arrive before the show and you can get your photo taken with Santa or one of the Rockettes. The ladies room is clean, spacious and glamorous, too!
Christmas spectacular with the Rockettes. Wow, what a show, just spectacular, don't miss it!

Spectacular Show for all ages. If you ever get the chance to visit NYC during the CHRISTMAS season and have small children this show is a must! And now they have a 3D special effect part that is out of this world1
Rockettes at Christmas-a must do!. Spectacular doesn't even begin to describe this show. If you are in NYC, you must do the Rockettes
FABULOUS!!. I had HIGH expectations and this show surpassed them all!! I would love to see it again just to take in some of the details that I missed the 1st time!! Loved it!!

Great Show!!. First time seeing the Christmas Show, in Boston. Loved it!! Very classy and beautiful. Appreciated the history of the show incorporated as well as the true Christmas story, something not told much anymore. Thank you!

Radio City Rockettes Christmas Spectacular!. Great show! Love it because I've never seen anything like it before. The rockettes were amazing!!! The "filler" while they changed acts, was boring but if you have small children, they may love it.
Rockettes Christmas. Enjoyed the Christmas spectacular show. Had to see Rockettes at least once. I recommend seeing the show and the hall.
Great Show!. Wonderful Christmas show! We all loved it, even the teenagers (but they are girls and dancers).

Rockettes were fabulous!. The Rockettes show was amazing! We didn't know what to expect but they were so talented and the sets totally worthy of NY theater. My daughter (11) and my husband even enjoyed it immensely! Don't miss the Christmas show with kids, it's great!
Excellent show.. My family went for the Christmas Spectacular. It really was spectacular . The show is appropriate for the entire family.

A Timeless Classic Show ~ Radio City Christmas Spectacular ~ Great for all ages!. A Very enjoyable Holiday/Christmas show for the entire family, from children to grandparents! This past Friday we attended the 1:00 pm matinee show at Radio City Music Hall, and we were all impressed at the special effects during the show (3-D) and of course the Rockettes! The entire show is enjoyable and full of music & talent that won't dissapoint anyone in the entire family. We arrived 45 minutes early as the show was sold out, however, even with the large crowds, There was plenty of staff to check our tickets and direct us to the proper door/isle to get us to our seats. The entire theater , including the rest rooms was clean and well maintained...It was a pleasure to be inside Radio City Music Hall again! This show as well as the Music Hall is a Timeless Classic and should not be missed by both native New Yorkers and Tourists, it is truly a part of a " New York Christmas" ! Overall Rating of the Music Hall & Christmas Spectacular Show ~ Very Good!
Great Theater.. The theater is wonderful, worthy of the New York hype.
A NYC ICON. By far, the best venue to see a concert, the Christmas Spectacular starring the Rockettes during Christmas, or just take a tour of this art-deco landmark.

3D Christmas Show Was Excellent. I'm not really into this kind of thing, but my wife wanted to go, and I had a really good time. The music and colors and dancing and leg-kicking really made for an enjoyable 90 minutes.Totally recommended if you have children, and there is not a bad seat in the house. Use your AAA card for a 30% discount on certain shows.

Radio City Christmas Rip Off. We had tickets for the Christmas show at 1PM Friday 12/23. We arrived at five minutes before one and they refused to let us into the theater - the show had already started - FIVE MINUTES EARLY. There were a dozen or so other ticket holders standing there with us and we were all refused entry. They would not even let us stand at the back of the theater and wait for an appropriate break to seat us, they simple made us wait outside and miss the begining of the show. There were four of us and the tickets were over $100.00 each!
Rockettes Rock. Fantasic, full on, Christmas Show. Rockettes perfection, living Nativity absolutely beautiful. Could do without the "video game" scene. Stick to the classics.
The Radio City Rockettes. Great show! The Christmas spectacular really is amazing. I still can't believe the camels that walked across the stage!
Fantastic show. We went to the Christmas show. It was 3-D in some spots of it. The dancing was great. We would go again.
Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. Gets better with every passing year. A must for the holidays
Christmas Show is a family show that will last a lifetime. I was skeptical but this show was beyond expectations.My entire family will remember this for a lifetime. Love the 3D
Christmas Spectacular. It was indeed a spectacular show - with the Rockettes plus 3-D -- lots of fun! Enjoyed it immensely!

Go early when the doors first open and enjoy the lobby's. The Christmas spectacular was as billed and 14 acts of pure extravagance. My 51 year old boyfriend had the most fun with the 3-D glasses and the flying santa sleigh!Go early to enjoy the beautfiully kept lobby and downstairs grand lounge. The ladies and mens lounges feature original murals keeping with the art deco history.I'll admit, I made my friend purchase for me the little spinning toy soldier rocket toy. No matter what your age, you'll find your inner child at a Radio City Music Hall.

Spectacular at Christmas. We had great seats in the first row of the third mezzanine allowing us to look down at this over-the-top spectacular show. There were even a couple of 3D numbers that worked surprisingly well. The show held our four year old daughters attention throughout -- that's ninety minutes with no intermission and a travel weary four year old who had been on the move for ten hours up to the show. It was all you would expect. Santa, glitz, singing, dancing, and even some impressive ice skating. The classics (kicking, toy soldier number, Santa) were great to finally see in person. I'm not much for musical theater or dance routines, but I was thoroughly entertained for the entire show. There are some reasonably priced souvenirs in the lobby as well as some more expensive ones. A quick tip -- if you need the facilities or a quick snack, the third mezzanine area is much less crowded than downstairs. There are several elevators to zip you up there as well.

Consistently good experience. A classic.. Even my children loved the show. They have done a great job weaving digital content, 3D film, sets and performers into a true spectacular. I also love that they haven't moved away from traditional Christmas content to more politically sanitized.

Rockettes Xmas 2011. What an extravaganza. Loved the Rockettes, not so much the hokey-story used as filler as the Rockettes changed into their next costume. The ending with the live-nativity was unexpected (I didn't read any reviews prior)- camels, sheep, donkeys- nice touch. I'd probably go again in 5 years for Xmas show- at 90 minutes, not for kids under 5.
Rockettes Rock. My 85-year-old parents and we really enjoyed the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall. It was extravagant and lovely and memorable.
Christmas spectacular is spectacular. Really amazing show this year, tickets are pricey if you want a good view, but worth it to get up near the front and see everything.
Best show yet in 2011. I thoroughly enjoyed this year's show. They changed it to be a whole new show and modernized it as well. LOVED IT!!
Christmas Spectacular!. WOW! I have seen many Christmas shows at Radio City but this I have to say was the most spectacular as another element was added. 3-D!

Rockettes at Christmas Fantastic. Don't miss the Christmas show, fantastic. Go early, lots to see in the lobby and seating at the very end gets crazy. Lines outside get very long due to the searching purses etc.

The Rockettes Christmas Show. What's NOT to like! The 14 scene 90 minute show was fabulous. Make sure you buy your tickets in advance for this show, buying them at the theatre is almost impossible due to the crowds.

excellent time, everyone is still raving about it.. the Rocketts are always a great time. I actually took my parents and other family members, not teenagers, but that isn't an option for reviews? Anyway, we all had a blast. What a great performance. The Rocketts are always great, but this is really special and I think it's something we'll all remember forever. I was really impressed with the projectors around the theater, but I didn't care for the 3d tv as much. To me, this show is about the talent of the performers and the musicians. It isn't about special effects and huge tv's. Overall though, this was THE most popular thing we did on our trip. Great job guys. Radio City Music Hall is such a gem in NYC, and its awesome to think how many people have enjoyed the great performances in this beautiful and legendary venue.

THE CHRISTMAS SHOW ROCKETTES. This show was grand and parts of the show could be viewed in 3D !!!!! (glasses provided for free). Definitely a must see/amazing if you are in New York ! The drink and souvenir vendors are very pleasant, too !

More than met my expectations!. Thought it would be just girls out there dancing, but it told a story, was creative, they used not only the stage, but the walls and ceiling, and had a huge LCD screen in the back of the stage for their 3d portion of the show. Excellent for all ages. The hall itself was decorated beautifully with a gorgeous crystal chandalier as the centerpiece.
The Christmas Spectacular is appropriately named!. What excellent performances by the Rockettes, musicians and, of course, Santa Claus. The live nativity portion of the show was very moving.

Rockettes: The epic failure.... First of all, I saw the rockettes for the first time 3 years ago and they were amazing. That being said- my boyfriend and I traveled to NYC to see this years Christmas spectacular. 1.5 hours later we realized our 150 dollars for tickets was a complete WASTE. The rockettes used to be an enjoyable experience for all but now it has turned into a complete childrens performance. This years newest part of the show included the rockettes fighting off ginger bread men while a mother and daughter play a video game. Certain parts of the show were also in 3-D. If I wanted to go see a 3-D movie I would have gone to an IMAX. The show has turned its attention away from the rockettes- the reason we all come to watch.
The Rockettes: defenetively you must watch the Show. I liked everything. The show was great. Maybe too expensive.
Loved The Rockettes Christmas Spectacular!. A GREAT way to get into the spirit of Christmas! Wonderful show but a little crazy once the show is over and everyone is clamoring for the doors

The place is a gem!. What a beautiful location, and the sound quality is so good! The Christmas Spectacular is good, with so very lively and fun portions, and some silly/dumb portions, but overall very well done. Those Rockettes never disappoint!

Christmas show. The show was great. Saw it with my 8-year old niece (for the 2nd time, 1st was when she was 6 and she asked me to take her back). She loved the whole thing from beginning to end. She was mesmerized by the Rockettes and loved the birth of Jesus act at the close. In my opinion, the only bad part of the show was the 'video game' scene which was an attempt to connect with todays kids which is not necessary as Santa and the 3-D do that well enough. As an adult, I really was impressed with the use of technology in the show and the coordination between the Rockettes. The venue is really spectacular. Seats are comfortable, sat in the orchestra about 2/3rds the way back and it was unobstructed by anyone or anything in front of us. I scoff at the price of the tickets (more about the $16.75 'fees' which is just Ticketmaster's way of making more money ontop of the already $100 ticket) and the $18.50 for 2 pretzels and 2 20-oz cokes, but otherwise, it was a great show.

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular - Some Parts Spectacular, Some Not. Traveled to NYC yesterday with my 18 yo daughter to see the holiday sights including the famed Rockettes. The show began well, but could have been jazzed up in a few parts.Sleigh Ride - Rockettes in reindeer costumes performed in perfect precision - kind of cool how they took the reins of Santa's sleigh.Santa Flies to New York - Nice seeing animated sights of New York, but Universal studios does a much better 3-D.The Twelve Days of Christmas - great tap number again with perfect precision and interesting groupings. The dancers demonstrated their incredible stamina.The Nutcracker - probably perfect for the younger set, but a little boring for fans of the ballet.The Parade of the Wooden Soldiers - quite fascinating, especially when they topple.New York at Christmas - OK, but not thrilling.Department Store, Here Comes Santa Claus, Closer Than You Know, Santa's Video Game, Closer Than I Knew - story meant to tug at the heart strings and emphasize the true meaning of Christmas - quite predictable and boring. Could have been executed differently, replaced with something else or cut.Let Christmas Shine - Classic Rockettes - Great!The Living Nativity - Colorful and quite spectacular!Joy to the World - OK, not an amazing finale.Usually this type of show would bring a tear or two to the eye, but not this time. Maybe I'm just jaded from seeing so many great performances in NY in the past, but I didn't have the experience I had hoped to have. Additionally, the number of restroom facilities available was completely inadequate - the lines were horribly long. Leaving the venue was a total nightmare - complete chaos and congestion.Families with small children may enjoy this show tremendously, but there are many, many more interesting ways to spend your afternoon in NYC.
A wonderful Christmas show!. Thank you to Radio City Music Hall for the birth of Jesus in your Christmas Spectacular!! We enjoyed the entire show...the Rockettes are truly spectacular.
Great Night. Went to Christmas spectacular and had a great time. Rockets were fabulous

Great Family Christmas Show. Wonderful music and great entertainers. This is a Christmas show that should not be missed. Everyone should go at least once in their lives. It's an experience! Excellent family entertainment.

worth the money. Went for the first time and really enjoyed the show. Is 90 mins long within stopping. I was totally amazed at how gorgeous the backdrops are. They had this one backdrop that revealed the inside of a house with a huge tree tucked beside a window-I'm telling you, that thing looked so real-with the tree being lit, and the windows sparkling from the reflection of lights. It was so gorgeous. They have fantastic scences. If you have never gone to Sight and Sound in Lancaster, it's worth a trip. I would rate Sight and Sound a 10 and this show a 9.5. Only because Sight and Sound has so many live animals and backdrops that are so real as well. Any show at Sight and Sound is awesome. And of course, this show is what I have to compare it to. If you are looking for a place to eat near RCMH, I would highly recommend Stardust, on Broadway. It's nothing fancy, it's a diner, but the experience is so much fun. The waiter and waitress's get on the table and sing.........and they have so much talent. Some have gone on to bigger and better things. You have to have a voice to work there, because they were all top notch. I got a turkey club, that didn't come with mayo. Fries were really good. Was a fun and upbeat experience. It was very crowded and tight at 11:30 am. Is worth the entertainment within a 50's diner.We were on a bus trip, so we didn't have tons of time to eat. But if you want NICE, go to the View Restaurant that is on Broadway, within the Mariott Hotel-I think. It's a revolving restaurant, that is very upscale. Very expensive, but worth putting it on your list of things you did.
Rockettes Christmas 2011. The venue amazing! The dancers even more amazing!! Snack bar with yummy choices. Don't let the long line to the ladies room ruin your visit.

A truly "spectacular" time. This must be my 6th time seeing the Radio City Hall Christmas Spectacular. I have taken nieces, daughters and grandchildren and friends. As far as I am concerned this is the only place to see this show because the staging is incredible.Highlights are the opening number where Santa takes you on a jorney through New York in 3D and of course the toy solders. The nativity at the end is beautiful. From the beginning to the finish it is filled with color, live music, action, and surprises. A must see during the holiday season.

Spectacular Indeed!. I had no expectations before going to see Radio City Music Hall's Christmas Spectacular. It was my girlfriend's idea, and I had never been in Radio City Music Hall and thought it might be kind of cool to see the Rockettes. Turns out, I was blown away. Everything was over the top. I've never seen such a thing live. What I liked was the throwback to stage shows of 80 years ago and combining that with newer concepts such as the 3D presentations. Unless you are exceptionally jaded, I think you will like this show. Hint: Don't pay for the $125 tickets that are up front, get the $75 tickets that are right up against the more expensive seats. Not only does it save you money, but being slightly further back lets you take in the full view of the stage and its surroundings.

Rockettes. A wonderful show I recommend it to everyone! The new 3-D experience was great. The crowd afterward was terrible no one knew where to go, it was mass confusion. I felt sorry for parents with small children.

Radio City Has Gone Hi Tech. Recently my husband and I spent the day in NYC. We went to see the show at Radio City Msic Hall. It has been at least 10 years since I had been there. It was very entertaining as always. I was impressed with the high tech addition of 3 D to two scenes. The whole show had many new scenes and a few of the old time favorites- a little ice skating on the stage the Nutcracker, and of course the living Nativity.It was most enjoyable. The many children in the audience were very well behaved and couldn't take their eyes off the stage. I would not recommend this for children younger than 4. Get online with your tickets at least a half hour before your show's performance.
The Christmas show. The show was great for children of all ages, including me at 77 years old.
Christmas Spectacular. Great show for the family! Very entertaining. No seat is really bad - we were on the first mezzanine which I think was actually nice to have more of an "aerial view."

Must see Rockette's Christmas Spectacular. We saw the Radio City Rockette's Christmas Spectacular show it is a MUST see. The Rockette's were truly spectacular, this is a show for all ages taking you on a christmas story. There were 3D effects which were great and all the dancers were amazing.

Radio City Rockettes Christmas Show. The show was awesome. The costumes, theme, 3D effects, music was superb. The theater is beautiful. My only complaint is with the ushers. They allowed late arrivals to block the aisles while trying to find their seat. This went on for about 15 minutes into the show. At one point one of the ushers got into a verbal argument over a seat. I was shocked at the number of late arrivals that disrupted the first part of the beautiful show. The show is about 90 minutes in duration so 15 minutes of disruption was substantial. There really needs to be a policy concerning people that arrive late or a procedure to get them to their seats with little disruption to the show.

Same old Christmas Show/Expensive everything!. The show hasn't changed much since last year, but the prices are outrageous! The pictures with Santa are way overpriced as are all of the souvenirs to buy. Puts a damper on the overall experience.
Loved the Rockettes. Few 'must-see' things live up to the hype, but the Rockettes at Radio City Music Hall were definitely worth seeing.

Saw the Christmas Spectacular. Worth seeing, very historic. The theater is beautiful, though I could have really done without the 3D portion of the show. That was a bit much after my pints at 3 Monkeys bar.
Radio City Music Hall. Awesome show! Went to 10:00PM show which was not sold out. As always, this show puts you in the Christmas spirit! It was something to check off my bucket-list.

The Rockettes Christmas show was good. I went to Radio City Hall to watch the Rockette's Christmas Spectacular and I must say that it was a good show. That being said, it's one of those type of shows where you would go to only once because there truly isn't anything breathtaking. You can only take a few minutes of the famous kicks until it gets pretty old. There also seems to be too much talking throughout the show, which is very uninteresting. However, if you are in the Christmas spirit and want to watch a nice, well choreographed production, then be sure to check out the Rockettes.
cool venue. went to see the rockettes christmas show... a historic venue, neat interior... would recommend to others

Christmas Spectacular a bit of a spectacle.. Maybe I've seen it one too many times (three in my lifetime), but I'm done; that was the last time. I'd say it's worth seeing once...the theater, the Rockettes, the snippet of 3d movie, and the living Nativity especially...but the blatant merchandising and souvenir hawking takes away from the experience. Wherever you look in the theater, people have glow-in-the-dark containers filled with popcorn or sugar or cocktails. Besides, how many times can you say "wow! They're all dancing in unison!"? I guess you just have to be in the mood, but, to me, it felt more like a ride at Disney than a show in NYC.P.S. If you decide to see it, don't pay extra to be up close...you get the full effect much better from further away.

Great Holiday Show for All Ages!. I recently attended the Rockettes Christmas Show at Radio City Music Hall. What a wonderful show for all ages! The show had a great mixture of entertainment from Santa Claus with some help from our 3D glasses to the spectacular dancing of the Rockettes. The show moves along quickly and the length of the show which is just about 90 mintues was fine. I ordered the tickets online and even though the seats were up in the second mezzaine they were still very good and everything was easy to see and to hear. The costumes are beautiful. Arrive early because it was very crowded and we had a very rainy night which made it difficult to navigate through the people and umbrellas. A great holiday evening for sure!

Christmas Spectacular. Seeing the Rockettes always brings back childhood memories. The Christmas Spectacular is quite good, and now includes two segments in which the audience dons 3D glasses and flies with Santa through the air. The show ends with an inspirational nativity scene. Very good and very popular!
Rockettes still kicking high. Perfectly outstanding Christmas show. Great music, dance, pageantry -- and they did not forget Jesus! I'd like to see the show again tomorrow.

Great Program, but sound quality was suboptimal toward the back of the orchestra.. This is an all-new version of the Rockette's Christmas extravaganza. They, as usual, are outstanding. There are neat 3-D visuals (with glasses) for parts of the program. We had seats in several back rows of the orchestra and were disappointed that the sould quality was quite flawed there. The pre-program organ music was barely audible, and the musical quality did not come through. We also couldn't catch some of the lyrics and other words in the progam itself. Otherwise, what a fine Christmas experience!!

THIS SHOW IS GREAT FOR ALL AGES!. This show is such a timeless attraction for people of all ages. It truly appeals to the kid in all of us. I believe this year or last, they finally incorporated new 3D technology into the show and that was great. The venue is large and comfortable. We sat in the first mezz in the front row. Incredible view. My girlfriend and I will definitely be back and hopefully someday we'll be able to share the experience with our kids!

Bucket List...check!. The 3D Radio City Music Hall Spectacular is not to be missed. Because the theatre is intimate, we sat in the center mezzanine and could not have been more pleased. Don't forget to appreciate the art deco theatre.
Rockette's Christmas Show. Even though the they have a travelling show, I am so glad that I waited to see it in NY. It was wonderful! I wish I could go every year to see it!

Christmas Spectacular is Amazing!. My husband and I went with friends to see the Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes this week. The show is truly one of the best I have ever seen. They spared no cost to make this an amazing experience for the audience. The costuming, set design and the use of technology to enhance the program were top notch. There was even 3 D glasses provided for special segments. "The Rockettes Magical Journey" is incredible for both young and old alike. Prior to the show, there were opportunities to have photos taken with Santa in his sleigh and with a Rockette. The picture packages were priced very reasonably and they were really very nice. I would recommend this show to all who love Christmas. I would also recommend paying a little higher price and getting seats closer to the stage. It is well worth it.We plan to make it a yearly family tradition.
Wonderfull experience. Great way to start the holiday season. Fun and family friendly. We were in the second balcony and seats were ok.

Rockettes!. What a great show. The Rockettes are incredible. The show didn't run as long as I thought it would, but it was well worth the price. Great seats everywhere. If you're in the Mezzanine or Balcony, take a set of small binoculars. Not totally necessary, but I wish we had taken ours.

Best show we have ever seen. We did the backstage tour last time we were in NY and they were doing the rehearsals. Weve always wanted to go to the christmas show and it was really, really good. It was like a cross between a panto, Shrek and an old fashioned music hall show ( I loved the HUMBUGS!!!!!!!!!!!!! ) If you're in NY at christmas and you want to do a show do this, it really goes upto 11
Once again, the best show we have seen. Would go every year!. If you are in NYC during this holiday season, this show is a MUST see.

Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall. We saw the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall on Dec 2nd 2011. We got there a little earlier to pic up our tickets to find a very long queue of people doing the same! However next to this was another line, where if you were going to see the show that was due to start you could walk right in. For $20 you get a programme and a CD of the music featured in the show all in a little bag, which I loved as I like to get a programme from each show I go to see.The show was very entertaining and the Rockettes were fabulous. The 90 minutes went very quick.The only thing that disappointed me was that people were still casually finding their seats once the show had started so sometimes all you could see were their heads and not the stage, in addition to this people seemed to talk through the show quite a lot, I thought the point of seeing a show was to watch not talk! Infact someone was talking so much by us that they got told off by another patron.I'm really glad I saw this as it was an amazing experience and something I would recommend to anyone visiting NY over the Christmas season.

I want to be a Radio City Rockette!. What a show! The Radio City Christmas Spectacular is amazing. We took seats on the mezzanine level which was good as it gave us a good overview of the entire show. We were impressed with the overall show, but it was the precision of the dancers that was amazing. Also nice to see the message of Christmas incorporated into the show. Thoroughly recommend it as a Christmas must see.

The Rockettes rocked!. The Rockettes show is a must! Spectacular! Well done! My 8 and 5 y.o. loved it and so did the parents! Great mix of the traditional with the modern. The kids will talk about this one for a long time. Great memories made...
Radio City Christmas Spectacular. Absolutely the best holiday show for all ages. Wonderful story, great performances, classic Rockettes, and all new AMAZING 3D effects! Don't miss it.
Christmas Spectacular. The Christmas Spectacular was better than we thought it would be!

See the Rockettes for Christmas. If in NY around Christmas be sure to see this show. It's amazing and visually stunning. The venue itself is gorgeous and you could spend an hour just looking at the decorations. The dancers make it all look effortless. I can't believe they can keep up that pace for 90 minutes. Everyone should see it once in their lives. Put this on your bucket list.

Saw the show on December 2, 2011, have seen it many times before, truly I will say that I missed the "original" version.. Radio City is a fabulous place. I've seen the show several times. I took a friend for the first time and really hyped up the show... needless to say I was rather dissapointed this time. The Rockettes were wonderful, but it didn't seem like they did as many acts as in the past... The BEST act: the bus - it was awesome, the soldiers (of course!), the ice skaters, Clara, and yes of course, Santa!... Where I was dissapointed was the new 3D video game act... it was very LONG, LOUD (and I wasn't up front), and it didn't seem to fit the "Spectacular" "Christmas" show that I have seen in the past. I understood the meaning but it didn't impress me or those around me. The other changes were the reindeer act - it seemed like they shorten the act. I remember it being SO awesome and how incredible it was to see the Rockettes do so many neat things with the reindeer costume. Also, the Santa Claus scene... I seem to remember that being different too, either the reindeer or the Santa act had a 3 level part to the act and it was truly awesome to watch.. The nativity scene was different too. When it was over, my friends said "is this it"?? :( I felt like I dissapointed them as I had hyped it up so much. Would I go again?? problably, but I wouldn't rush to buy the most expensive tickets like I did this time. My suggestion (if interested), would be to bring back the "original" Rockette Christmas Spectacular show.. The previous show was SO traditional - why does everyone feel they need to make a "change"? In no way do I mean to be harsh, I just want to share my opinion and hope it is heard... Radio City Christmas Spectacular had a special place in my heart because it was truly a "Christmas" spectacular.......
A classic. This time I took the opportunity of 50% discounted tickets (THANK YOU TKTS...) and attended the Christmas Spectacular. Very good production and certainly a classic.

Awesome. We sat in the upper mezzanine so the actual people on stage were a little small. However with the full effect of the show I dont know that I would want to be downstairs. The rockettes are fabulous and certainly worth going for alone however the 3D and the video backdrop that takes over the sides of the theater and the ceiling are what puts it over the edge. Sitting at orchestra level you may not be able to see it all if you have to look up but sitting in the mezzanine and watching it all together was breathtaking.
Christmas Spectacular Show. Best show I have ever seen! This is a must for all ages!

The Rockettes. When we got there the line to get in was unbelievable. What was more unbelievable was how fast the line went when they opened the doors. They were very organized and entry/exit was quick and orderly. The show was about a 4 out 5. The Rockettes were awesome but I didn't expect the skits in between. The two 3D movies were fun.

Rockettes Christmas Spetacular!. This was the first time we saw the Rockettes perform at Radio City Music Hall. The show was incredible! It was professional, entertaining, and exceeded all of our expectations! It kept us very entertained, and the 90 minute show went by much too quickly! It was a pleasure to be able to see the Rockettes in NYC. We loved the show, & enjoyed the decorations, and magic of Christmas in NYC!

Spectacular!. The Christmas Show at Radio City is a must see! it is a little different this year with technicolor and wonderful 3D surprise. I have been going since i am a little girl with my mom in the days where a movie preceded the show, remember those days?!! Well, aside from the traditions mini performance (Christmas story) the Wooeden Soldiers Rockettes theme sings back in my mind and makes me smile, Santa is the REAL GUY! He's been in the show for 20 plus years taking a break from Christmas preparation and you even get the see the North Pole for the little ones who never have and us young at heart who love to be young at heart. MY FAVORITE scene is the Nativity. In all of Broadway, there is no comparison, in my opinion to the MAGNIFICENT Nativity scene. I went with my girlfriend after many years of taking my 3 daughters with my mom (now young adults and mom in heaven). I hope to take my grandchildren in years to come! I stopped to see Santa and thank him for my many gifts (non material) and told him ......I BELIEVE! your freind, maryellen (51 years young) tip....use the ladies room on the 2nd or 3rd floor even though they direct you downstairs. the wait is much shorter and you wont miss the beginning of the show because you are on line.
christmas show. christmas show - rockettes were wonderful - loved the 3D santa tour of NY

Radio City Christmas Spectacular - Enjoyable for the whole family!. I took my kids (7&8) to see the Radio City Christmas Spectaclar 2 weeks ago. The show was very good & enjoyable for all of us. I highly reccomend it for families. The incorporates a bunch of different themes so it really has something for everyone!! It helped my family get into the Christmas spirit....and it reminded us ahead of time what the MEANING of Christmas really is!!

What great additions. We really enjoyed the Rockettes & their new additions to the show are amazing not to mention modern but the great stories of the season are still there. Don't forget to get your picture with Santa, the picture may be a bit expensive but Santa is the best even for 4 over 40 kids! A must see during the holidays!
Great Show. The Christmas Spectacular is a proverbial "must see" for everyone visiting NYC during the holiday season.

Great venue for a show!! A+. I saw Cirque du Soleil here in June on my first trip ever to NYC, and have to say wow! This was right up there w/ the Yankees game at the highlight of my trip. We had great seats in the lower level & Radio City couldn't have been better! I have seen Cirque in Vegas & this was just as good, if not better! A++

Great Christmas Show For All Ages!. A friend of mine invited me to attend the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular as a guest on her company bus tour. I was allowed to invite my family that included my grandmother, mother, husband and 19-month old son. Upon arrival we took the short walk to Rockefeller Center and watched people iceskate under the ginormous Christmas Tree. Afterward we visited the Lego Store and FAO Schwartz. Once we finished shopping we stood in line and Security was extremely nice. Our seats were way up high in the balcony but it was still a great view. My son sat through most of it and fell asleep during the rest of it. The Rockettes were FANTASTIC with their precision dancing and gorgeous outfits. The Icing: The storyline. I loved the story of the show - I won't give it away. They also had a couple of very fun 3D segments. I would love to make this a family tradition.Tips: Eat before you go. A family of 5 will spend close to $65 just for hot dogs.

Rockets Christmas Spectacular. It really was spectacular! Anyone going to New York during the holidays really should take in the show. My husband indulged me by going and left enjoying more than I did.

Fantastic Christmas Show. This was the highlight of our trip. From the time you enter the lobby you just feel something special in the air. The crystal tree was gorgeous. The show was fabulous and the rockettes never disappoint. The 3D was first class and the whole show was well worth the ticket price.

Christmas Spectacular is Just That Spectacular. This show is an outstanding showcase for the talents of the Rockettes. The theme puts you in the holiday mood and the nativity scene is like no other with the live animals. Had front row seats which were good but with their 3D portion of the show further back would have been better. Also, don't forget to get a picture taken with a Rockette on the mezzinine level. A bit pricey but worth it.
The Christmas Specatular is nothing less than Spectaular!. WOW. Words cannot express what a joy this show was to watch. Absolutely wonderful for the entire family.

Xmas Show - very good option for the holidays. It was a great show, will definately go back n the future. Went to the 10 am show day on Nov 26. Seats in the orchestra area, amazing view, definately worth it. But beware, since there is not much incline if you get a tall person in front your view may suffer. Strongly recommend getting there one hour before show starts, if going in the morning plan ahead so that you are not caugth in long lines getting breakfast or snacks for the kids. We parked in the Parkfast location on 44st and was very convenient, $17 plus tax for 12 hours. If going with kids and need to use the bathrooms, beware of huge lines in 1st level just before show starts, go to upper levels and there is less people. Also if coming from out of town, recommend researching options to eat, everything was packed and with long lines in the area close to Rockefeller Plaza, so we ended up walking around for quite some time just to find a place that was family friendly.

Rockettes Christmas Show. What a fun experience!!To say you were watching that show live was a very cool experience. Radio City is a HUGE venue!! The Christmas show was really cool overall, the Rockettes were the stars of the show. There were some other pieces in the story telling that got a little boring. The 3-D effects were pretty cool too.I highly recommend doing this at least once in your lifetime!! So glad I did

The Christmas Spirit is alive and well in Radio City Music Hall!. The Rockettes brought Christmas alive! The production had just the right amount of all of the Christmas memories brought to life! The added 3D was fun and brought oooohhhss and aaaahhhsss from the whole theatre! My personal favorite was the march of the toy soldiers! A must see experience for all ages!

Technical difficulties - what is the chance of that happening?. Was going to comment about the production to the kids when the show had to be stopped for around 10 minutes. No refunds, credits or apologies. In fact looks like they just skipped the 10 minutes and carried on. Disappointed.

Rockettes are Great. The Radio City Music Hall/ Rockettes Christmas Spectacular is a show for all ages. This is the 2nd year we have visited and my son (4) and daughter (6) as well as us adults have marveled at this show. The show is fabulous and runs through the Holiday Season. The interior of the Hall is very ornate and beautiful. Must visit to make a trip to NYC complete during the holidays. Certain to impress even the most grinchiest

Rockettes 2012 Show. We saw this in Boston last year...meh. But this show was incredible. The effects, new costumes and the whole Radio City Music Hall vibe is not to be missed. The show is about 1 hour, 20 minutes long without an intermission. It went by so fast. Pay up and get the best seats you can afford -- worth it!
Rockettes Rock. This show was the best Rockettes performance I have seen at Radio City. The Christmas Spectacular with 3d was non stop - the "tour bus" sequence being the highlight.

LOVED!. We loved this show! Had great seats in the balcony and could see everything. The Rockettes are just amazing. Parts of the show seemed slow or unnecessary (we just wanted to see more dancing). My husband, myself and girls absolutely loved it!!

Christmas Spectacular : not to be missed. Brilliant - simply brilliant. Try and get tickets at the tkt booth in Times Sq as they are expensive (I didn't - I bought bore travelled but still worth it)
Beautiful building and amazing show - try it out!
half time show at football game with 3d movie clips. If you want cheerleaders without the football game plus some 3d movie clips at astronomical prices then you should go see this show.

BRILLIANT!!!!!. Yes this was such a highlight......we bought tickets on the day by queuing in the morning for 20 mins and had we known what it was to be like we would have gone for the mid priced tickets instead of the cheapest which were $45 each (that felt quite a bit at the time)....however we still had brilliant seats and could see everything just fine but at a slightly more distance away (but don't let this put you off if you feel this is the max you can pay - DO GO)..this is a family Christmas Spectacular part of which is in 3D and the girls dancing and signing are so perfect and exact in all their moves.....it is a truly magical fun musical dance show. The building too is 'awesome' if dance and music and a really good fee-good time is what you're after then this is one for you without doubt. :)

Amazing. We turned up at 10.50 and queued for last minute tickets. Got 10 rows from the front left side and only paid a fraction of the advertised price. Great show, amazing special effects, beautiful theatre, great atmosphere, really gets you in the Christmas spirit. We could not believe the live animals, camels, sheep and cute donkey. My girls aged 10 & 6 loved it, be aware show goes straight through 1.5 hours no interval. Look round the theatre foyer as stunning ceilings, lights etc even the restrooms are showbiz. Great for all ages.
Rockettes. We went and saw the Rockettes and thought it was great! My only complaint is that it was a bit crowded/confusing to figure out what floor we needed to be on for our seats.

Radio City Christmas Show Was GREAT. There were 5 of us...three grandparents, a 7 and 8 year old. I, Grandma, went as a child then took my kids some 30 years ago, and now brought my granddaughter. We all loved the show. It was current with 3d, loved the Rockettes, and especially loved the Santa message. The best gift you can give is spending time with love ones, not getting crazed about buying the favorite gift. I was so happy to hear 2 words, Merry Christmas. I am sick to death of hearing Happy Holidays. For those that don't celebrate Christmas, that's fine but that doesn't mean the rest of us can't celebrate the birth of Christ!!!! The children also loved the show....

Rockett's Christmas Show. We had not seen the Rockett's Christmas Spectacular in over 10 years. We saw the very first performance on Friday, November 11, 2011 at 11:00 AM. The theater was completely full and the show was truly "Spectacular" as advertised. If you are planning to be in NYC during the Christmas season be sure to book your tickets to see this show.

Rockette's Christmas Spectacular. This show is soooo amazing and awesome. Very beautiful staging. Great family Christmas show. The 3D was great. This was our second trip to see this show. This is a show you would never get tired of. So many great routines. Sets you up for the Christmas season.

Got Last minute Tickets to the Christmas Show. We took a four day trip to NYC over the Thanksgiving Day holiday. We had advanced tickets to the Lio Kind, went to the Macy's Parade balloon inflation and paraded and had a nice dinner at the Crofton Reservoir Tavern. But, we didn't have plans for Thanksgiving evening.While on the train and during our stay I tried Googling for tickets to the Radio City Christmas show but came up empty. Even Tickettron had nothing. However, while walking past Radio City enroute to our dinner I asked a security guard if there was any possibility of getting tickets for the 8:30 show. He said "sure, just go the the box office." Sure enough, we got to great orchestra seats for a wonderful show.So, always check at the box office, you never know what you can get. AND, if you have children, take them to this show and the Lion King.
Radio city Christmas show. Wonderful, first time to Radio CitY Music Hall, spectacular.

Stay Home. I have seen this show maybe 20 times over the years and I have adored it, I attended the 11/22/11 2:00 pm performance and was so disappointed. First off the product placement of NY Life and Chase Logos throughout the two video portions of the show was so annoying and cheesey. I am surprised they did not display the chase logo over the nativity scene. They incorporated a new video 3d segment in the show replacing the north pole scene. It was awful and threw off the pace of the show.,that when the next number came on which in the past was wonderful, the joy was gone. Even the natvity scene lost it's charm this year. Don't waste your money. The christmas show was always about the pace. It would build up to the nativity. It would lead you up to a high, a place of bliss, sadly that is no longer the case.

Sad to see it decline. I've been to the Radio City Christmas Spectacular since I was a child, so about 15 years=15 shows. Every year it puts me in the Christmas spirit when I leave the show. The last few years there have been some changes for the worse, but this year was horrible! The show now has a video game storyline, a snow monster, humbug cartoon characters, and spinning video lights. I don't know how long the video game storyline was, but I quickly lost interest in the show. I saw a little girl in front of me upset because she was scared of the snow monster. This show should not be scary. Sometimes things stay the same for a reason....people loved the old Christmas show. I heard over and over on my way out of the music hall how people didn't like the new show. If this show continues to decline it will sadly be my last year going. I don't need fireworks, and 3 D glasses and hard to follow story lines. I need the Rockettes and the Christmas cheer that used to be. I would not bring a young child to the show.

Amazing Rockettes. This holiday program has been updated this year (2011). The Rockettes are now featured in a multi-media entertainment venue that includes Imax, 3-D and other special effects but the ladies still dominate the show with their powerhouse of talent and command of mind-boggling choreography. Great family fun for kids (and adults) who can sit through a 90-minute, no intermission performance and a wonderful way to get into the holiday spirit. You girls rock!

New Show..........Pretty Good. Let me preface by saying that I am not a big Christmas show fan. That being said, the new show is really pretty good. The Rockettes are fantastic, especially the March of the Toy Soldiers. Totally agree with the reviewer who said the video game sequence was stupid. Bus tour through New York was also very good. 3D is wonderful. All in all worth the visit

Drop the video game number and they get a five.. This is a wonderful experience for kids and a hoot for adults. Sadly, they have tried to update the show ... who wants that? People go for the reliable high kicks and spectacular sets. They have added a lame video game sequence which appeals neither to kids OR adults. Everyone just sat there thinking how stupid it was. (I asked around.) When you have something that is working, why change it? Bring back the old story and leave "video games" to people who know how to make them.And when is the music hall going to figure out the need for "family bathrooms"? I attend with a autistic male child who must be accompanied to the restroom. I am female. And what about a single parent with children of different sexes? Duh. If Radio City wants to move with times, that would be a better choice. Otherwise the crowds are well handled, the staff pleasant, and the AMURICAN food as one would expect, unhealthy and overpriced.
Still a Must See Attraction!. Our family booked well in advance to see the Christmas show and we were not disappointed. This is still a classic that our girls loved and we enjoyed again.

Radio City Christmas Show always delights!. I've seen the Christmas Show at Radio City many times, beginning when I was a kid, then I took my son when he was young. But, my husband hadn't seen it since he was a kid. So a few years ago, we saw it together for the first time. We had so much fun! He insists on good orchestra seats so we always have a good view. We've been going every year or every other year & we just went again last week. Once again, we had a great time. We are in our 50's & I guess deep inside we are still kids; we never tire of seeing the Rockettes, Santa Claus, and we're always moved by the Nativity scene. We usually get a souvenir photo to remember our good times. We have a new grandson & we can't wait til he's old enough for us to take him!

Excellent show. Went to see the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular show and was amazed, The scenes, the music and the stories were great. The dancing was superb and the theater was beautiful. By far one of the largest and most comfortable theaters I've ever been in. As we were leaving I commented to my wife to think what this show looks like through the eyes of a young child. A must see for families.

2011 Christmas Spectacular is a fun family oriented show. Kids, Teens & Adults alike will enjoy it!. Radio City Music Hall is one of those historic places you should experience while in New York City. Most tourists only walk by it to take photos and instead opt to see a Broadway show. However, the 2011 Christmas Spectacular may convince you to actually see a show at this historic venue. This show has a casual storyline with tradition Christmas themes. The show includes lots of dancing, singing and this year parts of the show's storyline are in 3-D. There is even a segment of the show's storyline involving a video game a sure favorite with kids and teens. Together these elements really entertained audience member of all ages. I felt like a kid again as I resisted the temptation to reach out and grab the 3-D images floating in front of me. My husband didn't resist. The show's storyline is varied and of course includes many of the classic Christmas stories from the Nutcracker to the Nativity scene. The show of course includes the classic Rockettes dance numbers with the high leg kicks, which I personally enjoyed as I grew up seeing images of the World-Famous Rockettes. The dance numbers and singing were very entertaining and the costumes creative. The show's supporting technology was equality impressive with a first rate lighting experience and the backdrop screen which displayed floor to ceiling images much like the IMAX theaters, I should note that I saw tons of audience members taking photos and videos inside the auditorium. Normally, this is not allowed in theaters, but the show's brochure only said no flash photography, so maybe it is allowed so long as the performers are not distracted. As a side note, downstairs near the bathrooms is a large advertisement for the show. It is a great place to take a group photo and pretend to kick your leg up like a Rockette! We bought Groupon.com discount show tickets at a great price. The tickets were only good for the month of November as the show tends to sell tons of seats in December. Even if you have to pay full price if you are looking for a family friendly show, or just a show to experience Radio City Music Hall, you will not be disappointed with the 2011 Christmas Spectacular. Be sure to arrive early as an entry line does form. If you are picking up tickets from Will Call be sure to arrive in enough time to wait in line, claim your tickets, use the bathroom facilities and get to your seat. The show starts on-time. After the show head across the street to Rockefeller Center to see the ice rink and the famous Christmas tree. You are sure to get in the Christmas spirit after seeing this show!

must see in the city come holiday time. my wife went down to radio city music hall with her mother last xmas holiday and said that they thouroughly enjoyed the show. a must see if in the city around the holidays. they also went to the top of the rock and loved the view from up there too. check out the rockettes at radio city music hall. you will be glad you went
Christmas show. Incredible hall, perfect acoustics and an astounding show by the Rockettes. The nativity scene at the end is well worth the wait.

Radio City Christmas Spectacular - Fun for All Ages. From special 3-D glasses and effects to fireworks to the always amazing Rockettes, this year's Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall was amazing. The theme carried nicely through the entire 90 minute presentation which also included live animals (camels!) during the Nativity scene. Check Groupon.com for half price tickets or go to the TKTS book on Broadway to see if you can score them there. Whatever you pay, it is worth it!

Christmas Spectacular is SPECTACULAR!!!. wow, wow, we visited NYC for 5 days, counted about 40 activities and sites and this was our No. 2 (No. 1 was meeting the cast of Law and Order - SVU). I have attended many shows in my lifetime but nothing that can touch this..... We went on the last night of our stay, had we gone earlier in our visit we would have gone back - yes it's that good!!!!! The only downside - it's only 1.5 hours long - wish it was longer and be sure to get there early to avoid missing the first part of the show - this place seats 6,000 and it's a bit chaotic...
Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. Went to the show and it was wonderful. Just wish people would not take pictures when they are asked not to.
Great Show !!. Christmas spectacular show was fabulous, worth the price !

The Christmas Show Was Great. See the 5 pm show after the tree at Rockefeller Center is lit and when you come out from the show you will feel like you are in a winter wonderland as you walk around seeing all the beautiful decorated sites!

Christmas Spectacular 2011 - go!. From the moment the dual organs start playing, you know you are somewhere very special. The Radio City Music Hall is a spectacular New York treasure. Although I have seen the Christmas Spectacular quite a few times over the years, I was still thrilled to see a full dress rehearsal just prior to the start of the 2011 season. I am pleased to report that it's amazing - as always. Even more 3D now - including a new video game sequence where the Rockettes get to wear some very space-age costumes - so make sure you get your free glasses at the entrance to your aisle.

Great!. The history of this place is so very cool. I enjoyed it sooo much. We got to meet a real Rockette and get a picture with her. She was beautiful. One of these days I will come back in December and see one of the shows. The theatre is one of a kind.

Reviweing the organised tour.. We took the organised tour and felt that it was well worth the money. You get to go backstage and into some special rooms which makes it all worth while. We met a Rockette for a photo opportunity and some Q&A. When you have an understanding of the wonderful history of the building, then you appreciate where you're standing all that much more.

Beautiful theater and wonderful acoustics. We saw Zarkana while sitting in row UU. The theater is beautiful, seats comfortable and performance was amazing. The acoustics was just as it should be at a theater - loud but well pitched and does not hurt your ears. I can just picture people dressed up attending this theater many, many years ago. It is a classic theater! A must see and do!
Everything you think it'd be. I saw the Rockette's Christmas Spectacular. It was just as dazzling as I thought it'd be! Radio City is a true treasure!

Great performance - worth to see. During a business trip to New York, I had the opportunity to see Zarkana - one of the Cirque the Soleil distinctive shows. I personally highly recommend you to try to see it. It was full of energy and the artist were amazing. The show was hosted by the Radio City music hall stage, which make it even better. I loved that most of the actors actually were everywhere around the theater before the show and you can actually take a picture. The best part they were truly into their specific characters and that made it even more exciting. I read some of the comments written prior, and I cant agree that the show is boring or that some of the performers actually were not able to do the stunts form the first time. Did you forgot it is actually performed life??? And its pretty difficult too.Anyway - I enjoyed the show a lot and was another memorable time in the Big Apple.

Breathtaking!!!. After a half past four in the morning sart, the thought of Radio City, and the Cirque Du Soleil at eight o'clock at night was fairly daunting. The long day was worth every minute. The venue is stunning, the show, Zarkana, was breathtaking. Radio City is a classic building, with an incredible art deco interior. If you visit New York, take in a show, and if you get to see one in this theatre, all the better.

Zarkana- Magical, Mesmerizing, a true feast for the senses. I took our family to see our first Cirque du Suleil show on October 8, 2011. It was truly a great show, with everything that one can expect from a circus in a subreal setting. The performance was excellent and the entire family loved it. The performers delivered a truly magical performance. After the performance was over, I found my children asking me if we could go see it again which is a true testament in this technology age of the quality of the show.Because our enjoyment of this show, our family will probably book our next vacation in Vegas to have a chance to see the other Cirque du Suleil shows that are resident there.Parking for the event, which is not connected with the venue, was pretty steep at $52.00 but we had such a good time that it was well worth it.

Absolutely beautiful. What a stunning venue. We went to see Zarkana here, which was also great, but the real highlight was the theater. It was beautiful and a real treat to go to it. The designs on the wall, the carpets and the curtains are all so luxurious. It was so well organised also with no waits to get in or out. Great night.

on of the best buildings in the world. I visited Radio City in the late 80's to see a concert. I forgot how beautiful it is. Saw Circus D there last week. The building is worth seeing any way you can.

A Beautiful Christmas Show. Radio City Music Hall is a "must do" attraction and if you can hit the right time of year, you will certainly enjoy their Christmas Show. We went for the first time in 2005 and again in 2010. Midwesterners going to the big city again...we're thinking what do we REALLY want to see and do again?? Of course, Radio City Music Hall was on the top of the "do over" list and this time, in December 2010 we were thrilled to get in on the Christmas show. Our friends had seats on the floor and we had seats in the balcony. Can really say, I was not disappointed with the balcony seats! Patience (a virtue) is required as there are several shows a day/evening so the line outside forms for the next show before the first one is over. Well worth the wait though! The show had something for everyone..old and young alike!! Food and drink and other items for purchase available in the Music Hall.

Do something else.. We have seen numerous cirque shows in Vegas. We thought radio city music hall. How could it be bad. We were wrong. My wife and I both were falling asleep. The score woke us up but only because it was so loud. You could understand nothing.

Radio City Music Hall and Cirque are perfect together!. We recently saw the show Zarakana (Cirque du Soleil) at Radio City Music Hall. What a beautiful venue. The inside of Radio City Music Hall is lovely and you just know you are sitting in an iconic theater.As always, Cirque went all out. The artists were amazing, the costumes creative and the set stunning.I wish we had taken the bask stage tour. Having never been inside the Hall, I really didn't expect it to be so architecturally detailed. One note - the bathroom was downstairs and FAR too small to accommodate all the women that needed it during the show intermission. One of the ushers did say there was an additional bathroom upstairs but given the line downstairs and the many, many women heading upstairs, we didn't think that would be any better.

BEST THEATER I'VE VISITED. It is the best theater I've ever visited. Always Top Events and Shows are there. You name it, they have it on schedule. Theater is huge and if you stay in the mezzanine area, you feel a little dizzy. That's how big the theater is.
fantastic!. Amazing show. The performers are outstanding and so incredibly talented. Its a must see, it finishes early October so get in there quick.

saw cirque du solie. the place and the show were fantastic. the building beggers beliefe. I could happly have spent hours just looking around the building without ever seeing a show at all, but was blown away by the cirque show.
The kids were totaly amazed, certainly no we'r bored coments at that show.

I saw Zarkana at Radio City. It's cheaper to go in person and purchase your tickets there. I went the day of my show and it cost me about $40 less to do it in person than it was going to cost me by doing it online only 30 minutes before I had decided to go in person. I purchased my tickets midday and the line was less than 6 people. It was my first Cirque du Soleil and my 2nd show at Radio City Music Hall. I sat in the front row of the first mezzanine and I had an excellent view of the entire stage, with a good amount of leg room. Snack and beverage prices inside are costly. I had an average size Willy Wonka chocolate bar for $6. Staff is very helpful along the way to help you find seats/ bathrooms.

NYC nostalgia!. We bought tickets online for Radio City Music Hall's showing of Zarkana. The tickets were pricey, as many other attractions and shows in NYC. The lines were long and security tight, but once in the hall, it was like traveling back in time. The inside of the theatre is gorgeous and we were lucky to get wonderful seats on the isle almost in the center of the theatre. We enjoyed the show, even though it was very modern and "rocky". It was colorful and interesting and even though it was difficult to follow the storyline, the acrobatics and aerial numbers were magnificent. The only cloud in our heaven and something which was extremely irritating and should be taken to heart by the administration, is the fact that people were still being shown to their seats by the ushers 20 minutes arter the show began! As i said before, we had wonderful seats but what good does that do if there are people walking in front of you while you are trying to watch the show?Please, Radio City Music Hall, take note of this. It would be more courteous to paying guests are really interested in seeing the show to close the doors and not allow disrespectful latecomers to enter.

Enjoyed Tremendously. We absolutely loved getting to attend a show at Radio City. The show was amazing. The stage was transformed for each different performance. We sat in the 2nd messidene & could see everything just fine. Highly recommend.

Fabulous Venue but be warned!. We visited Radio City Music Hall last week to see Cirque du Soleil 'Zarkana'. The venue is a huge art deco theatre and is quite amazing. The show did not disappoint and we had a wonderful evening BUT be warned...... the venue has a policy that bottles including water are not allowed to be taken in. I purchased a small bottle of water for $1.30 at a local shop before going to the theatre as I would going to any show but was searched on admisssion and the bottle confiscated. Once inside a similar bottle of water was on sale for $5.....a rip off!! In very tiny print on the back of the ticket this policy is stated but we felt this spoiled our initial impression of the venue. We have never experienced this policy at any other venue around the world.
Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes. All I can say is "AWESOME" Couldn't believe all the sets and dancers on stage. The music and dancing was out of this world.

Zarkana ... a Cirque Must See. I love Cirque shows, but lately they have become a bit predictable. This one has some new takes on stunts, acrobatics, "sand art" and the incredible theater design that takes it back to its roots when you would ooohh and ahhh during the performances. Now not everything works, the music is loud and that's about it and the prices are steep so I would recommend seeking discounts on the web because they are there to be had. This new Cirque gives me hope that Cirque can still excite and audience!

Zarkana - Music Loud, Bad Singing. First let me say, the Radio City Music Hall is fantastic, beautiful. Two friends, 50ish, on the pulse of life, love acrobatics (appreciates the danger), loves circus etc. I had never seen a Cirque & always wanted to. HOWEVER, this one did not wow me, mainly b/c of the 'rabbit-dog' creatures that everyone seemed to laugh at & clap for, while not clapping for the daring acrobatics (just a few of us). We just were annoyed by the 'critters' - their squeaky, stupid stuff; there's no real theme or point to the play, music too loud, could not hear words (we were in 3rd floor mezz), just quite annoying both lead male & female singers. We were very disappointed, should have seen a tried & true Tony Award winner - Memphis!

Amazing Venue. If you're a fan of Art Deco architecture, you'll love Radio City Music Hall. From the Grand Foyer to the restroom lounges, this place is an amazing example of the style. You can just imagine a time when people dressed to the nines to come here for an evening of entertainment. It's stunning. We were at the hall to see Zarkana - Cirque du Soleil's current offering in New York. It was a good show, but didn't really give me the "wow" feeling I was expecting from Cirque. While the stunts and the clowns were great, I had trouble following the plot. The score wasn't all that great either. Maybe I set my expectations too high. No one gave the show a standing ovation (other than the guy in front of us that seemed to love it). Nonetheless, it was a decent show and the chance to see it performed in Radio City Music Hall was worth the cost of the tickets.

First Time in NY City with Family. We walked through the theater, lounges and corridors of the iconic. We went behind the scenes and got an inside view of NY iconic entertainment venue of the biggest names in show business. Interesting to see where the Tony's Award are presented and to learn what other venues they hosted. We purchased tickets to Cirque du Soleil Zarkana for $57.00/ticket and sat at the very back mezz. If only the people in front of us sat right back in their seats then we could see everything.

Gorgeous! & Zarkana was fantastic!. Went here with my cousins & my aunt to see Cirque du Soleil Zarkana - and it was AMAZING! The show was awesome - and the location, stunning. The show especially exceeded my expectations - but it was worth going just to see the beautiful Radio City Music Hall! OVerall great experience, and would highly recommend the show! (WOWWW!)

Zarkana, Cirque du Soleil. I received a discount ticket in Times Square two days before performance. I saw this performance with my two grandaughters. It was very impressive!!! The children (two girls, eight and thirteen) were so excited and fascinated!!! Cost: $75.00 per ticket for excellent seats. Sunday matinee (2:00 PM). Amazing acrobatics, music, scenery, and stage sets.

If you love christmas as much as i do, this is a MUST SEE!!. I love Christmas in New York, and even better, radio hall Rockette Christmas spectacular.I couldn't wrap my head around how they could entertain us for 1.5-2 hours so I wasn't sure how entertaining it would be. It is such a great show! I'd highly recommend it for all ages!
Zarkana was breathtaking. This show was really riveting and would go again to see what I may have missed. Great family entertainment and from the 2nd mezzanine, could see all just fine.

More than we were expecting!. This tour was such a delight! Our tour guide (8/2 @ 3pm) was so knowledgeable and pleasant. A real class act. I just wish I remembered her name! She was a perfect hostess, entertainer and guide. The theater is pretty amazing, which helps make the tour a good one, but it was also comprehensive, well-paced, and diverse. We saw the stage, performers practicing, costumes, a short (but informative and entertaining) movie on the history and workings of the stage, notable people, etc.... The best part was meeting a real-life Rockette. She was sweet and patient with all the guests who asked questions and wanted to pose for pictures. We arrived at this tour tired from too much walking and disappointed by a tour we had just finished elsewhere, but soon forgot about our fatigue and got caught up on the wonder that is Radio City Music Hall.

zarkana is good old fashioned cirque. read the critique here and was wondering why everyone seemed to dislike this show.i have seen many cirque shows and keeping this in mind we decided to give it a try depite the negative reviews here. and glad we did.it is not Quidam or 'O' but it is back to basic circus, and to me this is what it's all about. why if you want a modern dance theatre go see Cedar Lake perform - and let Cirque du soleil be just that: a circus. it is a great set - wonderful visuals, and great acrobatics. and some fun rock tunes to go with it and some not too shabby singers. I enjoyed it as did the rest of the family. so definitely worth a visit.

Waste of Money- Acrobatics at Sea World are Better (Florida/California). Before I went to Zarkana I had seen some other bad reviews on Trip Advisor but decided to take a chance with 1/2 price tickets. I had heard that the show is a bit underwhelming but given that I had never seen a Cirque show before I would give this a chance. After spending ~$210 for 3 tickets- I almost left after intermission. You know it is a bad show when you are thinking that you have been suckered out of your money while you are watching the show. I saw a much better acrobatic show at Sea World (San Diego) .The show does improve after intermission and there are some really fantastic tricks. The talent might be there but the show needs a new director/choreographer. If you do decide to buy tickets- stay for the whole thing or come late and see just the second half. The highlight of the show for me was to see Radio City Music Hall which is an amazing building. The staff is super friendly too.

Only at an airport have I ever been forced...... to throw out my water bottle, until today.I found it down right rude & for no other reason than pure greed.We did a tour the day before & found the the whole thing quite facinating. (were we asked to not take water in then, NO).Radio City, I won't even review the show out of my disgust. Even at the top of The Eiffel Tower we weren't charged $5 for a basic bottle of still water,You should be ashamed.

I agree entirely with Sysron's review--"less than expected". I and my wife enjoyed the show, but it did seem like a disconnected show. In addition, the music blasted loud enough to give me a migraine.

ZARKANA...Too Much SINGING!. I trust my opinion of this show because I did not preview TripAdvisor before making reservations but, rather, read earlier submissions the day after having seen it. I base my opinion on a comparison between Zarkana and LaNouba since LaNouba was our first Cirque de Soliel. Unlike some reviewers, I was WOWed by Radio City Music Hall! We live a mere 100 miles South and have been there several times, over-the-years, but we are NOT avid theater-goers, I must concede. We were amazed at the staging and visual-effects of the show which stood-up well against the incredible special-effects we are used-to in today’s movies and videos. The magnificent Radio City Music Hall and the stage-crew get an “A” for this production. As for the rest, I must agree with the other reviews.The performers are, well, world-class circus performers, if anything, their skill and artistry is overshadowed, somewhat, by the sights and sounds of Zarkana. Speaking of Zarkana: I didn’t know what it meant BEFORE I watched the show and I STILL don’t know what it was about. It had something to do with SNAKES, though, a sort of a “Medusa” deal and there was an interlocutor and he was always singing loudly to some girl who was way-up in the rafters and didn’t come down till the Finale. I suppose he had a good voice but I didn’t come to a circus to hear songs. Maybe I’m a lowbrow but I found myself grimacing every time the guy walked out on to the stage between acts. And speaking of “between acts” I don’t get the comedic-duo that comes on between acts. I think it’s a French “Cirque” touch, ‘cause they had them in Orlando, too, but the “Tom & Jerry” routine got “old’ for me by the time I’d reached the age of reason. I guess they’re “charming.”The acrobats, gymnasts, trapeze-artists and jugglers are superb and sure to please, to one extent or another, depending upon which you enjoy seeing more of, i.e. although trapeze and tight-rope artists are breath-taking, I prefer jugglers and cyclists (or other mechanical apparatuses) AND I’ve never “gotten” the concept of so many things going-on at-once. One focuses on a performer and misses all the others doing stuff at the same time. That’s why I don’t like three-ring-circuses.Where was I? Oh, Yeah! I recommend Zarkana. I had a feeling that LaNouba was a little more intimate but that may be due to the venue. There’s no character to match “The Green Bird.” I haven’t fallen-in-love with a cartoon character since I was a child. My Sweetie’s evaluation of Shakespeare’s plays comes to mind, “Too Many WORDS!” when I search for a description of Zarkana…“Too Much SINGING!”

My wife favorite during our trip.. This is our first cirque du soleil show and I really enjoyed it. The stage was fantastic and the show was very enternaining. I was at the mezzanine and had a great view since they use the whole stage for their acts. From all the attractions and museums, this was my wife's favorite and my second favorite attraction in NYC during our trip. If you have not seen any cirque du soleil, this is your opportunity. I highly recommend.

Cirque du Soleil - Spectacular. While in NYC we bought tickets at the half prices at Tickets Tickets at Pier 17. The tickets were only about 10 rows back and in the centre. The show is amazing and we were so glad we chose this show. The hall has so much ambiance. I would recommend going to Zarkana if you are in town and looking for a broadway show!

Zarkana......good show. Zarkana....it was a good show loved all the special effects and lighting..but I will agree no plot....the music was very much like mulan rouge...if you like that. Still I am glad I went, been to several Cirque Du Soleil show and I never have love the music in any of them but I love the show for the wow factor...(special effects, costumes, lighting, etc)
