Zarkana and Radio City both truly spectacular.. O.k. so maybe the plot and the two clowns leave something to be desired but that apart this is a memorable and spectacular production. Not sure that the most important aspect of any Cirque du Soleil performance is the plot anyway. One of the undoubted 'stars' of the show is the Radio City Theatre itself which is simply magnificent. Beyond that the story of Zarkana is little more than a vehicle for the very best that this magical form of surreal circus has to offer and everything is there in this celebration of human spirit, creativity, imagination and sheer agility. Forget the slightly dated though well performed vocals and the slightly incomprehensible plot and just enjoy quality musicianship, magnificent sets and startlingly good acrobatics. Well worth a visit.

Zarkana - Save your money. I wish I had listened to other reviews here. We just went last night and I am terribly disssapointed. The stage was beautiful and the light show too. But the show was boring. The singing and shrieking was annoying. The ghost charcaters were annoying too and used cheap slap stick comedy to fill in time. I don't want to say much about the show. Its not worth it.We have seen shows at "Sea World" and the "Ringling Brothers circus" that is 100 times more impressive and well worth the money.Save your money and time folks. This leaves a bad taste in your mouth.

The tour is worth it!. I loved the backstage tour of the Radio City Music Hall. I was unable to attend a show, and this was an amazing way to see its 1932 restored interiors in great detail. The tour guide was pretty great as well, and very informative.

Zarkana at Radio City - Awful Show!!!. I have seen pretty much every Cirque show that has opened in the last 20+ years, except for Zed and Viva Elvis. Every time Cirque opens a new show in NY it is a sell out disaster. Wintuk was awful fluff, Bananashpeel was so bad it closed almost immediately and I found Zarkana to be a total train wreck. First off, the show has some of the greatest sets and costumes I have ever seen out of a Cirque show. Before the show you are greeted by so many colorful characters that you hardly ever see again during the show and seem to have little to no reason for being them. Beautiful costumes parade around the theater making you think you are really in for something special and then they disappear never to be seen again. Going in, I really expected Zarkana to knock my socks off and it failed on pretty much every level. There were a few cool acts, but only that sand art one was totally original and none of the others were improvements on similar acts they had already done in other shows. Somewhat dull versions of acts that were knockouts in other productions. The worst part about it was the music. The female singer screeched and screamed the whole time. My husband left with a migraine and my father and I both had headaches. The music is all sung in English, which detracts from the performance. Lyrics made no sense and felt very convoluted. Often the screaming was so shrill you couldn't decipher the lyrics and because the were in English your brain automatically focuses on what they are trying to squeal instead of the overall picture on stage. The music itself fluctuated between totally dull and screamingly deafening. Rock opera fail! Early in the first act, a little girl got sucked into a machine. What happened was never fully explained and the only time this was revisited was for a hot second in the second act when a funeral procession crossed the stage screeching "welcome to my funeral". Totally unsatisfying. I am totally into dark and morbid. O and Quidam changed my life, but they felt like explorations, not exploitations. In addition, the story was supposed to be that of a magician looking for love. The male singer crooned like Elvis, never demonstrated any magic and it was totally unclear what his objective was. My father thought he was a magician depressed because he had no magic. My husband thought he was a ringleader who wanted to learn magic and I only knew he was a magician from the program and thought he was searching for the little girl who fell into the death contraption. Nothing was clear, despite the lyrics in our own language. In shows like Quidam, despite all the kooky characters and Cirqueish lyrics, you can always kinda tell who is who and what is going on and the music pulls you in and stays with you forever. I can't remember a single tune, just crooning and screeching. This show was full of loose ends. Only in the end when screechy lady descends from the ceiling dressed like a rosebush on steroids and they walk up the staircase singing at each other like something out of Phantom did it remotely look like he was searching for a pairing. So many special effects and so little substance. Special effects, though a form of artistry in itself are not the foundations of Cirque. Human talent and mind blowing creativity are and I can not be sold on flashy sets and ever changing screen projections if there is no substance or purpose behind them. I was there on the first preview, nobody knew when to clap, there was no standing ovation at the end and the audience looked mostly baffled while leaving. I would like to think it would drastically improve before official opening but unless they get an entirely new score, I can say this and Wintuk are the worst Cirque shows I have ever seen and certainly not worthy of NY. Where is Franco Dragone when you need him.

Zarkana it was just a fancy circus without the smell.. First let me say our family is of average sophistication. We've always wanted to see a cirque show, after hearing from others, over the years, how good the Vegas shows were. So we got tickets early for good seats for Zarkana. Third row orch. Yes the women singers were screechy, the guy sounded like Neil Diamond. Maybe it's my adult ADD, but I couldn't follow any storyline. My family was bored. The clowns were not funny and all the acrobatics have been done before ie. Ringling Bros. Maybe I'll give a Vegas show a try after hearing that they're much better,but don't waste your money here. There's a reason it's a limited engagement, it doesn't need word of mouth to run for years.

Zarkana was a lot of fun. Zarka is a magician who has lost is powers and comes to NYC to find them and to find his love. He comes upon an abandoned theater that is filled with misfit clowns and four mutant ladies trying to keep him from accomplishing his goals. You would never know the plot unless you read the playbill; however, forget this silly simple story and enjoy the acrobatics. The stage is filled at all times with amazing imagery. There are trapeze artists, funny clowns, a sand artist, and all sorts’ marvelous things. Regarding Radio City, be prepared to wait on 15 minute bathroom lines at intermission if you are female and to pay $5 for a cup of club soda. The stage is fantastical and the venue is historic so go and have fun - it's a definite place to visit if you're in town. Then go down the street to the Rainbow Room and have a drink.

Zarkana - less than expected. I came to expect great shows when it comes to Cirque Du Soleil. They almost always manage to amaze me. This one was an 'almost'.The sand artists and the white dressed dancer on the small circular stage, plus the light /shade effects were indeed amazing, the acrobats were great as ususal but there was no flow, the story seemed disconnected and 'pasted' on the show.

Zarkana save your money. My husband & i saw Zarkana last night and we were very disappointed. The performing acrobats and sand artist were wonderful, too bad they are in a terrible show. Music and singers made us want to run from the theater. No plot or flow to the show, never knew what was going on! There was one segment when a guy came out, knelt on a platform, there was a woman in the background behind the curtain, then out of no where, he stood up and left. The theater itself was very hot. Many people left at intermission and never came back. We assumed the show would be as wonderful as "love" was out in Vegas. Not so.

No standing ovation for this tour. One of the most boring things that I have ever experienced.Tour guide had real nasal issues and a voice that could make you sleep for a week. Sat in the auditorium for 10 minutes , walked around two bathrooms, climbed six flights of stairs and sat in a very confined viewing room and watched a video of what we had already been told earlier ! Almost forgot....met a Rockette......sorry lost on me are they some kind of national institution ? Highlight of the tour for me was the exit sign.

Rockette Christmas Spectacular - AMAZING!. What an AMAZING show! I highly recommend. I did not know what to expect. All I knew was that they are famous for their high kicks, so I was wondering how they would fill a 90 min show. Well they do so much more – tap, ballet, ice skating. The precision with which they do it is amazing. The show is really about the meaning of Christmas which was a great touch. Very wonderful – can’t say enough good things about it. We just got the cheapest tickets since we didn't know what to expect so we were on the bottom level and 2nd row from the last. Our view was still good. Next time I would pay to sit close.The theatre itself is gorgeous!

my highlight,loved it.. got tickets on december29th,wednesday,for the 8pm,show,purchased the tkts,fromtkts,south sea port,$57( i think) each on the afternoon,hardly any queue,great seats,think they were orchestra seats towards the back,just loved the show,the 3d effects, the precision dancing,could have watched it all night long,infact it was the highlight of my 7 night trip,loved it,next day, we did the backstage tour,which we did with our ny city pass,timed it perfect,very small group,fantastic guide,very interesting,fascinating tour,evenwent into your own private viewing booth and we watched the first 5 mimutes of the show again,it was so interesting to walk around the place and the guide explaining all the history 5***************

The Rockettes Christmas Spectacular!. We booked to see the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular show at Radio City on Christmas Eve and had a fantastic time! The dancing was amazing, I kept scanning the line because I was sure somebody would make a mistake at some point, but the dancers didn't! There timing was incredible. The show was a brilliant thing to do on Christmas Eve to get you in the festive mood! i'd buy tickets early to get the best seats.

Christmas Show of the Rockettes - not as thrilling as hoped. Having seen the show before, it was very disappointing that the costumer designer/outfitter of the rockettes seems to have decided on a "modern" approach on their costumes, rather than the "Santarina" outfits that they're advertised in since many years. Certain things should not be changed. They're called traditions and the colors and texture and look of the female Santa Outfit of the Rockettes would have to been included in that. The show was pretty much the same as a few years ago, but the ending was slightly lame. That certainly seemed bettter when I first saw it. Getting the tickets was easy & the operation of getting in, retail, F&B etc was smooth enough to be enjoyable. Still a good show, but would have hoped for the final appearance of the Rockettes at the end in the Santarina costumes -so the ending was a bit dull. Great to visit with kids.

ridiculous radio rule(s). Be very, very sure that you're going to attend...as in, you're standing at the door to buy the tickets. they have a no refund, no exchanges policy. tickets for a family show like Christmas specular, run $80 per person. New York region was hit with a huge snowstorm on the day of my show. It started snowing before 11am. My show was at 8pm - long after it became treacherous to drive/get to train station, etc. They REFUSE TO CANCEL THE SHOW although most people probably didn't make it there because reasonable people fine "LIFE" to be the most SPECTACULAR show of all. The owners made money hand over fist. Find something else to do in the city.

Radio City Christmas Show - good, but too cute. I took my wife here just before we needed to fly back to England after a long weekend in New York. We had front row seats, and I'd advise anyone looking to go that these were NOT ideal. Being so close to the stage meant that you couldn't really appreciate the precision dancing of the performers, nor could you get much impact from a fairly lengthy 3D sequence which happened near the beginning. I would guess that about half way back, near the middle would have been much better.As for the show, my wife loves Christmas, so she enjoyed it. It was a bit too “cute” for my taste, but lots of people seemed to be enjoying themselves. The Rockettes are clearly very good at their job, and I certainly appreciate the skill involved. I just found it a bit repetitive, and the dancing teddy bears doing ballet were a bit much for me. Still, I had an idea it was going to be a fairly sugary experience, so as long as you go in knowing that, and get better seats, you'll probably love it.

Rockettes Christmas Spectacular lives up to it's name. Absolutely loved the Christmas Show. Dancing was amazing and the sets were brilliant. Total family entertainment for children aged 4 to 104! The theatre itself is a beautiful Art Deco design and the seating on the Mezzanine level was surprisingly spacious and comfortable.

A great way to get you in the mood for Christmas. We turned up one very wet Sunday morning hoping they could squeeze us into the next show, which would be a welcome relief from the rain. We were very lucky that they could - although admittedly for the most expensive tickets! I would certainly advise anyone collecting tickets or even holding tickets to get there early. Many people left it very late and must have missed the first 20/30 mins of the show due to queues, which is a great waste of a ticket.The show is great fun, based around the traditional Christmas story and traditional Xmas characters. The singing and dancing from the Rockettes is brilliant. Lots of great costume changes and fabulous choreographed dances - my favourite being the toy soldiers.This is a great way to get anyone in the Christmas spirit. It's fabulous fun and extremely well put together.

The Rockettes are unbelievable!. Went to see the Christmas Spectacular featuring the Rockettes at Radio City Music hall and it was amazing. Being in the Marine Corps and having to perform drill I know how hard it is to work in syncrosyn with others and to see what the Rockettes performed was amazing. The only negative I had was exiting Radio City. It wad a nightmare due to you are funneled onto 50th or broadway. Try to go to a early show if you can.

PRICELESS. I put off seeing this because I thought it was too expensive. This year I broke down and took the kids. It was AMAZING. And the look on my kids faces when Santa & the two boys fly - well - it was priceless! I think this will become an annual tradition - and our seats were good - Row O - Seats 501- 504. I thought the popcorn bucket & two drinks for $12 was a better deal than at the movies - and I treated myself to a glass of wine. I can't wait for next year!!!!!!!!!!!!

CHRISTMAS SPECTACULAR LIVED UP TO ITS NAME. We saw this show 10 yrs ago with our oldest son and it wasn't nearly as good as this year. The writing, directing and production have taken it to a new level. My husband was fussing that we had to take the younger son but he admitted how wonderful it was this year. They even did one set on the nativity which was great to see.The show was absolutley fabulous. A must see in your lifetime!! Put it on the long weekend bucket list

Average!!!. There are certain shows here (like ones in the summer) that are spectacular but as you venture towards th holiday season they get corny. The best show (i give) is only 3.5/5 stars.....I was suprised

Can't Believe I didn't go sooner!. I was in NYC to bring in the new year, 2010. I saw the December 30 Christmas Spectacular show and thoroughly enjoyed every minute of it! Not a dull moment and the Rockettes and other performers were excellent. I can't believe that I waited this long to experience this show. This will be a yearly event for me from now on. Oh, and Radio City Music Hall is beautiful! I love 30s architecture and I was in awe of how beautiful it is.

Better than expected!. Went to the Holiday Rockettes show! Thought it would be hokey, but it was really professional. Such a beautiful venue with so much history. Terrific seats in the fourth row for half price on New year's Day.

Magnificent!. This is truly the most enjoyable time I have ever spent in a theatre. The Rockettes were magnificent and the Christmas Day performance will stay in my memory forever. Thank you Radio City Musical Hall for the BEST SHOW in the WORLD!

I dont know why... but I felt like a star.!!. I totally loved this place and the guide was sooooo nice to us.!!Im a danceer so i got totally excited about the rockettes and everything..is good to know a little bit more about this place.!It is worth it.. promise.!!

Truly Spectacular. Great show for all ages. Worth every penny paid for tickets. The precision of the Rockettes is truly spectacular and the show is amazing! I got tickets early enough that we were able to get front row seats. My only tip would be that due to the height, size and motion of the stage during the performance, we actually would have had a better view had we been a few rows back.Definitely plan on making this an annual trip!

Christmas spectacular, Rockettes absolutely brilliant. I am not a novice when it comes to theatre shows and l live artists. I love ballet, pop music and classical music/opera. I have seen artists and performances as wide ranging as the 3 tenors to disney on ice and morrissey to swan lake. This show is to date the best i have seen. Absolutely brilliant for all ages and tastes! I lost track of what was real and what was animation and was completely spell bound for the full 90 minutes. My 3 yr old little boy who in his short life has never to this date been quiet or still for more than 10 seconds was motionless and transfixed for the full duration.New York at Christmas is a wonderful place and this show will for ever be my fondest memory of a fantastic week at xmas 2009.

Like a good wine it just gets better. First saw the christmas show 2 years ago.Having returned to New York with some first time visiters we decided to see the show again. What a wise move!!. Coming from England the only thing I can liken this to is a British pantomime only much much better. You can`t help come out with a huge smile on your face. We sat in row WW and we had a wonderful view of the whole huge stage. If you do come from outside of the USA you may not have heard of the Rockettes. Well they take Precision dancing to a whole new level fantastic, There are about 6 shows a day so no excuse not having time to see the show.Finally make sure you look at the fixtures and fittings even in the restrooms!!. Will be back on our next visit in 2 years
A Christmas show spectacular.. in the grand and lavish theatre, the rockettes kick high to expectations. entertaining family musical show.

Christmas Spectacular is just that!. The first time I saw this show I was over 20 years ago. It was stunning then, and it's stunning now. Even though this year was an "all new show" it had many of the same basic elements so it didn't feel new, and in my mind that was a good thing. Good is good, regardless of when. I was filled with joy that they stil have live animals in the show, just like they did when I could not believe I was seeing a live Camel in NYC and it wasn't the zoo or circus! The first time I'd been there, I had orchestra seating which I do NOT recommend. Period. Much of the show is on the elevated stage so that was a lot of neck craning for the front and squinting from the rear. This time I had first mezzanine and loved it, Get center row, 1st Mezzanine tickets in the 1st-7th rows and you won't be disappointed. The Hall is lovely even 10 years after it's renovation so take the time to poke around a bit. The Hall staff were both accomodating and polite and I enjoyed it even more this time seeing the show as an adult than I did as a child. My 18 y/o loved it too, and next year I'm going to take my 7 and 5 year old children. If You're coming to NY and can only see one show, this is it. Oh- tip- you can book using AMEX rewards points through ticketmaster (if it's working....)- and if you do opt for will-call, regardless of what the site says have your CC AND your ID ready.

Christmas Spectacular is a MUST!. We absolutely loved the Christmas Spectacular! We were four women ranging from ages 25 to 50. The show is not just about the Rockettes, there are LOTS of special features throughout and they don’t forget the real reason we celebrate Christmas! It was a great show for our first night in NYC. At one point or another in the show, we all got a little tear in our eye!We arrived about 25 minutes before the show, and although the line looked really long, we were inside with plenty of time to look around a little, use the rest room and get in our seats. You are allowed to take non-flash photos.It was our first night in NYC and we were concerned about “what are we going to eat for dinner that night.” We started out in Times Square and walking over to Radio City. There was so much to see, take pics of, and look at purses and scarves, that we actually ended up eating street food. I have THE BEST gyro ever and for only $5.00! Directly across the street from Radio City, I sat by the Christmas Ornaments Fountain and watched all the hustle and bustle of the city, then just walked across the street for the show!

Rockettes Show was Wonderful. We saw the Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes at RCMH. The venue is beautiful and the show was fantastic. I was worried when we booked the 3rd level mezzanine that we would be too far from the stage. We had great views of the stage from the 1st row on the 3rd level. The show was appropriate for any age and I enjoyed the 3D portion of the show (thought it might be cheesy!). Worth seeing - and tickets are affordable. The Swarovski Christmas Tree was also worth seeing.

Brilliant. In New York last December and although we were seeing other shows on Broadway we had a night free and got tickets on the spur of the moment from the TKTS booth in Times Square. The tickets were far cheaper, aout $50 each from memory, than those for the Broadway shows and so very good value.Very good Xmas show, highly professional in a very nice theatre.

Christmas in NYC is magic. We took the Amtrak Train from Lancaster,PA to NYC. We booked the tickets for the train, Radio City Music Hall and the Top of the Rockefeller Center Observatory- all as a package through the Amtrak Vacation. We were not dissappointed. We had a fun day in NYC. The show at Radio City was so much fun. Our seats for the Christmas show( purchased thru Amtrak Vacations ) were in a fantastic location. We really enjoyed the Christmas show.TIP- We had tickets at the will-call box. We got a few different answers from the crowd control people who were on the street. Here is what you need to do- take all the people whose names are on the tickets and take them to the will call office! The office people will not release tickets without ID. That is great but it caused some confusion for us when we had been told something else by another Radio City worker.

Christmas Spectacular lived up to it's name!. Nothing puts you in the Christmas spirit like this show. Our family of five all agreed that it was our favorite attraction while visiting NYC in December. My daughter especially loved the live animals. It is a must see for anyone visiting during the Christmas season.

A must to see. Ordered the tickets way back in the year as i had heard that it was a must to see in new york at christmas. And it was. We had such a great time. I had asked advice from ta if i could collect the tickets anytime before hand. I was told NO. But it turns out that u can. Also you can collect tickets for madison square gardens there to, which was great for me as we were due to see cirque tooo. The staff at rcmh were very helpful. We had a wheelchair with us and it was very easy to have it looked after alone with baby bugyes. Great show, worth the cost and the trip. There is also a great bakery around the corner that do great rcmh cupcakes

Beautiful Theater. Radio City itself is gorgeous! There was a complete restoration in 1999. I was there when it was decorated for the holidays; a beautiful Swarovski crystal tree is suspended from the ceiling, glittering and turning slowly. It definitely saves up on precious floor space. There originial murals have been restored as was the "musical carpet". There are also nutcrackers/toy soldiers along some walls and families were taking pictures there. There is also a formal picture-taking area that charges. There are several merchandise areas and bars on each floor as well. The bar on the mezzanine level is in beauitful etched glass and I think it is the "Rockettes" bar. It's a bit of a cattle call going in if you are going to a show, but once you are in, it thins out a bit. There is a downstairs, main floor and the mezzanine levels. If you have a chance to go, show or not, it is definitely a beautiful, historic place.

Must Go!. I try to go to the Christmas Spectacular every year and this year was by far the most unforgettable. They added new scenes, new songs and new costumes and I loved every second of it. In the past it began to become boring only because it was the same thing every year no variety. This year they changed and added and even my boyfriend who was not at all excited since he was dragged numerous times before loved the show. My favorite part is still the Wooden soldiers and happy they kept that in the show. As I've said in my other reviews, DO NOT PAY FULL PRICE! While it is well worth it why should you if you don't have to. You can visit numerous sites to get discount tickets. TheaterMania.com, Broadway Alerts, and MSG, check these sites before purchasing tickets. I got center orchestra seats for $50 a piece much better then $111 a piece.

75th Christmas Spectacular. Quite simply an excellent show. Friendly staff. Wasn't allowed to take a big digital camera or a mini video camera inside. I think little kids might be slightly confused by their "Santa is everywhere" explanation, but it was cute and the religious part of the show was a nice touch. Great performance. Went on a night where there was little queueing.

kids in new york. We just returned from a day trip to New York City with our 4 year old and our 8 year old. Radio City Music Hall's Christmas show was spectacular. There was enough variety and special effects to keep my 4 year old in her seat (or at least in a lap), which, as a mother of a spirited child, is very appreciated. We did have very good seats (row PP) - and the "snow" and streamersand Santa were there for us to experience. It didn't matter at all that we went this early (early November) to get cheaper seats. As we were getting the kids ready at 6 AM for the trip to NYC, my husband grumbled "this had better be good". We were not disappointed!

A MUST SHOW TO SEE IN NEW YORK. This show is a winner be you adult or child, the 3D show at the start is amazing, and the rest of the show is too. You must go see this if you are in new york in december.

Inflexible Guest Relations. We were looking forward to going to Radio City Music Hall to see Celtic Woman on the evening of March 16, but the New York metropolitan area was hit by a snow storm, and it was unsafe for us to drive the 100 miles to the show. When we contacted Radio City customer relations before the show, they said that it is clearly stated on their tickets that no refunds or exchanges are given, and they would not honor our request, but they hoped that we would patronize their music hall again in the future. It is obvious that they don't care about the safety of their customers.

Chinese New Year Spectacular. Save yourself the MONEY & Time!!!!What a disappointment! The website and the print ad is really deceiving. The show I saw last night has nothing to do with their presentation and video clips seen on-line. I spent all that money to see a very lousy show. Performers didn't even seemed professionals and the singing was very mediocre. So bad that it was comical at times...that's the only thing that made me laugh.

Christmas Extravaganza Show, Oh MY God! Fantastic!. Like most people except the Amercians, my wife and I had never heard of Radio City or the apparent "world famous Rockettes"!But we decided to book the Christmas Extravaganza show on a saturday night. Oh My God! What a fantastic show.Imagine a line of chorus girls in various states of christmas costumes with more Santas than you can shake a stick at,telling the story of Father Christmas through music and dance.Throw in an ice rink with skaters,Yes an ice rink on stage! The best special effects i have ever seen on a stage and you have the making of the greatest spectacular ever seen at christmas time.But that's not all, after all this the Nativity story is told in the traditional way. However there are exceptions, real animals are used, camels,sheep,donkeys,etc. Followed by the best Nativity story my wife and I have ever witnessed. Out of this world and very moving and the special effects invole in this,well see for yourself.If there is a show to be seen at christmas,see this one, we look forward to going again next year.

Christmas Spectacular Rockettes. Radio City Music Hall is amazing. I would have preferred taking a history tour of the building that buying the Rockettes ticket. However I am so glad I had the opportunity to see the building and experience a Rockette's Show - I have no doubt the show is a wonderful event for families and children and is an annual event for many. For me - I found the show Disney like and I am not in that stage of life so I can't say the show wowed me. But again, the Radio City Music Hall is a must see.

Suprised. Wanted to see the Christmas show but it hadn't started when we visited so on rainy day decided to do the theatre tour. My husband wasn't sure what to expect. What a suprise. If you haven't been to see a show you will be amazed by the building and the internal decorations, straight out of the 1920's!. My daughter wanted to meet a Rockette but unfortunately they weren't on that day but that was made clear to us before we started the tour. the tour guide was excellent answering all questions and adding inside information on how the theatre works. You get to see the stage mechanics and the rehearsal rooms. Well worth doing and good value.

Go just to imagine yourself there back in it's heyday. This is a performance hall of grand proportions. The art deco is amazing. The girl calling out for everyone to come and get their programs reminds you of another era. The show I saw, the Xmas Spectacular, was about a half hour too long for me, but I am glad I went. The restroom (ladies lounge) is in it's original state and is lovely. The views over the balconies are great. The rockettes are good too, but go just for the ambience! I purchased the least expensive tickets on the third level and I could see and hear just fine.

The Christmas Spectacular is Awesome. Please do not go to New York City during the holiday season unless you plan to see the Christmas Spectacular show at Radio City. The Rockette's are wonderful and the entire show will be pleasing to all ages. This show is so good! It is great family entertainment!

Absolutely Beautiful. We saw the Christmas Spectacular show during the week of Thanksgiving and it was the most beautiful show ever. We actually went on November 20th and used an Entertainment coupon and saved tons of money and had orchestra seating. That was the last day that was considered not part of the "peak season". I would recommend Entertainment coupon books for any state you go to. You save so much money for attractions, food, etc. Back to the Radio City Christmas Spectacular show. A lot of time and effort goes into this show you know. The Rockettes were absolutely beautiful and did such a great job. This is a must see show! I recommend to all!
Radoi city Music Hall. We saw the Christmas special and then came back for the tour the next day. Both were great. Every member of the family enjoyed the visits.
